National Sentence Text: This Part applies to all buildings covered in this Code. (See Article 1.1.1.1..)
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies to all buildings covered in this Code. (See Article 1.1.1.1..)

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 3.10., 4.5., 5.10., 6.4., 7.2., 8.3. and 9.37. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b) of Division A, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 3.10., 4.5., 5.10., 6.4., 7.5., 8.3., 9.38., 10.8. and 11.3. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 3., 4., 5. , 6. , 7., 8., 9. , 10. and 11. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b) of Division A, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 3.10., 4.5., 5.10., 6.4., 7.5., 8.3., 9.38., 10.8. and 11.3. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The climatic and seismic values required for the design of buildings under this Code shall be in conformance with the values established by the authority having jurisdiction or, in the absence of such data, with Sentence 1.1.3.1.(2) and the climatic and seismic values in . (See Note A-1.1.3.1.(1).) (See Note A-1.1.3.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The climatic and seismic values required for the design of buildings under this Code shall be in conformance with the values established by the authority having jurisdiction or, in the absence of such data, with Sentence 1.1.3.1.(2) and the climatic and seismic values in . (See Note A-1.1.3.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The outside winter design temperatures determined from Appendix C shall be those listed for the January 2.5% values. (See Note A-1.1.3.1.(2).) (See Note A-1.1.3.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The outside winter design temperatures determined from Appendix C shall be those listed for the January 2.5% values. (See Note A-1.1.3.1.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Depth of frost penetration shall be established on the basis of local experience.
P/T Sentence Text: Depth of frost penetration shall be established on the basis of local experience.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire safety plan is required, it shall conform to Section 2.8. of Division B of the NFC.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Where a fire safety plan is required, it shall conform to Section 2.8. of Division B of the NFC(AE).
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire safety plan is required, it shall conform to Section 2.8. of Division B of the NFC(AE).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where a fire safety plan is required, it shall conform to Section 2.8. of Division B of the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. shall have the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.
P/T Sentence Text: Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. shall have the meanings defined in the Safety Codes Act and its Regulations or the NFC(AE), or the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A shall have the meanings defined in the Safety Codes Act and its Regulations or the NFC(AE), or the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.

National Sentence Text: Where objectives and functional statements are referred to in Division B, they shall be the objectives and functional statements described in Parts 2 and 3 of Division A.
P/T Sentence Text: Where objectives and functional statements are referred to in Division B, they shall be the objectives and functional statements described in Parts 2 and 3 of Division A.

National Sentence Text: Where acceptable solutions are referred to in Division B, they shall be the provisions stated in Parts 3 to 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Where acceptable solutions are referred to in Division B, they shall be the provisions stated in Parts 3. to 11. .
For words not defined by Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), reference should be made to the Oxford University Press June 2004 Canadian Oxford Dictionary, 2nd Edition
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): For words not defined by Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), reference should be made to the Oxford University Press June 2004 Canadian Oxford Dictionary, 2nd Edition

National Sentence Text: The words and terms in italics in Division B shall have the meanings assigned to them in Article 1.4.1.2..
P/T Sentence Text: The words and terms in italics in Division B shall have the meanings assigned to them in Article 1.4.1.2..

National Sentence Text: The symbols and other abbreviations in Division B shall have the meanings assigned to them in Article 1.4.2.1. and Article 1.3.2.1.
P/T Sentence Text: The symbols and other abbreviations in Division B shall have the meanings assigned to them in Article 1.4.2.1. and Article 1.3.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise specified herein, the documents referenced in this Code shall include all amendments, revisions, reaffirmations, reapprovals, addenda and supplements effective to 30 June 2017.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Unless otherwise specified herein, the documents referenced in this Code shall include all amendments, revisions, reaffirmations, reapprovals, addenda and supplements effective to 30 June 2017.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless otherwise specified herein, the documents referenced in this Code shall include all amendments, revisions, reaffirmations, reapprovals, addenda and supplements effective to 01 April 2019.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Unless otherwise specified herein, the documents referenced in this Code shall include all amendments, revisions, reaffirmations, reapprovals, addenda and supplements effective to 01 April 2019.

National Sentence Text: Where documents are referenced in this Code, they shall be the editions designated in Table 1.3.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Where documents are referenced in this Code, they shall be the editions designated in Table 1.3.1.2.

National Sentence Text: The scope of this Part shall be as described in Subsection 1.3.3..
P/T Sentence Text: The scope of this Part shall be as described in part 1..

National Sentence Text: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..
P/T Sentence Text: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Part, the term "storage tank" shall mean a vessel for flammable liquids or combustible liquids having a capacity of more than 230 L and designed to be installed in a fixed location.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): For the purposes of this Part, the term "storage tank" shall mean a vessel for flammable liquids or combustible liquids having a capacity of more than 230 L and designed to be installed in a fixed location.

National Sentence Text: Information to be submitted regarding major components of fire protection shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 2.2.3.. (See Note A-3.1.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Information to be submitted regarding major components of fire protection shall conform to the requirements of part 2..

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.1.2.3.to 3.1.2.5., every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the Groups or Divisions described in Table 3.1.2.1. (See Note A-3.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.1.2.3. to 3.1.2.5., every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the Groups or Divisions described in Table 3.1.2.1. (See Note A-3.1.2.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: A building intended for use by more than one major occupancy shall be classified according to all major occupancies for which it is used or intended to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: A building intended for use by more than one major occupancy shall be classified according to all major occupancies for which it is used or intended to be used.

National Sentence Text: Any building is deemed to be occupied by a single major occupancy, notwithstanding its use for more than one major occupancy, provided that all occupancies are classified as belonging to the same Group classification or, where the Group is divided into Divisions, as belonging to the same Division classification described in Table 3.1.2.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Any building is deemed to be occupied by a single major occupancy, notwithstanding its use for more than one major occupancy, provided that all occupancies are classified as belonging to the same Group classification or, where the Group is divided into Divisions, as belonging to the same Division classification described in Table 3.1.2.1.

National Sentence Text: An arena-type building intended for occasional use for trade shows and similar exhibition purposes shall be classified as a Group A, Division 3 occupancy. (See Note A-3.1.2.3.(1).) (See Note A-3.1.2.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: An arena-type building intended for occasional use for trade shows and similar exhibition purposes shall be classified as a Group A, Division 3 occupancy. (See Note A-3.1.2.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: A police station with detention quarters is permitted to be classified as a Group B, Division 2 major occupancy provided the station is not more than 1 storey in building height and 600 m2 in building area.
P/T Sentence Text: A police station with detention quarters is permitted to be classified as a Group B, Division 2 major occupancy provided the station is not more than 1 storey in building height and 600 m2 in building area.

National Sentence Text: Convalescent homes and children’s custodial homes are permitted to be classified as residential occupancies within the application of Part 3, provided that occupants are ambulatory and live as a single housekeeping unit in a suite with sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Convalescent homes and children’s custodial homes are permitted to be classified as residential occupancies within the application of part 3., provided that occupants are ambulatory and live as a single housekeeping unit in a suite with sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons.

National Sentence Text: Buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall be classified as medium-hazard industrial occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall be classified as medium-hazard industrial occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.3.1.(2)and 3.1.3.1.(3), major occupancies shall be separated from adjoining major occupancies by fire separations having fire-resistance ratings conforming to Table 3.1.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.3.1.(2) and 3.1.3.1.(3), major occupancies shall be separated from adjoining major occupancies by fire separations having fire-resistance ratings conforming to Table 3.1.3.1.

National Sentence Text: In a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, if not more than 2 dwelling units are contained together with a Group E major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation between the 2 major occupancies need not be more than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, if not more than 2 dwelling units are contained together with a Group E major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation between the 2 major occupancies need not be more than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: In a building conforming to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.2.to 3.2.8.8., the requirements of Sentence 3.1.3.1.(1) for fire separations between major occupancies do not apply at the vertical plane around the perimeter of an opening through the horizontal fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building conforming to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.2. to 3.2.8.8., the requirements of Sentence 3.1.3.1.(1) for fire separations between major occupancies do not apply at the vertical plane around the perimeter of an opening through the horizontal fire separation.

National Sentence Text: No major occupancy of Group F, Division 1 shall be contained within a building with any occupancy classified as Group A, B or C.
P/T Sentence Text: No major occupancy of Group F, Division 1 shall be contained within a building with any occupancy classified as Group A, B or C.

National Sentence Text: Not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.

National Sentence Text: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. shall not contain except as provided in Sentence 3.1.3.2.(5), a Group A, Division 1 or 3, Group B, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy, or a Group A, Division 2 or Group E major occupancy above the second storey. (See Note A-3.1.3.2.(3) to (5).)
P/T Sentence Text: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. shall not contain except as provided in Sentence 3.1.3.2.(5), a Group A, Division 1 or 3, Group B, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy, or a Group A, Division 2 or Group E major occupancy above the second storey.

National Sentence Text: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.58. shall not contain a Group A, Division 1 or 3, Group B, or Group F, Division 1 major occupancy, or except as provided in Sentence 3.1.3.2.(5), a Group A, Division 2, Group E, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy above the second storey. (See Note A-3.1.3.2.(3) to (5).)
P/T Sentence Text: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.58. shall not contain a Group A, Division 1 or 3, Group B, or Group F, Division 1 major occupancy, or except as provided in Sentence 3.1.3.2.(5), a Group A, Division 2, Group E, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy above the second storey.

National Sentence Text: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58. is permitted to contain a storage garage below the fourth storey. (See Note A-3.1.3.2.(3) to (5).) (See also Sentence 4.4.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58. is permitted to contain a storage garage below the fourth storey. (See Note A-3.1.3.2.(3).) (See also Sentence 4.4.2.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: A building permitted to be of combustible construction is permitted to be constructed of combustible materials, with or without noncombustible components. (See Note A-3.1.4.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A building permitted to be of combustible construction is permitted to be constructed of combustible materials, with or without noncombustible components. (See Note A-3.1.4.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating on any exposed surface of foamed plastic insulation, and on any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the insulation in any direction, shall be not more than 500. (See Note A-3.1.4.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating on any exposed surface of foamed plastic insulation, and on any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the insulation in any direction, shall be not more than 500.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.1.4.2.(2), foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly in combustible construction shall be protected from adjacent spaces in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, and wall and ceiling assemblies, by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections 9.29.4.to 9.29.9., provided the building does not contain a Group A, Group B or Group C major occupancy, by sheet metal mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, not less than 0.38 mm thick, and with a melting point not below 650°C, or by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.15.(2) (see Note A-3.1.4.2.(1)(c)). (See Note A-3.1.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.1.4.2.(2), foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly in combustible construction shall be protected from adjacent spaces in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, and wall and ceiling assemblies, by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections 9.to 9., provided the building does not contain a Group A, Group B or Group C major occupancy, by sheet metal mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, not less than 0.38 mm thick, and with a melting point not below 650°C, or by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.15.(2) (see Note A-3.1.4.2.(1)(c)).

National Sentence Text: A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastics is permitted in a building required to be of combustible construction, provided the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick having a melting point not less than 650°C, do not contain an air space, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the space in which they are located or the space that they bound, as applicable. (See Note A-3.1.4.2.(2) and 3.1.5.7.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastics is permitted in a building required to be of combustible construction, provided the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick having a melting point not less than 650°C, do not contain an air space, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in part 3., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the space in which they are located or the space that they bound, as applicable.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of doors containing foamed plastics shall comply with Sentences 3.1.13.2.(1)to 3.1.13.2.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of doors containing foamed plastics shall comply with Sentences 3.1.13.2.(1) to 3.1.13.2.(3).

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.1.4.3.(2), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are installed in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test (FT1 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables or be located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Clause 3.1.5.23.(1)(b). (See Note A-3.1.4.3.(1).) (See also Sentence 3.6.4.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.1.4.3.(2), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are installed in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test (FT1 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables or be located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Sentence 3.1.5.23.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.1.4.3.(3)and 3.1.4.3.(4), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and are installed in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall exhibit the following characteristics when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating): a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.1.4.3.(3) and 3.1.4.3.(4), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and are installed in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall exhibit the following characteristics when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating): a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.1.4.3.(4), where totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are used in a plenum, exposed components of wiring systems with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes, including optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data, that are installed in the plenum or that extend not more than 9 m from the plenum, including drop down to the floor level, are permitted, provided they exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.1.4.3.(4), where totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are used in a plenum, exposed components of wiring systems with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes, including optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data, that are installed in the plenum or that extend not more than 9 m from the plenum, including drop down to the floor level, are permitted, provided they exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables

National Sentence Text: Cables or wires within plenums that are used for the transmission of signals in fire alarm systems need not comply with the requirements of Sentence 3.1.4.3.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Cables or wires within plenums that are used for the transmission of signals in fire alarm systems need not comply with the requirements of Sentence 3.1.4.3.(2).

National Sentence Text: Totally enclosed non-metallic raceways used in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall meet the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.23.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: Totally enclosed non-metallic raceways used in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall meet the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.23.(1).

National Sentence Text: If fire-retardant-treated wood is specified in this Part, the wood shall be pressure impregnated with fire-retardant chemicals in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-O80 Series-08 Wood Preservation and have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.
P/T Sentence Text: If fire-retardant-treated wood is specified in this Part, the wood shall be pressure impregnated with fire-retardant chemicals in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-O80 Series-08 Wood Preservation and have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: If combustible construction is permitted and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating more than 45 min, heavy timber construction is permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: If combustible construction is permitted and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating more than 45 min, heavy timber construction is permitted to be used.

National Sentence Text: If heavy timber construction is permitted, it shall conform to Article 3.1.4.7.
P/T Sentence Text: If heavy timber construction is permitted, it shall conform to Article 3.1.4.7.

National Sentence Text: Wood elements in heavy timber construction shall be arranged in heavy solid masses and with essentially smooth flat surfaces to avoid thin sections and sharp projections.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood elements in heavy timber construction shall be arranged in heavy solid masses and with essentially smooth flat surfaces to avoid thin sections and sharp projections.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.4.7.(3)to 3.1.4.7.(6)and 3.1.4.7.(12), the minimum dimensions of wood elements in heavy timber construction shall conform to Table 3.1.4.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.4.7.(3) to 3.1.4.7.(6)and 3.1.4.7.(12), the minimum dimensions of wood elements in heavy timber construction shall conform to Table 3.1.4.7.

National Sentence Text: Where splice plates are used at splices of roof arches supported on the tops of walls or abutments, roof trusses, roof beams and roof girders in heavy timber construction, they shall be not less than 64 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Where splice plates are used at splices of roof arches supported on the tops of walls or abutments, roof trusses, roof beams and roof girders in heavy timber construction, they shall be not less than 64 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Floors in heavy timber construction shall be of glued-laminated or solid sawn plank not less than 64 mm thick, splined or tongued and grooved, or 38 mm wide and 89 mm deep set on edge and well spiked together.
P/T Sentence Text: Floors in heavy timber construction shall be of glued-laminated or solid sawn plank not less than 64 mm thick, splined or tongued and grooved, or 38 mm wide and 89 mm deep set on edge and well spiked together.

National Sentence Text: Floors in heavy timber construction shall be laid so that no continuous line of end joints will occur except at points of support, and covered with tongued and grooved flooring not less than 19 mm thick laid crosswise or diagonally, or tongued and grooved phenolic-bonded plywood, strandboard or waferboard not less than 12.5 mm thick, and not closer than 15 mm to the walls to provide for expansion, with the gap covered at the top or bottom.
P/T Sentence Text: Floors in heavy timber construction shall be laid so that no continuous line of end joints will occur except at points of support, and covered with tongued and grooved flooring not less than 19 mm thick laid crosswise or diagonally, or tongued and grooved phenolic-bonded plywood, strandboard or waferboard not less than 12.5 mm thick, and not closer than 15 mm to the walls to provide for expansion, with the gap covered at the top or bottom.

National Sentence Text: Roofs in heavy timber construction shall be of tongued and grooved phenolic-bonded plywood, strandboard or waferboard not less than 28 mm thick, or glued-laminated or solid sawn plank that is not less than 38 mm thick, splined or tongued and grooved, or not less than 38 mm wide and 64 mm deep set on edge and laid so that no continuous line of end joints will occur except at the points of support.
P/T Sentence Text: Roofs in heavy timber construction shall be of tongued and grooved phenolic-bonded plywood, strandboard or waferboard not less than 28 mm thick, or glued-laminated or solid sawn plank that is not less than 38 mm thick, splined or tongued and grooved, or not less than 38 mm wide and 64 mm deep set on edge and laid so that no continuous line of end joints will occur except at the points of support.

National Sentence Text: Wood columns in heavy timber construction shall be continuous or superimposed throughout all storeys.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood columns in heavy timber construction shall be continuous or superimposed throughout all storeys.

National Sentence Text: Superimposed wood columns in heavy timber construction shall be connected by reinforced concrete or metal caps with brackets, steel or iron caps with pintles and base plates, or timber splice plates fastened to the columns by metal connectors housed within the contact faces.
P/T Sentence Text: Superimposed wood columns in heavy timber construction shall be connected by reinforced concrete or metal caps with brackets, steel or iron caps with pintles and base plates, or timber splice plates fastened to the columns by metal connectors housed within the contact faces.

National Sentence Text: Where beams and girders in heavy timber construction enter masonry, wall plates, boxes of the self-releasing type or hangers shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where beams and girders in heavy timber construction enter masonry, wall plates, boxes of the self-releasing type or hangers shall be used.

National Sentence Text: Wood girders and beams in heavy timber construction shall be closely fitted to columns, and adjoining ends shall be connected by ties or caps to transfer horizontal loads across the joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood girders and beams in heavy timber construction shall be closely fitted to columns, and adjoining ends shall be connected by ties or caps to transfer horizontal loads across the joints.

National Sentence Text: In heavy timber construction, intermediate wood beams used to support a floor shall be supported on top of the girders or on metal hangers into which the ends of the beams are closely fitted.
P/T Sentence Text: In heavy timber construction, intermediate wood beams used to support a floor shall be supported on top of the girders or on metal hangers into which the ends of the beams are closely fitted.

National Sentence Text: Roof arches supported on the top of walls or abutments, roof trusses, roof beams and roof girders in heavy timber construction are permitted to be not less than 64 mm wide provided where two or more spaced members are used, the intervening spaces are blocked solidly throughout, or tightly closed by a continuous wood cover plate not less than 38 mm thick secured to the underside of the members, or the underneath of the roof deck or sheathing is sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof arches supported on the top of walls or abutments, roof trusses, roof beams and roof girders in heavy timber construction are permitted to be not less than 64 mm wide provided where two or more spaced members are used, the intervening spaces are blocked solidly throughout, or tightly closed by a continuous wood cover plate not less than 38 mm thick secured to the underside of the members, or the underneath of the roof deck or sheathing is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Not less than 90% of the exterior cladding on each exterior wall of buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58. shall consist of noncombustible cladding, or a wall assembly that satisfies the criteria of Clause 3.1.5.5.(1)(b). (See Note A-3.1.4.8.(1).) (See also Notes A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)(i)and A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)(ii).)
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than 90% of the exterior cladding on each exterior wall of buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58. shall consist of noncombustible cladding, or a wall assembly that satisfies the criteria of Sentence 3.1.5.5.(1).

National Sentence Text: A wall assembly conforming to Clause 3.1.4.8.(1)(b) that includes combustible cladding made of fire-retardant-treated wood shall be tested for fire exposure after the cladding has been subjected to the accelerated weathering test specified in ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing (See Note A-3.1.4.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A wall assembly conforming to Sentence 3.1.4.8.(1) that includes combustible cladding made of fire-retardant-treated wood shall be tested for fire exposure after the cladding has been subjected to the accelerated weathering test specified in ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.5.1.(2)to 3.1.5.1.(4) and Articles 3.1.5.2.to 3.1.5.24., Article 3.1.13.4. and Article 3.2.2.16., a building or part of a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall be constructed with noncombustible materials. (See also Subsection 3.1.13. for the requirements regarding the flame-spread rating of interior finishes.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.5.1.(2) to 3.1.5.1.(4) and Articles 3.1.5.2.to 3.1.5.24., Article 3.1.13.4. and Article 3.2.2.16., a building or part of a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall be constructed with noncombustible materials. (See also part 3. for the requirements regarding the flame-spread rating of interior finishes.)

National Sentence Text: Notwithstanding the definition of noncombustible materials stated in Article 1.4.1.2., a material is permitted to be used in noncombustible construction provided that, when tested in accordance with ULC ULC-S135-04 Test Method for the Determination of Combustibility Parameters of Building Materials Using an Oxygen Consumption Calorimeter (Cone at a heat flux of 50 kW/m2, its average total heat release is not more than 3 MJ/m2, its average total smoke extinction area is not more than 1.0 m2, and the test duration is extended beyond the time stipulated in the referenced standard until it is clear that there is no further release of heat or smoke.
P/T Sentence Text: Notwithstanding the definition of noncombustible materials stated in Article 1.4.1.2., a material is permitted to be used in noncombustible construction provided that, when tested in accordance with ULC ULC-S135-04 Test Method for the Determination of Combustibility Parameters of Building Materials Using an Oxygen Consumption Calorimeter (Cone at a heat flux of 50 kW/m2 , its average total heat release is not more than 3 MJ/m2, its average total smoke extinction area is not more than 1.0 m2, and the test duration is extended beyond the time stipulated in the referenced standard until it is clear that there is no further release of heat or smoke.

National Sentence Text: If a material referred to in Sentence 3.1.5.1.(2) consists of a number of discrete layers and testing reveals that the surface layer or layers protect the underlying layers such that complete combustion of the underlying layers does not occur, the test shall be repeated by removing the outer layers sequentially until all layers have been exposed during testing, or until complete combustion has occurred.
P/T Sentence Text: If a material referred to in Sentence 3.1.5.1.(2) consists of a number of discrete layers and testing reveals that the surface layer or layers protect the underlying layers such that complete combustion of the underlying layers does not occur, the test shall be repeated by removing the outer layers sequentially until all layers have been exposed during testing, or until complete combustion has occurred.

National Sentence Text: The acceptance criteria for a material tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.5.1.(3) shall be based on the cumulative emissions from all layers, which must not exceed the criteria stated in Clauses 3.1.5.1.(2)(a)and 3.1.5.1.(2)(b).
P/T Sentence Text: The acceptance criteria for a material tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.5.1.(3) shall be based on the cumulative emissions from all layers, which must not exceed the criteria stated in Clauses 3.1.5.1.(2) and 3.1.5.1.(2).

National Sentence Text: The following minor combustible components are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction: paint (see also Clause 3.1.13.1.(2)(b)), self-adhesive tapes, mastics and caulking materials, including foamed plastic air sealants, applied to provide a seal between the major components of exterior wall construction, (see also Article 3.6.4.3. for limits on the use of combustible materials in plenum spaces), fire stops and fire blocks conforming to Sentence 3.1.9.1.(1) and Article 3.1.11.7., tubing for pneumatic controls provided it has an outside diameter of not more than 10 mm, adhesives, vapour barriers and sheathing papers, electrical outlet and junction boxes, wood blocking within wall assemblies intended for the attachment of handrails, fixtures, and similar items mounted on the surface of the wall, and similar minor components.
P/T Sentence Text: The following minor combustible components are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction: paint (see also Sentence 3.1.13.1.(2)), self-adhesive tapes, mastics and caulking materials, including foamed plastic air sealants, applied to provide a seal between the major components of exterior wall construction, (see also Article 3.6.4.3. for limits on the use of combustible materials in plenum spaces), fire stops and fire blocks conforming to Sentence 3.1.9.1.(1) and Article 3.1.11.7., tubing for pneumatic controls provided it has an outside diameter of not more than 10 mm, adhesives, vapour barriers and sheathing papers, electrical outlet and junction boxes, wood blocking within wall assemblies intended for the attachment of handrails, fixtures, and similar items mounted on the surface of the wall, and similar minor components.

National Sentence Text: Combustible roof covering that has an A, B, or C classification determined in conformance with Subsection 3.1.15. is permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible roof covering that has an A, B, or C classification determined in conformance with part 3. is permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Combustible roof sheathing and roof sheathing supports installed above a concrete deck are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustibleconstruction provided the concrete deck is not less than 50 mm thick, the height of the roof space above the deck is not more than 1 m, the roof space is divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with Article 3.1.11.5., openings through the concrete deck other than for noncombustible roof drains and plumbing piping are protected by masonry or concrete shafts constructed as fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and extending from the concrete deck to not less than 150 mm above the adjacent roof sheathing, the perimeter of the roof is protected by a noncombustible parapet extending from the concrete deck to not less than 150 mm above the adjacent sheathing, and except as permitted by Clause 3.1.5.3.(2)(d), the roof space does not contain any building services.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible roof sheathing and roof sheathing supports installed above a concrete deck are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustibleconstruction provided the concrete deck is not less than 50 mm thick, the height of the roof space above the deck is not more than 1 m, the roof space is divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with Article 3.1.11.5., openings through the concrete deck other than for noncombustible roof drains and plumbing piping are protected by masonry or concrete shafts constructed as fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and extending from the concrete deck to not less than 150 mm above the adjacent roof sheathing, the perimeter of the roof is protected by a noncombustible parapet extending from the concrete deck to not less than 150 mm above the adjacent sheathing, and except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.3.(2), the roof space does not contain any building services.

National Sentence Text: Combustible cant strips, roof curbs, nailing strips and similar components used in the installation of roofing are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible cant strips, roof curbs, nailing strips and similar components used in the installation of roofing are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Wood nailer facings to parapets, not more than 600 mm high, are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction, if the facings and any roof membranes covering the facings are protected by sheet metal.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood nailer facings to parapets, not more than 600 mm high, are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction, if the facings and any roof membranes covering the facings are protected by sheet metal.

National Sentence Text: Combustible skylight assemblies are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction if the assemblies have a flame-spread rating not more than 150 provided the assemblies have an individual area not more than 9 m2, have an aggregate horizontal projected area of the openings through the ceiling not more than 25% of the area of the ceiling of the room or space in which they are located, and are spaced not less than 2.5 m from adjacent assemblies and from required fire separations, or 75 provided the assemblies have an individual area not more than 27 m2, have an aggregate horizontal projected area of the openings through the ceiling not more than 33% of the area of the ceiling of the room or space in which they are located, and are spaced not less than 1.2 m from adjacent assemblies and from required fire separations. (See Note A-3.1.5.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible skylight assemblies are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction if the assemblies have a flame-spread rating not more than 150 provided the assemblies have an individual area not more than 9 m2 , have an aggregate horizontal projected area of the openings through the ceiling not more than 25% of the area of the ceiling of the room or space in which they are located, and are spaced not less than 2.5 m from adjacent assemblies and from required fire separations, or 75 provided the assemblies have an individual area not more than 27 m2 , have an aggregate horizontal projected area of the openings through the ceiling not more than 33% of the area of the ceiling of the room or space in which they are located, and are spaced not less than 1.2 m from adjacent assemblies and from required fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Combustible vertical glazing installed no higher than the second storey is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible vertical glazing installed no higher than the second storey is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.4.(4), the combustible vertical glazing permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.4.(2) shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 75.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.4.(4), the combustible vertical glazing permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.4.(2) shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 75.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of combustible glazing is permitted to be not more than 150 if the aggregate area of glazing is not more than 25% of the wall area of the storey in which it is located, and the glazing is installed in a building not more than 1 storey in building height, the glazing in the first storey is separated from the glazing in the second storey in accordance with the requirements of Article 3.2.3.17. for opening protection, or the building is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of combustible glazing is permitted to be not more than 150 if the aggregate area of glazing is not more than 25% of the wall area of the storey in which it is located, and the glazing is installed in a building not more than 1 storey in building height, the glazing in the first storey is separated from the glazing in the second storey in accordance with the requirements of Article 3.2.3.17. for opening protection, or the building is sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: Combustible window sashes and frames are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided each window in an exterior wall face is an individual unit separated by noncombustible wall construction from every other opening in the wall, windows in exterior walls in contiguous storeys are separated by not less than 1 m of noncombustible construction, and the aggregate area of openings in an exterior wall face of a fire compartment is not more than 40% of the area of the wall face.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible window sashes and frames are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided each window in an exterior wall face is an individual unit separated by noncombustible wall construction from every other opening in the wall, windows in exterior walls in contiguous storeys are separated by not less than 1 m of noncombustible construction, and the aggregate area of openings in an exterior wall face of a fire compartment is not more than 40% of the area of the wall face.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.5.5.(2)and 3.1.5.5.(3), combustible cladding is permitted to be used on an exterior wall assembly in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or sprinklered throughout, and when tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S134-13 Fire Test of Exterior Wall Assemblies the wall assembly satisfies the following criteria for testing and conditions of acceptance (see Note A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)): flaming on or in the wall assembly does not spread more than 5 m above the opening (see Note A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)(i)), and the heat flux during the flame exposure on the wall assembly is not more than 35 kW/m 2 measured at 3.5 m above the opening (see Note A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)(ii)).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.5.5.(2) and 3.1.5.5.(3), combustible cladding is permitted to be used on an exterior wall assembly in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or sprinklered throughout, and when tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S134-13 Fire Test of Exterior Wall Assemblies the wall assembly satisfies the following criteria for testing and conditions of acceptance (see Note A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)): flaming on or in the wall assembly does not spread more than 5 m above the opening (see Note A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)(i)), and the heat flux during the flame exposure on the wall assembly is not more than 35 kW/m 2 measured at 3.5 m above the opening (see Note A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)(ii)).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.3.10.and 3.2.3.11., where the limiting distance in Tables 3.2.3.1.-Bto 3.2.3.1.-E permits an area of unprotected openings of not more than 10% of the exposing building face, the construction requirements of Table 3.2.3.7. shall be met.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.3.10. and 3.2.3.11., where the limiting distance in Tables 3.2.3.1.-B to 3.2.3.1.-E permits an area of unprotected openings of not more than 10% of the exposing building face, the construction requirements of Table 3.2.3.7. shall be met.

National Sentence Text: A wall assembly permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.5.(1) that includes combustible cladding of fire-retardant-treated wood shall be tested for fire exposure after the cladding has been subjected to an accelerated weathering test as specified in ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing
P/T Sentence Text: A wall assembly permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.5.(1) that includes combustible cladding of fire-retardant-treated wood shall be tested for fire exposure after the cladding has been subjected to an accelerated weathering test as specified in ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing

National Sentence Text: Combustible components, other than those permitted by Article 3.1.5.5., are permitted to be used in an exterior wall assembly of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or sprinklered throughout, and the wall assembly meets the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.5.(1)(b), or is protected by masonry or concrete cladding not less than 25 mm thick (see Note A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible components, other than those permitted by Article 3.1.5.5., are permitted to be used in an exterior wall assembly of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or sprinklered throughout, and the wall assembly meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.5.(1), or is protected by masonry or concrete cladding not less than 25 mm thick (see Note A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.5.7.(2), factory-assembled wall and ceiling panels containing foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 500 are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered, is not more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, and does not contain a Group A, Group B, or Group C major occupancy, and the panels do not contain an air space, when tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S138-06 Test for Fire Growth of Insulated Building Panels in a Full-Scale Room Configuration meet the criteria defined therein, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the room or space that they bound.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.5.7.(2), factory-assembled wall and ceiling panels containing foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 500 are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered, is not more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, and does not contain a Group A, Group B, or Group C major occupancy, and the panels do not contain an air space, when tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S138-06 Test for Fire Growth of Insulated Building Panels in a Full-Scale Room Configuration meet the criteria defined therein, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in part 3., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the room or space that they bound.

National Sentence Text: Factory-assembled exterior wall panels containing thermosetting foamed plastic insulation are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, and does not contain a Group B or Group C major occupancy, and the wall panels do not contain an air space, are protected on both sides by sheet steel not less than 0.38 mm thick, remain in place for not less than 10 min when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials where the exposed surface includes typical vertical and horizontal joints, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the room or space that they bound.
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-assembled exterior wall panels containing thermosetting foamed plastic insulation are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, and does not contain a Group B or Group C major occupancy, and the wall panels do not contain an air space, are protected on both sides by sheet steel not less than 0.38 mm thick, remain in place for not less than 10 min when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials where the exposed surface includes typical vertical and horizontal joints, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in part 3., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the room or space that they bound.

National Sentence Text: A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 500 is permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered, and the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick with a melting point not less than 650°C, do not contain an air space, when tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S138-06 Test for Fire Growth of Insulated Building Panels in a Full-Scale Room Configuration meet the criteria defined therein, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the space in which they are located or the space that they bound, as applicable. (See Note A-3.1.4.2.(2) and 3.1.5.7.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 500 is permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered, and the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick with a melting point not less than 650°C, do not contain an air space, when tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S138-06 Test for Fire Growth of Insulated Building Panels in a Full-Scale Room Configuration meet the criteria defined therein, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in part 3., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the space in which they are located or the space that they bound, as applicable.

National Sentence Text: Wood nailing elements attached directly to or set into a continuous noncombustible backing for the attachment of interior finishes are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the concealed space created by the wood elements is not more than 50 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood nailing elements attached directly to or set into a continuous noncombustible backing for the attachment of interior finishes are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the concealed space created by the wood elements is not more than 50 mm thick.

P/T Sentence Text: Combustible insulation is permitted to be installed above roof decks, outside of foundation walls below ground level, and beneath concrete slabs-on-ground of buildings required to be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Combustible insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the exterior walls of a building required to be of noncombustible construction that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, lath and plaster, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, masonry or concrete not less than 25 mm thick, or any thermal barrier that, when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials will not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 10 min (see Note A-3.1.5.14.(5)(d)) (see also Article 3.2.3.7.).

National Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the interior walls, within ceilings and within roof assemblies of a building required to be of noncombustible construction that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of Type X gypsum board not less than 15.9 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, conforming to ASTM C 1177/C 1177M-13 Glass Mat Gypsum Substrate for Use as Sheathing ASTM C 1178/C 1178M-13 Coated Glass Mat Water-Resistant Gypsum Backing Panel ASTM C 1396/C 1396M-14 Gypsum Board or CSA CAN/CSA-A82.27-M91 Gypsum Board non-loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 50 mm thick, loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 75 mm thick, or any thermal barrier that, when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials does not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 20 min, and remains in place for not less than 40 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the interior walls, within ceilings and within roof assemblies of a building required to be of noncombustible construction that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of Type X gypsum board not less than 15.9 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, conforming to ASTM C 1177/C 1177M-13 Glass Mat Gypsum Substrate for Use as Sheathing ASTM C 1178/C 1178M-13 Coated Glass Mat Water-Resistant Gypsum Backing Panel ASTM C 1396/C 1396M-14 Gypsum Board or CSA CAN/CSA-A82.27-M91 Gypsum Board non-loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 50 mm thick, loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 75 mm thick, or any thermal barrier that, when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials does not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 20 min, and remains in place for not less than 40 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.16.(2), solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and wood framing in partitions located in a fire compartment not more than 600 m2 in area are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout provided the partitions are not required fire separations, and are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.16.(2), solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and wood framing in partitions located in a fire compartment not more than 600 m2 in area are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout provided the partitions are not required fire separations, and are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Partitions installed in a building of noncombustible construction are permitted to contain wood framing provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, the partitions are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy, and the partitions are not installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Partitions installed in a building of noncombustible construction are permitted to contain wood framing provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, the partitions are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy, and the partitions are not installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces.

National Sentence Text: Solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and partitions that contain wood framing are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the building is sprinklered throughout, and the partitions are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy, installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces, or used to satisfy the requirements of Clause 3.2.8.1.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: Solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and partitions that contain wood framing are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the building is sprinklered throughout, and the partitions are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy, installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces, or used to satisfy the requirements of Clause 3.2.8.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: Storage lockers in storage rooms are permitted to be constructed of wood in a building of residential occupancy required to be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage lockers in storage rooms are permitted to be constructed of wood in a building of residential occupancy required to be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.6.4.3.(1), combustible ducts, including plenums and duct connectors, are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided these ducts and duct connectors are used only in horizontal runs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.6.4.3.(1), combustible ducts, including plenums and duct connectors, are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided these ducts and duct connectors are used only in horizontal runs.

National Sentence Text: Combustible duct linings, duct coverings, duct insulation, vibration isolation connectors, duct tape, pipe insulation and pipe coverings are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they conform to the appropriate requirements of Subsection 3.6.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible duct linings, duct coverings, duct insulation, vibration isolation connectors, duct tape, pipe insulation and pipe coverings are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they conform to the appropriate requirements of part 3.

National Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible ducts need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.6.5.1.(1)and 3.6.5.1.(2) provided the ducts are part of a duct system conveying only ventilation air, and contained entirely within a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible ducts need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.6.5.1.(1)and 3.6.5.1.(2) provided the ducts are part of a duct system conveying only ventilation air, and contained entirely within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Clause 3.1.5.2.(1)(d) and Sentences 3.1.5.19.(2)and 3.1.5.19.(3), combustible piping and tubing and associated adhesives are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided that, except when concealed in a wall or concrete floor slab, they have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and if used in a building described in Subsection 3.2.6., have a smoke developed classification not more than 50.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.2.(1) and Sentences 3.1.5.19.(2) and 3.1.5.19.(3), combustible piping and tubing and associated adhesives are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided that, except when concealed in a wall or concrete floor slab, they have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and if used in a building described in part 3., have a smoke developed classification not more than 50.

National Sentence Text: Combustible sprinkler piping is permitted to be used within a sprinkleredfloor area in a building required to be of noncombustible construction. (See also Article 3.2.5.13.) (See also Article 3.2.5.13.)
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible sprinkler piping is permitted to be used within a sprinklered floor area in a building required to be of noncombustible construction. (See also Article 3.2.5.13.)

National Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipes and fittings are permitted to be used for drain, waste and vent piping for the conveyance of highly corrosive materials and for piping used to distribute distilled or dialyzed water in laboratory and hospital facilities in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered throughout, the piping is not located in a vertical shaft, and piping that penetrates a fire separation is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.
P/T Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipes and fittings are permitted to be used for drain, waste and vent piping for the conveyance of highly corrosive materials and for piping used to distribute distilled or dialyzed water in laboratory and hospital facilities in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered throughout, the piping is not located in a vertical shaft, and piping that penetrates a fire separation is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.

National Sentence Text: Combustible plumbing fixtures, including wall and ceiling enclosures that form part of the plumbing fixture, are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they are constructed of material having a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification not more than that permitted for the wall surface of the room or space in which they are installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible plumbing fixtures, including wall and ceiling enclosures that form part of the plumbing fixture, are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they are constructed of material having a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification not more than that permitted for the wall surface of the room or space in which they are installed.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.1.5.21.(2) and Article 3.1.5.22., optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables the wires and cables are located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Clause 3.1.5.23.(1)(b), or the wires and cables are communication cables used at the service entry to a building and are not more than 3 m long. (See Note A-3.1.5.21.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.1.5.21.(2) and Article 3.1.5.22., optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables the wires and cables are located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Sentence 3.1.5.23.(1), or the wires and cables are communication cables used at the service entry to a building and are not more than 3 m long.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.1.5.21.(3)and 3.1.5.21.(4), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and are not located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to be installed in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.1.5.21.(3) and 3.1.5.21.(4), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and are not located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to be installed in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.1.5.21.(4), where totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are used in a plenum, exposed components of wiring systems with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes, including optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data, that are installed in the plenum or that extend not more than 9 m from the plenum including drop down to the floor level, are permitted provided they exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.1.5.21.(4), where totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are used in a plenum, exposed components of wiring systems with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes, including optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data, that are installed in the plenum or that extend not more than 9 m from the plenum including drop down to the floor level, are permitted provided they exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables

National Sentence Text: Cables or wires within plenums that are used for the transmission of signals in fire alarm systems need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.1.5.21.(2)and 3.1.5.21.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: Cables or wires within plenums that are used for the transmission of signals in fire alarm systems need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.1.5.21.(2) and 3.1.5.21.(3).

National Sentence Text: Combustible travelling cables are permitted on elevating devices in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible travelling cables are permitted on elevating devices in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Totally enclosed non-metallic raceways used in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating).
P/T Sentence Text: Totally enclosed non-metallic raceways used in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating).

National Sentence Text: On buildings required to be of noncombustible construction, decorative wood cladding is permitted to be used on the exterior fascias and soffits of marquees or canopies on the building face of a storey having direct access to a street or access route, provided the wood cladding is fire-retardant-treated wood that has been conditioned in conformance with ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing before being tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies (See Note A-3.1.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: On buildings required to be of noncombustible construction, decorative wood cladding is permitted to be used on the exterior fascias and soffits of marquees or canopies on the building face of a storey having direct access to a street or access route, provided the wood cladding is fire-retardant-treated wood that has been conditioned in conformance with ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing before being tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures shall conform to Sections 3.3.and 3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures shall conform to Sections 3. and 3.

National Sentence Text: An air-supported structure shall not be located above the first storey on any building.
P/T Sentence Text: An air-supported structure shall not be located above the first storey on any building.

National Sentence Text: An air-supported structure shall not be used for Groups B, C, or Group F, Division 1 major occupancies or for classrooms.
P/T Sentence Text: An air-supported structure shall not be used for Groups B, C, or Group F, Division 1 major occupancies or for classrooms.

National Sentence Text: An air-supported structure shall be designed as open floor space without interior walls, mezzanines, intermediate floors or similar construction.
P/T Sentence Text: An air-supported structure shall be designed as open floor space without interior walls, mezzanines, intermediate floors or similar construction.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.6.3.(2), 3.1.6.3.(3)and 3.1.6.3.(4), every tent and air-supported structure shall conform to Subsection 3.2.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.6.3.(2) , 3.1.6.3.(3)and 3.1.6.3.(4), every tent and air-supported structure shall conform to part 3.

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other structures on the same property except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.6.3.(3)and 3.1.6.3.(4), and shall be sufficiently distant from one another to provide an area to be used as a means of emergency egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other structures on the same property except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.6.3.(3)and 3.1.6.3.(4), and shall be sufficiently distant from one another to provide an area to be used as a means of emergency egress.

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures not occupied by the public need not be separated from one another, and are permitted to be erected less than 3 m from other structures on the same property provided this spacing does not create a hazard to the public.
