National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.11.5.(4), in buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58., horizontal concealed spaces within a floor assembly or roof assembly of combustible construction shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments that are not more than 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 60 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and not more than 300 m2 in area with no dimension more than 20 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25. (See Note A-3.1.11.5.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.11.5.(4), in buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58., horizontal concealed spaces within a floor assembly or roof assembly of combustible construction shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments that are not more than 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 60 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and not more than 300 m2 in area with no dimension more than 20 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25.

National Sentence Text: Fire blocks conforming to Sentence 3.1.11.5.(3) are not required where the horizontal concealed space within the floor or roof assembly is entirely filled with noncombustible insulation such that any air gap between the top of the insulation and the floor or roof deck does not exceed 50 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks conforming to Sentence 3.1.11.5.(3) are not required where the horizontal concealed space within the floor or roof assembly is entirely filled with noncombustible insulation such that any air gap between the top of the insulation and the floor or roof deck does not exceed 50 mm.

National Sentence Text: A crawl space that is not considered as a basement by Article 3.2.2.9. and in which sprinklers are not installed, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments not more than 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 30 m.
P/T Sentence Text: A crawl space that is not considered as a basement by Article 3.2.2.9. and in which sprinklers are not installed, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments not more than 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 30 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.11.7.(2)to 3.1.11.7.(4)and 3.1.11.7.(7), fire blocks shall remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.11.7.(2) to 3.1.11.7.(4)and 3.1.11.7.(7), fire blocks shall remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials

National Sentence Text: Gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick and sheet steel not less than 0.38 mm thick need not be tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.11.7.(1), provided all joints have continuous support.
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick and sheet steel not less than 0.38 mm thick need not be tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.11.7.(1), provided all joints have continuous support.

National Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, wood nailing elements described in Article 3.1.5.8. need not be tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.11.7.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, wood nailing elements described in Article 3.1.5.8. need not be tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.11.7.(1).

National Sentence Text: In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, in a combustible roof system permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.3.(2), and in a raised platform permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.10.(2), fire blocks are permitted to be solid lumber or a structural composite lumber product conforming to ASTM D 5456-10a Evaluation of Structural Composite Lumber Products not less than 38 mm thick, phenolic bonded plywood, waferboard, or oriented strandboard not less than 12.5 mm thick with joints supported, or two thicknesses of lumber or a structural composite lumber product conforming to ASTM D 5456-10a Evaluation of Structural Composite Lumber Products each not less than 19 mm thick with joints staggered, where the width or height of the concealed space requires more than one piece of lumber or structural composite lumber product not less than 38 mm thick to block off the space.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, in a combustible roof system permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.3.(2), and in a raised platform permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.10.(2), fire blocks are permitted to be solid lumber or a structural composite lumber product conforming to ASTM D 5456-10a Evaluation of Structural Composite Lumber Products not less than 38 mm thick, phenolic bonded plywood, waferboard, or oriented strandboard not less than 12.5 mm thick with joints supported, or two thicknesses of lumber or a structural composite lumber product conforming to ASTM D 5456-10a Evaluation of Structural Composite Lumber Products each not less than 19 mm thick with joints staggered, where the width or height of the concealed space requires more than one piece of lumber or structural composite lumber product not less than 38 mm thick to block off the space.

National Sentence Text: Openings through materials referred to in Sentences 3.1.11.7.(1)to 3.1.11.7.(4) shall be protected to maintain the integrity of the construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through materials referred to in Sentences 3.1.11.7.(1)to 3.1.11.7.(4) shall be protected to maintain the integrity of the construction.

National Sentence Text: Where materials referred to in Sentences 3.1.11.7.(1)to 3.1.11.7.(4) are penetrated by construction elements or by service equipment, a fire stop shall be used to seal the penetration. (See Note A-3.1.11.7.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where materials referred to in Sentences 3.1.11.7.(1) to 3.1.11.7.(4) are penetrated by construction elements or by service equipment, a fire stop shall be used to seal the penetration. (See Note A-3.1.11.7.(6).)

National Sentence Text: In buildings permitted to be of combustible construction, semi-rigid fibre insulation board produced from glass, rock or slag is permitted to be used to block the vertical space in a double stud wall assembly formed at the intersection of the floor assembly and the walls, provided the width of the vertical space does not exceed 25 mm and the insulation board has a density not less than 45 kg/m3, is securely fastened to one set of studs, extends from below the bottom of the top plates in the lower storey to above the top of the bottom plate in the upper storey, and completely fills the portion of the vertical space between the headers and between the wall plates. (See Note A-3.1.11.7.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings permitted to be of combustible construction, semi-rigid fibre insulation board produced from glass, rock or slag is permitted to be used to block the vertical space in a double stud wall assembly formed at the intersection of the floor assembly and the walls, provided the width of the vertical space does not exceed 25 mm and the insulation board has a density not less than 45 kg/m3 , is securely fastened to one set of studs, extends from below the bottom of the top plates in the lower storey to above the top of the bottom plate in the upper storey, and completely fills the portion of the vertical space between the headers and between the wall plates.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2) and as permitted by Sentence 3.1.12.1.(3), the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of a material, assembly, or structural member shall be determined on the basis of not less than three tests conducted in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2) and as permitted by Sentence 3.1.12.1.(3), the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of a material, assembly, or structural member shall be determined on the basis of not less than three tests conducted in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of a material or assembly shall be determined on the basis of not less than three tests conducted in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.2-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies if the material or assembly is designed for use in a relatively horizontal position with only its top surface exposed to air, cannot be tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(1) without the use of supporting material that is not representative of the intended installation, or is thermoplastic.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of a material or assembly shall be determined on the basis of not less than three tests conducted in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.2-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies if the material or assembly is designed for use in a relatively horizontal position with only its top surface exposed to air, cannot be tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(1) without the use of supporting material that is not representative of the intended installation, or is thermoplastic.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided by this Subsection, interior finishes, furnishings and decorative materials shall conform to Section 2.3. of Division B of the NFC.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as otherwise provided by this Subsection, interior finishes, furnishings and decorative materials shall conform to Section 2.3. of Division B of the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided by this Subsection, interior finishes, furnishings and decorative materials shall conform to Section 2.3. of Division B of the NFC(AE).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as otherwise provided by this Subsection, interior finishes, furnishings and decorative materials shall conform to Section 2.3. of Division B of the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Interior finish material shall include any material that forms part of the interior surface of a floor, wall, partition or ceiling, including interior cladding of plaster, wood or tile, surfacing of fabric, paint, plastic, veneer or wallpaper, doors, windows and trim, lighting elements such as light diffusers and lenses forming part of the finished surface of the ceiling, and carpet material that overlies a floor that is not intended as the finished floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Interior finish material shall include any material that forms part of the interior surface of a floor, wall, partition or ceiling, including interior cladding of plaster, wood or tile, surfacing of fabric, paint, plastic, veneer or wallpaper, doors, windows and trim, lighting elements such as light diffusers and lenses forming part of the finished surface of the ceiling, and carpet material that overlies a floor that is not intended as the finished floor.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required or permitted by this Subsection, the flame-spread rating of interior wall and ceiling finishes, including glazing and skylights, shall be not more than 150 and shall conform to Table 3.1.13.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required or permitted by this Subsection, the flame-spread rating of interior wall and ceiling finishes, including glazing and skylights, shall be not more than 150 and shall conform to Table 3.1.13.2.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.13.2.(3), doors, other than those in Group A, Division 1 occupancies, need not conform to Sentence 3.1.13.2.(1) provided they have a flame-spread rating not more than 200. (See Note A-3.1.13.2.(2).) (See Note A-3.1.13.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.13.2.(3), doors, other than those in Group A, Division 1 occupancies, need not conform to Sentence 3.1.13.2.(1) provided they have a flame-spread rating not more than 200. (See Note A-3.1.13.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Doors within a dwelling unit need not conform to Sentences 3.1.13.2.(1)and 3.1.13.2.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Doors within a dwelling unit need not conform to Sentences 3.1.13.2.(1) and 3.1.13.2.(2).

National Sentence Text: Up to 10% of the total wall area and 10% of the total ceiling area of a wall or ceiling finish that is required by Sentence 3.1.13.2.(1) to have a flame-spread rating less than 150 is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150, except that up to 25% of the total wall area of lobbies described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2) is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150.
P/T Sentence Text: Up to 10% of the total wall area and 10% of the total ceiling area of a wall or ceiling finish that is required by Sentence 3.1.13.2.(1) to have a flame-spread rating less than 150 is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150, except that up to 25% of the total wall area of lobbies described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2) is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150.

National Sentence Text: Except in the case of Group A, Division 1 occupancies, combustible doors, skylights, glazing and light diffusers and lenses shall not be considered in the calculation of wall and ceiling areas described in Sentence 3.1.13.2.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Except in the case of Group A, Division 1 occupancies, combustible doors, skylights, glazing and light diffusers and lenses shall not be considered in the calculation of wall and ceiling areas described in Sentence 3.1.13.2.(4).

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of interior wall and ceiling finishes for a bathroom within a suite of residential occupancy shall be not more than 200.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of interior wall and ceiling finishes for a bathroom within a suite of residential occupancy shall be not more than 200.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of combustible light diffusers and lenses in all occupancies other than Group A, Division 1 is permitted to be more than the flame-spread rating limits required elsewhere in this Subsection, provided the light diffusers and lenses have a flame-spread rating not more than 250 and a smoke developed classification not more than 600 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.2-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies fall to the bottom of the test apparatus before igniting when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.3-07 Fire Test of Light Diffusers and Lenses are not prevented from falling from the ceiling by construction located beneath the elements, and are not used in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation or in an exit shaft unless individual diffusers or lenses are not more than 1 m2 in area and are not less than 1.2 m apart.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of combustible light diffusers and lenses in all occupancies other than Group A, Division 1 is permitted to be more than the flame-spread rating limits required elsewhere in this Subsection, provided the light diffusers and lenses have a flame-spread rating not more than 250 and a smoke developed classification not more than 600 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.2-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies fall to the bottom of the test apparatus before igniting when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.3-07 Fire Test of Light Diffusers and Lenses are not prevented from falling from the ceiling by construction located beneath the elements, and are not used in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation or in an exit shaft unless individual diffusers or lenses are not more than 1 m2 in area and are not less than 1.2 m apart.

National Sentence Text: Individual combustible skylights in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation shall be not more than 1 m2 in area and not less than 1.2 m apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Individual combustible skylights in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation shall be not more than 1 m2 in area and not less than 1.2 m apart.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.13.6.(2)and 3.1.13.6.(3), the flame-spread rating shall be not more than 75 for the interior wall finish of a public corridor, a corridor used by the public in an assembly occupancy, or a corridor serving classrooms.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.13.6.(2) and 3.1.13.6.(3), the flame-spread rating shall be not more than 75 for the interior wall finish of a public corridor, a corridor used by the public in an assembly occupancy, or a corridor serving classrooms.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating for corridors specified in Sentence 3.1.13.6.(1)is permitted to be waived, provided the flame-spread rating is not more than 25 on the upper half of the wall, and 150 on the lower half of the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating for corridors specified in Sentence 3.1.13.6.(1)is permitted to be waived, provided the flame-spread rating is not more than 25 on the upper half of the wall, and 150 on the lower half of the wall.

National Sentence Text: Where the floor area is sprinklered throughout, the flame-spread ratings for corridors specified in Sentences 3.1.13.6.(1)and 3.1.13.6.(2) shall be not more than 150.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the floor area is sprinklered throughout, the flame-spread ratings for corridors specified in Sentences 3.1.13.6.(1)and 3.1.13.6.(2) shall be not more than 150.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread ratings specified in Sentences 3.1.13.6.(1), 3.1.13.6.(2)and 3.1.13.6.(3) apply to occupancies in the corridor as well as to the corridor itself.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread ratings specified in Sentences 3.1.13.6.(1), 3.1.13.6.(2) and 3.1.13.6.(3) apply to occupancies in the corridor as well as to the corridor itself.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.13.6.(6), the interior ceiling finish of corridors and occupancies referred to in Sentences 3.1.13.6.(1)and 3.1.13.6.(4) shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.13.6.(6), the interior ceiling finish of corridors and occupancies referred to in Sentences 3.1.13.6.(1)and 3.1.13.6.(4) shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: Where the floor area is sprinklered throughout, the flame-spread rating of the interior ceiling finish of corridors and occupancies referred to in Sentences 3.1.13.6.(1) and 3.1.13.6.(4) shall be not more than 150.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the floor area is sprinklered throughout, the flame-spread rating of the interior ceiling finish of corridors and occupancies referred to in Sentences 3.1.13.6.(1) and 3.1.13.6.(4) shall be not more than 150.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.13.7.(2)to 3.1.13.7.(4), the interior wall, ceiling and floor finishes in a building regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6. shall conform to the flame-spread rating requirements in Articles 3.1.13.2.and 3.1.13.11. and to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification values in Table 3.1.13.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.13.7.(2) to 3.1.13.7.(4), the interior wall, ceiling and floor finishes in a building regulated by the provisions of part 3. shall conform to the flame-spread rating requirements in Articles 3.1.13.2.and 3.1.13.11. and to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification values in Table 3.1.13.7.

National Sentence Text: Except for a building of Group B major occupancy and elevator cars, the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of interior wall, floor and ceiling finishes need not conform to the values in Table 3.1.13.7., provided the building is sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a building of Group B major occupancy and elevator cars, the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of interior wall, floor and ceiling finishes need not conform to the values in Table 3.1.13.7., provided the building is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Trim and millwork in an exit stairway, a vestibule to an exit stairway, a lobby described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), or a corridor not within a suite need not conform to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.7.(1) provided they have a flame-spread rating not more than 150, a smoke developed classification not more than 300, and an aggregate area not more than 10% of the area of the wall or ceiling on which they occur.
P/T Sentence Text: Trim and millwork in an exit stairway, a vestibule to an exit stairway, a lobby described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), or a corridor not within a suite need not conform to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.7.(1) provided they have a flame-spread rating not more than 150, a smoke developed classification not more than 300, and an aggregate area not more than 10% of the area of the wall or ceiling on which they occur.

National Sentence Text: A door serving an exit stairway, a vestibule to an exit stairway, a lobby described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), or a corridor not within a suite need not conform to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.7.(1) provided it has a flame-spread rating not more than 200, it has a smoke developed classification not more than 300, and the aggregate area of all doors is not more than 10% of the area of the wall in which they are located.
P/T Sentence Text: A door serving an exit stairway, a vestibule to an exit stairway, a lobby described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), or a corridor not within a suite need not conform to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.7.(1) provided it has a flame-spread rating not more than 200, it has a smoke developed classification not more than 300, and the aggregate area of all doors is not more than 10% of the area of the wall in which they are located.

National Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, the flame-spread ratings required by Subsection 3.1.5. shall apply in addition to the requirements in this Subsection, and the flame-spread ratings for exits in this Subsection shall also apply to any surface in the exit that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, except that this requirement does not apply to doors, heavy timber construction in a sprinkleredbuilding and fire-retardant-treated wood.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, the flame-spread ratings required by part 3. shall apply in addition to the requirements in this Subsection, and the flame-spread ratings for exits in this Subsection shall also apply to any surface in the exit that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, except that this requirement does not apply to doors, heavy timber construction in a sprinklered building and fire-retardant-treated wood.

National Sentence Text: Except for paint, the interior wall and ceiling finishes of an underground walkway shall be of noncombustible materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for paint, the interior wall and ceiling finishes of an underground walkway shall be of noncombustible materials.

National Sentence Text: The wall and ceiling finishes of an exterior exit passageway that provides the only means of egress from the rooms or suites it serves, including the soffit beneath and the guard on the passageway, shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, except that a flame-spread rating not more than 150 is permitted for up to 10% of the total wall area and for up to 10% of the total ceiling area.
P/T Sentence Text: The wall and ceiling finishes of an exterior exit passageway that provides the only means of egress from the rooms or suites it serves, including the soffit beneath and the guard on the passageway, shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, except that a flame-spread rating not more than 150 is permitted for up to 10% of the total wall area and for up to 10% of the total ceiling area.

National Sentence Text: The wall and ceiling surfaces of elevator cars shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 75.
P/T Sentence Text: The wall and ceiling surfaces of elevator cars shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 75.

National Sentence Text: The wall, ceiling and floor surfaces of elevator cars shall have a smoke developed classification not more than 450.
P/T Sentence Text: The wall, ceiling and floor surfaces of elevator cars shall have a smoke developed classification not more than 450.

National Sentence Text: If a fire-retardant-treated wood roof system is used to comply with the requirements of Subsection 3.2.2., the roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of ULC CAN/ULC-S126-14 Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire-retardant-treated wood roof system is used to comply with the requirements of part 3., the roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of ULC CAN/ULC-S126-14 Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies

National Sentence Text: Supports for the roof deck assembly referred to in Sentence 3.1.14.1.(1) shall consist of fire-retardant-treated wood, heavy timber construction, noncombustible construction, or a combination thereof.
P/T Sentence Text: Supports for the roof deck assembly referred to in Sentence 3.1.14.1.(1) shall consist of fire-retardant-treated wood, heavy timber construction, noncombustible construction, or a combination thereof.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.14.2.(2), a metal roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of ULC CAN/ULC-S126-14 Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies if it supports a combustible material above the deck that could propagate a fire beneath the roof deck assembly, and the deck is used to comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.2.2.25.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.32.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.60.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.66.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.76.(2)and 3.2.2.83.(2) for noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.14.2.(2), a metal roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of ULC CAN/ULC-S126-14 Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies if it supports a combustible material above the deck that could propagate a fire beneath the roof deck assembly, and the deck is used to comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.2.2.25.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.32.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.60.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.66.(2), Sentence 3.2.2.76.(2) and 3.2.2.83.(2) for noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.1.14.2.(1) are waived provided the combustible material above the roof deck is protected by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly if located beneath the roof deck, or by a thermal barrier conforming to one of Clauses 3.1.5.15.(2)(c)to 3.1.5.15.(2)(e) that is located on the underside of the combustible material, or beneath the roof deck, the building is sprinklered throughout, or the roof assembly has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.1.14.2.(1) are waived provided the combustible material above the roof deck is protected by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly if located beneath the roof deck, or by a thermal barrier conforming to one of Clauses 3.1.5.15.(2) to 3.1.5.15.(2) that is located on the underside of the combustible material, or beneath the roof deck, the building is sprinklered throughout, or the roof assembly has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: A roof covering classification shall be determined in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S107-10 Fire Tests of Roof Coverings
P/T Sentence Text: A roof covering classification shall be determined in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S107-10 Fire Tests of Roof Coverings

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.15.2.(2)and 3.1.15.2.(3), every roof covering shall have a Class A, B or C classification as determined in accordance with Article 3.1.15.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.15.2.(2) and 3.1.15.2.(3) , every roof covering shall have a Class A, B or C classification as determined in accordance with Article 3.1.15.1.

National Sentence Text: A roof covering is not required to have a Class A, B or C classification for a tent, an air-supported structure, a building of Group A, Division 2 occupancy not more than 2 storeys in building height and not more than 1 000 m2 in building area provided the roof covering is underlaid with noncombustible material, or a steel building system referred to in Article 4.3.4.3., provided the roof covering consists of brick, masonry, concrete, metal sheets or metal shingles.
P/T Sentence Text: A roof covering is not required to have a Class A, B or C classification for a tent, an air-supported structure, a building of Group A, Division 2 occupancy not more than 2 storeys in building height and not more than 1 000 m2 in building area provided the roof covering is underlaid with noncombustible material, or a steel building system referred to in Article 4.3.4.3., provided the roof covering consists of brick, masonry, concrete, metal sheets or metal shingles.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.15.2.(4), roof coverings on buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58. shall have a Class A classification where the roof height is greater than 25 m measured from the floor of the first storey to the highest point of the roof.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.15.2.(4), roof coverings on buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58. shall have a Class A classification where the roof height is greater than 25 m measured from the floor of the first storey to the highest point of the roof.

National Sentence Text: Where buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58. include non-contiguous roof assemblies at different elevations, the roof coverings referred to in Sentence 3.1.15.2.(3) are permitted to be evaluated separately to determine the roof covering classification required.
P/T Sentence Text: Where buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58. include non-contiguous roof assemblies at different elevations, the roof coverings referred to in Sentence 3.1.15.2.(3) are permitted to be evaluated separately to determine the roof covering classification required.

National Sentence Text: Fabrics used as part of an awning, canopy or marquee that is located within or attached to a building of any type of construction shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S109-14 Flame Tests of Flame-Resistant Fabrics and Films
P/T Sentence Text: Fabrics used as part of an awning, canopy or marquee that is located within or attached to a building of any type of construction shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S109-14 Flame Tests of Flame-Resistant Fabrics and Films

National Sentence Text: The occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area shall be based on the number of seats in an assembly occupancy having fixed seats, 2 persons per sleeping room in a dwelling unit, or the number of persons for which the area is designed, but not less than that determined from Table 3.1.17.1. for occupancies other than those described in Clauses 3.1.17.1.(1)(a)and 3.1.17.1.(1)(b), unless it can be shown that the area will be occupied by fewer persons.
P/T Sentence Text: The occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area shall be based on the number of seats in an assembly occupancy having fixed seats, 2 persons per sleeping room in a dwelling unit, or the number of persons for which the area is designed, but not less than that determined from Table 3.1.17.1. for occupancies other than those described in Clauses 3.1.17.1.(1)and 3.1.17.1.(1), unless it can be shown that the area will be occupied by fewer persons.

National Sentence Text: If a floor area or part thereof has been designed for an occupant load other than that determined from Table 3.1.17.1., a permanent sign indicating that occupant load shall be posted in a conspicuous location. See Note A-3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: If a floor area or part thereof has been designed for an occupant load other than that determined from Table 3.1.17.1., a permanent sign indicating that occupant load shall be posted in a conspicuous location.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Article, mezzanines, tiers and balconies shall be regarded as part of the floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Article, mezzanines, tiers and balconies shall be regarded as part of the floor area.

National Sentence Text: If a room or group of rooms is intended for different occupancies at different times, the value to be used from Table 3.1.17.1. shall be the value which gives the greatest number of persons for the occupancies concerned.
P/T Sentence Text: If a room or group of rooms is intended for different occupancies at different times, the value to be used from Table 3.1.17.1. shall be the value which gives the greatest number of persons for the occupancies concerned.

National Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure provided for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
P/T Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure provided for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

National Sentence Text: Space under tiers of seats in a building of the arena type shall not be considered as adding to the building height provided the space is used only for dressing rooms, concession stands and similar purposes incidental to the major occupancy of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Space under tiers of seats in a building of the arena type shall not be considered as adding to the building height provided the space is used only for dressing rooms, concession stands and similar purposes incidental to the major occupancy of the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.1.1.(5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a)), and (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a)), except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.1.1.(7)and 3.3.2.13.(3), the space above the mezzanine is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.1.1.(5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a)), and except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.1.1.(7) and 3.3.2.13.(3), the space above the mezzanine is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.1.1.(5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed and do not meet the conditions of Sentence 3.2.1.1.(3) does not exceed 10% of the floor area in which they are located, and the area of a mezzanine in a suite does not exceed 10% of the area of that suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.1.1.(5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed and do not meet the conditions of Sentence 3.2.1.1.(3) does not exceed 10% of the floor area in which they are located, and the area of a mezzanine in a suite does not exceed 10% of the area of that suite.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.1.1.(6), each level of mezzanine that is partly or wholly superimposed above the first level of mezzanine shall be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.1.1.(6), each level of mezzanine that is partly or wholly superimposed above the first level of mezzanine shall be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

National Sentence Text: Platforms intended solely for periodic inspection and elevated maintenance catwalks need not be considered as floor assemblies or mezzanines for the purpose of calculating building height, provided they are not used for storage, and they are constructed with noncombustible materials, unless the building is permitted to be of combustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Platforms intended solely for periodic inspection and elevated maintenance catwalks need not be considered as floor assemblies or mezzanines for the purpose of calculating building height, provided they are not used for storage, and they are constructed with noncombustible materials, unless the building is permitted to be of combustible construction.

National Sentence Text: The space above a mezzanine conforming to Sentence 3.2.1.1.(3) is permitted to include an enclosed space whose area does not exceed 10% of the open area of the room in which the mezzanine is located provided the enclosed space does not obstruct visual communication between the open space above the mezzanine and the room in which it is located. (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a).)
P/T Sentence Text: The space above a mezzanine conforming to Sentence 3.2.1.1.(3) is permitted to include an enclosed space whose area does not exceed 10% of the open area of the room in which the mezzanine is located provided the enclosed space does not obstruct visual communication between the open space above the mezzanine and the room in which it is located. (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a).)

National Sentence Text: A service space in which facilities are included to permit a person to enter and to undertake maintenance and other operations pertaining to building services from within the service space need not be considered a storey if it conforms to Articles 3.2.5.14.and 3.3.1.24., and Sentences 3.2.4.18.(10), Sentence 3.2.7.3.(2), Sentence 3.3.1.3.(7), Sentence 3.4.2.4.(3)and 3.4.4.4.(9). (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(8).) (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: A service space in which facilities are included to permit a person to enter and to undertake maintenance and other operations pertaining to building services from within the service space need not be considered a storey if it conforms to Articles 3.2.5.14.and 3.3.1.24., and Sentences 3.2.4.18.(10), Sentence 3.2.7.3.(2), Sentence 3.3.1.3.(7), Sentence 3.4.2.4.(3) and 3.4.4.4.(9). (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(8).)

National Sentence Text: A basement used primarily as a storage garage is permitted to be considered as a separate building for the purposes of Subsection 3.2.2.and Sentences 3.2.5.12.(2)and 3.2.5.12.(3), provided the floor and roof assemblies above the basement and the exterior walls of the basement above the adjoining ground level are constructed as fire separations of noncombustible construction having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h and protected in conformance with Clause 3.1.10.2.(4)(a), except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.1.2.(2). (See Notes A-3.1.10.2.(4)and A-3.2.5.12.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A basement used primarily as a storage garage is permitted to be considered as a separate building for the purposes of part 3.and Sentences 3.2.5.12.(2)and 3.2.5.12.(3), provided the floor and roof assemblies above the basement and the exterior walls of the basement above the adjoining ground level are constructed as fire separations of noncombustible construction having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h and protected in conformance with Sentence 3.1.10.2.(4), except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.1.2.(2). (See Notes A-3.1.10.2.(4) and A-3.2.5.12.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The exterior wall of a basement that is required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating in accordance with Sentence 3.2.1.2.(1) is permitted to be penetrated by openings that are not protected by closures provided the storage garage is sprinklered throughout, every opening in the exterior wall is separated from storeys above the opening by a projection of the floor or roof assembly above the basement, extending not less than 1 m beyond the exterior face of the storage garage if the upper storeys are required to be of noncombustible construction, or 2 m beyond the exterior face of the storage garage if the upper storeys are permitted to be of combustible construction, or the exterior walls of any storeys located above the floor or roof assembly referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.2.(1) are recessed behind the outer edge of the assembly by not less than 1 m if the upper storeys are required to be of noncombustible construction, or 2 m if the upper storeys are permitted to be of combustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: The exterior wall of a basement that is required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating in accordance with Sentence 3.2.1.2.(1) is permitted to be penetrated by openings that are not protected by closures provided the storage garage is sprinklered throughout, every opening in the exterior wall is separated from storeys above the opening by a projection of the floor or roof assembly above the basement, extending not less than 1 m beyond the exterior face of the storage garage if the upper storeys are required to be of noncombustible construction, or 2 m beyond the exterior face of the storage garage if the upper storeys are permitted to be of combustible construction, or the exterior walls of any storeys located above the floor or roof assembly referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.2.(1) are recessed behind the outer edge of the assembly by not less than 1 m if the upper storeys are required to be of noncombustible construction, or 2 m if the upper storeys are permitted to be of combustible construction.

National Sentence Text: The floor or roof assembly projection referred to in Clause 3.2.1.2.(2)(b) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h and shall have no openings within the projection.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor or roof assembly projection referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.2.(2) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h and shall have no openings within the projection.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section any part of a roof that is pitched at an angle of 60° or more to the horizontal and is adjacent to a space intended for occupancy within a building shall be considered as part of an exterior wall of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section any part of a roof that is pitched at an angle of 60° or more to the horizontal and is adjacent to a space intended for occupancy within a building shall be considered as part of an exterior wall of the building.

National Sentence Text: All loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a floor assembly immediately above a basement shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required by Sentence 3.2.1.4.(1) for the floor assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: All loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a floor assembly immediately above a basement shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required by Sentence 3.2.1.4.(1) for the floor assembly.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.1.5.(2)and 3.2.2.15.(3), in a building in which an automatic sprinkler system is not required to be installed by Article 3.2.2.18., every basement shall be sprinklered throughout, or be subdivided into fire compartments not more than 600 m2 in area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly immediately above the basement.

National Sentence Text: An open-air storey need not conform to Sentence 3.2.1.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: An open-air storey need not conform to Sentence 3.2.1.5.(1).

National Sentence Text: The floor assembly of a mezzanine that is required to be considered as a storey in calculating the building height shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements for floor assemblies stated in Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90.

Except for buildings constructed under Article 3.2.2.89.or 3.2.2.90., and except for curling rinks or arenas used exclusively for sports activities, places of worship, community halls, gymnasiums and spaces containing a swimming pool, a building shall be protected with an automatic fire suppression system if it has a fire compartment more than 2 000 m2 in area.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except for buildings constructed under Article 3.2.2.89. or 3.2.2.90., and except for curling rinks or arenas used exclusively for sports activities, places of worship, community halls, gymnasiums and spaces containing a swimming pool, a building shall be protected with an automatic fire suppression system if it has a fire compartment more than 2 000 m2 in area.

P/T Sentence Text: Where a building is divided into more than one fire compartment with respect to Sentence 3.2.1.7.(1), the compartments shall be divided by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where a building is divided into more than one fire compartment with respect to Sentence 3.2.1.7.(1), the compartments shall be divided by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

P/T Sentence Text: Except for a building that is constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50., a building of combustible construction that contains a residential occupancy shall have no occupied floor level more than 11 m above the lowest exit level. (See Note A-3.2.1.8.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.3., a building shall be constructed in conformance with this Subsection to prevent fire spread and collapse caused by the effects of fire. (See Subsection 3.1.3. for fire separations between major occupancies.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.3., a building shall be constructed in conformance with this Subsection to prevent fire spread and collapse caused by the effects of fire. (See part 3. for fire separations between major occupancies.)

National Sentence Text: A structure that cannot be identified with the characteristics of a building in Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90. shall be protected against fire spread and collapse in conformance with good fire protection engineering practice. (See Note A-3.2.2.2.(1).) (See also Notes A-3and A-3.2.5.12.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.2.2.(1).) (See also Notes A-3and A-3.2.5.12.(1).)

Underground service passageways shall be considered unusual structures under Sentence 3.2.2.2.(1).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Underground service passageways shall be considered unusual structures under Sentence 3.2.2.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: Fire protection is not required for steel lintels above openings not more than 2 m wide in loadbearing walls and not more than 3 m wide in non-loadbearing walls, steel lintels above openings more than 2 m wide in loadbearing walls and more than 3 m wide in non-loadbearing walls provided the lintels are supported at intervals of not more than 2 m by structural members with the required fire-resistance rating, the bottom flanges of shelf angles and plates that are not a part of the structural frame, steel members for framework around elevator hoistway doorways, steel for the support of elevator and dumbwaiter guides, counterweights and other similar equipment, that are entirely enclosed in a hoistway and are not a part of the structural frame of the building, steel members of stairways and escalators that are not a part of the structural frame of a building, steel members of porches, exterior balconies, exterior stairways, fire escapes, cornices, marquees and other similar appurtenances, provided they are outside an exterior wall of a building, and loadbearing steel or concrete members wholly or partly outside a building face in a building not more than 4 storeys in building height and classified as Group A, B, C, D or F, Division 3 major occupancy provided the members are not less than 1 m away from any unprotected opening in an exterior wall, or shielded from heat radiation in the event of a fire within the building by construction that will provide the same degree of protection that would be necessary if the member was located inside the building, with the protection extending on either side of the member a distance equal to the projection of the member from the face of the wall. (See also Article 3.2.3.9.)
P/T Sentence Text: Fire protection is not required for steel lintels above openings not more than 2 m wide in loadbearing walls and not more than 3 m wide in non-loadbearing walls, steel lintels above openings more than 2 m wide in loadbearing walls and more than 3 m wide in non-loadbearing walls provided the lintels are supported at intervals of not more than 2 m by structural members with the required fire-resistance rating, the bottom flanges of shelf angles and plates that are not a part of the structural frame, steel members for framework around elevator hoistway doorways, steel for the support of elevator and dumbwaiter guides, counterweights and other similar equipment, that are entirely enclosed in a hoistway and are not a part of the structural frame of the building, steel members of stairways and escalators that are not a part of the structural frame of a building, steel members of porches, exterior balconies, exterior stairways, fire escapes, cornices, marquees and other similar appurtenances, provided they are outside an exterior wall of a building, and loadbearing steel or concrete members wholly or partly outside a building face in a building not more than 4 storeys in building height and classified as Group A, B, C, D or F, Division 3 major occupancy provided the members are not less than 1 m away from any unprotected opening in an exterior wall, or shielded from heat radiation in the event of a fire within the building by construction that will provide the same degree of protection that would be necessary if the member was located inside the building, with the protection extending on either side of the member a distance equal to the projection of the member from the face of the wall.

National Sentence Text: The requirements restricting fire spread and collapse for a building of a single major occupancy classification are provided in this Subsection according to its building height and building area.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements restricting fire spread and collapse for a building of a single major occupancy classification are provided in this Subsection according to its building height and building area.

National Sentence Text: If a building contains more than one major occupancy, classified in more than one Group or Division, the requirements of this Subsection concerning building size and construction relative to major occupancy shall apply according to Articles 3.2.2.5.to 3.2.2.8.
P/T Sentence Text: If a building contains more than one major occupancy, classified in more than one Group or Division, the requirements of this Subsection concerning building size and construction relative to major occupancy shall apply according to Articles 3.2.2.5.to 3.2.2.8.

National Sentence Text: In determining the fire safety requirements of a building in relation to each of the major occupancies contained therein, the building height and building area of the entire building shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: In determining the fire safety requirements of a building in relation to each of the major occupancies contained therein, the building height and building area of the entire building shall be used.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.7.and 3.2.2.8., in a building containing more than one major occupancy, the requirements of this Subsection for the most restricted major occupancy contained shall apply to the whole building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.8., in a building containing more than one major occupancy, the requirements of this Subsection for the most restricted major occupancy contained shall apply to the whole building.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.2.2.8. and Sentence 3.2.2.18.(2), in a building in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another major occupancy, the requirements in this Subsection for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall apply to that portion as if the entire building were of that major occupancy.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.2.7.(3) and 3.2.2.7.(4), Article 3.2.2.8. and Sentence 3.2.2.18.(2), in a building in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another major occupancy, the requirements in this Subsection for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall apply to that portion as if the entire building were of that major occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.2.7.(3) and 3.2.2.7.(4), Article 3.2.2.8. and Sentence 3.2.2.18.(2), in a building in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another major occupancy, the requirements in this Subsection for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall apply to that portion as if the entire building were of that major occupancy.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.2.7.(3) and 3.2.2.7.(4), Article 3.2.2.8. and Sentence 3.2.2.18.(2), in a building in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another major occupancy, the requirements in this Subsection for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall apply to that portion as if the entire building were of that major occupancy.

National Sentence Text: If one major occupancy is located above another major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the floor assembly between the major occupancies shall be determined on the basis of the requirements of this Subsection for the lower major occupancy. (See also Article 3.1.3.1.) (See also Article 3.1.3.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: If one major occupancy is located above another major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the floor assembly between the major occupancies shall be determined on the basis of the requirements of this Subsection for the lower major occupancy. (See also Article 3.1.3.1.)

National Sentence Text: A building that is wholly constructed in accordance with the building area and construction requirements of Article 3.2.2.50. shall not contain Group A, Division 2 and Group E major occupancies above the second storey, or a storage garage above the third storey (see also Sentence 4.4.2.1.(1)).
P/T Sentence Text: A building that is wholly constructed in accordance with the building area and construction requirements of Article 3.2.2.50. shall not contain Group A, Division 2 and Group E major occupancies above the second storey, or a storage garage above the third storey (see also Sentence 4.4.2.1.(1)).

National Sentence Text: A building that is wholly constructed in accordance with the building area and construction requirements of Article 3.2.2.58. shall not contain Group A, Division 2, Group E, and Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancies above the second storey, or a storage garage above the third storey (see also Sentence 4.4.2.1.(1)).
P/T Sentence Text: A building that is wholly constructed in accordance with the building area and construction requirements of Article 3.2.2.58. shall not contain Group A, Division 2, Group E, and Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancies above the second storey, or a storage garage above the third storey (see also Sentence 4.4.2.1.(1)).

National Sentence Text: In a building in which the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular Group or Division is not more than 10% of the floor area of the storey in which they are located, these major occupancies need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of this Subsection, provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building in which the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular Group or Division is not more than 10% of the floor area of the storey in which they are located, these major occupancies need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of this Subsection, provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of Articles 3.1.11.6., 3.2.1.4.and 3.2.1.5., a crawl space shall be considered as a basement if it is more than 1.8 m high between the lowest part of the floor assembly and the ground or other surface below, used for any occupancy, used for the passage of flue pipes, or used as a plenum in combustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of Articles 3.1.11.6. , 3.2.1.4. and 3.2.1.5., a crawl space shall be considered as a basement if it is more than 1.8 m high between the lowest part of the floor assembly and the ground or other surface below, used for any occupancy, used for the passage of flue pipes, or used as a plenum in combustible construction.

National Sentence Text: A floor assembly immediately above a crawl space is not required to be constructed as a fire separation and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the crawl space is not required to be considered as a basement by Sentence 3.2.2.9.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: A floor assembly immediately above a crawl space is not required to be constructed as a fire separation and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the crawl space is not required to be considered as a basement by Sentence 3.2.2.9.(1).

National Sentence Text: Every building shall face a street located in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.5.4.and 3.2.5.5. for access routes.
P/T Sentence Text: Every building shall face a street located in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.5.4.and 3.2.5.5. for access routes.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of Subsections 3.2.2.and 3.2.5. an access route conforming to Subsection 3.2.5. is permitted to be considered as a street.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of Subsections 3. and 3. an access route conforming to part 3. is permitted to be considered as a street.

National Sentence Text: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58. is considered to face 1 street where not less than 25% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of a street or streets.
P/T Sentence Text: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58. is considered to face 1 street where not less than 25% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of a street or streets.

National Sentence Text: A building is considered to face 2 streets provided not less than 50% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of the street or streets.
P/T Sentence Text: A building is considered to face 2 streets provided not less than 50% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of the street or streets.

National Sentence Text: A building is considered to face 3 streets provided not less than 75% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of the street or streets.
P/T Sentence Text: A building is considered to face 3 streets provided not less than 75% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of the street or streets.

National Sentence Text: Enclosed spaces, tunnels, bridges and similar structures, even though used for vehicular or pedestrian traffic, are not considered as streets for the purpose of this Part.
P/T Sentence Text: Enclosed spaces, tunnels, bridges and similar structures, even though used for vehicular or pedestrian traffic, are not considered as streets for the purpose of this Part.

National Sentence Text: An exterior balcony shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90., as applicable to the occupancy classification of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: An exterior balcony shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90., as applicable to the occupancy classification of the building.

National Sentence Text: An elevated exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90. for mezzanines.
P/T Sentence Text: An elevated exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90. for mezzanines.

National Sentence Text: A portion of a roof that supports an occupancy shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90. for floor assemblies, and not the fire-resistance rating for roof assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: A portion of a roof that supports an occupancy shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. for floor assemblies, and not the fire-resistance rating for roof assemblies.

National Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90.
P/T Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90.

National Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room, not more than one storey high, is not required to have a fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room, not more than one storey high, is not required to have a fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for a stairway shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90.
P/T Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for a stairway shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90.

National Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for a stairway need not have a fire-resistance rating nor be constructed as a fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for a stairway need not have a fire-resistance rating nor be constructed as a fire separation.

National Sentence Text: If a building is erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level and does not extend more than one storey below that ground level, the minimum precautions against fire spread and collapse shall be the same as are required for basements under a building of 1 storey in building height having the same occupancy and building area.
P/T Sentence Text: If a building is erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level and does not extend more than one storey below that ground level, the minimum precautions against fire spread and collapse shall be the same as are required for basements under a building of 1 storey in building height having the same occupancy and building area.

National Sentence Text: If any portion of a building is erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level and extends more than one storey below that ground level, the following minimum precautions against fire spread and collapse shall be taken: except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.15.(3), the basements shall be sprinklered throughout, a floor assembly below the ground level shall be constructed as a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 3 h if the basements are used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, or 2 h if the basements are not used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the construction that they support.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): If any portion of a building is erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level and extends more than one storey below that ground level, the following minimum precautions against fire spread and collapse shall be taken: the basements shall be sprinklered throughout, a floor assembly below the ground level shall be constructed as a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 3 h if the basements are used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, or 2 h if the basements are not used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the construction that they support.
P/T Sentence Text: If any portion of a building is erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level and extends more than one storey below that ground level, the following minimum precautions against fire spread and collapse shall be taken: the basements shall be sprinklered throughout, a floor assembly below the ground level shall be constructed as a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 3 h if the basements are used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, or 2 h if the basements are not used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the construction that they support.

National Sentence Text: If the first storey of a building is not required to be sprinklered, sprinklers are not required in the storey immediately below the first storey provided the storey below contains only residential occupancies, and has at least one unobstructed access opening conforming to Sentence 3.2.5.1.(2) installed on that storey for each 15 m of wall length in at least one wall required by this Subsection to face a street.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): If the first storey of a building is not required to be sprinklered, sprinklers are not required in the storey immediately below the first storey provided the storey below contains only residential occupancies, and has at least one unobstructed access opening conforming to Sentence 3.2.5.1.(2) installed on that storey for each 15 m of wall length in at least one wall required by this Subsection to face a street.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise permitted by Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90., a roof assembly in a building up to 2 storeys in building height is permitted to be of heavy timber construction regardless of building area or type of construction required, provided the building is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless otherwise permitted by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90., a roof assembly in a building up to 2 storeys in building height is permitted to be of heavy timber construction regardless of building area or type of construction required, provided the building is sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: If Sentence 3.2.2.16.(1) permits a roof assembly to be of heavy timber construction, structural members in the storey immediately below the roof assembly are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.
P/T Sentence Text: If Sentence 3.2.2.16.(1) permits a roof assembly to be of heavy timber construction, structural members in the storey immediately below the roof assembly are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.

National Sentence Text: The requirements for a roof assembly to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived for a gymnasium, a swimming pool, an arena, or a rink if no part of the roof assembly is less than 6 m above the main floor or balcony and the roof carries no loads other than normal roof loads, including permanent access walks, and ventilating, sound and lighting equipment, except that the restriction concerning minimum distance shall not apply to an inclined and stepped floor ascending from the main floor which is used for seating purposes only, or a balcony used for seating purposes only.

National Sentence Text: If a storey in a building or a floor area is required to have an automatic sprinkler system installed throughout in accordance with one or more of Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90. or Section 3.3., the automatic sprinkler system shall also be installed throughout all lower storeys in the building notwithstanding permission in Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90. to construct one or more of those storeys without installing automatic sprinkler protection. (See Note A-3.2.2.18.(2).) (See Note A-3.2.2.18.(2).)

(See Note A-3.2.2.18.(2).)

National Sentence Text: A building containing an impeded egress zone and conforming to the appropriate requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90. is not required to conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.36.and 3.2.2.37. for a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy provided the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, it does not include a contained use area, sleeping accommodation, a high-hazard industrial occupancy, or a mercantile occupancy, the building area is not more than 6 400 m2 if the building includes a medium-hazard industrial occupancy, the impeded egress zone does not extend beyond the boundaries of the fire compartment in which it is located, and the occupant load of the impeded egress zone is not more than 100.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for roof assemblies regulated by Articles 3.2.2.50. and 3.2.2.58., the requirements in Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived provided the building is sprinklered, the sprinkler system in Sentence 3.2.2.18.(3) is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), the operation of the sprinkler system in Sentence 3.2.2.18.(3) will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), and the roof does not support any occupancy other than for servicing or maintenance (see Article 3.2.2.13. for roofs intended for occupancy).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except for roof assemblies regulated by Articles 3.2.2.50. and 3.2.2.58., the requirements in Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived provided the building is sprinklered, the sprinkler system in Clause 3.2.2.18.(3)(a) is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), the operation of the sprinkler system in Clause 3.2.2.18.(3)(a) will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), and the roof does not support any occupancy other than for servicing or maintenance (see Article 3.2.2.13. for roofs intended for occupancy).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.21.and 3.2.2.22., a building classified as Group A, Division 1 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.20.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Except for mezzanines regulated by Articles 3.2.2.50.and 3.2.2.58., the requirements in Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. for mezzanines to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived where the building is sprinklered and the mezzanine is 240 m2 or less in area.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except for mezzanines regulated by Articles 3.2.2.50. and 3.2.2.58., the requirements in Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. for mezzanines to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived where the building is sprinklered and the mezzanine is 240 m2 or less in area.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.20.(1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building shall be sprinklered throughout, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: A building containing an impeded egress zone and conforming to the appropriate requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. is not required to conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.36.and 3.2.2.37. for a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy provided the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, it does not include a contained use area, sleeping accommodation, a high-hazard industrial occupancy, or a mercantile occupancy, the building area is not more than 6 400 m2 if the building includes a medium-hazard industrial occupancy, the impeded egress zone does not extend beyond the boundaries of the fire compartment in which it is located, and the occupant load of the impeded egress zone is not more than 100.

National Sentence Text: A building classified as Group A, Division 1 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.21.(2) provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, it has less than 40% of the area of the building as 2 storeys for the purpose of development of productions, including preparation of scenery and costumes and rehearsal of performers, organization of performers, scenery and sound equipment, preparation by performers for a performance, managerial functions, or toilets, rest rooms and similar public facilities, it has no occupancy above or below the auditorium other than one which serves it or is dependent on it, it is not more than 600 m2 in building area, and the occupant load is not more than 600.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.21. and 3.2.2.22., a building classified as Group A, Division 1 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.20.(2).
