P/T Sentence Text: A building used as a storage garage with all storeys constructed as open-air storeys and having no other occupancy above it is permitted to have its floor, wall, ceiling and roof assemblies constructed without a fire-resistance rating provided it is of noncombustible construction, not more than 22 m high, measured between grade and the ceiling level of the top storey, not more than 10 000 m2 in building area, and designed so that every portion of each floor area is within 60 m of an exterior wall opening.

National Sentence Text: A building used as a storage garage with all storeys constructed as open-air storeys and having no other occupancy above it is permitted to have its floor, wall, ceiling and roof assemblies constructed without a fire-resistance rating provided it is of noncombustible construction, not more than 22 m high, measured between grade and the ceiling level of the top storey, not more than 10 000 m2 in building area, and designed so that every portion of each floor area is within 60 m of an exterior wall opening. (See Note A-3.2.3.)

Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.3.10.to 3.2.3.12., the area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face for the applicable limiting distance shall be not more than the value determined in accordance with Table 3.2.3.1.-Bor 3.2.3.1.-C for an exposing building face conforming to Article 3.2.3.2. of a building or fire compartment which is not sprinklered, or Table 3.2.3.1.-Dor 3.2.3.1.-E for an exposing building face conforming to Article 3.2.3.2. of a sprinklered fire compartment that is part of a building which is sprinklered in conformance with Section 3.2. (See Note A-3.) (See also Article 3.1.6.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.3.10. to 3.2.3.12., the area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face for the applicable limiting distance shall be not more than the value determined in accordance with Table 3.2.3.1.-B or 3.2.3.1.-C for an exposing building face conforming to Article 3.2.3.2. of a building or fire compartment which is not sprinklered, or Table 3.2.3.1.-D or 3.2.3.1.-E for an exposing building face conforming to Article 3.2.3.2. of a sprinklered fire compartment that is part of a building which is sprinklered in conformance with part 3.

National Sentence Text: The area of the unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall be the aggregate area of unprotected openings expressed as a percentage of the area of the exposing building face in Table 3.2.3.1.-B, 3.2.3.1.-C, 3.2.3.1.-Dor 3.2.3.1.-E. (See Sentence 3.2.3.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The area of the unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall be the aggregate area of unprotected openings expressed as a percentage of the area of the exposing building face in Table 3.2.3.1.-B , 3.2.3.1.-C , 3.2.3.1.-D or 3.2.3.1.-E. (See Sentence 3.2.3.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining the type of construction and cladding and the fire-resistance rating of an exterior wall, the exposing building face shall be taken as the projection of the exterior wall onto a vertical plane located so that no portion of the exterior wall of the building or of a fire compartment, if the fire compartment complies with the requirements of Article 3.2.3.2., is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured, and the area of unprotected openings shall be determined from Table 3.2.3.1.-B, 3.2.3.1.-C, 3.2.3.1.-Dor 3.2.3.1.-E.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining the type of construction and cladding and the fire-resistance rating of an exterior wall, the exposing building face shall be taken as the projection of the exterior wall onto a vertical plane located so that no portion of the exterior wall of the building or of a fire compartment, if the fire compartment complies with the requirements of Article 3.2.3.2., is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured, and the area of unprotected openings shall be determined from Table 3.2.3.1.-B, 3.2.3.1.-C , 3.2.3.1.-D or 3.2.3.1.-E.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining the actual percentage of unprotected openings permitted in an exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face is permitted to be taken at a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).) (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining the actual percentage of unprotected openings permitted in an exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face is permitted to be taken at a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Except for buildings that are sprinklered, where the limiting distance is 2 m or less, individual unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall be no greater than the area stated in Table 3.2.3.1.-A, or where the limiting distance is equal to or greater than 1.2 m, the area calculated by Area=0.24 2×LD-1.22whereArea= area of the unprotected opening, and LD= limiting distance.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for buildings that are sprinklered, where the limiting distance is 2 m or less, individual unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall be no greater than the area stated in Table 3.2.3.1.-A, or where the limiting distance is equal to or greater than 1.2 m, the area calculated by Area=0.24 2×LD-1.22whereArea= area of the unprotected opening, and LD= limiting distance.

National Sentence Text: The spacing between individual unprotected openings described in Sentence 3.2.3.1.(5) that serve a single room or space described in Sentence 3.2.3.1.(7) shall not be less than 2 m horizontally of another unprotected opening that is on the same exposing building face and serves the single room or space, or 2 m vertically of another unprotected opening that serves the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.
P/T Sentence Text: The spacing between individual unprotected openings described in Sentence 3.2.3.1.(5) that serve a single room or space described in Sentence 3.2.3.1.(7) shall not be less than 2 m horizontally of another unprotected opening that is on the same exposing building face and serves the single room or space, or 2 m vertically of another unprotected opening that serves the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of Sentence 3.2.3.1.(6), "single room or space" shall mean two or more adjacent spaces having a full-height separating wall extending less than 1.5 m from the interior face of the exterior wall, or two or more stacked spaces that are on the same storey.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of Sentence 3.2.3.1.(6), "single room or space" shall mean two or more adjacent spaces having a full-height separating wall extending less than 1.5 m from the interior face of the exterior wall, or two or more stacked spaces that are on the same storey.

(See Notes A-3.2.3.1.(8)and A-3.2.3.)

(See Notes A-3.2.3.1.(8) and A-3.2.3.)

(See Notes A-3.2.3.1.(8) and A-3.2.3.)

National Sentence Text: If the surface temperature on the unexposed surface of a wall assembly exceeds the temperature limit of a standard fire test as permitted by Article 3.1.7.2., an allowance shall be made for the radiation from the hot unexposed wall surface by adding an equivalent area of unprotected opening to the area of actual openings as follows: AC=A+AF×FEOwhere AC= corrected area of unprotected openings including actual and equivalent openings, A= actual area of unprotected openings, AF= area of exterior surface of the exposing building face, exclusive of openings, on which the temperature limit of the standard test is exceeded, and FEO= an equivalent opening factor derived from the following expression: FEO=Tu+273 4Te+273 4Tu= average temperature in degrees Celsius of the unexposed wall surface at the time the required fire-resistance rating is reached under test conditions, Te= 892°C for a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, 927°C for a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and 1 010°C for a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: If the surface temperature on the unexposed surface of a wall assembly exceeds the temperature limit of a standard fire test as permitted by Article 3.1.7.2., an allowance shall be made for the radiation from the hot unexposed wall surface by adding an equivalent area of unprotected opening to the area of actual openings as follows: AC=A+AF×FEOwhere AC= corrected area of unprotected openings including actual and equivalent openings, A= actual area of unprotected openings, AF= area of exterior surface of the exposing building face, exclusive of openings, on which the temperature limit of the standard test is exceeded, and FEO= an equivalent opening factor derived from the following expression: FEO=Tu+273 4Te+273 4 Tu= average temperature in degrees Celsius of the unexposed wall surface at the time the required fire-resistance rating is reached under test conditions, Te= 892°C for a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, 927°C for a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and 1 010°C for a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Unless a closure used to protect an opening in an exposing building face has a protective performance equivalent to that required for the wall assembly in which it is located, an equivalent area of unprotected opening, determined in accordance with the procedures of Sentence 3.2.3.1.(9) shall be added to the greater of the actual area of unprotected openings, or the corrected area of unprotected openings.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless a closure used to protect an opening in an exposing building face has a protective performance equivalent to that required for the wall assembly in which it is located, an equivalent area of unprotected opening, determined in accordance with the procedures of Sentence 3.2.3.1.(9) shall be added to the greater of the actual area of unprotected openings, or the corrected area of unprotected openings.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.3.2.(2)and 3.2.3.2.(3), the area of an exposing building face shall be calculated as the total area of an exterior wall facing in one direction on any side of a building measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.3.2.(2) and 3.2.3.2.(3), the area of an exposing building face shall be calculated as the total area of an exterior wall facing in one direction on any side of a building measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling.

National Sentence Text: If a building is divided by fire separations into fire compartments, the area of exposing building face is permitted to be calculated for each fire compartment provided the fire separations have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: If a building is divided by fire separations into fire compartments, the area of exposing building face is permitted to be calculated for each fire compartment provided the fire separations have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: In a building that is sprinklered throughout and contains an interconnected floor space, the area of the exposing building face for the interconnected floor space is permitted to be determined by considering each storey as a separate fire compartment notwithstanding openings through the floor assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building that is sprinklered throughout and contains an interconnected floor space, the area of the exposing building face for the interconnected floor space is permitted to be determined by considering each storey as a separate fire compartment notwithstanding openings through the floor assemblies.

National Sentence Text: An exterior wall enclosing an attic or roof space and located above an exposing building face, shall be constructed in conformance with the requirements for the exposing building face.
P/T Sentence Text: An exterior wall enclosing an attic or roof space and located above an exposing building face, shall be constructed in conformance with the requirements for the exposing building face.

National Sentence Text: A party wall shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A party wall shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Openings in a wall that has a limiting distance less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings in a wall that has a limiting distance less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.

National Sentence Text: Wired glass or glass block shall not be used for a closure referred to in Sentence 3.2.3.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass or glass block shall not be used for a closure referred to in Sentence 3.2.3.5.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except for a building containing one or 2 dwelling units only, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread and are more than 1 m above ground level, including balconies, platforms, canopies and stairs, shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a building containing one or 2 dwelling units only, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread and are more than 1 m above ground level, including balconies, platforms, canopies and stairs, shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.6.(4), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.6.(4), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.6.(4), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.6.(4), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a street, lane or public thoroughfare. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(11) and 9.10.15.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: The face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a street, lane or public thoroughfare. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(11).)

National Sentence Text: Where roof soffits project to less than 1.2 m from the centre line of a lane or public thoroughfare, or from an imaginary line between two buildings or fire compartments on the same property, they shall have no openings, and be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick sheet steel, unvented aluminum conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber.

National Sentence Text: For buildings of combustible construction, materials installed to provide the required protection of soffits may be covered with a combustible or noncombustible finish material.

P/T Sentence Text: The construction requirements for the exposing building face stated in Sentences 3.2.3.7.(1) and 3.2.3.7.(2) shall be satisfied before increasing the unprotected opening area as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.12.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.8.(3) and in addition to the requirements of Sentences 3.2.3.7.(1)and 3.2.3.7.(2) and where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is greater than 10% of the exposing building face, foamed plastic insulation used in an exterior wall of a building more than 3 storeys in building height shall be protected on its exterior surface by concrete or masonry not less than 25 mm thick, or noncombustible material that complies with the criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance stated in Sentence 3.2.3.8.(2) when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.8.(3) and in addition to the requirements of Sentences 3.2.3.7.(1) and 3.2.3.7.(2) and where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is greater than 10% of the exposing building face, foamed plastic insulation used in an exterior wall of a building more than 3 storeys in building height shall be protected on its exterior surface by concrete or masonry not less than 25 mm thick, or noncombustible material that complies with the criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance stated in Sentence 3.2.3.8.(2) when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials

National Sentence Text: The criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance for a wall assembly to satisfy the requirements of Clause 3.2.3.8.(1)(b) are that the fire exposed area of the wall assembly shall be not less than 9.3 m2 and have no dimension less than 2.75 m, the exposed surface shall include typical vertical and horizontal joints, the test shall be continued for not less than 15 min and the standard time/temperature curve of the referenced standard shall be followed, the noncombustible protective material must remain in place and no through openings should develop that are visible when viewed normal to the face of the material, and the noncombustible protective material should not disintegrate in a manner that would permit fire to propagate along the surface of the test assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: The criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance for a wall assembly to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.8.(1) are that the fire exposed area of the wall assembly shall be not less than 9.3 m2 and have no dimension less than 2.75 m, the exposed surface shall include typical vertical and horizontal joints, the test shall be continued for not less than 15 min and the standard time/temperature curve of the referenced standard shall be followed, the noncombustible protective material must remain in place and no through openings should develop that are visible when viewed normal to the face of the material, and the noncombustible protective material should not disintegrate in a manner that would permit fire to propagate along the surface of the test assembly.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.8.(1) are waived for wall assemblies that comply with the requirements of Article 3.1.5.5. (See Note A-3.1.4.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.8.(1) are waived for wall assemblies that comply with the requirements of Article 3.1.5.5. (See Note A-3.1.4.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Structural members, including beams, columns and arches, that are placed wholly or partly outside the exterior face of a building and are less than 3 m from the property line or the centre line of a public thoroughfare shall be protected from exterior fire exposure by fire protection having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for their protection from interior fire exposure, as stated in Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90., but not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Structural members, including beams, columns and arches, that are placed wholly or partly outside the exterior face of a building and are less than 3 m from the property line or the centre line of a public thoroughfare shall be protected from exterior fire exposure by fire protection having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for their protection from interior fire exposure, as stated in Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90., but not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Structural members of heavy timber construction, including beams, columns and arches, that are placed wholly or partly outside the exterior face of a building and are 3 m or more from the property line or the centre line of a public thoroughfare need not be covered with noncombustible cladding.
P/T Sentence Text: Structural members of heavy timber construction, including beams, columns and arches, that are placed wholly or partly outside the exterior face of a building and are 3 m or more from the property line or the centre line of a public thoroughfare need not be covered with noncombustible cladding.

National Sentence Text: An exposing building face in a storage garage with all storeys constructed as open-air storeys is permitted to have unlimited unprotected openings provided it has a limiting distance not less than 3 m.
P/T Sentence Text: An exposing building face in a storage garage with all storeys constructed as open-air storeys is permitted to have unlimited unprotected openings provided it has a limiting distance not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: The exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is at the same level as the street is permitted to have unlimited unprotected openings if the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is at the same level as the street is permitted to have unlimited unprotected openings if the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.

National Sentence Text: An exposing building face of a building of low-hazard industrial occupancy conforming to Article 3.2.2.89. is permitted to be of noncombustible construction without a fire-resistance rating provided it is not a loadbearing wall, and the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.
P/T Sentence Text: An exposing building face of a building of low-hazard industrial occupancy conforming to Article 3.2.2.89. is permitted to be of noncombustible construction without a fire-resistance rating provided it is not a loadbearing wall, and the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.3.7.(5), the maximum area of unprotected openings in any exposing building face of an unsprinklered building is permitted to be doubled if the openings are glazed with glass block conforming to the requirements of Article 3.1.8.16., or wired glass assemblies conforming to Note D-2.2.3.15. in Appendix D.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.3.7.(5), the maximum area of unprotected openings in any exposing building face of an unsprinklered building is permitted to be doubled if the openings are glazed with glass block conforming to the requirements of Article 3.1.8.16., or wired glass assemblies conforming to apparticle D-2.2.3.15. in Appendix D.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.3.13.(3) and as permitted by Sentence 3.4.4.3.(1), if the plane of an exterior wall of an exit enclosure forms an angle less than 135° with the plane of an exterior wall of the building it serves, and an opening in the exterior wall of the exit enclosure could be exposed to fire from an opening in the exterior wall of the building, the opening in either the exterior wall of the exit or the exterior wall of the building shall be protected in conformance with the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.13.(4) where the opening in the exterior wall of the building is within 3 m horizontally and less than 10 m below an opening in the exterior wall of the exit, or less than 2 m above an opening in the exterior wall of the exit. (See Note A-3.2.3.14.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.3.13.(3) and as permitted by Sentence 3.4.4.3.(1), if the plane of an exterior wall of an exit enclosure forms an angle less than 135° with the plane of an exterior wall of the building it serves, and an opening in the exterior wall of the exit enclosure could be exposed to fire from an opening in the exterior wall of the building, the opening in either the exterior wall of the exit or the exterior wall of the building shall be protected in conformance with the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.13.(4) where the opening in the exterior wall of the building is within 3 m horizontally and less than 10 m below an opening in the exterior wall of the exit, or less than 2 m above an opening in the exterior wall of the exit.

National Sentence Text: If an unenclosed exterior exit stair or ramp could be exposed to fire from an opening in the exterior wall of the building it serves, the opening in the exterior wall of the building shall be protected in conformance with the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.13.(4) where the opening in the exterior wall of the building is within 3 m horizontally and less than 10 m below the exit stair or ramp, or less than 5 m above the exit stair or ramp.
P/T Sentence Text: If an unenclosed exterior exit stair or ramp could be exposed to fire from an opening in the exterior wall of the building it serves, the opening in the exterior wall of the building shall be protected in conformance with the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.13.(4) where the opening in the exterior wall of the building is within 3 m horizontally and less than 10 m below the exit stair or ramp, or less than 5 m above the exit stair or ramp.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.4.3.(1), if an exterior exit door in one fire compartment is within 3 m horizontally of an opening in another fire compartment and the exterior walls of these fire compartments intersect at an exterior angle of less than 135°, the opening shall be protected in conformance with the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.13.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.4.3.(1), if an exterior exit door in one fire compartment is within 3 m horizontally of an opening in another fire compartment and the exterior walls of these fire compartments intersect at an exterior angle of less than 135°, the opening shall be protected in conformance with the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.13.(4).

National Sentence Text: The opening protection referred to in Sentences 3.2.3.13.(1), 3.2.3.13.(2)and 3.2.3.13.(3) shall consist of glass block conforming to the requirements of Article 3.1.8.16., a wired glass assembly conforming to Note D-2.2.3.15. in Appendix D, or a closure conforming to the requirements of Subsection 3.1.8. and Articles 3.2.3.1.and 3.2.3.14.
P/T Sentence Text: The opening protection referred to in Sentences 3.2.3.13.(1) , 3.2.3.13.(2)and 3.2.3.13.(3) shall consist of glass block conforming to the requirements of Article 3.1.8.16., a wired glass assembly conforming to apparticle D-2.2.3.15. in Appendix D, or a closure conforming to the requirements of part 3. and Articles 3.2.3.1.and 3.2.3.14.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.2.3.14.(3)and 3.2.3.13.(1) or as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.19.(4), if an unprotected opening in an exterior wall of a fire compartment is exposed to an unprotected opening in the exterior wall of another fire compartment, and the planes of the 2 walls are parallel or at an angle less than 135°, measured from the exterior of the building, the unprotected openings in the 2 fire compartments shall be separated by a distance not less than Do where Do=2D-q90 ×D but in no case less than 1 m, and (See Note A-3.2.3.14.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.2.3.14.(3) and 3.2.3.13.(1) or as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.19.(4), if an unprotected opening in an exterior wall of a fire compartment is exposed to an unprotected opening in the exterior wall of another fire compartment, and the planes of the 2 walls are parallel or at an angle less than 135°, measured from the exterior of the building, the unprotected openings in the 2 fire compartments shall be separated by a distance not less than Do where Do=2D-q90 ×D but in no case less than 1 m, and

National Sentence Text: The exterior wall of each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 3.2.3.14.(1) within the distance, Do, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the interior vertical fire separation between the fire compartment and the remainder of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: The exterior wall of each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 3.2.3.14.(1) within the distance, Do, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the interior vertical fire separation between the fire compartment and the remainder of the building.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.2.3.14.(1) does not apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments within a building that is sprinklered throughout, but shall apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments on opposite sides of a firewall, and exposure from unprotected openings of a fire compartment that is not protected by an automatic sprinkler system.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence 3.2.3.14.(1) does not apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments within a building that is sprinklered throughout, but shall apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments on opposite sides of a firewall, and exposure from unprotected openings of a fire compartment that is not protected by an automatic sprinkler system.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.19.(4), if a wall in a building is exposed to a fire hazard from an adjoining roof of a separate fire compartment that is not sprinklered in the same building, and the exposed wall contains windows within 3 storeys vertically and 5 m horizontally of the roof, the roof shall contain no skylights within 5 m of the exposed wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.19.(4), if a wall in a building is exposed to a fire hazard from an adjoining roof of a separate fire compartment that is not sprinklered in the same building, and the exposed wall contains windows within 3 storeys vertically and 5 m horizontally of the roof, the roof shall contain no skylights within 5 m of the exposed wall.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.3.16.(3)and 3.2.3.16.(4), where there is a common attic or roof space above more than 2 suites of residential occupancy or above more than 2 patients’ sleeping rooms, and the common attic or roof space projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, the soffit, and any opening in the soffit or other surface of the projection located within 2 500 mm of a window or door opening, shall be protected by noncombustible material not less than 0.38 mm thick, and having a melting point not below 650°C, plywood not less than 11 mm thick, strandboard or waferboard not less than 12.5 mm thick, or lumber not less than 11 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.3.16.(3) and 3.2.3.16.(4), where there is a common attic or roof space above more than 2 suites of residential occupancy or above more than 2 patients’ sleeping rooms, and the common attic or roof space projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, the soffit, and any opening in the soffit or other surface of the projection located within 2 500 mm of a window or door opening, shall be protected by noncombustible material not less than 0.38 mm thick, and having a melting point not below 650°C, plywood not less than 11 mm thick, strandboard or waferboard not less than 12.5 mm thick, or lumber not less than 11 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: The soffit protection required by Sentence 3.2.3.16.(1) shall extend the full width of the opening and to not less than 1 200 mm on either side of it, and shall apply to all openings through the soffit within this limit.
P/T Sentence Text: The soffit protection required by Sentence 3.2.3.16.(1) shall extend the full width of the opening and to not less than 1 200 mm on either side of it, and shall apply to all openings through the soffit within this limit.

National Sentence Text: If an eave overhang is completely separated from the remainder of the attic or roof space by the use of fire blocks, the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.16.(1) do not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: If an eave overhang is completely separated from the remainder of the attic or roof space by the use of fire blocks, the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.16.(1) do not apply.

National Sentence Text: The protection required by Sentence 3.2.3.16.(1) for projections is permitted to be omitted if the fire compartments behind the window and door openings are sprinklered in accordance with Article 3.2.5.12., and all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding exceptions permitted in the standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12. for the installation of automatic sprinkler systems.
P/T Sentence Text: The protection required by Sentence 3.2.3.16.(1) for projections is permitted to be omitted if the fire compartments behind the window and door openings are sprinklered in accordance with Article 3.2.5.12., and all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding exceptions permitted in the standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12. for the installation of automatic sprinkler systems.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.3.17.(2)and 3.2.3.17.(3), if a storey classified as a Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 major occupancy is required to be separated from the storey above by a fire separation, every opening in the exterior wall of the lower storey that is located vertically below an opening in the storey above shall be separated from the storey above by a canopy projecting not less than 1 m from the face of the building at the intervening floor level, and the canopy required by Clause 3.2.3.17.(1)(a) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly but need not be more than 1 h, except as required elsewhere in this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.3.17.(2) and 3.2.3.17.(3), if a storey classified as a Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 major occupancy is required to be separated from the storey above by a fire separation, every opening in the exterior wall of the lower storey that is located vertically below an opening in the storey above shall be separated from the storey above by a canopy projecting not less than 1 m from the face of the building at the intervening floor level, and the canopy required by Sentence 3.2.3.17.(1) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly but need not be more than 1 h, except as required elsewhere in this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.17.(3), the canopy required by Sentence 3.2.3.17.(1) is permitted to be omitted if the exterior wall of the upper storey is recessed not less than 1 m behind the exterior wall containing the opening in the lower storey.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.17.(3), the canopy required by Sentence 3.2.3.17.(1) is permitted to be omitted if the exterior wall of the upper storey is recessed not less than 1 m behind the exterior wall containing the opening in the lower storey.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 3.2.3.17.(1)and 3.2.3.17.(2) are permitted to be waived if the building is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 3.2.3.17.(1) and 3.2.3.17.(2) are permitted to be waived if the building is sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: A covered vehicular passageway designed as a receiving or shipping area shall be separated from every building or part of a building adjoining it by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1.5 h.
P/T Sentence Text: A covered vehicular passageway designed as a receiving or shipping area shall be separated from every building or part of a building adjoining it by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1.5 h.

National Sentence Text: A covered vehicular passageway constructed below grade shall be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: A covered vehicular passageway constructed below grade shall be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.3.20.(2), if buildings are connected by a walkway, each building shall be separated from the walkway by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min .
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.3.20.(2), if buildings are connected by a walkway, each building shall be separated from the walkway by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.19.(3), a walkway connected to a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall also be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.19.(3), a walkway connected to a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall also be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: A walkway connected to a building required to be of noncombustible construction is permitted to be of heavy timber construction provided not less than 50% of the area of any enclosing perimeter walls is open to the outdoors, and the walkway is at ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: A walkway connected to a building required to be of noncombustible construction is permitted to be of heavy timber construction provided not less than 50% of the area of any enclosing perimeter walls is open to the outdoors, and the walkway is at ground level.

National Sentence Text: A walkway of noncombustible construction used only as a pedestrian thoroughfare need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.3.14.and 3.2.3.15.
P/T Sentence Text: A walkway of noncombustible construction used only as a pedestrian thoroughfare need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.3.14. and 3.2.3.15.

National Sentence Text: A walkway between buildings shall be not more than 9 m wide.
P/T Sentence Text: A walkway between buildings shall be not more than 9 m wide.

National Sentence Text: An underground walkway shall not be designed or used for any purpose other than pedestrian travel unless the purpose is acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction, and sprinklers are installed in any space in the walkway containing an occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: An underground walkway shall not be designed or used for any purpose other than pedestrian travel unless the purpose is acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction, and sprinklers are installed in any space in the walkway containing an occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Buildings connected by an underground walkway shall be separated from the walkway by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings connected by an underground walkway shall be separated from the walkway by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: An underground walkway shall be of noncombustible construction suitable for an underground location.
P/T Sentence Text: An underground walkway shall be of noncombustible construction suitable for an underground location.

National Sentence Text: In an underground walkway smoke barrier doors shall be installed at intervals of not more than 100 m, or the travel distance from the door of an adjacent room or space to the nearest exit shall be not more than one and a half times the least allowable travel distance to an exit for any of the adjacent occupancies as permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: In an underground walkway smoke barrier doors shall be installed at intervals of not more than 100 m, or the travel distance from the door of an adjacent room or space to the nearest exit shall be not more than one and a half times the least allowable travel distance to an exit for any of the adjacent occupancies as permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1).

National Sentence Text: An underground walkway between buildings shall be not more than 9 m wide.
P/T Sentence Text: An underground walkway between buildings shall be not more than 9 m wide.

National Sentence Text: Location of outdoor storage and outdoor process equipment in relation to buildings shall conform to Parts 3 and 4 of Division B of the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: Location of outdoor storage and outdoor process equipment in relation to buildings shall conform to Parts 3 and 4 of Division B of the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: When a building is erected over existing buried flammable gas mains, such service lines shall be encased in gas-tight conduits in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-Z662-15 Oil and Gas Pipeline Systems (See Note A-3.2.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: When a building is erected over existing buried flammable gas mains, such service lines shall be encased in gas-tight conduits in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-Z662-15 Oil and Gas Pipeline Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Buildings that contain fewer than 9 sprinklers conforming to Sentence 3.2.5.12.(4) need not comply with Sentence 3.2.4.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.4.1.(5)to 3.2.4.1.(7) and Sentence 3.2.4.2.(4), a fire alarm system shall be installed in a building that is not sprinklered throughout and that contains a contained use area, an impeded egress zone, more than 3 storeys, including the storeys below the first storey, a total occupant load more than 300, other than in open air seating areas, an occupant load more than 150 above or below the first storey, other than in open air seating areas, a school, college, or child care facility, including a daycare facility, with an occupant load more than 40, a licensed beverage establishment or a licensed restaurant, with an occupant load more than 150, a low-hazard industrial occupancy with an occupant load more than 75 above or below the first storey, a medium-hazard industrial occupancy with an occupant load more than 75 above or below the first storey, a residential occupancy with sleeping accommodation for more than 10 persons, a high-hazard industrial occupancy with an occupant load more than 25, or an occupant load more than 300 below an open air seating area.

National Sentence Text: Where each dwelling unit in an apartment building that is not sprinklered has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level, a fire alarm system is not required if not more than 4 dwelling units share a common means of egress, or the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height.

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm system is not required in a hotel or motel 3 storeys or less in building height that is contained in a building that is not sprinklered provided each suite has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): A fire alarm system is not required in a hotel or motel 3 storeys or less in building height that is contained in a building that is not sprinklered provided each suite has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level.

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm system is not required in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.90. that is contained in a building that is not sprinklered provided there are no other occupancies in the building.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire alarm system is not required in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.90. that is contained in a building that is not sprinklered provided there are no other occupancies in the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.2.(6), if there are openings through a firewall, other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and totally enclosed noncombustible raceways, the requirements in this Subsection shall apply to the floor areas on both sides of the firewall as if they were in the same building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.2.(6), if there are openings through a firewall, other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and totally enclosed noncombustible raceways, the requirements in this Subsection shall apply to the floor areas on both sides of the firewall as if they were in the same building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.2.(4), if a building contains more than one major occupancy and a fire alarm system is required, a single system shall serve all occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.2.(4), if a building contains more than one major occupancy and a fire alarm system is required, a single system shall serve all occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.2.(4), if a fire alarm system is required in any portion of a building, it shall be installed throughout the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.2.(4), if a fire alarm system is required in any portion of a building, it shall be installed throughout the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.4.2.(5), the requirements in this Subsection are permitted to be applied to each portion of a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, in which a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h separates the portion from the remainder of the building as if it were a separate building, provided there are no openings through the fire separation, other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and totally enclosed noncombustible raceways.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.4.2.(5), the requirements in this Subsection are permitted to be applied to each portion of a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, in which a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h separates the portion from the remainder of the building as if it were a separate building, provided there are no openings through the fire separation, other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and totally enclosed noncombustible raceways.

National Sentence Text: The permission in Sentence 3.2.4.2.(4) to consider separated portions of a building as separate buildings does not apply to service rooms and storage rooms.
P/T Sentence Text: The permission in Sentence 3.2.4.2.(4) to consider separated portions of a building as separate buildings does not apply to service rooms and storage rooms.

National Sentence Text: Buildings interconnected by walkways permitted in Articles 3.2.3.19.and 3.2.3.20. or by vestibules provided in conformance with Article 3.2.6.3. shall be treated as separate buildings for the purpose of fire alarm installation required by this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings interconnected by walkways permitted in Articles 3.2.3.19.and 3.2.3.20. or by vestibules provided in conformance with Article 3.2.6.3. shall be treated as separate buildings for the purpose of fire alarm installation required by this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm system shall be a single-stage system in a Group F, Division 1 occupancy, except as permitted in Clause 3.2.4.3.(1)(c), a 2-stage system in a Group B occupancy, a single- or 2-stage system in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy where the building is 3 storeys or less in building height, and a single- or 2-stage system in all other cases.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire alarm system shall be a single-stage system in a Group F, Division 1 occupancy, except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.3.(1), a 2-stage system in a Group B occupancy, a single- or 2-stage system in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy where the building is 3 storeys or less in building height, and a single- or 2-stage system in all other cases.

National Sentence Text: A single stage fire alarm system shall, upon the operation of any manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector, cause an alarm signal to sound on all audible signal devices in the system. (See Note A-3.2.4.4.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A single stage fire alarm system shall, upon the operation of any manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector, cause an alarm signal to sound on all audible signal devices in the system. (See Note A-3.2.4.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: A 2-stage fire alarm system shall cause an alert signal to sound upon the operation of any manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector, automatically cause an alarm signal to sound if the alert signal is not acknowledged within 5 min of its initiation, and have manual stations, each of which is equipped so that the use of a key or other similar device causes an alarm signal to sound that continues to sound upon removal of the key or similar device from the manual station (see Note A-3.2.4.4.(2)(c)). (See Note A-3.2.4.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A 2-stage fire alarm system shall cause an alert signal to sound upon the operation of any manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector, automatically cause an alarm signal to sound if the alert signal is not acknowledged within 5 min of its initiation, and have manual stations, each of which is equipped so that the use of a key or other similar device causes an alarm signal to sound that continues to sound upon removal of the key or similar device from the manual station (see Note A-3.2.4.4.(2)(c)).

National Sentence Text: A 2-stage fire alarm system is permitted to be zone coded so that, upon the operation of any manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector, a coded alert signal is sounded indicating the zone of alarm initiation, the coded alert signal is repeated in its entirety not less than 4 times, and a continuous alert signal is sounded upon completion of the coded signals referred to in Clause 3.2.4.4.(3)(b) and Sentence 3.2.4.4.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: A 2-stage fire alarm system is permitted to be zone coded so that, upon the operation of any manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector, a coded alert signal is sounded indicating the zone of alarm initiation, the coded alert signal is repeated in its entirety not less than 4 times, and a continuous alert signal is sounded upon completion of the coded signals referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.4.(3) and Sentence 3.2.4.4.(4).

National Sentence Text: If a second manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector is operated in a fire alarm system with zone coding as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.4.(3), in a zone other than that for which the first alert signal was sounded, the coded alert signal for the first zone shall be completed before the coded alert signal for the second zone is repeated not less than 4 times.
P/T Sentence Text: If a second manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector is operated in a fire alarm system with zone coding as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.4.(3), in a zone other than that for which the first alert signal was sounded, the coded alert signal for the first zone shall be completed before the coded alert signal for the second zone is repeated not less than 4 times.

National Sentence Text: Fire alarm systems, including the voice communication capability where provided, shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.4.10. and 3.2.4.19., fire alarm systems, including the voice communication capability where provided, shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.4.10. and 3.2.4.19., fire alarm systems, including the voice communication capability where provided, shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.4.10. and 3.2.4.19., fire alarm systems, including the voice communication capability where provided, shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems

National Sentence Text: Fire alarm systems shall be verified in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S537-13 Verification of Fire Alarm Systems to ensure they are operating satisfactorily.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire alarm systems shall be verified in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S537-13 Verification of Fire Alarm Systems to ensure they are operating satisfactorily.

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm system shall be designed so that when an alarm signal is actuated, it cannot be silenced automatically before a period of time has elapsed that is not less than 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 20 min for any other building.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire alarm system shall be designed so that when an alarm signal is actuated, it cannot be silenced automatically before a period of time has elapsed that is not less than 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 20 min for any other building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.18.(7) and Sentences 3.2.4.22.(2)and 3.2.4.22.(3), a fire alarm system shall not incorporate manual silencing switches other than those installed inside the fire alarm control unit. (See Note A-3.2.4.6.(2).) (See Note A-3.2.4.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.18.(7) and Sentences 3.2.4.22.(2)and 3.2.4.22.(3), a fire alarm system shall not incorporate manual silencing switches other than those installed inside the fire alarm control unit. (See Note A-3.2.4.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: A single stage fire alarm system installed in a building of assembly occupancy that has an occupant load more than 300 shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), that an alarm signal has been initiated.
P/T Sentence Text: A single stage fire alarm system installed in a building of assembly occupancy that has an occupant load more than 300 shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), that an alarm signal has been initiated.

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm system that includes waterflow-indicating devices shall be designed to notify the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4) when an alarm is initiated.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire alarm system that includes waterflow-indicating devices shall be designed to notify the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4) when an alarm is initiated.

National Sentence Text: A 2-stage fire alarm system shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), that an alert signal has been initiated.
P/T Sentence Text: A 2-stage fire alarm system shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), that an alert signal has been initiated.

National Sentence Text: Notification of the fire department, as required by Sentences 3.2.4.7.(1), 3.2.4.7.(2)and 3.2.4.7.(3), shall be provided in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S561-13 Installation and Services for Fire Signal Receiving Centres and Systems (See Note A-3.2.4.7.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Notification of the fire department, as required by Sentences 3.2.4.7.(1), 3.2.4.7.(2)and 3.2.4.7.(3), shall be provided in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S561-13 Installation and Services for Fire Signal Receiving Centres and Systems (See Note A-3.2.4.7.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Where a single stage fire alarm system is installed in a building that is not sprinklered throughout and Sentence 3.2.4.7.(1) does not apply, a legible notice that is not easily removed shall be affixed to the wall near each manual station stating that the fire department is to be notified in the event of a fire emergency, and the emergency telephone number for the municipality or for the fire department (see Note A-3.2.4.7.(5)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Where a single stage fire alarm system is installed in a building that is not sprinklered throughout and Sentence 3.2.4.7.(1) does not apply, a legible notice that is not easily removed shall be affixed to the wall near each manual station stating that the fire department is to be notified in the event of a fire emergency, and the emergency telephone number for the municipality or for the fire department (see Note A-3.2.4.7.(5)(b)).

National Sentence Text: Helicopter landing areas on roofs shall be provided with telephone extensions or means to notify the fire department.
P/T Sentence Text: Helicopter landing areas on roofs shall be provided with telephone extensions or means to notify the fire department.

The owner of a building for which Sentences 3.2.4.7.(1) to 3.2.4.7.(3) require signals to the fire department shall provide evidence of compliance to the authority having jurisdiction by means of a Fire Protective Signalling Certificate from a certified listing agency showing the address of the building, the listed fire alarm installation company, and the listed fire alarm monitoring company.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The owner of a building for which Sentences 3.2.4.7.(1) to 3.2.4.7.(3) require signals to the fire department shall provide evidence of compliance to the authority having jurisdiction by means of a Fire Protective Signalling Certificate from a certified listing agency showing the address of the building, the listed fire alarm installation company, and the listed fire alarm monitoring company.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.4.8.(3)to 3.2.4.8.(5), an annunciator shall be installed in close proximity to a building entrance that faces a street or an access route for fire department vehicles that complies with Sentence 3.2.5.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.4.8.(3) to 3.2.4.8.(5), an annunciator shall be installed in close proximity to a building entrance that faces a street or an access route for fire department vehicles that complies with Sentence 3.2.5.5.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.8.(6), the annunciator required by Sentence 3.2.4.8.(1) shall have separate zone indication of the actuation of the alarm initiating devices in each floor area so that the area of coverage for each zone in a building that is not sprinklered is not more than 2 000 m2, floor area so that the area of coverage for each zone is neither more than one storey, nor more than the system area limits specified in NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems shaft required to be equipped with smoke detectors, air-handling system required to be equipped with smoke detectors, fire extinguishing system required by NFPA 96-2014 Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations contained use area, impeded egress zone, and fire compartment required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2). (See Note A-3.2.4.8.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.8.(6), the annunciator required by Sentence 3.2.4.8.(1) shall have separate zone indication of the actuation of the alarm initiating devices in each floor area so that the area of coverage for each zone in a building that is not sprinklered is not more than 2 000 m2 , floor area so that the area of coverage for each zone is neither more than one storey, nor more than the system area limits specified in NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems shaft required to be equipped with smoke detectors, air-handling system required to be equipped with smoke detectors, fire extinguishing system required by NFPA 96-2017 Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations contained use area, impeded egress zone, and fire compartment required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2).

National Sentence Text: An annunciator need not be provided for a fire alarm system if not more than one zone indicator is required by Sentence 3.2.4.8.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: An annunciator need not be provided for a fire alarm system if not more than one zone indicator is required by Sentence 3.2.4.8.(2).

National Sentence Text: If an annunciator is not installed as part of a fire alarm system in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(1), a visual and audible trouble signal device shall be provided inside the main entrance of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: If an annunciator is not installed as part of a fire alarm system in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(1), a visual and audible trouble signal device shall be provided inside the main entrance of the building.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.2.4.8.(1) are waived in a building in which an automatic sprinkler system is not installed, that has an aggregate area for all storeys of not more than 2 000 m2, and that is not more than 3 storeys in building height.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.2.4.8.(1) are waived in a building in which an automatic sprinkler system is not installed, that has an aggregate area for all storeys of not more than 2 000 m2 , and that is not more than 3 storeys in building height.

National Sentence Text: The area limits of Clause 3.2.4.8.(2)(a) are waived for an interior undivided open space used as an arena, a rink, or a swimming pool provided that other spaces in the building that are separated from the open space are individually zoned in accordance with the requirements of Sentence 3.2.4.8.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: The area limits of Sentence 3.2.4.8.(2) are waived for an interior undivided open space used as an arena, a rink, or a swimming pool provided that other spaces in the building that are separated from the open space are individually zoned in accordance with the requirements of Sentence 3.2.4.8.(2).

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm control unit installed in close proximity to a building entrance that faces a street or an access route for fire department vehicles that complies with Sentence 3.2.5.5.(1) is deemed to satisfy the requirement for an annunciator, provided all indicators required for an annunciator or trouble signal device are included on the control unit.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire alarm control unit installed in close proximity to a building entrance that faces a street or an access route for fire department vehicles that complies with Sentence 3.2.5.5.(1) is deemed to satisfy the requirement for an annunciator, provided all indicators required for an annunciator or trouble signal device are included on the control unit.

National Sentence Text: Electrical supervision shall be provided for a fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical supervision shall be provided for a fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: If a fire alarm system in a building is required to have an annunciator by Sentence 3.2.4.8.(1), except for hose valves, all valves controlling water supplies in a standpipe system shall be equipped with an electrically supervised switch for transmitting a trouble signal to the annunciator in the event of movement of the valve handle.
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire alarm system in a building is required to have an annunciator by Sentence 3.2.4.8.(1), except for hose valves, all valves controlling water supplies in a standpipe system shall be equipped with an electrically supervised switch for transmitting a trouble signal to the annunciator in the event of movement of the valve handle.

National Sentence Text: An automatic sprinkler system shall be electrically supervised to indicate a supervisory signal on the building fire alarm system annunciator for each of the following: movement of a valve handle that controls the supply of water to sprinklers, loss of excess water pressure required to prevent false alarms in a wet pipe system, loss of air pressure in a dry pipe system, loss of air pressure in a pressure tank, a significant change in water level in any water storage container used for firefighting purposes, loss of power to any automatically starting fire pump (see Note A-3.2.4.9.(3)(f)), and (see Note A-3.2.4.9.(3)(f) a temperature approaching the freezing point in any dry pipe valve enclosure or water storage container used for firefighting purposes.
P/T Sentence Text: An automatic sprinkler system shall be electrically supervised to indicate a supervisory signal on the building fire alarm system annunciator for each of the following: movement of a valve handle that controls the supply of water to sprinklers, loss of excess water pressure required to prevent false alarms in a wet pipe system, loss of air pressure in a dry pipe system, loss of air pressure in a pressure tank, a significant change in water level in any water storage container used for firefighting purposes, loss of power to any automatically starting fire pump (see Note A-3.2.4.9.(3)(f)), and a temperature approaching the freezing point in any dry pipe valve enclosure or water storage container used for firefighting purposes.

National Sentence Text: A fire pump shall be electrically supervised as stipulated in NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection
P/T Sentence Text: A fire pump shall be electrically supervised as stipulated in NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection

National Sentence Text: Indication of a supervisory signal in accordance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3) shall be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Indication of a supervisory signal in accordance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3) shall be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).

National Sentence Text: Fire detectors required by this Code shall be connected to the fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire detectors required by this Code shall be connected to the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), if a fire alarm system is required in a building that is not sprinklered, fire detectors shall be installed in the following spaces: storage rooms not within dwelling units, service rooms not within dwelling units, janitors’ rooms, rooms in which hazardous substances are to be used or stored (see Note A-3.3.1.2.(1)), elevator hoistways and dumbwaiter shafts, and laundry rooms in buildings of residential occupancy, but not those within dwelling units.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.4.10.(3), 3.2.4.10.(5) and 3.2.4.10.(6) if a fire alarm system is required in a building that is not sprinklered, fire detectors shall be installed in the following spaces: storage rooms not within dwelling units, service rooms not within dwelling units, janitors rooms, rooms in which hazardous substances are to be used or stored (see Note A-3.3.1.2.(1)), elevator hoistways and dumbwaiter shafts, and laundry rooms in buildings of residential occupancy, but not those within dwelling units.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.4.10.(3) , 3.2.4.10.(5) and 3.2.4.10.(6) if a fire alarm system is required in a building that is not sprinklered, fire detectors shall be installed in the following spaces: storage rooms not within dwelling units, service rooms not within dwelling units, janitors’ rooms, rooms in which hazardous substances are to be used or stored (see Note A-3.3.1.2.(1)), elevator hoistways and dumbwaiter shafts, and laundry rooms in buildings of residential occupancy, but not those within dwelling units.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.4.10.(3), 3.2.4.10.(5) and 3.2.4.10.(6) if a fire alarm system is required in a building that is not sprinklered, fire detectors shall be installed in the following spaces: storage rooms not within dwelling units, service rooms not within dwelling units, janitors rooms, rooms in which hazardous substances are to be used or stored (see Note A-3.3.1.2.(1)), elevator hoistways and dumbwaiter shafts, and laundry rooms in buildings of residential occupancy, but not those within dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: Fire detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.10.(2) need not be provided within floor areas that are sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.10.(2) need not be provided within floor areas that are sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Fire detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.10.(2) shall be installed in elevator hoistways and dumbwaiter shafts where a sprinkler system is not installed within the hoistway or shaft.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.10.(2) shall be installed in elevator hoistways and dumbwaiter shafts where a sprinkler system is not installed within the hoistway or shaft.

Fire detectors need not be installed in a room used for storage if the room is less than 1 m2 in area unless the room is a janitor’s closet, or the room is used for the storage of hazardous substances.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Fire detectors need not be installed in a room used for storage if the room is less than 1 m2 in area unless the room is a janitor s closet, or the room is used for the storage of hazardous substances.

P/T Sentence Text: A clothes closet not more than 800 mm in depth shall not be considered as a storage room for the purposes of this Article.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): A clothes closet not more than 800 mm in depth shall not be considered as a storage room for the purposes of this Article.

National Sentence Text: If a fire alarm system is installed, smoke detectors shall be installed in except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.11.(2), each sleeping room and each corridor serving as part of a means of egress from sleeping rooms in portions of a building classified as a Group B major occupancy, each room in a contained use area and corridors serving those rooms, each corridor in portions of a building classified as a Group A, Division 1 major occupancy, each public corridor in portions of a building classified as a Group C major occupancy, each exit stair shaft other than those serving only a Group A, Division 4 major occupancy or an open storage garage, the vicinity of draft stops required by Article 3.2.8.6., and elevator machine rooms. (See Note A-3.2.4.11.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire alarm system is installed, smoke detectors shall be installed in except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.11.(2), each sleeping room and each corridor serving as part of a means of egress from sleeping rooms in portions of a building classified as a Group B major occupancy, each room in a contained use area and corridors serving those rooms, each corridor in portions of a building classified as a Group A, Division 1 major occupancy, each public corridor in portions of a building classified as a Group C major occupancy, each exit stair shaft other than those serving only a Group A, Division 4 major occupancy or an open storage garage, the vicinity of draft stops required by Article 3.2.8.6., and elevator machine rooms.

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors need not be installed in sleeping rooms and in corridors serving the sleeping rooms within a suite of care occupancy where smoke alarms are installed in accordance with Article 3.2.4.20.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors need not be installed in sleeping rooms and in corridors serving the sleeping rooms within a suite of care occupancy where smoke alarms are installed in accordance with Article 3.2.4.20.

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required in the sleeping rooms of a care, treatment or detention occupancy shall, upon actuation, provide an audible and visible signal to staff serving those rooms so that the room or location containing the actuated smoke detector can be easily identified. (See Note A-3.2.4.11.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required in the sleeping rooms of a care, treatment or detention occupancy shall, upon actuation, provide an audible and visible signal to staff serving those rooms so that the room or location containing the actuated smoke detector can be easily identified. (See Note A-3.2.4.11.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required in Clause 3.2.4.11.(1)(g) shall, upon actuation, recall the elevators served by the elevator machine room in which the smoke detector is installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required in Sentence 3.2.4.11.(1) shall, upon actuation, recall the elevators served by the elevator machine room in which the smoke detector is installed.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.4.11.(6)and 3.2.4.11.(7), smoke detectors installed in buildings required to be equipped with a fire alarm system shall be located near the entrance to walkways described in Articles 3.2.3.19.and 3.2.3.20. or vestibules provided in conformance with Article 3.2.6.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.4.11.(6) and 3.2.4.11.(7), smoke detectors installed in buildings required to be equipped with a fire alarm system shall be located near the entrance to walkways described in Articles 3.2.3.19.and 3.2.3.20. or vestibules provided in conformance with Article 3.2.6.3.

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors installed at the entrance to the walkways in conformance with Article 3.1.8.14. shall be deemed to meet the requirements of Sentence 3.2.4.11.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors installed at the entrance to the walkways in conformance with Article 3.1.8.14. shall be deemed to meet the requirements of Sentence 3.2.4.11.(5).

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.11.(5) may be replaced with fire detectors in Group F occupancies where the smoke detectors may be subjected to false alarms due to the activities within the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.11.(5) may be replaced with fire detectors in Group F occupancies where the smoke detectors may be subjected to false alarms due to the activities within the building.

National Sentence Text: If a fire alarm system is installed, an air-handling system shall be designed to prevent the circulation of smoke upon a signal from a duct-type smoke detector if the air-handling system serves more than one storey, serves more than one suite in a storey, or serves more than one fire compartment required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire alarm system is installed, an air-handling system shall be designed to prevent the circulation of smoke upon a signal from a duct-type smoke detector if the air-handling system serves more than one storey, serves more than one suite in a storey, or serves more than one fire compartment required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2).

National Sentence Text: A central vacuum cleaning system in a building equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon actuation of the fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: A central vacuum cleaning system in a building equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon actuation of the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.14.(3), in a building having elevators that serve storeys above the first storey and that are equipped with an automatic emergency recall feature, smoke detectors shall be installed in the elevator lobbies on the recall level so that when these smoke detectors are actuated, the elevators will automatically return directly to an alternate floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.14.(3), in a building having elevators that serve storeys above the first storey and that are equipped with an automatic emergency recall feature, smoke detectors shall be installed in the elevator lobbies on the recall level so that when these smoke detectors are actuated, the elevators will automatically return directly to an alternate floor level.

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.14.(1) shall be designed as part of the building fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.14.(1) shall be designed as part of the building fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: The alternate floor recall feature required by Sentence 3.2.4.14.(1) is not required if the floor area containing the recall level is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The alternate floor recall feature required by Sentence 3.2.4.14.(1) is not required if the floor area containing the recall level is sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: An automatic sprinkler system shall be equipped with waterflow detecting devices and, if an annunciator is required by Article 3.2.4.8., shall be installed so that each device serves not more than one storey, and an area on each storey that is not more than the system area limits as specified in NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems
P/T Sentence Text: An automatic sprinkler system shall be equipped with waterflow detecting devices and, if an annunciator is required by Article 3.2.4.8., shall be installed so that each device serves not more than one storey, and an area on each storey that is not more than the system area limits as specified in NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems

National Sentence Text: Waterflow-detecting devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.15.(1) shall be connected to the fire alarm system so that, upon its actuation, an alert signal or an alarm signal is initiated.
P/T Sentence Text: Waterflow-detecting devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.15.(1) shall be connected to the fire alarm system so that, upon its actuation, an alert signal or an alarm signal is initiated.

National Sentence Text: The actuation of each waterflow detecting device required by Sentence 3.2.4.15.(1) shall be indicated separately on the fire alarm system annunciator.
P/T Sentence Text: The actuation of each waterflow detecting device required by Sentence 3.2.4.15.(1) shall be indicated separately on the fire alarm system annunciator.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.4.16.(2)and 3.2.4.16.(3), where a fire alarm system is installed, a manual station shall be installed in every floor area near every principal entrance to the building, and every exit. (See Note A-3.2.4.16.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.4.16.(2) and 3.2.4.16.(3), where a fire alarm system is installed, a manual station shall be installed in every floor area near every principal entrance to the building, and every exit.
