National Sentence Text: In a building that is sprinklered throughout, a manual station is not required at an exterior egress doorway from a suite that does not lead to an interior shared means of egress in a hotel or motel not more than 3 storeys in building height, provided each suite is served by an exterior exit facility leading directly to ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building that is sprinklered throughout, a manual station is not required at an exterior egress doorway from a suite that does not lead to an interior shared means of egress in a hotel or motel not more than 3 storeys in building height, provided each suite is served by an exterior exit facility leading directly to ground level.

National Sentence Text: In a building that is sprinklered throughout, a manual station is not required at an exterior egress doorway from a dwelling unit that does not lead to an interior shared means of egress in a building not more than 3 storeys in building height containing only dwelling units, provided each dwelling unit is served by an exterior exit facility leading directly to ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building that is sprinklered throughout, a manual station is not required at an exterior egress doorway from a dwelling unit that does not lead to an interior shared means of egress in a building not more than 3 storeys in building height containing only dwelling units, provided each dwelling unit is served by an exterior exit facility leading directly to ground level.

National Sentence Text: In a building referred to in Sentences 3.2.4.16.(2)or 3.2.4.16.(3), manual stations shall be installed near doorways leading from shared interior corridors to the exterior.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building referred to in Sentences 3.2.4.16.(2)or 3.2.4.16.(3), manual stations shall be installed near doorways leading from shared interior corridors to the exterior.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire alarm system is installed, a manually operated fire alarm station shall be installed on the roof at each exit from a helicopter landing area.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire alarm system is installed, a manually operated fire alarm station shall be installed on the roof at each exit from a helicopter landing area.

National Sentence Text: In a 2-stage fire alarm system described in Sentence 3.2.4.4.(2), the same audible signal devices are permitted to be used to sound the alert signals and the alarm signals.
P/T Sentence Text: In a 2-stage fire alarm system described in Sentence 3.2.4.4.(2), the same audible signal devices are permitted to be used to sound the alert signals and the alarm signals.

National Sentence Text: If audible signal devices with voice reproduction capabilities are intended for paging and similar voice message use, other than during a fire emergency, they shall be installed so that alert signals and alarm signals take priority over all other signals.
P/T Sentence Text: If audible signal devices with voice reproduction capabilities are intended for paging and similar voice message use, other than during a fire emergency, they shall be installed so that alert signals and alarm signals take priority over all other signals.

National Sentence Text: Audible signal devices forming part of a fire alarm or voice communication system shall not be used for playing music or background noise. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.)
P/T Sentence Text: Audible signal devices forming part of a fire alarm or voice communication system shall not be used for playing music or background noise.

National Sentence Text: Audible signal devices forming part of a fire alarm system shall be installed in a building so that alarm signals are clearly audible throughout the floor area, and alert signals are clearly audible in continuously staffed locations, and where there are no continuously staffed locations, throughout the floor area. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Audible signal devices forming part of a fire alarm system shall be installed in a building so that alarm signals are clearly audible throughout the floor area, and alert signals are clearly audible in continuously staffed locations, and where there are no continuously staffed locations, throughout the floor area.

National Sentence Text: The sound pattern of an alarm signal shall conform to the temporal pattern defined in Clause 4.2 of ISO 8201:1987(E) Acoustics – Audible emergency evacuation signal (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(2).) (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The sound pattern of an alarm signal shall conform to the temporal pattern defined in Clause 4.2 of ISO 8201:1987(E) Acoustics – Audible emergency evacuation signal (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The sound patterns of alert signals shall be significantly different from the temporal patterns of alarm signals. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: The sound patterns of alert signals shall be significantly different from the temporal patterns of alarm signals. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(3).)

National Sentence Text: The fire alarm signal sound pressure level shall be not more than 110 dBA in any normally occupied area. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(4).) (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: The fire alarm signal sound pressure level shall be not more than 110 dBA in any normally occupied area. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(4).)

National Sentence Text: The sound pressure level in a sleeping room from a fire alarm audible signal device shall be not less than 75 dBA in a building of residential or care occupancy when any intervening doors between the device and the sleeping room are closed. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The sound pressure level in a sleeping room from a fire alarm audible signal device shall be not less than 75 dBA in a building of residential or care occupancy when any intervening doors between the device and the sleeping room are closed. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(5).)

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.4.18.(5), the sound pressure level from a fire alarm system’s audible signal device within a floor area shall be not less than 10 dBA above the ambient noise level without being less than 65 dBA.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.4.18.(5), the sound pressure level from a fire alarm system’s audible signal device within a floor area shall be not less than 10 dBA above the ambient noise level without being less than 65 dBA.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.18.(11), audible signal devices located within a dwelling unit shall include a means for them to be manually silenced for a period of not more than 10 min, after which time the devices shall restore themselves to normal operation. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.18.(11), audible signal devices located within a dwelling unit shall include a means for them to be manually silenced for a period of not more than 10 min, after which time the devices shall restore themselves to normal operation. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).)

National Sentence Text: Audible signal devices within a dwelling unit or a suite of residential or care occupancy shall be connected to the fire alarm system in a manner such that a single open circuit at one device will not impair the operation of other audible signal devices on that same circuit that serve the other dwelling units or suites of residential or care occupancy, or on separate signal circuits that are not connected to the devices in any other dwelling unit, public corridor or suite of residential or care occupancy. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(8) and (9).)
P/T Sentence Text: Audible signal devices within a dwelling unit or a suite of residential or care occupancy shall be connected to the fire alarm system in a manner such that a single open circuit at one device will not impair the operation of other audible signal devices on that same circuit that serve the other dwelling units or suites of residential or care occupancy, or on separate signal circuits that are not connected to the devices in any other dwelling unit, public corridor or suite of residential or care occupancy.

National Sentence Text: In a building or part thereof classified as a residential or care occupancy, separate circuits shall be provided for audible signal devices on each floor area, and audible signal devices within dwelling units or suites of residential or care occupancy shall be wired on separate signal circuits from those not within dwelling units or suites of residential or care occupancy. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(8) and (9).)
P/T Sentence Text: In a building or part thereof classified as a residential or care occupancy, separate circuits shall be provided for audible signal devices on each floor area, and audible signal devices within dwelling units or suites of residential or care occupancy shall be wired on separate signal circuits from those not within dwelling units or suites of residential or care occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Audible signal devices shall be installed in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8) and shall be connected to the fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: Audible signal devices shall be installed in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8) and shall be connected to the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Audible signal devices within dwelling units that are wired on separate signal circuits need not include a means for silencing as required by Sentence 3.2.4.18.(7) provided the fire alarm system includes a provision for an automatic signal silence within dwelling units, where the automatic signal silence cannot occur within the first 60 s of operation or within the zone of initiation, a subsequent alarm elsewhere in the building will reactuate the silenced audible signal devices within dwelling units, after a period of not more than 10 min, the silenced audible signal devices will be restored to continuous audible signal if the alarm is not acknowledged, and the voice communication systems referred to in Articles 3.2.4.22.and 3.2.4.23. have a provision to override the automatic signal silence to allow the transmission of voice messages through silenced audible signal device circuits that serve the dwelling units. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: Audible signal devices within dwelling units that are wired on separate signal circuits need not include a means for silencing as required by Sentence 3.2.4.18.(7) provided the fire alarm system includes a provision for an automatic signal silence within dwelling units, where the automatic signal silence cannot occur within the first 60 s of operation or within the zone of initiation, a subsequent alarm elsewhere in the building will reactuate the silenced audible signal devices within dwelling units, after a period of not more than 10 min, the silenced audible signal devices will be restored to continuous audible signal if the alarm is not acknowledged, and the voice communication systems referred to in Articles 3.2.4.22.and 3.2.4.23. have a provision to override the automatic signal silence to allow the transmission of voice messages through silenced audible signal device circuits that serve the dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: If a 2-stage fire alarm system has been installed with an automatic signal silence as described in Sentence 3.2.4.18.(11), the system shall be designed so that any silenced audible signal devices serving dwelling units are reactuated whenever an alarm signal is required to be transmitted as part of the second stage. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).) (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a 2-stage fire alarm system has been installed with an automatic signal silence as described in Sentence 3.2.4.18.(11), the system shall be designed so that any silenced audible signal devices serving dwelling units are reactuated whenever an alarm signal is required to be transmitted as part of the second stage. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).)

National Sentence Text: Visual signal devices shall be installed in addition to alarm signals in buildings or portions thereof intended for use primarily by persons with a hearing impairment, in assembly occupancies in which music and other sounds associated with performances could exceed 100 dBA, in any floor area in which the ambient noise level is more than 87 dBA, and in any floor area in which the occupants use ear protection devices, are located in an audiometric booth, or are located in sound-insulating enclosures.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire alarm system is installed, visual signals shall be provided in addition to alarm signals in buildings or portions thereof intended for use primarily by persons with a hearing impairment, assembly occupancies in which music and other sounds associated with performances could exceed 100 dBA, any floor area in which the ambient noise level is more than 87 dBA, any floor area in which the occupants use ear protection devices, are located in an audiometric booth, or are located in sound-insulating enclosures, public corridors, corridors used by the public and in a floor area or part thereof where the public may congregate serving a Group A major occupancy, corridors used by the public or serving patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms in a Group B major occupancy, washrooms, except those located within suites of residential occupancy, those located within suites of care occupancy, those located within patients’ sleeping rooms, and single toilet rooms, universal washrooms provided in accordance with Article 3.8.3.12., and suites of residential occupancy, such that at least one device is located within the principal living area.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where a fire alarm system is installed, visual signals shall be provided in addition to alarm signals in buildings or portions thereof intended for use primarily by persons with a hearing impairment, assembly occupancies in which music and other sounds associated with performances could exceed 100 dBA, any floor area in which the ambient noise level is more than 87 dBA, any floor area in which the occupants use ear protection devices, are located in an audiometric booth, or are located in sound-insulating enclosures, public corridors, corridors used by the public and in a floor area or part thereof where the public may congregate serving a Group A major occupancy, corridors used by the public or serving patients or residents sleeping rooms in a Group B major occupancy, washrooms, except those located within suites of residential occupancy, those located within suites of care occupancy, those located within patients sleeping rooms, and single toilet rooms, universal washrooms provided in accordance with Article 3.8.3.12., and suites of residential occupancy, such that at least one device is located within the principal living area.

National Sentence Text: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19.(1) shall be installed so that the signal from at least one device is visible throughout the floor area or portion thereof in which they are installed. (See Note A-3.2.4.19.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19.(1) shall be installed so that the signal from at least one device is visible throughout the floor area or portion thereof in which they are installed. (See Note A-3.2.4.19.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.21., smoke alarms shall be installed in accordance with this Article.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.21., smoke alarms shall be installed in accordance with this Article.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(5) and permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8), smoke alarms conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S531-14 Smoke Alarms shall be installed in each dwelling unit and, except for care, treatment or detention occupancies required to have a fire alarm system, in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit or suite of care occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(5) and permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8), smoke alarms conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S531-14 Smoke Alarms shall be installed in each dwelling unit and, except for care, treatment or detention occupancies required to have a fire alarm system, in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit or suite of care occupancy.

National Sentence Text: At least one smoke alarm shall be installed on each storey of a dwelling unit or suite of care occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one smoke alarm shall be installed on each storey of a dwelling unit or suite of care occupancy.

National Sentence Text: On any storey of a dwelling unit containing sleeping rooms, a smoke alarm shall be installed in each sleeping room, and in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the storey, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a hallway, the smoke alarm shall be located in the hallway.
P/T Sentence Text: On any storey of a dwelling unit containing sleeping rooms, a smoke alarm shall be installed in each sleeping room, and in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the storey, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a hallway, the smoke alarm shall be located in the hallway.

National Sentence Text: Where a care occupancy has individual suites for residents, a smoke alarm shall be installed in each sleeping room, and in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the suite, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a corridor within the suite, the smoke alarm shall be located in the corridor.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a care occupancy has individual suites for residents, a smoke alarm shall be installed in each sleeping room, and in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the suite, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a corridor within the suite, the smoke alarm shall be located in the corridor.

National Sentence Text: A smoke alarm shall be installed on or near the ceiling.
P/T Sentence Text: A smoke alarm shall be installed on or near the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8), smoke alarms referred in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(2) shall be installed with permanent connections to an electrical circuit (see Note A-3.2.4.20.(7)(a)), have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the smoke alarm, and in case the regular power supply to the smoke alarm is interrupted, be provided with a battery as an alternative power source that can continue to provide power to the smoke alarm for a period of no less than 7 days in the normal condition, followed by 4 minutes of alarm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8), smoke alarms referred in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(2) shall be installed with permanent connections to an electrical circuit (see Note A-3.2.4.20.(7)(a)), have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the smoke alarm, and in case the regular power supply to the smoke alarm is interrupted, be provided with a battery as an alternative power source that can continue to provide power to the smoke alarm for a period of no less than 7 days in the normal condition, followed by 4 minutes of alarm.

National Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual suites, except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(9), are installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems and form part of the fire alarm system. (See Note A-3.2.4.20.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual suites, except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(9), are installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems and form part of the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors permitted to be installed in lieu of smoke alarms as stated in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8) are permitted to sound localized alarms within individual suites, and need not sound an alarm throughout the rest of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors permitted to be installed in lieu of smoke alarms as stated in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8) are permitted to sound localized alarms within individual suites, and need not sound an alarm throughout the rest of the building.

National Sentence Text: If more than one smoke alarm is required in a dwelling unit, the smoke alarms shall be wired so that the actuation of one smoke alarm will cause all smoke alarms within the dwelling unit to sound.
P/T Sentence Text: If more than one smoke alarm is required in a dwelling unit, the smoke alarms shall be wired so that the actuation of one smoke alarm will cause all smoke alarms within the dwelling unit to sound.

National Sentence Text: A smoke alarm required by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(2) shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S553-14 Installation of Smoke Alarms
P/T Sentence Text: A smoke alarm required by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(2) shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S553-14 Installation of Smoke Alarms

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(13), a manually operated silencing device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a dwelling unit so that it will silence the signal emitted by the smoke alarm for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and again sound the alarm if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to reactuate the smoke alarm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(13), a manually operated silencing device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a dwelling unit so that it will silence the signal emitted by the smoke alarm for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and again sound the alarm if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to reactuate the smoke alarm.

National Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy equipped with smoke detectors installed to ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems as part of the fire alarm system in lieu of smoke alarms as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8), need not incorporate the manually operated device required in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(12). (See Note A-3.2.4.20.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy equipped with smoke detectors installed to ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems as part of the fire alarm system in lieu of smoke alarms as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8), need not incorporate the manually operated device required in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(12). (See Note A-3.2.4.20.(8).)

National Sentence Text: The sound patterns of smoke alarms shall meet the temporal patterns of alarm signals (see Note A-3.2.4.18.(2)), or be a combination temporal pattern and voice relay.
P/T Sentence Text: The sound patterns of smoke alarms shall meet the temporal patterns of alarm signals (see Note A-3.2.4.18.(2)), or be a combination temporal pattern and voice relay.

National Sentence Text: Except where a fire alarm system is installed or required in a building, smoke detectors forming part of a residential fire warning system installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S540-13 Residential Fire and Life Safety Warning Systems: Installation, Inspection, Testing and Maintenance are permitted to be installed in lieu of all smoke alarms required by Article 3.2.4.20., provided the system is capable of sounding audible signals in accordance with Articles 9.10.19.2. and Article 9.10.19.5., is powered in accordance with Article 9.10.19.4., and is provided with a silencing device in accordance with Article 9.10.19.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a fire alarm system is installed or required in a building, smoke detectors forming part of a residential fire warning system installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S540-13 Residential Fire and Life Safety Warning Systems: Installation, Inspection, Testing and Maintenance are permitted to be installed in lieu of all smoke alarms required by Article 3.2.4.20., provided the system is capable of sounding audible signals in accordance with Articles 9.10.19.2. and Article 9.10.19.5., is powered in accordance with Article 9.10.19.4., and is provided with a silencing device in accordance with Article 9.10.19.6.

National Sentence Text: A voice communication system required by Subsection 3.2.6. shall consist of a two-way means of communication with the central alarm and control facility and to the mechanical control centre from each floor area, and be capable of broadcasting prerecorded, synthesized, or live messages from the central alarm and control facility that are audible and intelligible in all parts of the building, except that this requirement does not apply to elevator cars (see Note A-3.2.4.22.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: A voice communication system required by part 3. shall consist of a two-way means of communication with the central alarm and control facility and to the mechanical control centre from each floor area, and be capable of broadcasting prerecorded, synthesized, or live messages from the central alarm and control facility that are audible and intelligible in all parts of the building, except that this requirement does not apply to elevator cars (see Note A-3.2.4.22.(1)(b)).

National Sentence Text: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.22.(1) shall include a means to silence the alarm signal in a single stage fire alarm system while voice instructions are being transmitted, but only after the alarm signal has initially sounded for not less than 30 s.
P/T Sentence Text: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.22.(1) shall include a means to silence the alarm signal in a single stage fire alarm system while voice instructions are being transmitted, but only after the alarm signal has initially sounded for not less than 30 s.

National Sentence Text: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.22.(1) shall include a means to silence the alert signal and the alarm signal in a 2-stage fire alarm system while voice instructions are being transmitted, but only after the alert signal has initially sounded for not less than 10 s in hospitals that have supervisory personnel on duty for twenty-four hours each day, or 30 s for all other occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.22.(1) shall include a means to silence the alert signal and the alarm signal in a 2-stage fire alarm system while voice instructions are being transmitted, but only after the alert signal has initially sounded for not less than 10 s in hospitals that have supervisory personnel on duty for twenty-four hours each day, or 30 s for all other occupancies.

National Sentence Text: The voice communication system referred to in Clause 3.2.4.22.(1)(b) shall be designed so that the alarm signal in a 2-stage fire alarm system can be selectively transmitted to any zone or zones while maintaining an alert signal or selectively transmitting voice instructions to any other zone or zones in the building.
P/T Sentence Text: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.22.(1) shall be designed so that the alarm signal in a 2-stage fire alarm system can be selectively transmitted to any zone or zones while maintaining an alert signal or selectively transmitting voice instructions to any other zone or zones in the building.

National Sentence Text: The 2-way communication system referred to in Clause 3.2.4.22.(1)(a) shall be installed so that emergency telephones are located in each floor area near exit stair shafts.
P/T Sentence Text: The 2-way communication system referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.22.(1) shall be installed so that emergency telephones are located in each floor area near exit stair shafts.

National Sentence Text: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19.(1) shall continue to emit a visible signal while voice instructions are being transmitted.
P/T Sentence Text: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19.(1) shall continue to emit a visible signal while voice instructions are being transmitted.

National Sentence Text: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Except for Group B, Division 1 and Group F, Division 1 major occupancies, where a fire alarm system is required under Subsection 3.2.4., a one-way voice communication system shall be installed in buildings where a 2-stage fire alarm system is installed and whose occupant load exceeds 1 000.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for Group B, Division 1 and Group F, Division 1 major occupancies, where a fire alarm system is required under part 3., a one-way voice communication system shall be installed in buildings where a 2-stage fire alarm system is installed and whose occupant load exceeds 1 000.

National Sentence Text: The one-way voice communication system required by Sentence 3.2.4.23.(1) shall consist of loudspeakers that are operated from the central alarm and control facility or, in the absence of such a facility, from a designated area, and except in elevator cars, designed and located so that transmitted messages are audible and intelligible in all parts of the building. (See Note A-3.2.4.22.(1)(b).)
P/T Sentence Text: The one-way voice communication system required by Sentence 3.2.4.23.(1) shall consist of loudspeakers that are operated from the central alarm and control facility or, in the absence of such a facility, from a designated area, and except in elevator cars, designed and located so that transmitted messages are audible and intelligible in all parts of the building.

National Sentence Text: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: The one-way voice communication system required by Sentence 3.2.4.23.(1) shall meet the silencing and transmission requirements of Sentences 3.2.4.22.(2)to 3.2.4.22.(4)and 3.2.4.22.(6). (See Note A-3.)
P/T Sentence Text: The one-way voice communication system required by Sentence 3.2.4.23.(1) shall meet the silencing and transmission requirements of Sentences 3.2.4.22.(2) to 3.2.4.22.(4) and 3.2.4.22.(6).

National Sentence Text: Except for storeys below the first storey, direct access for firefighting shall be provided from the outdoors to every storey that is not sprinklered throughout and whose floor level is less than 25 m above grade, by at least one unobstructed window or access panel for each 15 m of wall in each wall required to face a street by Subsection 3.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for storeys below the first storey, direct access for firefighting shall be provided from the outdoors to every storey that is not sprinklered throughout and whose floor level is less than 25 m above grade, by at least one unobstructed window or access panel for each 15 m of wall in each wall required to face a street by part 3.

National Sentence Text: An opening for access required by Sentence 3.2.5.1.(1) shall have a sill no higher than 900 mm above the inside floor, and be not less than 1 100 mm high by not less than 550 mm wide for a building not designed for the storage or use of dangerous goods, or 750 mm wide for a building designed for the storage or use of dangerous goods.
P/T Sentence Text: An opening for access required by Sentence 3.2.5.1.(1) shall have a sill no higher than 900 mm above the inside floor, and be not less than 1 100 mm high by not less than 550 mm wide for a building not designed for the storage or use of dangerous goods, or 750 mm wide for a building designed for the storage or use of dangerous goods.

National Sentence Text: Access panels above the first storey shall be readily openable from both inside and outside, or the opening shall be glazed with plain glass.
P/T Sentence Text: Access panels above the first storey shall be readily openable from both inside and outside, or the opening shall be glazed with plain glass.

National Sentence Text: Direct access from at least one street shall be provided from the outdoors in a building that is not sprinklered to each basement having a horizontal dimension more than 25 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Direct access from at least one street shall be provided from the outdoors in a building that is not sprinklered to each basement having a horizontal dimension more than 25 m.

National Sentence Text: The access required by Sentence 3.2.5.2.(1) is permitted to be provided by doors, windows or other means that provide an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, with a sill no higher than 900 mm above the inside floor, or an interior stairway immediately accessible from the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: The access required by Sentence 3.2.5.2.(1) is permitted to be provided by doors, windows or other means that provide an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, with a sill no higher than 900 mm above the inside floor, or an interior stairway immediately accessible from the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: On a building more than 3 storeys in building height where the slope of the roof is less than 1 in 4, all main roof areas shall be provided with direct access from the floor areas immediately below, either by a stairway, or a hatch not less than 550 mm by 900 mm with a fixed ladder.
P/T Sentence Text: On a building more than 3 storeys in building height where the slope of the roof is less than 1 in 4, all main roof areas shall be provided with direct access from the floor areas immediately below, either by a stairway, or a hatch not less than 550 mm by 900 mm with a fixed ladder.

National Sentence Text: A building which is more than 3 storeys in building height or more than 600 m2 in building area shall be provided with access routes for fire department vehicles to the building face having a principal entrance, and to each building face having access openings for firefighting as required by Articles 3.2.5.1.and 3.2.5.2. (See Note A-3.2.5.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A building which is more than 3 storeys in building height or more than 600 m2 in building area shall be provided with access routes for fire department vehicles to the building face having a principal entrance, and to each building face having access openings for firefighting as required by Articles 3.2.5.1. and 3.2.5.2.

National Sentence Text: Access routes required by Article 3.2.5.4. shall be located so that the principal entrance and every access opening required by Articles 3.2.5.1.and 3.2.5.2. are located not less than 3 m and not more than 15 m from the closest portion of the access route required for fire department use, measured horizontally from the face of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Access routes required by Article 3.2.5.4. shall be located so that the principal entrance and every access opening required by Articles 3.2.5.1. and 3.2.5.2. are located not less than 3 m and not more than 15 m from the closest portion of the access route required for fire department use, measured horizontally from the face of the building.

National Sentence Text: Access routes shall be provided to a building so that for a building provided with a fire department connection, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located adjacent to the hydrants referred to in Article 3.2.5.15., for a building not provided with a fire department connection, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located so that the length of the access route from a hydrant to the vehicle plus the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter from the vehicle to the building is not more than 90 m, and the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter from the vehicle to the building is not more than 45 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Access routes shall be provided to a building so that for a building provided with a fire department connection, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located adjacent to the hydrants referred to in Article 3.2.5.15., for a building not provided with a fire department connection, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located so that the length of the access route from a hydrant to the vehicle plus the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter from the vehicle to the building is not more than 90 m, and the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter from the vehicle to the building is not more than 45 m.

National Sentence Text: The unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter required by Sentence 3.2.5.5.(2) from the vehicle to the building shall be measured from the vehicle to the fire department connection provided for the building, except that if no fire department connection is provided, the path of travel shall be measured to the principal entrance of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter required by Sentence 3.2.5.5.(2) from the vehicle to the building shall be measured from the vehicle to the fire department connection provided for the building, except that if no fire department connection is provided, the path of travel shall be measured to the principal entrance of the building.

National Sentence Text: If a portion of a building is completely cut off from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building, the access routes required by Sentence 3.2.5.5.(2) shall be located so that the unobstructed path of travel from the vehicle to one entrance of each portion of the building is not more than 45 m.
P/T Sentence Text: If a portion of a building is completely cut off from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building, the access routes required by Sentence 3.2.5.5.(2) shall be located so that the unobstructed path of travel from the vehicle to one entrance of each portion of the building is not more than 45 m.

National Sentence Text: A portion of a roadway or yard provided as a required access route for fire department use shall have a clear width not less than 6 m, unless it can be shown that lesser widths are satisfactory, have a centre-line radius not less than 12 m, have an overhead clearance not less than 5 m, have a change of gradient not more than 1 in 12.5 over a minimum distance of 15 m, be designed to support the expected loads imposed by firefighting equipment and be surfaced with concrete, asphalt or other material designed to permit accessibility under all climatic conditions, have turnaround facilities for any dead-end portion of the access route more than 90 m long, and be connected with a public thoroughfare. (See Note A-3.2.5.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A portion of a roadway or yard provided as a required access route for fire department use shall have a clear width not less than 6 m, unless it can be shown that lesser widths are satisfactory, have a centre-line radius not less than 12 m, have an overhead clearance not less than 5 m, have a change of gradient not more than 1 in 12.5 over a minimum distance of 15 m, be designed to support the expected loads imposed by firefighting equipment and be surfaced with concrete, asphalt or other material designed to permit accessibility under all climatic conditions, have turnaround facilities for any dead-end portion of the access route more than 90 m long, and be connected with a public thoroughfare.

National Sentence Text: For buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58., no portion of the access route described in Sentence 3.2.2.10.(3) shall be more than 20 m below the uppermost floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: For buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58., no portion of the access route described in Sentence 3.2.2.10.(3) shall be more than 20 m below the uppermost floor level.

Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.5.7.(3) to 3.2.5.7.(5), and except for a building that is neither more than 3 storeys in building height nor more than 600 m2 in building area, a building shall have water available for firefighting purposes that is provided by a piped municipal water supply capable of being delivered at a rate of not less than 3 800 L/min, and residual pressure of not less than 140 kPa, or private water supply that is not less than the quantity derived from the following formula: Q=V×O×SwhereQ= minimum water supply (litres), V= total building volume (cubic metres), O= water supply coefficient (from Table 3.2.5.7.), S= spatial coefficient whose value is 1.5 for a building that has any limiting distance less than 7.5 m, otherwise whose value is 1.0.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.5.7.(3) to 3.2.5.7.(5), and except for a building that is neither more than 3 storeys in building height nor more than 600 m2 in building area, a building shall have water available for firefighting purposes that is provided by a piped municipal water supply capable of being delivered at a rate of not less than 3 800 L/min, and residual pressure of not less than 140 kPa, or private water supply that is not less than the quantity derived from the following formula: Q = V × O × S where Q = minimum water supply (litres), V = total building volume (cubic metres), O = water supply coefficient (from Table 3.2.5.7.), S = spatial coefficient whose value is 1.5 for a building that has any limiting distance less than 7.5 m, otherwise whose value is 1.0.

P/T Sentence Text: The private water supply referred to in Sentence 3.2.5.7.(1) shall be capable of being delivered at a rate of not less than 2 700 L/min for a building required to have a quantity less than 75 000 L, and 3 800 L/min for a building required to have a quantity of 75 000 L or greater, and provided with a dry hydrant conforming to Chapter 8 of NFPA 1142-2017 Water Supplies for Suburban and Rural Fire Fighting or pressurized hydrant conforming to the requirements of NFPA 24-2013 Installation of Private Fire Service Mains and Their Appurtenances
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The private water supply referred to in Clause 3.2.5.7.(1)(b) shall be capable of being delivered at a rate of not less than 2 700 L/min for a building required to have a quantity less than 75 000 L, and 3 800 L/min for a building required to have a quantity of 75 000 L or greater, and provided with a dry hydrant conforming to Chapter 8 of NFPA 1142-2017 Water Supplies for Suburban and Rural Fire Fighting or pressurized hydrant conforming to the requirements of NFPA 24-2013 Installation of Private Fire Service Mains and Their Appurtenances

National Sentence Text: Every building shall be provided with an adequate water supply for firefighting. (See Note A-3.2.5.7.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Capacity requirements under Sentence 3.2.5.7.(1) do not apply to a building having a standpipe system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 14-2013 Installation of Standpipe and Hose Systems
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Capacity requirements under Sentence 3.2.5.7.(1) do not apply to a building having a standpipe system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 14-2013 Installation of Standpipe and Hose Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Capacity requirements under Sentence 3.2.5.7.(1) do not apply to a building that is sprinklered in conformance with NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems NFPA 13R-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems in Low-Rise Residential Occupancies or NFPA 13D-2016 Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Capacity requirements under Sentence 3.2.5.7.(1) do not apply to a building that is sprinklered in conformance with NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems NFPA 13R-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems in Low-Rise Residential Occupancies or NFPA 13D-2016 Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes

P/T Sentence Text: Sentence 3.2.5.7.(1) does not apply to a building classified as a medium-hazard industrial occupancy or low-hazard industrial occupancy, provided the building is not more than 1 200 m2 in building area, not more than 1 storey in building height, of noncombustible construction, and not intended for the manufacture or storage of combustible materials and does not contain a mercantile occupancy, any business and personal services occupancy contained within the building occupies not more than 10% of the building area, a single stage fire alarm system is installed in the building in accordance with part 3., and additionally, the fire alarm system is provided with an alarm bell on the exterior of the building, the fire alarm system is designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), that an alarm signal has been initiated, and the owner provides evidence of compliance to the authority having jurisdiction as required by Sentence 3.2.4.7.(7), the floor area of the building is primarily an open space with minimal subdivision into smaller rooms or spaces, the travel distance to an exit does not exceed 20 m, portable fire extinguishers are installed in accordance with NFPA 10-2013 Portable Fire Extinguishers except that the permitted area for each extinguisher is one half that permitted in the standard, the capacity of each extinguisher is double that required by the standard, or an equivalent combination of Subclauses 3.2.5.7.(5)and 3.2.5.7.(5) is used, and the highest point of the building is not more than 10 m above grade.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Sentence 3.2.5.7.(1) does not apply to a building classified as a medium-hazard industrial occupancy or low-hazard industrial occupancy, provided the building is not more than 1 200 m2 in building area, not more than 1 storey in building height, of noncombustible construction, and not intended for the manufacture or storage of combustible materials and does not contain a mercantile occupancy, any business and personal services occupancy contained within the building occupies not more than 10% of the building area, a single stage fire alarm system is installed in the building in accordance with Subsection 3.2.4., and additionally, the fire alarm system is provided with an alarm bell on the exterior of the building, the fire alarm system is designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), that an alarm signal has been initiated, and the owner provides evidence of compliance to the authority having jurisdiction as required by Sentence 3.2.4.7.(7), the floor area of the building is primarily an open space with minimal subdivision into smaller rooms or spaces, the travel distance to an exit does not exceed 20 m, portable fire extinguishers are installed in accordance with NFPA 10-2013 Portable Fire Extinguishers except that the permitted area for each extinguisher is one half that permitted in the standard, the capacity of each extinguisher is double that required by the standard, or an equivalent combination of Subclauses 3.2.5.7.(5)(f)(i) and 3.2.5.7.(5)(f)(ii) is used, and the highest point of the building is not more than 10 m above grade.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.9.(4), a standpipe system shall be installed in a building that is more than 3 storeys in building height, more than 14 m high measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey, or not more than 14 m high measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey but has a building area exceeding the area shown in Table 3.2.5.8. for the applicable building height unless the building is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.9.(4), a standpipe system shall be installed in a building that is more than 3 storeys in building height, more than 14 m high measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey, or not more than 14 m high measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey but has a building area exceeding the area shown in Table 3.2.5.8. for the applicable building height unless the building is sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.5.9.(2)to 3.2.5.9.(6), Articles 3.2.5.10.and 3.2.5.11., and Sentence 3.2.4.9.(2), the design, construction, installation and testing of a standpipe system shall conform to NFPA 14-2013 Installation of Standpipe and Hose Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.5.9.(2) to 3.2.5.9.(6), Articles 3.2.5.10. and 3.2.5.11., and Sentence 3.2.4.9.(2), the design, construction, installation and testing of a standpipe system shall conform to NFPA 14-2013 Installation of Standpipe and Hose Systems

National Sentence Text: A dry standpipe that is not connected to a water supply shall not be considered as fulfilling the requirements of this Article.
P/T Sentence Text: A dry standpipe that is not connected to a water supply shall not be considered as fulfilling the requirements of this Article.

National Sentence Text: If more than one standpipe is provided, the total water supply need not be more than 30 L/s.
P/T Sentence Text: If more than one standpipe is provided, the total water supply need not be more than 30 L/s.

National Sentence Text: A standpipe need not be installed in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.90., provided the building is not more than 15 m high.
P/T Sentence Text: A standpipe need not be installed in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.90., provided the building is not more than 15 m high.

National Sentence Text: The residual water pressure at the design flow rate at the topmost hose connection of a standpipe system that is required to be installed in a building is permitted to be less than 690 kPa provided the building is sprinklered throughout, the water supply at the base of the sprinkler riser is capable of meeting, without a fire pump, the design flow rate and pressure demand of the sprinkler system, including the inside and outside hose allowance, and fire protection equipment is available to deliver, by means of the fire department connection, the full demand flow rate at a residual water pressure of 690 kPa at the topmost hose connection of the standpipe system (see Note A-3.2.5.9.(5)(c)).
P/T Sentence Text: The residual water pressure at the design flow rate at the topmost hose connection of a standpipe system that is required to be installed in a building is permitted to be less than 690 kPa provided the building is sprinklered throughout, the water supply at the base of the sprinkler riser is capable of meeting, without a fire pump, the design flow rate and pressure demand of the sprinkler system, including the inside and outside hose allowance, and fire protection equipment is available to deliver, by means of the fire department connection, the full demand flow rate at a residual water pressure of 690 kPa at the topmost hose connection of the standpipe system (see Note A-3.2.5.9.(5)(c)).

National Sentence Text: A fire department connection shall be provided for every standpipe system.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire department connection shall be provided for every standpipe system.

National Sentence Text: Hose connections are not required within a floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: Hose connections are not required within a floor area.

National Sentence Text: Hose connections shall be provided with sufficient clearance to permit the use of a standard fire department hose key.
P/T Sentence Text: Hose connections shall be provided with sufficient clearance to permit the use of a standard fire department hose key.

P/T Sentence Text: A hose cabinet shall be located so that its door, when fully opened, will not obstruct the required width of a means of egress.

National Sentence Text: If a building contains fewer than 9 sprinklers, the water supply for these sprinklers is permitted to be supplied from the domestic water system for the building provided the required flow for the sprinklers can be met by the domestic system.
P/T Sentence Text: If a building contains fewer than 9 sprinklers, the water supply for these sprinklers is permitted to be supplied from the domestic water system for the building provided the required flow for the sprinklers can be met by the domestic system.

(See Note A-3.2.5.12.(6).) (See Note A-3.2.5.12.(6).)

National Sentence Text: Sprinklers in elevator machine rooms shall have a temperature rating not less than that required for an intermediate temperature classification and shall be protected against physical damage. (See Note A-3.2.5.12.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinklers in elevator machine rooms shall have a temperature rating not less than that required for an intermediate temperature classification and shall be protected against physical damage. (See Note A-3.2.5.12.(8).)

If a sprinkleredbuilding receives its water supply for the sprinkler system from sources other than a piped municipal water system, external provision shall be made for the fire department to use the water supply.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): If a sprinklered building receives its water supply for the sprinkler system from sources other than a piped municipal water system, external provision shall be made for the fire department to use the water supply.

P/T Sentence Text: Notwithstanding the requirements of Sentence 3.2.5.12.(2) regarding the installation of automatic sprinkler systems and except for buildings constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50., in buildings of combustible construction, sprinklers shall be required in porches and balconies, public corridors, stairs that are open and attached, attics and floor/ceiling spaces, penthouse equipment rooms, elevator machine rooms, concealed spaces dedicated exclusively to and containing only dwelling unit ventilation equipment, crawl spaces, closets or storage rooms on exterior balconies, and other concealed spaces that are not used or intended for living purposes or storage and do not contain fuel-fired appliances.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Notwithstanding the requirements of Sentence 3.2.5.12.(2) regarding the installation of automatic sprinkler systems and except for buildings constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50., in buildings of combustible construction, sprinklers shall be required in porches and balconies, public corridors, stairs that are open and attached, attics and floor/ceiling spaces, penthouse equipment rooms, elevator machine rooms, concealed spaces dedicated exclusively to and containing only dwelling unit ventilation equipment, crawl spaces, closets or storage rooms on exterior balconies, and other concealed spaces that are not used or intended for living purposes or storage and do not contain fuel-fired appliances. (See also Article 3.1.11.5. for requirements on the protection of concealed spaces in buildings conforming to Article 3.2.2.50.)

P/T Sentence Text: A concealed space referred to in Sentence 3.2.5.12.(10) need not be equipped with sprinklers, provided the concealed space meets one of the criteria described in Clause 8.15.1.2 of NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems

National Sentence Text: Combustible sprinkler piping shall be used only for sprinkler systems in residential occupancies and other light-hazard occupancies. (See Note A-3.2.5.13.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.5.13.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible sprinkler piping shall be used only for sprinkler systems in residential occupancies and other light-hazard occupancies. (See Note A-3.2.5.13.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Combustible sprinkler piping shall meet the requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C199P-2002 Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible sprinkler piping shall meet the requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C199P-2002 Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.13.(5), combustible sprinkler piping shall be separated from the area served by the sprinkler system, and from any other fire compartment, by ceilings, walls, or soffits consisting of, as a minimum, lath and plaster, gypsum board not less than 9.5 mm thick, plywood not less than 13 mm thick, or a suspended membrane ceiling with steel suspension grids, and lay-in panels or tiles having a mass not less than 1.7 kg/m2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.13.(5), combustible sprinkler piping shall be separated from the area served by the sprinkler system, and from any other fire compartment, by ceilings, walls, or soffits consisting of, as a minimum, lath and plaster, gypsum board not less than 9.5 mm thick, plywood not less than 13 mm thick, or a suspended membrane ceiling with steel suspension grids, and lay-in panels or tiles having a mass not less than 1.7 kg/m2.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.13.(5), combustible sprinkler piping may be located above a ceiling provided that the distance between the edge of any ceiling opening that is not protected in conformance with Sentence 3.2.5.13.(3) and the nearest sprinkler is not more than 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.13.(5), combustible sprinkler piping may be located above a ceiling provided that the distance between the edge of any ceiling opening that is not protected in conformance with Sentence 3.2.5.13.(3) and the nearest sprinkler is not more than 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where combustible sprinkler piping has been tested in conformance with ULC ULC/ORD-C199P-2002 Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems and has been shown to meet the requirements therein without additional protection, conformance to Sentences 3.2.5.13.(3)and 3.2.5.13.(4) is not required.
P/T Sentence Text: Where combustible sprinkler piping has been tested in conformance with ULC ULC/ORD-C199P-2002 Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems and has been shown to meet the requirements therein without additional protection, conformance to Sentences 3.2.5.13.(3)and 3.2.5.13.(4) is not required.

National Sentence Text: An automatic sprinkler system shall be installed in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8) if flooring for access within the service space is other than catwalks.
P/T Sentence Text: An automatic sprinkler system shall be installed in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8) if flooring for access within the service space is other than catwalks.

National Sentence Text: The sprinkler system required by Sentence 3.2.5.14.(1) shall be equipped with waterflow detecting devices, with each device serving not more than one storey.
P/T Sentence Text: The sprinkler system required by Sentence 3.2.5.14.(1) shall be equipped with waterflow detecting devices, with each device serving not more than one storey.

National Sentence Text: The waterflow detecting devices required by Sentence 3.2.5.14.(2) shall be connected to the fire alarm system, to initiate an alert signal in a 2-stage system or an alarm signal in a single stage system, and indicate separately on the fire alarm system annunciator the actuation of each device.
P/T Sentence Text: The waterflow detecting devices required by Sentence 3.2.5.14.(2) shall be connected to the fire alarm system, to initiate an alert signal in a 2-stage system or an alarm signal in a single stage system, and indicate separately on the fire alarm system annunciator the actuation of each device.

National Sentence Text: The fire department connection for a standpipe system shall be located so that the distance from the fire department connection to a hydrant is not more than 45 m and is unobstructed.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire department connection for a standpipe system shall be located so that the distance from the fire department connection to a hydrant is not more than 45 m and is unobstructed.

National Sentence Text: The fire department connection for an automatic sprinkler system shall be located so that the distance from the fire department connection to a hydrant is not more than 45 m and is unobstructed.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire department connection for an automatic sprinkler system shall be located so that the distance from the fire department connection to a hydrant is not more than 45 m and is unobstructed.
The fire department connection referred to in Sentences 3.2.5.15.(1)and 3.2.5.15.(2) shall be located no closer than 3 m and no further than 15 m from the principal entrance to the building.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The fire department connection referred to in Sentences 3.2.5.15.(1) and 3.2.5.15.(2) shall be located no closer than 3 m and no further than 15 m from the principal entrance to the building.

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be provided and installed in accordance with provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or the NFC, in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause 3.2.5.16.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: Portable fire extinguishers shall be provided and installed in conformance with the NFC(AE).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Portable fire extinguishers shall be provided and installed in conformance with the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: In a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy, portable fire extinguishers are permitted to be located in secure areas, or in lockable cabinets provided identical keys for all cabinets are located at all supervisory or security stations, or electrical remote release devices are provided and are connected to an emergency power supply.
P/T Sentence Text: In a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy, portable fire extinguishers are permitted to be located in secure areas, or in lockable cabinets provided identical keys for all cabinets are located at all supervisory or security stations, or electrical remote release devices are provided and are connected to an emergency power supply.

National Sentence Text: Equipment forming part of a fire protection system shall be protected from freezing if it could be adversely affected by freezing temperatures, and it is located in an unheated area.
P/T Sentence Text: Equipment forming part of a fire protection system shall be protected from freezing if it could be adversely affected by freezing temperatures, and it is located in an unheated area.

National Sentence Text: If a fire pump is installed, it shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection (See Note A-3.2.5.18.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.5.18.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire pump is installed, it shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection tested to ensure satisfactory operation in conformance with NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection and provided with emergency power meeting the requirements of Article 3.2.7.9.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): If a fire pump is installed, it shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection tested to ensure satisfactory operation in conformance with NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection and provided with emergency power meeting the requirements of Article 3.2.7.9. (See Note A-3.2.5.18.(1).)

P/T Sentence Text: Fittings for inlets and outlets for firefighting use shall conform to the NFC(AE).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Fittings for inlets and outlets for firefighting use shall conform to the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to a building of Group A, D, E or F major occupancy classification that is more than 36 m high, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, or 18 m high, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, and in which the cumulative or total occupant load on or above any storey above grade, other than the first storey, divided by 1.8 times the width in metres of all exit stairs at that storey, exceeds 300, containing a Group B major occupancy in which the floor level of the highest storey of that major occupancy is more than 18 m above grade, containing a floor area or part of a floor area located above the third storey designed or intended as a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, or containing a Group C major occupancy whose floor level is more than 18 m above grade.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to a building of Group A, D, E or F major occupancy classification that is more than 36 m high, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, or 18 m high, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, and in which the cumulative or total occupant load on or above any storey above grade, other than the first storey, divided by 1.8 times the width in metres of all exit stairs at that storey, exceeds 300, containing a Group B major occupancy in which the floor level of the highest storey of that major occupancy is more than 18 m above grade, containing a floor area or part of a floor area located above the third storey designed or intended as a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, or containing a Group C major occupancy whose floor level is more than 18 m above grade.

National Sentence Text: A building to which this Subsection applies shall be designed in accordance with Sentences 3.2.6.2.(2)to 3.2.6.2.(6) and Article 3.2.6.3. to limit the danger to occupants and firefighters from exposure to smoke in a building fire.
P/T Sentence Text: A building to which this Subsection applies shall be designed in accordance with Sentences 3.2.6.2.(2) to 3.2.6.2.(6) and Article 3.2.6.3. to limit the danger to occupants and firefighters from exposure to smoke in a building fire.

National Sentence Text: A building referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.2.(1) shall be designed so that, during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, each exit stair serving storeys below the lowest exit level will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in accordance with Subsection 1.1.3. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A building referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.2.(1) shall be designed so that, during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, each exit stair serving storeys below the lowest exit level will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in accordance with part 1. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Each stairway that serves storeys above the lowest exit level shall have a vent to the outdoors, at or near the bottom of the stair shaft, that has an openable area of 0.05 m2 for every door between the stair shaft and a floor area, but not less than 1.8 m2, opens directly to the outdoors or into a vestibule that has a similar opening to the outdoors, and has a door or closure that is openable manually, and can remain in the open position during a fire emergency. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Each stairway that serves storeys above the lowest exit level shall have a vent to the outdoors, at or near the bottom of the stair shaft, that has an openable area of 0.05 m2 for every door between the stair shaft and a floor area, but not less than 1.8 m2, opens directly to the outdoors or into a vestibule that has a similar opening to the outdoors, and has a door or closure that is openable manually, and can remain in the open position during a fire emergency.

National Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to limit movement of smoke from a fire in a floor area below the lowest exit storey into upper storeys. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(4).) (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to limit movement of smoke from a fire in a floor area below the lowest exit storey into upper storeys. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Except for exhaust fans in kitchens, washrooms and bathrooms in dwelling units, and except for fans used for smoke venting as required by Article 3.2.6.6., air moving fans in a system that serves more than 2 storeys shall be designed and installed so that in the event of a fire these fans can be stopped by means of a manually operated switch at the central alarm and control facility.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for exhaust fans in kitchens, washrooms and bathrooms in dwelling units, and except for fans used for smoke venting as required by Article 3.2.6.6., air moving fans in a system that serves more than 2 storeys shall be designed and installed so that in the event of a fire these fans can be stopped by means of a manually operated switch at the central alarm and control facility.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.12. or where there is a conflict with other smoke control measures in the building, air-handling systems used to provide make-up air to public corridors serving suites in a Group C major occupancy shall not shut down automatically upon activation of the fire alarm so as to maintain corridor pressurization.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.12. or where there is a conflict with other smoke control measures in the building, air-handling systems used to provide make-up air to public corridors serving suites in a Group C major occupancy shall not shut down automatically upon activation of the fire alarm so as to maintain corridor pressurization.

National Sentence Text: If a building described in Article 3.2.6.1. is connected to any other building, measures shall be taken to limit movement of contaminated air from one building into another during a fire. (See Note A-3.2.6.3.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.6.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a building described in Article 3.2.6.1. is connected to any other building, measures shall be taken to limit movement of contaminated air from one building into another during a fire. (See Note A-3.2.6.3.(1).)
Elevators shall comply with the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Elevators shall comply with the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

P/T Sentence Text: Special Emergency Services, as defined in the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, shall be provided in all elevators.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Special Emergency Services, as defined in the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, shall be provided in all elevators.

National Sentence Text: Manual emergency recall shall be provided for all elevators serving storeys above the first storey.
P/T Sentence Text: Manual emergency recall shall be provided for all elevators serving storeys above the first storey.

National Sentence Text: Key-operated switches for emergency recall required by Sentence 3.2.6.4.(1) shall be provided in a conspicuous location at each elevator lobby on the recall level, and the central alarm and control facility required by Article 3.2.6.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Key-operated switches for emergency recall required by Sentence 3.2.6.4.(3) shall be provided in a conspicuous location at each elevator lobby on the recall level, and the central alarm and control facility required by Article 3.2.6.7.

National Sentence Text: In-car emergency service switches shall be provided in all elevator cars.
P/T Sentence Text: In-car emergency service switches shall be provided in all elevator cars.

National Sentence Text: Keys to operate the switches required by Sentences 3.2.6.4.(2)and 3.2.6.4.(3) shall be provided in a suitably identified box conspicuously located on the outside of an elevator hoistway near the central alarm and control facility required by Article 3.2.6.7., and kept at the central alarm and control facility.
P/T Sentence Text: Keys to operate the switches required by Sentences 3.2.6.4.(4)and 3.2.6.4.(5) shall be provided in a suitably identified box conspicuously located on the outside of an elevator hoistway near the central alarm and control facility required by Article 3.2.6.7., and kept at the central alarm and control facility.
All elevators shall be capable of operation on emergency power.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): All elevators shall be capable of operation on emergency power.

P/T Sentence Text: Not more than one elevator at one time is required to operate on emergency power.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Not more than one elevator at one time is required to operate on emergency power.

National Sentence Text: At least one elevator shall be provided for use by firefighters in conformance with Sentences 3.2.6.5.(2)to 3.2.6.5.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: At least one elevator shall be provided with features described in Sentences 3.2.6.5.(4) to 3.2.6.5.(8).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): At least one elevator shall be provided with features described in Sentences 3.2.6.5.(4) to 3.2.6.5.(8).

National Sentence Text: The elevator referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5.(1) shall have a useable platform area not less than 2.2 m2 and shall be capable of carrying a load of 900 kg to the top floor that it serves from a landing on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4.and 3.2.5.5. within 1 min.
P/T Sentence Text: The elevator referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5.(3) shall have a useable platform area not less than 2.2 m2 and shall be capable of carrying a load of 900 kg to the top floor that it serves from a landing on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. within 1 min.

National Sentence Text: Each elevator for use by firefighters shall be provided with a closure at each shaft opening so that the interlock mechanism remains mechanically engaged and electrical continuity is maintained in the interlock circuits and associated wiring for a period of not less than 1 h when the assembly is subjected to the standard fire exposure described in ULC CAN/ULC-S104-15 Fire Tests of Door Assemblies be protected with a vestibule containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be protected with a corridor containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Each elevator for use by firefighters shall be provided with a closure at each shaft opening so that the interlock mechanism remains mechanically engaged and electrical continuity is maintained in the interlock circuits and associated wiring for a period of not less than 1 h when the assembly is subjected to the standard fire exposure described in ULC CAN/ULC-S104-15 Fire Tests of Door Assemblies be protected with a vestibule containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be protected with a corridor containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.6.5.(5), an elevator referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5.(1) shall be capable of providing transportation from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4.and 3.2.5.5. to every floor that is above grade in the building and that is normally served by the elevator system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.6.5.(7), an elevator referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5.(3) shall be capable of providing transportation from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4.and 3.2.5.5. to every floor that is above grade in the building and that is normally served by the elevator system.

National Sentence Text: If it is necessary to change elevators to reach any floor referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5.(4), the system shall be designed so that not more than one change of elevator is required when travelling to any floor in the building from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4.and 3.2.5.5.
P/T Sentence Text: If it is necessary to change elevators to reach any floor referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5.(6), the system shall be designed so that not more than one change of elevator is required when travelling to any floor in the building from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5.

National Sentence Text: Electrical conductors for the operation of the elevator referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5.(1) shall be installed in service spaces conforming to Section 3.6. that do not contain other combustible material, or protected against exposure to fire from the service entrance of the emergency power supply, or the normal service entrance of the normal power supply, to the equipment served, to ensure operation for a period of 1 h when subjected to the standard fire exposure described in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials (see Note A-3.2.6.5.(6)(b)). P/T Sentence Text: Electrical conductors for the operation of the elevator referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5.(3) shall be installed in service spaces conforming to part 3. that do not contain other combustible material, or protected against exposure to fire from the service entrance of the emergency power supply, or the normal service entrance of the normal power supply, to the equipment served, to ensure operation for a period of 1 h when subjected to the standard fire exposure described in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials (see Note A-3.2.6.5.(8)(b)).

National Sentence Text: Means of venting each floor area to the outdoors shall be provided by windows, wall panels, smoke shafts, or the building exhaust system. (See Note A-3.2.6.6.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.6.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Means of venting each floor area to the outdoors shall be provided by windows, wall panels, smoke shafts, or the building exhaust system. (See Note A-3.2.6.6.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Fixed glass windows shall not be used for the venting required by Sentence 3.2.6.6.(1) if the breaking of the windows could endanger pedestrians below.

P/T Sentence Text: Elevator hoistways shall not be designed for the venting required by Sentence 3.2.6.6.(1).

(See Note A-3.2.6.7.(2).)

National Sentence Text: A voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.22. shall be provided in a building if the floor of the top storey is more than 36 m above grade, or a floor area or part of a floor area located above the third storey is designed or intended for use as a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy.
