P/T Sentence Text: A voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.22. shall be provided in a building if the floor of the top storey is more than 36 m above grade, or a floor area or part of a floor area located above the third storey is designed or intended for use as a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy.

National Sentence Text: The systems for control of smoke movement and mechanical venting required by Articles 3.2.6.2.and 3.2.6.6. shall be tested to ensure satisfactory operation. (See Note A-3.2.6.9.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.6.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The systems for control of smoke movement and mechanical venting required by Articles 3.2.6.2. and 3.2.6.6. shall be tested to ensure satisfactory operation. (See Note A-3.2.6.9.(1).)

National Sentence Text: An exit, a public corridor, or a corridor providing access to exit for the public or serving patients’ sleeping rooms or classrooms shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level not less than 50 lx at floor or tread level and at angles and intersections at changes of level where there are stairs or ramps.
P/T Sentence Text: An exit, a public corridor, or a corridor providing access to exit for the public or serving patients’ sleeping rooms or classrooms shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level not less than 50 lx at floor or tread level and at angles and intersections at changes of level where there are stairs or ramps.

National Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 3.2.7.1.(1) shall be not less than 10 lx.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 3.2.7.1.(1) shall be not less than 10 lx.

National Sentence Text: Rooms and spaces used by the public shall be illuminated as described in Article 9.34.2.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Rooms and spaces used by the public shall be illuminated as described in Article 9.34.2.7.

National Sentence Text: Lighting outlets in a building of residential occupancy shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 9.34.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Lighting outlets in a building of residential occupancy shall be provided in conformance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: A recessed lighting fixture shall not be located in an insulated ceiling unless the fixture is designed for this type of installation.
P/T Sentence Text: A recessed lighting fixture shall not be located in an insulated ceiling unless the fixture is designed for this type of installation.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided to an average level of illumination not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level in exits, principal routes providing access to exit in open floor areas and in service rooms, corridors used by the public, corridors serving sleeping rooms in a treatment occupancy, corridors serving sleeping rooms in a care occupancy, except corridors serving sleeping rooms within individual suites of care occupancy, corridors serving classrooms, underground walkways, public corridors, floor areas or parts thereof where the public may congregate in Group A, Division 1 occupancies, or in Group A, Division 2 and 3 occupancies having an occupant load of 60 or more, floor areas or parts thereof of daycare centres where persons are cared for, food preparation areas in commercial kitchens, and public washrooms that are equipped to serve more than one person at a time.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided to an average level of illumination not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level in exits, principal routes providing access to exit in open floor areas and in service rooms, corridors used by the public, corridors serving sleeping rooms in a treatment occupancy, corridors serving sleeping rooms in a care occupancy, except corridors serving sleeping rooms within individual suites of care occupancy, corridors serving classrooms, underground walkways, public corridors, floor areas or parts thereof where the public may congregate in Group A, Division 1 occupancies, or in Group A, Division 2 and 3 occupancies having an occupant load of 60 or more, floor areas or parts thereof of daycare centres where persons are cared for, food preparation areas in commercial kitchens, and public washrooms that are equipped to serve more than one person at a time.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting to provide an average level of illumination of not less than 10 lx at floor or catwalk level shall be included in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8).
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting to provide an average level of illumination of not less than 10 lx at floor or catwalk level shall be included in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8).

National Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentences 3.2.7.3.(1)and 3.2.7.3.(2) shall be not less than 1 lx.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentences 3.2.7.3.(1)and 3.2.7.3.(2) shall be not less than 1 lx.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Sentences 3.2.7.3.(1)to 3.2.7.3.(3), the installation of battery-operated emergency lighting in buildings or part thereof where treatment is provided shall conform to the appropriate requirements of CSA Z32-09 Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Sentences 3.2.7.3.(1) to 3.2.7.3.(3), the installation of battery-operated emergency lighting in buildings or part thereof where treatment is provided shall conform to the appropriate requirements of CSA Z32-09 Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities

National Sentence Text: An emergency power supply shall be provided to maintain the emergency lighting required by this Subsection from a power source such as batteries or generators that will continue to supply power in the event that the regular power supply to the building is interrupted, and so designed and installed that upon failure of the regular power it will assume the electrical load automatically for a period of 2 h for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building of Group B major occupancy classification that is not within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58., and 30 min for a building of any other occupancy. (See Note A-3.2.7.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: An emergency power supply shall be provided to maintain the emergency lighting required by this Subsection from a power source such as batteries or generators that will continue to supply power in the event that the regular power supply to the building is interrupted, and so designed and installed that upon failure of the regular power it will assume the electrical load automatically for a period of 2 h for a building within the scope of part 3., 1 h for a building of Group B major occupancy classification that is not within the scope of part 3., 1 h for a building constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58., and 30 min for a building of any other occupancy.

National Sentence Text: If self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: If self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Articles 3.2.7.6.and 3.2.7.7., an emergency electrical power supply system shall be installed in conformance with CSA C282-15 Emergency Electrical Power Supply for Buildings (See Sentence 3.2.7.8.(1) for emergency electrical power supply for voice communication systems.) (See Sentence 3.2.7.8.(1) for emergency electrical power supply for voice communication systems.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Articles 3.2.7.6. and 3.2.7.7., an emergency electrical power supply system shall be installed in conformance with CSA C282-15 Emergency Electrical Power Supply for Buildings (See Sentence 3.2.7.8.(1) for emergency electrical power supply for voice communication systems.)

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.2.7.7., an emergency electrical power supply system for emergency equipment required by this Part for treatment occupancies shall be installed in conformance with CSA Z32-09 Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities (See Note A-3.2.7.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.2.7.7., an emergency electrical power supply system for emergency equipment required by this Part for treatment occupancies shall be installed in conformance with CSA Z32-09 Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities (See Note A-3.2.7.6.(1).)

National Sentence Text: If a liquid or gas fuel-fired engine or turbine for an emergency electric power supply is dependent on a fuel supply from outside the building, the fuel supply shall be provided with a suitably-identified separate shut-off valve outside the building.
P/T Sentence Text: If a liquid or gas fuel-fired engine or turbine for an emergency electric power supply is dependent on a fuel supply from outside the building, the fuel supply shall be provided with a suitably-identified separate shut-off valve outside the building.

National Sentence Text: Fire alarm systems, including those incorporating a voice communication system, shall be provided with an emergency power supply conforming to Sentences 3.2.7.8.(2), 3.2.7.8.(3)and 3.2.7.8.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Fire alarm systems, including those incorporating a voice communication system, shall be provided with an emergency power supply conforming to Sentences 3.2.7.8.(2), 3.2.7.8.(3) and 3.2.7.8.(4).

National Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8.(1) shall be supplied from a generator, batteries, or a combination thereof.
P/T Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8.(1) shall be supplied from a generator, batteries, or a combination thereof.

National Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8.(1) shall be capable of providing supervisory power for not less than 24 h, and immediately following that period, emergency power under full load for not less than 2 h for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building classified as a Group B major occupancy that is not within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58., 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 30 min for any other building. (See Note A-3.2.7.8.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8.(1) shall be capable of providing supervisory power for not less than 24 h, and immediately following that period, emergency power under full load for not less than 2 h for a building within the scope of part 3., 1 h for a building classified as a Group B major occupancy that is not within the scope of part 3., 1 h for a building constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58., 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 30 min for any other building.

National Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8.(1) shall be designed so that, in the event of a failure of the normal power source, there is an immediate automatic transfer to emergency power with no loss of information.
P/T Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8.(1) shall be designed so that, in the event of a failure of the normal power source, there is an immediate automatic transfer to emergency power with no loss of information.

National Sentence Text: An emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for not less than 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator for every elevator serving storeys above the first storey in a building that is more than 36 m high measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey and every elevator for firefighters in conformance with Sentence 3.2.7.9.(2), water supply for firefighting in conformance with Article 3.2.5.7., if the supply is dependent on electrical power supplied to the building, fans and other electrical equipment that are installed to maintain the air quality specified in Articles 3.2.6.2.and 3.3.3.6., fans required for venting by Article 3.2.6.6., and fans required by Clause 3.2.8.4.(1)(c) and Article 3.2.8.7. in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. (See Note A-3.2.7.9.(1).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): An emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for not less than 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator for every elevator in a building required to conform to Subsection 3.2.6., assuming that only one elevator will operate at one time, water supply for firefighting in conformance with Article 3.2.5.7., if the supply is dependent on electrical power supplied to the building, fans and other electrical equipment that are installed to maintain the air quality specified in Articles 3.2.6.2. , 3.3.3.6. and 3.3.3.7. , fans required for venting by Article 3.2.6.6., and fans required by Clause 3.2.8.4.(1)(c) and Article 3.2.8.7. in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. (See Note A-3.2.7.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: An emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for not less than 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator for every elevator in a building required to conform to part 3., assuming that only one elevator will operate at one time, water supply for firefighting in conformance with Article 3.2.5.7., if the supply is dependent on electrical power supplied to the building, fans and other electrical equipment that are installed to maintain the air quality specified in Articles 3.2.6.2. , 3.3.3.6. and 3.3.3.7. , fans required for venting by Article 3.2.6.6., and fans required by Sentence 3.2.8.4.(1) and Article 3.2.8.7. in buildings within the scope of part 3.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): An emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for not less than 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator for every elevator in a building required to conform to Subsection 3.2.6., assuming that only one elevator will operate at one time, water supply for firefighting in conformance with Article 3.2.5.7., if the supply is dependent on electrical power supplied to the building, fans and other electrical equipment that are installed to maintain the air quality specified in Articles 3.2.6.2. , 3.3.3.6. and 3.3.3.7. , fans required for venting by Article 3.2.6.6., and fans required by Clause 3.2.8.4.(1)(c) and Article 3.2.8.7. in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. (See Note A-3.2.7.9.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.7.9.(3), the emergency power supply for elevators required by Clause 3.2.7.9.(1)(a) shall be capable of operating all elevators for firefighters plus one additional elevator simultaneously.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.7.9.(3), the emergency power supply for elevators required by Clause 3.2.7.9.(1)(a) shall be capable of operating all elevators for firefighters plus one additional elevator simultaneously.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel supply storage for a generator prime mover shall be provided on site and shall be independent of fuel supplies for other building services.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Fuel supply storage for a generator prime mover shall be provided on site and shall be independent of fuel supplies for other building services.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.2.7.9.(2) does not apply if the time to recall all elevators under emergency power supply is not more than 5 min, each from its most remote storey to the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4.and 3.2.5.5., or to a transfer lobby.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Sentence 3.2.7.9.(2) does not apply if the time to recall all elevators under emergency power supply is not more than 5 min, each from its most remote storey to the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5., or to a transfer lobby.

National Sentence Text: The protection of electrical and emergency conductors referred to in Clauses 3.2.7.10.(1)(a)to 3.2.7.10.(1)(c) shall conform to the requirements stated in Sentences 3.2.7.10.(2)to 3.2.7.10.(11): electrical conductors located within buildings identified in Article 3.2.6.1. serving fire alarms, emergency lighting, or emergency equipment within the scope of Articles 3.2.6.2.to 3.2.6.8., emergency conductors serving fire pumps required to be installed under Article 3.2.5.18., and electrical conductors serving mechanical systems serving areas of refuge identified in Clause 3.3.3.6.(1)(b), or contained use areas identified in Clauses 3.3.3.7.(4)(a)and 3.3.3.7.(4)(b).
P/T Sentence Text: The protection of electrical and emergency conductors referred to in Clauses 3.2.7.10.(1)to 3.2.7.10.(1) shall conform to the requirements stated in Sentences 3.2.7.10.(2)to 3.2.7.10.(11): electrical conductors located within buildings identified in Article 3.2.6.1. serving fire alarms, emergency lighting, or emergency equipment within the scope of Articles 3.2.6.2. to 3.2.6.8., emergency conductors serving fire pumps required to be installed under Article 3.2.5.18., and electrical conductors serving mechanical systems serving areas of refuge identified in Sentence 3.3.3.6.(1), or contained use areas identified in Clauses 3.3.3.7.(4) and 3.3.3.7.(4).

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by Sentence 3.2.7.10.(3) and permitted by this Article, electrical conductors that are used in conjunction with systems identified in Sentence 3.2.7.10.(1) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S139-12 Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 1 h(see Note A-3.2.7.10.(2)(a) and (3)(a)), or be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by Sentence 3.2.7.10.(3) and permitted by this Article, electrical conductors that are used in conjunction with systems identified in Sentence 3.2.7.10.(1) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S139-12 Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 1 h(see Note A-3.2.7.10.(2)(a)), or be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Electrical conductors identified in Clause 3.2.7.10.(1)(c) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S139-12 Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 2 h(see Note A-3.2.7.10.(2)(a) and (3)(a)), or be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical conductors identified in Sentence 3.2.7.10.(1) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S139-12 Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 2 h(see Note A-3.2.7.10.(2)(a)), or be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: The service spaces referred to in Clauses 3.2.7.10.(2)(b)and 3.2.7.10.(3)(b) shall not contain any combustible materials other than the conductors being protected.
P/T Sentence Text: The service spaces referred to in Clauses 3.2.7.10.(2)and 3.2.7.10.(3) shall not contain any combustible materials other than the conductors being protected.

National Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentences 3.2.7.10.(7)and 3.2.7.10.(9), the electrical conductors referred to in Sentence 3.2.7.10.(1) are those that extend from the source of emergency power to the equipment served, or the distribution equipment supplying power to the equipment served, if both are in the same room (see Note A-3.2.7.10.(5)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentences 3.2.7.10.(7) and 3.2.7.10.(9), the electrical conductors referred to in Sentence 3.2.7.10.(1) are those that extend from the source of emergency power to the equipment served, or the distribution equipment supplying power to the equipment served, if both are in the same room (see Note A-3.2.7.10.(5)(b)).

National Sentence Text: If a fire alarm transponder or annunciator in one fire compartment is connected to a central processing unit or another transponder or annunciator located in a different fire compartment, the electrical conductors connecting them shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire alarm transponder or annunciator in one fire compartment is connected to a central processing unit or another transponder or annunciator located in a different fire compartment, the electrical conductors connecting them shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2).

National Sentence Text: Fire alarm system branch circuits within a storey that connect transponders and individual devices need not conform to Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2). (See Note A-3.2.7.10.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: Fire alarm system branch circuits within a storey that connect transponders and individual devices need not conform to Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2). (See Note A-3.2.7.10.(7).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.7.10.(9), if a distribution panel supplies power to emergency lighting, the power supply conductors leading up to the distribution panel shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.7.10.(9), if a distribution panel supplies power to emergency lighting, the power supply conductors leading up to the distribution panel shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2).

National Sentence Text: Conductors leading from a distribution panel referred to in Sentence 3.2.7.10.(8) to emergency lighting units in the same storey need not conform to Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Conductors leading from a distribution panel referred to in Sentence 3.2.7.10.(8) to emergency lighting units in the same storey need not conform to Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2).

National Sentence Text: Distribution panels serving emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be installed in a service room separated from the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Distribution panels serving emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be installed in a service room separated from the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Conductors leading from a distribution panel to emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2) between the distribution panel and the floor area where the emergency lighting units are located.
P/T Sentence Text: Conductors leading from a distribution panel to emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2) between the distribution panel and the floor area where the emergency lighting units are located.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.8.2. and Sentence 3.3.4.2.(3), the portions of a floor area or a mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly and extending from the floor assembly to the underside of the floor or roof assembly above, or be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.8.2. and Sentence 3.3.4.2.(3), the portions of a floor area or a mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly and extending from the floor assembly to the underside of the floor or roof assembly above, or be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8.

National Sentence Text: The penetration of a floor assembly by an exit or a vertical service space shall conform to the requirements of Sections 3.4., 3.5.and 3.6.
P/T Sentence Text: The penetration of a floor assembly by an exit or a vertical service space shall conform to the requirements of Sections 3. , 3.and 3.

National Sentence Text: A floor area containing sleeping rooms in a building of Group B, Division 2 major occupancy shall not be constructed as part of an interconnected floor space.
P/T Sentence Text: A floor area containing sleeping rooms in a building of Group B, Division 2 major occupancy shall not be constructed as part of an interconnected floor space.

National Sentence Text: A mezzanine need not terminate at a vertical fire separation nor be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8. provided the mezzanine serves a Group A, Division 1 major occupancy, serves a Group A, Division 3 major occupancy in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height, or serves a Group A, C, D, E or F major occupancy and is 500 m2 or less in area, and conforms to Sentence 3.2.1.1.(3)or 3.2.1.1.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: A mezzanine need not terminate at a vertical fire separation nor be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.8. provided the mezzanine serves a Group A, Division 1 major occupancy, serves a Group A, Division 3 major occupancy in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height, or serves a Group A, C, D, E or F major occupancy and is 500 m2 or less in area, and conforms to Sentence 3.2.1.1.(3)or 3.2.1.1.(4).

National Sentence Text: Except for floors referred to in Sentence 3.1.10.3.(1) and Article 3.2.1.2., openings through a horizontal fire separation for vehicular ramps in a storage garage are not required to be protected with closures and need not conform to this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for floors referred to in Sentence 3.1.10.3.(1) and Article 3.2.1.2., openings through a horizontal fire separation for vehicular ramps in a storage garage are not required to be protected with closures and need not conform to this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: If a closure in an opening in a fire separation would disrupt the nature of a manufacturing process, such as a continuous flow of material from storey to storey, the closure for the opening is permitted to be omitted provided precautions are taken to offset the resulting hazard. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(3).) (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a closure in an opening in a fire separation would disrupt the nature of a manufacturing process, such as a continuous flow of material from storey to storey, the closure for the opening is permitted to be omitted provided precautions are taken to offset the resulting hazard. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(3).)

National Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space in a Group B, Division 1 occupancy need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8. provided the interconnected floor space does not interconnect more than 2 adjacent storeys.
P/T Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space in a Group B, Division 1 occupancy need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8. provided the interconnected floor space does not interconnect more than 2 adjacent storeys.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.8.2.(6), openings for escalators and inclined moving walks need not conform to the requirements in Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8. provided the opening for each escalator or walk does not exceed 10 m2, the building is sprinklered throughout, and the interconnected floor space contains only Group A, Division 1, 2 or 3, Group D or Group E major occupancies (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(6)(c)).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.8.2.(6), openings for escalators and inclined moving walks need not conform to the requirements in Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.8. provided the opening for each escalator or walk does not exceed 10 m2, the building is sprinklered throughout, and the interconnected floor space contains only Group A, Division 1, 2 or 3, Group D or Group E major occupancies (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(6)(c)).

National Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8., provided it consists of the first storey and the storey next above or below it, but not both, it is sprinklered throughout or, where the building area is not more than one half of the area permitted by Subsection 3.2.2., the openings through the floor are used only for stairways, escalators or moving walks (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(6)(b)), and it contains only Group A, Division 1, 2 or 3, Group D, Group E, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancies (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(6)(c)).
P/T Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.8., provided it consists of the first storey and the storey next above or below it, but not both, it is sprinklered throughout or, where the building area is not more than one half of the area permitted by part 3., the openings through the floor are used only for stairways, escalators or moving walks (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(6)(b)), and it contains only Group A, Division 1, 2 or 3, Group D, Group E, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancies (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(6)(c)).

National Sentence Text: A building containing an interconnected floor space shall be sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: A building containing an interconnected floor space shall be sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: An exit opening into an interconnected floor space shall be protected at each opening into the interconnected floor space by a vestibule with doorways that are not less than 1.8 m apart, that is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation that is not required to have a fire-resistance rating (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b)), and (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b)) that is designed to limit the passage of smoke so that the exit stair shaft does not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in accordance with Subsection 1.1.3. (see Note A-3.2.8.4.(1)(c)).
P/T Sentence Text: An exit opening into an interconnected floor space shall be protected at each opening into the interconnected floor space by a vestibule with doorways that are not less than 1.8 m apart, that is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation that is not required to have a fire-resistance rating (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b)), and that is designed to limit the passage of smoke so that the exit stair shaft does not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in accordance with part 1. (see Note A-3.2.8.4.(1)(c)).

National Sentence Text: An exit opening into an interconnected floor space shall conform to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: An exit opening into an interconnected floor space shall conform to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6).

National Sentence Text: If an elevator hoistway opens into an interconnected floor space and into storeys above the interconnected floor space, either the elevator doors opening into the interconnected floor space or the elevator doors opening into the storeys above the interconnected floor space shall be protected by vestibules conforming to Sentence 3.2.8.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: If an elevator hoistway opens into an interconnected floor space and into storeys above the interconnected floor space, either the elevator doors opening into the interconnected floor space or the elevator doors opening into the storeys above the interconnected floor space shall be protected by vestibules conforming to Sentence 3.2.8.4.(1).

National Sentence Text: A protected floor space used to satisfy the requirements of Clause 3.4.3.2.(6)(b) shall be separated from the interconnected floor space by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly of the storey in which it is located, have all openings in the vertical fire separation between a protected floor space and the adjacent interconnected floor space protected by vestibules conforming to Sentence 3.2.8.4.(1), and be designed so that it is not necessary to enter the interconnected floor space to reach an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: A protected floor space used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6) shall be separated from the interconnected floor space by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly of the storey in which it is located, have all openings in the vertical fire separation between a protected floor space and the adjacent interconnected floor space protected by vestibules conforming to Sentence 3.2.8.4.(1), and be designed so that it is not necessary to enter the interconnected floor space to reach an exit.

National Sentence Text: A draft stop shall be provided at each floor level within an interconnected floor space, immediately adjacent to and surrounding the opening, and shall be not less than 500 mm deep measured from ceiling level down to the underside of the draft stop.
P/T Sentence Text: A draft stop shall be provided at each floor level within an interconnected floor space, immediately adjacent to and surrounding the opening, and shall be not less than 500 mm deep measured from ceiling level down to the underside of the draft stop.

National Sentence Text: A mechanical exhaust system shall be provided to remove air from an interconnected floor space at a rate of 4 air changes per hour. (See Note A-3.2.8.7.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.8.7.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A mechanical exhaust system shall be provided to remove air from an interconnected floor space at a rate of 4 air changes per hour. (See Note A-3.2.8.7.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The mechanical exhaust system required by Sentence 3.2.8.7.(1) shall be actuated by a switch located on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4.and 3.2.5.5. near the annunciator for the fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: The mechanical exhaust system required by Sentence 3.2.8.7.(1) shall be actuated by a switch located on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. near the annunciator for the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space shall be designed so that the combustible contents, excluding interior finishes, in those parts of a floor area in which the ceiling is more than 8 m above the floor, are limited to not more than 16 g of combustible material for each cubic metre of volume of the interconnected floor space.
P/T Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space shall be designed so that the combustible contents, excluding interior finishes, in those parts of a floor area in which the ceiling is more than 8 m above the floor, are limited to not more than 16 g of combustible material for each cubic metre of volume of the interconnected floor space.

National Sentence Text: Where fire protection and life safety systems and systems with fire protection and life safety functions are integrated with each other, they shall be tested as a whole in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S1001-11 Integrated Systems Testing of Fire Protection and Life Safety Systems to verify that they have been properly integrated. (See Note A-3.2.9.1.(1).) (See Note A-3.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where fire protection and life safety systems and systems with fire protection and life safety functions are integrated with each other, they shall be tested as a whole in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S1001-11 Integrated Systems Testing of Fire Protection and Life Safety Systems to verify that they have been properly integrated. (See Note A-3.2.9.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.1.(2)and 3.3.1.1.(3), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h. (See also Subsection 3.3.3. for care, treatment or detention occupancies, Article 3.3.4.2. for residential occupancies, and Article 3.1.8.7. for fire dampers.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.1.(2) and 3.3.1.1.(3), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h. (See also part 3. for care, treatment or detention occupancies, Article 3.3.4.2. for residential occupancies, and Article 3.1.8.7. for fire dampers.)

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.1.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.1.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Occupancies that are served by public corridors conforming to Clause 3.3.1.4.(4)(b) in a building that is sprinklered throughout, are not required to be separated from one another by fire separations provided the occupancies are suites of business and personal services occupancy, fast food vending operations that do not provide seating for customers, suites of mercantile occupancy, or any combination of these occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Occupancies that are served by public corridors conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.4.(4) in a building that is sprinklered throughout, are not required to be separated from one another by fire separations provided the occupancies are suites of business and personal services occupancy, fast food vending operations that do not provide seating for customers, suites of mercantile occupancy, or any combination of these occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsections 3.3.5.and 3.3.6., the storage, handling and use of hazardous substances shall be in conformance with provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause 3.3.1.2.(1)(a), the NFC. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsections 3. and 3., the storage, handling and use of hazardous substances shall be in conformance with the NFC(AE). (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Subsections 3.3.5. and 3.3.6., the storage, handling and use of hazardous substances shall be in conformance with the NFC(AE). (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Systems for the ventilation of cooking equipment that is not within a dwelling unit and is used in processes producing grease-laden vapours shall be designed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.6.3.5., 6.3.1.7.and 6.9.1.3. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Systems for the ventilation of cooking equipment that is not within a dwelling unit and is used in processes producing grease-laden vapours shall be designed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.6.3.5. , 6.3.1.7.and 6.9.1.3. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: A fuel-fired appliance shall not be installed in a corridor serving as an access to exit.
P/T Sentence Text: A fuel-fired appliance shall not be installed in a corridor serving as an access to exit.

National Sentence Text: Access to exit within floor areas shall conform to Subsections 3.3.2.to 3.3.5., in addition to the requirements of this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Access to exit within floor areas shall conform to Subsections 3. to 3., in addition to the requirements of this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: If a podium, terrace, platform or contained open space is provided, egress requirements shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1) for rooms and suites.
P/T Sentence Text: If a podium, terrace, platform or contained open space is provided, egress requirements shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1) for rooms and suites.

National Sentence Text: Means of egress shall be provided from every roof which is intended for occupancy, and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.
P/T Sentence Text: Means of egress shall be provided from every roof which is intended for occupancy, and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.

National Sentence Text: At least two separate means of egress shall be provided from a roof, used or intended for an occupant load more than 60, to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements regarding exit stairs stated in Section 3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: At least two separate means of egress shall be provided from a roof, used or intended for an occupant load more than 60, to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements regarding exit stairs stated in part 3.

National Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure shall be provided with an access to exit that leads to an exit at the roof level, or on the storey immediately below the roof.
P/T Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure shall be provided with an access to exit that leads to an exit at the roof level, or on the storey immediately below the roof.

National Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure which is more than 200 m2 in area shall be provided with at least 2 means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure which is more than 200 m2 in area shall be provided with at least 2 means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Two points of egress shall be provided for a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8) if the area is more than 200 m2, or the travel distance measured from any point in the service space to a point of egress is more than 25 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Two points of egress shall be provided for a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8) if the area is more than 200 m2 , or the travel distance measured from any point in the service space to a point of egress is more than 25 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.4.(5)and 3.3.4.4.(6), each suite in a floor area that contains more than one suite shall have an exterior exit doorway, or a doorway into a public corridor, or to an exterior passageway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.4.(5) and 3.3.4.4.(6), each suite in a floor area that contains more than one suite shall have an exterior exit doorway, or a doorway into a public corridor, or to an exterior passageway.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.3.(8) opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.3.(8) opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.
No access to exit for patrons in an assembly occupancy shall pass through a kitchen, service space or storage room.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): No access to exit for patrons in an assembly occupancy shall pass through a kitchen, service space or storage room.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by this Part or as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.4.(4), a public corridor shall be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by this Part or as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.4.(4), a public corridor shall be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.4.(3) and Clauses 3.3.1.4.(4)(a)and 3.3.1.4.(4)(b), the fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.4.(3) and Clauses 3.3.1.4.(4) and 3.3.1.4.(4), the fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: If a storey is sprinklered throughout, no fire-resistance rating is required for a fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey, provided the corridor does not serve a care, treatment or detention occupancy or a residential occupancy. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a storey is sprinklered throughout, no fire-resistance rating is required for a fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey, provided the corridor does not serve a care, treatment or detention occupancy or a residential occupancy. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)

National Sentence Text: No fire separation is required in a sprinkleredfloor area between a public corridor and except as required by Sentences 3.3.3.5.(8)and 3.3.4.2.(1), and notwithstanding Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2), the remainder of a storey, provided the travel distance from any part of the floor area to an exit is not more than 45 m, a room or a suite, provided the public corridor complies with Sentence 3.3.1.9.(6) and Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d), or a space containing plumbing fixtures required by Subsection 3.7.2., provided the space and the public corridor are separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required between the public corridor and the remainder of the storey.
P/T Sentence Text: No fire separation is required in a sprinkleredfloor area between a public corridor and except as required by Sentences 3.3.3.5.(8) and 3.3.4.2.(1), and notwithstanding Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2), the remainder of a storey, provided the travel distance from any part of the floor area to an exit is not more than 45 m, a room or a suite, provided the public corridor complies with Sentence 3.3.1.9.(6) and Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1), or a space containing plumbing fixtures required by part 3., provided the space and the public corridor are separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required between the public corridor and the remainder of the storey.

National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, a minimum of 2 egress doorways located so that one doorway could provide egress from the room or suite as required by Article 3.3.1.3. if the other doorway becomes inaccessible to the occupants due to a fire which originates in the room or suite, shall be provided for every room and every suite that is used for a high-hazard industrial occupancy and whose area is more than 15 m2, intended for an occupant load more than 60, in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, and the area of a room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-A, or the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-A, or in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout and does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy and the travel distance to an egress doorway is more than 25 m, or the area of the room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, a minimum of 2 egress doorways located so that one doorway could provide egress from the room or suite as required by Article 3.3.1.3. if the other doorway becomes inaccessible to the occupants due to a fire which originates in the room or suite, shall be provided for every room and every suite that is used for a high-hazard industrial occupancy and whose area is more than 15 m2 , intended for an occupant load more than 60, in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, and the area of a room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-A, or the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-A, or in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout and does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy and the travel distance to an egress doorway is more than 25 m, or the area of the room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-B.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 egress doorways are required by Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1), they shall be placed at a distance from one another equal to or greater than one third of the maximum overall diagonal dimension of the area to be served, measured as the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the nearest required egress doors.
P/T Sentence Text: Where 2 egress doorways are required by Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1), they shall be placed at a distance from one another equal to or greater than one third of the maximum overall diagonal dimension of the area to be served, measured as the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the nearest required egress doors.

National Sentence Text: If more than one egress doorway is required from a room or suite referred to in Article 3.3.1.5., the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway shall not exceed the maximum travel distances specified in Clauses 3.4.2.5.(1)(a), 3.4.2.5.(1)(b), 3.4.2.5.(1)(c)and 3.4.2.5.(1)(f) for exits.
P/T Sentence Text: If more than one egress doorway is required from a room or suite referred to in Article 3.3.1.5., the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway shall not exceed the maximum travel distances specified in Clauses 3.4.2.5.(1) , 3.4.2.5.(1), 3.4.2.5.(1)and 3.4.2.5.(1) for exits.

National Sentence Text: Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall be served by an elevator conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5.(4)to 3.2.6.5.(6), protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(3)(b)or 3.2.6.5.(3)(c), and in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3., be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences 3.3.1.7.(2), 3.3.1.7.(3)and 3.1.8.5.(6) so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b)) persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) for the occupancy classification of the zone, in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.7.(4), except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2., have an exterior exit at ground level, or have a ramp leading to ground level. (See Note A-3.3.1.7.(1).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall be served by an elevator conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5.(6) to 3.2.6.5.(8), protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(5) or 3.2.6.5.(5), and in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3., be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences 3.3.1.7.(2), 3.3.1.7.(3) and 3.1.8.5.(6) so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b)) persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) for the occupancy classification of the zone, in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.7.(4), except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2., have an exterior exit at ground level, or have a ramp leading to ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall be served by an elevator conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5.(6) to 3.2.6.5.(8), protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(5)or 3.2.6.5.(5), and in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with part 1., be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences 3.3.1.7.(2) , 3.3.1.7.(3)and 3.1.8.5.(6) so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b)) persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) for the occupancy classification of the zone, in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.7.(4), except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2., have an exterior exit at ground level, or have a ramp leading to ground level.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall be served by an elevator conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5.(6) to 3.2.6.5.(8), protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(5) or 3.2.6.5.(5), and in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3., be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences 3.3.1.7.(2), 3.3.1.7.(3) and 3.1.8.5.(6) so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b)) persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) for the occupancy classification of the zone, in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.7.(4), except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2., have an exterior exit at ground level, or have a ramp leading to ground level.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.7.(3), the fire separations referred to in Clause 3.3.1.7.(1)(b) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.7.(3), the fire separations referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.7.(1) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separations referred to in Clause 3.3.1.7.(1)(b) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separations referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.7.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: A balcony required by Clause 3.3.1.7.(1)(c) shall have direct barrier-free access from the suite or floor area be not less than 1.5 m deep from the outside face of the exterior wall to the inside edge of the balcony, and provide not less than 1.5 m2 of balcony space for each non-ambulatory occupant and 0.5 m2 for each ambulatory occupant.
P/T Sentence Text: A balcony required by Sentence 3.3.1.7.(1) shall have direct barrier-free access from the suite or floor area be not less than 1.5 m deep from the outside face of the exterior wall to the inside edge of the balcony, and provide not less than 1.5 m2 of balcony space for each non-ambulatory occupant and 0.5 m2 for each ambulatory occupant.

National Sentence Text: Except within the floor area of a storage garage, the minimum headroom clearance in every access to exit shall conform to the requirements of Article 3.4.3.4. for exits. (See also Sentence 3.3.5.4.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except within the floor area of a storage garage, the minimum headroom clearance in every access to exit shall conform to the requirements of Article 3.4.3.4. for exits. (See also Sentence 3.3.5.4.(5).)

National Sentence Text: The minimum width of a public corridor shall be 1 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum width of a public corridor shall be 1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.3.3.3.(3), the minimum unobstructed width of a corridor used by the public or a corridor serving classrooms or patients’ sleeping rooms shall be 1 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.3.3.3.(3), the minimum unobstructed width of a corridor used by the public or a corridor serving classrooms or patients’ sleeping rooms shall be 1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.9.(4), obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project more than 100 mm horizontally into an exit passageway, a public corridor, a corridor used by the public or a corridor serving classrooms or patients’ sleeping rooms in a manner that would create a hazard for a person with a visual disability traveling adjacent to the walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.9.(4), obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project more than 100 mm horizontally into an exit passageway, a public corridor, a corridor used by the public or a corridor serving classrooms or patients’ sleeping rooms in a manner that would create a hazard for a person with a visual disability traveling adjacent to the walls.

National Sentence Text: The horizontal projection of an obstruction referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.9.(3) is permitted to be more than 100 mm provided the clearance between the obstruction and the floor is less than 680 mm. (See Note A-3.3.1.9.(4).) (See Note A-3.3.1.9.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal projection of an obstruction referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.9.(3) is permitted to be more than 100 mm provided the clearance between the obstruction and the floor is less than 680 mm. (See Note A-3.3.1.9.(4).)

National Sentence Text: If a corridor contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall not reduce the unobstructed width of the corridor to less than its required width.
P/T Sentence Text: If a corridor contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall not reduce the unobstructed width of the corridor to less than its required width.

National Sentence Text: If a public corridor conforming to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d) contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall be located so that for pedestrian travel there is an unobstructed width not less than 3 m at all times adjacent and parallel to all rooms and suites that front onto the public corridor, and the combined area of all occupancies in the public corridor shall be not more than 15% of the area of the public corridor.
P/T Sentence Text: If a public corridor conforming to Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall be located so that for pedestrian travel there is an unobstructed width not less than 3 m at all times adjacent and parallel to all rooms and suites that front onto the public corridor, and the combined area of all occupancies in the public corridor shall be not more than 15% of the area of the public corridor.

National Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite or as permitted by Sentences 3.3.3.3.(1)and 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite or as permitted by Sentences 3.3.3.3.(1) and 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, aisles shall be provided in conformance with the NFC.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as otherwise stated in this Section, aisles shall be provided in conformance with the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, aisles shall be provided in conformance with the NFC(AE).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as otherwise stated in this Section, aisles shall be provided in conformance with the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.11.(5) and Article 3.3.1.12., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a suite or room not located within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.11.(5) and Article 3.3.1.12., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a suite or room not located within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.3.1.12., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a room or suite that is used or intended for an occupant load more than 60 or for a high-hazard industrial occupancy shall swing in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.3.1.12., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a room or suite that is used or intended for an occupant load more than 60 or for a high-hazard industrial occupancy shall swing in the direction of travel to the exit.

National Sentence Text: Every door that divides a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Every door that divides a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit.

National Sentence Text: If a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: If a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of travel to the exit.

National Sentence Text: Doors that serve storage suites not more than 28 m2 in area in warehousing buildings need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.11.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Doors that serve storage suites not more than 28 m2 in area in warehousing buildings need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.11.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.12.(2)and 3.3.1.11.(5), a sliding door provided in the locations described in Article 3.3.1.11. shall be designed and installed to swing on the vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit when pressure is applied, and be identified as a swinging door by means of a label or decal affixed to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.12.(2) and 3.3.1.11.(5), a sliding door provided in the locations described in Article 3.3.1.11. shall be designed and installed to swing on the vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit when pressure is applied, and be identified as a swinging door by means of a label or decal affixed to it.

National Sentence Text: In a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or in an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, sliding doors used in an access to exit need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1) and Article 3.3.1.11.
P/T Sentence Text: In a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or in an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, sliding doors used in an access to exit need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1) and Article 3.3.1.11.

National Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1) and Sentences 3.3.1.11.(1)and 3.3.1.11.(2), provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.12.(3).) (See Note A-3.3.1.12.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1) and Sentences 3.3.1.11.(1)and 3.3.1.11.(2), provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.12.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.3.3.4., a door that opens into or is located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite shall provide a clear opening of not less than 800 mm if there is only one door leaf, in a doorway with multiple leaves, have the active leaf providing a clear opening of not less than 800 mm, not open onto a step, and have a threshold not more than 13 mm higher than the surrounding finished floor surface, except where it is used to confine the spillage of flammable liquids within a service room or within a room in an industrial occupancy, or provides access to an exterior balcony, unless the balcony is required by Clause 3.3.1.7.(1)(c).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.3.3.4., a door that opens into or is located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite shall provide a clear opening of not less than 800 mm if there is only one door leaf, in a doorway with multiple leaves, have the active leaf providing a clear opening of not less than 800 mm, not open onto a step, and have a threshold not more than 13 mm higher than the surrounding finished floor surface, except where it is used to confine the spillage of flammable liquids within a service room or within a room in an industrial occupancy, or provides access to an exterior balcony, unless the balcony is required by Sentence 3.3.1.7.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.1.13.(6)and 3.3.1.13.(7), a door in an access to exit shall be readily openable in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.1.13.(6) and 3.3.1.13.(7), a door in an access to exit shall be readily openable in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(4), door release hardware shall comply with Clause 3.8.3.8.(1)(b) and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation. (See also Sentence 3.8.3.6.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(4), door release hardware shall comply with Sentence 3.8.3.8.(1) and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation. (See also Sentence 3.8.3.6.(4).)

National Sentence Text: An egress door from an individual dwelling unit or from a suite of residential occupancy is permitted to be provided with additional devices that require a releasing operation additional to the main door release hardware, provided the devices are readily operable from the inside without the use of keys, special devices or specialized knowledge. (See Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).) (See Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: An egress door from an individual dwelling unit or from a suite of residential occupancy is permitted to be provided with additional devices that require a releasing operation additional to the main door release hardware, provided the devices are readily operable from the inside without the use of keys, special devices or specialized knowledge. (See Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Door release hardware shall be installed not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Door release hardware shall be installed not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.

National Sentence Text: An egress door in an access to exit serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone is permitted to be equipped with locking devices, provided they can be released either locally or remotely in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.13.(8)or 3.3.1.13.(9). (See Note A-3.3.1.13.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: An egress door in an access to exit serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone is permitted to be equipped with locking devices, provided they can be released either locally or remotely in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.13.(8) or 3.3.1.13.(9). (See Note A-3.3.1.13.(6).)

National Sentence Text: A door in an access to exit is permitted to be equipped with an electromagnetic lock conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4)or 3.4.6.16.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: A door in an access to exit is permitted to be equipped with an electromagnetic lock conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4) or 3.4.6.16.(5).

National Sentence Text: Local locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6) shall be operable by a key from both sides of the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Local locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6) shall be operable by a key from both sides of the door.

National Sentence Text: Controls for the remote release of door locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6) shall be located in an area readily available to security personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: Controls for the remote release of door locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6) shall be located in an area readily available to security personnel.

National Sentence Text: Locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6) that are electrically operated shall be designed to operate on emergency power, and capable of manual release by security personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: Locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6) that are electrically operated shall be designed to operate on emergency power, and capable of manual release by security personnel.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.14.(2), Article 3.3.4.7. and Subsection 3.3.2., ramps and stairways that do not serve as exits shall conform to the requirements for exit ramps and stairways stated in Sentence 3.4.3.2.(8) and Articles 3.4.3.4., and 3.4.6.1.to 3.4.6.9.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.14.(2), Article 3.3.4.7. and part 3., ramps and stairways that do not serve as exits shall conform to the requirements for exit ramps and stairways stated in Sentence 3.4.3.2.(8) and Articles 3.4.3.4., and 3.4.6.1. to 3.4.6.9.

National Sentence Text: Ramps and stairways that serve service rooms, service spaces or industrial occupancies need not comply with Sentence 3.3.1.14.(1), provided they are intended only for occasional use for servicing equipment and machinery, and they do not serve as exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Ramps and stairways that serve service rooms, service spaces or industrial occupancies need not comply with Sentence 3.3.1.14.(1), provided they are intended only for occasional use for servicing equipment and machinery, and they do not serve as exits.

National Sentence Text: An exterior passageway leading to a required exit shall conform to the requirements of Section 3.4. for exterior exit passageways.
P/T Sentence Text: An exterior passageway leading to a required exit shall conform to the requirements of part 3. for exterior exit passageways.

National Sentence Text: Flights of stairs shall consist solely of straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence 3.3.1.16.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Flights of stairs shall consist solely of straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence 3.3.1.16.(2).

National Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a curved flight that is not required as an exit shall have a minimum run of 150 mm, a run not less than 280 mm when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread, and a riser conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.8.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a curved flight that is not required as an exit shall have a minimum run of 150 mm, a run not less than 280 mm when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread, and a riser conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.8.(2).

National Sentence Text: Tapered treads shall have a consistent angle and uniform run and rise dimensions in accordance with the construction tolerances stipulated in Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread.
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads shall have a consistent angle and uniform run and rise dimensions in accordance with the construction tolerances stipulated in Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread.

National Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction. (See Article 3.3.1.9. for minimum widths of corridors.)
P/T Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.

National Sentence Text: The capacity of an access to exit shall be based on the occupant load of the portion of the floor area served.
P/T Sentence Text: The capacity of an access to exit shall be based on the occupant load of the portion of the floor area served.

National Sentence Text: In an access to exit the required width of ramps with a slope not more than 1 in 8, doorways, and corridors shall be based on not less than 6.1 mm per person.
P/T Sentence Text: In an access to exit the required width of ramps with a slope not more than 1 in 8, doorways, and corridors shall be based on not less than 6.1 mm per person.

National Sentence Text: In an access to exit the required width of a ramp with a slope more than 1 in 8 shall be based on not less than 9.2 mm per person.
P/T Sentence Text: In an access to exit the required width of a ramp with a slope more than 1 in 8 shall be based on not less than 9.2 mm per person.

National Sentence Text: In an access to exit from a floor area used or intended to be used for patients in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy or residents in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy, the required width of corridors, doorways, and ramps shall be based on not less than 18.4 mm per person.
P/T Sentence Text: In an access to exit from a floor area used or intended to be used for patients in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy or residents in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy, the required width of corridors, doorways, and ramps shall be based on not less than 18.4 mm per person.

National Sentence Text: The capacity of stairs in an access to exit shall conform to the requirements for stairs in Sentences 3.4.3.2.(1)to 3.4.3.2.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: The capacity of stairs in an access to exit shall conform to the requirements for stairs in Sentences 3.4.3.2.(1)to 3.4.3.2.(3).

National Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered throughout in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.12.(1), an access to exit that is part of the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one half of the required exit width.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered throughout in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.12.(1), an access to exit that is part of the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one half of the required exit width.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.18.(5) and Article 3.3.2.9., a guard not less than 1 070 mm high shall be provided around any roof to which access is provided for purposes other than maintenance, at openings into smoke shafts referred to in Subsection 3.2.6. that are less than 1 070 mm above the floor, and at each raised floor, mezzanine, balcony, gallery, interior or exterior vehicular ramp, and at other locations where (see Note A-9.8.8.1.) the difference in elevation is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.
