P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.18.(5) and Article 3.3.2.9., a guard not less than 1 070 mm high shall be provided around any roof to which access is provided for purposes other than maintenance, at openings into smoke shafts referred to in part 3. that are less than 1 070 mm above the floor, and at each raised floor, mezzanine, balcony, gallery, interior or exterior vehicular ramp, and at other locations where (see Note A-9.8.8.1.) the difference in elevation is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.1.18.(3)and 3.3.2.9.(4) and Articles 3.3.4.7. and Article 3.3.5.10., openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is more than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.1.18.(3) and 3.3.2.9.(4) and Articles 3.3.4.7. and Article 3.3.5.10., openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is more than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Openings through guards other than those required by Sentence 3.3.1.18.(1) that serve occupancies other than industrial occupancies shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 100 mm, or permits the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 200 mm. (See Note A-9.8.8.5.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through guards other than those required by Sentence 3.3.1.18.(1) that serve occupancies other than industrial occupancies shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 100 mm, or permits the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 200 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except for guards conforming to Article 3.3.5.10., guards that protect a level located more than one storey or 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for guards conforming to Article 3.3.5.10., guards that protect a level located more than one storey or 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.3.1.18.(1) does not apply to the front edges of stages, to loading docks, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence 3.3.1.18.(1) does not apply to the front edges of stages, to loading docks, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.19.(5), a glass or transparent door shall be designed and constructed so that the existence and position of the door is readily apparent, by attaching visually contrasting hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.19.(5), a glass or transparent door shall be designed and constructed so that the existence and position of the door is readily apparent, by attaching visually contrasting hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures to it.

National Sentence Text: The visibility of fully glazed transparent doors, sidelights and panels shall be enhanced through the inclusion of mullions, markings or other elements that are visually contrasting, are at least 50 mm high, extend the full width of the door, sidelight or panel, and are located between 1 350 mm and 1 500 mm above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: The visibility of fully glazed transparent doors, sidelights and panels shall be enhanced through the inclusion of mullions, markings or other elements that are visually contrasting, are at least 50 mm high, extend the full width of the door, sidelight or panel, and are located between 1 350 mm and 1 500 mm above the floor.

National Sentence Text: A glass door shall be constructed of laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Sentence Text: A glass door shall be constructed of laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.19.(5), transparent panels used in an access to exit that, because of their physical configuration or design, could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be made inaccessible by barriers or railings.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.19.(5), transparent panels used in an access to exit that, because of their physical configuration or design, could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be made inaccessible by barriers or railings.

National Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences 3.3.1.19.(1)and 3.3.1.19.(4), provided the partitions are suitably marked in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.19.(2) to indicate their existence and position.
P/T Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences 3.3.1.19.(1) and 3.3.1.19.(4), provided the partitions are suitably marked in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.19.(2) to indicate their existence and position.

National Sentence Text: Where vision glass is provided in doors or transparent sidelights, the lowest edge of the glass shall be no higher than 900 mm above floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: Where vision glass is provided in doors or transparent sidelights, the lowest edge of the glass shall be no higher than 900 mm above floor level.

National Sentence Text: Glass in doors and in sidelights that could be mistaken for doors, within or at the entrances to dwelling units and in public areas, shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.6.1.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass in doors and in sidelights that could be mistaken for doors, within or at the entrances to dwelling units and in public areas, shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.6.1.4.

National Sentence Text: A window in a public area that extends to less than 1 000 mm above the floor and is located above the second storey in a building of residential occupancy, shall be protected by a barrier or railing to not less than 1 070 mm above the floor, or the window shall be non-openable and designed to withstand the lateral design loads for balcony guards required by Article 4.1.5.14.
P/T Sentence Text: A window in a public area that extends to less than 1 000 mm above the floor and is located above the second storey in a building of residential occupancy, shall be protected by a barrier or railing to not less than 1 070 mm above the floor, or the window shall be non-openable and designed to withstand the lateral design loads for balcony guards required by Article 4.1.5.14.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.20.(2), an exhaust ventilation system designed in conformance with the appropriate requirements of Part 6. shall be provided in a building or part of a building in which dust, fumes, gases, vapour or other impurities or contaminants have the potential to create a fire or explosion hazard. (See also Article 4.2.4.13.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.20.(2), an exhaust ventilation system designed in conformance with the appropriate requirements of part 6. shall be provided in a building or part of a building in which dust, fumes, gases, vapour or other impurities or contaminants have the potential to create a fire or explosion hazard. (See also Article 4.2.4.13.)

National Sentence Text: Where a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating is penetrated by a ventilation system required by Sentence 3.3.1.20.(1) for power-ventilated enclosures in laboratories, the ducts shall be continuously enclosed from the first penetrated fire separation to any subsequent fire separations or concealed spaces and all the way through to the outdoors so that the highest fire-resistance rating of all the penetrated fire separations is maintained, and exempted from the requirement to be equipped with a fire damper, smoke damper and fire/smoke damper as stated in Article 3.1.8.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating is penetrated by a ventilation system required by Sentence 3.3.1.20.(1) for power-ventilated enclosures in laboratories, the ducts shall be continuously enclosed from the first penetrated fire separation to any subsequent fire separations or concealed spaces and all the way through to the outdoors so that the highest fire-resistance rating of all the penetrated fire separations is maintained, and exempted from the requirement to be equipped with a fire damper, smoke damper and fire/smoke damper as stated in Article 3.1.8.7.

National Sentence Text: Explosion relief devices, vents or other protective measures conforming to Subsection 6.3.1. and Article 6.9.1.2. shall be provided for a space in which substances or conditions that have the potential to create an explosion hazard are present as a result of the principal use of a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Explosion relief devices, vents or other protective measures conforming to part 6. and Article 6.9.1.2. shall be provided for a space in which substances or conditions that have the potential to create an explosion hazard are present as a result of the principal use of a building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.21.(2)and 3.3.1.21.(3), a room or space within a floor area for the storage of janitorial supplies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.21.(2) and 3.3.1.21.(3), a room or space within a floor area for the storage of janitorial supplies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.21.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.21.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.21.(1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the room or space is located is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.21.(1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the room or space is located is sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.22.(2)and 3.3.1.22.(3), in a building of residential occupancy, a laundry room in a floor area that is not within a dwelling unit shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.22.(2) and 3.3.1.22.(3), in a building of residential occupancy, a laundry room in a floor area that is not within a dwelling unit shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.22.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.22.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.22.(1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the laundry room is located is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.22.(1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the laundry room is located is sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: No obstruction shall be permitted in any occupancy that would restrict the width of a normal means of egress from any part of a floor area to less than 750 mm unless an alternative means of egress is provided adjacent to, accessible from, and plainly visible from the obstructed means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.23.(1).) (See Note A-3.3.1.23.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: No obstruction shall be permitted in any occupancy that would restrict the width of a normal means of egress from any part of a floor area to less than 750 mm unless an alternative means of egress is provided adjacent to, accessible from, and plainly visible from the obstructed means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.23.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Illuminated signs conforming to Sentences 3.4.5.1.(2)and 3.4.5.1.(6) shall be provided to indicate the direction to egress points in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8).
P/T Sentence Text: Illuminated signs conforming to Sentences 3.4.5.1.(2) and 3.4.5.1.(6) shall be provided to indicate the direction to egress points in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.25.(2), welding and cutting operations shall be carried out in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.25.(2), welding and cutting operations shall be carried out in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.3.1.25.(1) shall not apply to industrial occupancies where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence 3.3.1.25.(1) shall not apply to industrial occupancies where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to assembly occupancies and to outdoor places of assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to assembly occupancies and to outdoor places of assembly.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 3.3.2.1.(3), provisions 12.2.3.2, 12.2.3.3, 12.2.5.4, 12.2.5.5, 12.2.5.6, 12.2.11.1, 12.4.1 and 12.4.2 of Chapter 12 of NFPA 101-2015 Life Safety Code are permitted to be used in lieu of Articles 3.3.2.4., 3.3.2.5., 3.3.2.9., 3.3.2.11.and 3.3.2.12. (See Note A-3.3.2.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 3.3.2.1.(3), provisions 12.2.3.2, 12.2.3.3, 12.2.5.4, 12.2.5.5, 12.2.5.6, 12.2.11.1, 12.4.1 and 12.4.2 of Chapter 12 of NFPA 101-2018 Life Safety Code are permitted to be used in lieu of Articles 3.3.2.4. , 3.3.2.5., 3.3.2.9., 3.3.2.11. and 3.3.2.12. (See Note A-3.3.2.1.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The minimum clear width of aisle accessways between rows of seats shall be calculated according to provisions 12.2.5.5.2, 12.2.5.5.4.1 and 12.2.5.5.5.1 of Chapter 12 of NFPA 101-2015 Life Safety Code except that in no case shall the width be less than 400 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum clear width of aisle accessways between rows of seats shall be calculated according to provisions 12.2.5.5.2, 12.2.5.5.4.1 and 12.2.5.5.5.1 of Chapter 12 of NFPA 101-2018 Life Safety Code except that in no case shall the width be less than 400 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.2.(2), the seating area of a Group A, Division 1 occupancy shall be separated from adjacent occupancies in the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h if the occupant load in the seating area exceeds 200.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.2.(2), the seating area of a Group A, Division 1 occupancy shall be separated from adjacent occupancies in the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h if the occupant load in the seating area exceeds 200.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.2.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.2.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: If usable space exists under tiers of seats in arena-type buildings, a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min shall be provided between the space and the seats or the space shall be sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: If usable space exists under tiers of seats in arena-type buildings, a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min shall be provided between the space and the seats or the space shall be sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Non-fixed seating shall conform to the NFC.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Non-fixed seating shall conform to the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: Non-fixed seating shall conform to the NFC(AE).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Non-fixed seating shall conform to the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Except for the requirements of Article 3.3.2.8. for bench-type seats and except as required or permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(2) and Articles 3.3.2.11.and 3.3.2.12., fixed seats in places of assembly shall be attached or secured to the floor, platform or platform riser, provided with arms and back, and arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage not less than 400 mm wide measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row in the unoccupied position.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the requirements of Article 3.3.2.8. for bench-type seats and except as required or permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(2) and Articles 3.3.2.11.and 3.3.2.12., fixed seats in places of assembly shall be attached or secured to the floor, platform or platform riser, provided with arms and back, and arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage not less than 400 mm wide measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row in the unoccupied position.

National Sentence Text: For fixed seats with backs and with folding tablet arms, the value of 400 mm required by Clause 3.3.2.4.(1)(c) shall be measured when the tablet arms are in the use position, but is permitted to be measured in the stored position provided there are not more than 7 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, the seats are located in a lecture hall or an auditorium used for instructional purposes, and the tablet arm, when raised manually to a vertical position, falls by the force of gravity to the stored position. (See Note A-3.3.2.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: For fixed seats with backs and with folding tablet arms, the value of 400 mm required by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(1) shall be measured when the tablet arms are in the use position, but is permitted to be measured in the stored position provided there are not more than 7 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, the seats are located in a lecture hall or an auditorium used for instructional purposes, and the tablet arm, when raised manually to a vertical position, falls by the force of gravity to the stored position.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats with backs or 20 seats without backs between any seat and the nearest aisle.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats with backs or 20 seats without backs between any seat and the nearest aisle.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.3.2.4.(3) do not apply if egress doorways are provided to serve both ends of rows of seats, each doorway referred to in Clause 3.3.2.4.(4)(a) serves not more than 3 rows of seats, and each row contains not more than 100 seats.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.3.2.4.(3) do not apply if egress doorways are provided to serve both ends of rows of seats, each doorway referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4) serves not more than 3 rows of seats, and each row contains not more than 100 seats.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Articles 3.3.2.11.and 3.3.2.12., aisles leading to exits shall be provided in conformance with Sentences 3.3.2.5.(2)to 3.3.2.5.(17) in places of assembly which contain fixed seats.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Articles 3.3.2.11. and 3.3.2.12., aisles leading to exits shall be provided in conformance with Sentences 3.3.2.5.(2)to 3.3.2.5.(17) in places of assembly which contain fixed seats.

National Sentence Text: The minimum clear width of aisles shall be not less than 1 100 mm, except that the width is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm if serving not more than 60 seats, and 900 mm if serving seats on one side only.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum clear width of aisles shall be not less than 1 100 mm, except that the width is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm if serving not more than 60 seats, and 900 mm if serving seats on one side only.

National Sentence Text: Except in the case of bleacher seats, the minimum clear width of aisles referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2) shall be measured at the point farthest from an exit, cross aisle or foyer and shall be increased by 25 mm for each metre of distance toward the exit, cross aisle or foyer.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in the case of bleacher seats, the minimum clear width of aisles referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2) shall be measured at the point farthest from an exit, cross aisle or foyer and shall be increased by 25 mm for each metre of distance toward the exit, cross aisle or foyer.

National Sentence Text: Aisles shall terminate in a cross aisle, foyer or exit, and the width of the cross aisle, foyer or exit shall be not less than the required width of the widest aisle plus 50% of the total required width of the remaining aisles that it serves.
P/T Sentence Text: Aisles shall terminate in a cross aisle, foyer or exit, and the width of the cross aisle, foyer or exit shall be not less than the required width of the widest aisle plus 50% of the total required width of the remaining aisles that it serves.

National Sentence Text: Dead-end aisles shall be not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: Dead-end aisles shall be not more than 6 m long.

National Sentence Text: The length of travel to an exit door by any aisle shall be not more than 45 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The length of travel to an exit door by any aisle shall be not more than 45 m.

National Sentence Text: Side aisles shall be not less than 1 100 mm wide if seating is provided in conformance with Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Side aisles shall be not less than 1 100 mm wide if seating is provided in conformance with Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4).

National Sentence Text: An aisle that has a slope not more than 1 in 8 shall not be stepped.
P/T Sentence Text: An aisle that has a slope not more than 1 in 8 shall not be stepped.

National Sentence Text: An aisle that slopes more than 1 in 8 shall be stepped.
P/T Sentence Text: An aisle that slopes more than 1 in 8 shall be stepped.

National Sentence Text: The passageway between rows of seats served by a stepped aisle shall be level at right angles to the line of travel.
P/T Sentence Text: The passageway between rows of seats served by a stepped aisle shall be level at right angles to the line of travel.

National Sentence Text: The riser of a step in an aisle shall be not less than 110 mm high, and not more than 200 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: The riser of a step in an aisle shall be not less than 110 mm high, and not more than 200 mm high.

National Sentence Text: Variations are permitted in riser height provided the height of adjacent risers does not vary by more than 6 mm, and the width of a tread or a platform in the direction of travel is not less than 430 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Variations are permitted in riser height provided the height of adjacent risers does not vary by more than 6 mm, and the width of a tread or a platform in the direction of travel is not less than 430 mm.

National Sentence Text: Steps in an aisle shall have a run not less than 230 mm exclusive of nosings, have a tread width not less than 250 mm, extend to the adjacent rows of seats in a manner that will not create a hazard from tripping, and have a finish on the treads conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Steps in an aisle shall have a run not less than 230 mm exclusive of nosings, have a tread width not less than 250 mm, extend to the adjacent rows of seats in a manner that will not create a hazard from tripping, and have a finish on the treads conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: The location of every riser in an aisle shall be made apparent from both directions of travel by strategically placed lighting or contrasting marking stripes.
P/T Sentence Text: The location of every riser in an aisle shall be made apparent from both directions of travel by strategically placed lighting or contrasting marking stripes.

National Sentence Text: A platform in an aisle shall be level, except that a slope not more than 1 in 50 is permitted for a platform that is not less than 430 mm wide in the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: A platform in an aisle shall be level, except that a slope not more than 1 in 50 is permitted for a platform that is not less than 430 mm wide in the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: If a step is used at the entry to a row of seats from a stepped aisle, an unobstructed platform not less than 800 mm square shall be provided adjacent to the aisle.
P/T Sentence Text: If a step is used at the entry to a row of seats from a stepped aisle, an unobstructed platform not less than 800 mm square shall be provided adjacent to the aisle.

National Sentence Text: The finish of the surface of a platform in or adjacent to a stepped aisle shall conform to Sentence 3.4.6.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The finish of the surface of a platform in or adjacent to a stepped aisle shall conform to Sentence 3.4.6.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.2.6.(2)to 3.3.2.6.(4), a corridor used by the public in an assembly occupancy as an access to exit shall be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.2.6.(2) to 3.3.2.6.(4), a corridor used by the public in an assembly occupancy as an access to exit shall be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.6.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.6.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating required by Sentence 3.3.2.6.(1) is permitted to be waived if the floor area in which the corridor is located is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating required by Sentence 3.3.2.6.(1) is permitted to be waived if the floor area in which the corridor is located is sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: The requirement for a fire separation stated in Sentence 3.3.2.6.(1) is permitted to be waived if the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to the exit does not exceed the travel distance permitted by Article 3.4.2.5.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirement for a fire separation stated in Sentence 3.3.2.6.(1) is permitted to be waived if the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to the exit does not exceed the travel distance permitted by Article 3.4.2.5.

National Sentence Text: A door equipped with a latching mechanism in an access to exit from a room or suite of assembly occupancy containing an occupant load more than 100 shall be equipped with a device that will release the latch and allow the door to swing wide open when a force not more than that specified in Sentence 3.8.3.6.(8) is applied to the device in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: A door equipped with a latching mechanism in an access to exit from a room or suite of assembly occupancy containing an occupant load more than 100 shall be equipped with a device that will release the latch and allow the door to swing wide open when a force not more than that specified in Sentence 3.8.3.6.(8) is applied to the device in the direction of travel to the exit.

National Sentence Text: If fixed bench-type seats without arms are provided, the seat width per person shall be assumed to be 450 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: If fixed bench-type seats without arms are provided, the seat width per person shall be assumed to be 450 mm.

National Sentence Text: The centre-to-centre spacing between rows of bench-type seats shall be not less than 760 mm if back rests are provided, and not less than 550 mm if back rests are not provided.
P/T Sentence Text: The centre-to-centre spacing between rows of bench-type seats shall be not less than 760 mm if back rests are provided, and not less than 550 mm if back rests are not provided.

National Sentence Text: A clear space of not less than 300 mm shall be provided between the back of each seat and the front of the seat immediately behind it.
P/T Sentence Text: A clear space of not less than 300 mm shall be provided between the back of each seat and the front of the seat immediately behind it.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.3.2.9.(2)to 3.3.2.9.(4) for bleacher seats, guards shall be installed in outdoor and indoor places of assembly with fixed seats so that at the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery where the seats extend to the edge, the height of guards is not less than 760 mm in front of the seats, and 920 mm if located at the end of aisles or at the foot of steps, the height of guards along every cross aisle other than those adjacent to the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery is not less than 660 mm, except that guards need not be provided if the backs of the seats along the front side of the aisle are not less than 600 mm above the floor of the aisle, and where the seating is arranged in successive tiers and the height of rise between platforms is more than 450 mm, the height of guards is not less than 660 mm along the entire row of seats at the edge of the platform.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.3.2.9.(2) to 3.3.2.9.(4) for bleacher seats, guards shall be installed in outdoor and indoor places of assembly with fixed seats so that at the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery where the seats extend to the edge, the height of guards is not less than 760 mm in front of the seats, and 920 mm if located at the end of aisles or at the foot of steps, the height of guards along every cross aisle other than those adjacent to the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery is not less than 660 mm, except that guards need not be provided if the backs of the seats along the front side of the aisle are not less than 600 mm above the floor of the aisle, and where the seating is arranged in successive tiers and the height of rise between platforms is more than 450 mm, the height of guards is not less than 660 mm along the entire row of seats at the edge of the platform.

National Sentence Text: The backs and ends of bleacher seats more than 1 200 mm above the ground or floor that are not adjacent to a wall shall be protected with a guard not less than 1 070 mm high above an adjacent aisle surface or foot rest, and not less than 920 mm high above the centre of an adjacent seat board.
P/T Sentence Text: The backs and ends of bleacher seats more than 1 200 mm above the ground or floor that are not adjacent to a wall shall be protected with a guard not less than 1 070 mm high above an adjacent aisle surface or foot rest, and not less than 920 mm high above the centre of an adjacent seat board.

National Sentence Text: If the front of a bleacher is more than 600 mm above the ground or floor, it shall be protected with a guard not less than 840 mm high above the front foot rest.
P/T Sentence Text: If the front of a bleacher is more than 600 mm above the ground or floor, it shall be protected with a guard not less than 840 mm high above the front foot rest.

National Sentence Text: The size of any opening in a guard required by Sentences 3.3.2.9.(2)and 3.3.2.9.(3) shall not allow the passage of a sphere whose diameter is more than 300 mm. (See Note A-3.3.2.10.)
P/T Sentence Text: The size of any opening in a guard required by Sentences 3.3.2.9.(2) and 3.3.2.9.(3) shall not allow the passage of a sphere whose diameter is more than 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Handrails shall be provided in aisles with steps in conformance with Table 3.3.2.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails shall be provided in aisles with steps in conformance with Table 3.3.2.10.

National Sentence Text: Handrails installed along aisle centre lines as required by Table 3.3.2.10. shall comply with Sentences 3.4.6.5.(5)to 3.4.6.5.(7)and 3.4.6.5.(14), have gaps not less than 560 mm and not more than 915 mm wide, measured horizontally, at intervals not exceeding five rows, comply with Sentence 3.4.6.5.(11) at terminations and required gaps, and have an intermediate rail located 305 mm below the principal handrail.
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails installed along aisle centre lines as required by Table 3.3.2.10. shall comply with Sentences 3.4.6.5.(5) to 3.4.6.5.(7) and 3.4.6.5.(14), have gaps not less than 560 mm and not more than 915 mm wide, measured horizontally, at intervals not exceeding five rows, comply with Sentence 3.4.6.5.(11) at terminations and required gaps, and have an intermediate rail located 305 mm below the principal handrail.

National Sentence Text: A Group A, Division 4 occupancy and each tier or balcony that has a capacity of more than 1 000 persons shall have not less than 3 separate exits , or 4 000 persons shall have not less than 4 separate exits .
P/T Sentence Text: A Group A, Division 4 occupancy and each tier or balcony that has a capacity of more than 1 000 persons shall have not less than 3 separate exits , or 4 000 persons shall have not less than 4 separate exits .

National Sentence Text: In a Group A, Division 4 occupancy, every seat shall be located so that the travel distance is not more than 45 m measured along the path of travel from the seat to the ground, an exit, an opening to a passageway leading from the seating area, or a portal, a vomitory or any other opening through the seating deck structure.
P/T Sentence Text: In a Group A, Division 4 occupancy, every seat shall be located so that the travel distance is not more than 45 m measured along the path of travel from the seat to the ground, an exit, an opening to a passageway leading from the seating area, or a portal, a vomitory or any other opening through the seating deck structure.

National Sentence Text: Exits from outdoor stadia or grandstands shall be located not more than 25 m apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Exits from outdoor stadia or grandstands shall be located not more than 25 m apart.

National Sentence Text: The capacity of a means of egress for a Group A, Division 4 occupancy shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 3.4.3.2.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: The capacity of a means of egress for a Group A, Division 4 occupancy shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 3.4.3.2.(3).

National Sentence Text: Aisles in a Group A, Division 4 occupancy shall be located so that there are not more than 20 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, and be not less than 1 200 mm wide, except that an aisle serving less than 60 persons is permitted to be 750 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Aisles in a Group A, Division 4 occupancy shall be located so that there are not more than 20 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, and be not less than 1 200 mm wide, except that an aisle serving less than 60 persons is permitted to be 750 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Steps provided in aisles of bleachers of the telescopic type shall have risers not more than 250 mm high, and have treads with a run not less than 280 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Steps provided in aisles of bleachers of the telescopic type shall have risers not more than 250 mm high, and have treads with a run not less than 280 mm.

National Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide 2 equal risers between platforms.
P/T Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide 2 equal risers between platforms.

National Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 450 mm, 2 intermediate steps shall be provided the full width of the aisle so that there are 3 equal risers between platforms.
P/T Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 450 mm, 2 intermediate steps shall be provided the full width of the aisle so that there are 3 equal risers between platforms.

National Sentence Text: If the passageway between rows of seats is not a closed deck, footboards shall be provided so that the total width of the footboards shall be not less than three quarters of the centre-to-centre spacing between rows of seats, and the spacing between footboard members shall be not more than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: If the passageway between rows of seats is not a closed deck, footboards shall be provided so that the total width of the footboards shall be not less than three quarters of the centre-to-centre spacing between rows of seats, and the spacing between footboard members shall be not more than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Openings above footboards and below the seats in rows of bleacher seats shall be provided with intermediate construction so that there is no opening that would permit the passage of a sphere of more than 100 mm in diameter.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings above footboards and below the seats in rows of bleacher seats shall be provided with intermediate construction so that there is no opening that would permit the passage of a sphere of more than 100 mm in diameter.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(2), a library book storage room that is not normally accessible to the public shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h if it is more than 250 m2 in area, or contains book stacks that are more than 10 m high, or penetrate more than one floor assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(2), a library book storage room that is not normally accessible to the public shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h if it is more than 250 m2 in area, or contains book stacks that are more than 10 m high, or penetrate more than one floor assembly.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(1) is not required if the book storage room is sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(1) is not required if the book storage room is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Open book shelves are permitted above and below a mezzanine floor in a library building provided the height of the shelves is not more than 2.1 m but not more than 75% of the floor-to-ceiling height of the space above or below the mezzanine floor assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Open book shelves are permitted above and below a mezzanine floor in a library building provided the height of the shelves is not more than 2.1 m but not more than 75% of the floor-to-ceiling height of the space above or below the mezzanine floor assembly.

National Sentence Text: A stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: A stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: A fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h shall be provided between a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h shall be provided between a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.14.(6), a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be separated from the seating area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except for a proscenium opening protected with a sprinkler deluge system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems an unframed fire curtain if the opening is not more than 20 m wide, or a semi-rigid fire curtain if the opening is more than 20 m wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.14.(6), a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be separated from the seating area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except for a proscenium opening protected with a sprinkler deluge system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems an unframed fire curtain if the opening is not more than 20 m wide, or a semi-rigid fire curtain if the opening is more than 20 m wide.

National Sentence Text: A fire curtain required by Sentence 3.3.2.14.(3) shall be of a type acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction and designed to close automatically upon the actuation of the sprinkler system, automatically upon actuation of the fire alarm system, and manually by remote control devices located at the curtain control panel and at each side of the stage.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire curtain required by Sentence 3.3.2.14.(3) shall be of a type acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction and designed to close automatically upon the actuation of the sprinkler system, automatically upon actuation of the fire alarm system, and manually by remote control devices located at the curtain control panel and at each side of the stage.

National Sentence Text: At least 2 vents for the purpose of venting fire and smoke to the outside of a building shall be provided above a stage designed for theatrical performances and shall have an aggregate area not less than one eighth of the area of the stage behind the proscenium opening, and be arranged to open automatically upon actuation of the sprinkler system.
P/T Sentence Text: At least 2 vents for the purpose of venting fire and smoke to the outside of a building shall be provided above a stage designed for theatrical performances and shall have an aggregate area not less than one eighth of the area of the stage behind the proscenium opening, and be arranged to open automatically upon actuation of the sprinkler system.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.14.(3) is not required between a stage and a seating area in a building that is sprinklered throughout, provided a sprinkler deluge system is installed at the boundary between the stage and the seating area.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.14.(3) is not required between a stage and a seating area in a building that is sprinklered throughout, provided a sprinkler deluge system is installed at the boundary between the stage and the seating area.

National Sentence Text: In a Group A, Division 2 occupancy used for the serving of food and beverages, an interior flight of stairs with fewer than 3 risers is permitted provided it is not less than 900 mm wide, is illuminated at all times that occupants are on the premises, and has a handrail on each side.
P/T Sentence Text: In a Group A, Division 2 occupancy used for the serving of food and beverages, an interior flight of stairs with fewer than 3 risers is permitted provided it is not less than 900 mm wide, is illuminated at all times that occupants are on the premises, and has a handrail on each side.

National Sentence Text: Where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in assembly occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in assembly occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC(AE) for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in assembly occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC(AE) for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in assembly occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to care, treatment and detention occupancies. (See Note A-3.3.3.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to care, treatment and detention occupancies. (See Note A-3.3.3.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.5.(1) between a care, treatment or detention occupancy and a repair garage shall have no openings.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.5.(1) between a care, treatment or detention occupancy and a repair garage shall have no openings.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.3.3.(2), a corridor used by the public or serving patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms shall have no dead-end portion.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.3.3.(2), a corridor used by the public or serving patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms shall have no dead-end portion.

National Sentence Text: Corridors are permitted to have dead-portions, where the area served by the dead-end portion has a second and separate means of egress, or the corridor serves a suite of care occupancy and the dead-end portion does not exceed 6 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Corridors are permitted to have dead-portions, where the area served by the dead-end portion has a second and separate means of egress, or the corridor serves a suite of care occupancy and the dead-end portion does not exceed 6 m.

National Sentence Text: Corridors shall be not less than 2 400 mm wide in buildings of treatment occupancy where the corridors may be used to move patients or residents in beds, 1 650 mm wide in buildings of care or treatment occupancy where the corridors will not be used to move patients or residents in beds, and in buildings of care occupancy with more than 10 residents and where the corridors serve the residents, or 1 100 mm wide in buildings of care occupancy with not more than 10 residents.
P/T Sentence Text: Corridors shall be not less than 2 400 mm wide in buildings of treatment occupancy where the corridors may be used to move patients or residents in beds, 1 650 mm wide in buildings of care or treatment occupancy where the corridors will not be used to move patients or residents in beds, and in buildings of care occupancy with more than 10 residents and where the corridors serve the residents, or 1 100 mm wide in buildings of care occupancy with not more than 10 residents.

National Sentence Text: Paired doors in a corridor referred to in Clause 3.3.3.3.(3)(a) shall swing in opposite directions, the right-hand door swinging in the direction of travel, and be not less than 1 100 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Paired doors in a corridor referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.3.(3) shall swing in opposite directions, the right-hand door swinging in the direction of travel, and be not less than 1 100 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.3.4.(2) and within individual suites of care occupancy, the minimum clear width of a doorway shall be 850 mm where it opens into or is located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit for patients or residents in floor areas containing care or treatment occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.3.4.(2) and within individual suites of care occupancy, the minimum clear width of a doorway shall be 850 mm where it opens into or is located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit for patients or residents in floor areas containing care or treatment occupancies.

National Sentence Text: The minimum clear width of doorways through which it is necessary to move patients in bed shall be 1 050 mm. (See Note A-3.3.3.4.(2).) (See Note A-3.3.3.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum clear width of doorways through which it is necessary to move patients in bed shall be 1 050 mm. (See Note A-3.3.3.4.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Floor areas containing patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms in a care or treatment occupancy where overnight sleeping accommodation is provided for more than a total of 10 patients or residents shall conform to Sentences 3.3.3.5.(2)to 3.3.3.5.(13).
P/T Sentence Text: Floor areas containing patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms in a care or treatment occupancy where overnight sleeping accommodation is provided for more than a total of 10 patients or residents shall conform to Sentences 3.3.3.5.(2) to 3.3.3.5.(13).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(3), a floor area described in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(1) shall be divided into not less than 2 fire compartments, each not more than 1 000 m2 in area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(3), a floor area described in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(1) shall be divided into not less than 2 fire compartments, each not more than 1 000 m2 in area.

National Sentence Text: The floor area on either side of a horizontal exit conforming to Article 3.4.6.10. is permitted to be considered as a fire compartment in applying the requirements of this Article.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor area on either side of a horizontal exit conforming to Article 3.4.6.10. is permitted to be considered as a fire compartment in applying the requirements of this Article.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(5), fire separations separating fire compartments required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(5), fire separations separating fire compartments required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of a fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of a fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: The travel distance from any point within each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2) to a door to an adjoining fire compartment shall be not more than 45 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The travel distance from any point within each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2) to a door to an adjoining fire compartment shall be not more than 45 m.

National Sentence Text: Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2) shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 2.5 m2 per patient in the adjacent fire compartment.
P/T Sentence Text: Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(2) shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 2.5 m2 per patient in the adjacent fire compartment.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.3.5.(9)to 3.3.3.5.(13), walls between patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms and the remainder of the floor area shall be constructed as fire separations but are not required to have a fire-resistance rating unless one is required by other provisions in this Part. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.3.5.(9) to 3.3.3.5.(13), walls between patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms and the remainder of the floor area shall be constructed as fire separations but are not required to have a fire-resistance rating unless one is required by other provisions in this Part. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)

National Sentence Text: The fire separation requirements of Sentence 3.3.3.5.(8) do not apply to walls within a group of intercommunicating patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms, provided the group of rooms does not contain more than 5 patients or residents, or include storage, bathing or toilet facilities serving persons not occupying the group of rooms. (See Note A-3.3.3.5.(9).)
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation requirements of Sentence 3.3.3.5.(8) do not apply to walls within a group of intercommunicating patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms, provided the group of rooms does not contain more than 5 patients or residents, or include storage, bathing or toilet facilities serving persons not occupying the group of rooms.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation requirements of Sentence 3.3.3.5.(8) do not apply to walls within individual suites of care occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation requirements of Sentence 3.3.3.5.(8) do not apply to walls within individual suites of care occupancy.

National Sentence Text: A door in a fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(8) is permitted to be equipped with a roller latch.
P/T Sentence Text: A door in a fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(8) is permitted to be equipped with a roller latch.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(13), a fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(8) shall not have any grilles, louvres or other openings.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(13), a fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(8) shall not have any grilles, louvres or other openings.

National Sentence Text: A door or wall separating a patient’s or resident’s sleeping room from an ensuite toilet room, shower room or similar ancillary space is permitted to incorporate grilles and louvres, provided the adjacent rooms are not used to store flammable or combustible materials, and the openings are located so that smoke cannot pass through these rooms to other parts of the building. (See Note A-3.3.3.5.(13).)
P/T Sentence Text: A door or wall separating a patient’s or resident’s sleeping room from an ensuite toilet room, shower room or similar ancillary space is permitted to incorporate grilles and louvres, provided the adjacent rooms are not used to store flammable or combustible materials, and the openings are located so that smoke cannot pass through these rooms to other parts of the building.

National Sentence Text: Walls between individual suites of care occupancy and the remainder of the floor area in buildings of care occupancy shall be constructed as fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than that specified for residential occupancies in Sentences 3.3.4.2.(1)and 3.3.4.2.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Walls between individual suites of care occupancy and the remainder of the floor area in buildings of care occupancy shall be constructed as fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than that specified for residential occupancies in Sentences 3.3.4.2.(1)and 3.3.4.2.(2).

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies within individual suites of care occupancy need not be constructed as fire separations, provided the suites meet the conditions described in Clauses 3.3.4.2.(3)(a)and 3.3.4.2.(3)(b).
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies within individual suites of care occupancy need not be constructed as fire separations, provided the suites meet the conditions described in Clauses 3.3.4.2.(3)and 3.3.4.2.(3).

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.6.(1) is permitted to be waived if the fire separation is located between individual suites of care occupancy and an attached storage garage containing not more than 5 vehicles, provided the conditions described in Sentence 3.3.4.2.(4) are met.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.6.(1) is permitted to be waived if the fire separation is located between individual suites of care occupancy and an attached storage garage containing not more than 5 vehicles, provided the conditions described in Sentence 3.3.4.2.(4) are met.

National Sentence Text: Compartments containing rooms such as operating rooms, recovery rooms, delivery rooms and intensive care units, from which it is impracticable to move patients in an emergency, shall be separated from adjacent spaces by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and provided with a mechanical air supply so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in another space, the compartments will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire area.
P/T Sentence Text: Compartments containing rooms such as operating rooms, recovery rooms, delivery rooms and intensive care units, from which it is impracticable to move patients in an emergency, shall be separated from adjacent spaces by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and provided with a mechanical air supply so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in another space, the compartments will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire area.

National Sentence Text: A contained use area shall conform to Sentences 3.3.3.7.(2)to 3.3.3.7.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: A contained use area shall conform to Sentences 3.3.3.7.(2)to 3.3.3.7.(5).

National Sentence Text: A contained use area shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: A contained use area shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.7.(4), a building that includes a contained use area shall be sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.7.(4), a building that includes a contained use area shall be sprinklered throughout.

National Sentence Text: A contained use area, in a building for which Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90. do not require the installation of an automatic sprinkler system, is not required to be sprinklered as required by Sentence 3.3.3.7.(3) provided the building is designed so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in the contained use area other fire compartments will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the contained use area, the building is designed so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in another part of the building the contained use area will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the other part of the building, all doors are designed to be remotely released in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6), and the contained use area does not contain any rooms lined with combustible padding.
P/T Sentence Text: A contained use area, in a building for which Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.90. do not require the installation of an automatic sprinkler system, is not required to be sprinklered as required by Sentence 3.3.3.7.(3) provided the building is designed so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in the contained use area other fire compartments will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the contained use area, the building is designed so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in another part of the building the contained use area will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the other part of the building, all doors are designed to be remotely released in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6), and the contained use area does not contain any rooms lined with combustible padding.

National Sentence Text: A corridor serving a contained use area shall have no dead-end portion unless the area served by the dead-end portion has a second and separate means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: A corridor serving a contained use area shall have no dead-end portion unless the area served by the dead-end portion has a second and separate means of egress.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to residential occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to residential occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.2.(2)and 3.2.2.9.(2), suites of residential occupancy shall be separated from each other and the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.2.(2) and 3.2.2.9.(2), suites of residential occupancy shall be separated from each other and the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.4.2.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.4.2.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies within a dwelling unit need not be constructed as fire separations provided the distance between the lowest floor level and the uppermost floor level within the dwelling unit is not more than 6 m, and the dwelling unit is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h if the building is not sprinklered throughout, 45 min if the building is sprinklered throughout and it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or 1 h if the building is sprinklered throughout and it is more than 3 storeys in building height.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies within a dwelling unit need not be constructed as fire separations provided the distance between the lowest floor level and the uppermost floor level within the dwelling unit is not more than 6 m, and the dwelling unit is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h if the building is not sprinklered throughout, 45 min if the building is sprinklered throughout and it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or 1 h if the building is sprinklered throughout and it is more than 3 storeys in building height.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.6.(1) is permitted to be waived if the fire separation is located between a dwelling unit and an attached storage garage containing not more than 5 vehicles, provided the dwelling unit and the attached storage garage are sprinklered, the dwelling unit and the attached storage garage are separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentences 3.3.4.2.(1), 3.3.4.2.(2)and 3.3.4.2.(3), there are no air duct systems connecting the storage garage and the dwelling unit, the construction between the storage garage and the dwelling unit provides an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the storage garage and the dwelling unit is tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes, fitted with a self-closing device, and not located in a room intended for sleeping.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.6.(1) is permitted to be waived if the fire separation is located between a dwelling unit and an attached storage garage containing not more than 5 vehicles, provided the dwelling unit and the attached storage garage are sprinklered, the dwelling unit and the attached storage garage are separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentences 3.3.4.2.(1), 3.3.4.2.(2) and 3.3.4.2.(3), there are no air duct systems connecting the storage garage and the dwelling unit, the construction between the storage garage and the dwelling unit provides an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the storage garage and the dwelling unit is tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes, fitted with a self-closing device, and not located in a room intended for sleeping.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.6.(1) is not required between a dwelling unit and an attached storage garage, serving that dwelling unit only, provided the dwelling unit and its attached storage garage are separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentences 3.3.4.2.(1), 3.3.4.2.(2)and 3.3.4.2.(3), there are no air duct systems connecting the storage garage and the dwelling unit, the construction between the storage garage and the dwelling unit provides an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the storage garage and the dwelling unit is tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes, fitted with a self-closing device, and not located in a room intended for sleeping.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.6.(1) is not required between a dwelling unit and an attached storage garage, serving that dwelling unit only, provided the dwelling unit and its attached storage garage are separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentences 3.3.4.2.(1), 3.3.4.2.(2) and 3.3.4.2.(3), there are no air duct systems connecting the storage garage and the dwelling unit, the construction between the storage garage and the dwelling unit provides an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the storage garage and the dwelling unit is tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes, fitted with a self-closing device, and not located in a room intended for sleeping.

National Sentence Text: Sprinklers shall be installed in a storage room provided for the use of tenants in a residential occupancy within a floor area but not contained within a suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinklers shall be installed in a storage room provided for the use of tenants in a residential occupancy within a floor area but not contained within a suite.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.4.3.(3), a storage room referred to in Sentence 3.3.4.3.(1) shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.4.3.(3), a storage room referred to in Sentence 3.3.4.3.(1) shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.4.3.(2) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.4.3.(2) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Except for the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids inside a single-family dwelling unit and garages or sheds attached to these dwelling units, where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in residential occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except for the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids inside a single-family dwelling unit and garages or sheds attached to these dwelling units, where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in residential occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids inside a single-family dwelling unit and garages or sheds attached to these dwelling units, where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC(AE) for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in residential occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except for the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids inside a single-family dwelling unit and garages or sheds attached to these dwelling units, where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC(AE) for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in residential occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.

National Sentence Text: Single storeydwelling units in an apartment building need not lead to a public corridor or exterior passageway on the same storey provided the dwelling units are served by private stairways leading directly to a public access to exit on the storey immediately above, and immediately below. (See Note A-3.3.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Single storeydwelling units in an apartment building need not lead to a public corridor or exterior passageway on the same storey provided the dwelling units are served by private stairways leading directly to a public access to exit on the storey immediately above, and immediately below.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.4.(3)and 3.3.4.4.(4), a dwelling unit containing more than one storey shall have an exit door or an egress door opening directly into a public access to exit from the uppermost storey and from the lowest storey of the dwelling unit so that each of these storeys is served by an exit or egress door located not more than 1.5 m above or below its floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.4.(3) and 3.3.4.4.(4), a dwelling unit containing more than one storey shall have an exit door or an egress door opening directly into a public access to exit from the uppermost storey and from the lowest storey of the dwelling unit so that each of these storeys is served by an exit or egress door located not more than 1.5 m above or below its floor level.

National Sentence Text: A single exit is permitted from a dwelling unit provided the exit is an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level and it is not necessary to travel up or down more than one storey to reach the exit door, or the uppermost floor level opens to a balcony not more than 6 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: A single exit is permitted from a dwelling unit provided the exit is an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level and it is not necessary to travel up or down more than one storey to reach the exit door, or the uppermost floor level opens to a balcony not more than 6 m above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: An egress door from either the uppermost storey or the lowest storey of a dwelling unit, as required by Sentence 3.3.4.4.(2), need not be provided if that storey is served by a stairway that leads to a public access to exit, has no direct access to any other storey in the dwelling unit, and is separated from the other storeys in the dwelling unit by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: An egress door from either the uppermost storey or the lowest storey of a dwelling unit, as required by Sentence 3.3.4.4.(2), need not be provided if that storey is served by a stairway that leads to a public access to exit, has no direct access to any other storey in the dwelling unit, and is separated from the other storeys in the dwelling unit by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: In a building of residential occupancy not more than 3 storeys in building height, a doorway from a dwelling unit is permitted to open directly into an exit stairway provided the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building of residential occupancy not more than 3 storeys in building height, a doorway from a dwelling unit is permitted to open directly into an exit stairway provided the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.

National Sentence Text: If a dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress, one means of egress from a dwelling unit is permitted to pass through an interior corridor served by a single exit, an exterior balcony served by a single exit stairway, or an exterior passageway served by a single exit stairway.
P/T Sentence Text: If a dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress, one means of egress from a dwelling unit is permitted to pass through an interior corridor served by a single exit, an exterior balcony served by a single exit stairway, or an exterior passageway served by a single exit stairway.

National Sentence Text: Except for hotels and motels, a door opening onto a public corridor which provides access to exit from a suite shall be designed not to lock automatically. (See Note A-3.3.4.5.(1).) (See Note A-3.3.4.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for hotels and motels, a door opening onto a public corridor which provides access to exit from a suite shall be designed not to lock automatically. (See Note A-3.3.4.5.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Occupants of dwelling units shall be protected from airborne noise in conformance with Section 5.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Occupants of dwelling units shall be protected from airborne noise in conformance with part 5.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 3.3.4.8., stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards within a dwelling unit shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Section 9.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 3.3.4.8., stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards within a dwelling unit shall conform to the appropriate requirements in part 9.
