National Sentence Text: Exterior stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards serving a single dwelling unit, and loads on guards serving not more than two dwelling units, shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Section 9.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards serving a single dwelling unit, and loads on guards serving not more than two dwelling units, shall conform to the appropriate requirements in part 9.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.4.8.(2), openable windows in suites of residential occupancy shall be protected by a guard with a minimum height of 1 070 mm constructed in accordance with Article 3.3.1.18., or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm measured either vertically or horizontally where the other dimension is greater than 380 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.4.8.(2), openable windows in suites of residential occupancy shall be protected by a guard with a minimum height of 1 070 mm constructed in accordance with Article 3.3.1.18., or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm measured either vertically or horizontally where the other dimension is greater than 380 mm.

National Sentence Text: Windows need not be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.3.4.8.(1) where the only opening having greater dimensions than those allowed by Clause 3.3.4.8.(1)(b) is located higher than 1 070 mm above the finished floor, or the bottom edge of the openable portion of the window is located less than 1 800 mm above the floor or ground on the other side of the window.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows need not be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.3.4.8.(1) where the only opening having greater dimensions than those allowed by Sentence 3.3.4.8.(1) is located higher than 1 070 mm above the finished floor, or the bottom edge of the openable portion of the window is located less than 1 800 mm above the floor or ground on the other side of the window.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to industrial occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to industrial occupancies.

National Sentence Text: In addition to other requirements in this Code for the installation of automatic fire extinguishing systems, an appropriate fire extinguishing system shall be installed in every industrial occupancyfloor area to provide protection if required by provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or the NFC, in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause 3.3.5.2.(1)(a).
Matched National Sentence (Variation): In addition to other requirements in this Code for the installation of automatic fire extinguishing systems, an appropriate fire extinguishing system shall be installed in every industrial occupancy floor area to provide protection if required by the NFC(AE).
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to other requirements in this Code for the installation of automatic fire extinguishing systems, an appropriate fire extinguishing system shall be installed in every industrial occupancy floor area to provide protection if required by the NFC(AE).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): In addition to other requirements in this Code for the installation of automatic fire extinguishing systems, an appropriate fire extinguishing system shall be installed in every industrial occupancy floor area to provide protection if required by the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: A basement shall not be used for the storage, manufacture or handling of volatile solids, liquids or gases that generate explosive air-vapour mixtures or for processes that involve explosive dusts.
P/T Sentence Text: A basement shall not be used for the storage, manufacture or handling of volatile solids, liquids or gases that generate explosive air-vapour mixtures or for processes that involve explosive dusts.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): A basement shall not be used for the storage, manufacture or handling of volatile solids, liquids or gases that generate explosive air-vapour mixtures or for processes that involve explosive dusts.

National Sentence Text: Entrances and exits to a basement and to rooms containing building services shall be separate from the remainder of the building in a building in which the storage, manufacture or handling of volatile materials can generate explosive air-vapour mixtures, or processes occur that produce explosive dusts.
P/T Sentence Text: Entrances and exits to a basement and to rooms containing building services shall be separate from the remainder of the building in a building in which the storage, manufacture or handling of volatile materials can generate explosive air-vapour mixtures, or processes occur that produce explosive dusts.

National Sentence Text: Basements and rooms referred to in Sentence 3.3.5.3.(2) shall be separated from the remainder of the building with a vapour-tight separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Basements and rooms referred to in Sentence 3.3.5.3.(2) shall be separated from the remainder of the building with a vapour-tight separation.

National Sentence Text: If access is provided from a storage garage to a stair tower or elevator serving occupancies above the level of the storage garage, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: If access is provided from a storage garage to a stair tower or elevator serving occupancies above the level of the storage garage, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(4).

National Sentence Text: Treads and landings in interior stairs that extend to the roof of a storage garage shall be designed to be free of accumulations of ice and snow.
P/T Sentence Text: Treads and landings in interior stairs that extend to the roof of a storage garage shall be designed to be free of accumulations of ice and snow.

National Sentence Text: A mechanical storage garage not more than 4 storeys in building height, in which no persons other than parking attendants are permitted above the street floor level, need not have a fire separation between the exits and the remainder of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: A mechanical storage garage not more than 4 storeys in building height, in which no persons other than parking attendants are permitted above the street floor level, need not have a fire separation between the exits and the remainder of the building.

National Sentence Text: A garage shall be provided with natural or mechanical ventilation in conformance with the requirements of Subsection 6.3.1. and Article 6.9.1.2. to prevent excessive accumulation of carbon monoxide, exhaust fumes or flammable and toxic vapours.
P/T Sentence Text: A garage shall be provided with natural or mechanical ventilation in conformance with the requirements of part 6. and Article 6.9.1.2. to prevent excessive accumulation of carbon monoxide, exhaust fumes or flammable and toxic vapours.

National Sentence Text: The clear height in a storage garage shall be not less than 2 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height in a storage garage shall be not less than 2 m.

National Sentence Text: Where garage floors or ramps are 600 mm or more above the adjacent ground or floor level, every opening through such floors and the perimeter of floors and ramps shall be provided with a continuous curb not less than 140 mm high, a guard not less than 1 070 mm high, and a vehicle guardrail not less than 500 mm high conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.4.(7), or a full-height wall conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.4.(7).
P/T Sentence Text: Where garage floors or ramps are 600 mm or more above the adjacent ground or floor level, every opening through such floors and the perimeter of floors and ramps shall be provided with a continuous curb not less than 140 mm high, a guard not less than 1 070 mm high, and a vehicle guardrail not less than 500 mm high conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.4.(7), or a full-height wall conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.4.(7).

National Sentence Text: Vehicle guardrails and full-height walls required in Sentence 3.3.5.4.(6) shall be designed and constructed to withstand the loading values stipulated in Sentence 4.1.5.15.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Vehicle guardrails and full-height walls required in Sentence 3.3.5.4.(6) shall be designed and constructed to withstand the loading values stipulated in Sentence 4.1.5.15.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except for open-air storeys, every storey of a storage garage or repair garage located below grade shall be sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for open-air storeys, every storey of a storage garage or repair garage located below grade shall be sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: A repair garage and any ancillary spaces serving it, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: A repair garage and any ancillary spaces serving it, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.2.(4)and 3.3.4.2.(5), a storage garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1.5 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.2.(4) and 3.3.4.2.(5), a storage garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1.5 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.5.7.(2), if access is provided through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 1 or Group B occupancy, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.5.7.(2), if access is provided through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 1 or Group B occupancy, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(4).

National Sentence Text: If access is provided through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group B, Division 3 occupancy with not more than 10 occupants, access need not be through a vestibule, provided the fire separation complies with Clauses 3.3.4.2.(5)(b)to 3.3.4.2.(5)(d).
P/T Sentence Text: If access is provided through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group B, Division 3 occupancy with not more than 10 occupants, access need not be through a vestibule, provided the fire separation complies with Clauses 3.3.4.2.(5)to 3.3.4.2.(5).

National Sentence Text: In a building more than 3 storeys in building height, access through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 2, 3 or 4, or a Group C occupancy, shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: In a building more than 3 storeys in building height, access through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 2, 3 or 4, or a Group C occupancy, shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(4).

National Sentence Text: If access is provided through a vestibule, as required by Sentences 3.3.5.7.(1), 3.3.5.7.(3)and 3.3.5.4.(1), the vestibule shall be not less than 1.8 m long, be ventilated naturally to outside air by a vent that has an unobstructed area of not less than 0.1 m2 for each door that opens into the vestibule but not less than 0.4 m2, or mechanically at a rate of 14 m3/h for each square metre of vestibule floor surface area, and have openings between the vestibule and an adjoining occupancy provided with self-closing doors with no hold-open devices.
P/T Sentence Text: If access is provided through a vestibule, as required by Sentences 3.3.5.7.(1), 3.3.5.7.(3)and 3.3.5.4.(1), the vestibule shall be not less than 1.8 m long, be ventilated naturally to outside air by a vent that has an unobstructed area of not less than 0.1 m2 for each door that opens into the vestibule but not less than 0.4 m2 , or mechanically at a rate of 14 m3/h for each square metre of vestibule floor surface area, and have openings between the vestibule and an adjoining occupancy provided with self-closing doors with no hold-open devices.

National Sentence Text: Facilities for the dispensing of fuel having a flash point below 37.8°C shall not be installed above any space intended for occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Facilities for the dispensing of fuel having a flash point below 37.8°C shall not be installed above any space intended for occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Facilities for the dispensing of fuel having a flash point below 37.8°C shall not be installed in any building, except that this requirement does not apply to a canopy which is open on not less than 75% of its perimeter.
P/T Sentence Text: Facilities for the dispensing of fuel having a flash point below 37.8°C shall not be installed in any building, except that this requirement does not apply to a canopy which is open on not less than 75% of its perimeter.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.9.3.1.(5) or unless the building is sprinklered throughout, each individual tenancy in a multiple tenant self storage warehouse classified as an industrial occupancy shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentence 3.9.3.1.(5) or unless the building is sprinklered throughout, each individual tenancy in a multiple-tenant self-storage warehouse classified as an industrial occupancy shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.9.3.1.(5) or unless the building is sprinklered throughout, each individual tenancy in a multiple-tenant self-storage warehouse classified as an industrial occupancy shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of a top railing, and one or more intermediate rails spaced such that openings through the guard are of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 535 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of a top railing, and one or more intermediate rails spaced such that openings through the guard are of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 535 mm.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to design and fire protection requirements for buildings or parts thereof used for the storage, handling, use and processing of dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, in quantities in excess of those identified in Table 3.2.7.1. of Division B of the NFC. (See Note A-3.3.6.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to design and fire protection requirements for buildings or parts thereof used for the storage, handling, use and processing of dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, in quantities in excess of those identified in Table 3.2.7.1. of Division B of the NFC(AE). (See Note A-3.3.6.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Solid and liquid dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Solid and liquid dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The design of buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of dangerous goods classified as explosives shall conform to the NRCan R.S.C., 1985, c. E-17 Explosives Act and its Regulations, published by Natural Resources Canada.
P/T Sentence Text: The design of buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of dangerous goods classified as explosives shall conform to the Explosives Act and its Regulations, published by Natural Resources Canada.

National Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for hazardous locations. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(4).)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Where required by the NFC, cylinders of dangerous goods classified as flammable gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the building by a gas-tight fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 2 h, that is located on an exterior wall of the building, that can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are equipped with self-closing devices that keep the closures closed when not in use, and constructed so as to prevent the migration of gases from the room into other parts of the building.

National Sentence Text: Fire separations for rooms where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are stored are required to be constructed with a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Subsection 4.2.9. of Division B of the NFC.

National Sentence Text: Where Class IA or IB liquids specified in Subsection 4.1.2. of Division B of the NFC are dispensed within a storage room, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.3.6.4.(2).)

National Sentence Text: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.5.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Where Article 3.2.9.1. of Division B of the NFC applies due to the quantity and nature of the stored product, and as stipulated in Sentences 3.3.6.6.(2)to 3.3.6.6.(6), buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be classified as medium-hazard industrial occupancies (Group F, Division 2).

National Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be not more than one storey in building height.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be not more than one storey in building height.

National Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall not have basements or crawl spaces, or contain open floor drains, tunnels, elevator pits or other pockets that might trap molten ammonium nitrate.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall not have basements or crawl spaces, or contain open floor drains, tunnels, elevator pits or other pockets that might trap molten ammonium nitrate.

National Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall have not less than 0.007 m2 of vent area for each square metre of storage area, unless mechanical ventilation is provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall have not less than 0.007 m2 of vent area for each square metre of storage area, unless mechanical ventilation is provided.

National Sentence Text: All flooring in storage areas described in Sentence 3.3.6.6.(1) shall be constructed of noncombustible materials.
P/T Sentence Text: All flooring in storage areas described in Sentence 3.3.6.6.(1) shall be constructed of noncombustible materials.

National Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that will cause the ammonium nitrate to become unstable, may corrode or deteriorate by reason of contact with the ammonium nitrate, or will become impregnated with the ammonium nitrate. (See Note A-3.3.6.6.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that will cause the ammonium nitrate to become unstable, may corrode or deteriorate by reason of contact with the ammonium nitrate, or will become impregnated with the ammonium nitrate.

National Sentence Text: Floors in areas where dangerous goods are stored shall be constructed of impermeable materials to prevent the absorption of chemicals.
P/T Sentence Text: Floors in areas where dangerous goods are stored shall be constructed of impermeable materials to prevent the absorption of chemicals.

National Sentence Text: In process plants, areas where unstable liquids are handled or where small-scale unit chemical processes occur shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: In process plants, areas where unstable liquids are handled or where small-scale unit chemical processes occur shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Process plants where Class I and II flammable liquids and combustible liquids are handled shall not be constructed with basements or covered pits.
P/T Sentence Text: Process plants where Class I and II flammable liquids and combustible liquids are handled shall not be constructed with basements or covered pits.

National Sentence Text: Exit facilities complying with this Section shall be provided from every floor area that is intended for occupancy. (See Note A-3.4.1.1.(1).) (See Note A-3.4.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exit facilities complying with this Section shall be provided from every floor area that is intended for occupancy. (See Note A-3.4.1.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.1.2.(2), if more than one exit is required from a floor area, each exit shall be separate from every other exit leading from that floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.1.2.(2), if more than one exit is required from a floor area, each exit shall be separate from every other exit leading from that floor area.

National Sentence Text: If more than 2 exits are provided from a floor area, exits are permitted to converge in conformance with Sentence 3.4.3.1.(2), provided the cumulative capacity of the converging exits does not contribute more than 50% of the total required exit width for the floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: If more than 2 exits are provided from a floor area, exits are permitted to converge in conformance with Sentence 3.4.3.1.(2), provided the cumulative capacity of the converging exits does not contribute more than 50% of the total required exit width for the floor area.

National Sentence Text: Access to exits shall conform to Section 3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Access to exits shall conform to part 3.

National Sentence Text: Subject to the requirements of this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following, used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway, an exterior passageway, an exterior ramp, an exterior stairway, a fire escape (conforming to Subsection 3.4.7.), a horizontal exit, an interior passageway, an interior ramp, or an interior stairway.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to the requirements of this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following, used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway, an exterior passageway, an exterior ramp, an exterior stairway, a fire escape (conforming to part 3.), a horizontal exit, an interior passageway, an interior ramp, or an interior stairway.

National Sentence Text: Access to an exterior exit passageway from a floor area shall be through exit doors at the floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: Access to an exterior exit passageway from a floor area shall be through exit doors at the floor level.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.1.6.(2), horizontal exits shall not comprise more than one half of the required number of exits from any floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.1.6.(2), horizontal exits shall not comprise more than one half of the required number of exits from any floor area.

National Sentence Text: In a hospital or nursing home with treatment, horizontal exits serving patients’ sleeping rooms shall comprise not more than two thirds of the required number of exits from any floor area. (See Note A-3.4.1.6.(2).) (See Note A-3.4.1.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: In a hospital or nursing home with treatment, horizontal exits serving patients’ sleeping rooms shall comprise not more than two thirds of the required number of exits from any floor area. (See Note A-3.4.1.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: A slide escape shall not be erected on any building as a required exit, but is permitted to be provided as an additional egress facility if unusual hazards are foreseen.
P/T Sentence Text: A slide escape shall not be erected on any building as a required exit, but is permitted to be provided as an additional egress facility if unusual hazards are foreseen.

National Sentence Text: Glass and transparent panels in an exit shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Article 3.3.1.19. for glass and transparent panels in an access to exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass and transparent panels in an exit shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Article 3.3.1.19. for glass and transparent panels in an access to exit.

National Sentence Text: No mirror shall be placed in or adjacent to any exit in a manner that would confuse the direction of exit.
P/T Sentence Text: No mirror shall be placed in or adjacent to any exit in a manner that would confuse the direction of exit.

National Sentence Text: Combustible glazing is not permitted in wall or ceiling assemblies or in closures used to construct an exit enclosure.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible glazing is not permitted in wall or ceiling assemblies or in closures used to construct an exit enclosure.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.2.1.(2)to 3.4.2.1.(4), every floor area intended for occupancy shall be served by at least 2 exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.2.1.(2) to 3.4.2.1.(4), every floor area intended for occupancy shall be served by at least 2 exits .

National Sentence Text: A floor area in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height, is permitted to be served by one exit provided the total occupant load served by the exit is not more than 60, and in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, the floor area and the travel distance are not more than the values in Table 3.4.2.1.-A, or in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout the travel distance is not more than 25 m, and the floor area is not more than the value in Table 3.4.2.1.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: A floor area in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height, is permitted to be served by one exit provided the total occupant load served by the exit is not more than 60, and in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, the floor area and the travel distance are not more than the values in Table 3.4.2.1.-A, or in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout the travel distance is not more than 25 m, and the floor area is not more than the value in Table 3.4.2.1.-B.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(4), if Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2) permits a single exit from a floor area classified as Group B or Group C occupancy, the exit shall be an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(4), if Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2) permits a single exit from a floor area classified as Group B or Group C occupancy, the exit shall be an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 3.4.2.1.(1)and 3.4.2.1.(2) are permitted to be waived for dwelling units that have an access to exit conforming to Sentences 3.3.4.4.(1)to 3.3.4.4.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 3.4.2.1.(1) and 3.4.2.1.(2) are permitted to be waived for dwelling units that have an access to exit conforming to Sentences 3.3.4.4.(1) to 3.3.4.4.(4).

National Sentence Text: Exits are not required directly from rooftop enclosures that are provided with access to exits in conformance with Sentences 3.3.1.3.(5)and 3.3.1.3.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: Exits are not required directly from rooftop enclosures that are provided with access to exits in conformance with Sentences 3.3.1.3.(5)and 3.3.1.3.(6).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.2.2.(2)and 3.4.2.2.(3), the space above a mezzanine shall be served by means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level on the same basis as floor areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.2.2.(2) and 3.4.2.2.(3), the space above a mezzanine shall be served by means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level on the same basis as floor areas.

National Sentence Text: The means of egress from a mezzanine need not conform to Sentence 3.4.2.2.(1), provided the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted in Sentence 3.2.8.2.(1), the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60, the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits stated in Table 3.4.2.2., and the distance limits stated in Table 3.4.2.2. measured along the path of travel are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks, if the space is served by a single egress door, or the egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by 2 or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The means of egress from a mezzanine need not conform to Sentence 3.4.2.2.(1), provided the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted in Sentence 3.2.8.2.(1), the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60, the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits stated in Table 3.4.2.2., and the distance limits stated in Table 3.4.2.2. measured along the path of travel are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks, if the space is served by a single egress door, or the egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by 2 or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1).

National Sentence Text: At least half of the required means of egress from a mezzanine shall comply with Sentence 3.4.2.2.(1) if the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a fire separation as permitted by Sentence 3.2.8.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: At least half of the required means of egress from a mezzanine shall comply with Sentence 3.4.2.2.(1) if the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a fire separation as permitted by Sentence 3.2.8.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.2.3.(2), the least distance between 2 exits from a floor area shall be one half the maximum diagonal dimension of the floor area, but need not be more than 9 m for a floor area having a public corridor, or one half the maximum diagonal dimension of the floor area, but not less than 9 m for all other floor areas. (See Note A-3.4.2.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.2.3.(2), the least distance between 2 exits from a floor area shall be one half the maximum diagonal dimension of the floor area, but need not be more than 9 m for a floor area having a public corridor, or one half the maximum diagonal dimension of the floor area, but not less than 9 m for all other floor areas.

National Sentence Text: Exits need not comply with Sentence 3.4.2.3.(1) where the floor area is divided so that not less than one third of the floor area is on each side of a fire separation, and it is necessary to pass through the fire separation to travel from one exit to another exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Exits need not comply with Sentence 3.4.2.3.(1) where the floor area is divided so that not less than one third of the floor area is on each side of a fire separation, and it is necessary to pass through the fire separation to travel from one exit to another exit.

National Sentence Text: The minimum distance between exits referred to in Sentence 3.4.2.3.(1) shall be the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the exits, assuming that the smoke will not penetrate an intervening fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum distance between exits referred to in Sentence 3.4.2.3.(1) shall be the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the exits, assuming that the smoke will not penetrate an intervening fire separation.

National Sentence Text: The distance between 2 exterior discharges of exit stairs serving the same floor area shall be not less than 9 m, or not less than 6 m, where the building is sprinklered throughout, and the 2 exterior discharges are located within 15 m of a street.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance between 2 exterior discharges of exit stairs serving the same floor area shall be not less than 9 m, or not less than 6 m, where the building is sprinklered throughout, and the 2 exterior discharges are located within 15 m of a street.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to the exit.

National Sentence Text: The travel distance from a suite or a room not within a suite is permitted to be measured from an egress door of the suite or room to the nearest exit, provided the suite or room is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, or which is not required to have a fire-resistance rating, in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout, and the egress door opens onto an exterior passageway, a corridor used by the public that is separated from the remainder of the floor area in conformance with the requirements in Article 3.3.1.4. for the separation of public corridors, or a public corridor that is separated from the remainder of the floor area in conformance with Article 3.3.1.4. (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: The travel distance from a suite or a room not within a suite is permitted to be measured from an egress door of the suite or room to the nearest exit, provided the suite or room is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, or which is not required to have a fire-resistance rating, in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout, and the egress door opens onto an exterior passageway, a corridor used by the public that is separated from the remainder of the floor area in conformance with the requirements in Article 3.3.1.4. for the separation of public corridors, or a public corridor that is separated from the remainder of the floor area in conformance with Article 3.3.1.4. (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b)).

National Sentence Text: Travel distance to an exit shall be not more than 50 m from any point in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8).
P/T Sentence Text: Travel distance to an exit shall be not more than 50 m from any point in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.2.5.(2)and 3.3.2.5.(6), if more than one exit is required from a floor area, the exits shall be located so that the travel distance to at least one exit shall be not more than 25 m in a high-hazard industrial occupancy, 40 m in a business and personal services occupancy, 45 m in a floor area that contains an occupancy other than a high-hazard industrial occupancy, provided it is sprinklered throughout, 105 m in any floor area, served by a public corridor, in which rooms and suites are not separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation, provided the public corridor is not less than 9 m wide, the ceiling height in the public corridor is not less than 4 m above all floor surfaces, the building is sprinklered throughout, and not more than one half of the required egress doorways from a room or suite open into the public corridor if the room or suite is required to have more than one egress doorway, 60 m in any storage garage that conforms to the requirements of Article 3.2.2.90., and 30 m in any floor area other than those referred to in Clauses 3.4.2.5.(1)(a)to 3.4.2.5.(1)(e).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.2.5.(2) and 3.3.2.5.(6), if more than one exit is required from a floor area, the exits shall be located so that the travel distance to at least one exit shall be not more than 25 m in a high-hazard industrial occupancy, 40 m in a business and personal services occupancy, 45 m in a floor area that contains an occupancy other than a high-hazard industrial occupancy, provided it is sprinklered throughout, 105 m in any floor area, served by a public corridor, in which rooms and suites are not separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation, provided the public corridor is not less than 9 m wide, the ceiling height in the public corridor is not less than 4 m above all floor surfaces, the building is sprinklered throughout, and not more than one half of the required egress doorways from a room or suite open into the public corridor if the room or suite is required to have more than one egress doorway, 60 m in any storage garage that conforms to the requirements of Article 3.2.2.90., and 30 m in any floor area other than those referred to in Clauses 3.4.2.5.(1) to 3.4.2.5.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except for a high-hazard industrial occupancy, Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) need not apply if exits are placed along the perimeter of the floor area and are not more than 60 m apart, measured along the perimeter, provided each main aisle in the floor area leads directly to an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a high-hazard industrial occupancy, Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) need not apply if exits are placed along the perimeter of the floor area and are not more than 60 m apart, measured along the perimeter, provided each main aisle in the floor area leads directly to an exit.

National Sentence Text: Exits shall be located and arranged so that they are clearly visible or their locations are clearly indicated and they are accessible at all times.
P/T Sentence Text: Exits shall be located and arranged so that they are clearly visible or their locations are clearly indicated and they are accessible at all times.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, at least one door at every principal entrance to a building providing access from the exterior at ground level shall be designed in accordance with the requirements for exits.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, at least one door at every principal entrance to a building providing access from the exterior at ground level shall be designed in accordance with the requirements for exits.

National Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered throughout in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.12.(1), the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one half of the required exit width.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered throughout in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.12.(1), the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one half of the required exit width.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining the aggregate width of exits, the occupant load of every room or floor area shall be determined in conformance with Subsection 3.1.17.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining the aggregate width of exits, the occupant load of every room or floor area shall be determined in conformance with part 3.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.3.2.(4), the required exit width shall be cumulative if 2 or more exits converge.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.3.2.(4), the required exit width shall be cumulative if 2 or more exits converge.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.3.2.(3), the minimum aggregate required width of exits serving floor areas intended for assembly occupancies, residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies, mercantile occupancies, and industrial occupancies shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 6.1 mm per person for ramps with a slope of not more than 1 in 8, doorways, corridors and passageways, 8 mm per person for a stair consisting of steps whose rise is not more than 180 mm and whose run is not less than 280 mm, or 9.2 mm per person for ramps with a slope of more than 1 in 8, or stairs, other than stairs conforming to Clause 3.4.3.2.(1)(b).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.3.2.(3), the minimum aggregate required width of exits serving floor areas intended for assembly occupancies, residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies, mercantile occupancies, and industrial occupancies shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 6.1 mm per person for ramps with a slope of not more than 1 in 8, doorways, corridors and passageways, 8 mm per person for a stair consisting of steps whose rise is not more than 180 mm and whose run is not less than 280 mm, or 9.2 mm per person for ramps with a slope of more than 1 in 8, or stairs, other than stairs conforming to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: The minimum aggregate width of exits serving floor areas intended for a care, treatment or detention occupancy shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 18.4 mm per person.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum aggregate width of exits serving floor areas intended for a care, treatment or detention occupancy shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 18.4 mm per person.

National Sentence Text: The minimum aggregate width of means of egress serving a Group A, Division 4 occupancy shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 1.8 mm per person for aisles, stairs other than exit stairs, and ramps and passageways in vomitories and exits, and 2.4 mm per person for exit stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum aggregate width of means of egress serving a Group A, Division 4 occupancy shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 1.8 mm per person for aisles, stairs other than exit stairs, and ramps and passageways in vomitories and exits, and 2.4 mm per person for exit stairs.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.4.3.2.(5)and 3.4.3.2.(6), the required exit width need not be cumulative in an exit serving 2 or more floor areas located one above the other.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.4.3.2.(5) and 3.4.3.2.(6), the required exit width need not be cumulative in an exit serving 2 or more floor areas located one above the other.

National Sentence Text: The required exit width for an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serving more than one balcony level shall conform to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: The required exit width for an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serving more than one balcony level shall conform to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6).

National Sentence Text: The required exit width for exit stairs that serve interconnected floor space designed in accordance with Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8. shall be cumulative, unless the stairs provide not less than 0.3 m2 of area of treads and landings for each occupant of the interconnected floor space (see Note A-3.4.3.2.(6)(a)), or protected floor spaces conforming to Article 3.2.8.5. are provided at each floor level and the protected floor space on a floor level has not less than 0.5 m2 of space for each occupant of that floor level of the interconnected floor space. (See Note A-3.4.3.2.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: The required exit width for exit stairs that serve interconnected floor space designed in accordance with Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8. shall be cumulative, unless the stairs provide not less than 0.3 m2 of area of treads and landings for each occupant of the interconnected floor space (see Note A-3.4.3.2.(6)(a)), or protected floor spaces conforming to Article 3.2.8.5. are provided at each floor level and the protected floor space on a floor level has not less than 0.5 m2 of space for each occupant of that floor level of the interconnected floor space.

National Sentence Text: If more than one exit is required, every exit shall be considered as contributing not more than one half of the required exit width.
P/T Sentence Text: If more than one exit is required, every exit shall be considered as contributing not more than one half of the required exit width.

National Sentence Text: The minimum widths of exits shall conform to Tables 3.4.3.2.-Aand 3.4.3.2.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.8.3.6., the minimum widths of exits shall conform to Tables 3.4.3.2.-A and 3.4.3.2.-B.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as required by Article 3.8.3.6., the minimum widths of exits shall conform to Tables 3.4.3.2.-A and 3.4.3.2.-B.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.3.3.(2)and 3.4.3.3.(4), no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project into or be fixed within the required width of an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.3.3.(2) and 3.4.3.3.(4), no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project into or be fixed within the required width of an exit.

National Sentence Text: Swinging doors in their swing shall not reduce the required width of exit stairs or landings to less than 750 mm or reduce the width of an exit passageway to less than the minimum required width.
P/T Sentence Text: Swinging doors in their swing shall not reduce the required width of exit stairs or landings to less than 750 mm or reduce the width of an exit passageway to less than the minimum required width.

National Sentence Text: Doors shall be installed so that, when open, they do not diminish nor obstruct the required width of the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors shall be installed so that, when open, they do not diminish nor obstruct the required width of the exit.

National Sentence Text: Handrails and construction below handrails, including handrail supports and stair stringers, shall not project more than 100 mm into the required width of a means of egress. (See Note A-3.4.3.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails and construction below handrails, including handrail supports and stair stringers, shall not project more than 100 mm into the required width of a means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.3.4.(4)and 3.4.3.4.(5), every exit shall have a clear height over the clear width of the exit of not less than 2 050 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.3.4.(4) and 3.4.3.4.(5), every exit shall have a clear height over the clear width of the exit of not less than 2 050 mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height of stairways shall be measured vertically over the clear width of the stairway, from the straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest element above. (See Note A-9.8.7.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height of stairways shall be measured vertically over the clear width of the stairway, from the straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest element above. (See Note A-9.8.7.4.)

National Sentence Text: The clear height of landings shall be measured within the clear width of the landing vertically to the lowest element above.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height of landings shall be measured within the clear width of the landing vertically to the lowest element above.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.3.4.(5), the headroom clearance for doorways shall be not less than 2 030 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.3.4.(5), the headroom clearance for doorways shall be not less than 2 030 mm.

National Sentence Text: No door closer or other device shall be installed so as to reduce the headroom clearance of a doorway to less than 1 980 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: No door closer or other device shall be installed so as to reduce the headroom clearance of a doorway to less than 1 980 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.4.1.(2), Sentence 3.3.5.4.(3), Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2)and 3.4.4.3.(1), every exit shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required by Subsection 3.2.2., but not less than 45 min, for the floor assembly above the storey, or the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.4.1.(2), Sentence 3.3.5.4.(3), Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2)and 3.4.4.3.(1), every exit shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required by part 3., but not less than 45 min, for the floor assembly above the storey, or the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.4.4.1.(1) need not be more than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.4.4.1.(1) need not be more than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: If an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serves more than one balcony level, the exit stair shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.4.4.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: If an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serves more than one balcony level, the exit stair shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.4.4.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), no exit from a floor area above or below the first storey shall lead through a lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), no exit from a floor area above or below the first storey shall lead through a lobby.

National Sentence Text: Not more than one exit from a floor area is permitted to lead through a lobby, provided the lobby floor is not more than 4.5 m above grade, the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors is not more than 15 m, the adjacent rooms or premises having direct access to the lobby do not contain a care, residential or industrial occupancy, the lobby is not located within an interconnected floor space other than as described in Sentence 3.2.8.2.(6), the lobby conforms to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms and storage rooms are permitted to open onto the lobby, the fire separation between the lobby and a room used for the sole purpose of control and supervision of the building need not have a fire-resistance rating, the fire separation between the lobby and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open onto the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating provided the lobby and adjacent occupancies are sprinklered, and passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby, provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading passengers, and a fire separation, constructed in accordance with Sentence 3.4.4.1.(1), is maintained between the lobby and any exit permitted by this Sentence to lead through the lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than one exit from a floor area is permitted to lead through a lobby, provided the lobby floor is not more than 4.5 m above grade, the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors is not more than 15 m, the adjacent rooms or premises having direct access to the lobby do not contain a care, residential or industrial occupancy, the lobby is not located within an interconnected floor space other than as described in Sentence 3.2.8.2.(6), the lobby conforms to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms and storage rooms are permitted to open onto the lobby, the fire separation between the lobby and a room used for the sole purpose of control and supervision of the building need not have a fire-resistance rating, the fire separation between the lobby and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open onto the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating provided the lobby and adjacent occupancies are sprinklered, and passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby, provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading passengers, and a fire separation, constructed in accordance with Sentence 3.4.4.1.(1), is maintained between the lobby and any exit permitted by this Sentence to lead through the lobby.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 3.4.4.1.(1)and 3.2.3.13.(1)and 3.2.3.13.(3) do not apply to an exterior exit passageway provided not less than 50% of the exterior side is open to the outdoors, and an exit stair is provided at each end of the passageway.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 3.4.4.1.(1) and 3.2.3.13.(1) and 3.2.3.13.(3) do not apply to an exterior exit passageway provided not less than 50% of the exterior side is open to the outdoors, and an exit stair is provided at each end of the passageway.

National Sentence Text: A fire separation that separates an exit from the remainder of the building shall have no openings except for standpipe and sprinkler piping, electrical wires and cables, totally enclosed noncombustible raceways and noncombustible piping that serve only the exit, openings required by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6., exit doorways, and wired glass and glass block permitted by Article 3.1.8.16.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation that separates an exit from the remainder of the building shall have no openings except for standpipe and sprinkler piping, electrical wires and cables, totally enclosed noncombustible raceways and noncombustible piping that serve only the exit, openings required by the provisions of part 3., exit doorways, and wired glass and glass block permitted by Article 3.1.8.16.

National Sentence Text: Exits within scissors stairs and other contiguous exit stairways shall be separated from each other by a smoke-tight fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly through which they pass.
P/T Sentence Text: Exits within scissors stairs and other contiguous exit stairways shall be separated from each other by a smoke-tight fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly through which they pass.

National Sentence Text: Fire separations separating contiguous stairs described in Sentence 3.4.4.4.(2) shall not be pierced by doorways, ductwork, piping or any other openings that affect the continuity of the separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire separations separating contiguous stairs described in Sentence 3.4.4.4.(2) shall not be pierced by doorways, ductwork, piping or any other openings that affect the continuity of the separation.

National Sentence Text: A fuel-fired appliance shall not be installed in an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: A fuel-fired appliance shall not be installed in an exit.

National Sentence Text: An exit shall not be used as a plenum for a heating, ventilating or air-conditioning system.
P/T Sentence Text: An exit shall not be used as a plenum for a heating, ventilating or air-conditioning system.

National Sentence Text: An exit shall be designed for no purpose other than for exiting, except that an exit is permitted also to be designed to serve as an access to a floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: An exit shall be designed for no purpose other than for exiting, except that an exit is permitted also to be designed to serve as an access to a floor area.

National Sentence Text: A service room shall not open directly into an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: A service room shall not open directly into an exit.

National Sentence Text: Storage rooms, washrooms, toilet rooms, laundry rooms and similar ancillary rooms shall not open directly into an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage rooms, washrooms, toilet rooms, laundry rooms and similar ancillary rooms shall not open directly into an exit.

National Sentence Text: Service spaces referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8) shall not open directly into an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Service spaces referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8) shall not open directly into an exit.

National Sentence Text: Every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over or adjacent to it if the exit serves a building more than 2 storeys in building height, a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over or adjacent to it if the exit serves a building more than 2 storeys in building height, a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Every exit sign shall be visible on approach to the exit, consist of a green and white or lightly tinted graphical symbol meeting the colour specifications referred to in ISO 3864-1:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Part 1: Design principles for safety signs and safety markings and conform to ISO 7010:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Registered safety signs for the following symbols (see Note A-3.4.5.1.(2)(c)): E001 emergency exit left, E002 emergency exit right, E005 90-degree directional arrow, and E006 45-degree directional arrow.
P/T Sentence Text: Every exit sign shall be visible on approach to the exit, consist of a green and white or lightly tinted graphical symbol meeting the colour specifications referred to in ISO 3864-1:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Part 1: Design principles for safety signs and safety markings and conform to ISO 7010:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Registered safety signs for the following symbols (see Note A-3.4.5.1.(2)(c)): E001 emergency exit left, E002 emergency exit right, E005 90-degree directional arrow, and E006 45-degree directional arrow.

National Sentence Text: Internally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated and where illumination of the sign is powered by an electrical circuit, be constructed in conformance with CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment or where illumination of the sign is not powered by an electrical circuit, be constructed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S572-17 Photoluminescent and Self-Luminous Exit Signs and Path Marking Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Internally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated and where illumination of the sign is powered by an electrical circuit, be constructed in conformance with CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment or where illumination of the sign is not powered by an electrical circuit, be constructed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S572-17 Photoluminescent and Self-Luminous Exit Signs and Path Marking Systems

National Sentence Text: Externally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated and be constructed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S572-17 Photoluminescent and Self-Luminous Exit Signs and Path Marking Systems (See Note A-3.4.5.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Externally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated and be constructed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S572-17 Photoluminescent and Self-Luminous Exit Signs and Path Marking Systems (See Note A-3.4.5.1.(4).)

National Sentence Text: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall serve no equipment other than emergency equipment, and be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Article 3.2.7.4.
P/T Sentence Text: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall serve no equipment other than emergency equipment, and be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Article 3.2.7.4.

National Sentence Text: Where no exit is visible from a public corridor, from a corridor used by the public in a Group A or B major occupancy, or from principal routes serving an open floor area having an occupant load of more than 150, an exit sign conforming to Clauses 3.4.5.1.(2)(b)and 3.4.5.1.(2)(c) with an arrow or pointer indicating the direction of egress shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where no exit is visible from a public corridor, from a corridor used by the public in a Group A or B major occupancy, or from principal routes serving an open floor area having an occupant load of more than 150, an exit sign conforming to Clauses 3.4.5.1.(2)and 3.4.5.1.(2) with an arrow or pointer indicating the direction of egress shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Except for egress doorways described in Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4), an exit sign conforming to Sentences 3.4.5.1.(2)to 3.4.5.1.(5) shall be placed over or adjacent to every egress doorway from rooms with an occupant load of more than 60 in Group A, Division 1 occupancies, dance halls, licensed beverage establishments, and other similar occupancies that, when occupied, have lighting levels below that which would provide easy identification of the egress doorway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for egress doorways described in Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4), an exit sign conforming to Sentences 3.4.5.1.(2)to 3.4.5.1.(5) shall be placed over or adjacent to every egress doorway from rooms with an occupant load of more than 60 in Group A, Division 1 occupancies, dance halls, licensed beverage establishments, and other similar occupancies that, when occupied, have lighting levels below that which would provide easy identification of the egress doorway.

National Sentence Text: In a building more than 2 storeys in building height, any part of an exit ramp or stairway that continues up or down past the lowest exit level shall have a posted sign clearly indicating that it does not lead to an exit. (See Note A-3.4.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: In a building more than 2 storeys in building height, any part of an exit ramp or stairway that continues up or down past the lowest exit level shall have a posted sign clearly indicating that it does not lead to an exit.

National Sentence Text: The surfaces of ramps, and landings and treads shall have a finish that is slip resistant, and if accessible to the public, shall have either a colour contrast or a distinctive pattern to demarcate the leading edge of the tread and the leading edge of the landing, as well as the beginning and end of a ramp.
P/T Sentence Text: The surfaces of ramps, and landings and treads shall have a finish that is slip resistant, and if accessible to the public, shall have either a colour contrast or a distinctive pattern to demarcate the leading edge of the tread and the leading edge of the landing, as well as the beginning and end of a ramp.

National Sentence Text: Treads and landings of exterior exit stairs more than 10 m high shall be designed to be free of ice and snow accumulations.
P/T Sentence Text: Treads and landings of exterior exit stairs more than 10 m high shall be designed to be free of ice and snow accumulations.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.15.(1), every flight of interior stairs shall have not less than 3 risers.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.15.(1), every flight of interior stairs shall have not less than 3 risers.

National Sentence Text: No flight of stairs shall have a vertical rise of more than 3.7 m between floors or landings, except that a flight of stairs serving as an exit in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy shall have a vertical rise not more than 2.4 m between floors or landings.
P/T Sentence Text: No flight of stairs shall have a vertical rise of more than 3.7 m between floors or landings, except that a flight of stairs serving as an exit in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy shall have a vertical rise not more than 2.4 m between floors or landings.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.3.(3), a landing shall be provided at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, at the top and bottom of every section of ramp, where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp, where a ramp opens onto a stair, and where a stair opens onto a ramp.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.3.(3), a landing shall be provided at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, at the top and bottom of every section of ramp, where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp, where a ramp opens onto a stair, and where a stair opens onto a ramp.

National Sentence Text: A landing may be omitted at the bottom of an exterior stair or ramp, provided there is no gate, door or fixed obstruction within the lesser of the width of the stair or ramp, or 1 100 mm. (See Note A-3.4.6.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: A landing may be omitted at the bottom of an exterior stair or ramp, provided there is no gate, door or fixed obstruction within the lesser of the width of the stair or ramp, or 1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.4.(2), a landing shall be at least as wide and as long as the width of the stairway in which it occurs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.4.(2), a landing shall be at least as wide and as long as the width of the stairway in which it occurs.

National Sentence Text: In a straight stairway and in a stairway that turns less than 90°, the length of the landing need not be more than the lesser of the required width of stair, or 1 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: In a straight stairway and in a stairway that turns less than 90°, the length of the landing need not be more than the lesser of the required width of stair, or 1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: The length of a landing shall be measured perpendicular to the nosing of adjacent steps, at a distance equal to half the length required in Sentence 3.4.6.4.(2), from the narrow edge of the landing.
P/T Sentence Text: The length of a landing shall be measured perpendicular to the nosing of adjacent steps, at a distance equal to half the length required in Sentence 3.4.6.4.(2), from the narrow edge of the landing.

National Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway empties onto a ramp through a side wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp, and for a distance of 300 mm on either side of the wall opening, except one side if it abuts on an end wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway empties onto a ramp through a side wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp, and for a distance of 300 mm on either side of the wall opening, except one side if it abuts on an end wall.

National Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway empties onto a ramp through an end wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp and along its length for not less than 900 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway empties onto a ramp through an end wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp and along its length for not less than 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: One handrail shall be provided on stairs that are less than 1 100 mm in width.
P/T Sentence Text: One handrail shall be provided on stairs that are less than 1 100 mm in width.

National Sentence Text: One handrail shall be provided on each side of stairs that are 1 100 mm or more in width, curved flights of any width, and ramps.
P/T Sentence Text: One handrail shall be provided on each side of stairs that are 1 100 mm or more in width, curved flights of any width, and ramps.

National Sentence Text: In addition to Sentence 3.4.6.5.(2), intermediate handrails shall be provided so that a handrail is reachable within 750 mm of all portions of the required exit width, at least one portion of the stair or ramp between two handrails is the minimum width required for stairways or ramps (see Sentences 3.4.3.2.(8)and 3.4.3.3.(4)), and all other portions of the stair or ramp between two handrails have a clear width of 510 mm or more.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to Sentence 3.4.6.5.(2), intermediate handrails shall be provided so that a handrail is reachable within 750 mm of all portions of the required exit width, at least one portion of the stair or ramp between two handrails is the minimum width required for stairways or ramps (see Sentences 3.4.3.2.(8)and 3.4.3.3.(4)), and all other portions of the stair or ramp between two handrails have a clear width of 510 mm or more.

National Sentence Text: Where a stair or ramp is wider than its required exit width, handrails shall be located along the most direct path of travel. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a stair or ramp is wider than its required exit width, handrails shall be located along the most direct path of travel. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Handrails shall be continuously graspable along their entire length, be free of any sharp or abrasive elements, and have a circular cross-section with an outside diameter not less than 30 mm and not more than 43 mm, or a non-circular cross-section with a perimeter not less than 100 mm and not more than 125 mm and whose largest cross-sectional dimension is not more than 45 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails shall be continuously graspable along their entire length, be free of any sharp or abrasive elements, and have a circular cross-section with an outside diameter not less than 30 mm and not more than 43 mm, or a non-circular cross-section with a perimeter not less than 100 mm and not more than 125 mm and whose largest cross-sectional dimension is not more than 45 mm.

National Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs, on aisles with steps and on ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair or aisle step served by the handrail (see Note A-9.8.7.4.), or the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs, on aisles with steps and on ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair or aisle step served by the handrail (see Note A-9.8.7.4.), or the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.5.(8)and Clause 3.8.3.5.(1)(e), the height of handrails on stairs, on aisles with steps and on ramps shall be not less than 865 mm, and not more than 1 070 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.5.(8) and Sentence 3.8.3.5.(1), the height of handrails on stairs, on aisles with steps and on ramps shall be not less than 865 mm, and not more than 1 070 mm .

National Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence 3.4.6.5.(7).
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence 3.4.6.5.(7).

National Sentence Text: Required handrails shall be continuously graspable throughout the length of a ramp, and a flight of stairs, from the bottom riser to the top riser. (See Note A-9.8.7.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Required handrails shall be continuously graspable throughout the length of a ramp, and a flight of stairs, from the bottom riser to the top riser.

National Sentence Text: Except where interrupted by doorways, at least one handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of a stairway or ramp, including at landings. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where interrupted by doorways, at least one handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of a stairway or ramp, including at landings. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)

National Sentence Text: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)

National Sentence Text: At least one handrail at the side of a stairway or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of the stairway or ramp. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: At least one handrail at the side of a stairway or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of the stairway or ramp. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)

National Sentence Text: The clearance between a handrail and any surface behind it shall be not less than 50 mm, or 60 mm if the surface behind the handrail is rough or abrasive.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance between a handrail and any surface behind it shall be not less than 50 mm, or 60 mm if the surface behind the handrail is rough or abrasive.

National Sentence Text: Handrails and their supports shall be designed and constructed to withstand the loading values specified in Sentence 4.1.5.14.(7).
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails and their supports shall be designed and constructed to withstand the loading values specified in Sentence 4.1.5.14.(7).

National Sentence Text: A ramp shall have handrails on both sides.
P/T Sentence Text: A ramp shall have handrails on both sides.

National Sentence Text: Every exit shall have a wall or a well-secured guard on each side, where there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2. (See Note A-9.8.8.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Every exit shall have a wall or a well-secured guard on each side, where there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.4.6.6.(4), the height of guards for exit stairs and exit ramps as well as their landings shall be not less than 1 070 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.4.6.6.(4), the height of guards for exit stairs and exit ramps as well as their landings shall be not less than 1 070 mm.

National Sentence Text: The height of guards shall be measured vertically to the top of the guard from a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings, or the surface of the ramp or landing.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of guards shall be measured vertically to the top of the guard from a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings, or the surface of the ramp or landing.

National Sentence Text: The height of guards for exterior stairs and landings more than 10 m above adjacent ground level shall be not less than 1 500 mm measured vertically to the top of the guard from the surface of the landing or from a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of guards for exterior stairs and landings more than 10 m above adjacent ground level shall be not less than 1 500 mm measured vertically to the top of the guard from the surface of the landing or from a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.18.(3) and Articles 3.3.4.7.and 3.3.5.10.,guards in exits shall not have any openings that permit the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is more than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.18.(3) and Articles 3.3.4.7. and 3.3.5.10.,guards in exits shall not have any openings that permit the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is more than 100 mm.
