National Sentence Text: In a stairway, a window for which the distance measured vertically between the bottom of the window and a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings is less than 900 mm, or a window that extends to less than 1 070 mm above the landing, shall be protected by a guard that is located approximately 900 mm above a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings, or not less than 1 070 mm high measured to the top of the guard from the surface of the landing, or be fixed in position and designed to resist the lateral design loads specified for guards and walls in Articles 4.1.5.14.and 4.1.5.16.
P/T Sentence Text: In a stairway, a window for which the distance measured vertically between the bottom of the window and a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings is less than 900 mm, or a window that extends to less than 1 070 mm above the landing, shall be protected by a guard that is located approximately 900 mm above a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings, or not less than 1 070 mm high measured to the top of the guard from the surface of the landing, or be fixed in position and designed to resist the lateral design loads specified for guards and walls in Articles 4.1.5.14.and 4.1.5.16.

National Sentence Text: Except for guards conforming to Article 3.3.5.10., guards that protect a level located more than one storey or 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level being protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).) (See also Article 3.8.3.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for guards conforming to Article 3.3.5.10., guards that protect a level located more than one storey or 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level being protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as required for aisles by Article 3.3.2.5., the maximum slope of a ramp shall be 1 in 10 in any assembly, care, treatment, detention or residential occupancy, 1 in 6 in an industrial occupancy, 1 in 8 in all other occupancies, and 1 in 10 for an exterior ramp. (See Note A-9.8.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required for aisles by Article 3.3.2.5., the maximum slope of a ramp shall be 1 in 10 in any assembly, care, treatment, detention or residential occupancy, 1 in 6 in an industrial occupancy, 1 in 8 in all other occupancies, and 1 in 10 for an exterior ramp.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted for dwelling units and by Sentence 3.4.7.5.(1) for fire escapes, steps for stairs shall have a run of not less than 280 mm between successive steps.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted for dwelling units and by Sentence 3.4.7.5.(1) for fire escapes, steps for stairs shall have a run of not less than 280 mm between successive steps.

National Sentence Text: Steps for stairs referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.8.(1) shall have a rise between successive treads not less than 125 mm and not more than 180 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Steps for stairs referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.8.(1) shall have a rise between successive treads not less than 125 mm and not more than 180 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.3.4.7. and except for fire escape stairs, stairs that are principally used for maintenance and service, and stairs that serve industrial occupancies other than storage garages, steps for stairs shall have no open risers.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.3.4.7. and except for fire escape stairs, stairs that are principally used for maintenance and service, and stairs that serve industrial occupancies other than storage garages, steps for stairs shall have no open risers.

National Sentence Text: Except in fire escape stairs and where an exterior stair adjoins a walkway as permitted in Sentence 3.4.6.3.(3), risers, measured as the vertical nosing-to-nosing distance, shall be of uniform height in any one flight, with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads or landings, and 10 mm between the tallest and shortest risers in a flight.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in fire escape stairs and where an exterior stair adjoins a walkway as permitted in Sentence 3.4.6.3.(3), risers, measured as the vertical nosing-to-nosing distance, shall be of uniform height in any one flight, with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads or landings, and 10 mm between the tallest and shortest risers in a flight.

National Sentence Text: Except in fire escape stairs, treads shall have a uniform run with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads, and 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in fire escape stairs, treads shall have a uniform run with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads, and 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.

National Sentence Text: Treads and risers shall not differ significantly in run and rise in successive flights in any stair system.
P/T Sentence Text: Treads and risers shall not differ significantly in run and rise in successive flights in any stair system.

National Sentence Text: The slope of treads or landings shall not exceed 1 in 50.
P/T Sentence Text: The slope of treads or landings shall not exceed 1 in 50.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.8.(10), the top of the nosing of stair treads shall have a rounded or beveled edge extending not less than 6 mm and not more than 13 mm measured horizontally from the front of the nosing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.8.(10), the top of the nosing of stair treads shall have a rounded or beveled edge extending not less than 6 mm and not more than 13 mm measured horizontally from the front of the nosing.

National Sentence Text: The front edge of stair treads in exits and public access to exits shall be at right angles to the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: The front edge of stair treads in exits and public access to exits shall be at right angles to the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: If resilient material is used to cover the nosing of a stair tread, the minimum rounded or beveled edge required by Sentence 3.4.6.8.(8) is permitted to be reduced to 3 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: If resilient material is used to cover the nosing of a stair tread, the minimum rounded or beveled edge required by Sentence 3.4.6.8.(8) is permitted to be reduced to 3 mm.

National Sentence Text: Exit stair flights shall consist solely of straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence 3.4.6.9.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Exit stair flights shall consist solely of straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence 3.4.6.9.(2).

National Sentence Text: A curved flight used as an exit shall have a handrail on each side, a minimum run of 240 mm, a run that conforms to Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread, and an inside radius that is not less than twice the stair width.
P/T Sentence Text: A curved flight used as an exit shall have a handrail on each side, a minimum run of 240 mm, a run that conforms to Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread, and an inside radius that is not less than twice the stair width.

National Sentence Text: Tapered treads shall have a consistent angle and uniform run and rise dimensions in accordance with the construction tolerances stipulated in Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread.
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads shall have a consistent angle and uniform run and rise dimensions in accordance with the construction tolerances stipulated in Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread.

National Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.
P/T Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.

National Sentence Text: The floor area on each side of a horizontal exit shall be sufficient to accommodate the occupants of both floor areas, allowing not less than 0.5 m2 of clear floor space per person, except that 1.5 m2 shall be provided for each person in a wheelchair and 2.5 m2 for each bedridden patient.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor area on each side of a horizontal exit shall be sufficient to accommodate the occupants of both floor areas, allowing not less than 0.5 m2 of clear floor space per person, except that 1.5 m2 shall be provided for each person in a wheelchair and 2.5 m2 for each bedridden patient.

National Sentence Text: If vestibules, enclosed balconies or bridges are used as parts of a horizontal exit, their clear width shall be not less than that of the exit doorways opening into them, except that handrails are not permitted to project into this clear width more than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: If vestibules, enclosed balconies or bridges are used as parts of a horizontal exit, their clear width shall be not less than that of the exit doorways opening into them, except that handrails are not permitted to project into this clear width more than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: In a horizontal exit where there is a difference in level between the connected floor areas, slopes not more than those specified for ramps in Article 3.4.6.7. are permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: In a horizontal exit where there is a difference in level between the connected floor areas, slopes not more than those specified for ramps in Article 3.4.6.7. are permitted to be used.

National Sentence Text: No stairs or steps shall be used in a horizontal exit.
P/T Sentence Text: No stairs or steps shall be used in a horizontal exit.

National Sentence Text: If 2 doors are provided in a horizontal exit that comprises a part of the required number of exits from the floor areas on both sides of the exit the doors shall be mounted adjacent to each other with the door on the right side in the direction of travel through the horizontal exit swinging in the direction of travel through the horizontal exit, and signs shall be provided on each side of the horizontal exit to indicate the door that swings in the direction of travel from that side. (See Note A-3.4.6.10.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: If 2 doors are provided in a horizontal exit that comprises a part of the required number of exits from the floor areas on both sides of the exit the doors shall be mounted adjacent to each other with the door on the right side in the direction of travel through the horizontal exit swinging in the direction of travel through the horizontal exit, and signs shall be provided on each side of the horizontal exit to indicate the door that swings in the direction of travel from that side.

National Sentence Text: If a horizontal exit utilizes bridges between buildings or outside balconies, the bridges or balconies shall conform to Article 3.2.3.19.
P/T Sentence Text: If a horizontal exit utilizes bridges between buildings or outside balconies, the bridges or balconies shall conform to Article 3.2.3.19.

National Sentence Text: The distance between a stair riser and the leading edge of a door during its swing shall be not less than 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance between a stair riser and the leading edge of a door during its swing shall be not less than 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.11.(3) and where doorways are used to confine the spillage of flammable liquids within a service room or within a room in an industrial occupancy, a threshold for a doorway in an exit shall be not more than 13 mm higher than the surrounding finished floor surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.11.(3) and where doorways are used to confine the spillage of flammable liquids within a service room or within a room in an industrial occupancy, a threshold for a doorway in an exit shall be not more than 13 mm higher than the surrounding finished floor surface.

National Sentence Text: Except for doors providing access to ground level as required by Clause 3.3.1.7.(1)(d)and 3.3.1.7.(1)(e), an exit door is permitted to open onto not more than one step which shall be not more than 150 mm high where there is a risk of blockage by ice or snow.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for doors providing access to ground level as required by Sentence 3.3.1.7.(1)and 3.3.1.7.(1), an exit door is permitted to open onto not more than one step which shall be not more than 150 mm high where there is a risk of blockage by ice or snow.

National Sentence Text: Exit doors shall be clearly identifiable. (See Note A-3.4.6.11.(4).) (See Note A-3.4.6.11.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exit doors shall be clearly identifiable. (See Note A-3.4.6.11.(4).)

National Sentence Text: No door leaf in an exit doorway with more than one leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: No door leaf in an exit doorway with more than one leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Where an exit door leading directly to the outside is subject to being obstructed by parked vehicles or storage because of its location, a visible sign or a physical barrier prohibiting such obstructions shall be installed on the exterior side of the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exit door leading directly to the outside is subject to being obstructed by parked vehicles or storage because of its location, a visible sign or a physical barrier prohibiting such obstructions shall be installed on the exterior side of the door.

National Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit and except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.12.(2) and Article 3.4.6.14., every exit door shall open in the direction of exit travel, and swing on its vertical axis.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit and except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.12.(2) and Article 3.4.6.14., every exit door shall open in the direction of exit travel, and swing on its vertical axis.

National Sentence Text: Exit doors need not conform to Sentence 3.4.6.12.(1), where they serve storage garages serving not more than one dwelling unit, they serve accessory buildings serving not more than one dwelling unit, they serve storage suites not more than 28 m2 in area that are on the first storey in warehousing buildings, and open directly outdoors at ground level, or they serve individual self-service storage units referred to in Section 3.9.
P/T Sentence Text: Exit doors need not conform to Sentence 3.4.6.12.(1), where they serve storage garages serving not more than one dwelling unit, they serve accessory buildings serving not more than one dwelling unit, they serve storage suites not more than 28 m2 in area that are on the first storey in warehousing buildings, and open directly outdoors at ground level, or they serve individual self-service storage units referred to in part 3.

National Sentence Text: An exit door that is normally required to be kept closed shall be provided with a self-closing mechanism, and shall never be secured in an open position except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.14.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: An exit door that is normally required to be kept closed shall be provided with a self-closing mechanism, and shall never be secured in an open position except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.14.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.6.14.(2)and 3.4.6.12.(2), an exit door leading directly to outdoors at ground level is permitted to be a sliding door provided it conforms to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.6.14.(2) and 3.4.6.12.(2), an exit door leading directly to outdoors at ground level is permitted to be a sliding door provided it conforms to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1).

National Sentence Text: An exit door serving a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, is permitted to be a sliding door that does not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1) provided it is designed to be released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.13.
P/T Sentence Text: An exit door serving a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, is permitted to be a sliding door that does not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1) provided it is designed to be released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.15.(3), a revolving door, if used, shall be collapsible, have hinged doors providing equivalent exiting capacity located adjacent to it, be used as an exit from the ground floor level only, not be used at the foot of any stairway, and have all glass in door leaves and enclosure panels conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.15.(3), a revolving door, if used, shall be collapsible, have hinged doors providing equivalent exiting capacity located adjacent to it, be used as an exit from the ground floor level only, not be used at the foot of any stairway, and have all glass in door leaves and enclosure panels conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.15.(3), a revolving door shall not be considered to have an exiting capacity for more than 45 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.15.(3), a revolving door shall not be considered to have an exiting capacity for more than 45 persons.

National Sentence Text: An electrically powered revolving door is not required to conform to Sentences 3.4.6.15.(1)and 3.4.6.15.(2) provided the door leaves will collapse and stop automatic rotation of the door system and not obstruct the doorway if a force not more than that specified in Sentence 3.4.6.16.(2) is applied at the centre of a door leaf, the door leaves are capable of being opened from inside the building without requiring keys, special devices, or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism, the allowable exiting capacity is based on the clear width of passage through the door enclosure when the doors are fully collapsed, a permanent sign, whose centre line is between 1 000 mm and 1 500 mm above the floor, is placed on each face of each door leaf indicating the method for collapsing the door leaf in an emergency, and glass used for door leaves and enclosure panels is safety glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Sentence Text: An electrically powered revolving door is not required to conform to Sentences 3.4.6.15.(1)and 3.4.6.15.(2) provided the door leaves will collapse and stop automatic rotation of the door system and not obstruct the doorway if a force not more than that specified in Sentence 3.4.6.16.(2) is applied at the centre of a door leaf, the door leaves are capable of being opened from inside the building without requiring keys, special devices, or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism, the allowable exiting capacity is based on the clear width of passage through the door enclosure when the doors are fully collapsed, a permanent sign, whose centre line is between 1 000 mm and 1 500 mm above the floor, is placed on each face of each door leaf indicating the method for collapsing the door leaf in an emergency, and glass used for door leaves and enclosure panels is safety glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass

National Sentence Text: Except for devices on doors serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone designed to be remotely released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.13., and except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.6.16.(4)and 3.4.6.16.(5) and Article 3.4.6.17., locking, latching and other fastening devices on a principal entrance door to a building as well as those on every exit door shall include release hardware complying with Clause 3.8.3.8.(1)(b) to permit the door to be readily opened from the inside with not more than one releasing operation and without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism. (See Note A-3.4.6.16.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for devices on doors serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone designed to be remotely released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.13., and except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.6.16.(4)and 3.4.6.16.(5) and Article 3.4.6.17., locking, latching and other fastening devices on a principal entrance door to a building as well as those on every exit door shall include release hardware complying with Sentence 3.8.3.8.(1) to permit the door to be readily opened from the inside with not more than one releasing operation and without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism. (See Note A-3.4.6.16.(1).)

National Sentence Text: If a door is equipped with a latching mechanism, a device that will release the latch and allow the door to swing wide open when a force of not more than 90 N is applied to the device in the direction of travel to the exit shall be installed on every exit door from a floor area containing an assembly occupancy having an occupant load more than 100, every door leading to an exit lobby from an exit stair shaft, and every exterior door leading from an exit stair shaft in a building having an occupant load more than 100, and every exit door from a floor area containing a high-hazard industrial occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: If a door is equipped with a latching mechanism, a device that will release the latch and allow the door to swing wide open when a force of not more than 90 N is applied to the device in the direction of travel to the exit shall be installed on every exit door from a floor area containing an assembly occupancy having an occupant load more than 100, every door leading to an exit lobby from an exit stair shaft, and every exterior door leading from an exit stair shaft in a building having an occupant load more than 100, and every exit door from a floor area containing a high-hazard industrial occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.8.3.6.(8), every exit door shall be designed and installed so that, when the latch is released, the door will open under a force of not more than 90 N, applied at the knob or other latch releasing device.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.8.3.6.(8), every exit door shall be designed and installed so that, when the latch is released, the door will open under a force of not more than 90 N, applied at the knob or other latch releasing device.

National Sentence Text: Electromagnetic locks that do not incorporate latches, pins or other similar devices to keep the door in the closed position are permitted to be installed on doors in Group B, Division 2 and Division 3 occupancies, provided the building is equipped with a fire alarm system, and sprinklered, the electromagnetic lock releases upon actuation of the alarm signal from the building’s fire alarm system, loss of its power supply and of power to its auxiliary controls, actuation of a manually operated switch that is readily accessible at a constantly attended location within the locked space, and actuation of the manual station installed within 0.5 m of each door and equipped with an auxiliary contact, which directly releases the electromagnetic lock, upon release, the electromagnetic lock requires manual resetting by actuation of the switch referred to in subclause 3.4.6.16.(5)(b)(iii), a legible sign with the words "EMERGENCY EXIT UNLOCKED BY FIRE ALARM" written in letters at least 25 mm high with a stroke at least 5 mm wide is permanently mounted on the door, the operation of any by-pass switch, where provided for testing of the fire alarm system, sets off an audible signal and a visual signal at the fire alarm annunciator panel and at the monitoring station referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), and emergency lighting is provided at the doors. (See Note A-3.4.6.16.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Electromagnetic locks that do not incorporate latches, pins or other similar devices to keep the door in the closed position are permitted to be installed on doors in Group B, Division 2 and Division 3 occupancies, provided the building is equipped with a fire alarm system, and sprinklered, the electromagnetic lock releases upon actuation of the alarm signal from the building’s fire alarm system, loss of its power supply and of power to its auxiliary controls, actuation of a manually operated switch that is readily accessible at a constantly attended location within the locked space, and actuation of the manual station installed within 0.5 m of each door and equipped with an auxiliary contact, which directly releases the electromagnetic lock, upon release, the electromagnetic lock requires manual resetting by actuation of the switch referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.16.(5), a legible sign with the words "EMERGENCY EXIT UNLOCKED BY FIRE ALARM" written in letters at least 25 mm high with a stroke at least 5 mm wide is permanently mounted on the door, the operation of any by-pass switch, where provided for testing of the fire alarm system, sets off an audible signal and a visual signal at the fire alarm annunciator panel and at the monitoring station referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), and emergency lighting is provided at the doors.

National Sentence Text: Door hardware for the operation of the doors referred to in this Section shall be installed at a height not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Door hardware for the operation of the doors referred to in this Section shall be installed at a height not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.

National Sentence Text: If a building is sprinklered throughout, the requirements of Sentence 3.4.6.16.(1) are permitted to be waived for exit and egress doors complying with Sentences 3.4.6.17.(2)to 3.4.6.17.(9) that serve a floor area or part of a floor area used exclusively for a bank, or the sale of retail merchandise. (See Note A-3.4.6.17.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a building is sprinklered throughout, the requirements of Sentence 3.4.6.16.(1) are permitted to be waived for exit and egress doors complying with Sentences 3.4.6.17.(2)to 3.4.6.17.(9) that serve a floor area or part of a floor area used exclusively for a bank, or the sale of retail merchandise.

National Sentence Text: Exit and egress doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1) shall be designed to prevent locking at any time that the part of the floor area that they serve is open to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Exit and egress doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1) shall be designed to prevent locking at any time that the part of the floor area that they serve is open to the public.

National Sentence Text: A sign with the words "This door shall not be locked at any time that the public is present" in letters not less than 50 mm high shall be permanently affixed to both sides of doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: A sign with the words "This door shall not be locked at any time that the public is present" in letters not less than 50 mm high shall be permanently affixed to both sides of doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1).

National Sentence Text: Exit and egress facilities complying with Sentences 3.4.6.17.(5)to 3.4.6.17.(9) shall be incorporated for egress by persons other than the public from a floor area or a part of a floor area referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1) during times when the public is neither present nor being admitted to the area that they serve.
P/T Sentence Text: Exit and egress facilities complying with Sentences 3.4.6.17.(5) to 3.4.6.17.(9) shall be incorporated for egress by persons other than the public from a floor area or a part of a floor area referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1) during times when the public is neither present nor being admitted to the area that they serve.

National Sentence Text: In exit and egress facilities referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(4), at least one door at each exit and egress location shall be operable in conformance with Sentence 3.4.6.16.(1), or be equipped with locks conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4) that release immediately if an alert signal or alarm signal is initiated in the fire alarm system, or the sprinkler system is actuated.
P/T Sentence Text: In exit and egress facilities referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(4), at least one door at each exit and egress location shall be operable in conformance with Sentence 3.4.6.16.(1), or be equipped with locks conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4) that release immediately if an alert signal or alarm signal is initiated in the fire alarm system, or the sprinkler system is actuated.

National Sentence Text: A door referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(5) shall be permanently and distinctly marked to indicate that it is an emergency exit.
P/T Sentence Text: A door referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(5) shall be permanently and distinctly marked to indicate that it is an emergency exit.

National Sentence Text: Exit and egress facilities required for evacuation of persons other than the public from a floor area or a part of a floor area referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1) shall have an aggregate width based on the maximum number of persons other than the public and determined in accordance with Articles 3.4.3.1.to 3.4.3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Exit and egress facilities required for evacuation of persons other than the public from a floor area or a part of a floor area referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1) shall have an aggregate width based on the maximum number of persons other than the public and determined in accordance with Articles 3.4.3.1.to 3.4.3.3.

National Sentence Text: Travel distance to an exit referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(7) shall not exceed the travel distance determined in accordance with Subsection 3.4.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Travel distance to an exit referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(7) shall not exceed the travel distance determined in accordance with part 3.

National Sentence Text: Exit and egress doors serving a floor area or part of a floor area referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1) are permitted to be equipped with locks that require keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism provided the doors do not lead into exit stairs, the doors do not lead from exit stairs to the exterior of the building, the doors do not serve any other occupancy, the area served contains at least one telephone that is accessible and in operation at all times, that is not coin or card operated, and marked to indicate that it is for emergency use, the area served is illuminated by normal power or by emergency power when the doors are locked, there are provisions that enable an announcement to be made throughout the area served before the locks are fastened, and the locks are designed for use during times that the building is not occupied.
P/T Sentence Text: Exit and egress doors serving a floor area or part of a floor area referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1) are permitted to be equipped with locks that require keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism provided the doors do not lead into exit stairs, the doors do not lead from exit stairs to the exterior of the building, the doors do not serve any other occupancy, the area served contains at least one telephone that is accessible and in operation at all times, that is not coin or card operated, and marked to indicate that it is for emergency use, the area served is illuminated by normal power or by emergency power when the doors are locked, there are provisions that enable an announcement to be made throughout the area served before the locks are fastened, and the locks are designed for use during times that the building is not occupied.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.4.6.18.(2), doors providing access to floor areas from exit stairs shall not have locking devices to prevent entry into any floor area from which the travel distance up or down to an unlocked door is more than 2 storeys.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.4.6.18.(2), doors providing access to floor areas from exit stairs shall not have locking devices to prevent entry into any floor area from which the travel distance up or down to an unlocked door is more than 2 storeys.

National Sentence Text: Doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.18.(1) are permitted to be equipped with electromagnetic locks, provided they comply with Sentences 3.4.6.16.(4)and 3.4.6.16.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.18.(1) are permitted to be equipped with electromagnetic locks, provided they comply with Sentences 3.4.6.16.(4) and 3.4.6.16.(5).

National Sentence Text: Doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.18.(1) shall be identified by a sign on the stairway side to indicate that they are openable from that side.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.18.(1) shall be identified by a sign on the stairway side to indicate that they are openable from that side.

National Sentence Text: Locked doors intended to prevent entry into a floor area from an exit stair shall be identified by a sign on the stairway side to indicate the location of the nearest unlocked door in each direction of travel, and be openable with a master key that fits all locking devices and is kept in a designated location accessible to firefighters or be provided with a wired glass panel not less than 0.0645 m2 in area and located not more than 300 mm from the door opening hardware.
P/T Sentence Text: Locked doors intended to prevent entry into a floor area from an exit stair shall be identified by a sign on the stairway side to indicate the location of the nearest unlocked door in each direction of travel, and be openable with a master key that fits all locking devices and is kept in a designated location accessible to firefighters or be provided with a wired glass panel not less than 0.0645 m2 in area and located not more than 300 mm from the door opening hardware.

National Sentence Text: Where access to floor areas through unlocked doors is required by Sentence 3.4.6.18.(1), it shall be possible for a person entering the floor area to have access through unlocked doors within the floor area to at least one other exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where access to floor areas through unlocked doors is required by Sentence 3.4.6.18.(1) , it shall be possible for a person entering the floor area to have access through unlocked doors within the floor area to at least one other exit.

National Sentence Text: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall be mounted permanently on the stair side of the wall at the latch side of doors to exit stair shafts, be not less than 60 mm high, raised approximately 0.7 mm above the surface, be located 1 500 mm from the finished floor and not more than 300 mm from the door, and be contrasting in colour with the surface to which they are applied (see Note A-3.4.6.19.(1)(d)). (see Note A-3.4.6.19.(1)(d))
P/T Sentence Text: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall be mounted permanently on the stair side of the wall at the latch side of doors to exit stair shafts, be not less than 60 mm high, raised approximately 0.7 mm above the surface, be located 1 500 mm from the finished floor and not more than 300 mm from the door, and be contrasting in colour with the surface to which they are applied (see Note A-3.4.6.19.(1)(d)).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.7.1.(2), fire escapes shall not be erected on a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.7.1.(2), fire escapes shall not be erected on a building.

National Sentence Text: If it is impracticable to provide one or more of the exit facilities listed in Article 3.4.1.4., fire escapes conforming to Articles 3.4.7.2.to 3.4.7.7. are permitted to serve floor areas in an existing building provided the floor areas served are not more than 2 storeys above ground level in care, treatment or detention occupancies, and 5 storeys above ground level in other occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: If it is impracticable to provide one or more of the exit facilities listed in Article 3.4.1.4., fire escapes conforming to Articles 3.4.7.2. to 3.4.7.7. are permitted to serve floor areas in an existing building provided the floor areas served are not more than 2 storeys above ground level in care, treatment or detention occupancies, and 5 storeys above ground level in other occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Fire escapes shall be of metal or concrete, of the stair type extending to ground level, constructed throughout in a strong substantial manner and securely fixed to the building, except that wooden fire escapes are permitted to be used on buildings of combustible construction if all posts and brackets are not less than 89 mm in their least dimension and all other woodwork is not less than 38 mm in its least dimension.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire escapes shall be of metal or concrete, of the stair type extending to ground level, constructed throughout in a strong substantial manner and securely fixed to the building, except that wooden fire escapes are permitted to be used on buildings of combustible construction if all posts and brackets are not less than 89 mm in their least dimension and all other woodwork is not less than 38 mm in its least dimension.

National Sentence Text: Access to fire escapes shall be from corridors through doors at floor level, except that access from a dwelling unit is permitted to be through a casement window having an unobstructed opening not less than 1 100 mm high by 550 mm wide with a sill height of not more than 900 mm above the inside floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Access to fire escapes shall be from corridors through doors at floor level, except that access from a dwelling unit is permitted to be through a casement window having an unobstructed opening not less than 1 100 mm high by 550 mm wide with a sill height of not more than 900 mm above the inside floor.

National Sentence Text: The clear area of a fire escape balcony onto which a door opens, shall be not less than 1 m2.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear area of a fire escape balcony onto which a door opens, shall be not less than 1 m2 .

National Sentence Text: If a fire escape serves any storey above the second, openings located in a zone described in Sentence 3.4.7.4.(2), including access doorways in the exterior walls of the building to which the fire escape is attached, shall be protected by closures conforming to Subsection 3.1.8.
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire escape serves any storey above the second, openings located in a zone described in Sentence 3.4.7.4.(2), including access doorways in the exterior walls of the building to which the fire escape is attached, shall be protected by closures conforming to part 3.

National Sentence Text: The zone referred to in Sentence 3.4.7.4.(1) extends from any balcony, platform or stairway of a fire escape to a distance 3 m horizontally, 10 m below, or 1.8 m above.
P/T Sentence Text: The zone referred to in Sentence 3.4.7.4.(1) extends from any balcony, platform or stairway of a fire escape to a distance 3 m horizontally, 10 m below, or 1.8 m above.

National Sentence Text: Stairs shall be inclined at an angle of not more than 45° with the horizontal, and their steps shall have risers not more than 210 mm high and treads not less than 220 mm wide exclusive of nosing.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairs shall be inclined at an angle of not more than 45° with the horizontal, and their steps shall have risers not more than 210 mm high and treads not less than 220 mm wide exclusive of nosing.

National Sentence Text: Stairway headroom shall be not less than 1 950 mm plus the height of one riser measured vertically above the nosing of any tread or platform.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairway headroom shall be not less than 1 950 mm plus the height of one riser measured vertically above the nosing of any tread or platform.

National Sentence Text: The width of a fire escape shall conform to Articles 3.4.3.1.to 3.4.3.3., except that the width is permitted to be reduced to 550 mm provided the fire escape serves not more than 3 storeys, and not more than 15 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: The width of a fire escape shall conform to Articles 3.4.3.1.to 3.4.3.3., except that the width is permitted to be reduced to 550 mm provided the fire escape serves not more than 3 storeys, and not more than 15 persons.

National Sentence Text: If a flight of stairs leading to the ground at the foot of a fire escape is not fixed in position, it shall be held in the raised position without a latch or locking device, and shall be fitted with a counterbalancing device that will permit it to be easily and quickly brought into position for use.
P/T Sentence Text: If a flight of stairs leading to the ground at the foot of a fire escape is not fixed in position, it shall be held in the raised position without a latch or locking device, and shall be fitted with a counterbalancing device that will permit it to be easily and quickly brought into position for use.

National Sentence Text: The open sides of every platform, balcony and stairway forming part of a fire escape shall be protected by guards not less than 920 mm high measured vertically above the nosing of any tread or platform.
P/T Sentence Text: The open sides of every platform, balcony and stairway forming part of a fire escape shall be protected by guards not less than 920 mm high measured vertically above the nosing of any tread or platform.

National Sentence Text: The top rail of a guard is permitted to serve as a handrail if it is free from obstructions which could break a handhold.
P/T Sentence Text: The top rail of a guard is permitted to serve as a handrail if it is free from obstructions which could break a handhold.

National Sentence Text: A wall handrail shall be installed if the fire escape is more than 550 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: A wall handrail shall be installed if the fire escape is more than 550 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown that the size of openings that exceed this limit does not present a hazard, there shall be no opening that permits the passage of a sphere whose diameter is more than 100 mm through a guard for a fire escape.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown that the size of openings that exceed this limit does not present a hazard, there shall be no opening that permits the passage of a sphere whose diameter is more than 100 mm through a guard for a fire escape.

National Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown that the location and size of an opening do not present a hazard, a guard for a fire escape shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above a platform or the nosing of any tread will facilitate climbing.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown that the location and size of an opening do not present a hazard, a guard for a fire escape shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above a platform or the nosing of any tread will facilitate climbing.

National Sentence Text: Platforms for a fire escape shall be provided in conformance with the requirements for stair landings in Articles 3.4.6.3.and 3.4.6.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Platforms for a fire escape shall be provided in conformance with the requirements for stair landings in Articles 3.4.6.3. and 3.4.6.4.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to vertical transportation facilities installed in a building, including elevators, escalators and dumbwaiters.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to vertical transportation facilities installed in a building, including elevators, escalators and dumbwaiters.

National Sentence Text: Elevators in a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. shall conform to Articles 3.2.6.4., 3.2.6.5.and 3.2.6.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Elevators in a building within the scope of part 3. shall conform to Articles 3.2.6.4., 3.2.6.5. and 3.2.6.6.

National Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of every elevator, escalator and dumbwaiter shall conform to provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2010/CSA B44-10 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause 3.5.2.1.(1)(a). (See Note A-3.5.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of every elevator, escalator, passenger-elevating device, freight platform lift and dumbwaiter shall conform to the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See Note A-3.5.2.1.(1).)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The design, construction, installation and alteration of every elevator, escalator, passenger-elevating device, freight platform lift and dumbwaiter shall conform to the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See Note A-3.5.2.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Before being placed in service, every elevator, escalator or dumbwaiter installation, including safety and control devices, shall be inspected and tested in accordance with provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2010/CSA B44-10 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause 3.5.2.1.(2)(a). (See Note A-3.5.2.1.(1).) (See Note A-3.5.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Before being placed in service, every elevator, escalator, passenger-elevating device, freight platform lift or dumbwaiter installation, including safety and control devices, shall be inspected and tested in accordance with the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Before being placed in service, every elevator, escalator, passenger-elevating device, freight platform lift or dumbwaiter installation, including safety and control devices, shall be inspected and tested in accordance with the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

National Sentence Text: Passenger elevators shall conform to Appendix E of ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2010/CSA B44-10 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators
P/T Sentence Text: Passenger elevators shall conform to Appendix E of ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2013/CSA B44-13 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.5.3.1.(2), a vertical service space used as an elevator hoistway shall be separated from all other portions of each adjacent storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.5.3.1. for the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. for the floor assembly above the storey, or the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.5.3.1.(2), a vertical service space used as an elevator hoistway shall be separated from all other portions of each adjacent storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.5.3.1. for the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. for the floor assembly above the storey, or the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Passenger elevators, other than those provided for firefighters in accordance with Article 3.2.6.5., are permitted to be located within interconnected floor space without being enclosed in a hoistway separated from the remainder of the building, provided the elevator machinery is located in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for hoistways by Sentence 3.5.3.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Passenger elevators, other than those provided for firefighters in accordance with Article 3.2.6.5., are permitted to be located within interconnected floor space without being enclosed in a hoistway separated from the remainder of the building, provided the elevator machinery is located in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for hoistways by Sentence 3.5.3.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: A vertical service space containing a dumbwaiter shall be separated from all other portions of each adjacent storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.5.3.1. for the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. for the floor assembly above the storey or the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: A vertical service space containing a dumbwaiter shall be separated from all other portions of each adjacent storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.5.3.1. for the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. for the floor assembly above the storey or the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.5.3.3.(2), a room containing elevator machinery shall be separated from all other parts of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical service space containing the elevator hoistway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.5.3.3.(2), a room containing elevator machinery shall be separated from all other parts of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical service space containing the elevator hoistway.

National Sentence Text: A room containing elevator machinery need not be separated from the elevator hoistway that it serves provided the room and the hoistway are separated from all other parts of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical service space containing the elevator hoistway.
P/T Sentence Text: A room containing elevator machinery need not be separated from the elevator hoistway that it serves provided the room and the hoistway are separated from all other parts of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical service space containing the elevator hoistway.

National Sentence Text: If one or more elevators are provided in a building, all storeys shall be served by at least one elevator which has inside dimensions that will accommodate and provide adequate access for a patient stretcher 2 010 mm long and 610 mm wide in the prone position. (See Note A-3.5.4.1.(1).) (See Note A-3.5.4.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: If one or more elevators are provided in a building, all storeys shall be served by at least one elevator which has inside dimensions that will accommodate and provide adequate access for a patient stretcher 2 010 mm long and 610 mm wide in the prone position. (See Note A-3.5.4.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: An elevator satisfying the requirements of Sentence 3.5.4.1.(1) shall be clearly identified on the main entrance level of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: An elevator satisfying the requirements of Sentence 3.5.4.1.(1) shall be clearly identified on the main entrance level of the building.

National Sentence Text: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall be mounted permanently on both jambs of passenger elevator hoistway entrances in conformance with Appendix E of ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2010/CSA B44-10 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators
P/T Sentence Text: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall be mounted permanently on both jambs of passenger elevator hoistway entrances in conformance with Appendix E of ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2013/CSA B44-13 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators

National Sentence Text: The provisions of this Section apply to horizontal service spaces, vertical service spaces, attic or roof spaces, ducts, crawl spaces, shaft spaces, service rooms, and mechanical penthouses, and facilities contained therein.
P/T Sentence Text: The provisions of this Section apply to horizontal service spaces, vertical service spaces, attic or roof spaces, ducts, crawl spaces, shaft spaces, service rooms, and mechanical penthouses, and facilities contained therein.

National Sentence Text: The installation of electrical wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the requirements of provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause 3.6.1.2.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of electrical wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the requirements of the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The installation of electrical wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the requirements of the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

National Sentence Text: A lightning protection system, when provided, shall conform to the requirements of the appropriate provincial or territorial legislation or, in the absence of such legislation, to CSA CAN/CSA-B72-M87 Installation Code for Lightning Protection Systems
Matched National Sentence (Variation): A lightning protection system, when provided, shall conform to the requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-B72-M87 Installation Code for Lightning Protection Systems
P/T Sentence Text: A lightning protection system, when provided, shall conform to the requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-B72-M87 Installation Code for Lightning Protection Systems
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): A lightning protection system, when provided, shall conform to the requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-B72-M87 Installation Code for Lightning Protection Systems

National Sentence Text: Service spaces shall not be designed to facilitate subsequent use as storage space.
P/T Sentence Text: Service spaces shall not be designed to facilitate subsequent use as storage space.

National Sentence Text: A fuel-fired appliance installed on the roof of a building or in another location outside the building shall be installed not less than 1.2 m from a property line, measured horizontally, and 3 m from an adjacent wall of the same building if that wall contains any opening within 3 storeys above and 5 m horizontally from the appliance, unless every opening within these limits is protected by a closure having a fire-protection rating not less than 45 min determined in accordance with Article 3.1.8.4., or a wired glass assembly permitted for use in a vertical fire separation and described in Note D-2.2.3.15. in Appendix D.
P/T Sentence Text: A fuel-fired appliance installed on the roof of a building or in another location outside the building shall be installed not less than 1.2 m from a property line, measured horizontally, and 3 m from an adjacent wall of the same building if that wall contains any opening within 3 storeys above and 5 m horizontally from the appliance, unless every opening within these limits is protected by a closure having a fire-protection rating not less than 45 min determined in accordance with Article 3.1.8.4., or a wired glass assembly permitted for use in a vertical fire separation and described in apparticle D-2.2.3.15. in Appendix D.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.6.2.1.(2), 3.6.2.1.(8), 3.6.2.1.(9)and 3.6.2.1.(10), fuel-fired appliances shall be installed in service rooms separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.6.2.1.(2) , 3.6.2.1.(8), 3.6.2.1.(9)and 3.6.2.1.(10), fuel-fired appliances shall be installed in service rooms separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.6.2.1.(3), a fuel-fired appliance that serves only one room or suite is not required to be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.6.2.1.(3), a fuel-fired appliance that serves only one room or suite is not required to be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building.

National Sentence Text: A solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be located in a repair garage, a storage garage, or any other location where it could be exposed to flammable vapours or gases, unless it is enclosed in a service room that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, it is supplied with combustion air directly from outside the building, and the heat that it generates is supplied indirectly to the space served by means of ducts or piping.
P/T Sentence Text: A solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be located in a repair garage, a storage garage, or any other location where it could be exposed to flammable vapours or gases, unless it is enclosed in a service room that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, it is supplied with combustion air directly from outside the building, and the heat that it generates is supplied indirectly to the space served by means of ducts or piping.

National Sentence Text: A service room containing an incinerator shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: A service room containing an incinerator shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Equipment that uses a liquid having a flash point below 93.3°C shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Equipment that uses a liquid having a flash point below 93.3°C shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Electrical equipment that is required to be located in a service room according to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Electrical equipment that is required to be located in a service room according to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical equipment that is required to be located in a service room according to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Electrical equipment that is required to be located in a service room according to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.6.2.1.(8), in a storey that is not sprinklered throughout, a service room that contains service equipment other than that addressed by Sentences 3.6.2.1.(1)to 3.6.2.1.(6) shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.6.2.1.(8), in a storey that is not sprinklered throughout, a service room that contains service equipment other than that addressed by Sentences 3.6.2.1.(1)to 3.6.2.1.(6) shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Where a service room contains a limited quantity of service equipment, and the service equipment neither constitutes a fire hazard nor is essential to the operation of fire safety systems in the building, the requirements for a fire separation shall not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a service room contains a limited quantity of service equipment, and the service equipment neither constitutes a fire hazard nor is essential to the operation of fire safety systems in the building, the requirements for a fire separation shall not apply.

National Sentence Text: A fire separation is not required between a fireplace and the space it serves.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation is not required between a fireplace and the space it serves.

National Sentence Text: A fire separation is not required between a roof-top appliance and the building it serves.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation is not required between a roof-top appliance and the building it serves.

National Sentence Text: A service room containing service equipment subject to possible explosion, such as boilers operating in excess of 100 kPa (gauge) and some types of refrigerating machinery and transformers, shall not be located directly under a required exit.
P/T Sentence Text: A service room containing service equipment subject to possible explosion, such as boilers operating in excess of 100 kPa (gauge) and some types of refrigerating machinery and transformers, shall not be located directly under a required exit.

National Sentence Text: A service room containing space heating, space cooling and service water heating appliances is permitted to contain other service equipment such as electrical service equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: A service room containing space heating, space cooling and service water heating appliances is permitted to contain other service equipment such as electrical service equipment.

National Sentence Text: A service room containing an incinerator shall not contain other fuel-fired appliances.
P/T Sentence Text: A service room containing an incinerator shall not contain other fuel-fired appliances.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.6.3.3.(9), a room for the storage of combustible refuse shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and sprinklered. (See Note A-3.6.2.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.6.3.3.(9), a room for the storage of combustible refuse shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: A swing-type door from a service room containing a boiler or incinerator shall swing outward from the room, except that the door shall swing inward if the door opens onto a corridor or any room used for an assembly occupancy. (See also Sentence 3.4.4.4.(7).) (See also Sentence 3.4.4.4.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: A swing-type door from a service room containing a boiler or incinerator shall swing outward from the room, except that the door shall swing inward if the door opens onto a corridor or any room used for an assembly occupancy. (See also Sentence 3.4.4.4.(7).)

National Sentence Text: An electrical equipment vault shall conform to Sentences 3.6.2.7.(2)to 3.6.2.7.(8) if it is required by provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause 3.6.2.7.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: An electrical equipment vault shall conform to Sentences 3.6.2.7.(2)to 3.6.2.7.(10) if it is required by the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): An electrical equipment vault shall conform to Sentences 3.6.2.7.(2) to 3.6.2.7.(10) if it is required by the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

National Sentence Text: An electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation of solid masonry or concrete construction having a fire-resistance rating not less than 3 h if the vault is not protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system, or 2 h if the vault is protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system.
P/T Sentence Text: An electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation of solid masonry or concrete construction having a fire-resistance rating not less than 3 h if the vault is not protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system, or 2 h if the vault is protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system.

National Sentence Text: If a building is sprinklered throughout, an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) need not be sprinklered provided the vault is designed for no purpose other than to contain the electrical equipment, and the vault contains a smoke detector which will actuate the building fire alarm system in the event of a fire in the vault.
P/T Sentence Text: If a building is sprinklered throughout, an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) need not be sprinklered provided the vault is designed for no purpose other than to contain the electrical equipment, and the vault contains a smoke detector which will actuate the building fire alarm system in the event of a fire in the vault.

National Sentence Text: Only pipes or ducts necessary for fire protection or the proper operation of the electrical installation shall penetrate the fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Only pipes or ducts necessary for fire protection or the proper operation of the electrical installation shall penetrate the fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(2).

National Sentence Text: Explosion-relief devices and vents or other protective measures conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.20.(3) shall be provided for an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) that contains dielectric-liquid-filled electrical equipment. (See Note A-3.6.2.7.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Explosion-relief devices and vents or other protective measures conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.20.(3) shall be provided for an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) that contains dielectric-liquid-filled electrical equipment. (See Note A-3.6.2.7.(5).)

National Sentence Text: An electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) shall be provided with a ventilation system designed in conformance with Part 6. to prevent the ambient temperature in the vault from exceeding 40°C.
P/T Sentence Text: An electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) shall be provided with a ventilation system designed in conformance with part 6. to prevent the ambient temperature in the vault from exceeding 40°C.

National Sentence Text: The ventilation system required by Sentence 3.6.2.7.(6) shall be separate from the system for the remainder of the building and shall be designed so that it is automatically shut off in the event of a fire in the vault.
P/T Sentence Text: The ventilation system required by Sentence 3.6.2.7.(6) shall be separate from the system for the remainder of the building and shall be designed so that it is automatically shut off in the event of a fire in the vault.

National Sentence Text: The floor of an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) shall be liquid tight and surrounded by liquid tight walls and sills of sufficient height to confine within the vault all of the liquid from the largest item of electrical equipment, but to a height of not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor of an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(1) shall be liquid tight and surrounded by liquid tight walls and sills of sufficient height to confine within the vault all of the liquid from the largest item of electrical equipment, but to a height of not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Electrical equipment vaults shall be secured against unauthorized entry.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical equipment vaults shall be secured against unauthorized entry.

An electrical equipment vault that contains a dielectric-liquid filled piece of electrical equipment shall not be drained to a storm drain, a sanitary drainage system or a private sewage disposal system, and shall have a floor that drains to a sump with sufficient capacity for all the liquid in the transformers, or a curb of sufficient height around each transformer so that all the liquid in the transformer can be contained within the curb system.

National Sentence Text: Where a generator intended to supply emergency power for lighting, fire safety and life safety systems is located in a building, except where such building is used solely for the purpose of housing the generator and its ancillary equipment, it shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, and contains only the generating set and equipment related to the emergency power supply system.

National Sentence Text: A vertical service space that does not extend through the roof of a building shall be enclosed at the top with construction having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical service space walls.
