P/T Sentence Text: Where supplemental energy dissipation devices are used across the isolation interface of a seismically isolated structure, displacements, velocities, and accelerations shall be determined in accordance with Article 4.1.8.20.

National Sentence Text: For the analysis and modeling of structures with supplemental energy dissipation devices, the following criteria shall apply: a three-dimensional Non-linear Dynamic Analysis of the structure shall be performed in accordance with Article 4.1.8.12. (see Note A-4.1.8.21.(4)(a)), for SFRS with Rd > 1.0, the non-linear hysteretic behaviour of the SFRS shall be explicitly—with sufficient detail—accounted for in the modeling and analysis of the structure, unless verified from rational analysis, the inherent equivalent viscous damping—excluding the damping provided by the supplemental energy dissipation devices—used in the analysis shall not be taken as more than 2.5% of the critical damping at the significant modes of vibration, all supplemental energy dissipation devices shall be modeled with sufficient detail to account for their non-linear force deformation characteristics, including effects of the relevant loads, and with consideration of variations in their properties over the design life of the structure, and except for the SFRS and elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, other components of the structure shall be modeled using elastic material properties in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.3.(8).
P/T Sentence Text: For the analysis and modeling of structures with supplemental energy dissipation devices, the following criteria shall apply: a three-dimensional Non-linear Dynamic Analysis of the structure shall be performed in accordance with Article 4.1.8.12. (see Note A-4.1.8.21.(4)(a)), for SFRS with Rd > 1.0, the non-linear hysteretic behaviour of the SFRS shall be explicitly—with sufficient detail—accounted for in the modeling and analysis of the structure, unless verified from rational analysis, the inherent equivalent viscous damping—excluding the damping provided by the supplemental energy dissipation devices—used in the analysis shall not be taken as more than 2.5% of the critical damping at the significant modes of vibration, all supplemental energy dissipation devices shall be modeled with sufficient detail to account for their non-linear force deformation characteristics, including effects of the relevant loads, and with consideration of variations in their properties over the design life of the structure, and except for the SFRS and elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, other components of the structure shall be modeled using elastic material properties in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.3.(8).

National Sentence Text: The ground motion histories used in Sentence 4.1.8.21.(4) shall be appropriately selected and scaled following good engineering practice, compatible with a 5% damped response spectrum derived from the design spectral acceleration values, S(T), defined in Sentence 4.1.8.4.(9), and amplitude-scaled in an appropriate manner over the period range of 0.2 T1 to 1.5 T1, where T1 is the fundamental lateral period of the structure with the supplemental energy dissipation system. (See Note A-4.1.8.19.(4) and 4.1.8.21.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The ground motion histories used in Sentence 4.1.8.21.(4) shall be appropriately selected and scaled following good engineering practice, compatible with a 5% damped response spectrum derived from the design spectral acceleration values, S(T), defined in Sentence 4.1.8.4.(9), and amplitude-scaled in an appropriate manner over the period range of 0.2 T1 to 1.5 T1, where T1 is the fundamental lateral period of the structure with the supplemental energy dissipation system.

National Sentence Text: The values of storey shears, storey forces, member forces, and deflections for the design of all structural framing elements and all supplemental energy dissipation devices shall be obtained from analysis conforming to Sentence 4.1.8.21.(4) using one of the following values, whichever produces the most critical effect: mean plus IE times the standard deviation of the results of all Non-linear Dynamic Analyses, or  IE times the mean of the results of all Non-linear Dynamic Analyses.
P/T Sentence Text: The values of storey shears, storey forces, member forces, and deflections for the design of all structural framing elements and all supplemental energy dissipation devices shall be obtained from analysis conforming to Sentence 4.1.8.21.(4) using one of the following values, whichever produces the most critical effect: mean plus IE times the standard deviation of the results of all Non-linear Dynamic Analyses, or  IE times the mean of the results of all Non-linear Dynamic Analyses.

National Sentence Text: The largest interstorey deflection at any level of the structure as determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.22.(1) shall conform to the limits stated in Sentence 4.1.8.13.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: The largest interstorey deflection at any level of the structure as determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.22.(1) shall conform to the limits stated in Sentence 4.1.8.13.(3).

National Sentence Text: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics of the supplemental energy dissipation devices used in the analysis and design of structures with supplemental energy dissipation systems shall be validated by testing at least two full-size specimens of each type of supplementary energy dissipation device.
P/T Sentence Text: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics of the supplemental energy dissipation devices used in the analysis and design of structures with supplemental energy dissipation systems shall be validated by testing at least two full-size specimens of each type of supplementary energy dissipation device.

National Sentence Text: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics and damping values of a representative sample of the supplemental energy dissipation devices installed in the building shall be validated by tests prior to their installation.
P/T Sentence Text: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics and damping values of a representative sample of the supplemental energy dissipation devices installed in the building shall be validated by tests prior to their installation.

National Sentence Text: Elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, except the supplemental energy dissipation devices themselves, shall be designed to remain elastic for the design loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, except the supplemental energy dissipation devices themselves, shall be designed to remain elastic for the design loads.

National Sentence Text: All structural framing elements shall be designed for an SFRS with Rd =1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22.(1) with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for Rd   1.5 and the applicable referenced design standards, or for an SFRS with Rd > 1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22.(1) with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for the selected Rd and the applicable referenced design standards.
P/T Sentence Text: All structural framing elements shall be designed for an SFRS with Rd =1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22.(1) with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for Rd   1.5 and the applicable referenced design standards, or for an SFRS with Rd > 1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22.(1) with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for the selected Rd and the applicable referenced design standards.

National Sentence Text: Supplemental energy dissipation devices and other components of the supplemental energy dissipation system shall be designed in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.22.(1) with consideration of the following: low-cycle, large-displacement degradation due to seismic loads, high-cycle, small-displacement degradation due to wind, thermal, or other cyclic loads, forces or displacements due to gravity loads, adhesion of device parts due to corrosion or abrasion, biodegradation, moisture, or chemical exposure, exposure to environmental conditions, including, but not limited to, temperature, humidity, moisture, radiation (e.g., ultraviolet light), and reactive or corrosive substances (e.g., salt water), devices subject to failure due to low-cycle fatigue must resist wind forces without slip, movement, or inelastic cycling, the range of thermal conditions, device wear, manufacturing tolerances, and other effects that cause device properties to vary during the design life of the device, and connection points of devices must provide sufficient articulation to accommodate simultaneous longitudinal, lateral, and vertical displacements of the supplemental energy dissipation system.
P/T Sentence Text: Supplemental energy dissipation devices and other components of the supplemental energy dissipation system shall be designed in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.22.(1) with consideration of the following: low-cycle, large-displacement degradation due to seismic loads, high-cycle, small-displacement degradation due to wind, thermal, or other cyclic loads, forces or displacements due to gravity loads, adhesion of device parts due to corrosion or abrasion, biodegradation, moisture, or chemical exposure, exposure to environmental conditions, including, but not limited to, temperature, humidity, moisture, radiation (e.g., ultraviolet light), and reactive or corrosive substances (e.g., salt water), devices subject to failure due to low-cycle fatigue must resist wind forces without slip, movement, or inelastic cycling, the range of thermal conditions, device wear, manufacturing tolerances, and other effects that cause device properties to vary during the design life of the device, and connection points of devices must provide sufficient articulation to accommodate simultaneous longitudinal, lateral, and vertical displacements of the supplemental energy dissipation system.

National Sentence Text: Means of access for inspection and removal for replacement of all supplemental energy dissipation devices shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Means of access for inspection and removal for replacement of all supplemental energy dissipation devices shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to excavations and foundation systems for buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to excavations and foundation systems for buildings.

National Sentence Text: A subsurface investigation, including groundwater conditions, shall be carried out by or under the direction of a professional engineer having knowledge and experience in planning and executing such investigations to a degree appropriate for the building and its use, the ground and the surrounding site conditions. (See Note A-4.2.2.1.(1).) Note A-4.2.2.1.(1)

National Sentence Text: Drawings associated with foundations and excavations shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Section 2.2.. (See Article 2.2.4.6..)
P/T Sentence Text: Drawings associated with foundations and excavations shall conform to the appropriate requirements of part 2.. (See Article 2.2.4.6..)

National Sentence Text: A field review shall be carried out by the designer or by another suitably qualified person to ascertain that the subsurface conditions are consistent with the design and that construction is carried out in accordance with the design and good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.2.2.3.(1).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): A field review shall be carried out by the designer or by another suitably qualified person to ascertain that the subsurface conditions are consistent with the design and that construction is carried out in accordance with the design and good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.2.2.3.(1).)

(See Note A-4.2.2.3.(1).)

(See Note A-4.2.2.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The review required by Sentence 4.2.2.3.(1) shall be carried out on a continuous basis during the construction of all deep foundation units with all pertinent information recorded for each foundation unit, during the installation and removal of retaining structures and related backfilling operations, and during the placement of engineered fills that are to be used to support the foundation units, and as required, unless otherwise directed by the authority having jurisdiction, in the construction of all shallow foundation units, and in excavating, dewatering and other related works.
P/T Sentence Text: The review required by Sentence 4.2.2.3.(1) shall be carried out on a continuous basis during the construction of all deep foundation units with all pertinent information recorded for each foundation unit, during the installation and removal of retaining structures and related backfilling operations, and during the placement of engineered fills that are to be used to support the foundation units, and as required, unless otherwise directed by the authority having jurisdiction, in the construction of all shallow foundation units, and in excavating, dewatering and other related works.

National Sentence Text: If, during construction, the soil, rock or groundwater is found not to be of the type or in the condition used in design and as indicated on the drawings, the design shall be reassessed by the designer.
P/T Sentence Text: If, during construction, the soil, rock or groundwater is found not to be of the type or in the condition used in design and as indicated on the drawings, the design shall be reassessed by the designer.

National Sentence Text: If, during construction, climatic or any other conditions change the properties of the soil, rock or groundwater, the design shall be reassessed by the designer.
P/T Sentence Text: If, during construction, climatic or any other conditions change the properties of the soil, rock or groundwater, the design shall be reassessed by the designer.

National Sentence Text: Wood used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the appropriate requirements of Subsection 4.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the appropriate requirements of part 4.

National Sentence Text: Wood exposed to soil or air above the lowest anticipated groundwater table shall be treated with preservative in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-O80 Series-08 Wood Preservation and the requirements of the appropriate commodity standard as follows: CSA CAN/CSA-O80.2-08 Processing and Treatment CSA CAN/CSA-O80.3-08 Preservative Formulations or CSA O80.15-97 Preservative Treatment of Wood for Building Foundation Systems, Basements, and Crawl Spaces by Pressure Processes
P/T Sentence Text: Wood exposed to soil or air above the lowest anticipated groundwater table shall be treated with preservative in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-O80 Series-08 Wood Preservation and the requirements of the appropriate commodity standard as follows: CSA CAN/CSA-O80.2-08 Processing and Treatment CSA CAN/CSA-O80.3-08 Preservative Formulations or CSA O80.15-97 Preservative Treatment of Wood for Building Foundation Systems, Basements, and Crawl Spaces by Pressure Processes

National Sentence Text: Where timber has been treated as required in Sentence 4.2.3.2.(1), it shall be cared for as provided in AWPA M4-11 Care of Preservative-Treated Wood Products as revised by Clause 6 of CSA CAN/CSA-O80 Series-08 Wood Preservation
P/T Sentence Text: Where timber has been treated as required in Sentence 4.2.3.2.(1), it shall be cared for as provided in AWPA M4-11 Care of Preservative-Treated Wood Products as revised by Clause 6 of CSA CAN/CSA-O80 Series-08 Wood Preservation

National Sentence Text: Plain or reinforced masonry used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the requirements of Subsection 4.3.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Plain or reinforced masonry used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the requirements of part 4.

National Sentence Text: Where plain or reinforced masonry in foundations or in structures supporting soil or rock may be subject to conditions conducive to deterioration, protection shall be provided to prevent such deterioration.
P/T Sentence Text: Where plain or reinforced masonry in foundations or in structures supporting soil or rock may be subject to conditions conducive to deterioration, protection shall be provided to prevent such deterioration.

National Sentence Text: Plain, reinforced or pre-stressed concrete used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the requirements of Subsection 4.3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Plain, reinforced or pre-stressed concrete used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the requirements of part 4.

National Sentence Text: Where concrete in foundations may be subject to chemical attack, it shall be treated in conformance with the requirements in CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Where concrete in foundations may be subject to chemical attack, it shall be treated in conformance with the requirements in CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction

National Sentence Text: Steel used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the appropriate requirements of Subsection 4.3.3. or Subsection 4.3.4., unless otherwise specified in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the appropriate requirements of part 4. or part 4., unless otherwise specified in this Section.

National Sentence Text: Where steel piles are used in deep foundations and act as permanent load-carrying members, the steel shall conform with one of the following standards: ASTM A 252-10 Welded and Seamless Steel Pipe Piles ASTM A 283/A 283M-13 Low and Intermediate Tensile Strength Carbon Steel Plates ASTM A 1008/A 1008M-13 Steel, Sheet, Cold-Rolled, Carbon, Structural, High-Strength Low-Alloy, High-Strength Low-Alloy with Improved Formability, Solution Hardened, and Bake Hardenable ASTM A 1011/A 1011M-14 Steel, Sheet and Strip, Hot-Rolled, Carbon, Structural, High-Strength Low-Alloy, High-Strength Low-Alloy with Improved Formability, and Ultra-High Strength or CSA G40.21-13 Structural Quality Steel
P/T Sentence Text: Where steel piles are used in deep foundations and act as permanent load-carrying members, the steel shall conform with one of the following standards: ASTM A 252-10 Welded and Seamless Steel Pipe Piles ASTM A 283/A 283M-13 Low and Intermediate Tensile Strength Carbon Steel Plates ASTM A 1008/A 1008M-13 Steel, Sheet, Cold-Rolled, Carbon, Structural, High-Strength Low-Alloy, High-Strength Low-Alloy with Improved Formability, Solution Hardened, and Bake Hardenable ASTM A 1011/A 1011M-14 Steel, Sheet and Strip, Hot-Rolled, Carbon, Structural, High-Strength Low-Alloy, High-Strength Low-Alloy with Improved Formability, and Ultra-High Strength or CSA G40.21-13 Structural Quality Steel

National Sentence Text: Where high strength steel is used for tendons in anchor systems used for the permanent support of a foundation or in the erection of temporary support of soil or rock adjacent to an excavation, it shall conform with the requirements of CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction

National Sentence Text: Where conditions are corrosive to steel, adequate protection of exposed steel shall be provided. (See Article 1.2.1.1. for use of other materials.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where conditions are corrosive to steel, adequate protection of exposed steel shall be provided. (See Article 1.2.1.1. for use of other materials.)

National Sentence Text: The design of foundations, excavations and soil- and rock-retaining structures shall be based on a subsurface investigation carried out in conformance with the requirements of this Section, and on any of the following, as appropriate: application of generally accepted geotechnical and civil engineering principles by a professional engineer especially qualified in this field of work, as provided in this Section and other Sections of Part 4, established local practice, where such practice includes successful experience both with soils and rocks of similar type and condition and with a foundation or excavation of similar type, construction method, size and depth, or in situ testing of foundation units, such as the load testing of piles, anchors or footings, carried out by a person competent in this field of work. National Sentence Text: The foundations of a building shall be capable of resisting all the loads stipulated in Section 4.1., in accordance with limit states design in Subsection 4.1.3.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of the application of the load combinations given in Table 4.1.3.2.-A, the geotechnical components of loads and the factored geotechnical resistances at ULS shall be determined by a suitably qualified and experienced professional engineer. National Sentence Text: Geotechnical components of service loads and geotechnical reactions for SLS shall be determined by a suitably qualified and experienced professional engineer.

Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Geotechnical components of service loads and geotechnical reactions for SLS shall be determined by a suitably qualified and experienced registered engineering professional.

National Sentence Text: The foundation of a building shall be designed to satisfy SLS requirements within the limits that the building is designed to accommodate, including total settlement and differential settlement, heave, lateral movement, tilt or rotation. (See Note A-4.2.4.1.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The foundation of a building shall be designed to satisfy SLS requirements within the limits that the building is designed to accommodate, including total settlement and differential settlement, heave, lateral movement, tilt or rotation. (See Note A-4.2.4.1.(5).)

National Sentence Text: Communication, interaction and coordination between the designer and the professional engineer responsible for the geotechnical aspects of the project shall take place to a degree commensurate with the complexity and requirements of the project.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Communication, interaction and coordination between the designer and the professional engineer responsible for the geotechnical aspects of the project shall take place to a degree commensurate with the complexity and requirements of the project.

Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Communication, interaction and coordination between the designer and the registered engineering professional responsible for the geotechnical aspects of the project shall take place to a degree commensurate with the complexity and requirements of the project.

National Sentence Text: A subsurface investigation shall be carried out to the depth and extent to which the building or excavation will significantly change the stress in the soil or rock, or to such a depth and extent as to provide all the necessary information for the design and construction of the excavation or the foundations.
P/T Sentence Text: A subsurface investigation shall be carried out to the depth and extent to which the building or excavation will significantly change the stress in the soil or rock, or to such a depth and extent as to provide all the necessary information for the design and construction of the excavation or the foundations.

National Sentence Text: The identification and classification of soil, rock and groundwater and descriptions of their engineering and physical properties shall be in accordance with a widely accepted system.
P/T Sentence Text: The identification and classification of soil, rock and groundwater and descriptions of their engineering and physical properties shall be in accordance with a widely accepted system.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.2.4.4.(2), the bearing surface of a foundation shall be below the level of potential damage, including damage resulting from frost action, and the foundation shall be designed to prevent damage resulting from adfreezing and frost jacking. (See Note A-4.2.4.4.(1).) Note A-4.2.4.4.(1)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.2.4.4.(2), the bearing surface of a foundation shall be below the level of potential damage, including damage resulting from frost action, and the foundation shall be designed to prevent damage resulting from adfreezing and frost jacking. (See Note A-4.2.4.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The bearing surface of a foundation need not be below the level of potential damage from frost where the foundation is designed against frost action, or overlies material not susceptible to frost action.
P/T Sentence Text: The bearing surface of a foundation need not be below the level of potential damage from frost where the foundation is designed against frost action, or overlies material not susceptible to frost action.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation is to rest on, in or near sloping ground, this particular condition shall be provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation is to rest on, in or near sloping ground, this particular condition shall be provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: Where there is eccentricity or inclination of loading in foundation units, this effect shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where there is eccentricity or inclination of loading in foundation units, this effect shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: Where dynamic loading conditions apply, the effects shall be assessed by a special investigation of these conditions and provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where dynamic loading conditions apply, the effects shall be assessed by a special investigation of these conditions and provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation or any part of a building is subject to hydrostatic uplift, the effects shall be provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation or any part of a building is subject to hydrostatic uplift, the effects shall be provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: Where proposed construction will result in a temporary or permanent change in the groundwater level, the effects of this change on adjacent buildings shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where proposed construction will result in a temporary or permanent change in the groundwater level, the effects of this change on adjacent buildings shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: Where conditions of permafrost are encountered or proven to exist, the design of the foundation shall be based upon analysis of these conditions by a person especially qualified in that field of work.
P/T Sentence Text: Where conditions of permafrost are encountered or proven to exist, the design of the foundation shall be based upon analysis of these conditions by a person especially qualified in that field of work.

National Sentence Text: Where swelling or shrinking soils, in which movements resulting from moisture content changes may be sufficient to cause damage to a structure, are encountered or known to exist, such a condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where swelling or shrinking soils, in which movements resulting from moisture content changes may be sufficient to cause damage to a structure, are encountered or known to exist, such a condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: Where rock that expands or deteriorates when subjected to unfavourable environmental conditions or to stress release is known to exist, this condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where rock that expands or deteriorates when subjected to unfavourable environmental conditions or to stress release is known to exist, this condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: Buildings may be placed on fill if it can be shown by subsurface investigation that the fill is or can be made capable of safely supporting the building, detrimental movement of the building or of services leading to the building will not occur, and explosive gases can be controlled or do not exist.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings may be placed on fill if it can be shown by subsurface investigation that the fill is or can be made capable of safely supporting the building, detrimental movement of the building or of services leading to the building will not occur, and explosive gases can be controlled or do not exist.

National Sentence Text: The structural design of the foundation of a building, the procedures and construction practices shall conform with the appropriate Sections of this Code unless otherwise specified in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: The structural design of the foundation of a building, the procedures and construction practices shall conform with the appropriate Sections of this Code unless otherwise specified in this Section.

National Sentence Text: The design of excavations and of supports for the sides of excavations shall conform with Subsection 4.2.4. and with this Subsection. (See Note A-4.2.5.1.(1).) Note A-4.2.5.1.(1)
P/T Sentence Text: The design of excavations and of supports for the sides of excavations shall conform with part 4. and with this Subsection. (See Note A-4.2.5.1.(1) .)

National Sentence Text: Every excavation shall be undertaken in such a manner as to prevent movement that would cause damage to adjacent buildings at all phases of construction, and comply with the appropriate requirements of Part 8.
P/T Sentence Text: Every excavation shall be undertaken in such a manner as to prevent movement that would cause damage to adjacent buildings at all phases of construction, and comply with the appropriate requirements of part 8..

National Sentence Text: Material shall not be placed nor shall equipment be operated or placed in or adjacent to an excavation in a manner that may endanger the integrity of the excavation or its supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Material shall not be placed nor shall equipment be operated or placed in or adjacent to an excavation in a manner that may endanger the integrity of the excavation or its supports.

National Sentence Text: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock shall be supported by a retaining structure conforming with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and Article 4.2.5.2., except as permitted in Article 4.2.5.4.
P/T Sentence Text: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock shall be supported by a retaining structure conforming with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and Article 4.2.5.2., except as permitted in Article 4.2.5.4.

National Sentence Text: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock may be unsupported where a design is prepared in conformance with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and Article 4.2.5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock may be unsupported where a design is prepared in conformance with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and Article 4.2.5.2.

National Sentence Text: Surface water, all groundwater, perched groundwater and in particular artesian groundwater shall be kept under control at all phases of excavation and construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Surface water, all groundwater, perched groundwater and in particular artesian groundwater shall be kept under control at all phases of excavation and construction.

National Sentence Text: At all phases of excavation and construction, loss of ground due to water or any other cause shall be prevented.
P/T Sentence Text: At all phases of excavation and construction, loss of ground due to water or any other cause shall be prevented.

National Sentence Text: All sides of an excavation, supported and unsupported, shall be continuously maintained and protected from possible deterioration by construction activity or by the action of frost, rain and wind.
P/T Sentence Text: All sides of an excavation, supported and unsupported, shall be continuously maintained and protected from possible deterioration by construction activity or by the action of frost, rain and wind.

National Sentence Text: Where an excavation is backfilled, the backfill shall be placed so as to provide lateral support to the soil adjacent to the excavation, and prevent detrimental movements.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an excavation is backfilled, the backfill shall be placed so as to provide lateral support to the soil adjacent to the excavation, and prevent detrimental movements.

National Sentence Text: The material used as backfill or fill supporting a footing, foundation or a floor on grade shall be of a type that is not subject to detrimental volume change with changes in moisture content and temperature.
P/T Sentence Text: The material used as backfill or fill supporting a footing, foundation or a floor on grade shall be of a type that is not subject to detrimental volume change with changes in moisture content and temperature.

National Sentence Text: The design of shallow foundations shall be in conformance with Subsection 4.2.4. and the requirements of this Subsection. (See Note A-4.2.6.1.(1).) Note A-4.2.6.1.(1)
P/T Sentence Text: The design of shallow foundations shall be in conformance with Subsection 4. and the requirements of this Subsection. (See Note A-4.2.6.1.(1) .)

National Sentence Text: Where a shallow foundation is to be placed on soil or rock, the soil or rock shall be cleaned of loose and unsound material and shall be adequate to support the design load taking into account temperature, precipitation, construction activities and other factors that may lead to changes in the properties of soil or rock.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a shallow foundation is to be placed on soil or rock, the soil or rock shall be cleaned of loose and unsound material and shall be adequate to support the design load taking into account temperature, precipitation, construction activities and other factors that may lead to changes in the properties of soil or rock.

National Sentence Text: Where a shallow foundation unit has not been placed or located as indicated on the drawings, the error shall be corrected, or the design of the foundation unit shall be recalculated for the altered conditions by the designer and action taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..
P/T Sentence Text: Where a shallow foundation unit has not been placed or located as indicated on the drawings, the error shall be corrected, or the design of the foundation unit shall be recalculated for the altered conditions by the designer and action taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..

National Sentence Text: If a shallow foundation unit is damaged, it shall be repaired, or the design of the foundation unit shall be recalculated for the damaged condition by the designer and action taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..
P/T Sentence Text: If a shallow foundation unit is damaged, it shall be repaired, or the design of the foundation unit shall be recalculated for the damaged condition by the designer and action taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..

National Sentence Text: A deep foundation shall provide support for a building by transferring loads by end-bearing to a competent stratum at considerable depth below the structure, or by mobilizing resistance by adhesion or friction, or both, in the soil or rock in which it is placed. (See Note A-4.2.7.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A deep foundation shall provide support for a building by transferring loads by end-bearing to a competent stratum at considerable depth below the structure, or by mobilizing resistance by adhesion or friction, or both, in the soil or rock in which it is placed. (See Note A-4.2.7.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Deep foundations shall be designed in conformance with Subsection 4.2.4. and this Subsection. (See Note A-4.2.7.2.(1).) Note A-4.2.7.2.(1)
P/T Sentence Text: Deep foundations shall be designed in conformance with part 4. and this Subsection. (See Note A-4.2.7.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Where deep foundation units are load tested, as required in Clause 4.2.4.1.(1)(c), the determination of the number and type of load test and the interpretation of the results shall be carried out by a professional engineer especially qualified in this field of work. (See Note A-4.2.7.2.(2).) Note A-4.2.7.2.(2)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Where deep foundation units are load tested, as required in Clause 4.2.4.1.(1)(c), the determination of the number and type of load test and the interpretation of the results shall be carried out by a professional engineer especially qualified in this field of work. (See Note A-4.2.7.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where deep foundation units are load tested, as required in Sentence 4.2.4.1.(1), the determination of the number and type of load test and the interpretation of the results shall be carried out by a registered engineering professional especially qualified in this field of work. (See Note A-4.2.7.2.(2) .)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where deep foundation units are load tested, as required in Clause 4.2.4.1.(1)(c), the determination of the number and type of load test and the interpretation of the results shall be carried out by a registered engineering professional especially qualified in this field of work. (See Note A-4.2.7.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The design of deep foundations shall be determined on the basis of geotechnical considerations taking into account the method of installation, the degree of inspection, the spacing of foundation units and group effects, other requirements in this Subsection, and the appropriate structural requirements in Section 4.1. and Subsections 4.3.1., Subsection 4.3.3. and Subsection 4.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: The design of deep foundations shall be determined on the basis of geotechnical considerations taking into account the method of installation, the degree of inspection, the spacing of foundation units and group effects, other requirements in this Subsection, and the appropriate structural requirements in part 4. and Subsections 4., part 4. and part 4.

National Sentence Text: The portion of a deep foundation unit permanently in contact with soil or rock shall be structurally designed as a laterally supported compression member.
P/T Sentence Text: The portion of a deep foundation unit permanently in contact with soil or rock shall be structurally designed as a laterally supported compression member.

National Sentence Text: The portion of a deep foundation unit that is not permanently in contact with soil or rock shall be structurally designed as a laterally unsupported compression member.
P/T Sentence Text: The portion of a deep foundation unit that is not permanently in contact with soil or rock shall be structurally designed as a laterally unsupported compression member.

National Sentence Text: The structural design of prefabricated deep foundation units shall allow for all stresses resulting from driving, handling and testing.
P/T Sentence Text: The structural design of prefabricated deep foundation units shall allow for all stresses resulting from driving, handling and testing.

National Sentence Text: Permissible deviations from the design alignment and the location of the top of deep foundation units shall be determined by design analysis and shall be indicated on the drawings.
P/T Sentence Text: Permissible deviations from the design alignment and the location of the top of deep foundation units shall be determined by design analysis and shall be indicated on the drawings.

National Sentence Text: Where a deep foundation unit has not been placed within the permissible deviations referred to in Article 4.2.7.3., the condition of the foundation shall be assessed by the designer, any necessary changes made and action taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..
P/T Sentence Text: Where a deep foundation unit has not been placed within the permissible deviations referred to in Article 4.2.7.3., the condition of the foundation shall be assessed by the designer, any necessary changes made and action taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..

National Sentence Text: Deep foundation units shall be installed in such a manner as not to impair the strength of the deep foundation units and the properties of the soil or rock on or in which they are placed beyond the calculated or anticipated limits, the integrity of previously installed deep foundation units, or the integrity of neighbouring buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Deep foundation units shall be installed in such a manner as not to impair the strength of the deep foundation units and the properties of the soil or rock on or in which they are placed beyond the calculated or anticipated limits, the integrity of previously installed deep foundation units, or the integrity of neighbouring buildings.

National Sentence Text: Where inspection shows that a deep foundation unit is damaged or not consistent with design or good engineering practice, such a unit shall be reassessed by the designer, any necessary changes shall be made, and action shall be taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..
P/T Sentence Text: Where inspection shows that a deep foundation unit is damaged or not consistent with design or good engineering practice, such a unit shall be reassessed by the designer, any necessary changes shall be made, and action shall be taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..

National Sentence Text: Where special foundation systems are used, such systems shall conform to Subsection 4.2.4., Sentence 4.1.1.5.(2) and Article 1.2.1.1..
P/T Sentence Text: Where special foundation systems are used, such systems shall conform to part 4., Sentence 4.1.1.5.(2) and Article 1.2.1.1..

National Sentence Text: Existing foundations may be used to support new or altered buildings provided they comply with all pertinent requirements of this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Existing foundations may be used to support new or altered buildings provided they comply with all pertinent requirements of this Section.

National Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of wood shall conform to CSA O86-14 Engineering Design in Wood
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of wood shall conform to CSA O86-14 Engineering Design in Wood

National Sentence Text: Glued-laminated members shall be fabricated in plants conforming to CSA O177-06 Qualification Code for Manufacturers of Structural Glued-Laminated Timber
P/T Sentence Text: Glued-laminated members shall be fabricated in plants conforming to CSA O177-06 Qualification Code for Manufacturers of Structural Glued-Laminated Timber

National Sentence Text: In areas known to be infested by termites, the requirements in Articles 9.3.2.9., 9.12.1.1.and 9.15.5.1. shall apply.
P/T Sentence Text: In areas known to be infested by termites, the requirements in Articles 9.3.2.9., 9.12.1.1. and 9.15.5.1. shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of plain and reinforced masonry shall conform to CSA S304-14 Design of Masonry Structures
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of plain and reinforced masonry shall conform to CSA S304-14 Design of Masonry Structures

National Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of plain, reinforced and pre-stressed concrete shall conform to CSA A23.3-14 Design of Concrete Structures (See Note A-4.3.3.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of plain, reinforced and pre-stressed concrete shall conform to CSA A23.3-14 Design of Concrete Structures (See Note A-4.3.3.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of structural steel shall conform to CSA S16-14 Design of Steel Structures (See Note A-4.3.4.1.(1).) (See Note A-4.3.4.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of structural steel shall conform to CSA S16-14 Design of Steel Structures (See Note A-4.3.4.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of cold-formed steel shall conform to CSA S136-16 North American Specification for the Design of Cold-Formed Steel Structural Members (using the Appendix B provisions applicable to (See Note A-4.3.4.2.(1).) Note A-4.3.4.2.(1)
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of cold-formed steel shall conform to CSA S136-16 North American Specification for the Design of Cold-Formed Steel Structural Members (using the Appendix B provisions applicable to (See Note A-4.3.4.2.(1) .)

National Sentence Text: Steel building systems shall be manufactured by companies certified in accordance with the requirements of CSA A660-10 Certification of Manufacturers of Steel Building Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Steel building systems shall be manufactured by companies certified in accordance with the requirements of CSA A660-10 Certification of Manufacturers of Steel Building Systems

National Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of aluminum shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-S157-05/S157.1-05 Strength Design in Aluminum/Commentary on CSA S157-05, Strength Design in Aluminum using the loads stipulated in Section 4.1., in accordance with limit states design in Subsection 4.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of aluminum shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-S157-05/S157.1-05 Strength Design in Aluminum/Commentary on CSA S157-05, Strength Design in Aluminum using the loads stipulated in part 4., in accordance with limit states design in part 4.

National Sentence Text: Glass used in buildings shall be designed in conformance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.20-M89 Structural Design of Glass for Buildings using an adjustment factor on the wind load, W, of not less than 0.75, or ASTM E 1300-12ae1 Determining Load Resistance of Glass in Buildings using an adjustment factor on the wind load, W, of not less than 1.0. (See Note A-4.3.6.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Glass used in buildings shall be designed in conformance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.20-M89 Structural Design of Glass for Buildings using an adjustment factor on the wind load, W, of not less than 0.75, or ASTM E 1300-12ae1 Determining Load Resistance of Glass in Buildings using an adjustment factor on the wind load, W, of not less than 1.0.

National Sentence Text: The structural design of air-supported structures shall conform to CSA S367-12 Air-, Cable-, and Frame-Supported Membrane Structures using the loads stipulated in Section 4.1., in accordance with limit states design in Subsection 4.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The structural design of air-supported structures shall conform to CSA S367-12 Air-, Cable-, and Frame-Supported Membrane Structures using the loads stipulated in part 4., in accordance with limit states design in part 4.

National Sentence Text: Parking structures and repair garages shall be designed in conformance with CSA S413-14 Parking Structures (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Parking structures and repair garages shall be designed in conformance with CSA S413-14 Parking Structures (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 4.5.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).) (See Note A-5.)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 4.5.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: This Part is concerned with the control of condensation in building components and assemblies, and on building materials, components and assemblies, and the transfer of heat, air, moisture and sound through building materials, components and assemblies, and interfaces between building materials, components and assemblies. (See Note A-5.1.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Part is concerned with the control of condensation in building components and assemblies, and on building materials, components and assemblies, and the transfer of heat, air, moisture and sound through building materials, components and assemblies, and interfaces between building materials, components and assemblies.

National Sentence Text: This Part applies, as described in Subsection 1.3.3., to building materials, components and assemblies exposed to exterior space or the ground, including those separating interior space from exterior space or separating interior space from the ground, building materials, components and assemblies separating environmentally dissimilar interior spaces (see Note A-5.8.), and site materials, components, assemblies and grading that may affect environmental loads on building materials, components and assemblies exposed to exterior space or the ground. (See Note A-5.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies, as described in part 1., to building materials, components and assemblies exposed to exterior space or the ground, including those separating interior space from exterior space or separating interior space from the ground, building materials, components and assemblies separating environmentally dissimilar interior spaces (see Note A-5.8.), and site materials, components, assemblies and grading that may affect environmental loads on building materials, components and assemblies exposed to exterior space or the ground.

National Sentence Text: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2.. (See Note A-5.1.4.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..

National Sentence Text: Building materials, components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior shall have sufficient capacity and integrity to resist or accommodate all environmental loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected having regard to the intended use of the building, and the environment to which the materials, components and assemblies are subject, and all structural loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected.
P/T Sentence Text: Building materials, components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior shall have sufficient capacity and integrity to resist or accommodate all environmental loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected having regard to the intended use of the building, and the environment to which the materials, components and assemblies are subject, and all structural loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected.

National Sentence Text: Where building materials, components or assemblies perform more than one function, they shall satisfy the requirements of all of those functions. (See Note A-5.1.4.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where building materials, components or assemblies perform more than one function, they shall satisfy the requirements of all of those functions. (See Note A-5.1.4.1.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Compliance with Clause 5.1.4.1.(1)(a) shall be demonstrated by design complying with Subsection 5.2.1. and construction conforming to that design.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence 5.1.4.1.(1) shall be demonstrated by design complying with part 5. and construction conforming to that design.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with Clause 5.1.4.1.(1)(b) shall be demonstrated by design complying with Subsection 5.2.2., and construction conforming to that design, with regard to materials, components and assemblies, and associated loads, that are identified in Part 4, air pressure loads imposed on air barrier systems, wind up-lift imposed on roofing, and hydrostatic pressure imposed on the means of protection from moisture in the ground.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence 5.1.4.1.(1) shall be demonstrated by design complying with part 5., and construction conforming to that design, with regard to materials, components and assemblies, and associated loads, that are identified in part 4., air pressure loads imposed on air barrier systems, wind up-lift imposed on roofing, and hydrostatic pressure imposed on the means of protection from moisture in the ground.

National Sentence Text: For materials, components, assemblies and loads to which Sentence 5.1.4.1.(4) does not apply, compliance with Clause 5.1.4.1.(1)(b) shall be demonstrated by design complying with Subsection 5.2.2. for individual applicable loads and construction conforming to that design, or in the case of common materials, components and assemblies, and their installation, by proven past performance over a period of several years for individual applicable loads. (See Note A-5.1.4.1.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: For materials, components, assemblies and loads to which Sentence 5.1.4.1.(4) does not apply, compliance with Sentence 5.1.4.1.(1) shall be demonstrated by design complying with part 5. for individual applicable loads and construction conforming to that design, or in the case of common materials, components and assemblies, and their installation, by proven past performance over a period of several years for individual applicable loads.

National Sentence Text: Materials, components and assemblies separating dissimilar environments and assemblies exposed to the exterior, including their connections, that are subject to structural loads as defined in Article 5.2.2.1. shall transfer such loads to the building structure without adverse effects on the performance of other materials, components or assemblies, not deflect to a degree that adversely affects the performance of other materials, components or assemblies (see Note A-5.1.4.1.(6)(b) and (c)), and be designed, and constructed according to that design, to accommodate (see Note A-5.1.4.1.(6)(b) and (c)) the maximum relative structural movement that may reasonably be expected, and construction tolerances that may be reasonably expected. (See Article 4.1.3.5., Sentence 4.1.3.3.(2) and Subsection 4.1.8. for information on different types of structural movements.) (See Note A-5.1.4.1.) (See Note A-5.1.4.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Materials, components and assemblies separating dissimilar environments and assemblies exposed to the exterior, including their connections, that are subject to structural loads as defined in Article 5.2.2.1. shall transfer such loads to the building structure without adverse effects on the performance of other materials, components or assemblies, not deflect to a degree that adversely affects the performance of other materials, components or assemblies (see Note A-5.1.4.1.(6)(b)), and be designed, and constructed according to that design, to accommodate (see Note A-5.1.4.1.(6)(b)) the maximum relative structural movement that may reasonably be expected, and construction tolerances that may be reasonably expected.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.1.4.2.(2), materials used in building components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments, or in assemblies exposed to the exterior, shall be compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to any mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature and function of the materials, and the exposure and climatic conditions in which they will be installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.1.4.2.(2), materials used in building components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments, or in assemblies exposed to the exterior, shall be compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to any mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature and function of the materials, and the exposure and climatic conditions in which they will be installed.

National Sentence Text: Material compatibility and deterioration resistance are not required where it can be shown that incompatibility or uncontrolled deterioration will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.
P/T Sentence Text: Material compatibility and deterioration resistance are not required where it can be shown that incompatibility or uncontrolled deterioration will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.

National Sentence Text: Structural and fire safety requirements in other Parts of the NBC shall apply.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Structural and fire safety requirements in other Parts of the NBC shall apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Structural and fire safety requirements in other Parts of this Code shall apply.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Structural and fire safety requirements in other Parts of this Code shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Above ground climatic loads shall be determined according to Subsection 1.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Above ground climatic loads shall be determined according to part 1.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.1.1.(3), below ground exterior environmental loads not described in Subsection 1.1.3. shall be determined from existing geological and hydrological data or from site tests.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.1.1.(3), below ground exterior environmental loads not described in part 1. shall be determined from existing geological and hydrological data or from site tests.

National Sentence Text: Where local design and construction practice has shown soil temperature analysis to be unnecessary, soil temperatures need not be determined. (See Note A-5.2.1.1.(3).) Note A-5.2.1.1.(3)
P/T Sentence Text: Where local design and construction practice has shown soil temperature analysis to be unnecessary, soil temperatures need not be determined. (See Note A-5.2.1.1.(3) .)

National Sentence Text: Interior environmental loads shall be determined in accordance with good practice as described in Sentence 6.2.1.1.(1) based on the intended use of the space. (See Note A-5.2.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Interior environmental loads shall be determined in accordance with good practice as described in Sentence 6.2.1.1.(1) based on the intended use of the space. (See Note A-5.2.1.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Calculations related to the transfer of heat, air and moisture and the transmission of sound shall conform to good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks.
P/T Sentence Text: Calculations related to the transfer of heat, air and moisture and the transmission of sound shall conform to good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of any analysis conducted to indicate conformance to the thermal resistance levels required in Article 5.3.1.2., soil temperatures shall be determined based on annual average soil temperature, seasonal amplitude of variation and attenuation of variation with depth.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of any analysis conducted to indicate conformance to the thermal resistance levels required in Article 5.3.1.2., soil temperatures shall be determined based on annual average soil temperature, seasonal amplitude of variation and attenuation of variation with depth.

National Sentence Text: Wind load calculations shall conform to Subsection 4.1.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Wind load calculations shall conform to part 4.

National Sentence Text: Where materials, components or assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior, or their connections, are required to be designed to withstand structural loads, these loads shall be determined in accordance with Part 4. (See also Subsection 2.2.5..) (See also Subsection 2.2.5..)
P/T Sentence Text: Where materials, components or assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior, or their connections, are required to be designed to withstand structural loads, these loads shall be determined in accordance with part 4.. (See also part 2..)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.1.8.18., the structural loads referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.1.(1) and their related effects shall include dead loads transferred from structural elements, wind, snow, rain, hydrostatic and earth pressures, earthquake effects for post-disaster buildings, depending on their intended function (see Note A-5.2.2.1.(2)(c)), live loads due to use and occupancy, and loads due to thermal or moisture-related expansion and contraction, deflection, deformation, creep, shrinkage, settlement, and differential movement.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.1.8.18., the structural loads referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.1.(1) and their related effects shall include dead loads transferred from structural elements, wind, snow, rain, hydrostatic and earth pressures, earthquake effects for post-disaster buildings, depending on their intended function (see Note A-5.2.2.1.(2)(c)), live loads due to use and occupancy, and loads due to thermal or moisture-related expansion and contraction, deflection, deformation, creep, shrinkage, settlement, and differential movement.

National Sentence Text: Where materials, components or assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior, or their connections, can be expected to be subject to loads or other effects not described in this Subsection or in Part 4, such loads or effects shall be taken into account in the design based on the most current and applicable information available. (See Note A-5.2.2.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where materials, components or assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior, or their connections, can be expected to be subject to loads or other effects not described in this Subsection or in part 4., such loads or effects shall be taken into account in the design based on the most current and applicable information available.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to the determination of wind load to be used in the design of materials, components and assemblies, including their connections, that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior, where these are subject to wind load, and required to be designed to resist wind load.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to the determination of wind load to be used in the design of materials, components and assemblies, including their connections, that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior, where these are subject to wind load, and required to be designed to resist wind load.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(3), the wind load referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(1) shall be 100% of the specified wind load determined in accordance with Article 4.1.7.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(3), the wind load referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(1) shall be 100% of the specified wind load determined in accordance with Article 4.1.7.1.

National Sentence Text: Where it can be shown by test or analysis that a material, component, assembly or connection referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(1) will be subject to less than 100% of the specified wind load, the wind load referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(1) shall be not less than the load determined by test or analysis.
P/T Sentence Text: Where it can be shown by test or analysis that a material, component, assembly or connection referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(1) will be subject to less than 100% of the specified wind load, the wind load referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(1) shall be not less than the load determined by test or analysis.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(5), the wind uplift resistance of membrane roofing assemblies shall be determined in accordance with the requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-A123.21-10 Dynamic Wind Uplift Resistance of Membrane-Roofing Systems (See Note A-5.2.2.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(5), the wind uplift resistance of membrane roofing assemblies shall be determined in accordance with the requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-A123.21-10 Dynamic Wind Uplift Resistance of Membrane-Roofing Systems (See Note A-5.2.2.2.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Membrane roofing assemblies with proven past performance for the anticipated wind loads need not comply with Sentence 5.2.2.2.(4). (See Note A-5.1.4.1.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Membrane roofing assemblies with proven past performance for the anticipated wind loads need not comply with Sentence 5.2.2.2.(4). (See Note A-5.1.4.1.(5).)

National Sentence Text: Structural design shall be carried out in accordance with Subsection 4.1.3. and other applicable requirements in Part 4. (See Note A-5.3.) (See Note A-5.3.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Structural design shall be carried out in accordance with part 4. and other applicable requirements in part 4..

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.1.(2), where a building component or assembly will be subjected to an intended temperature differential, the component or assembly shall include materials to resist heat transfer or a means to dissipate transferred heat in accordance with the remainder of this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.1.(2), where a building component or assembly will be subjected to an intended temperature differential, the component or assembly shall include materials to resist heat transfer or a means to dissipate transferred heat in accordance with the remainder of this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: The installation of materials to resist heat transfer in accordance with the remainder of this Subsection is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled heat transfer will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. (See Note A-5.3.1.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of materials to resist heat transfer in accordance with the remainder of this Subsection is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled heat transfer will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.

National Sentence Text: Taking into account the conditions on either side of the environmental separator, materials and components installed to provide the required resistance to heat transfer or the means implemented to dissipate heat shall provide sufficient resistance or dissipation, to minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component or assembly, in conjunction with other materials and components in the assembly, to minimize condensation within the component or assembly, in conjunction with systems installed for space conditioning, to meet the interior design thermal conditions for the intended occupancy, and to minimize ice damming on sloped roofs. (See Note A-5.3.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Taking into account the conditions on either side of the environmental separator, materials and components installed to provide the required resistance to heat transfer or the means implemented to dissipate heat shall provide sufficient resistance or dissipation, to minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component or assembly, in conjunction with other materials and components in the assembly, to minimize condensation within the component or assembly, in conjunction with systems installed for space conditioning, to meet the interior design thermal conditions for the intended occupancy, and to minimize ice damming on sloped roofs.

National Sentence Text: Where a material required by Article 5.3.1.1. is intersected by a building assembly, penetrated by a high conductance component or interrupted by expansion, control or construction joints, and where condensation is likely to occur at these intersections, penetrations or interruptions, sufficient thermal resistance shall be provided so as to minimize condensation at these locations.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a material required by Article 5.3.1.1. is intersected by a building assembly, penetrated by a high conductance component or interrupted by expansion, control or construction joints, and where condensation is likely to occur at these intersections, penetrations or interruptions, sufficient thermal resistance shall be provided so as to minimize condensation at these locations.

National Sentence Text: Materials providing required thermal resistance shall have sufficient inherent resistance to airflow or be positioned in the assembly so as to prevent convective airflow through and around the material. (See Note A-5.3.1.3.(2).) Note A-5.3.1.3.(2) (See Note A-5.4.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Materials providing required thermal resistance shall have sufficient inherent resistance to airflow or be positioned in the assembly so as to prevent convective airflow through and around the material. (See Note A-5.3.1.3.(2) .)

National Sentence Text: Where a building component or assembly separates interior conditioned space from exterior space, interior space from the ground, or environmentally dissimilar interior spaces, the properties and position of the materials and components in those components or assemblies shall be such that they control air leakage or permit venting to the exterior so as to provide acceptable conditions for the building occupants, maintain appropriate conditions for the intended use of the building, minimize the accumulation of condensation in and the penetration of precipitation into the building component or assembly, control heat transfer to roofs where ice damming can occur, minimize the ingress of airborne radon from the ground with an aim to controlling the indoor radon concentration to an acceptable level, and not compromise the operation of building services.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building component or assembly separates interior conditioned space from exterior space, interior space from the ground, or environmentally dissimilar interior spaces, the properties and position of the materials and components in those components or assemblies shall be such that they control air leakage or permit venting to the exterior so as to provide acceptable conditions for the building occupants, maintain appropriate conditions for the intended use of the building, minimize the accumulation of condensation in and the penetration of precipitation into the building component or assembly, control heat transfer to roofs where ice damming can occur, minimize the ingress of airborne radon from the ground with an aim to controlling the indoor radon concentration to an acceptable level, and not compromise the operation of building services.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.4.1.1.(3), an air barrier system shall be installed to provide the principal resistance to air leakage.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.4.1.1.(3), an air barrier system shall be installed to provide the principal resistance to air leakage.

National Sentence Text: An air barrier system is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled air leakage will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.
P/T Sentence Text: An air barrier system is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled air leakage will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.4.1.2.(2), air barrier materials intended to provide the principal resistance to air leakage shall have an air leakage characteristic not greater than 0.02 L/(s·m2) measured at an air pressure difference of 75 Pa, when tested in accordance to ASTM E 2178-13 Air Permeance of Building Materials or conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S741-08 Air Barrier Materials – Specification (See Note A-5.4.1.2.(1) and (2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.4.1.2.(2), air barrier materials intended to provide the principal resistance to air leakage shall have an air leakage characteristic not greater than 0.02 L/(s·m2) measured at an air pressure difference of 75 Pa, when tested in accordance to ASTM E 2178-13 Air Permeance of Building Materials or conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S741-08 Air Barrier Materials – Specification

National Sentence Text: The air leakage limit specified in Sentence 5.4.1.2.(1) is permitted to be increased where it can be shown that the higher rate of leakage will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of the building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. (See Note A-5.4.1.2.(1) and (2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The air leakage limit specified in Sentence 5.4.1.2.(1) is permitted to be increased where it can be shown that the higher rate of leakage will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of the building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.

National Sentence Text: The air barrier system shall be continuous across construction, control and expansion joints, across junctions between different building assemblies, and around penetrations through the building assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: The air barrier system shall be continuous across construction, control and expansion joints, across junctions between different building assemblies, and around penetrations through the building assembly.

National Sentence Text: The structural design of air barrier systems installed in assemblies subject to air pressure loads shall comply with Article 5.1.4.1. and Subsection 5.2.2. (See Note A-5.5.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: The structural design of air barrier systems installed in assemblies subject to air pressure loads shall comply with Article 5.1.4.1. and part 5.

National Sentence Text: Where a building component or assembly is subjected to differentials in temperature and water vapour pressure, the properties and position of the materials and components in those components or assemblies shall be such that they control vapour diffusion or permit venting to the exterior so as to minimize the accumulation of condensation in the building component or assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building component or assembly is subjected to differentials in temperature and water vapour pressure, the properties and position of the materials and components in those components or assemblies shall be such that they control vapour diffusion or permit venting to the exterior so as to minimize the accumulation of condensation in the building component or assembly.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.1.1.(3), a vapour barrier shall be installed to provide the principal resistance to water vapour diffusion.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.1.1.(3), a vapour barrier shall be installed to provide the principal resistance to water vapour diffusion.

National Sentence Text: A vapour barrier is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled vapour diffusion will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. (See Note A-5.3.1.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: A vapour barrier is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled vapour diffusion will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.

National Sentence Text: The vapour barrier shall have sufficiently low permeance and shall be positioned in the building component or assembly so as to minimize moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, or reduce moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, to a rate that will not allow sufficient accumulation of moisture to cause deterioration or otherwise adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. (See Note A-5.5.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The vapour barrier shall have sufficiently low permeance and shall be positioned in the building component or assembly so as to minimize moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, or reduce moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, to a rate that will not allow sufficient accumulation of moisture to cause deterioration or otherwise adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.

National Sentence Text: Coatings applied to gypsum board to provide required resistance to vapour diffusion shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 5.5.1.2.(1) when tested in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-1.501-M89 Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard
P/T Sentence Text: Coatings applied to gypsum board to provide required resistance to vapour diffusion shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 5.5.1.2.(1) when tested in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-1.501-M89 Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard

National Sentence Text: Coatings applied to materials other than gypsum board to provide required resistance to vapour diffusion shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 5.5.1.2.(1) when tested in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials by the desiccant method (dry cup). (See Note A-5.6.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Coatings applied to materials other than gypsum board to provide required resistance to vapour diffusion shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 5.5.1.2.(1) when tested in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials by the desiccant method (dry cup).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.6.1.1.(2), where a building component or assembly is exposed to precipitation, the component or assembly shall minimize ingress of precipitation into the component or assembly, and prevent ingress of precipitation into interior space.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.6.1.1.(2), where a building component or assembly is exposed to precipitation, the component or assembly shall minimize ingress of precipitation into the component or assembly, and prevent ingress of precipitation into interior space.
