National Sentence Text: Asbestos shall not be used in HVAC systems and equipment.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Asbestos shall not be used in HVAC systems or equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Asbestos shall not be used in HVAC systems or equipment.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Asbestos shall not be used in HVAC systems or equipment.

P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 6.2.1.8.(2), all buildings shall be equipped with heating facilities capable of maintaining the design indoor air temperature commensurate with the use of the building at the outside winter design temperature.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as required by Sentence 6.2.1.8.(2), all buildings shall be equipped with heating facilities capable of maintaining the design indoor air temperature commensurate with the use of the building at the outside winter design temperature.

P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 6.2.1.8.(1), heating facilities capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature of 22°C at the outside winter design temperature shall be provided for all sleeping rooms in a care, treatment or detention occupancy, and in a building used for residential occupancy intended for use in the winter months on a continuing basis.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as permitted by Sentence 6.2.1.8.(1), heating facilities capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature of 22°C at the outside winter design temperature shall be provided for all sleeping rooms in a care, treatment or detention occupancy, and in a building used for residential occupancy intended for use in the winter months on a continuing basis.

P/T Sentence Text: Heating facilities shall be provided in a building used for residential occupancy which shall be capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature at the outside winter design temperature of not less than 18°C in an unfinished basement, and 15°C in a crawl space required to be heated.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Heating facilities shall be provided in a building used for residential occupancy which shall be capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature at the outside winter design temperature of not less than 18°C in an unfinished basement, and 15°C in a crawl space required to be heated.

P/T Sentence Text: Thermostatic control of the heat supply shall be provided in each dwelling unit.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Thermostatic control of the heat supply shall be provided in each dwelling unit.

P/T Sentence Text: Devices shall be provided that enable the heat supply to be controlled to each sleeping room in a building used for care, treatment or detention occupancy, and each room in a residential occupancy that is used or intended to be used for living, sleeping, eating or cooking purposes.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Devices shall be provided that enable the heat supply to be controlled to each sleeping room in a building used for care, treatment or detention occupancy, and each room in a residential occupancy that is used or intended to be used for living, sleeping, eating or cooking purposes.

National Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment

National Sentence Text: A storage bin for solid fuel shall not be located above a sewer opening or drain opening.
P/T Sentence Text: A storage bin for solid fuel shall not be located above a sewer opening or drain opening.

National Sentence Text: Storage bins for solid fuel shall be designed and constructed so that the air temperature in the bin or the surface temperature of any part of the floor or walls is below 50°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage bins for solid fuel shall be designed and constructed so that the air temperature in the bin or the surface temperature of any part of the floor or walls is below 50°C.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.1.1.(3), all buildings shall be ventilated in accordance with this Part.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.1.1.(3), all buildings shall be ventilated in accordance with this Part.

National Sentence Text: Except in storage garages covered by Article 6.3.1.4., the rates at which outdoor air is supplied in buildings by ventilation systems shall be not less than the rates required by ASHRAE ANSI/ASHRAE 62-2001 Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality (except Addendum n).
P/T Sentence Text: Except in storage garages covered by Article 6.3.1.4., the rates at which outdoor air is supplied in buildings by ventilation systems shall be not less than the rates required by ASHRAE ANSI/ASHRAE 62-2001 Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality (except Addendum n).

National Sentence Text: Self-contained heating-season mechanical ventilation systems serving only one dwelling unit shall comply with this Part, or Subsection 9.32.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Self-contained heating-season mechanical ventilation systems serving only one dwelling unit shall comply with this Part, or part 9.

National Sentence Text: Unconditioned and unoccupied crawl spaces and unconditioned and unoccupied attic or roof spaces shall be ventilated by natural or mechanical means as required by Part 5. (See Note A-6.3.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Unconditioned and unoccupied crawl spaces and unconditioned and unoccupied attic or roof spaces shall be ventilated by natural or mechanical means as required by Part 5. (See Note A-6.3.1.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 6.3.1.3.(2), the ventilation required by Article 6.3.1.1. shall be provided by mechanical ventilation, except that it can be provided by natural ventilation or a combination of natural and mechanical ventilation in buildings of other than residential occupancy having an occupant load of not more than one person per 40 m2 during normal use, buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the processes contained therein permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter, and seasonal buildings not intended to be occupied during the winter.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 6.3.1.3.(2), the ventilation required by Article 6.3.1.1. shall be provided by mechanical ventilation, except that it can be provided by natural ventilation or a combination of natural and mechanical ventilation in buildings of other than residential occupancy having an occupant load of not more than one person per 40 m2 during normal use, buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the processes contained therein permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter, and seasonal buildings not intended to be occupied during the winter.

National Sentence Text: Where climatic conditions permit, buildings containing occupancies other than residential occupancies may be ventilated by natural ventilation methods in lieu of mechanical ventilation where engineering data demonstrates that such a method will provide the required ventilation for the type of occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Where climatic conditions permit, buildings containing occupancies other than residential occupancies may be ventilated by natural ventilation methods in lieu of mechanical ventilation where engineering data demonstrates that such a method will provide the required ventilation for the type of occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 6.3.1.4.(4)and 6.3.1.4.(6), an enclosed storage garage for five or more motor vehicles shall have a mechanical ventilation system designed to limit the concentration of carbon monoxide to not more than 100 parts per million parts of air, limit the concentration of nitrogen dioxide to not more than 3 parts per million parts of air, where the majority of the vehicles stored are powered by diesel-fuelled engines, or provide, during operating hours, a continuous supply of outdoor air at a rate of not less than 3.9 L/s for each square metre of floor area (see Article 3.3.1.20.). (See also Sentence 3.3.5.4.(4).) (See Note A-6.3.1.4.(1).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 6.3.1.4.(4) and 6.3.1.4.(6), an enclosed storage garage for five or more motor vehicles shall have a mechanical ventilation system designed to limit the concentration of carbon monoxide to not more than 100 parts per million parts of air, limit the concentration of nitrogen dioxide to not more than 3 parts per million parts of air, where the majority of the vehicles stored are powered by diesel-fuelled engines, or provide, during operating hours, a continuous supply of outdoor air at a rate of not less than 3.9 L/s for each square metre of floor area (see Article 3.3.1.20.). (See also Sentence 3.3.5.4.(4).) (See Note A-6.3.1.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 6.3.1.4.(4) and 6.3.1.4.(6), an enclosed storage garage for five or more motor vehicles shall have a mechanical ventilation system designed to limit the concentration of carbon monoxide to not more than 100 parts per million parts of air when measured between 900 mm and 1 200 mm above the floor, limit the concentration of nitrogen dioxide to not more than 3 parts per million parts of air when measured between 900 mm and 1 200 mm above the floor, where the majority of the vehicles stored are powered by diesel-fuelled engines, or provide, during operating hours, a continuous supply of outdoor air at a rate of not less than 3.9 L/s for each square metre of floor area (see Article 3.3.1.20.).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 6.3.1.4.(4) and 6.3.1.4.(6), an enclosed storage garage for five or more motor vehicles shall have a mechanical ventilation system designed to limit the concentration of carbon monoxide to not more than 100 parts per million parts of air when measured between 900 mm and 1 200 mm above the floor, limit the concentration of nitrogen dioxide to not more than 3 parts per million parts of air when measured between 900 mm and 1 200 mm above the floor, where the majority of the vehicles stored are powered by diesel-fuelled engines, or provide, during operating hours, a continuous supply of outdoor air at a rate of not less than 3.9 L/s for each square metre of floor area (see Article 3.3.1.20.). (See also Sentence 3.3.5.4.(4).) (See Note A-6.3.1.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with Clause 6.3.1.4.(1)(a) shall be controlled by carbon monoxide monitoring devices, and systems provided in accordance with Clause 6.3.1.4.(1)(b) shall be controlled by nitrogen dioxide or other acceptable monitoring devices. (See Note A-6.3.1.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with Sentence 6.3.1.4.(1) shall be controlled by carbon monoxide monitoring devices, and systems provided in accordance with Sentence 6.3.1.4.(1) shall be controlled by nitrogen dioxide or other acceptable monitoring devices. (See Note A-6.3.1.4.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with Sentence 6.3.1.4.(1) shall be designed such that the pressure in the storage garage is less than the pressure in adjoining buildings of other occupancy, or in adjacent portions of the same building having a different occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with Sentence 6.3.1.4.(1) shall be designed such that the pressure in the storage garage is less than the pressure in adjoining buildings of other occupancy, or in adjacent portions of the same building having a different occupancy.

National Sentence Text: In storage garages subject to the requirements of Sentences 6.3.1.4.(1)and 6.3.1.4.(2), where motor vehicles are parked by mechanical means, the ventilation requirements may be reduced by one half.
P/T Sentence Text: In storage garages subject to the requirements of Sentences 6.3.1.4.(1) and 6.3.1.4.(2), where motor vehicles are parked by mechanical means, the ventilation requirements may be reduced by one half.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.1.4.(6), ticket and attendant booths of storage garages shall be pressurized with a supply of uncontaminated air.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.1.4.(6), ticket and attendant booths of storage garages shall be pressurized with a supply of uncontaminated air.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 6.3.1.4.(1)to 6.3.1.4.(5) shall not apply to open-air storeys in a storage garage.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 6.3.1.4.(1) to 6.3.1.4.(5) shall not apply to open-air storeys in a storage garage.

National Sentence Text: Heat recovery ventilators with rated capacities of not less than 25 L/s and not more than 200 L/s shall be installed in accordance with Subsection 9.32.3. (See Note A-6.3.1.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Heat recovery ventilators with rated capacities of not less than 25 L/s and not more than 200 L/s shall be installed in accordance with Subsection 9.

National Sentence Text: Air contaminants of concern that are released within buildings shall be removed insofar as is possible at their points of origin, and not be permitted to accumulate in concentrations greater than those permitted by applicable provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, by good engineering practice such as that described in the publications listed in Sentence 6.2.1.1.(1), measured using the methodology described therein.
P/T Sentence Text: Air contaminants of concern that are released within buildings shall be removed insofar as is possible at their points of origin, and not be permitted to accumulate in concentrations greater than those permitted by applicable provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, by good engineering practice such as that described in the publications listed in Sentence 6.2.1.1.(1), measured using the methodology described therein.

National Sentence Text: Systems serving spaces that contain sources of contamination and systems serving other occupied parts of the building but located in or running through spaces that contain sources of contamination shall be designed in such a manner as to prevent the spread of such contamination to other occupied parts of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Systems serving spaces that contain sources of contamination and systems serving other occupied parts of the building but located in or running through spaces that contain sources of contamination shall be designed in such a manner as to prevent the spread of such contamination to other occupied parts of the building.

National Sentence Text: Heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be designed to minimize the growth and spread of bio-contaminants.
P/T Sentence Text: Heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be designed to minimize the growth and spread of bio-contaminants.
Air contaminants in spaces where workers will be present shall not exceed the occupational exposure limits set out in the Occupational Health and Safety Act and its Regulations.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Air contaminants in spaces where workers will be present shall not exceed the occupational exposure limits set out in the Occupational Health and Safety Act and its Regulations.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5., systems for the ventilation of commercial cooking equipment shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to NFPA 96-2014 Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5., systems for the ventilation of commercial cooking equipment shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to NFPA 96-2017 Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations
A ventilation system for a food establishment shall not have components that allow drips to fall onto surfaces where food is prepared or into food.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): A ventilation system for a food establishment shall not have components that allow drips to fall onto surfaces where food is prepared or into food.

P/T Sentence Text: A ventilation system for a food establishment shall have all openings to the exterior of the building located and protected to prevent the entry of vermin, dust, dirt and other contaminating material into the food establishment.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): A ventilation system for a food establishment shall have all openings to the exterior of the building located and protected to prevent the entry of vermin, dust, dirt and other contaminating material into the food establishment.

P/T Sentence Text: Canopies, hoods and ductwork for a ventilation system exposed within the kitchen or cooking area of a food establishment shall be constructed of stainless steel.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Canopies, hoods and ductwork for a ventilation system exposed within the kitchen or cooking area of a food establishment shall be constructed of stainless steel.

P/T Sentence Text: A food establishment in which food is prepared and the process generates odours, smoke, steam or heat shall have a mechanical ventilation system that includes canopies, ductwork and fans to remove odours, smoke, steam or heat to the exterior of the building.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): A food establishment in which food is prepared and the process generates odours, smoke, steam or heat shall have a mechanical ventilation system that includes canopies, ductwork and fans to remove odours, smoke, steam or heat to the exterior of the building.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems other than those in dwelling units covered by Part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems other than those in dwelling units covered by part 9..

National Sentence Text: Dehumidifying cooling coil assemblies and condensate-producing heat exchangers shall be equipped with drain pans beneath them that are designed in accordance with Section 5.11, Drain Pans, of ASHRAE ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1-2007 Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be eliminated, and installed so that water drains freely from the pan.
P/T Sentence Text: Dehumidifying cooling coil assemblies and condensate-producing heat exchangers shall be equipped with drain pans beneath them that are designed in accordance with Section 5.11, Drain Pans, of ASHRAE ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1-2007 Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be eliminated, and installed so that water drains freely from the pan.

National Sentence Text: All ducts, duct connectors, associated fittings and plenums used in air duct systems shall be constructed of materials as described in Article 3.6.5.1.
P/T Sentence Text: All ducts, duct connectors, associated fittings and plenums used in air duct systems shall be constructed of materials as described in Article 3.6.5.1.

National Sentence Text: Ducts that are used in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet and shall be resistant to moisture-induced corrosion.
P/T Sentence Text: Ducts that are used in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet and shall be resistant to moisture-induced corrosion.

National Sentence Text: All ductwork and fittings shall be constructed and installed as recommended in SMACNA Manuals and ASHRAE Standards.
P/T Sentence Text: All ductwork and fittings shall be constructed and installed as recommended in SMACNA Manuals and ASHRAE Standards.

National Sentence Text: All duct materials shall be suitable for exposure to the temperature and humidity of the air being carried and shall be resistant to corrosion caused by contaminants in the air being conveyed in the duct.
P/T Sentence Text: All duct materials shall be suitable for exposure to the temperature and humidity of the air being carried and shall be resistant to corrosion caused by contaminants in the air being conveyed in the duct.

National Sentence Text: Air duct systems shall have tight-fitting connections throughout. (See Note A-6.3.2.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Air duct systems shall have tight-fitting connections throughout.

National Sentence Text: Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation used in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation used in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.4.

National Sentence Text: Duct linings shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers or of fire dampers, fire stop flaps and other closures.
P/T Sentence Text: Duct linings shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers or of fire dampers, fire stop flaps and other closures.

National Sentence Text: The clearance of ducts and plenums from combustible materials shall comply with Article 3.6.5.6.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance of ducts and plenums from combustible materials shall comply with Article 3.6.5.6.

National Sentence Text: In a care or residential occupancy, air from one suite shall not be circulated to any other suite or to a public corridor.
P/T Sentence Text: In a care or residential occupancy, air from one suite shall not be circulated to any other suite or to a public corridor.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 6.3.2.7.(3)and 6.3.2.10.(6), air duct systems serving storage garages shall not be directly interconnected with other parts of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 6.3.2.7.(3) and 6.3.2.10.(6), air duct systems serving storage garages shall not be directly interconnected with other parts of the building.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts referred to in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(10) are permitted to exhaust through an enclosed storage garage prior to exhausting to the outdoors, provided the storage garage’s exhaust system runs continuously, the capacity of the storage garage’s exhaust system is equal to or exceeds the volume of the exhaust entering the garage, and a leakage rate 1 smoke/fire damper rated in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S112.1-10 Leakage Rated Dampers for Use in Smoke Control Systems is provided near the duct outlet location in the storage garage to prevent air from the storage garage from entering the exhaust ductwork system in the event the building’s exhaust fan is shut down. (See Note A-6.2.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts referred to in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(10) are permitted to exhaust through an enclosed storage garage prior to exhausting to the outdoors, provided the storage garage’s exhaust system runs continuously, the capacity of the storage garage’s exhaust system is equal to or exceeds the volume of the exhaust entering the garage, and a leakage rate 1 smoke/fire damper rated in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S112.1-10 Leakage Rated Dampers for Use in Smoke Control Systems is provided near the duct outlet location in the storage garage to prevent air from the storage garage from entering the exhaust ductwork system in the event the building’s exhaust fan is shut down.

National Sentence Text: In ventilating systems that exhaust air to the outdoors, provision shall be made for the admission of a supply of makeup air in sufficient quantity so that the operation of the exhaust system and other exhaust equipment or combustion equipment is not adversely affected.
P/T Sentence Text: In ventilating systems that exhaust air to the outdoors, provision shall be made for the admission of a supply of makeup air in sufficient quantity so that the operation of the exhaust system and other exhaust equipment or combustion equipment is not adversely affected.

National Sentence Text: Makeup air facilities required by Sentence 6.3.2.8.(1) shall be interlocked with the exhaust devices they serve so that both operate together.
P/T Sentence Text: Makeup air facilities required by Sentence 6.3.2.8.(1) shall be interlocked with the exhaust devices they serve so that both operate together.

National Sentence Text: Where makeup air facilities are intended to introduce air directly from the outdoors to occupied parts of the building in winter, they shall incorporate means of tempering that air to maintain the indoor design temperature.
P/T Sentence Text: Where makeup air facilities are intended to introduce air directly from the outdoors to occupied parts of the building in winter, they shall incorporate means of tempering that air to maintain the indoor design temperature.

National Sentence Text: Supply, return and exhaust air openings located less than 2 m above the floor in rooms or spaces in buildings shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diam sphere.
P/T Sentence Text: Supply, return and exhaust air openings located less than 2 m above the floor in rooms or spaces in buildings shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diam sphere.

National Sentence Text: Outdoor air intakes shall be located so that the quality of the air entering the building complies with Sentences 6.2.1.2.(2)and 6.2.1.2.(3), and they are separated a minimum distance from sources of contaminants in accordance with Table 6.3.2.9.
P/T Sentence Text: Outdoor air intakes shall be located so that the quality of the air entering the building complies with Sentences 6.2.1.2.(2) and 6.2.1.2.(3), and they are separated a minimum distance from sources of contaminants in accordance with Table 6.3.2.9.

National Sentence Text: Outdoor air intakes shall be installed not less than 0.3 m above roofs, landscape grades or other surfaces, taking into account anticipated snow accumulation levels.
P/T Sentence Text: Outdoor air intakes shall be installed not less than 0.3 m above roofs, landscape grades or other surfaces, taking into account anticipated snow accumulation levels.

National Sentence Text: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where experience has shown that climatic conditions require larger openings to prevent the screen openings from icing over.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where experience has shown that climatic conditions require larger openings to prevent the screen openings from icing over.

National Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence 6.3.2.9.(4) shall be accessible for maintenance.
P/T Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence 6.3.2.9.(4) shall be accessible for maintenance.

National Sentence Text: Combustible grilles, diffusers and other devices covering supply, return, intake and exhaust openings shall comply with Article 3.6.5.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible grilles, diffusers and other devices covering supply, return, intake and exhaust openings shall comply with Article 3.6.5.7.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(2), exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(2), exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving similar occupancies may be combined immediately below the point of final delivery to the outdoors, such as at the base of a roof ventilator.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving similar occupancies may be combined immediately below the point of final delivery to the outdoors, such as at the base of a roof ventilator.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts of ventilating systems shall have provision for the removal of condensation where this may be a problem.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts of ventilating systems shall have provision for the removal of condensation where this may be a problem.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust outlets shall be designed to prevent backdraft under wind conditions.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust outlets shall be designed to prevent backdraft under wind conditions.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(6), exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(5) and (6).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(6), exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(5).)

National Sentence Text: Exhaust systems are permitted to exhaust into a storage garage, provided they serve rooms that are accessible only from that storage garage, the exhaust contains no contaminants that would adversely affect the air quality in the storage garage (see Note A-6.3.2.10.(6)(b)), and they are designed in accordance with Sentence 6.3.2.7.(3). (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(5) and (6).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust systems are permitted to exhaust into a storage garage, provided they serve rooms that are accessible only from that storage garage, the exhaust contains no contaminants that would adversely affect the air quality in the storage garage (see Note A-6.3.2.10.(6)(b)), and they are designed in accordance with Sentence 6.3.2.7.(3).

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, accessible for inspection and cleaning, and constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(7) and (8).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, accessible for inspection and cleaning, and constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(7) and (8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, gas vents or chimneys, be accessible for inspection and cleaning, be constructed of a smooth, corrosion-resistant material, not include screens, and not be secured with screws protruding into the duct.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, gas vents or chimneys, be accessible for inspection and cleaning, be constructed of a smooth, corrosion-resistant material, not include screens, and not be secured with screws protruding into the duct. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(7) and (8).)

National Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and be provided with make-up air. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(7) and (8).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and be provided with make-up air. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(7) and (8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, be provided with make-up air, and be constructed of sheet metal material.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, be provided with make-up air, and be constructed of sheet metal material. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(7) and (8).)

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(12) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(12) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(12) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing residential cooking equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(12) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing residential cooking equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.

National Sentence Text: Two or more exhaust systems described in Sentences 6.3.2.10.(10)and 6.3.2.10.(11) may be interconnected or connected with exhaust ducts serving other areas of the building, provided the connections are made at the inlet of an exhaust fan, and all interconnected systems are equipped with suitable back pressure devices to prevent the passage of odours from one system to another when the fan is not in operation, or the exhaust ducts discharge to a shaft that is served by an exhaust fan having a capacity that is equal to or greater than the combined capacity of the exhaust fans discharging to the plenum multiplied by the operation diversity factor, provided that the exhaust fan serving the shaft operates continuously (see Note A-6.3.2.10.(12)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more exhaust systems described in Sentences 6.3.2.10.(10)and 6.3.2.10.(11) may be interconnected or connected with exhaust ducts serving other areas of the building, provided the connections are made at the inlet of an exhaust fan, and all interconnected systems are equipped with suitable back pressure devices to prevent the passage of odours from one system to another when the fan is not in operation, or the exhaust ducts discharge to a shaft that is served by an exhaust fan having a capacity that is equal to or greater than the combined capacity of the exhaust fans discharging to the plenum multiplied by the operation diversity factor, provided that the exhaust fan serving the shaft operates continuously (see Note A-6.3.2.10.(12)(b)).

National Sentence Text: Where exhaust ducts containing air from conditioned spaces pass through or are adjacent to unconditioned spaces, the ducts shall be constructed to prevent condensation from forming on the inside or outside of the ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: Where exhaust ducts containing air from conditioned spaces pass through or are adjacent to unconditioned spaces, the ducts shall be constructed to prevent condensation from forming on the inside or outside of the ducts.

National Sentence Text: Return-air systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Return-air systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.8.

National Sentence Text: Where a ceiling space is used as a return-air plenum, the requirements of Article 3.6.4.3. shall apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a ceiling space is used as a return-air plenum, the requirements of Article 3.6.4.3. shall apply.

National Sentence Text: A public corridor or exit shall not be used as a return-air plenum.
P/T Sentence Text: A public corridor or exit shall not be used as a return-air plenum.

National Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall be constructed and installed to provide interior drainage from and access to all low points, not be connected directly to a sewer, and be installed and constructed of materials recommended by ASHRAE and SMACNA Standards and HRAI Manuals.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall be constructed and installed to provide interior drainage from and access to all low points, not be connected directly to a sewer, and be installed and constructed of materials recommended by ASHRAE and SMACNA Standards and HRAI Manuals.

National Sentence Text: A clean-out or pump-out connection shall be provided in an underground duct system at every low point of the duct system.
P/T Sentence Text: A clean-out or pump-out connection shall be provided in an underground duct system at every low point of the duct system.

National Sentence Text: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S111-13 Fire Tests for Air Filter Units
P/T Sentence Text: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S111-13 Fire Tests for Air Filter Units

National Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or, in dwelling units, when the furnace circulation fan is not operating.
P/T Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or, in dwelling units, when the furnace circulation fan is not operating.

National Sentence Text: Where outdoor air quality conditions do not meet the requirements of Sentence 6.2.1.2.(2), ventilation required by Sentence 6.3.1.1.(1) shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce particles and gases to the maximum acceptable levels described in Sentence 6.2.1.2.(2) prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Where outdoor air quality conditions do not meet the requirements of Sentence 6.2.1.2.(2), ventilation required by Sentence 6.3.1.1.(1) shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce particles and gases to the maximum acceptable levels described in Sentence 6.2.1.2.(2) prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.

National Sentence Text: Where contaminants of concern are present in the outdoor air of the local area of the building site, ventilation required by Sentence 6.3.1.1.(1) shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce the concentrations of contaminants to those permitted in the ACGIH’s ACGIH 28th Edition Industrial Ventilation: A Manual of Recommended Practice for Design prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Where contaminants of concern are present in the outdoor air of the local area of the building site, ventilation required by Sentence 6.3.1.1.(1) shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce the concentrations of contaminants to those permitted in the ACGIH’s ACGIH 28th Edition Industrial Ventilation: A Manual of Recommended Practice for Design prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.

National Sentence Text: Discharge from evaporative cooling towers to ventilation air intakes shall comply with Sentence 6.3.2.9.(2), and CSA CAN/CSA-Z317.2-10 Special Requirements for Heating, Ventilation, and Air-Conditioning (HVAC) Systems in Health Care Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: Discharge from evaporative cooling towers to ventilation air intakes shall comply with Sentence 6.3.2.9.(2), and CSA CAN/CSA-Z317.2-10 Special Requirements for Heating, Ventilation, and Air-Conditioning (HVAC) Systems in Health Care Facilities

National Sentence Text: The distance between the air intakes of evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers in relation to kitchen exhaust outlets, vegetation or other sources of organic matter shall be not less than 4.6 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance between the air intakes of evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers in relation to kitchen exhaust outlets, vegetation or other sources of organic matter shall be not less than 4.6 m.

National Sentence Text: Make-up water connections shall be equipped with backflow prevention devices that conform to Article 2.6.2.1. of Division B of the NPC.
P/T Sentence Text: Make-up water connections shall be equipped with backflow prevention devices that conform to Article 2.6.2.1. of Division B of the NPC.

National Sentence Text: Water treatment equipment for biological growth control shall be provided in accordance with Sub-Section 7.6.2. of ASHRAE Guideline 12-2000 Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Water treatment equipment for biological growth control shall be provided in accordance with Sub-Section 7.6.2. of ASHRAE Guideline 12-2000 Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems

National Sentence Text: Drains, overflows and blow-downs shall be connected to the building’s drainage system in accordance with Clause 2.4.2.1.(1)(e) of Division B of the NPC.
P/T Sentence Text: Drains, overflows and blow-downs shall be connected to the building’s drainage system in accordance with Clause 2.4.2.1.(1)(e) of Division B of the NPC.

National Sentence Text: Evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers shall be provided with access ports, service platforms, fixed ladders and restraint connections to allow visual inspection, maintenance and testing.
P/T Sentence Text: Evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers shall be provided with access ports, service platforms, fixed ladders and restraint connections to allow visual inspection, maintenance and testing.

National Sentence Text: The filter and water evaporation medium of every air washer and evaporative air cooler enclosed within a building shall be made of noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: The filter and water evaporation medium of every air washer and evaporative air cooler enclosed within a building shall be made of noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Sumps for air washers and evaporative air coolers shall be constructed and installed so that they can be flushed and drained.
P/T Sentence Text: Sumps for air washers and evaporative air coolers shall be constructed and installed so that they can be flushed and drained.

National Sentence Text: Evaporative air coolers, misters, atomizers, air washers and humidifiers shall be designed in accordance with Sections 8 and 9 of ASHRAE Guideline 12-2000 Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Evaporative air coolers, misters, atomizers, air washers and humidifiers shall be designed in accordance with Sections 8 and 9 of ASHRAE Guideline 12-2000 Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems

National Sentence Text: Fans for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be located and installed so that their operation does not adversely affect the draft required for proper operation of fuel-fired appliances, and does not allow the air in the duct system to be contaminated by air or gases from the boiler room or furnace room.
P/T Sentence Text: Fans for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be located and installed so that their operation does not adversely affect the draft required for proper operation of fuel-fired appliances, and does not allow the air in the duct system to be contaminated by air or gases from the boiler room or furnace room.

National Sentence Text: Fans and associated air-handling equipment, such as air washers, filters and heating and cooling units, when installed on the roof or elsewhere outside the building, shall be of a type designed for outdoor use.
P/T Sentence Text: Fans and associated air-handling equipment, such as air washers, filters and heating and cooling units, when installed on the roof or elsewhere outside the building, shall be of a type designed for outdoor use.

National Sentence Text: Vibration isolation connectors in air duct systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Vibration isolation connectors in air duct systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.2.

National Sentence Text: Tape used for sealing joints in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Tape used for sealing joints in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 6.3.3.2.and 6.3.3.3., the products of combustion from oil-, gas- and solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be vented in conformance with the requirements in the applicable appliance installation standard listed in Article 6.2.1.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 6.3.3.2. and 6.3.3.3., the products of combustion from oil-, gas- and solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be vented in conformance with the requirements in the applicable appliance installation standard listed in Article 6.2.1.5.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 6.2.1.5., vented products of combustion, other than those referred to in Sentence 6.3.3.1.(1), shall be discharged away from the building, so as not to re-enter it, to a distance not less than 2.15 m above sidewalks and driveways, 3 m from outdoor air intakes, 3 m horizontally or vertically from doors and operable windows, and 3 m horizontally or vertically from occupiable outdoor spaces, excluding maintenance spaces. (See Note A-6.3.3.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 6.2.1.5., vented products of combustion, other than those referred to in Sentence 6.3.3.1.(1), shall be discharged away from the building, so as not to re-enter it, to a distance not less than 2.15 m above sidewalks and driveways, 3 m from outdoor air intakes, 3 m horizontally or vertically from doors and operable windows, and 3 m horizontally or vertically from occupiable outdoor spaces, excluding maintenance spaces.

National Sentence Text: Rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height shall conform to Part 9. if they serve appliances with a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, or fireplaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height shall conform to part 9. if they serve appliances with a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, or fireplaces.

National Sentence Text: Masonry or concrete chimneys other than those described in Sentence 6.3.3.2.(1) shall be designed and installed in conformance with the appropriate requirements in NFPA 211-2016 Chimneys, Fireplaces, Vents, and Solid Fuel-Burning Appliances
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry or concrete chimneys other than those described in Sentence 6.3.3.2.(1) shall be designed and installed in conformance with the appropriate requirements in NFPA 211-2016 Chimneys, Fireplaces, Vents, and Solid Fuel-Burning Appliances

National Sentence Text: Single wall metal smoke stacks shall be designed and installed in conformance with NFPA 211-2016 Chimneys, Fireplaces, Vents, and Solid Fuel-Burning Appliances
P/T Sentence Text: Single wall metal smoke stacks shall be designed and installed in conformance with NFPA 211-2016 Chimneys, Fireplaces, Vents, and Solid Fuel-Burning Appliances

National Sentence Text: Access ladders for chimneys, when provided, shall consist of steel or bronze rungs, built into the walls of the chimneys.
P/T Sentence Text: Access ladders for chimneys, when provided, shall consist of steel or bronze rungs, built into the walls of the chimneys.

National Sentence Text: Rungs for external ladders shall begin at not less than 2.5 m from ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Rungs for external ladders shall begin at not less than 2.5 m from ground level.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to laboratories where dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, are used in normal laboratory operations in quantities or in a manner that creates a fire or explosion hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to laboratories where dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, are used in normal laboratory operations in quantities or in a manner that creates a fire or explosion hazard.

National Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed to ensure that dangerous goods vapours and particles do not accumulate in the laboratory, are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, do not accumulate in the ventilation system, are exhausted to the outdoors, and are not returned to the building.
P/T Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed to ensure that dangerous goods vapours and particles do not accumulate in the laboratory, are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, do not accumulate in the ventilation system, are exhausted to the outdoors, and are not returned to the building.

National Sentence Text: A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be provided with monitoring devices to indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and sound an alarm if the ventilation system is malfunctioning.
P/T Sentence Text: A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be provided with monitoring devices to indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and sound an alarm if the ventilation system is malfunctioning.

National Sentence Text: A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be maintained in conformance with Article 5.5.4.1. of Division B of the NFC.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be maintained in conformance with Article 5.5.4.1. of Division B of the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be maintained in conformance with Article 5.5.4.1. of Division B of the NFC(AE).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be maintained in conformance with Article 5.5.4.1. of Division B of the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC shall conform to NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system, confine dangerous goods vapours and particles to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors, not return the exhausted air to the building, and be provided with well identified control switches that are located outside of the power-ventilated enclosure, and readily accessible in case of an emergency.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC shall conform to NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system, confine dangerous goods vapours and particles to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors, not return the exhausted air to the building, and be provided with well identified control switches that are located outside of the power-ventilated enclosure, and readily accessible in case of an emergency.
P/T Sentence Text: The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC(AE) shall conform to NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system, confine dangerous goods vapours and particles to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors, not return the exhausted air to the building, and be provided with well identified control switches that are located outside of the power-ventilated enclosure, and readily accessible in case of an emergency.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC(AE) shall conform to NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system, confine dangerous goods vapours and particles to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors, not return the exhausted air to the building, and be provided with well identified control switches that are located outside of the power-ventilated enclosure, and readily accessible in case of an emergency.

National Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC and its exhaust duct system shall except as provided in Sentences 6.3.4.4.(2)and 6.3.4.4.(3), be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to the dangerous goods vapours and particles being exhausted, and be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC and its exhaust duct system shall except as provided in Sentences 6.3.4.4.(2) and 6.3.4.4.(3), be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to the dangerous goods vapours and particles being exhausted, and be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC(AE) and its exhaust duct system shall except as provided in Sentences 6.3.4.4.(2) and 6.3.4.4.(3), be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to the dangerous goods vapours and particles being exhausted, and be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC(AE) and its exhaust duct system shall except as provided in Sentences 6.3.4.4.(2) and 6.3.4.4.(3), be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to the dangerous goods vapours and particles being exhausted, and be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts.

National Sentence Text: Combustible materials are permitted in systems described in Clause 6.3.4.4.(1)(a) if such materials are required by the corrosive or reactive properties of the dangerous goods being used, and their flame-spread rating is not more than 25.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible materials are permitted in systems described in Sentence 6.3.4.4.(1) if such materials are required by the corrosive or reactive properties of the dangerous goods being used, and their flame-spread rating is not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating required by Sentence 6.3.4.4.(2) is permitted to be greater than 25 if an automatic fire suppression system is provided inside the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating required by Sentence 6.3.4.4.(2) is permitted to be greater than 25 if an automatic fire suppression system is provided inside the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system.

National Sentence Text: Except for appliances installed in dwelling units, fuel-fired heating appliances shall be located, enclosed or separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Section 3.6.(See also Subsection 9.10.10.) (See also Subsection 9.10.10.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for appliances installed in dwelling units, fuel-fired heating appliances shall be located, enclosed or separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with part 3.(See also part 9.)

National Sentence Text: Fuel-fired appliances installed outside a building shall be designed and constructed for outdoor use.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel-fired appliances installed outside a building shall be designed and constructed for outdoor use.

National Sentence Text: Every unit heater using either steam or hot water as the heating medium shall be installed such that the clearances between the appliance and adjacent combustible material conform to Table 6.7.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Every unit heater using either steam or hot water as the heating medium shall be installed such that the clearances between the appliance and adjacent combustible material conform to Table 6.7.1.2.

National Sentence Text: A noncombustible lining or backing shall be provided for every steam or hot water radiator and convector located in a recess or concealed space, or attached to the face of a wall of combustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: A noncombustible lining or backing shall be provided for every steam or hot water radiator and convector located in a recess or concealed space, or attached to the face of a wall of combustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Every steam or hot water radiator and convector shall be installed so as to conform to the clearance requirements of Table 6.7.1.2. (See Note A-6.3.2.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Every steam or hot water radiator and convector shall be installed so as to conform to the clearance requirements of Table 6.7.1.2.

National Sentence Text: Insulation and coverings on pipes shall comply with Article 3.6.5.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation and coverings on pipes shall comply with Article 3.6.5.5.

National Sentence Text: Insulation and coverings on pipes shall be composed of material that will withstand deterioration from softening, melting, mildew and mould at the operating temperature of the system.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation and coverings on pipes shall be composed of material that will withstand deterioration from softening, melting, mildew and mould at the operating temperature of the system.

National Sentence Text: Exposed piping or equipment subject to human contact shall be insulated so that the temperature of the exposed surface does not exceed 70°C. (See Note A-6.5.1.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exposed piping or equipment subject to human contact shall be insulated so that the temperature of the exposed surface does not exceed 70°C. (See Note A-6.5.1.1.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Where a cooling unit is combined with a fuel-fired furnace in the same duct system, the cooling unit shall be installed in parallel with the heating furnace, upstream of the furnace provided the furnace is designed for such application, or downstream of the furnace provided the cooling unit is designed to prevent excessive temperature or pressure in the refrigeration system.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a cooling unit is combined with a fuel-fired furnace in the same duct system, the cooling unit shall be installed in parallel with the heating furnace, upstream of the furnace provided the furnace is designed for such application, or downstream of the furnace provided the cooling unit is designed to prevent excessive temperature or pressure in the refrigeration system.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be made from materials designed to withstand the effects of temperatures and pressures that may occur in the system. (See Articles 3.1.5.19., 3.1.9.1., 9.10.9.6.and 9.10.9.7. for fire safety requirements.)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be made from materials designed to withstand the effects of temperatures and pressures that may occur in the system. (See Articles 3.1.5.19., 3.1.9.1. , 9.10.9.6. and 9.10.9.7. for fire safety requirements.)

National Sentence Text: Every pipe used in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be installed to allow for expansion and contraction due to temperature changes.
P/T Sentence Text: Every pipe used in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be installed to allow for expansion and contraction due to temperature changes.

National Sentence Text: Supports and anchors for piping in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be designed and installed to ensure that undue stress is not placed on the supporting structure.
P/T Sentence Text: Supports and anchors for piping in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be designed and installed to ensure that undue stress is not placed on the supporting structure.

National Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 6.7.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 6.7.1.2.

National Sentence Text: The exposed surface temperature of a steam or hot water radiator shall not exceed 70°C unless precautions are taken to prevent human contact. (See Note A-6.5.1.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: The exposed surface temperature of a steam or hot water radiator shall not exceed 70°C unless precautions are taken to prevent human contact. (See Note A-6.5.1.1.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Where a pipe carrying steam or hot water at a temperature above 120°C passes through a combustible floor, ceiling or wall, the construction shall be protected by a sleeve of metal or other noncombustible material not less than 50 mm larger in diameter than the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pipe carrying steam or hot water at a temperature above 120°C passes through a combustible floor, ceiling or wall, the construction shall be protected by a sleeve of metal or other noncombustible material not less than 50 mm larger in diameter than the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Where piping for heating or air-conditioning systems is enclosed in a shaft, the requirements of Article 3.6.3.1. for shafts shall apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping for heating or air-conditioning systems is enclosed in a shaft, the requirements of Article 3.6.3.1. for shafts shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Service pipes passing through a storage bin for solid fuel shall be protected or so located as to avoid damage to the pipes.
P/T Sentence Text: Service pipes passing through a storage bin for solid fuel shall be protected or so located as to avoid damage to the pipes.

National Sentence Text: Except for fuel-thawing pipes, every pipe designed to operate at a temperature of 50°C or above shall be located where solid fuel cannot be stored in contact with it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for fuel-thawing pipes, every pipe designed to operate at a temperature of 50°C or above shall be located where solid fuel cannot be stored in contact with it.

National Sentence Text: Any covering of an access opening through which a person could enter shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys where there is a possibility of the opening being accidentally closed while the system or equipment is being serviced.
P/T Sentence Text: Any covering of an access opening through which a person could enter shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys where there is a possibility of the opening being accidentally closed while the system or equipment is being serviced.

National Sentence Text: Air duct systems shall have no openings other than those required for the proper operation and maintenance of the system.
P/T Sentence Text: Air duct systems shall have no openings other than those required for the proper operation and maintenance of the system.

National Sentence Text: Access openings shall be provided in duct systems to allow the removal of material that may accumulate in plenums and ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: Access openings shall be provided in duct systems to allow the removal of material that may accumulate in plenums and ducts.

National Sentence Text: When odour removal equipment of the adsorption type is used, it shall be installed to allow access so that adsorption material can be reactivated or renewed, and protected from dust accumulation by air filters installed on the inlet side.
P/T Sentence Text: When odour removal equipment of the adsorption type is used, it shall be installed to allow access so that adsorption material can be reactivated or renewed, and protected from dust accumulation by air filters installed on the inlet side.

National Sentence Text: Facilities for flushing and drainage shall be provided where filters are designed to be washed in place.
P/T Sentence Text: Facilities for flushing and drainage shall be provided where filters are designed to be washed in place.

National Sentence Text: The fire safety characteristics of heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall comply with Subsection 3.6.5.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire safety characteristics of heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall comply with Subsection 3.

National Sentence Text: Characteristics referred to in Sentence 6.9.1.1.(1) include but are not limited to use of combustible materials in duct systems, flame-spread ratings and smoke-developed ratings of duct and pipe materials and coverings, installation of equipment relative to property lines, and requirements for fire dampers and fire stop flaps.
P/T Sentence Text: Characteristics referred to in Sentence 6.9.1.1.(1) include but are not limited to use of combustible materials in duct systems, flame-spread ratings and smoke-developed ratings of duct and pipe materials and coverings, installation of equipment relative to property lines, and requirements for fire dampers and fire stop flaps.

Except as provided in Subsection 6., systems serving spaces that contain hazardous gases, dusts or liquids shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to the requirements of this Code or, in the absence of specific requirements, to good engineering practice such as that described in the publications of the National Fire Protection Association and in the NFC(AE). (See Note A-6.9.1.2.(1).)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Subsection 6.3.4., systems serving spaces that contain hazardous gases, dusts or liquids shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to the requirements of this Code or, in the absence of specific requirements, to good engineering practice such as that described in the publications of the National Fire Protection Association and in the NFC(AE). (See Note A-6.9.1.2.(1).)

P/T Sentence Text: When indoor piping for Class I flammable liquids is installed in a trench, the trench shall be provided with positive ventilation to the outdoors, or designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.

Ventilation systems in storage rooms where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored in compliance with the NFC(AE) shall provide at least 5 L/s of exhaust air per square metre of room area, but not less than 70 L/s in total.

P/T Sentence Text: Materials selected for components and accessories used in and around a water slide flume shall have all parts with external surfaces and edges that may come into contact with a slider assembled, arranged and finished so that they will not constitute a cutting, pinching, puncturing or abrasion hazard in casual contact and in intended use.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Materials selected for components and accessories used in and around a water slide flume shall have all parts with external surfaces and edges that may come into contact with a slider assembled, arranged and finished so that they will not constitute a cutting, pinching, puncturing or abrasion hazard in casual contact and in intended use.

P/T Sentence Text: Structural design of a water slide flume, its supporting structure and ancillary facilities shall conform to part 4. or, in the absence of specific requirements, to good engineering practice.

P/T Sentence Text: A water slide flume and its receiving pool shall be watertight with smooth, inert, non-toxic surfaces that are easy to clean.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): A water slide flume and its receiving pool shall be watertight with smooth, inert, non-toxic surfaces that are easy to clean.

P/T Sentence Text: A water slide flume shall be designed to prevent a hazardous concentration of disinfectant fumes and enclosed sections shall be ventilated if necessary.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): A water slide flume shall be designed to prevent a hazardous concentration of disinfectant fumes and enclosed sections shall be ventilated if necessary.

P/T Sentence Text: All curves, turns, and tunnels within the path of a water slide flume shall be designed so that body impact with the walls of the flume or ceiling of a tunnel does not present a hazard.

P/T Sentence Text: A water slide flume shall be banked to keep a slider’s body safely inside the flume or curve under all foreseeable circumstances.

P/T Sentence Text: All slopes within the path of a water slide flume shall be designed so that the slider’s speed does not exceed a level where a safe equilibrium of dynamic forces can be maintained on any curve or turn within a path, as required by Sentences 7.2.7.3.(4)and 7.2.7.3.(5).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): All slopes within the path of a water slide flume shall be designed so that the slider s speed does not exceed a level where a safe equilibrium of dynamic forces can be maintained on any curve or turn within a path, as required by Sentences 7.2.7.3.(4) and 7.2.7.3.(5).

P/T Sentence Text: In sections of an elevated water slide flume where, contrary to intended use, a slider may stop, there shall be safety walls or other provisions to keep a slider from falling out of the flume.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): In sections of an elevated water slide flume where, contrary to intended use, a slider may stop, there shall be safety walls or other provisions to keep a slider from falling out of the flume.

P/T Sentence Text: The wall thickness of a water slide flume shall be designed so that the continuous and combined action of hydrostatic, dynamic and static loads and normal environmental deterioration do not cause structural failure, which could result in injury, or continually require repair, which would weaken the strength of the original structure.

P/T Sentence Text: The slope of the floor of a receiving pool shall be not more than 1:7.

National Sentence Text: A covered way shall have a clear height of not less than 2.5 m, have a clear width of not less than 1.5 m or the width of the public way, whichever is the lesser, be designed and constructed to support safely all loads that may be reasonably expected to be applied to it, but in no case less than 2.4 kPa on the roof, have a weathertight roof sloped towards the site or, if flat, be equipped with a splash board not less than 300 mm high on the street side, be totally enclosed on the site side with a structure having a reasonably smooth surface facing the public way, have a railing 1 070 mm high on the street side where the covered way is supported by posts on the street side, and be adequately lighted when the public way is lighted.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 8.2.3.2., provisions shall be made at all times for the safe passage of pedestrian and vehicular traffic past the site.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 8.2.3.2., provisions shall be made at all times for the safe passage of pedestrian and vehicular traffic past the site.

National Sentence Text: Material or equipment shall not be placed on any street or other public property except as authorized.
P/T Sentence Text: Material or equipment shall not be placed on any street or other public property except as authorized.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 8.2.3.1.(4), where a sidewalk exists adjacent to the site it shall be kept clear of obstructions at all times.

P/T Sentence Text: Where construction operations necessitate the obstruction of a sidewalk, a temporary sidewalk shall be provided and it shall be kept clear of obstruction at all times.

National Sentence Text: Operations such as the hoisting of major components onto a tall building or other overhead activities that constitute a hazard to pedestrians below from which the public cannot be protected by barricades, covered ways or similar means shall not be carried out until the street or other public way is closed.

P/T Sentence Text: If the safety of pedestrians cannot be assured during hoisting or the undertaking of other hazardous operations, then the gates required by Sentence 8.2.1.2.(1) and Sentence 8.2.1.3.(3) that are located in the danger zone shall be closed and locked and pedestrians shall be redirected away from the danger.

National Sentence Text: Excavations in streets or public property shall be adequately barricaded, and have warning signs or lights installed on each section of the barricades referred to in Clause 8.2.3.3.(1)(a).

National Sentence Text: All sidewalks, streets or other public property that have been damaged shall be restored to a safe condition.
P/T Sentence Text: All sidewalks, streets or other public property that have been damaged shall be restored to a safe condition.

National Sentence Text: All obstructions on sidewalks, streets or other public property shall be removed when the need for such obstructions is ended.

National Sentence Text: Warning lights shall be placed and shall be in operation during the hours of darkness at all obstructions on streets or other public ways.
P/T Sentence Text: Warning lights shall be placed and shall be in operation during the hours of darkness at all obstructions on streets or other public ways.

National Sentence Text: Where a hazard to vehicular traffic on a public way is created by work on a construction site, the following shall be provided to direct the traffic: one or more workers, warning signs, barriers, lane control devices, or flashing lights or flares located at a suitable distance from the hazard.

National Sentence Text: A flag used to direct traffic shall be red, not less than 450 mm by 500 mm, mounted on a staff not less than 1 m long, with the long side of the flag attached securely to the staff along its entire length, and maintained in a clean and untorn condition when being used.
P/T Sentence Text: A flag used to direct traffic shall be red, not less than 450 mm by 500 mm, mounted on a staff not less than 1 m long, with the long side of the flag attached securely to the staff along its entire length, and maintained in a clean and untorn condition when being used.

National Sentence Text: A sign used to direct traffic shall be diamond-shaped and of material not less rigid than 6 mm thick plywood, not less than 450 mm by 450 mm in size and mounted at one corner on a substantial pole not less than 1.2 m long, red on one side with black corner areas so that the red area is a regular 8-sided figure, and with the word "STOP" or "ARRÊT" in clearly distinguishable white letters not less than 150 mm high located centrally on the sign, yellow on the other side with the word "SLOW" or "LENTEMENT" in clearly distinguishable black letters not less than 150 mm high located centrally on the sign, or symbols recognized by the International Traffic Code, and maintained in a clean condition when being used.

National Sentence Text: A worker who is directing traffic shall be equipped as required by Article 8.2.4.5., be instructed in the signals to be used in controlling traffic, be provided with a copy of written instructions on the correct methods for traffic direction, and direct traffic by using either a flag or sign.
