National Sentence Text: A worker while directing traffic shall wear the following clothing which shall be fluorescent and coloured either blaze orange or red: a vest, or sleeves that extend from above the elbow to the wrist.
P/T Sentence Text: A worker while directing traffic shall wear the following clothing which shall be fluorescent and coloured either blaze orange or red: a vest, or sleeves that extend from above the elbow to the wrist.

National Sentence Text: Waste material or other material shall not be permitted to fall freely from one storey to another.
P/T Sentence Text: Waste material or other material shall not be permitted to fall freely from one storey to another.

National Sentence Text: Waste material shall be removed as quickly as possible by means of appropriate containers, an enclosed shaft or chute conforming to Sentence 8.2.5.4.(1), or a hoisting apparatus if large pieces or objects are involved.
P/T Sentence Text: Waste material shall be removed as quickly as possible by means of appropriate containers, an enclosed shaft or chute conforming to Sentence 8.2.5.4.(1), or a hoisting apparatus if large pieces or objects are involved.

National Sentence Text: Waste material cleared as provided in Sentence 8.2.5.2.(1) shall be deposited in an enclosure so arranged as to prevent waste material from being projected beyond the confines of the enclosure, and not accessible to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Waste material cleared as provided in Sentence 8.2.5.2.(1) shall be deposited in an enclosure so arranged as to prevent waste material from being projected beyond the confines of the enclosure, and not accessible to the public.

National Sentence Text: The chute described in Clause 8.2.5.2.(1)(b) shall be closed if it is inclined more than 45° to the horizontal.
P/T Sentence Text: The chute described in Sentence 8.2.5.2.(1) shall be closed if it is inclined more than 45° to the horizontal.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 8.3.1.1. National Sentence Text: The application of this Part shall be as described in Subsection 1.3.3.. (See Note A-9.1.1.1.(1) regarding application to seasonally and intermittently occupied buildings.)
P/T Sentence Text: The application of this Part shall be as described in part 1.. (See Note A-9.1.1.1.(1) regarding application to seasonally and intermittently occupied buildings.)

National Sentence Text: The total floor area of all storeys of a secondary suite shall be not more than the lesser of 80% of the total floor area of all storeys of the other dwelling unit, excluding the garage floor area and common spaces serving both dwelling units, and 80 m2.

National Sentence Text: Words in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..
P/T Sentence Text: Words in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..

National Sentence Text: Unreinforced and nominally reinforced site-batched concrete shall be designed, mixed, placed and cured in accordance with Articles 9.3.1.2.to 9.3.1.9.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.3.1.1.(4), reinforced concrete shall be designed to conform to the requirements of Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.3.1.1.(4), reinforced concrete shall be designed to conform to the requirements of part 4..

National Sentence Text: For flat insulating concrete form walls not exceeding 2 storeys in building height and having a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m, in buildings of light-frame construction containing only a single dwelling unit, the concrete and reinforcing shall comply with Part 4 or the concrete shall conform to CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction with a maximum aggregate size of 19 mm, and the reinforcing shall conform to CSA G30.18-09 Carbon Steel Bars for Concrete Reinforcement have a minimum specified yield strength of 400 MPa, and be lapped a minimum of 450 mm for 10M bars and 650 mm for 15M bars (see also Articles 9.15.4.5.and 9.20.17.2.to 9.20.17.4.).

National Sentence Text: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001-13 Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001-13 Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete

National Sentence Text: Concrete in contact with sulphate soil, which is deleterious to normal cement, shall conform to the requirements in Clause 4.1.1.6 of CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete in contact with sulphate soil, which is deleterious to normal cement, shall conform to the requirements in Clause 4.1.1.6 of CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction

National Sentence Text: Aggregates shall consist of sand, gravel, crushed rock, crushed air-cooled blast furnace slag, expanded shale or expanded clay conforming to CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction and be clean, well-graded and free of injurious amounts of organic and other deleterious material.
P/T Sentence Text: Aggregates shall consist of sand, gravel, crushed rock, crushed air-cooled blast furnace slag, expanded shale or expanded clay conforming to CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction and be clean, well-graded and free of injurious amounts of organic and other deleterious material.

National Sentence Text: Water shall be clean and free of injurious amounts of oil, organic matter, sediment or any other deleterious material. (See also Article 9.12.4.1., Sentence 9.15.4.2.(1) and Article 9.18.6.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Water shall be clean and free of injurious amounts of oil, organic matter, sediment or any other deleterious material.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided elsewhere in this Part, the compressive strength of unreinforced concrete after 28 days shall be not less than 15 MPa for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 20 MPa for floors other than those in garages and carports, and for garage and carport floors, and the exterior steps, 32 MPa, or 30 MPa where indigenous aggregates do not achieve 32 MPa with a 0.45 water to cementing material ratio.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided elsewhere in this Part, the compressive strength of unreinforced concrete after 28 days shall be not less than 15 MPa for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 20 MPa for floors other than those in garages and carports, and for garage and carport floors, and the exterior steps, 32 MPa, or 30 MPa where indigenous aggregates do not achieve 32 MPa with a 0.45 water to cementing material ratio.

National Sentence Text: Site-batched concrete used for garage and carport floors and exterior steps shall have air entrainment of 5 to 8%. (See Note A-9.3.1.7.)
P/T Sentence Text: Site-batched concrete used for garage and carport floors and exterior steps shall have air entrainment of 5 to 8%.

National Sentence Text: For pre-mixed concrete and for the site-batched concrete mixes described in Table 9.3.1.7., the maximum ratio of water to cementing materials measured by weight shall not exceed 0.70 for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 0.65 for floors other than those in garages and carports, and 0.45 for garage and carport floors, and exterior steps.

National Sentence Text: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence 9.3.1.7.(1) shall not exceed 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence 9.3.1.7.(1) shall not exceed 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.

National Sentence Text: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C 260/C 260M-10a Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete or ASTM C 494/C 494M-13 Chemical Admixtures for Concrete as applicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C 260/C 260M-10a Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete or ASTM C 494/C 494M-13 Chemical Admixtures for Concrete as applicable.

National Sentence Text: When the air temperature is below 5°C, concrete shall be kept at a temperature of not less than 10°C or more than 25°C while being mixed and placed, and maintained at a temperature of not less than 10°C for 72 h after placing.

National Sentence Text: No frozen material or ice shall be used in concrete described in Sentence 9.3.1.9.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: No frozen material or ice shall be used in concrete described in Sentence 9.3.1.9.(1).

National Sentence Text: Lumber for joists, rafters, trusses and beams and for the uses listed in Table 9.3.2.1. shall be identified by a grade stamp to indicate its grade as determined by NLGA 2014 Standard Grading Rules for Canadian Lumber (See Note A-9.3.2.1.(1).) See Note A-Table 9.3.2.1.

P/T Sentence Text: Except for joists, rafters, trusses and beams, visually graded lumber shall conform to the grades in Table 9.3.2.1. (See Article 9.23.4.2. for joists, rafters and beams and Article 9.23.14.11. for trusses.)

National Sentence Text: Machine stress rated lumber shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 4.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Machine stress rated lumber shall conform to the requirements of part 4.

National Sentence Text: OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating the manufacturer of the material, the standard to which it is produced, and that the material is of an exterior type.

National Sentence Text: Moisture content of lumber shall be not more than 19% at the time of installation.

National Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur, clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence 9.3.2.9.(2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites. (See Note A-9.3.2.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur, clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence 9.3.2.9.(2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.

National Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur and foundations are insulated or otherwise finished in a manner that could conceal a termite infestation, a metal or plastic barrier shall be installed through the insulation and any other separation or finish materials above finished ground level to control the passage of termites behind or through the insulation, separation or finish materials, and all sides of the finished supporting assembly shall be visible to permit inspection.
P/T Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur and foundations are insulated or otherwise finished in a manner that could conceal a termite infestation, a metal or plastic barrier shall be installed through the insulation and any other separation or finish materials above finished ground level to control the passage of termites behind or through the insulation, separation or finish materials, and all sides of the finished supporting assembly shall be visible to permit inspection.

National Sentence Text: Structural wood elements shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the vertical clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm (see also Articles 9.23.2.2.and 9.23.2.3.), or where the wood elements are not protected from exposure to precipitation, the configuration is conducive to moisture accumulation, and the moisture index is greater than 1.00. (See Note A-9.3.2.9.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Structural wood elements shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the vertical clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm (see also Articles 9.23.2.2. and 9.23.2.3.), or where the wood elements are not protected from exposure to precipitation, the configuration is conducive to moisture accumulation, and the moisture index is greater than 1.00.

National Sentence Text: Structural wood elements used in retaining walls and cribbing shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the retaining wall or cribbing supports ground that is critical to the stability of buildingfoundations, or the retaining wall or cribbing is greater than 1.2 m in height. (See Note A-9.3.2.9.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Structural wood elements used in retaining walls and cribbing shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the retaining wall or cribbing supports ground that is critical to the stability of buildingfoundations, or the retaining wall or cribbing is greater than 1.2 m in height.

National Sentence Text: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures, of CSA CAN/CSA-O80.1-08 Specification of Treated Wood as follows: Use Category 1 (UC1), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member remains dry, Use Category 2 (UC2), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, Use Category 3.2 (UC3.2), where the wood member is used in exterior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, Use Category 4.1 (UC4.1), where the wood member is in contact with the ground, the wood member is in contact with fresh water, or the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or Use Category 4.2 (UC4.2), where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures, of CSA CAN/CSA-O80.1-08 Specification of Treated Wood as follows: Use Category 1 (UC1), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member remains dry, Use Category 2 (UC2), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, Use Category 3.2 (UC3.2), where the wood member is used in exterior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, Use Category 4.1 (UC4.1), where the wood member is in contact with the ground, the wood member is in contact with fresh water, or the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or Use Category 4.2 (UC4.2), where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.

National Sentence Text: Where wood is protected in accordance with UC1 or UC2 using an inorganic boron preservative, the wood shall be protected from direct exposure to water during and after the completion of construction, and separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier that is resistant to all expected mechanisms of deterioration in the service environment if the vertical clearance to the ground is less than 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood is protected in accordance with UC1 or UC2 using an inorganic boron preservative, the wood shall be protected from direct exposure to water during and after the completion of construction, and separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier that is resistant to all expected mechanisms of deterioration in the service environment if the vertical clearance to the ground is less than 150 mm.

National Sentence Text: Wood that is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay shall be identified by a mark to indicate the type of preservative used and conformance to the relevant required Use Category.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood that is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay shall be identified by a mark to indicate the type of preservative used and conformance to the relevant required Use Category.

National Sentence Text: Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material that are stated in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material and, in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.

National Sentence Text: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of ASTM A 653/A 653M-13 Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated (Galvanized) or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated (Galvannealed) by the Hot-Dip Process or ASTM A 792/A 792M-10 Steel Sheet, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of ASTM A 653/A 653M-13 Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated (Galvanized) or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated (Galvannealed) by the Hot-Dip Process or ASTM A 792/A 792M-10 Steel Sheet, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process

National Sentence Text: Where galvanized sheet steel is intended for use in locations exposed to the weather or as a flashing material, it shall have a zinc coating not less than the G90 [Z275] coating designation or an aluminum-zinc alloy coating not less than the AZM150 coating designation, as referred to in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1). (See Note A-9.4.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where galvanized sheet steel is intended for use in locations exposed to the weather or as a flashing material, it shall have a zinc coating not less than the G90 [Z275] coating designation or an aluminum-zinc alloy coating not less than the AZM150 coating designation, as referred to in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, be designed according to good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction or be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in Part 9, or Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, be designed according to good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction or be designed according to part 4. using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in part 9., or part 4..

National Sentence Text: Where floor framing is designed in accordance with Clause 9.4.1.1.(1)(b)or 9.4.1.1.(1)(c), and where supporting wall framing and fastenings, or footings, are designed according to Clause 9.4.1.1.(1)(a), the maximum specified live load on the floor according to Table 4.1.5.3. shall not exceed 2.4 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Where floor framing is designed in accordance with Sentence 9.4.1.1.(1) or 9.4.1.1.(1), and where supporting wall framing and fastenings, or footings, are designed according to Sentence 9.4.1.1.(1), the maximum specified live load on the floor according to Table 4.1.5.3. shall not exceed 2.4 kPa.

National Sentence Text: Location-specific information for structural design, including snow and wind loads and seismic spectral response accelerations, shall be determined according to Subsection 1.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Location-specific information for structural design, including snow and wind loads and seismic spectral response accelerations, shall be determined according to part 1.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to light-frame constructions whose wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of frames of small repetitive structural members, and where the roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., the clear span of any structural member does not exceed 12.2 m, the maximum deflection of the structural roof members conforms to Article 9.4.3.1., the maximum total roof area, notwithstanding any separation of adjoining buildings by firewalls, is 4 550 m2, and for flat roofs, there are no significant obstructions on the roof, such as parapet walls, spaced closer than the distance calculated by Do=10Ho-0.8 Ss/gwhereDo= minimum distance between obstructions, m, Ho= height of the obstruction above the roof, m, Ss= ground snow load, kPa, and  = specific weight of snow, kN/m3. (See Note A-9.4.2.1.(1).) (See Note A-9.4.2.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to light-frame constructions whose wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of frames of small repetitive structural members, and where the roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., the clear span of any structural member does not exceed 12.2 m, the maximum deflection of the structural roof members conforms to Article 9.4.3.1., the maximum total roof area, notwithstanding any separation of adjoining buildings by firewalls, is 4 550 m2 , and for flat roofs, there are no significant obstructions on the roof, such as parapet walls, spaced closer than the distance calculated by Do=10Ho-0.8 Ss/gwhereDo= minimum distance between obstructions, m, Ho= height of the obstruction above the roof, m, Ss= ground snow load, kPa, and  = specific weight of snow, kN/m3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.4.2.2.(2)and 9.4.2.2.(3), specified snow loads shall be not less than those calculated using the following formula: S=CbSs+SrwhereS= specified snow load, Cb= basic snow load roof factor, which is 0.45 where the entire width of the roof does not exceed 4.3 m and 0.55 for all other roofs, Ss= 1-in-50-year ground snow load in kPa, determined according to Subsection 1.1.3., and Sr= associated 1-in-50-year rain load in kPa, determined according to Subsection 1.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.4.2.2.(2) and 9.4.2.2.(3), specified snow loads shall be not less than those calculated using the following formula: S=CbSs+SrwhereS= specified snow load, Cb= basic snow load roof factor, which is 0.45 where the entire width of the roof does not exceed 4.3 m and 0.55 for all other roofs, Ss= 1-in-50-year ground snow load in kPa, determined according to part 1., and Sr= associated 1-in-50-year rain load in kPa, determined according to part 1.

National Sentence Text: In no case shall the specified snow load be less than 1 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: In no case shall the specified snow load be less than 1 kPa.

National Sentence Text: Bow string, arch or semi-circular roof trusses having an unsupported span greater than 6 m shall be designed in conformance with the snow load requirements in Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Bow string, arch or semi-circular roof trusses having an unsupported span greater than 6 m shall be designed in conformance with the snow load requirements in Subsection 4.

National Sentence Text: Balconies, decks and other accessible exterior platforms intended for an occupancy and subject to snow loads shall be designed to carry the specified roof snow load or 1.9 kPa, whichever is greater, where the platform, or each segregated area of the platform, serves a single dwelling unit. (See Note A-9.4.2.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Balconies, decks and other accessible exterior platforms intended for an occupancy and subject to snow loads shall be designed to carry the specified roof snow load or 1.9 kPa, whichever is greater, where the platform, or each segregated area of the platform, serves a single dwelling unit. (See Note A-9.4.2.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The ceiling joists or truss bottom chords in residential attic or roof spaces having limited accessibility that precludes the storage of equipment or material shall be designed for a total specified load of not less than 0.35 kPa, where the total specified load is the sum of the specified dead load plus the specified live load of the ceiling. (See Note A-9.4.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The ceiling joists or truss bottom chords in residential attic or roof spaces having limited accessibility that precludes the storage of equipment or material shall be designed for a total specified load of not less than 0.35 kPa, where the total specified load is the sum of the specified dead load plus the specified live load of the ceiling. (See Note A-9.4.2.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The maximum deflection of structural members shall conform to Table 9.4.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum deflection of structural members shall conform to Table 9.4.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence 9.4.3.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence 9.4.3.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: Footing sizes for shallow foundations shall be determined in accordance with Section 9.15., or designed in accordance with Section 4.2. using the maximum allowable bearing pressures in Table 9.4.4.1., or allowable bearing pressures determined from subsurface investigation.
P/T Sentence Text: Footing sizes for shallow foundations shall be determined in accordance with part 9., or designed in accordance with part 4. using the maximum allowable bearing pressures in Table 9.4.4.1., or allowable bearing pressures determined from subsurface investigation.

National Sentence Text: Where a soil or rock within a distance equal to twice the footing width below the bearing surface has a lower allowable bearing pressure than that at the bearing surface as shown in Article 9.4.4.1., the design capacity of the foundation shall not be greater than would cause the weakest soil or rock to be stressed beyond its allowable bearing pressure.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a soil or rock within a distance equal to twice the footing width below the bearing surface has a lower allowable bearing pressure than that at the bearing surface as shown in Article 9.4.4.1., the design capacity of the foundation shall not be greater than would cause the weakest soil or rock to be stressed beyond its allowable bearing pressure.

National Sentence Text: In calculating subsurface pressures referred to in Sentence 9.4.4.2.(1), the loads from the footings shall be assumed to be distributed uniformly over a horizontal plane within a frustum extending downward from the footing at an angle of 60° to the horizontal.
P/T Sentence Text: In calculating subsurface pressures referred to in Sentence 9.4.4.2.(1), the loads from the footings shall be assumed to be distributed uniformly over a horizontal plane within a frustum extending downward from the footing at an angle of 60° to the horizontal.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation bears on gravel, sand or silt, and the water table is within a distance below the bearing surface equal to the width of the foundation, the allowable bearing pressure shall be 50% of that determined in Article 9.4.4.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation bears on gravel, sand or silt, and the water table is within a distance below the bearing surface equal to the width of the foundation, the allowable bearing pressure shall be 50% of that determined in Article 9.4.4.1.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation is located in an area where soil movement caused by changes in soil moisture content, freezing, or chemical-microbiological oxidation is known to occur to the extent that it will damage a building, measures shall be taken to preclude such movement or to reduce its effects on the building so that the building’s stability and the performance of assemblies will not be adversely affected. (See Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation is located in an area where soil movement caused by changes in soil moisture content, freezing, or chemical-microbiological oxidation is known to occur to the extent that it will damage a building, measures shall be taken to preclude such movement or to reduce its effects on the building so that the building’s stability and the performance of assemblies will not be adversely affected. (See Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Walls shall be designed to resist the lateral pressure of the retained material. (See Note A-9.4.4.6. and 9.15.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Walls shall be designed to resist the lateral pressure of the retained material.

National Sentence Text: Except where constructed in accordance with Section 9.15., walls supporting drained earth shall be designed for a pressure equivalent to that exerted by a fluid that has a density of not less than 480 kg/m3 and a depth equal to that of the retained earth, or in accordance with Section 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where constructed in accordance with part 9., walls supporting drained earth shall be designed for a pressure equivalent to that exerted by a fluid that has a density of not less than 480 kg/m3 and a depth equal to that of the retained earth, or in accordance with part 4. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Walls supporting other than drained earth shall be designed for the pressure described in Clause 9.4.4.6.(1)(a) plus the fluid pressure of the surcharge, or in accordance with Section 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Walls supporting other than drained earth shall be designed for the pressure described in Sentence 9.4.4.6.(1) plus the fluid pressure of the surcharge, or in accordance with part 4. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise indicated herein, dimensions of rooms or spaces shall be measured between finished wall surfaces and between finished floor and ceiling surfaces. (See Note A-9.5.1.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Unless otherwise indicated herein, dimensions of rooms or spaces shall be measured between finished wall surfaces and between finished floor and ceiling surfaces.

National Sentence Text: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the area of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the area of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.

National Sentence Text: Where the dependent area is a bedroom, direct passage shall be provided between the two areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the dependent area is a bedroom, direct passage shall be provided between the two areas.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.5.2.3.and 3.8.2.1., every building shall be designed in conformance with Section 3.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.5.2.3. and 3.8.2.1., every building shall be designed in conformance with Section 3.

National Sentence Text: Where a barrier-free path of travel required in Article 9.5.2.1. is provided to any storey above the first storey, the requirements in Article 3.3.1.7. shall apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a barrier-free path of travel required in Article 9.5.2.1. is provided to any storey above the first storey, the requirements in Article 3.3.1.7. shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.5.2.3.(2), if the building is not equipped with an elevator, the barrier-free path of travel described in Section 3.8. need only be provided on the entrance level of an apartment building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.5.2.3.(2), if the building is not equipped with an elevator, the barrier-free path of travel described in part 3. need only be provided on the entrance level of an apartment building.

National Sentence Text: The barrier-free path of travel on the entrance level described in Sentence 9.5.2.3.(1) need not be provided where the difference in floor elevation between the entrance level and every dwelling unit exceeds 600 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The barrier-free path of travel on the entrance level described in Sentence 9.5.2.3.(1) need not be provided where the difference in floor elevation between the entrance level and every dwelling unit exceeds 600 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.5.3.1.(2)and 9.5.3.1.(3), the ceiling heights and clear heights in rooms or spaces in residential occupancies shall conform to Table 9.5.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.5.3.1.(2) and 9.5.3.1.(3), the ceiling heights and clear heights in rooms or spaces in residential occupancies shall conform to Table 9.5.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Ceiling heights in secondary suites shall be not less than 1.95 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling heights in secondary suites shall be not less than 1.95 m.

National Sentence Text: Clear heights under beams and ducting in secondary suites shall be not less than 1.85 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Clear heights under beams and ducting in secondary suites shall be not less than 1.85 m.

National Sentence Text: Areas in rooms or spaces over which ceiling height and clear height are not less than the minimum specified in Table 9.5.3.1. or Sentence 9.5.3.1.(2)or 9.5.3.1.(3) shall be contiguous with the entry or entries to those rooms or spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Areas in rooms or spaces over which ceiling height and clear height are not less than the minimum specified in Table 9.5.3.1. or Sentence 9.5.3.1.(2) or 9.5.3.1.(3) shall be contiguous with the entry or entries to those rooms or spaces.

National Sentence Text: The ceiling height above and below a mezzanine floor assembly in occupancies other than residential occupancies shall be not less than 2.1 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The ceiling height above and below a mezzanine floor assembly in occupancies other than residential occupancies shall be not less than 2.1 m.

National Sentence Text: The clear height in a storage garage shall be not less than 2 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height in a storage garage shall be not less than 2 m.

National Sentence Text: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm where there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and a second exit is provided in the hallway near the end farthest from the living area, or in each bedroom served by the hallway.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm where there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and a second exit is provided in the hallway near the end farthest from the living area, or in each bedroom served by the hallway.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.5.5.1.(2) and Articles 9.5.5.3., 9.9.6.2. and 9.9.6.3., doorway openings within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be designed to accommodate at least the door sizes given in Table 9.5.5.1. for swing-type and folding doors.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.5.5.1.(2) and Articles 9.5.5.3., 9.9.6.2. and 9.9.6.3., doorway openings within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be designed to accommodate at least the door sizes given in Table 9.5.5.1. for swing-type and folding doors.

National Sentence Text: Doorway openings within secondary suites shall be designed to accommodate swing-type and folding doors not less than 1 890 mm high where the ceiling height complies with Sentence 9.5.3.1.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Doorway openings within secondary suites shall be designed to accommodate swing-type and folding doors not less than 1 890 mm high where the ceiling height complies with Sentence 9.5.3.1.(2).

National Sentence Text: Doorways to public water-closet rooms shall be not less than 810 mm wide and 2 030 mm high. (See Note A-9.5.5.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Doorways to public water-closet rooms shall be not less than 810 mm wide and 2 030 mm high.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies where a hallway of not less than 860 mm wide serves one or more rooms containing a bathtub, shower or water closet.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies where a hallway of not less than 860 mm wide serves one or more rooms containing a bathtub, shower or water closet.

National Sentence Text: At least one doorway in a hallway described in Sentence 9.5.5.3.(1) shall be constructed so that access is provided to not less than 1 of each type of fixture described in Sentence 9.5.5.3.(1), and to accommodate a door not less than 760 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one doorway in a hallway described in Sentence 9.5.5.3.(1) shall be constructed so that access is provided to not less than 1 of each type of fixture described in Sentence 9.5.5.3.(1), and to accommodate a door not less than 760 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to glass in interior doors and interior windows and their sidelights, clothes closets, site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, shower or bathtub enclosures, glazed panels and partitions, and the protection of glass.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to glass in interior doors and interior windows and their sidelights, clothes closets, site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, shower or bathtub enclosures, glazed panels and partitions, and the protection of glass.

National Sentence Text: Glass shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.2-M91 Flat, Clear Sheet Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.3-M91 Flat, Clear Float Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.4-M91 Heat Absorbing Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.8-97 Insulating Glass Units CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.10-M76 Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass or ASTM E 2190-10 Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation
P/T Sentence Text: Glass shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.2-M91 Flat, Clear Sheet Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.3-M91 Flat, Clear Float Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.4-M91 Heat Absorbing Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.8-97 Insulating Glass Units CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.10-M76 Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass or ASTM E 2190-10 Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation

National Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors are only permitted to be used at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-82.6-M86 Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe (See Note A-9.6.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors are only permitted to be used at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-82.6-M86 Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe (See Note A-9.6.1.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.3.(2), glass shall be designed in conformance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.20-M89 Structural Design of Glass for Buildingsor ASTM E 1300-12ae1 Determining Load Resistance of Glass in Buildings (See also Article 4.3.6.1.).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.3.(2), glass shall be designed in conformance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.20-M89 Structural Design of Glass for Buildingsor ASTM E 1300-12ae1 Determining Load Resistance of Glass in Buildings (See also Article 4.3.6.1.).

National Sentence Text: Where the building has an essentially uniform distribution of paths for air leakage, including operable openings, but no large openings that would permit wind gusts to rapidly enter the building and the building is not in an exceptionally exposed location such as a hilltop, the maximum area of individual panes of glass for windows shall conform to Tables 9.6.1.3.-Ato 9.6.1.3.-C, where the building has a height from grade to the uppermost roof of 12 m or less, and is located in a built-up area, no less than 120 m away from the boundary between this area and open terrain, or Tables 9.6.1.3.-Dto 9.6.1.3.-F. (See Note A-9.6.1.3.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The maximum area of individual panes of glass for doors shall conform to Table 9.6.1.3.-G.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum area of individual panes of glass for doors shall conform to Table 9.6.1.3.-G.

National Sentence Text: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a dwelling unit and in public areas shall be safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a dwelling unit and in public areas shall be safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), glass in entrance doors to dwelling units and in public areas, other than the entrance doors described in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(1), shall be safety glass or wired glass of the type described in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(1) where the glass area exceeds 0.5 m2 and extends to less than 900 mm from the bottom of the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), glass in entrance doors to dwelling units and in public areas, other than the entrance doors described in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(1), shall be safety glass or wired glass of the type described in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(1) where the glass area exceeds 0.5 m2 and extends to less than 900 mm from the bottom of the door.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.

National Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences 9.6.1.4.(2), 9.6.1.4.(3)and 9.6.1.4.(5), except that such partitions shall be suitably marked to indicate their existence and position.
P/T Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences 9.6.1.4.(2) , 9.6.1.4.(3) and 9.6.1.4.(5), except that such partitions shall be suitably marked to indicate their existence and position.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to windows, doors and skylights in buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to windows, doors and skylights in buildings .

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "doors" includes glazing in doors and sidelights for doors.

National Sentence Text: A door shall be provided at each entrance to a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to Section 9.5.

National Sentence Text: The protection of window and door openings to protect persons from falling through them shall conform to Article 9.8.8.1.

National Sentence Text: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to Section 9.9.

National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required means of egress from bedrooms shall conform to Subsection 9.9.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required means of egress from bedrooms shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to Subsection 9.10.12.
P/T Sentence Text: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Doors between dwelling units and attached garages shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors between dwelling units and attached garages shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15.

National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required access to a building for firefighting purposes shall conform to Subsection 9.10.20.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required access to a building for firefighting purposes shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Windows and skylights installed to provide required non-heating season ventilation shall conform to Article 9.32.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and skylights installed to provide required non-heating season ventilation shall conform to Article 9.32.2.2.

National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in part 9.

Notwithstanding the installation of overhead doors for vehicular access, at least one egress door not less than 1 980 mm high and 760 mm wide, swinging on a vertical axis shall be installed to serve a storage garage. (See Note A-9.7.2.3.(1).)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Notwithstanding the installation of overhead doors for vehicular access, at least one egress door not less than 1 980 mm high and 760 mm wide, swinging on a vertical axis shall be installed to serve a storage garage. (See Note A-9.7.2.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.7.3.1.(2)to 9.7.3.1.(4), windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist the ingress of precipitation into interior space (see Note A-9.7.4.2.(1)), resist wind loads, control air leakage, resist the ingress of insects and vermin, where required, resist forced entry, and are easily operable when not intended to be fixed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.7.3.1.(2) to 9.7.3.1.(4), windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist the ingress of precipitation into interior space (see Note A-9.7.4.2.(1)), resist wind loads, control air leakage, resist the ingress of insects and vermin, where required, resist forced entry, and are easily operable when not intended to be fixed.

National Sentence Text: Skylights and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that they resist snow loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Skylights and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that they resist snow loads.

National Sentence Text: Where windows, doors and skylights and their components separate suites from the remainder of the building, they shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they control air leakage, where required, resist forced entry, and are easily operable when not intended to be fixed.
P/T Sentence Text: Where windows, doors and skylights and their components separate suites from the remainder of the building, they shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they control air leakage, where required, resist forced entry, and are easily operable when not intended to be fixed.

National Sentence Text: Storm doors for sliding doors and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist wind loads, control air leakage to a minimum allowable 5 m3h/m and a maximum allowable 8.35 m3h/m, resist the ingress of insects and vermin, and be easily operable.
P/T Sentence Text: Storm doors for sliding doors and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist wind loads, control air leakage to a minimum allowable 5 m3h/m and a maximum allowable 8.35 m3h/m, resist the ingress of insects and vermin, and be easily operable.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with the performance requirements described in Sentences 9.7.3.1.(1)to 9.7.3.1.(4) shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in Subsection 9.7.4.or 9.7.5., and Subsection 9.7.6., or design and construction conforming to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the performance requirements described in Sentences 9.7.3.1.(1)to 9.7.3.1.(4) shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in part 9. or 9., and part 9., or design and construction conforming to part 5..

National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights and their components described in Sentence 9.7.1.1.(1) shall be designed, constructed and installed to minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component (see Note A-9.7.3.2.(1)(a)), and ensure comfortable conditions for occupants.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights and their components described in Sentence 9.7.1.1.(1) shall be designed, constructed and installed to minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component (see Note A-9.7.3.2.(1)(a)), and ensure comfortable conditions for occupants.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence 9.7.3.2.(1) shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or design and construction conforming to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence 9.7.3.2.(1) shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or design and construction conforming to part 5..

National Sentence Text: Metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.

National Sentence Text: Windows and doors described in Sentence 9.7.3.3.(1) do not require a thermal break where they are installed as vehicular access doors, storm windows and doors, or windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors described in Sentence 9.7.3.3.(1) do not require a thermal break where they are installed as vehicular access doors, storm windows and doors, or windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights with or without storm doors or sash that are installed in buildings where the intended use of the interior space will not result in high moisture generation shall have a maximum thermal transmittance (U-value) or minimum temperature index (I) in accordance with Table 9.7.3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights with or without storm doors or sash that are installed in buildings where the intended use of the interior space will not result in high moisture generation shall have a maximum thermal transmittance (U-value) or minimum temperature index (I) in accordance with Table 9.7.3.3.

National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights with or without storm doors or sash that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with Section 5.3. (See Note A-9.25.5.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights with or without storm doors or sash that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with part 5. (See Note A-9.25.5.2.)

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to windows, doors and skylights covered in the scope of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (Harmonized Standard).
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to windows, doors and skylights covered in the scope of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (Harmonized Standard).

National Sentence Text: Manufactured and pre-assembled windows, doors and skylights and their installation shall conform to CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (Harmonized Standard), CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights the remainder of this Subsection, and the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6. (See Note A-9.7.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Manufactured and pre-assembled windows, doors and skylights and their installation shall conform to CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (Harmonized Standard), CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights the remainder of this Subsection, and the applicable requirements in part 9.

National Sentence Text: Performance grades for windows, doors and skylights shall be selected according to the Canadian Supplement referenced in Clause 9.7.4.2.(1)(b) so as to be appropriate for the conditions and geographic location in which the window, door or skylight will be installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Performance grades for windows, doors and skylights shall be selected according to the Canadian Supplement referenced in Sentence 9.7.4.2.(1) so as to be appropriate for the conditions and geographic location in which the window, door or skylight will be installed.

National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the performance grades selected in Sentence 9.7.4.3.(1) when tested in accordance with the Harmonized Standard referenced in Clause 9.7.4.2.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the performance grades selected in Sentence 9.7.4.3.(1) when tested in accordance with the Harmonized Standard referenced in Sentence 9.7.4.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: The minimum level of performance required for windows, doors and skylights shall be that of the Performance Class R.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum level of performance required for windows, doors and skylights shall be that of the Performance Class R.

National Sentence Text: Exterior wood doors shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-O132.2 Series-90 Wood Flush Doors and shall have legibly indicated on them the name of the manufacturer, the standard according to which they were produced, and that they are of an exterior type.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior wood doors shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-O132.2 Series-90 Wood Flush Doors and shall have legibly indicated on them the name of the manufacturer, the standard according to which they were produced, and that they are of an exterior type.

National Sentence Text: Materials, design, construction and installation of windows, doors and skylights that separate conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior but that are not covered in the scope of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights shall conform to the remainder of this Subsection or Subsection 9.7.4., and the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6., or to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials, design, construction and installation of windows, doors and skylights that separate conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior but that are not covered in the scope of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights shall conform to the remainder of this Subsection or part 9., and the applicable requirements in part 9., or to part 5..

National Sentence Text: Glass for site-built windows, doors, sidelights for doors, and skylights shall comply with Section 9.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass for site-built windows, doors, sidelights for doors, and skylights shall comply with part 9.

National Sentence Text: Except for exterior doors to garages and to other ancillary spaces, this Article applies to swinging entrance doors to dwelling units, swinging doors between dwelling units and attached garages or other ancillary spaces, and swinging doors that provide access directly or indirectly from a storage garage to a dwelling unit. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for exterior doors to garages and to other ancillary spaces, this Article applies to swinging entrance doors to dwelling units, swinging doors between dwelling units and attached garages or other ancillary spaces, and swinging doors that provide access directly or indirectly from a storage garage to a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Doors, frames and hardware that conform to a security level of at least Grade 10 as described in the Annex to ASTM F 476-14 Security of Swinging Door Assemblies are not required to conform to Sentences 9.7.5.2.(3)to 9.7.5.2.(7). (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Doors, frames and hardware that conform to a security level of at least Grade 10 as described in the Annex to ASTM F 476-14 Security of Swinging Door Assemblies are not required to conform to Sentences 9.7.5.2.(3)to 9.7.5.2.(7). (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), wood doors as described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be solid core or stile-and-rail type, be not less than 45 mm thick, and if of the stile-and-rail type, have a panel thickness of not less than 19 mm, with a total panel area not more than half of the door area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), wood doors as described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be solid core or stile-and-rail type, be not less than 45 mm thick, and if of the stile-and-rail type, have a panel thickness of not less than 19 mm, with a total panel area not more than half of the door area.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be provided with a deadbolt lock with a cylinder having no fewer than 5 pins, and a bolt throw not less than 25 mm long, protected with a solid or hardened free-turning ring or beveled cylinder housing. (See Article 9.9.6.7.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be provided with a deadbolt lock with a cylinder having no fewer than 5 pins, and a bolt throw not less than 25 mm long, protected with a solid or hardened free-turning ring or beveled cylinder housing.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), an inactive leaf in double doors used in locations specified in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be provided with heavy-duty bolts top and bottom having an engagement of not less than 15 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), an inactive leaf in double doors used in locations specified in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be provided with heavy-duty bolts top and bottom having an engagement of not less than 15 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), hinges for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be fastened to wood doors with wood screws not less than 25 mm long and to wood frames with wood screws so that at least 2 screws per hinge penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or to metal doors and metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 10 and not less than 10 mm long. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), hinges for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be fastened to wood doors with wood screws not less than 25 mm long and to wood frames with wood screws so that at least 2 screws per hinge penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or to metal doors and metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 10 and not less than 10 mm long.

National Sentence Text: Strikeplates for deadbolts described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(4) shall be fastened to wood frames with wood screws that penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or to metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 8 and not less than 10 mm long. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(6))
P/T Sentence Text: Strikeplates for deadbolts described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(4) shall be fastened to wood frames with wood screws that penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or to metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 8 and not less than 10 mm long.

National Sentence Text: Except for storm or screen doors, doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) that swing outward shall be provided with hinges or pins so that the doors cannot be removed when they are in the closed position. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for storm or screen doors, doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) that swing outward shall be provided with hinges or pins so that the doors cannot be removed when they are in the closed position. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(8).)

National Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be provided on both sides at the lock height between the jambs for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) and the structural framing so that the jambs will resist spreading by force.
P/T Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be provided on both sides at the lock height between the jambs for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) and the structural framing so that the jambs will resist spreading by force.

National Sentence Text: In dwelling units, windows, any part of which is located within 2 m of adjacent ground level, shall conform to the requirements for resistance to forced entry as described in Clause 5.3.5 of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (See Note A-9.7.5.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In dwelling units, windows, any part of which is located within 2 m of adjacent ground level, shall conform to the requirements for resistance to forced entry as described in Clause 5.3.5 of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (See Note A-9.7.5.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A440.4-07 Window, Door, and Skylight Installation except that shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be made of treated plywood, and protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to Section 9.27.
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A440.4-07 Window, Door, and Skylight Installation except that shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be made of treated plywood, and protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: The installation of manufactured and pre-assembled windows, doors and skylights and the field assembly of manufactured window and door combination units shall conform to the manufacturer’s instructions.
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of manufactured and pre-assembled windows, doors and skylights and the field assembly of manufactured window and door combination units shall conform to the manufacturer’s instructions.

National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall be sealed to air barriers and vapour barriers.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall be sealed to air barriers and vapour barriers.

National Sentence Text: The sealing compound used to seal the glass component of an insulating glazing unit to the sash component shall be compatible with the sealing compound used to edge seal the glass component.
P/T Sentence Text: The sealing compound used to seal the glass component of an insulating glazing unit to the sash component shall be compatible with the sealing compound used to edge seal the glass component.

National Sentence Text: Flashing used to protect openings shall conform to Articles 9.27.3.7.and 9.27.3.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing used to protect openings shall conform to Articles 9.27.3.7.and 9.27.3.8.

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall be applied between window frames or trim and the exterior cladding or masonry in conformance with Subsection 9.27.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall be applied between window frames or trim and the exterior cladding or masonry in conformance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: All unfinished portions of the frame and other components of aluminum windows, doors or skylights in contact with the edges of masonry, concrete, stucco or plaster shall be protected with an alkali-resistant coating.
P/T Sentence Text: All unfinished portions of the frame and other components of aluminum windows, doors or skylights in contact with the edges of masonry, concrete, stucco or plaster shall be protected with an alkali-resistant coating.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to the design and construction of interior and exterior stairs, steps, ramps, handrails and guards.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to the design and construction of interior and exterior stairs, steps, ramps, handrails and guards.

National Sentence Text: Where stairs, ramps, landings, handrails or guards are installed in garages that serve a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the garage shall be considered to be part of the dwelling unit and the requirements for stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards within dwelling units shall apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where stairs, ramps, landings, handrails or guards are installed in garages that serve a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the garage shall be considered to be part of the dwelling unit and the requirements for stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards within dwelling units shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Where a stair, ramp or landing forms part of an exit, the appropriate requirements in Sections 9.9.and 9.10. shall also apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a stair, ramp or landing forms part of an exit, the appropriate requirements in Sections 9. and 9. shall also apply.

National Sentence Text: Escalators and moving walkways shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Part 3.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Escalators and moving walkways shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Escalators and moving walks shall conform to the appropriate requirements in part 3..
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Escalators and moving walks shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Part 3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.2.1.(2) and Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than 900 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.2.1.(2) and Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: Exit stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Exit stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of other than residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than the greater of 900 mm, or 8 mm per person based on the occupant load limits specified in Table 3.1.17.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of other than residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than the greater of 900 mm, or 8 mm per person based on the occupant load limits specified in Table 3.1.17.1.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., at least one stair between each floor level within a dwelling unit, and exterior stairs serving a single dwelling unit except required exit stairs, shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., at least one stair between each floor level within a dwelling unit, and exterior stairs serving a single dwelling unit except required exit stairs, shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above. (See Note A-3.4.3.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above. (See Note A-3.4.3.4.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.2.2.(3)and 9.8.2.2.(4)and Article 9.8.4.7., the clear height over stairs shall not be less than 2 050 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.2.2.(3) and 9.8.2.2.(4) and Article 9.8.4.7. , the clear height over stairs shall not be less than 2 050 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., the clear height over stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall not be less than 1 950 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., the clear height over stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall not be less than 1 950 mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over stairs that are located under beams and ducting in secondary suites shall not be less than 1 850 mm. (See Notes A-9.8.3.1.and A-9.8.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height over stairs that are located under beams and ducting in secondary suites shall not be less than 1 850 mm.

National Sentence Text: Stairs in buildings other than dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite, including their common spaces, shall consist of straight flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.3.1.(4), curved flights, or except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.7.(2), spiral stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairs in buildings other than dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite, including their common spaces, shall consist of straight flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.3.1.(4), curved flights, or except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.7.(2), spiral stairs.

National Sentence Text: Stairs within dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite, including their common spaces, shall consist of straight flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.3.1.(4), curved flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.7.(2), spiral stairs, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.3.1.(3), flights with rectangular treads and winders, or flights with a mix of rectangular and tapered treads.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairs within dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite, including their common spaces, shall consist of straight flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.3.1.(4), curved flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.7.(2), spiral stairs, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.3.1.(3), flights with rectangular treads and winders, or flights with a mix of rectangular and tapered treads.

National Sentence Text: Only one set of winders described in Article 9.8.4.6. shall be permitted between floor levels.
P/T Sentence Text: Only one set of winders described in Article 9.8.4.6. shall be permitted between floor levels.

National Sentence Text: Curved flights in exits shall comply with Sentence 3.4.6.9.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Curved flights in exits shall comply with Sentence 3.4.6.9.(2).

National Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.
P/T Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least 3 risers shall be provided in interior flights.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least 3 risers shall be provided in interior flights.

National Sentence Text: The vertical height of any flight of stairs shall not exceed 3.7 m. (See Note A-9.8.4.) (See Note A-9.8.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: The vertical height of any flight of stairs shall not exceed 3.7 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7. and except for stairs serving areas only used as service rooms or service spaces, the rise, which is measured as the vertical nosing-to-nosing distance, shall comply with Table 9.8.4.1. (See Note A-9.8.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7. and except for stairs serving areas only used as service rooms or service spaces, the rise, which is measured as the vertical nosing-to-nosing distance, shall comply with Table 9.8.4.1.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs serving areas only used as service rooms or service spaces, the run shall comply with Table 9.8.4.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs serving areas only used as service rooms or service spaces, the run shall comply with Table 9.8.4.2.

National Sentence Text: The depth of a rectangular tread shall be not less than its run and not more than its run plus 25 mm. (See Note A-9.8.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: The depth of a rectangular tread shall be not less than its run and not more than its run plus 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.3.(2) and Articles 9.8.4.6.and 9.8.4.7., tapered treads shall have a run that is not less than 150 mm at the narrow end of the tread, and complies with the dimensions stated in Table 9.8.4.2. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.3.(2) and Articles 9.8.4.6. and 9.8.4.7., tapered treads shall have a run that is not less than 150 mm at the narrow end of the tread, and complies with the dimensions stated in Table 9.8.4.2. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread.

National Sentence Text: Tapered treadsin required exit stairs shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.4.6.9.
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads in required exit stairs shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.4.6.9.

National Sentence Text: The depth of a tapered treadshall be not less than its run at any point and not more than its run at any point plus 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The depth of a tapered tread shall be not less than its run at any point and not more than its run at any point plus 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.4.(2), risers shall be of uniform height in any one flight, with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads or landings, and 10 mm between the tallest and shortest risers in a flight.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.4.(2), risers shall be of uniform height in any one flight, with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads or landings, and 10 mm between the tallest and shortest risers in a flight.

National Sentence Text: Except for required exit stairs, where the top or bottom riser in a stair adjoins a sloping finished walking surface, such as a garage floor, driveway or sidewalk, the height of the riser across the stair shall vary by not more than 1 in 12.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for required exit stairs, where the top or bottom riser in a stair adjoins a sloping finished walking surface, such as a garage floor, driveway or sidewalk, the height of the riser across the stair shall vary by not more than 1 in 12.

National Sentence Text: Rectangular treads shall have a uniform run with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads, and 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.
P/T Sentence Text: Rectangular treads shall have a uniform run with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads, and 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.
