National Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a flight shall have a uniform run in accordance with the construction tolerances stipulated in Sentence 9.8.4.4.(3) when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail as described in Sentence 9.8.7.1.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a flight shall have a uniform run in accordance with the construction tolerances stipulated in Sentence 9.8.4.4.(3) when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail as described in Sentence 9.8.7.1.(5).

National Sentence Text: The slope of treads shall not exceed 1 in 50.
P/T Sentence Text: The slope of treads shall not exceed 1 in 50.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.5.(2) and Article 9.8.4.6., where a flight of stairs consists of both tapered treads and rectangular treads, all the treads shall have a uniform run when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.5.(2) and Article 9.8.4.6., where a flight of stairs consists of both tapered treads and rectangular treads, all the treads shall have a uniform run when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.

National Sentence Text: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight, the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads. (See Note A-9.8.4.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight, the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads.

National Sentence Text: Individual treads in winders that converge on a centre point shall turn through an angle of 30° with no deviation above or below 30°, or 45° with no deviation above or below 45°.
P/T Sentence Text: Individual treads in winders that converge on a centre point shall turn through an angle of 30° with no deviation above or below 30°, or 45° with no deviation above or below 45°.

National Sentence Text: Where winders are incorporated into a stair, each set shall not turn through more than 90°. (See Note A-9.8.4.7.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where winders are incorporated into a stair, each set shall not turn through more than 90°.

National Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall have handrails on both sides, the outer handrail being not less than 1 070 mm high, a clear width not less than 660 mm between the handrails, risers that are not more than 240 mm high, treads that are a minimum of 190 mm deep at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrails at the narrower edge, have a consistent angle and uniform dimension, and turn in the same direction, and not less than 1 980 mm clear height.
P/T Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall have handrails on both sides, the outer handrail being not less than 1 070 mm high, a clear width not less than 660 mm between the handrails, risers that are not more than 240 mm high, treads that are a minimum of 190 mm deep at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrails at the narrower edge, have a consistent angle and uniform dimension, and turn in the same direction, and not less than 1 980 mm clear height.

National Sentence Text: Spiral stairs conforming to Sentence 9.8.4.7.(1) are permitted to be used as the only means of egress where they serve not more than 3 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Spiral stairs conforming to Sentence 9.8.4.7.(1) are permitted to be used as the only means of egress where they serve not more than 3 persons.

National Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall not serve as an exit. (See Notes A-9.8.4.8.and A-9.8.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall not serve as an exit.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.8.4.8.(2), the top of the nosings of stair treads shall have a rounded or beveled edge extending not less than 6 mm and not more than 14 mm measured horizontally from the front of the nosing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.8.4.8.(2), the top of the nosings of stair treads shall have a rounded or beveled edge extending not less than 6 mm and not more than 14 mm measured horizontally from the front of the nosing.

National Sentence Text: If resilient material is used to cover the nosing of a stair tread, the minimum extension of the rounded or beveled edge required by Sentence 9.8.4.8.(1) is permitted to be reduced to 3 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: If resilient material is used to cover the nosing of a stair tread, the minimum extension of the rounded or beveled edge required by Sentence 9.8.4.8.(1) is permitted to be reduced to 3 mm.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to pedestrian ramps, except ramps in a barrier-free path of travel.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to pedestrian ramps, except ramps in a barrier-free path of travel.

National Sentence Text: Ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5. (See also Article 9.9.3.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.5.2.(2), ramps shall be not less than 1 100 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.5.2.(2), ramps shall be not less than 1 100 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 860 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 860 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.8.5.3.(2), the clear height over ramps shall be not less than 2 050 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.8.5.3.(2), the clear height over ramps shall be not less than 2 050 mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height over ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.

National Sentence Text: The slope of ramps shall be not more than 1 in 10 for exterior ramps, 1 in 10 for interior ramps serving residential occupancies, 1 in 6 for industrial occupancies, and 1 in 8 for all other occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: The slope of ramps shall be not more than 1 in 10 for exterior ramps, 1 in 10 for interior ramps serving residential occupancies, 1 in 6 for industrial occupancies, and 1 in 8 for all other occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Where the slope of the ramp is greater than 1 in 12, the maximum rise between floors or landings shall be 1 500 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the slope of the ramp is greater than 1 in 12, the maximum rise between floors or landings shall be 1 500 mm.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to landings, except landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to landings, except landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel.

National Sentence Text: Landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5.

National Sentence Text: Finished floors, and ground surfaces with a slope not exceeding 1 in 50, at the top and bottom of stairs or ramps shall be considered as landings.
P/T Sentence Text: Finished floors, and ground surfaces with a slope not exceeding 1 in 50, at the top and bottom of stairs or ramps shall be considered as landings.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.6.2.(2)to 9.8.6.2.(4) and Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), a landing shall be provided at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, including stairs in garages, at the top and bottom of every ramp with a slope greater than 1 in 50, where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp, where a ramp opens onto a stair, and where a stair opens onto a ramp.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.6.2.(2) to 9.8.6.2.(4) and Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), a landing shall be provided at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, including stairs in garages, at the top and bottom of every ramp with a slope greater than 1 in 50, where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp, where a ramp opens onto a stair, and where a stair opens onto a ramp.

National Sentence Text: Where a door at the top of a stair within a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a door at the top of a stair within a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.

National Sentence Text: A landing may be omitted at the top of an exterior flight serving a secondary entrance to a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, provided the stair does not contain more than 3 risers, the principal door is a sliding door or swings away from the stair, and only a storm or screen door, if any, swings over the stair and is equipped with hardware to hold it open.
P/T Sentence Text: A landing may be omitted at the top of an exterior flight serving a secondary entrance to a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, provided the stair does not contain more than 3 risers, the principal door is a sliding door or swings away from the stair, and only a storm or screen door, if any, swings over the stair and is equipped with hardware to hold it open.

National Sentence Text: A landing may be omitted at the bottom of an exterior stair or ramp provided there is no obstruction, such as a gate or door, within the lesser of the width of the stair or ramp or 900 mm for stairs or ramps serving a single dwelling unit, and 1 100 mm for stairs or ramps not serving a single dwelling unit. (See Note A-3.4.6.4.) (See also Articles 9.9.6.1. and 9.9.6.6. regarding landings in exits.)
P/T Sentence Text: A landing may be omitted at the bottom of an exterior stair or ramp provided there is no obstruction, such as a gate or door, within the lesser of the width of the stair or ramp or 900 mm for stairs or ramps serving a single dwelling unit, and 1 100 mm for stairs or ramps not serving a single dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.6.3.(2)to 9.8.6.3.(7), landings shall be at least as wide and as long as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.6.3.(2) to 9.8.6.3.(7), landings shall be at least as wide and as long as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur.

National Sentence Text: Where the landing in a stairway or ramp does not turn or turns less than 90°, the length of the landing need not be more than the lesser of the required width of the stair or ramp, or 1 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the landing in a stairway or ramp does not turn or turns less than 90°, the length of the landing need not be more than the lesser of the required width of the stair or ramp, or 1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: The length of a landing shall be measured perpendicular to the nosings of adjacent steps or to the end of the ramp, at a distance equal to half the length required in Sentence 9.8.6.3.(2) from the narrow edge of the landing.
P/T Sentence Text: The length of a landing shall be measured perpendicular to the nosings of adjacent steps or to the end of the ramp, at a distance equal to half the length required in Sentence 9.8.6.3.(2) from the narrow edge of the landing.

National Sentence Text: Where stair flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, or where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths, not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width.
P/T Sentence Text: Where stair flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, or where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths, not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width.

National Sentence Text: Where a door swings toward a stair, the full arc of the swing shall be over the landing.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a door swings toward a stair, the full arc of the swing shall be over the landing.

National Sentence Text: The slope of landings shall not exceed 1 in 50.
P/T Sentence Text: The slope of landings shall not exceed 1 in 50.

National Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway opens onto the side of a ramp, the landing shall extend for a distance of not less than 300 mm on either side of the doorway or stairway, except on a side abutting an end wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway opens onto the side of a ramp, the landing shall extend for a distance of not less than 300 mm on either side of the doorway or stairway, except on a side abutting an end wall.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.8.6.4.(2), the clear height over landings shall be not less than 2 050 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.8.6.4.(2), the clear height over landings shall be not less than 2 050 mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over landings serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height over landings serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.7.1.(2)to 9.8.7.1.(4), handrails shall be installed on stairs and ramps in accordance with Table 9.8.7.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.7.1.(2) to 9.8.7.1.(4), handrails shall be installed on stairs and ramps in accordance with Table 9.8.7.1.

National Sentence Text: Except where a stair or ramp serves not more than two dwelling units, at least one handrail shall be located not more than 750 mm from the natural path of travel on the stair or ramp. (See Note A-9.8.7.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a stair or ramp serves not more than two dwelling units, at least one handrail shall be located not more than 750 mm from the natural path of travel on the stair or ramp. (See Note A-9.8.7.1.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Handrails are not required for stairs and ramps serving a single dwelling unit, where interior stairs have not more than 2 risers, exterior stairs have not more than 3 risers, or ramps rise not more than 400 mm.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Handrails are not required for stairs and ramps serving a single dwelling unit, where interior stairs have not more than 2 risers, exterior stairs have not more than 3 risers, or ramps rise not more than 400 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails are not required for stairs and ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, where interior stairs have not more than 2 risers, exterior stairs have not more than 3 risers, or ramps rise not more than 400 mm.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Handrails are not required for stairs and ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, where interior stairs have not more than 2 risers, exterior stairs have not more than 3 risers, or ramps rise not more than 400 mm.

National Sentence Text: Only one handrail is required on exterior stairs having more than 3 risers provided such stairs serve not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Only one handrail is required on exterior stairs having more than 3 risers provided such stairs serve not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs with winders, where a flight of stairs within a dwelling unit consists of tapered treads, or a mix of tapered treads and rectangular treads, one handrail shall be installed along the narrow end of the treads. (See Note A-9.8.7.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs with winders, where a flight of stairs within a dwelling unit consists of tapered treads, or a mix of tapered treads and rectangular treads, one handrail shall be installed along the narrow end of the treads.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.7.2.(3), required handrails shall be continuously graspable throughout the length of ramps, and flights of stairs, from the bottom riser to the top riser.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.7.2.(3), required handrails shall be continuously graspable throughout the length of ramps, and flights of stairs, from the bottom riser to the top riser.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs or ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, at least one required handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of the stair or ramp, including at the landing except where interrupted by doorways. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs or ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, at least one required handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of the stair or ramp, including at the landing except where interrupted by doorways. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(10).)

National Sentence Text: For stairs or ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, a handrail is permitted to start from a newel post or volute installed on the bottom tread.
P/T Sentence Text: For stairs or ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, a handrail is permitted to start from a newel post or volute installed on the bottom tread.

National Sentence Text: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard. (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(1).) (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard. (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs and ramps serving only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, at least one handrail at the sides of a stair or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of each flight or ramp. (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(2).) (See Note A-9.8.7.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs and ramps serving only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, at least one handrail at the sides of a stair or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of each flight or ramp. (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs and ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair served by the handrail, or the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs and ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair served by the handrail, or the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.7.4.(3) and Clause 3.8.3.5.(1)(e), required handrails shall be 865 mm to 1 070 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.7.4.(3) and Sentence 3.8.3.5.(1), required handrails shall be 865 mm to 1 070 mm high.

National Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence 9.8.7.4.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence 9.8.7.4.(2).

National Sentence Text: The clearance between a handrail and the surface behind it shall be not less than 50 mm, or where said surface is rough or abrasive, 60 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance between a handrail and the surface behind it shall be not less than 50 mm, or where said surface is rough or abrasive, 60 mm.

National Sentence Text: All handrails shall be constructed so as to be continually graspable along their entire length with no obstruction on or above them to break a handhold. (See Note A-9.8.7.5.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: All handrails shall be constructed so as to be continually graspable along their entire length with no obstruction on or above them to break a handhold. (See Note A-9.8.7.5.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Handrails and constructions below handrails, including handrail supports and stair stringers, shall not project more than 100 mm into the required width of a stair or ramp. (See also Articles 9.8.2.1.and 9.8.5.2.) (See Note A-9.8.7.7.)
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails and constructions below handrails, including handrail supports and stair stringers, shall not project more than 100 mm into the required width of a stair or ramp. (See also Articles 9.8.2.1. and 9.8.5.2.)

National Sentence Text: Handrails and their supports shall be designed and constructed to withstand the following loads, which need not be considered to act simultaneously: a concentrated load of not less than 0.9 kN applied at any point and in any direction for all handrails, and for handrails other than those serving a single dwelling unit, a uniform load of not less than 0.7 kN/m.
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails and their supports shall be designed and constructed to withstand the following loads, which need not be considered to act simultaneously: a concentrated load of not less than 0.9 kN applied at any point and in any direction for all handrails, and for handrails other than those serving a single dwelling unit, a uniform load of not less than 0.7 kN/m.

National Sentence Text: Where exterior or interior handrails serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces are attached to wood studs or blocking, the attachment shall be deemed to comply with Sentence 9.8.7.7.(1), where the attachment points are spaced not more than 1.2 m apart measured on the horizontal plane, the first attachment point at either end is located no more than 300 mm from the end of the handrail, and the fasteners consist of not less than 2 No. 8 wood screws at each point, penetrating not less than 32 mm into solid wood. (See Note A-9.8.8.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where exterior or interior handrails serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces are attached to wood studs or blocking, the attachment shall be deemed to comply with Sentence 9.8.7.7.(1), where the attachment points are spaced not more than 1.2 m apart measured on the horizontal plane, the first attachment point at either end is located no more than 300 mm from the end of the handrail, and the fasteners consist of not less than 2 No. 8 wood screws at each point, penetrating not less than 32 mm into solid wood.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(2), every surface to which access is provided, including but not limited to flights of steps and ramps, exterior landings, porches, balconies, mezzanines, galleries and raised walkways, shall be protected by a guard on each side that is not protected by a wall for the length where there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(2), every surface to which access is provided, including but not limited to flights of steps and ramps, exterior landings, porches, balconies, mezzanines, galleries and raised walkways, shall be protected by a guard on each side that is not protected by a wall for the length where there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.

National Sentence Text: Guards are not required at loading docks, at floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
P/T Sentence Text: Guards are not required at loading docks, at floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.

National Sentence Text: Doors in buildings of residential occupancy, where the finished floor on one side of the door is more than 600 mm above the floor or other constructed surface or ground level on the other side of the door, shall be protected by a guard, or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the door so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors in buildings of residential occupancy, where the finished floor on one side of the door is more than 600 mm above the floor or other constructed surface or ground level on the other side of the door, shall be protected by a guard, or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the door so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(5), openable windows in buildings of residential occupancy shall be protected by a guard, or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm measured either vertically or horizontally where the other dimension is greater than 380 mm. (See Note A-9.8.8.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(5), openable windows in buildings of residential occupancy shall be protected by a guard, or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm measured either vertically or horizontally where the other dimension is greater than 380 mm.

National Sentence Text: Windows need not be protected in accordance with Sentence 9.8.8.1.(4), where the window serves a dwelling unit that is not located above another suite, the window serves a house with a secondary suite, the only opening greater than 100 mm by 380 mm is a horizontal opening at the top of the window, the window sill is located more than 450 mm above the finished floor on one side of the window, or the window is located in a room or space with the finished floor described in Clause 9.8.8.1.(5)(d) located less than 1 800 mm above the floor or ground on the other side of the window. (See Note A-9.8.8.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Windows need not be protected in accordance with Sentence 9.8.8.1.(4), where the window serves a dwelling unit that is not located above another suite, the window serves a house with a secondary suite, the only opening greater than 100 mm by 380 mm is a horizontal opening at the top of the window, the window sill is located more than 450 mm above the finished floor on one side of the window, or the window is located in a room or space with the finished floor described in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(5) located less than 1 800 mm above the floor or ground on the other side of the window.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(7), glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 1 070 mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be protected by guards, in accordance with this Subsection, or non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for balcony guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(7), glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 1 070 mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be protected by guards, in accordance with this Subsection, or non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for balcony guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.

National Sentence Text: In dwelling units, glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 900 mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be protected by guards, in accordance with this Subsection, or non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for balcony guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.
P/T Sentence Text: In dwelling units, glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 900 mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be protected by guards, in accordance with this Subsection, or non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for balcony guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.

National Sentence Text: Glazing installed in public areas that extends to less than 1 m from the floor and is located above the second storey in buildings of residential occupancy shall be protected by guards in accordance with this Subsection, or non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for balcony guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14. (See Note A-9.8.8.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Glazing installed in public areas that extends to less than 1 m from the floor and is located above the second storey in buildings of residential occupancy shall be protected by guards in accordance with this Subsection, or non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for balcony guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.8.2.(2)and 9.8.8.2.(4),guards shall be designed to resist the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.8.2.(2) and 9.8.8.2.(4), guards shall be designed to resist the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2.

National Sentence Text: For guards within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces and for exterior guards serving not more than 2 dwelling units, where the width and spacing of balusters are such that 3 balusters can be engaged by a load imposed over a 300 mm width, the load shall be imposed so as to engage 3 balusters.
P/T Sentence Text: For guards within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces and for exterior guards serving not more than 2 dwelling units , where the width and spacing of balusters are such that 3 balusters can be engaged by a load imposed over a 300 mm width, the load shall be imposed so as to engage 3 balusters.

National Sentence Text: None of the loads specified in Table 9.8.8.2. need be considered to act simultaneously.
P/T Sentence Text: None of the loads specified in Table 9.8.8.2. need be considered to act simultaneously.

National Sentence Text: For guards within dwelling unitsand within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces and for exterior guards serving not more than 2 dwelling units, Table 9.8.8.2. need not apply where the guard construction used has been demonstrated to provide effective performance. (See Note A-9.8.8.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: For guards within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces and for exterior guards serving not more than 2 dwelling units , Table 9.8.8.2. need not apply where the guard construction used has been demonstrated to provide effective performance.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.8.3.(2)to 9.8.8.3.(4), all guards shall be not less than 1 070 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.8.3.(2) to 9.8.8.3.(4), all guards shall be not less than 1 070 mm high.

National Sentence Text: All guards within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: All guards within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high.

National Sentence Text: Exterior guards serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high where the walking surface served by the guard is not more than 1 800 mm above the finished ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior guards serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high where the walking surface served by the guard is not more than 1 800 mm above the finished ground level.

National Sentence Text: Guards for flights of steps, except in required exit stairs, shall be not less than 900 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: Guards for flights of steps, except in required exit stairs, shall be not less than 900 mm high.

National Sentence Text: The height of guards for flights of steps shall be measured vertically from the top of the guard to a line drawn through the tread nosing served by the guard.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of guards for flights of steps shall be measured vertically from the top of the guard to a line drawn through the tread nosing served by the guard.

National Sentence Text: Except for floors of garages referred to in Section 9.35., where garage floors or ramps are 600 mm or more above the adjacent ground or floor level, every opening through a garage floor and the perimeter of floors and ramps that have no exterior walls shall be provided with a continuous curb not less than 140 mm in height, and a guard not less than 1 070 mm above the floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for floors of garages referred to in part 9., where garage floors or ramps are 600 mm or more above the adjacent ground or floor level, every opening through a garage floor and the perimeter of floors and ramps that have no exterior walls shall be provided with a continuous curb not less than 140 mm in height, and a guard not less than 1 070 mm above the floor level.

National Sentence Text: Vehicle guardrails shall be designed and constructed to withstand the loading values stipulated in Sentence 4.1.5.15.(1). (See Note A-4.1.5.14. and 4.1.5.15.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Vehicle guardrails shall be designed and constructed to withstand the loading values stipulated in Sentence 4.1.5.15.(1). (See Note A-4.1.5.14..)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.8.8.5.(2)and 9.8.8.5.(3), openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm. (See Note A-9.8.8.5.(1) and (2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.8.8.5.(2)and 9.8.8.5.(3), openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm. (See Note A-9.8.8.5.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of a top railing, and one or more horizontal intermediate rails spaced such that the size of the openings through the guard prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm. (See Note A-9.8.8.5.(1) and (2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of a top railing, and one or more horizontal intermediate rails spaced such that the size of the openings through the guard prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm.

National Sentence Text: Openings through any guard that is not required by Article 9.8.8.1. and that serves an occupancy other than an industrial occupancy shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm, or permits the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 200 mm. (See Note A-9.8.8.5.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through any guard that is not required by Article 9.8.8.1. and that serves an occupancy other than an industrial occupancy shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm, or permits the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 200 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except for guards in industrial occupancies, guards required by Article 9.8.8.1. that protect a level located more than 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for guards in industrial occupancies, guards required by Article 9.8.8.1. that protect a level located more than 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Glass in guards shall be safety glass of the laminated or tempered type conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Glass in guards shall be safety glass of the laminated or tempered type conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass

National Sentence Text: Except as specified in Articles 9.8.9.4.and 9.8.9.5., stairs and ramps shall be designed for strength and rigidity under uniform loading criteria to support specified loads of 1.9 kPa for stairs and ramps serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and 4.8 kPa for other stairs and ramps.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as specified in Articles 9.8.9.4. and 9.8.9.5., stairs and ramps shall be designed for strength and rigidity under uniform loading criteria to support specified loads of 1.9 kPa for stairs and ramps serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and 4.8 kPa for other stairs and ramps.

National Sentence Text: Exterior concrete stairs with more than 2 risers and 2 treads shall be supported on unit masonry or concrete walls or piers not less than 150 mm in cross section, or cantilevered from the main foundation wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior concrete stairs with more than 2 risers and 2 treads shall be supported on unit masonry or concrete walls or piers not less than 150 mm in cross section, or cantilevered from the main foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: Stairs described in Sentence 9.8.9.2.(1), when cantilevered from the foundation wall, shall be constructed and installed in conformance with Subsection 9.8.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairs described in Sentence 9.8.9.2.(1), when cantilevered from the foundation wall, shall be constructed and installed in conformance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: The depth below ground level for foundations for exterior steps shall conform to the requirements in Section 9.12.
P/T Sentence Text: The depth below ground level for foundations for exterior steps shall conform to the requirements in part 9.

National Sentence Text: Exterior wood steps shall not be in direct contact with the ground unless suitably treated with a wood preservative.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior wood steps shall not be in direct contact with the ground unless suitably treated with a wood preservative.

National Sentence Text: Wooden stair stringers shall have a minimum effective depth of 90 mm, measured perpendicularly to the bottom of the stringer at the point of minimum cross-section, and an overall depth of not less than 235 mm, be supported and secured top and bottom, be not less than 25 mm actual thickness if supported along their length and 38 mm actual thickness if unsupported along their length, and except as permitted in Sentence 9.8.9.4.(2), be spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. in stairs serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and 600 mm o.c. in other stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: Wooden stair stringers shall have a minimum effective depth of 90 mm, measured perpendicularly to the bottom of the stringer at the point of minimum cross-section, and an overall depth of not less than 235 mm, be supported and secured top and bottom, be not less than 25 mm actual thickness if supported along their length and 38 mm actual thickness if unsupported along their length, and except as permitted in Sentence 9.8.9.4.(2), be spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. in stairs serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and 600 mm o.c. in other stairs.

National Sentence Text: For stairs serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, where risers support the front portion of the tread, the space between stringers shall be not more than 1 200 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: For stairs serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, where risers support the front portion of the tread, the space between stringers shall be not more than 1 200 mm.

National Sentence Text: Stair treads of lumber, plywood or O-2 grade OSB within dwelling units shall be not less than 25 mm actual thickness, except that if open risers are used and the distance between stringers exceeds 750 mm, the treads shall be not less than 38 mm actual thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: Stair treads of lumber, plywood or O-2 grade OSB within dwelling units shall be not less than 25 mm actual thickness, except that if open risers are used and the distance between stringers exceeds 750 mm, the treads shall be not less than 38 mm actual thickness.

National Sentence Text: Stair treads of plywood or OSB that are not continuously supported by the riser shall have their face grain or direction of face orientation at right angles to the stringers.
P/T Sentence Text: Stair treads of plywood or OSB that are not continuously supported by the riser shall have their face grain or direction of face orientation at right angles to the stringers.

National Sentence Text: The finish for treads and landings of interior stairs in dwelling units, other than stairs to unfinished basements, shall consist of hardwood, vertical grain softwood, resilient flooring or other material providing equivalent performance.
P/T Sentence Text: The finish for treads and landings of interior stairs in dwelling units, other than stairs to unfinished basements, shall consist of hardwood, vertical grain softwood, resilient flooring or other material providing equivalent performance.

National Sentence Text: Treads and landings of interior and exterior stairs and ramps, other than those within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces, shall have a slip-resistant finish or be provided with slip-resistant strips that extend not more than 1 mm above the surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Treads and landings of interior and exterior stairs and ramps, other than those within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces, shall have a slip-resistant finish or be provided with slip-resistant strips that extend not more than 1 mm above the surface.

National Sentence Text: Exterior concrete steps and their anchorage system that are cantilevered from a foundation wall shall be designed and installed to support the loads to which they may be subjected.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior concrete steps and their anchorage system that are cantilevered from a foundation wall shall be designed and installed to support the loads to which they may be subjected.

National Sentence Text: Cantilevered concrete steps referred to in Article 9.8.10.1. shall be anchored to concrete foundation walls not less than 200 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Cantilevered concrete steps referred to in Article 9.8.10.1. shall be anchored to concrete foundation walls not less than 200 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Suitable precautions shall be taken during backfilling and grading operations to ensure that subsequent freezing of the soil will not cause uplift forces on the underside of cantilevered concrete steps to the extent that the steps or the walls to which they are attached will be damaged.
P/T Sentence Text: Suitable precautions shall be taken during backfilling and grading operations to ensure that subsequent freezing of the soil will not cause uplift forces on the underside of cantilevered concrete steps to the extent that the steps or the walls to which they are attached will be damaged.

National Sentence Text: Stairways, handrails and guards in a means of egress shall conform to the requirements in Section 9.8. as well as to the requirements in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairways, handrails and guards in a means of egress shall conform to the requirements in part 9. as well as to the requirements in this Section.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the fire protection requirements provided in Subsection 9.9.4., flame-spread ratings, fire-resistance ratings and fire-protection ratings for means of egress shall conform to Section 9.10.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the fire protection requirements provided in part 9., flame-spread ratings, fire-resistance ratings and fire-protection ratings for means of egress shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, the occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area shall be the number of persons for which such areas are designed, but not fewer than that determined from Table 3.1.17.1., unless it can be shown that the area will be occupied by fewer persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, the occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area shall be the number of persons for which such areas are designed, but not fewer than that determined from Table 3.1.17.1., unless it can be shown that the area will be occupied by fewer persons.

National Sentence Text: The occupant load for dwelling units shall be based on 2 persons per bedroom or sleeping area.
P/T Sentence Text: The occupant load for dwelling units shall be based on 2 persons per bedroom or sleeping area.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway, an exterior passageway, an exterior ramp, an exterior stairway, a fire escape, a horizontal exit, an interior passageway, an interior ramp, or an interior stairway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway, an exterior passageway, an exterior ramp, an exterior stairway, a fire escape, a horizontal exit, an interior passageway, an interior ramp, or an interior stairway.

National Sentence Text: Fire escapes shall only be used as exits on existing buildings and shall be designed and installed in conformance with Subsection 3.4.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire escapes shall only be used as exits on existing buildings and shall be designed and installed in conformance with part 3.

National Sentence Text: Where a horizontal exit is used, it shall conform to Sentence 3.4.1.6.(1) and Article 3.4.6.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a horizontal exit is used, it shall conform to Sentence 3.4.1.6.(1) and Article 3.4.6.10.

National Sentence Text: An exit shall be designed for no purpose other than for exiting except that an exit may also serve as an access to a floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: An exit shall be designed for no purpose other than for exiting except that an exit may also serve as an access to a floor area.

National Sentence Text: Elevators, slide escapes and windows shall not be considered as part of a required means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Elevators, slide escapes and windows shall not be considered as part of a required means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, at least one door at every principal entrance to a building providing access from the exterior at ground level shall be designed in accordance with the requirements for exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, at least one door at every principal entrance to a building providing access from the exterior at ground level shall be designed in accordance with the requirements for exits.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to every means of egress except exits that serve not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and access to exits within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to every means of egress except exits that serve not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and access to exits within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.

National Sentence Text: Except for doors and corridors, the width of every exit facility shall be not less than 900 mm. (See Article 9.9.6.3. for doors, Article 9.8.2.1. for stairs, and Article 9.8.5.2. for ramps.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for doors and corridors, the width of every exit facility shall be not less than 900 mm. (See Article 9.9.6.3. for doors, Article 9.8.2.1. for stairs, and Article 9.8.5.2. for ramps.)

National Sentence Text: The width of every public corridor, corridor used by the public, and exit corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm. (See also Subsection 9.9.5. for obstructions in corridors.)
P/T Sentence Text: The width of every public corridor, corridor used by the public, and exit corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm. (See also part 9. for obstructions in corridors.)

National Sentence Text: Except for stairways, doorways and storage garages, the minimum clear height in exits and access to exits shall be 2.1 m. (See Article 9.8.2.2. for stairs, Article 9.8.5.3. for ramps, Article 9.8.6.4. for landings and Article 9.9.6.2. for doorways.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairways, doorways and storage garages, the minimum clear height in exits and access to exits shall be 2.1 m. (See Article 9.8.2.2. for stairs, Article 9.8.5.3. for ramps, Article 9.8.6.4. for landings and Article 9.9.6.2. for doorways.)

National Sentence Text: The clear height in exits and access to exits in storage garages shall be not less than 2 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height in exits and access to exits in storage garages shall be not less than 2 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.9.4.4.and 9.9.4.6., this Subsection applies to the fire protection of all exits except exits serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.9.4.4. and 9.9.4.6., this Subsection applies to the fire protection of all exits except exits serving not more than one dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.4.2.(2)and 9.9.4.2.(5) and Article 9.9.8.5., every exit other than an exterior doorway shall be separated from each adjacent floor area or from another exit where there is a floor assembly above the floor area, by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly above the floor area (see Article 9.10.9.10.), and where there is no floor assembly above the floor area, by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than the greater of that required by Subsection 9.10.8. for the floor assembly below, or 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.4.2.(2) and 9.9.4.2.(5) and Article 9.9.8.5., every exit other than an exterior doorway shall be separated from each adjacent floor area or from another exit where there is a floor assembly above the floor area, by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly above the floor area (see Article 9.10.9.10.), and where there is no floor assembly above the floor area, by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than the greater of that required by part 9. for the floor assembly below, or 45 min.

National Sentence Text: Where an exit is located in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the exit shall be protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board installed on both sides of walls separating the exit from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the exit from the remainder of the building. (See Sentence 9.10.9.3.(2) for closures.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exit is located in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the exit shall be protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board installed on both sides of walls separating the exit from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the exit from the remainder of the building.

National Sentence Text: A fire separation common to 2 exits shall be smoke-tight and not be pierced by doorways, duct work, piping or any other opening that may affect the continuity of the separation.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation common to 2 exits shall be smoke-tight and not be pierced by doorways, duct work, piping or any other opening that may affect the continuity of the separation.

National Sentence Text: A fire separation that separates an exit from the remainder of the building shall have no openings except those for electrical wiring, noncombustible conduit and noncombustible piping that serve only the exit, and for standpipes, sprinkler piping, exit doorways and wired glass and glass block permitted in Article 9.9.4.3.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation that separates an exit from the remainder of the building shall have no openings except those for electrical wiring, noncombustible conduit and noncombustible piping that serve only the exit, and for standpipes, sprinkler piping, exit doorways and wired glass and glass block permitted in Article 9.9.4.3.

National Sentence Text: The requirements in Sentences 9.9.4.2.(1)and 9.9.4.2.(2) do not apply to an exterior exit passageway provided the passageway has not less than 50% of its exterior sides open to the outdoors and is served by an exit stair at each end of the passageway. (See Note A-3.1.8.19.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements in Sentences 9.9.4.2.(1) and 9.9.4.2.(2) do not apply to an exterior exit passageway provided the passageway has not less than 50% of its exterior sides open to the outdoors and is served by an exit stair at each end of the passageway.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to wired glass in doors, and wired glass or glass block in sidelights, where these are installed in fire separations between exit enclosures and floor areas.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to wired glass in doors, and wired glass or glass block in sidelights, where these are installed in fire separations between exit enclosures and floor areas.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(3), the combined area of glazing in doors and sidelights shall not exceed 0.8 m2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(3), the combined area of glazing in doors and sidelights shall not exceed 0.8 m2.

National Sentence Text: Where an exit enclosure connects with a floor area through an enclosed vestibule or corridor separated from the floor area by fire separations having not less than a 45 minfire-resistance rating, the glazed areas described in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(1) need not be limited as required in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exit enclosure connects with a floor area through an enclosed vestibule or corridor separated from the floor area by fire separations having not less than a 45 minfire-resistance rating, the glazed areas described in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(1) need not be limited as required in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(2).

National Sentence Text: Unprotected openings in exterior walls of the building shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block conforming to Articles 9.10.13.5.and 9.10.13.7., where an unenclosed exterior exit stair or ramp provides the only means of egress from a suite and is exposed to fire from unprotected openings in the exterior walls of another fire compartment, or another dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite, and unprotected openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 10 m below or less than 5 m above the exit stair or ramp.
P/T Sentence Text: Unprotected openings in exterior walls of the building shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block conforming to Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where an unenclosed exterior exit stair or ramp provides the only means of egress from a suite and is exposed to fire from unprotected openings in the exterior walls of another fire compartment, or another dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite, and unprotected openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 10 m below or less than 5 m above the exit stair or ramp.

National Sentence Text: Either openings in exterior walls of an exit or openings in adjacent exterior walls of the building the exit serves shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block installed in accordance with Articles 9.10.13.5.and 9.10.13.7., where the exit enclosure has exterior walls that intersect the exterior walls of the building at an angle of less than 135° measured on the outside of the building, and the openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 2 m above the openings in the exterior walls of the exit. (See Note A-9.9.4.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Either openings in exterior walls of an exit or openings in adjacent exterior walls of the building the exit serves shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block installed in accordance with Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where the exit enclosure has exterior walls that intersect the exterior walls of the building at an angle of less than 135° measured on the outside of the building, and the openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 2 m above the openings in the exterior walls of the exit.

National Sentence Text: Unprotected openings shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block conforming to Articles 9.10.13.5.and 9.10.13.7., where an exterior exit door in one fire compartment is within 3 m horizontally of an unprotected opening serving another fire compartment, or in one dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite is within 3 m horizontally of the unprotected openings serving another dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite, and the exterior walls of the fire compartments, dwelling units, ancillary spaces and common spaces in a house with a secondary suite referred to in Clause 9.9.4.6.(1)(a) intersect at an exterior angle of less than 135°.
P/T Sentence Text: Unprotected openings shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block conforming to Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where an exterior exit door in one fire compartment is within 3 m horizontally of an unprotected opening serving another fire compartment, or in one dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite is within 3 m horizontally of the unprotected openings serving another dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite, and the exterior walls of the fire compartments, dwelling units, ancillary spaces and common spaces in a house with a secondary suite referred to in Sentence 9.9.4.6.(1) intersect at an exterior angle of less than 135°.

National Sentence Text: Where a suite of Group D or E occupancy is located partly on the first storey and partly on the second storey, stairways serving the second storey of that suite need not be constructed as exit stairs provided, the building is not greater than 2 storeys in building height, the suite is separated from other occupancies by at least a 45 minfire separation, the area occupied by the suite is not greater than 100 m2 per storey, the maximum travel distance from any point in the suite to an exterior exit is not greater than 25 m, the floor assemblies have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or are of noncombustible construction, and the basement and first storey are separated by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a suite of Group D or E occupancy is located partly on the first storey and partly on the second storey, stairways serving the second storey of that suite need not be constructed as exit stairs provided, the building is not greater than 2 storeys in building height, the suite is separated from other occupancies by at least a 45 min fire separation, the area occupied by the suite is not greater than 100 m2 per storey, the maximum travel distance from any point in the suite to an exterior exit is not greater than 25 m, the floor assemblies have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or are of noncombustible construction, and the basement and first storey are separated by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to obstructions and hazards in every means of egress except those within a dwelling unit or serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to obstructions and hazards in every means of egress except those within a dwelling unit or serving not more than one dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Where a corridor contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall not reduce the unobstructed width of the corridor to less than the required width of the corridor.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a corridor contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall not reduce the unobstructed width of the corridor to less than the required width of the corridor.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.9.5.3.(2), obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project horizontally more than 100 mm into exit passageways, corridors used by the public or public corridors in a manner that would create a hazard for visually impaired persons travelling adjacent to walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.9.5.3.(2), obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project horizontally more than 100 mm into exit passageways, corridors used by the public or public corridors in a manner that would create a hazard for visually impaired persons travelling adjacent to walls.

National Sentence Text: The horizontal projection of an obstruction referred to in Sentence 9.9.5.3.(1) is permitted to exceed 100 mm where the obstruction extends to less than 680 mm above the floor. (See Note A-3.3.1.9.(4).) (See Note A-3.3.1.9.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal projection of an obstruction referred to in Sentence 9.9.5.3.(1) is permitted to exceed 100 mm where the obstruction extends to less than 680 mm above the floor. (See Note A-3.3.1.9.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.9.6. and Article 9.8.7.6., no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project within the required width of an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in part 9. and Article 9.8.7.6., no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project within the required width of an exit.

National Sentence Text: No obstructions such as posts or turnstiles shall be placed so as to restrict the width of a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area to less than 750 mm unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.
P/T Sentence Text: No obstructions such as posts or turnstiles shall be placed so as to restrict the width of a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area to less than 750 mm unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.5.5.(3), no obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not meet the requirements for exit doors, shall be placed in a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.5.5.(3), no obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not meet the requirements for exit doors, shall be placed in a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.

National Sentence Text: Obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not satisfy Sentence 9.9.5.5.(2), are permitted to be placed in a required means of egress from a part of a floor area in mercantile occupancies and business and personal services occupancies, provided that the part of the floor area served by the obstructed means of egress is not generally accessible to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not satisfy Sentence 9.9.5.5.(2), are permitted to be placed in a required means of egress from a part of a floor area in mercantile occupancies and business and personal services occupancies, provided that the part of the floor area served by the obstructed means of egress is not generally accessible to the public.

National Sentence Text: No mirror shall be placed in or adjacent to any exit so as to confuse the direction of exit, and no mirror or draperies shall be placed on or over exit doors.
P/T Sentence Text: No mirror shall be placed in or adjacent to any exit so as to confuse the direction of exit, and no mirror or draperies shall be placed on or over exit doors.

National Sentence Text: Fuel-fired appliances shall not be installed in an exit or corridor serving as an access to exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel-fired appliances shall not be installed in an exit or corridor serving as an access to exit.

National Sentence Text: Service rooms containing equipment subject to possible explosion, such as boilers designed to operate at a pressure in excess of 100 kPa, and certain types of refrigerating and transformer equipment, shall not be located under required exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Service rooms containing equipment subject to possible explosion, such as boilers designed to operate at a pressure in excess of 100 kPa, and certain types of refrigerating and transformer equipment, shall not be located under required exits.

National Sentence Text: Except in houses with a secondary suite, ancillary rooms such as storage rooms, washrooms, toilet rooms, laundry rooms and service rooms shall not open directly into an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in houses with a secondary suite, ancillary rooms such as storage rooms, washrooms, toilet rooms, laundry rooms and service rooms shall not open directly into an exit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.1.(4), obstructions created by doors shall be limited in accordance with Sentences 9.9.6.1.(2)and 9.9.6.1.(3) at exit doors, at doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and at doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.1.(4), obstructions created by doors shall be limited in accordance with Sentences 9.9.6.1.(2)and 9.9.6.1.(3) at exit doors, at doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and at doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

National Sentence Text: When fully open, doors described in Sentence 9.9.6.1.(1) shall not decrease the required exit width by more than 100 mm in exit corridors, and 50 mm for other exit facilities.
P/T Sentence Text: When fully open, doors described in Sentence 9.9.6.1.(1) shall not decrease the required exit width by more than 100 mm in exit corridors, and 50 mm for other exit facilities.

National Sentence Text: The swing of doors described in Sentence 9.9.6.1.(1) shall not reduce the width of the path of travel to less than the required exit width in exit corridors and passageways, and 750 mm on exit stairs or landings.
P/T Sentence Text: The swing of doors described in Sentence 9.9.6.1.(1) shall not reduce the width of the path of travel to less than the required exit width in exit corridors and passageways, and 750 mm on exit stairs or landings.

National Sentence Text: Doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentences 9.9.6.1.(2)and 9.9.6.1.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: Doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentences 9.9.6.1.(2) and 9.9.6.1.(3).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.6.2.(2)and 9.9.6.2.(3), the clear opening height of doorways shall be not less than 2 030 mm high at exit doors, doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.6.2.(2) and 9.9.6.2.(3), the clear opening height of doorways shall be not less than 2 030 mm high at exit doors, doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

National Sentence Text: The clear opening height under door closers and other devices in doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.2.(1) shall be not less than 1 980 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear opening height under door closers and other devices in doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.2.(1) shall be not less than 1 980 mm.

National Sentence Text: Doorways serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentences 9.9.6.2.(1)and 9.9.6.2.(2). (See also Article 9.5.5.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Doorways serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentences 9.9.6.2.(1) and 9.9.6.2.(2). (See also Article 9.5.5.1.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.3.(4), the clear opening width of doorways shall comply with Sentence 9.9.6.3.(2) at exit doors, and doors that open into or are located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.3.(4), the clear opening width of doorways shall comply with Sentence 9.9.6.3.(2) at exit doors, and doors that open into or are located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

National Sentence Text: Doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.3.(1) shall be not less than 800 mm wide where there is only one door leaf, not less than 800 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with only one active leaf having a latching mechanism described in Article 9.9.6.7., and not less than 1 210 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with two active leaves.
P/T Sentence Text: Doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.3.(1) shall be not less than 800 mm wide where there is only one door leaf, not less than 800 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with only one active leaf having a latching mechanism described in Article 9.9.6.7., and not less than 1 210 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with two active leaves.

National Sentence Text: In doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.3.(1) that have multiple-leaf doors installed, no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.
P/T Sentence Text: In doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.3.(1) that have multiple-leaf doors installed, no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.

National Sentence Text: Doorways serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentence 9.9.6.3.(2). (See also Article 9.5.5.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Doorways serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentence 9.9.6.3.(2). (See also Article 9.5.5.1.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.6.4.(4)and 9.9.6.4.(5), required exit doors and doors in required means of egress, except doors in means of egress within dwelling units, shall swing on the vertical axis.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.6.4.(4) and 9.9.6.4.(5), required exit doors and doors in required means of egress, except doors in means of egress within dwelling units, shall swing on the vertical axis.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.4.(5), breakaway sliding doors, installed as required exit doors or required doors in means of egress, shall be identified as swinging doors by means of a label or decal affixed to the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.4.(5), breakaway sliding doors, installed as required exit doors or required doors in means of egress, shall be identified as swinging doors by means of a label or decal affixed to the door.

National Sentence Text: Revolving doors shall comply with Article 3.4.6.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Revolving doors shall comply with Article 3.4.6.15.

National Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence 9.9.6.4.(1), provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.12.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence 9.9.6.4.(1), provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.12.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Exit doors need not conform to Sentences 9.9.6.4.(1)or 9.9.6.4.(2), where the doors serve accessory buildings where life safety is not adversely affected, the doors serve storage garages or other accessory buildings serving not more than one dwelling unit, or the doors serve storage suites of not more than 20 m2 in gross area that are in warehousing buildings of not more than one storey, and open directly to the exterior at ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Exit doors need not conform to Sentences 9.9.6.4.(1) or 9.9.6.4.(2), where the doors serve accessory buildings where life safety is not adversely affected, the doors serve storage garages or other accessory buildings serving not more than one dwelling unit, or the doors serve storage suites of not more than 20 m2 in gross area that are in warehousing buildings of not more than one storey, and open directly to the exterior at ground level.

National Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, exit doors that are required to swing shall swing in the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, exit doors that are required to swing shall swing in the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Doors that open onto a corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a room or suite having an occupant load of more than 60 persons shall swing on the vertical axis in the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors that open onto a corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a room or suite having an occupant load of more than 60 persons shall swing on the vertical axis in the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Doors that divide a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing in the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors that divide a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing in the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Where a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right-hand side swinging in the direction of exit travel, or swing in both directions.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right-hand side swinging in the direction of exit travel, or swing in both directions.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), the distance between a stair riser and the leading edge of a door during its swing, except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, shall be not less than 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), the distance between a stair riser and the leading edge of a door during its swing, except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, shall be not less than 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where there is a danger of blockage from ice or snow, an exit door, including doors serving a single dwelling unit, may open onto not more than one step, provided the riser of such a step does not exceed 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where there is a danger of blockage from ice or snow, an exit door, including doors serving a single dwelling unit, may open onto not more than one step, provided the riser of such a step does not exceed 150 mm.
