National Sentence Text: Principal entrance doors, exit doors and doors to suites, including exterior doors of dwelling units, and other doors in an access to exit shall be openable from the inside or in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism, or be controlled by electromagnetic locking mechanisms in accordance with Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Principal entrance doors, exit doors and doors to suites, including exterior doors of dwelling units, and other doors in an access to exit shall be openable from the inside or in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism, or be controlled by electromagnetic locking mechanisms in accordance with Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4).

National Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, and doors to accessory buildings and to garages serving a single dwelling unit, door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be operable with one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation. (See also Sentence 3.8.3.6.(4) and Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, and doors to accessory buildings and to garages serving a single dwelling unit, door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be operable with one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation. (See also Sentence 3.8.3.6.(4) and Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be installed not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be installed not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.

National Sentence Text: Except for hotels and motels, a door opening onto a public corridor that provides access to exit from suites shall be designed not to lock automatically if it is equipped with an automatic self-closing device. (See Note A-3.3.4.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for hotels and motels, a door opening onto a public corridor that provides access to exit from suites shall be designed not to lock automatically if it is equipped with an automatic self-closing device. (See Note A-3.3.4.5.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Every exit door, except doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, shall be designed and installed so that when the latch is released the door will open in the direction of exit travel under a force of not more than 90 N applied to the door release hardware. (See Sentence 3.8.3.6.(8) for door opening forces in a barrier-free path of travel.)
P/T Sentence Text: Every exit door, except doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, shall be designed and installed so that when the latch is released the door will open in the direction of exit travel under a force of not more than 90 N applied to the door release hardware. (See Sentence 3.8.3.6.(8) for door opening forces in a barrier-free path of travel.)

National Sentence Text: An access to exit shall be provided from every roof intended for occupancy and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.
P/T Sentence Text: An access to exit shall be provided from every roof intended for occupancy and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.

National Sentence Text: Where a roof is intended for an occupant load of more than 60 persons, at least 2 separate means of egress shall be provided from the roof to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements for exit stairs and located remote from each other.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roof is intended for an occupant load of more than 60 persons, at least 2 separate means of egress shall be provided from the roof to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements for exit stairs and located remote from each other.

National Sentence Text: Where a podium, terrace, platform or contained open space is provided, egress requirements shall conform to the appropriate requirements for rooms or suites in Article 9.9.7.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a podium, terrace, platform or contained open space is provided, egress requirements shall conform to the appropriate requirements for rooms or suites in Article 9.9.7.4.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.9.9.3.(1), each suite in a floor area occupied by more than one suite shall have an exterior exit doorway, a doorway to a public corridor, or a doorway to an exterior passageway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.9.9.3.(1), each suite in a floor area occupied by more than one suite shall have an exterior exit doorway, a doorway to a public corridor, or a doorway to an exterior passageway.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.7.3.(1)and 9.9.8.2.(2), from the point where a doorway described in Clause 9.9.7.2.(1)(b)or 9.9.7.2.(1)(c) enters the public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.7.3.(1) and 9.9.8.2.(2), from the point where a doorway described in Sentence 9.9.7.2.(1)or 9.9.7.2.(1) enters the public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.

National Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite and except as permitted in Sentence 9.9.9.2.(1), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite and except as permitted in Sentence 9.9.9.2.(1), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.

National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, at least 2 egress doors shall be provided when the area of a room or suite, or the distance measured from any point within the room or suite to the nearest egress door, exceeds the values in Table 9.9.7.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, at least 2 egress doors shall be provided when the area of a room or suite, or the distance measured from any point within the room or suite to the nearest egress door, exceeds the values in Table 9.9.7.4.

National Sentence Text: Doors required in Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1) shall be spaced so that in the event that one door is made inaccessible by a fire within such room or suite, the other door will provide safe egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors required in Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1) shall be spaced so that in the event that one door is made inaccessible by a fire within such room or suite, the other door will provide safe egress.

National Sentence Text: Required access to exit from suites shall not be through any other dwelling unit, service room or other occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Required access to exit from suites shall not be through any other dwelling unit, service room or other occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, the travel distance from any point within the room or suite to the nearest egress door shall not exceed the maximum travel distance in Article 9.9.8.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, the travel distance from any point within the room or suite to the nearest egress door shall not exceed the maximum travel distance in Article 9.9.8.2.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.8.1.(2)and 9.9.8.1.(3), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.8.1.(2) and 9.9.8.1.(3), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Where a room or suite is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min or, in a sprinkleredbuilding, by a fire separation which is not required to have a fire-resistance rating, the travel distance may be measured from an egress door of the room or suite to the nearest exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room or suite is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min or, in a sprinkleredbuilding, by a fire separation which is not required to have a fire-resistance rating, the travel distance may be measured from an egress door of the room or suite to the nearest exit.

National Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is not less than 9 m wide and conforms to Subclauses 3.4.2.5.(1)(d)(i)to 3.4.2.5.(1)(d)(iv), the travel distance may be determined in accordance with those Subclauses.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is not less than 9 m wide and conforms to Subclauses 3.4.2.5.(1)to 3.4.2.5.(1), the travel distance may be determined in accordance with those Subclauses.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.8.2.(2) and Subsection 9.9.9., at least 2 exits shall be provided from every floor area, spaced so that the travel distance to the nearest exit is not more than 40 m in the case of business and personal services occupancies, 45 m for all occupancies where the floor area is sprinklered, and 30 m for all other occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.8.2.(2) and part 9., at least 2 exits shall be provided from every floor area, spaced so that the travel distance to the nearest exit is not more than 40 m in the case of business and personal services occupancies, 45 m for all occupancies where the floor area is sprinklered, and 30 m for all other occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 9.9.9., a single exit is permitted from each storey in buildings of 1 and 2 storeys in building height provided the floor area and travel distance requirements conform to those required in Article 9.9.7.4. and the total occupant load served by an exit facility does not exceed 60 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in part 9., a single exit is permitted from each storey in buildings of 1 and 2 storeys in building height provided the floor area and travel distance requirements conform to those required in Article 9.9.7.4. and the total occupant load served by an exit facility does not exceed 60 persons.

National Sentence Text: Where more than one exit is required from a floor area, each exit shall be considered as contributing not more than half the required exit width.
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one exit is required from a floor area, each exit shall be considered as contributing not more than half the required exit width.

National Sentence Text: Where more than one exit is required from a floor area, at least 2 exits shall be independent of each other and be placed remote from each other along the path of travel between them. (See Note A-9.9.8.4.(1).) (See Note A-9.9.8.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one exit is required from a floor area, at least 2 exits shall be independent of each other and be placed remote from each other along the path of travel between them. (See Note A-9.9.8.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Not more than one exit from a floor area above or below the first storey is permitted to lead through a lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than one exit from a floor area above or below the first storey is permitted to lead through a lobby.

National Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) shall be not more than 4.5 m above grade, and the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors shall not exceed 15 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) shall be not more than 4.5 m above grade, and the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors shall not exceed 15 m.

National Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.

National Sentence Text: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating. (See Note A-3.4.4.2.(2)(e).) (See Note A-3.4.4.2.(2)(e).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating. (See Note A-3.4.4.2.(2)(e).)

National Sentence Text: Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading passengers.
P/T Sentence Text: Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading passengers.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.9.8.6.(2)and 9.9.8.6.(3), the space above a mezzanine shall be served by means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level, on the same basis as floor areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.9.8.6.(2) and 9.9.8.6.(3), the space above a mezzanine shall be served by means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level, on the same basis as floor areas.

National Sentence Text: The means of egress from a mezzanine need not conform to Sentence 9.9.8.6.(1), provided the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60, the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits stated in Table 9.9.7.4., and the distance limits stated in Table 9.9.7.4., measured along the path of travel, are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks if the space is served by a single egress door, or an egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by 2 or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The means of egress from a mezzanine need not conform to Sentence 9.9.8.6.(1), provided the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60, the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits stated in Table 9.9.7.4., and the distance limits stated in Table 9.9.7.4., measured along the path of travel, are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks if the space is served by a single egress door, or an egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by 2 or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1).

National Sentence Text: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), and that exceeds the limits of Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2) is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located, provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.
P/T Sentence Text: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), and that exceeds the limits of Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2) is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located, provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2), the maximum travel distance from any point on a mezzanine to the nearest exit shall be not more than 40 m in a business and personal services occupancy, 45 m in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout, provided it does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy, or 30 m in any floor area not referred to in Clauses 9.9.8.6.(4)(a)or 9.9.8.6.(4)(b).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2), the maximum travel distance from any point on a mezzanine to the nearest exit shall be not more than 40 m in a business and personal services occupancy, 45 m in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout, provided it does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy, or 30 m in any floor area not referred to in Clauses 9.9.8.6.(4)or 9.9.8.6.(4).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.9.1.(2)and 9.9.9.1.(3), every dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have exits or egress doors located so that it shall not be necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach a level served by an egress door to a public corridor, enclosed exit stair or exterior passageway, or an exit doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.9.1.(2) and 9.9.9.1.(3), every dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have exits or egress doors located so that it shall not be necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach a level served by an egress door to a public corridor, enclosed exit stair or exterior passageway, or an exit doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is not located above or below another suite, the travel limit from a floor level in the dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level is served by an openable window providing an unobstructed opening of not less than 1 m in height and 0.55 m in width, and located so that the sill is not more than 1 m above the floor, and 7 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is not located above or below another suite, the travel limit from a floor level in the dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level is served by an openable window providing an unobstructed opening of not less than 1 m in height and 0.55 m in width, and located so that the sill is not more than 1 m above the floor, and 7 m above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: The travel limit from a floor level in a dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level has direct access to a balcony.
P/T Sentence Text: The travel limit from a floor level in a dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level has direct access to a balcony.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.7.3.(1) and except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, where an egress door from a dwelling unit opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway it shall be possible from the location where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway to go in opposite directions to 2 separate exits unless the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.7.3.(1) and except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, where an egress door from a dwelling unit opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway it shall be possible from the location where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway to go in opposite directions to 2 separate exits unless the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, a dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from the dwelling unit opens onto an exit stairway serving more than one suite, a public corridor serving more than one suite, and served by a single exit, an exterior passageway serving more than one suite, served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, or a balcony serving more than one suite, served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, a dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from the dwelling unit opens onto an exit stairway serving more than one suite, a public corridor serving more than one suite, and served by a single exit, an exterior passageway serving more than one suite, served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, or a balcony serving more than one suite, served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is located above another dwelling unit or common space in a house with a secondary suite, the upper dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from that dwelling unit opens onto an exterior passageway that has a floor assembly with a fire-resistance rating less than 45 min, is served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and is located more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is located above another dwelling unit or common space in a house with a secondary suite, the upper dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from that dwelling unit opens onto an exterior passageway that has a floor assembly with a fire-resistance rating less than 45 min, is served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and is located more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: Except where the suite is sprinklered, each bedroom or combination bedroom shall have at least one outside window or exterior door openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge and without the removal of sashes or hardware. (See Article 9.5.1.2. and Note A-9.9.10.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the suite is sprinklered, each bedroom or combination bedroom shall have at least one outside window or exterior door openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge and without the removal of sashes or hardware. (See Article 9.5.1.2. and Note A-9.9.10.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The window referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(1) shall provide an unobstructed opening of not less than 0.35 m2 in area with no dimension less than 380 mm, and maintain the required opening during an emergency without the need for additional support. (See Note A-9.9.10.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The window referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(1) shall provide an unobstructed opening of not less than 0.35 m2 in area with no dimension less than 380 mm, and maintain the required opening during an emergency without the need for additional support.

National Sentence Text: Where a window required in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(1) opens into a window well, a clearance of not less than 760 mm shall be provided in front of the window. (See Note A-9.9.10.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a window required in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(1) opens into a window well, a clearance of not less than 760 mm shall be provided in front of the window. (See Note A-9.9.10.1.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(3) swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(3) swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.

National Sentence Text: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(3), the enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(3), the enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.
If the window referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(1) is provided with security bars, the security bars shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): If the window referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(1) is provided with security bars, the security bars shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to all exits except those serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to all exits except those serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.

National Sentence Text: Exits shall be located so as to be clearly visible or their locations shall be clearly indicated.
P/T Sentence Text: Exits shall be located so as to be clearly visible or their locations shall be clearly indicated.

National Sentence Text: Where an exit door leading directly to the outside is subject to being obstructed by parked vehicles or storage because of its location, a visible sign or a physical barrier prohibiting such obstructions shall be installed on the exterior side of the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exit door leading directly to the outside is subject to being obstructed by parked vehicles or storage because of its location, a visible sign or a physical barrier prohibiting such obstructions shall be installed on the exterior side of the door.

National Sentence Text: Every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over it or adjacent to it if the exit serves a building that is 3 storeys in building height, a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over it or adjacent to it if the exit serves a building that is 3 storeys in building height, a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Every exit sign shall be visible on approach to the exit, consist of a green and white or lightly tinted graphical symbol meeting the colour specifications referred to in ISO 3864-1:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Part 1: Design principles for safety signs and safety markings and conform to ISO 7010:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Registered safety signs for the following symbols (see Note A-3.4.5.1.(2)(c)): E001 emergency exit left, E002 emergency exit right, E005 90-degree directional arrow, and E006 45-degree directional arrow.
P/T Sentence Text: Every exit sign shall be visible on approach to the exit, consist of a green and white or lightly tinted graphical symbol meeting the colour specifications referred to in ISO 3864-1:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Part 1: Design principles for safety signs and safety markings and conform to ISO 7010:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Registered safety signs for the following symbols (see Note A-3.4.5.1.(2)(c)): E001 emergency exit left, E002 emergency exit right, E005 90-degree directional arrow, and E006 45-degree directional arrow.

National Sentence Text: Internally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated and where illumination of the sign is powered by an electrical circuit, be constructed in conformance with CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment or where illumination of the sign is not powered by an electrical circuit, be constructed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S572-17 Photoluminescent and Self-Luminous Exit Signs and Path Marking Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Internally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated and where illumination of the sign is powered by an electrical circuit, be constructed in conformance with CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment or where illumination of the sign is not powered by an electrical circuit, be constructed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S572-17 Photoluminescent and Self-Luminous Exit Signs and Path Marking Systems

National Sentence Text: Externally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated and be constructed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S572-17 Photoluminescent and Self-Luminous Exit Signs and Path Marking Systems (See Note A-3.4.5.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Externally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated and be constructed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S572-17 Photoluminescent and Self-Luminous Exit Signs and Path Marking Systems (See Note A-3.4.5.1.(4).)

National Sentence Text: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall serve no equipment other than emergency equipment, and be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Sentences 9.9.12.3.(2), 9.9.12.3.(3)and 9.9.12.3.(7).
P/T Sentence Text: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall serve no equipment other than emergency equipment, and be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Sentences 9.9.12.3.(2), 9.9.12.3.(3) and 9.9.12.3.(7).

National Sentence Text: Where no exit is visible from a public corridor, from a corridor used by the public, or from principal routes serving an open floor area having an occupant load of more than 150, an exit sign conforming to Clauses 9.9.11.3.(2)(b)and 9.9.11.3.(2)(c) with an arrow or pointer indicating the direction of egress shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where no exit is visible from a public corridor, from a corridor used by the public, or from principal routes serving an open floor area having an occupant load of more than 150, an exit sign conforming to Clauses 9.9.11.3.(2)and 9.9.11.3.(2) with an arrow or pointer indicating the direction of egress shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: In buildings that are 3 storeys in building height, any part of an exit ramp or stairway that continues up or down past the lowest exit level shall be clearly marked to indicate that it does not lead to an exit, if the portion beyond the exit level may be mistaken as the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings that are 3 storeys in building height, any part of an exit ramp or stairway that continues up or down past the lowest exit level shall be clearly marked to indicate that it does not lead to an exit, if the portion beyond the exit level may be mistaken as the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall be mounted permanently on the stair side of the wall at the latch side of doors to exit stair shafts, not less than 60 mm high, raised approximately 0.8 mm above the surface, located 1 500 mm from the finished floor and not more than 300 mm from the door, and contrasting in colour with the surface on which they are applied. (See Note A-3.4.6.19.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall be mounted permanently on the stair side of the wall at the latch side of doors to exit stair shafts, not less than 60 mm high, raised approximately 0.8 mm above the surface, located 1 500 mm from the finished floor and not more than 300 mm from the door, and contrasting in colour with the surface on which they are applied. (See Note A-3.4.6.19.(1)(d).)

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the lighting of all means of egress except those within dwelling units or a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the lighting of all means of egress except those within dwelling units or a house with a secondary suite.

National Sentence Text: Every exit, public corridor or corridor providing access to exit for the public shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level of not less than 50 lx at floor or tread level and at all points such as angles and intersections at changes of level where there are stairs or ramps.
P/T Sentence Text: Every exit, public corridor or corridor providing access to exit for the public shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level of not less than 50 lx at floor or tread level and at all points such as angles and intersections at changes of level where there are stairs or ramps.

National Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 9.9.12.2.(1) shall be not less than 10 lx.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 9.9.12.2.(1) shall be not less than 10 lx.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided in exits, principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area, corridors used by the public, underground walkways, and public corridors.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided in exits, principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area, corridors used by the public, underground walkways, and public corridors.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(1) shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(1) shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.

National Sentence Text: Lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(1) shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of at least 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.
P/T Sentence Text: Lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(1) shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of at least 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.

National Sentence Text: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(1) shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.
P/T Sentence Text: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(1) shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.

National Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 9.9.12.3.(4) shall be not less than 1 lx.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 9.9.12.3.(4) shall be not less than 1 lx.

National Sentence Text: Where incandescent lighting is provided, lighting equal to 1 W/m2 of floor area shall be considered to meet the requirement in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Where incandescent lighting is provided, lighting equal to 1 W/m2 of floor area shall be considered to meet the requirement in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(4).

National Sentence Text: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, roofs with slopes of 60° or more to the horizontal that are adjacent to a room or space intended for occupancy shall be considered as a wall.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, roofs with slopes of 60° or more to the horizontal that are adjacent to a room or space intended for occupancy shall be considered as a wall.

National Sentence Text: Where life safety and fire protection systems and systems with fire protection and life safety functions are integrated with each other, they shall be tested as a whole in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S1001-11 Integrated Systems Testing of Fire Protection and Life Safety Systems to verify that they have been properly integrated. (See Note A-3.2.9.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where life safety and fire protection systems and systems with fire protection and life safety functions are integrated with each other, they shall be tested as a whole in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S1001-11 Integrated Systems Testing of Fire Protection and Life Safety Systems to verify that they have been properly integrated. (See Note A-3.2.9.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Tents, air-supported structures, transformer vaults, walkways, elevators and escalators shall conform to Part 3..
P/T Sentence Text: Tents, air-supported structures, transformer vaults, walkways, elevators and escalators shall conform to part 3..

National Sentence Text: Where rooms or spaces are intended for an assembly occupancy, such rooms or spaces shall conform to Part 3..
P/T Sentence Text: Where rooms or spaces are intended for an assembly occupancy, such rooms or spaces shall conform to part 3..

National Sentence Text: Basements containing more than 1 storey or exceeding 600 m2 in area shall conform to Part 3..
P/T Sentence Text: Basements containing more than 1 storey or exceeding 600 m2 in area shall conform to part 3..

National Sentence Text: Where rooms or spaces are intended for the storage, manufacture or use of hazardous or explosive material, such rooms or spaces shall conform to Part 3.. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).) (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where rooms or spaces are intended for the storage, manufacture or use of hazardous or explosive material, such rooms or spaces shall conform to part 3.. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.3.5.8., facilities for the dispensing of fuel shall not be installed in any building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.3.5.8., facilities for the dispensing of fuel shall not be installed in any building.

National Sentence Text: Openings through floors that are not protected by shafts or closures shall be protected in conformance with Subsection 3.2.8. (See also Sentence 9.9.4.7.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through floors that are not protected by shafts or closures shall be protected in conformance with part 3. (See also Sentence 9.9.4.7.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Chutes and shafts shall conform to Subsection 3.6.3. except where they are entirely contained within a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Chutes and shafts shall conform to part 3. except where they are entirely contained within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Sprinkler systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.12.to 3.2.5.15.and 3.2.5.17.
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinkler systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.12. to 3.2.5.15. and 3.2.5.17.

National Sentence Text: Standpipe and hose systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.8.to 3.2.5.11.and 3.2.5.17.
P/T Sentence Text: Standpipe and hose systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.8. to 3.2.5.11.and 3.2.5.17.

National Sentence Text: Fire pumps shall be installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.17.and 3.2.5.18.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire pumps shall be installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.17.and 3.2.5.18.

National Sentence Text: Where fuel-fired appliances are installed on a roof, such appliances shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.6.1.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where fuel-fired appliances are installed on a roof, such appliances shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.6.1.5.
Rooms or spaces that contain welding or flame cutting operations shall conform to Article 3.3.1.25.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Rooms or spaces that contain welding or flame cutting operations shall conform to Article 3.3.1.25.

National Sentence Text: In kitchens containing commercial cooking equipment used in processes producing grease-laden vapours, the equipment shall be designed and installed in conformance with Article 6.3.1.7. (See Note A-9.10.1.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In kitchens containing commercial cooking equipment used in processes producing grease-laden vapours, the equipment shall be designed and installed in conformance with Article 6.3.1.7. (See Note A-9.10.1.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.2.2., every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the groups or divisions described in Table 9.10.2.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.2.2., every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the groups or divisions described in Table 9.10.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Children’s custodial homes and convalescent homes for ambulatory occupants living as a single housekeeping unit in a dwelling unit with sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons are permitted to be classified as residential occupancies (Group C).
P/T Sentence Text: Children’s custodial homes and convalescent homes for ambulatory occupants living as a single housekeeping unit in a dwelling unit with sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons are permitted to be classified as residential occupancies (Group C).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than one major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than one major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.

National Sentence Text: In a building containing more than one major occupancy, where the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular group or division does not exceed 10% of the floor area on the storey on which they are located, they need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of Articles 9.10.8.1.and 9.10.2.3. provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 2 occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building containing more than one major occupancy, where the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular group or division does not exceed 10% of the floor area on the storey on which they are located, they need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of Articles 9.10.8.1.and 9.10.2.3. provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 2 occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating or a fire-protection rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in conformance with the test methods described in Part 3, the calculation method presented in , or the construction specifications presented in Tables 9.10.3.1.-Aand 9.10.3.1.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating or a fire-protection rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in conformance with the test methods described in part 3., the calculation method presented in , or the construction specifications presented in Tables 9.10.3.1.-Aand 9.10.3.1.-B.

National Sentence Text: Where a flame-spread rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in accordance with the test methods described in Part 3., or in accordance with .
P/T Sentence Text: Where a flame-spread rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in accordance with the test methods described in part 3., or in accordance with .

National Sentence Text: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to herein as a "surface flame-spread rating," it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to herein as a "surface flame-spread rating," it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.

National Sentence Text: Floor, roof and ceiling assemblies shall be rated for exposure to fire on the underside.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor, roof and ceiling assemblies shall be rated for exposure to fire on the underside.

National Sentence Text: Exterior walls shall be rated for exposure to fire from inside the building, except that such walls need not comply with the temperature rise limitations required by the standard tests referred to in Article 9.10.3.1. if such walls have a limiting distance of not less than 1.2 m, and due allowance is made for the effects of heat radiation in accordance with the requirements in Part 3..
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior walls shall be rated for exposure to fire from inside the building, except that such walls need not comply with the temperature rise limitations required by the standard tests referred to in Article 9.10.3.1. if such walls have a limiting distance of not less than 1.2 m, and due allowance is made for the effects of heat radiation in accordance with the requirements in part 3..

National Sentence Text: Interior vertical fire separations required to have fire-resistance ratings shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.
P/T Sentence Text: Interior vertical fire separations required to have fire-resistance ratings shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.

National Sentence Text: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles which contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles which contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 9.10.4.1.(2)and 9.10.4.2.(1), the space above a mezzanine is permitted to be excluded from the calculation of building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 10% of the floor area of the building in which they are located, and the area of mezzanine in a suite does not exceed 10% of the area of that suite on the storey on which it is located.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 9.10.4.1.(2) and 9.10.4.2.(1), the space above a mezzanine is permitted to be excluded from the calculation of building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 10% of the floor area of the building in which they are located, and the area of mezzanine in a suite does not exceed 10% of the area of that suite on the storey on which it is located.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.10.4.2.(1), the space above a mezzanine is permitted to be excluded from the calculation of building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a)), and except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.4.1.(3), the space above the mezzanine floor is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.10.4.2.(1), the space above a mezzanine is permitted to be excluded from the calculation of building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a)), and except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.4.1.(3), the space above the mezzanine floor is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.

National Sentence Text: The space above a mezzanine conforming to Sentence 9.10.4.1.(2) is permitted to include an enclosed space whose area does not exceed 10% of the open area of the room in which the mezzanine is located, provided the enclosed space does not obstruct visual communication between the open space above the mezzanine and the room in which it is located.
P/T Sentence Text: The space above a mezzanine conforming to Sentence 9.10.4.1.(2) is permitted to include an enclosed space whose area does not exceed 10% of the open area of the room in which the mezzanine is located, provided the enclosed space does not obstruct visual communication between the open space above the mezzanine and the room in which it is located.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining occupant load, the areas of mezzanines that are not considered as storeys shall be added to the floor area of the storey on which they are located. (See Note A-9.10.4.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of determining occupant load, the areas of mezzanines that are not considered as storeys shall be added to the floor area of the storey on which they are located. (See Note A-9.10.4.1.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Platforms and catwalks intended solely for periodic inspection and maintenance need not be considered as floor assemblies or mezzanines for the purpose of calculating building height, provided they are not used for storage, and they are constructed with noncombustible materials, unless the building is permitted to be of combustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Platforms and catwalks intended solely for periodic inspection and maintenance need not be considered as floor assemblies or mezzanines for the purpose of calculating building height, provided they are not used for storage, and they are constructed with noncombustible materials, unless the building is permitted to be of combustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Each level of mezzanine that is partly or wholly superimposed above the first level of mezzanine shall be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
P/T Sentence Text: Each level of mezzanine that is partly or wholly superimposed above the first level of mezzanine shall be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

National Sentence Text: Where a basement is used primarily as a storage garage, the basement is permitted to be considered as a separate building for the purposes of this Section provided the floor above the basement and the exterior walls of the basement above the adjoining ground level are constructed as fire separations of masonry or concrete having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a basement is used primarily as a storage garage, the basement is permitted to be considered as a separate building for the purposes of this Section provided the floor above the basement and the exterior walls of the basement above the adjoining ground level are constructed as fire separations of masonry or concrete having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Roof-top enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof-top enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.5.1.(2)and 9.10.5.1.(4), a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall not be pierced by openings into the assembly unless the assembly has been tested and rated for such openings.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.5.1.(2) and 9.10.5.1.(4), a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall not be pierced by openings into the assembly unless the assembly has been tested and rated for such openings.

National Sentence Text: A wall or ceiling membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating is permitted to be pierced by openings for electrical and similar service outlet boxes provided such outlet boxes are tightly fitted.
P/T Sentence Text: A wall or ceiling membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating is permitted to be pierced by openings for electrical and similar service outlet boxes provided such outlet boxes are tightly fitted.

National Sentence Text: Where boxes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(2) are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Where boxes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(2) are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.

National Sentence Text: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Table 9.10.3.1.-B or is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to the requirements of .
P/T Sentence Text: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Table 9.10.3.1.-B or is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to the requirements of .

National Sentence Text: Where a building or part of a building is required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible elements shall be limited in conformance with the requirements in Subsection 3.1.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building or part of a building is required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible elements shall be limited in conformance with the requirements in part 3.

National Sentence Text: Heavy timber construction shall be considered to have a 45 minfire-resistance rating when it is constructed in accordance with the requirements for heavy timber construction in Article 3.1.4.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Heavy timber construction shall be considered to have a 45 min fire-resistance rating when it is constructed in accordance with the requirements for heavy timber construction in Article 3.1.4.7.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the fire-resistance ratings of floors and roofs shall conform to Table 9.10.8.1. (See Subsection 9.10.2. for mixed occupancies and Subsection 9.10.21. for construction camps.)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the fire-resistance ratings of floors and roofs shall conform to Table 9.10.8.1. (See Subsection 9.10.2. for mixed occupancies and Part 9. for construction camps.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the fire-resistance ratings of floors and roofs shall conform to Table 9.10.8.1. (See part 9. for mixed occupancies and part 10. for construction camps.)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the fire-resistance ratings of floors and roofs shall conform to Table 9.10.8.1. (See Subsection 9.10.2. for mixed occupancies and Part 10 for construction camps.)

National Sentence Text: The requirements in Table 9.10.8.1. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived in sprinkleredbuildings where the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements in Table 9.10.8.1. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived in sprinklered buildings where the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, all loadbearing walls, columns and arches in the storey immediately below a floor or roof assembly shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than that required for the supported floor or roof assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, all loadbearing walls, columns and arches in the storey immediately below a floor or roof assembly shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than that required for the supported floor or roof assembly.

National Sentence Text: Light-frame walls, columns, arches and beams as well as loadbearing steel elements that support floors between dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be protected by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board. (See Note A-9.10.8.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Light-frame walls, columns, arches and beams as well as loadbearing steel elements that support floors between dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be protected by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board. (See Note A-9.10.8.3.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Where an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and to have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and to have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Construction supporting a service room need not conform to Article 9.10.8.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Construction supporting a service room need not conform to Article 9.10.8.3.

National Sentence Text: Mezzanines required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1.and 9.10.4.2. shall be constructed in conformance with the requirements for "Floors Except Floors over Crawl Spaces" in Table 9.10.8.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Mezzanines required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1.and 9.10.4.2. shall be constructed in conformance with the requirements for "Floors Except Floors over Crawl Spaces" in Table 9.10.8.1.

National Sentence Text: Where a portion of a roof supports an occupancy, that portion shall be constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to the rating for "Floors Except Floors over Crawl Spaces" in Table 9.10.8.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a portion of a roof supports an occupancy, that portion shall be constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to the rating for "Floors Except Floors over Crawl Spaces" in Table 9.10.8.1.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.8.8.(2)and 9.10.8.8.(3), the floor assembly of every exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.8.8.(2) and 9.10.8.8.(3), the floor assembly of every exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving buildings of Group D, E or F major occupancy that are not more than 2 storeys in building height.
P/T Sentence Text: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving buildings of Group D, E or F major occupancy that are not more than 2 storeys in building height.

National Sentence Text: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving a house with a secondary suite, or a single dwelling unit where no suite is located above or below the dwelling unit (see also Sentence 9.9.9.3.(2)).
P/T Sentence Text: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving a house with a secondary suite, or a single dwelling unit where no suite is located above or below the dwelling unit (see also Sentence 9.9.9.3.(2)).

National Sentence Text: Where a crawl space exceeds 1.8 m in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a crawl space exceeds 1.8 m in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.

National Sentence Text: Table 9.10.8.1. does not apply to a dwelling unit that has no other dwelling unit above or below it, houses with a secondary suite, where the floor framing is protected on the underside by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, or a dwelling unit that is not above or below another major occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Table 9.10.8.1. does not apply to a dwelling unit that has no other dwelling unit above or below it, houses with a secondary suite, where the floor framing is protected on the underside by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, or a dwelling unit that is not above or below another major occupancy.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in Section 3.2.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in part 3.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to fire separations required between rooms and spaces in buildings, and smoke-tight barriers required in houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to fire separations required between rooms and spaces in buildings, and smoke-tight barriers required in houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of fire and retard the passage of smoke.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of fire and retard the passage of smoke.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a smoke-tight barrier shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of smoke.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a smoke-tight barrier shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of smoke.

National Sentence Text: The continuity of a fire separation or smoke-tight barrier shall be maintained where it abuts another fire separation or smoke-tight barrier, a floor, a ceiling, a roof, or an exterior wall assembly. (See Notes A-9.10.9.2.(3)and A-3.1.8.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: The continuity of a fire separation or smoke-tight barrier shall be maintained where it abuts another fire separation or smoke-tight barrier, a floor, a ceiling, a roof, or an exterior wall assembly. (See Notes A-9.10.9.2.(3)and A-3.1.8.3.(4).)

National Sentence Text: All gypsum board joints in the assemblies described in Sentences 9.10.9.2.(1)and 9.9.9.3.(2) shall conform to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application and penetrations in these assemblies shall be sealed using flexible sealant or tape to maintain the integrity of the smoke-tight barrier over the entire surface.
P/T Sentence Text: All gypsum board joints in the assemblies described in Sentences 9.10.9.2.(1)and 9.9.9.3.(2) shall conform to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application and penetrations in these assemblies shall be sealed using flexible sealant or tape to maintain the integrity of the smoke-tight barrier over the entire surface.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5., 9.10.9.6.and 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to Subsection 9.10.13.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5. , 9.10.9.6. and 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Doors in smoke-tight barriers shall be solid-core, wood doors at least 45 mm thick, and have a self-closing device. (See Note A-9.10.9.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Doors in smoke-tight barriers shall be solid-core, wood doors at least 45 mm thick, and have a self-closing device.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.9.4.(2)to 9.10.9.4.(4), all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.9.4.(2) to 9.10.9.4.(4), all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies contained within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite need not be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies contained within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite need not be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9.10.8. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1.and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is not required by Article 9.10.8.9. to be constructed as a basement, the floor above it need not be constructed as a fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is not required by Article 9.10.8.9. to be constructed as a basement, the floor above it need not be constructed as a fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Interconnected floor spaces shall conform to Subsection 3.2.8. (See Note A-3.1.9.)
P/T Sentence Text: Interconnected floor spaces shall conform to part 3.

National Sentence Text: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Note A-9.10.9.6.(1).) (See Note A-9.10.9.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Note A-9.10.9.6.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.6.(4)to 9.10.9.6.(12) and Article 9.10.9.7., pipes, ducts, electrical boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating such equipment. (See Note A-3.1.9.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.6.(4) to 9.10.9.6.(12) and Article 9.10.9.7., pipes, ducts, electrical boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating such equipment. (See Note A-3.1.9.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Electrical wires or similar wiring enclosed in noncombustible totally enclosed raceways are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical wires or similar wiring enclosed in noncombustible totally enclosed raceways are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3).

National Sentence Text: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketting that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketting that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketting that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketting that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Combustible totally enclosed raceways which are embedded in a concrete floor slab are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), where the concrete provides not less than 50 mm of cover between the raceway and the bottom of the slab.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible totally enclosed raceways which are embedded in a concrete floor slab are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), where the concrete provides not less than 50 mm of cover between the raceway and the bottom of the slab.

National Sentence Text: Combustible outlet boxes are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the opening through the membrane into the box does not exceed 160 cm2.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible outlet boxes are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the opening through the membrane into the box does not exceed 160 cm2 .

National Sentence Text: Combustible water distribution piping is permitted to partly or wholly penetrate a fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the piping is protected with a fire stop in conformance with Sentence 3.1.9.5.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible water distribution piping is permitted to partly or wholly penetrate a fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the piping is protected with a fire stop in conformance with Sentence 3.1.9.5.(4).

National Sentence Text: Combustible sprinkler piping is permitted to penetrate a fire separation provided the fire compartments on each side of the fire separation are sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible sprinkler piping is permitted to penetrate a fire separation provided the fire compartments on each side of the fire separation are sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Sprinklers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1), provided the annular space created by the penetration of a fire sprinkler is covered by a metal escutcheon plate in accordance with NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinklers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1), provided the annular space created by the penetration of a fire sprinkler is covered by a metal escutcheon plate in accordance with NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems

National Sentence Text: Combustible piping for central vacuum systems is permitted to penetrate a fire separation provided the installation conforms to the requirements that apply to combustible drain, waste and vent piping specified in Sentences 9.10.9.7.(2)to 9.10.9.7.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible piping for central vacuum systems is permitted to penetrate a fire separation provided the installation conforms to the requirements that apply to combustible drain, waste and vent piping specified in Sentences 9.10.9.7.(2) to 9.10.9.7.(6).

National Sentence Text: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1), provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives or specifically designed with a fire stop. (See Note A-3.1.9.)
P/T Sentence Text: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1), provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives or specifically designed with a fire stop.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.9.7.(2)to 9.10.9.7.(6), combustible piping shall not be used in any part of a drain, waste and vent piping system where any part of that system partly or wholly penetrates a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or penetrates a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of an assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.9.7.(2) to 9.10.9.7.(6), combustible piping shall not be used in any part of a drain, waste and vent piping system where any part of that system partly or wholly penetrates a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or penetrates a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of an assembly.

National Sentence Text: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping not located in a vertical shaft is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping not located in a vertical shaft is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.

National Sentence Text: The rating referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.7.(2) shall be based on ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.
P/T Sentence Text: The rating referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.7.(2) shall be based on ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.
