National Sentence Text: Combustible drain piping is permitted to penetrate a horizontal fire separation or a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of a horizontal fire separation, provided it leads directly from a noncombustible watercloset through a concrete floor slab.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible drain piping is permitted to penetrate a horizontal fire separation or a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of a horizontal fire separation, provided it leads directly from a noncombustible watercloset through a concrete floor slab.

National Sentence Text: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a vertical fire separation provided it is not located in a vertical shaft.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a vertical fire separation provided it is not located in a vertical shaft.

National Sentence Text: In buildings containing 2 dwelling units only, combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a horizontal fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings containing 2 dwelling units only, combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a horizontal fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Combustible construction that abuts on or is supported by a noncombustiblefire separation shall be constructed so that its collapse under fire conditions will not cause collapse of the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible construction that abuts on or is supported by a noncombustible fire separation shall be constructed so that its collapse under fire conditions will not cause collapse of the fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Where pockets for the support of beams or joists are formed in a masonry or concrete fire separation, the remaining total thickness of masonry and/or grout and/or concrete shall be not less than the required equivalent thickness shown for Type S monolithic concrete in Table B-2.1.1. in Appendix D for the required fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Where pockets for the support of beams or joists are formed in a masonry or concrete fire separation, the remaining total thickness of masonry and/or grout and/or concrete shall be not less than the required equivalent thickness shown for Type S monolithic concrete in Table B-2.1.1. in Appendix D for the required fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.10.(2), a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.10.(2), a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.

National Sentence Text: Where a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, such space need not be divided as required in Sentence 9.10.9.10.(1) provided the construction between such space and the space below is constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical fire separation, except that where the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating greater than 45 min, the fire-resistance rating of the ceiling may be reduced to 30 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, such space need not be divided as required in Sentence 9.10.9.10.(1) provided the construction between such space and the space below is constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical fire separation, except that where the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating greater than 45 min, the fire-resistance rating of the ceiling may be reduced to 30 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.11.(2), residential occupancies shall be separated from all other major occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.11.(2), residential occupancies shall be separated from all other major occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.11.(3), a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium-hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.11.(3), a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium-hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Where not more than 2 dwelling units are located in a building containing a mercantile occupancy, such mercantile occupancy shall be separated from the dwelling units by a fire separation having not less than 1 hfire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Where not more than 2 dwelling units are located in a building containing a mercantile occupancy, such mercantile occupancy shall be separated from the dwelling units by a fire separation having not less than 1 h fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.10.9.14. and as permitted by Sentence 9.10.9.13.(2), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.10.9.14. and as permitted by Sentence 9.10.9.13.(2), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: In sprinkleredbuildings, suites of business and personal services occupancy and mercantile occupancy that are served by public corridors conforming with Clause 3.3.1.4.(4)(b) are not required to be separated from each other by fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: In sprinkleredbuildings, suites of business and personal services occupancy and mercantile occupancy that are served by public corridors conforming with Sentence 3.3.1.4.(4) are not required to be separated from each other by fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.14.(2), 9.10.9.14.(3)and 9.10.9.14.(4) and Article 9.10.21.2., suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.14.(2), 9.10.9.14.(3) and 9.10.9.14.(4) and Article 9.10.21.2., suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.14.(2) , 9.10.9.14.(3) and 9.10.9.14.(4) and part 10. , suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.14.(2), 9.10.9.14.(3) and 9.10.9.14.(4) and Part 10., suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: Sleeping rooms in boarding and lodging houses where sleeping accommodation is provided for not more than 8 boarders or lodgers need not be separated from the remainder of the floor area as required in Sentence 9.10.9.14.(1) where the sleeping rooms form part of the proprietor’s residence and do not contain cooking facilities.
P/T Sentence Text: Sleeping rooms in boarding and lodging houses where sleeping accommodation is provided for not more than 8 boarders or lodgers need not be separated from the remainder of the floor area as required in Sentence 9.10.9.14.(1) where the sleeping rooms form part of the proprietor’s residence and do not contain cooking facilities.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.14.(4), dwelling units that contain 2 or more storeys including basements shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h. (See Note A-3.3.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.14.(4), dwelling units that contain 2 or more storeys including basements shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h. (See Note A-3.3.4.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Walls and floor-ceiling framing in a house with a secondary suite that separate dwelling units from each other or dwelling units from ancillary spaces and common spaces need not comply with Sentence 9.10.9.14.(1), where the walls and floor-ceiling framing are protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board installed on both sides of walls, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing. (See Sentence 9.10.9.3.(2) for closures.)
P/T Sentence Text: Walls and floor-ceiling framing in a house with a secondary suite that separate dwelling units from each other or dwelling units from ancillary spaces and common spaces need not comply with Sentence 9.10.9.14.(1), where the walls and floor-ceiling framing are protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board installed on both sides of walls, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.15.(2), 9.10.9.15.(3)and 9.10.9.15.(4), public corridors shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 45 minfire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.15.(2) , 9.10.9.15.(3) and 9.10.9.15.(4), public corridors shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).

National Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire separation is required between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), and the corridor exceeds 5 m in width.
P/T Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire separation is required between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), and the corridor exceeds 5 m in width.

National Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is located in a house with a secondary suite, a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board shall be installed on both sides of walls separating the corridor from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the corridor from the remainder of the building. (See Sentence 9.10.9.3.(2) for closures.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is located in a house with a secondary suite, a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board shall be installed on both sides of walls separating the corridor from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the corridor from the remainder of the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.16.(2)and 9.10.9.16.(3), a storage garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having not less than a 1.5 hfire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.16.(2) and 9.10.9.16.(3), a storage garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having not less than a 1.5 hfire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(3), storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(3), storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Where a storage garage serves only the dwelling unit to which it is attached or in which it is built, it shall be considered as part of that dwelling unit and the fire separation required in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(2) need not be provided between the garage and the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage serves only the dwelling unit to which it is attached or in which it is built, it shall be considered as part of that dwelling unit and the fire separation required in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(2) need not be provided between the garage and the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(5), where a storage garage is attached to or built into a building of residential occupancy, an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the garage and the remainder of the building to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the garage and the remainder of the building shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(5), where a storage garage is attached to or built into a building of residential occupancy, an air barrier system conforming to part 9. shall be installed between the garage and the remainder of the building to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the garage and the remainder of the building shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15.

National Sentence Text: Where membrane materials are used to provide the required airtightness in the air barrier system, all joints shall be sealed and structurally supported.
P/T Sentence Text: Where membrane materials are used to provide the required airtightness in the air barrier system, all joints shall be sealed and structurally supported.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.17.(2)and 9.10.9.17.(3), a repair garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.17.(2) and 9.10.9.17.(3), a repair garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Ancillary spaces directly serving a repair garage, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, need not be separated from the repair garage but shall be separated from other occupancies as required in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Ancillary spaces directly serving a repair garage, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, need not be separated from the repair garage but shall be separated from other occupancies as required in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(1).

National Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(1) shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, where the building is not more than one storey in building height, the building is operated as a single suite, and the only occupancy other than the repair garage is a mercantile occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(1) shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, where the building is not more than one storey in building height, the building is operated as a single suite, and the only occupancy other than the repair garage is a mercantile occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(5), where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes. (See Note A-9.10.9.16.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(5), where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to part 9. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes. (See Note A-9.10.9.16.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Where membrane materials are used to provide the required airtightness in the air barrier system, all joints shall be sealed and structurally supported.
P/T Sentence Text: Where membrane materials are used to provide the required airtightness in the air barrier system, all joints shall be sealed and structurally supported.

National Sentence Text: Where a vertical service space contains an exhaust duct that serves more than one fire compartment, the duct shall have a fan located at or near the exhaust outlet to ensure that the duct is under negative pressure.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a vertical service space contains an exhaust duct that serves more than one fire compartment, the duct shall have a fan located at or near the exhaust outlet to ensure that the duct is under negative pressure.

National Sentence Text: Individual fire compartments referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.18.(1) shall not have fans that exhaust directly into the duct in the vertical service space.
P/T Sentence Text: Individual fire compartments referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.18.(1) shall not have fans that exhaust directly into the duct in the vertical service space.

National Sentence Text: A central vacuum system shall serve not more than one suite.
P/T Sentence Text: A central vacuum system shall serve not more than one suite.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to service rooms in all buildings except rooms located within a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to service rooms in all buildings except rooms located within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating requirements in this Subsection do not apply to the floor assembly immediately below a service room.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating requirements in this Subsection do not apply to the floor assembly immediately below a service room.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.10.3.(2) and Articles 9.10.10.5.and 9.10.10.6., service rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h when the floor area containing the service room is not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.10.3.(2) and Articles 9.10.10.5.and 9.10.10.6., service rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h when the floor area containing the service room is not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.10.3.(1) shall not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.10.3.(1) shall not apply.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.10.4.(2)and 9.10.10.4.(3) and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 hfire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.10.4.(2) and 9.10.10.4.(3) and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 6.2.1.5.(1), 9.33.5.2.(1)and 9.33.5.3.(1), fuel-fired space-heating appliances, space-cooling appliances, service water heaters and laundry appliances need not be separated from the remainder of the building as required in Sentence 9.10.10.4.(1), where the appliances serve not more than one room or suite, or a building with a building area of not more than 400 m2 and a building height of not more than 2 storeys, or where the appliances serve a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and are located in a service room where both sides of any wall assemblies and the underside of any floor-ceiling framing separating this room from both dwelling units or their common spaces are protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 6.2.1.5.(1) , 9.33.5.2.(1)and 9.33.5.3.(1), fuel-fired space-heating appliances, space-cooling appliances, service water heaters and laundry appliances need not be separated from the remainder of the building as required in Sentence 9.10.10.4.(1), where the appliances serve not more than one room or suite, or a building with a building area of not more than 400 m2 and a building height of not more than 2 storeys, or where the appliances serve a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and are located in a service room where both sides of any wall assemblies and the underside of any floor-ceiling framing separating this room from both dwelling units or their common spaces are protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 9.10.10.4.(1) does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence 9.10.10.4.(1) does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.

National Sentence Text: Service rooms containing incinerators shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Service rooms containing incinerators shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment

National Sentence Text: Every incinerator shall be connected to a chimneyflue conforming to the requirements in Section 9.21. and serving no other appliance.
P/T Sentence Text: Every incinerator shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to the requirements in part 9. and serving no other appliance.

National Sentence Text: An incinerator shall not be located in a room with other fuel-fired appliances.
P/T Sentence Text: An incinerator shall not be located in a room with other fuel-fired appliances.

National Sentence Text: Rooms for the temporary storage of combustible refuse in all occupancies or for public storage in residential occupancies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 hfire-resistance rating, except that a 45 minfire separation is permitted where the fire-resistance rating of the floor assembly is not required to exceed 45 min, or where such rooms are sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Rooms for the temporary storage of combustible refuse in all occupancies or for public storage in residential occupancies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating, except that a 45 min fire separation is permitted where the fire-resistance rating of the floor assembly is not required to exceed 45 min, or where such rooms are sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.11.2., a party wall on a property line shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.11.2., a party wall on a property line shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentence 9.10.11.2.(2), a party wall on a property line of a building of residential occupancy need not be constructed as a firewall, provided it is constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 1 hfire-resistance rating, where the party wall separates two dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, a dwelling unit and a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, or two houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentence 9.10.11.2.(2), a party wall on a property line of a building of residential occupancy need not be constructed as a firewall, provided it is constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating, where the party wall separates two dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, a dwelling unit and a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, or two houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.

National Sentence Text: Where a building of residential occupancy contains more than 2 houses, a party wall that separates any 2 adjacent houses with a secondary suite from the rest of the building shall be constructed as a firewall to create separate buildings each containing no more than 2 adjacent houses with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building of residential occupancy contains more than 2 houses, a party wall that separates any 2 adjacent houses with a secondary suite from the rest of the building shall be constructed as a firewall to create separate buildings each containing no more than 2 adjacent houses with a secondary suite.

National Sentence Text: The wall described in Sentence 9.10.11.2.(1) shall provide continuous protection from the top of the footings to the underside of the roof deck.
P/T Sentence Text: The wall described in Sentence 9.10.11.2.(1) shall provide continuous protection from the top of the footings to the underside of the roof deck.

National Sentence Text: Any space between the top of the wall described in Sentence 9.10.11.2.(1) and the roof deck shall be tightly filled with mineral wool or noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: Any space between the top of the wall described in Sentence 9.10.11.2.(1) and the roof deck shall be tightly filled with mineral wool or noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Where firewalls are used, the requirements in Part 3. shall apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where firewalls are used, the requirements in part 3. shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2) and in Articles 9.10.1.3.and 9.10.9.5., the portions of a floor area or mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft, shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly that terminates at the separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2) and in Articles 9.10.1.3. and 9.10.9.5., the portions of a floor area or mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft, shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly that terminates at the separation.

National Sentence Text: A mezzanine need not terminate at a vertical fire separation where the mezzanine is not required to be considered as a storey in Articles 9.10.4.1.and 9.10.4.2.
P/T Sentence Text: A mezzanine need not terminate at a vertical fire separation where the mezzanine is not required to be considered as a storey in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2.

National Sentence Text: Where a wall in a building is exposed to a fire hazard from an adjoining roof of a separate unsprinklered fire compartment in the same building, the roof shall contain no skylights within a horizontal distance of 5 m of the windows in the exposed wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a wall in a building is exposed to a fire hazard from an adjoining roof of a separate unsprinklered fire compartment in the same building, the roof shall contain no skylights within a horizontal distance of 5 m of the windows in the exposed wall.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.9.4.5., where exterior walls of a building meet at an external angle of 135° or less, the horizontal distance from an unprotected opening in one exterior wall to an unprotected opening in the other exterior wall shall be not less than 1.2 m, where these openings are in different fire compartments, or in different dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.9.4.5., where exterior walls of a building meet at an external angle of 135° or less, the horizontal distance from an unprotected opening in one exterior wall to an unprotected opening in the other exterior wall shall be not less than 1.2 m, where these openings are in different fire compartments, or in different dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.12.3.(3), the exterior wall of each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 9.10.12.3.(1) within the 1.2 m distance shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the interior vertical fire separation between the compartment and the remainder of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.12.3.(3), the exterior wall of each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 9.10.12.3.(1) within the 1.2 m distance shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the interior vertical fire separation between the compartment and the remainder of the building.

National Sentence Text: Where interior walls between dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite are not constructed as fire separations, the exterior wall of each dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space referred to in Sentence 9.10.12.3.(1) within the 1.2 m distance shall be finished on the interior with not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.
P/T Sentence Text: Where interior walls between dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite are not constructed as fire separations, the exterior wall of each dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space referred to in Sentence 9.10.12.3.(1) within the 1.2 m distance shall be finished on the interior with not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door. (See Note A-9.10.12.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.12.4.(4)and 9.10.12.4.(5), the construction described in Sentence 9.10.12.4.(1) shall have no unprotected openings and shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 9.10.12.4.(3), where the soffit encloses a common attic or roof space that spans more than 2 suites of residential occupancy and projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey and a fire separation is required at the floor between the two, or the floor separates dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite, or a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey, and the projection is continuous across a vertical fire separation separating two suites, or a wall separating dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.12.4.(4) and 9.10.12.4.(5), the construction described in Sentence 9.10.12.4.(1) shall have no unprotected openings and shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 9.10.12.4.(3), where the soffit encloses a common attic or roof space that spans more than 2 suites of residential occupancy and projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey and a fire separation is required at the floor between the two, or the floor separates dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite, or a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey, and the projection is continuous across a vertical fire separation separating two suites, or a wall separating dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite.

National Sentence Text: Protection required by Sentence 9.10.12.4.(2) shall be provided by noncombustible material having a minimum thickness of 0.38 mm and a melting point not below 650°C, not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Note A-9.10.12.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Protection required by Sentence 9.10.12.4.(2) shall be provided by noncombustible material having a minimum thickness of 0.38 mm and a melting point not below 650°C, not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber.

National Sentence Text: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence 9.10.12.4.(1) that is at the edge of an attic or roof space and completely separated from the remainder of that attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.12.4.(2) do not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence 9.10.12.4.(1) that is at the edge of an attic or roof space and completely separated from the remainder of that attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.12.4.(2) do not apply.

National Sentence Text: Where all suites spanned by a common attic or roof space or situated above or below the projecting floor are sprinklered, the requirements of Sentence 9.10.12.4.(2) do not apply, provided that all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exceptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Where all suites spanned by a common attic or roof space or situated above or below the projecting floor are sprinklered, the requirements of Sentence 9.10.12.4.(2) do not apply, provided that all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exceptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.

This Article applies to buildings that contain more than 2 suites of residential occupancy, are not less than 2 storeys in building height, have dwelling units located in whole or in part above other dwelling units, and are not sprinklered throughout.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): This Article applies to buildings that contain more than 2 suites of residential occupancy, are not less than 2 storeys in building height, have dwelling units located in whole or in part above other dwelling units, and are not sprinklered throughout.

P/T Sentence Text: The protection required by Sentences 9.10.12.5.(3) and 9.10.12.5.(4) shall be provided by cladding that conforms to part 9., part 9., or one of the methods described in Sentence 3.2.3.7.(4) or 3.2.3.7.(4).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The protection required by Sentences 9.10.12.5.(3) and 9.10.12.5.(4) shall be provided by cladding that conforms to Subsection 9.27.11., Section 9.28., or one of the methods described in Clause 3.2.3.7.(4)(c) or 3.2.3.7.(4)(d).

P/T Sentence Text: Balcony walls shall be protected by one of the methods mentioned in Sentence 9.10.12.5.(2) from the floor level of the balcony to the underside of the balcony or roof assembly above for the full width and depth of the balcony, and 1.2 m on either side of the balcony.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Balcony walls shall be protected by one of the methods mentioned in Sentence 9.10.12.5.(2) from the floor level of the balcony to the underside of the balcony or roof assembly above for the full width and depth of the balcony, and 1.2 m on either side of the balcony.

P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling and roof assemblies above balconies mentioned in Sentence 9.10.12.5.(3) shall be protected by one of the methods mentioned in Sentence 9.10.12.5.(2).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Ceiling and roof assemblies above balconies mentioned in Sentence 9.10.12.5.(3) shall be protected by one of the methods mentioned in Sentence 9.10.12.5.(2).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.13.2., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with a closure conforming to Table 9.10.13.1. and shall be installed in conformance with Chapters 2 to 14 of NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives unless otherwise specified herein. (See also Article 9.10.3.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.13.2., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with a closure conforming to Table 9.10.13.1. and shall be installed in conformance with Chapters 2 to 14 of NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives unless otherwise specified herein. (See also Article 9.10.3.1.)

National Sentence Text: A 45 mm thick solid core wood door is permitted to be used where a minimum fire-protection rating of 20 min is permitted or between a public corridor and a suite provided that the door conforms to ULC CAN/ULC-S113-16 Wood Core Doors Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104 for Twenty Minute Fire Rated Closure Assemblies (See Note A-9.10.13.2.(1).) (See Note A-9.10.13.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A 45 mm thick solid core wood door is permitted to be used where a minimum fire-protection rating of 20 min is permitted or between a public corridor and a suite provided that the door conforms to ULC CAN/ULC-S113-16 Wood Core Doors Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104 for Twenty Minute Fire Rated Closure Assemblies (See Note A-9.10.13.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Doors described in Sentence 9.10.13.2.(1) shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors described in Sentence 9.10.13.2.(1) shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.

National Sentence Text: Doors required to provide a 20 minfire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of not less than 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of not less than 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.

National Sentence Text: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to Subsection 9.9.6. in addition to this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to part 9. in addition to this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Wired glass conforming to Article 9.6.1.2. which has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a vertical fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h provided such glass is not less than 6 mm thick and is mounted in conformance with Sentence 9.10.13.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass conforming to Article 9.6.1.2. which has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a vertical fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h provided such glass is not less than 6 mm thick and is mounted in conformance with Sentence 9.10.13.5.(2).

National Sentence Text: Wired glass described in Sentence 9.10.13.5.(1) shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass described in Sentence 9.10.13.5.(1) shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.

National Sentence Text: Individual panes of glass described in Sentence 9.10.13.5.(1) shall not exceed 0.8 m2 in area or 1.4 m in height or width, and the area of glass not structurally supported by mullions shall not exceed 7.5 m2.
P/T Sentence Text: Individual panes of glass described in Sentence 9.10.13.5.(1) shall not exceed 0.8 m2 in area or 1.4 m in height or width, and the area of glass not structurally supported by mullions shall not exceed 7.5 m2.

National Sentence Text: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S105-16 Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104
P/T Sentence Text: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S105-16 Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104

National Sentence Text: Glass block that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h. (See Article 9.20.9.6.) (See Article 9.20.9.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Glass block that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h. (See Article 9.20.9.6.)

National Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 11 m2, with no dimension greater than 3.7 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 11 m2, with no dimension greater than 3.7 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 m2, with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 m2 , with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Every swing type door in a fire separation shall be equipped with a latch.
P/T Sentence Text: Every swing type door in a fire separation shall be equipped with a latch.

National Sentence Text: Except as described in Sentence 9.10.13.10.(2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as described in Sentence 9.10.13.10.(2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.

National Sentence Text: Self-closing doors are not required between public corridors and suites in business and personal services occupancies, except in dead-end corridors.
P/T Sentence Text: Self-closing doors are not required between public corridors and suites in business and personal services occupancies, except in dead-end corridors.

National Sentence Text: Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with Article 3.1.8.14.
P/T Sentence Text: Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with Article 3.1.8.14.

National Sentence Text: Swing-type doors shall open into service rooms containing fuel-fired equipment where such doors lead to public corridors or rooms used for assembly but shall swing outward from such rooms in all other cases.
P/T Sentence Text: Swing-type doors shall open into service rooms containing fuel-fired equipment where such doors lead to public corridors or rooms used for assembly but shall swing outward from such rooms in all other cases.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.10.13.13.(2)to 9.10.13.13.(5) and Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4), a duct that penetrates an assembly required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating shall be equipped with a fire damper in conformance with Articles 3.1.8.4.and 3.1.8.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.10.13.13.(2) to 9.10.13.13.(5) and Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4), a duct that penetrates an assembly required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating shall be equipped with a fire damper in conformance with Articles 3.1.8.4.and 3.1.8.10.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation provided the duct has a melting point not below 760°C, has a cross-sectional area less than 130 cm2, and supplies only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air at not more than 1.2 m above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation provided the duct has a melting point not below 760°C, has a cross-sectional area less than 130 cm2 , and supplies only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air at not more than 1.2 m above the floor.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation around an exhaust duct riser in which the airflow is upward provided the melting point of the branch duct is not below 760°C, the branch duct is carried up inside the riser not less than 500 mm, and the exhaust duct is under negative pressure as described in Article 9.10.9.18.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation around an exhaust duct riser in which the airflow is upward provided the melting point of the branch duct is not below 760°C, the branch duct is carried up inside the riser not less than 500 mm, and the exhaust duct is under negative pressure as described in Article 9.10.9.18.

National Sentence Text: Noncombustible ducts that penetrate a fire separation separating a vertical service space from the remainder of the building need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation provided the ducts have a melting point above 760°C, and each individual duct exhausts directly to the outside at the top of the vertical service space.
P/T Sentence Text: Noncombustible ducts that penetrate a fire separation separating a vertical service space from the remainder of the building need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation provided the ducts have a melting point above 760°C, and each individual duct exhausts directly to the outside at the top of the vertical service space.

National Sentence Text: A duct serving commercial cooking equipment and piercing a required fire separation need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation. (See also Article 6.3.1.7.)
P/T Sentence Text: A duct serving commercial cooking equipment and piercing a required fire separation need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation. (See also Article 6.3.1.7.)

National Sentence Text: Fire stop flaps in ceiling membranes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S112.2-07 Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies and activate at a temperature approximately 30°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the ducts, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire stop flaps in ceiling membranes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S112.2-07 Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies and activate at a temperature approximately 30°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the ducts, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.

National Sentence Text: A door between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall be tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes and shall be fitted with a self-closing device.
P/T Sentence Text: A door between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall be tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes and shall be fitted with a self-closing device.

National Sentence Text: A doorway between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall not be located in a room intended for sleeping.
P/T Sentence Text: A doorway between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall not be located in a room intended for sleeping.

National Sentence Text: Where a door is installed so that it may damage the integrity of a fire separation if its swing is unrestricted, door stops shall be installed to prevent such damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a door is installed so that it may damage the integrity of a fire separation if its swing is unrestricted, door stops shall be installed to prevent such damage.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to buildings other than those to which Subsection 9.10.15. applies.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to buildings other than those to which part 9. applies.

National Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4.-A to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4.-A to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.5.-A to determine the required type of construction, cladding and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured, and the value for the maximum area of unprotected openings (see second column of Table 9.10.14.5.-A) shall be determined using the limiting distance measured from the location described in Clause 9.10.14.2.(3)(a). (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.5.-A to determine the required type of construction, cladding and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured, and the value for the maximum area of unprotected openings (see second column of Table 9.10.14.5.-A) shall be determined using the limiting distance measured from the location described in Sentence 9.10.14.2.(3). (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Except for the purpose of applying Sentences 9.10.14.4.(2), 9.10.14.4.(3), 9.10.14.4.(8)and 9.10.14.4.(9), and Sentences 9.10.14.5.(3), 9.10.14.5.(8)and 9.10.14.5.(13), a limiting distance equal to half the actual limiting distance shall be used as input to the requirements of this Subsection, where the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the first fire department vehicle arrives at the building exceeds 10 min in 10% or more of all calls to the building, and any storey in the building is not sprinklered. (See Notes A-3.2.3.and A-3.2.3.1.(8).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except for the purpose of applying Sentences 9.10.14.4.(2), 9.10.14.4.(3), 9.10.14.4.(8) and 9.10.14.4.(9), and Sentences 9.10.14.5.(3), 9.10.14.5.(8) and 9.10.14.5.(13), a limiting distance equal to half the actual limiting distance shall be used as input to the requirements of this Subsection, where the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the first fire department vehicle arrives at the building exceeds 10 min in 10% or more of all calls to the building, and any storey in the building is not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the purpose of applying Sentences 9.10.14.4.(2) , 9.10.14.4.(3), 9.10.14.4.(8)and 9.10.14.4.(9), and Sentences 9.10.14.5.(3) , 9.10.14.5.(8) and 9.10.14.5.(13), a limiting distance equal to half the actual limiting distance shall be used as input to the requirements of this Subsection, where the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the first fire department vehicle capable of beginning suppression activities arrives at the building exceeds 10 min in 10% or more of all calls to the building, and any storey in the building is not sprinklered.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except for the purpose of applying Sentences 9.10.14.4.(2), 9.10.14.4.(3), 9.10.14.4.(8) and 9.10.14.4.(9), and Sentences 9.10.14.5.(3), 9.10.14.5.(8) and 9.10.14.5.(13), a limiting distance equal to half the actual limiting distance shall be used as input to the requirements of this Subsection, where the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the first fire department vehicle capable of beginning suppression activities arrives at the building exceeds 10 min in 10% or more of all calls to the building, and any storey in the building is not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.4.(6)to 9.10.14.4.(10), the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall conform to Table 9.10.14.4.-A, conform to Subsection 3.2.3., or where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than the limiting distance squared, for residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies and low-hazard industrial occupancies, and half the limiting distance squared, for mercantile occupancies and medium-hazard industrial occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.4.(6) to 9.10.14.4.(10), the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall conform to Table 9.10.14.4.-A, conform to part 3., or where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than the limiting distance squared, for residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies and low-hazard industrial occupancies, and half the limiting distance squared, for mercantile occupancies and medium-hazard industrial occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall. (See Table 9.10.13.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall. (See Table 9.10.13.1.)

National Sentence Text: Except for buildings that are sprinklered and for openable windows having an unobstructed opening equal to 0.35 m2 installed in accordance with Sentences 9.9.10.1.(1)and 9.9.10.1.(2), where the limiting distance is 2 m or less, individual unprotected openings shall be no greater than the area stated in Table 9.10.14.4.-B, or where the limiting distance is equal to or greater than 1.2 m, the area calculated by Area=0.242×LD-1.2 2whereArea= area of the unprotected opening, and LD= limiting distance.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for buildings that are sprinklered and for openable windows having an unobstructed opening equal to 0.35 m2 installed in accordance with Sentences 9.9.10.1.(1) and 9.9.10.1.(2), where the limiting distance is 2 m or less, individual unprotected openings shall be no greater than the area stated in Table 9.10.14.4.-B, or where the limiting distance is equal to or greater than 1.2 m, the area calculated by Area=0.242×LD-1.2 2whereArea= area of the unprotected opening, and LD= limiting distance.

National Sentence Text: The spacing between individual unprotected openings described in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(3) that serve a single room or space described in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(5) shall be not less than 2 m horizontally of another unprotected opening that is on the same exposing building face and serves the single room or space, or 2 m vertically of another unprotected opening that serves the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.
P/T Sentence Text: The spacing between individual unprotected openings described in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(3) that serve a single room or space described in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(5) shall be not less than 2 m horizontally of another unprotected opening that is on the same exposing building face and serves the single room or space, or 2 m vertically of another unprotected opening that serves the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of Sentence 9.10.14.4.(4), "single room or space" shall mean two or more adjacent spaces having a full-height separating wall extending less than 1.5 m from the interior face of the exterior wall, or two or more stacked spaces that are on the same storey.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of Sentence 9.10.14.4.(4), "single room or space" shall mean two or more adjacent spaces having a full-height separating wall extending less than 1.5 m from the interior face of the exterior wall, or two or more stacked spaces that are on the same storey.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the unprotected openings are glazed with wired glass in steel frames, as described in Article 9.10.13.5., or glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the unprotected openings are glazed with wired glass in steel frames, as described in Article 9.10.13.5., or glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.

National Sentence Text: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is at the same level as the street need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is at the same level as the street need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(11), for garages or accessory buildings that serve a single dwelling unit only and are detached from any building, the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings shall comply with the requirements for unprotected openings.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(11), for garages or accessory buildings that serve a single dwelling unit only and are detached from any building, the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings shall comply with the requirements for unprotected openings.

National Sentence Text: The limits on the area of glazed openings stated in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(10) need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): The limits on the area of glazed openings stated in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(10) need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
P/T Sentence Text: The limits on the area of glazed openings stated in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(10) need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unitor a house with a secondary suite, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The limits on the area of glazed openings stated in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(10) need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.14.5.(3)to 9.10.14.5.(14), each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Table 9.10.14.5.-A. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(1).) (See also Subsection 9.10.8.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.14.5.(3) to 9.10.14.5.(14), each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Table 9.10.14.5.-A. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(1).) (See also part 9.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.5.(3)to 9.10.14.5.(8), cladding on exposing building faces and exterior walls located above exposing building faces that enclose an attic or roof space, for buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 10% of the exposing building face, need not be noncombustible where the wall assembly complies with the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.5.(1)(b) when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S134-13 Fire Test of Exterior Wall Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.5.(3) to 9.10.14.5.(8), cladding on exposing building faces and exterior walls located above exposing building faces that enclose an attic or roof space, for buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 10% of the exposing building face, need not be noncombustible where the wall assembly complies with the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.5.(1) when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S134-13 Fire Test of Exterior Wall Assemblies

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.5.(4)to 9.10.14.5.(8) and permitted by Sentence 9.10.14.5.(9), cladding on exposing building faces and on exterior walls located above exposing building faces of buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 25% but not more than 50% of the exposing building face need not be noncombustible, where the limiting distance is greater than 5.0 m, the limiting distance is greater than 2.5 m where the area and width-to-height ratio of the exposing building face conform to Table 9.10.14.5.-B, the building or fire compartment is sprinklered, the cladding conforms to Subsections 9.27.6., 9.27.7., 9.27.8.or 9.27.9., is installed without furring members, or on furring not more than 25 mm thick, over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, and after conditioning in conformance with ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), or the cladding conforms to Subsection 9.27.12., is installed with or without furring members over a gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and does not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.5.(4) to 9.10.14.5.(8) and permitted by Sentence 9.10.14.5.(9), cladding on exposing building faces and on exterior walls located above exposing building faces of buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 25% but not more than 50% of the exposing building face need not be noncombustible, where the limiting distance is greater than 5.0 m, the limiting distance is greater than 2.5 m where the area and width-to-height ratio of the exposing building face conform to Table 9.10.14.5.-B, the building or fire compartment is sprinklered, the cladding conforms to Subsections 9. , 9., 9.or 9., is installed without furring members, or on furring not more than 25 mm thick, over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, and after conditioning in conformance with ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), or the cladding conforms to part 9., is installed with or without furring members over a gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and does not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(5), where a garage or accessory building serves one dwelling unit only and is detached from any building, the exposing building face need not conform to the minimum required fire-resistance rating stated in Table 9.10.14.5.-A, where the limiting distance is 0.6 m or more, shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, and need not conform to the type of cladding required by Table 9.10.14.5.-A, regardless of the limiting distance.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(5), where a garage or accessory building serves one dwelling unit only and is detached from any building, the exposing building face need not conform to the minimum required fire-resistance rating stated in Table 9.10.14.5.-A, where the limiting distance is 0.6 m or more, shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, and need not conform to the type of cladding required by Table 9.10.14.5.-A, regardless of the limiting distance.

National Sentence Text: The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating, type of construction and type of cladding need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(7), combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 m above ground level and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.

National Sentence Text: Where combustible projections on an exposing building face are permitted by Sentence 9.10.14.5.(7), are totally enclosed and constructed with solid faces, such as for fireplaces and chimneys, and extend within 1.2 m of a property line, the construction of the face and sides of the projection shall comply with the corresponding requirements for exposing building faces for limiting distances less than 1.2 m as stated in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(2)or 9.10.14.5.(3), and where the underside of the projection is more than 0.6 m above finished ground level, it shall be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick noncombustible material, unvented aluminum conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(8).)
