National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(11), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(11), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(11), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(11), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a street, lane or public thoroughfare. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(11) and 9.10.15.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: The face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a street, lane or public thoroughfare. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(11).)

National Sentence Text: Where roof soffits project to less than 1.2 m from the property line, the centre line of a lane or public thoroughfare, or an imaginary line between two buildings or fire compartments on the same property, they shall have no openings, and be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick sheet steel, unvented aluminum conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where roof soffits project to less than 1.2 m from the property line, the centre line of a lane or public thoroughfare, or an imaginary line between two buildings or fire compartments on the same property, they shall have no openings, and be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick sheet steel, unvented aluminum conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber.

National Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence 9.10.14.5.(1), provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence 9.10.14.5.(1), provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing wall components need not have a minimum fire-resistance rating, where the building is 1 storey in building height, is of noncombustible construction, is classified as a low-hazard industrial occupancy and used only for low fire loadoccupancies, such as power-generating plants or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and has a limiting distance of 3 m or more.
P/T Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing wall components need not have a minimum fire-resistance rating, where the building is 1 storey in building height, is of noncombustible construction, is classified as a low-hazard industrial occupancy and used only for low fire load occupancies, such as power-generating plants or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and has a limiting distance of 3 m or more.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to buildings that contain only dwelling units and have no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, and houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces. (See Note A-9.10.15.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to buildings that contain only dwelling units and have no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, and houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.

National Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min, or except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.2.(2), where Table 9.10.15.4. is used to determine the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings, the area of any number of individual vertical portions of the wall measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling. (See Note A-9.10.15.4.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Where the exposing building face of any section of an exterior wall enclosing a single room or space, or combination room and space, has a limiting distance of 2 m or less, that section of the exposing building face serving the room or space shall not be divided into portions for the purpose of calculating area of exposing building face. (See Sentence 9.10.15.4.(5) and Note A-9.10.15.4.(2).)

(See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

(See Article 9.10.15.5. and Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. National Sentence Text: The spacing between individual glazed openings described in Sentence 9.10.15.4.(3) serving a single room or space described in Sentence 9.10.15.4.(5) shall be not less than 2 m horizontally of another glazed opening that is on the same exposing building face and serves the single room or space, or 2 m vertically of another glazed opening that serves the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of Sentence 9.10.15.4.(4), "single room or space" shall mean two or more adjacent spaces having a full-height separating wall extending less than 1.5 m from the interior face of the exterior wall, or two or more stacked spaces that are on the same storey.

National Sentence Text: The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating and type of cladding-sheathing assembly shall not apply to the exposing building face or projections from an exposing building face of a dwelling unit facing a detached garage or accessory building, or a garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

P/T Sentence Text: The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating and type of cladding-sheathing assembly shall not apply to the exposing building face or projections from an exposing building face of a dwelling unit facing a detached garage or accessory building, or a garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating and type of cladding-sheathing assembly shall not apply to the exposing building face or projections from an exposing building face of a dwelling unit facing a detached garage or accessory building, or a garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.5.(6), combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 m above ground level and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.5.(6), combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 m above ground level and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.15.5.(8)to 9.10.15.5.(11), Sentence 9.10.15.5.(5) shall not apply to buildings containing 1 or 2 dwelling units only, and detached garages or accessory buildings, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(7).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.15.5.(8) to 9.10.15.5.(11), Sentence 9.10.15.5.(5) shall not apply to buildings containing 1 or 2 dwelling units only, and detached garages or accessory buildings, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.15.5.(8) to 9.10.15.5.(11), Sentence 9.10.15.5.(5) shall not apply to buildings containing 1 or 2 dwelling units only, and detached garages or accessory buildings, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.15.5.(8) to 9.10.15.5.(11), Sentence 9.10.15.5.(5) shall not apply to buildings containing 1 or 2 dwelling units only, and detached garages or accessory buildings, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(7).)

National Sentence Text: Where combustible projections on an exposing building face are permitted by Sentence 9.10.15.5.(6), are totally enclosed and constructed with solid faces, such as for fireplaces and chimneys, and extend within 1.2 m of a property line, the construction of the face and sides of the projection shall comply with the corresponding requirements for exposing building faces for limiting distances less than 1.2 m as stated in Sentence 9.10.15.5.(2)or 9.10.15.5.(3), and where the underside of the projection is more than 0.6 m above finished ground level, it shall be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick noncombustible material, unvented aluminum conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where combustible projections on an exposing building face are permitted by Sentence 9.10.15.5.(6), are totally enclosed and constructed with solid faces, such as for fireplaces and chimneys, and extend within 1.2 m of a property line, the construction of the face and sides of the projection shall comply with the corresponding requirements for exposing building faces for limiting distances less than 1.2 m as stated in Sentence 9.10.15.5.(2)or 9.10.15.5.(3), and where the underside of the projection is more than 0.6 m above finished ground level, it shall be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick noncombustible material, unvented aluminum conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.5.(10), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.5.(10), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.5.(10), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.5.(10), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a street, lane or public thoroughfare. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(11) and 9.10.15.5.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: The face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a street, lane or public thoroughfare. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(11).)

National Sentence Text: Where roof soffits project to less than 1.2 m from the property line, the centre line of a lane or public thoroughfare, or an imaginary line between two buildings or fire compartments on the same property, they shall have no openings, and be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick sheet steel, unvented aluminum conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Note A-3.2.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where roof soffits project to less than 1.2 m from the property line, the centre line of a lane or public thoroughfare, or an imaginary line between two buildings or fire compartments on the same property, they shall have no openings, and be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick sheet steel, unvented aluminum conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber.

National Sentence Text: For buildings of combustible construction, materials installed to provide the required protection for soffits may be covered with a combustible or noncombustible finish material.
P/T Sentence Text: For buildings of combustible construction, materials installed to provide the required protection for soffits may be covered with a combustible or noncombustible finish material.

National Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence 9.10.15.5.(1), provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence 9.10.15.5.(1), provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: Vertical concealed spaces in interior walls and exterior walls shall be separated by fire blocks one from the other, and from horizontal concealed spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical concealed spaces in interior walls and exterior walls shall be separated by fire blocks one from the other, and from horizontal concealed spaces.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal concealed spaces in attics, roof spaces, ceilings, floors, and crawl spaces shall be separated by fire blocks one from the other, and from vertical concealed spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal concealed spaces in attics, roof spaces, ceilings, floors, and crawl spaces shall be separated by fire blocks one from the other, and from vertical concealed spaces.

National Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at all interconnections between concealed vertical and horizontal spaces in interior coved ceilings, drop ceilings and soffits where the exposed construction materials within the concealed spaces have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at all interconnections between concealed vertical and horizontal spaces in interior coved ceilings, drop ceilings and soffits where the exposed construction materials within the concealed spaces have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.

National Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at the top and bottom of each run of stairs where they pass through a floor containing concealed space in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at the top and bottom of each run of stairs where they pass through a floor containing concealed space in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.

National Sentence Text: Unsprinklered concealed spaces of combustible construction created by a ceiling, roof space or unoccupied attic space shall be separated by fire blocks into compartments not more than 60 m in greatest dimension, and where such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25, not more than 300 m2 in area.
P/T Sentence Text: Unsprinklered concealed spaces of combustible construction created by a ceiling, roof space or unoccupied attic space shall be separated by fire blocks into compartments not more than 60 m in greatest dimension, and where such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25, not more than 300 m2 in area.

National Sentence Text: No dimension of the concealed space described in Clause 9.10.16.1.(5)(b) shall exceed 20 m.
P/T Sentence Text: No dimension of the concealed space described in Sentence 9.10.16.1.(5) shall exceed 20 m.

National Sentence Text: Concealed spaces in mansard or gambrel style roofs, exterior cornices, balconies and canopies of combustible construction in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating exceeding 25 shall have vertical fire blocks at intervals of not more than 20 m and at points where such concealed spaces extend across the ends of required vertical fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Concealed spaces in mansard or gambrel style roofs, exterior cornices, balconies and canopies of combustible construction in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating exceeding 25 shall have vertical fire blocks at intervals of not more than 20 m and at points where such concealed spaces extend across the ends of required vertical fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.16.2.(2), fire blocks shall be provided to block off concealed spaces within wall assemblies, including spaces created by furring, at each floor level, at each ceiling level where the ceiling contributes to part of the required fire-resistance rating, and at other locations within the wall, so that the distance between fire blocks does not exceed 20 m horizontally and 3 m vertically.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.16.2.(2), fire blocks shall be provided to block off concealed spaces within wall assemblies, including spaces created by furring, at each floor level, at each ceiling level where the ceiling contributes to part of the required fire-resistance rating, and at other locations within the wall, so that the distance between fire blocks does not exceed 20 m horizontally and 3 m vertically.

National Sentence Text: Fire blocks described in Sentence 9.10.16.2.(1) are not required, provided the insulated wall assembly contains not more than one concealed air space whose horizontal thickness is not more than 25 mm, the exposed construction materials within the space are noncombustible, the exposed construction materials within the space, including insulation, but not including wiring, piping or similar services, have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25, or the concealed wall space is filled with insulation.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks described in Sentence 9.10.16.2.(1) are not required, provided the insulated wall assembly contains not more than one concealed air space whose horizontal thickness is not more than 25 mm, the exposed construction materials within the space are noncombustible, the exposed construction materials within the space, including insulation, but not including wiring, piping or similar services, have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25, or the concealed wall space is filled with insulation.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.10.16.3.(2)and 9.10.16.3.(3), fire blocks shall be constructed of materials that will remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.10.16.3.(2) and 9.10.16.3.(3), fire blocks shall be constructed of materials that will remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials

National Sentence Text: Fire blocks are deemed to comply with Sentence 9.10.16.3.(1) if they are constructed of not less than 0.38 mm sheet steel, 12.7 mm gypsum board, 12.5 mm plywood, OSB or waferboard, with joints having continuous supports, 2 layers of 19 mm lumber with joints staggered, or 38 mm lumber.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks are deemed to comply with Sentence 9.10.16.3.(1) if they are constructed of not less than 0.38 mm sheet steel, 12.7 mm gypsum board, 12.5 mm plywood, OSB or waferboard, with joints having continuous supports, 2 layers of 19 mm lumber with joints staggered, or 38 mm lumber.

National Sentence Text: In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, semi-rigid fibre insulation board produced from glass, rock or slag is permitted to be used to block the vertical space in a double-frame wall assembly formed at the intersection of the floor assembly and the walls, provided the width of the vertical space does not exceed 25 mm and the insulation board has a density not less than 45 kg/m3, is securely fastened to one set of studs, extends from below the bottom of the top plates in the lower storey to above the top of the bottom plate in the upper storey, and completely fills the portion of the vertical space between the headers and between the wall plates. (See Note A-3.1.11.7.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, semi-rigid fibre insulation board produced from glass, rock or slag is permitted to be used to block the vertical space in a double-frame wall assembly formed at the intersection of the floor assembly and the walls, provided the width of the vertical space does not exceed 25 mm and the insulation board has a density not less than 45 kg/m3 , is securely fastened to one set of studs, extends from below the bottom of the top plates in the lower storey to above the top of the bottom plate in the upper storey, and completely fills the portion of the vertical space between the headers and between the wall plates.

National Sentence Text: Where fire blocks are pierced by pipes, ducts or other elements, the effectiveness of the fire blocks shall be maintained around such elements.
P/T Sentence Text: Where fire blocks are pierced by pipes, ducts or other elements, the effectiveness of the fire blocks shall be maintained around such elements.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the exposed surface of every interior wall and ceiling, including skylights and glazing, shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 150.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the exposed surface of every interior wall and ceiling, including skylights and glazing, shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 150.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.17.1.(3), doors need not conform to Sentence 9.10.17.1.(1) provided they have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.17.1.(3), doors need not conform to Sentence 9.10.17.1.(1) provided they have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.

National Sentence Text: Doors within dwelling units, other than garage doors, need not conform to Sentences 9.10.17.1.(1)and 9.10.17.1.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Doors within dwelling units, other than garage doors, need not conform to Sentences 9.10.17.1.(1) and 9.10.17.1.(2).

National Sentence Text: At least 90% of the exposed surface of every ceiling in an exit or unsprinklered ceiling in a public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: At least 90% of the exposed surface of every ceiling in an exit or unsprinklered ceiling in a public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.17.3.(2), at least 90% of the exposed surfaces of every wall in an exit shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.17.3.(2), at least 90% of the exposed surfaces of every wall in an exit shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)

National Sentence Text: At least 75% of the wall surface of a lobby used as an exit in Article 9.9.8.5. shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: At least 75% of the wall surface of a lobby used as an exit in Article 9.9.8.5. shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)

National Sentence Text: Where an exterior exit passageway provides the only means of egress from the rooms or suites it serves, the wall and ceiling finishes of that passageway, including the soffit beneath and the guard on the passageway, shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25, except that up to 10% of the total wall area and 10% of the total ceiling area is permitted to have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 150.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exterior exit passageway provides the only means of egress from the rooms or suites it serves, the wall and ceiling finishes of that passageway, including the soffit beneath and the guard on the passageway, shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25, except that up to 10% of the total wall area and 10% of the total ceiling area is permitted to have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 150.

National Sentence Text: At least 90% of the total wall surface in any unsprinklered public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, or at least 90% of the upper half of such walls shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: At least 90% of the total wall surface in any unsprinklered public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, or at least 90% of the upper half of such walls shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)

National Sentence Text: Skylights, glazing, combustible doors, and combustible light diffusers and lenses shall not be considered in the calculation of wall and ceiling areas in this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Skylights, glazing, combustible doors, and combustible light diffusers and lenses shall not be considered in the calculation of wall and ceiling areas in this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Where a public corridor or a corridor used by the public contains an occupancy, the interior finish materials used on the walls or ceiling of such occupancy, shall have a surface flame-spread rating in conformance with that required for public corridors.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a public corridor or a corridor used by the public contains an occupancy, the interior finish materials used on the walls or ceiling of such occupancy, shall have a surface flame-spread rating in conformance with that required for public corridors.

National Sentence Text: Light diffusers and lenses having flame-spread ratings that exceed those permitted for the ceiling finish, shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Light diffusers and lenses having flame-spread ratings that exceed those permitted for the ceiling finish, shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.4.(1).

National Sentence Text: Individual combustible skylights in corridors required to be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations shall not exceed 1 m2 in area and shall be spaced not less than 1.2 m apart. (See Note A-3.1.4.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Individual combustible skylights in corridors required to be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations shall not exceed 1 m2 in area and shall be spaced not less than 1.2 m apart.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.17.10.(2)and 9.10.17.10.(3), foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly shall be protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, wall assemblies and ceiling assemblies by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections 9.29.4.to 9.29.9., provided the building does not contain a Group C major occupancy, by sheet metal that is mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, is not less than 0.38 mm thick, and has a melting point not less than 650°C, or by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.15.(2). (See Note A-3.1.4.2.(1)(c).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.17.10.(2) and 9.10.17.10.(3), foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly shall be protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, wall assemblies and ceiling assemblies by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections 9.to 9., provided the building does not contain a Group C major occupancy, by sheet metal that is mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, is not less than 0.38 mm thick, and has a melting point not less than 650°C, or by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.15.(2).

National Sentence Text: A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastics is permitted to be used, provided the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick having a melting point not less than 650°C, do not contain an air space, and have a flame-spread rating, determined by subjecting a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12., that is not more than that permitted for the room or space in which they are located or that they bound.
P/T Sentence Text: A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastics is permitted to be used, provided the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick having a melting point not less than 650°C, do not contain an air space, and have a flame-spread rating, determined by subjecting a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation to the applicable test described in part 3., that is not more than that permitted for the room or space in which they are located or that they bound.

National Sentence Text: Thermosetting foamed plastic insulation having a flame-spread rating of not more than 200 is permitted to be used in factory-assembled doors in storage garages serving single dwelling units provided that the insulation is covered on the interior with a metallic foil, the assembly has a flame-spread rating of not more than 200, and the assembly incorporates no air spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Thermosetting foamed plastic insulation having a flame-spread rating of not more than 200 is permitted to be used in factory-assembled doors in storage garages serving single dwelling units provided that the insulation is covered on the interior with a metallic foil, the assembly has a flame-spread rating of not more than 200, and the assembly incorporates no air spaces.

National Sentence Text: The interior finish of walls and ceilings in bathrooms within suites of residential occupancy shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.
P/T Sentence Text: The interior finish of walls and ceilings in bathrooms within suites of residential occupancy shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.

National Sentence Text: Where a covering or a lining is used with a duct, such lining or covering shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to Article 3.6.5.4. or Article 9.33.6.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a covering or a lining is used with a duct, such lining or covering shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to Article 3.6.5.4. or Article 9.33.6.4.

National Sentence Text: Where access is provided through a firewall, the requirements in this Subsection shall apply to the floor areas on both sides of the firewall as if they were in the same building.
P/T Sentence Text: Where access is provided through a firewall, the requirements in this Subsection shall apply to the floor areas on both sides of the firewall as if they were in the same building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.18.2.(3)and 9.10.18.2.(4), a fire alarm system shall be installed in buildings in which a sprinkler system is installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.18.2.(3) and 9.10.18.2.(4), a fire alarm system shall be installed in buildings in which a sprinkler system is installed.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.18.2.(5), a fire alarm system shall be installed in every building that contains more than 3 storeys, including storeys below the first storey, where the total occupant load exceeds 300, or when the occupant load for any major occupancy in Table 9.10.18.2. is exceeded.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.18.2.(5), a fire alarm system shall be installed in every building that contains more than 3 storeys, including storeys below the first storey, where the total occupant load exceeds 300, or when the occupant load for any major occupancy in Table 9.10.18.2. is exceeded.

National Sentence Text: In buildings in which a sprinkler system has been installed in accordance with NFPA 13D-2016 Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes a fire alarm system need not be installed.
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings in which a sprinkler system has been installed in accordance with NFPA 13D-2016 Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes a fire alarm system need not be installed.

National Sentence Text: In buildings that contain fewer than 9 sprinklers conforming to Sentence 3.2.5.12.(4), a fire alarm system need not be installed.
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings that contain fewer than 9 sprinklers conforming to Sentence 3.2.5.12.(4), a fire alarm system need not be installed.

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm system is not required in a residential occupancy where an exit or public corridor serves not more than 4 suites or where each suite has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire alarm system is not required in a residential occupancy where an exit or public corridor serves not more than 4 suites or where each suite has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level.

National Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentence 9.10.18.3.(2) and as required by this Subsection, where fire alarm, fire detection and smoke detection devices and systems are installed, these devices and systems and their installation shall conform to Subsection 3.2.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentence 9.10.18.3.(2) and as required by this Subsection, where fire alarm, fire detection and smoke detection devices and systems are installed, these devices and systems and their installation shall conform to part 3.

National Sentence Text: The following Articles in Subsection 3.2.4. regarding fire alarm systems do not apply to Part 9 buildings: Articles 3.2.4.1., 3.2.4.10., 3.2.4.11., 3.2.4.12., 3.2.4.13.and 3.2.4.22.
P/T Sentence Text: The following Articles in part 3. regarding fire alarm systems do not apply to part 9. buildings: Articles 3.2.4.1., 3.2.4.10. , 3.2.4.11. , 3.2.4.12. , 3.2.4.13.and 3.2.4.22.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire alarm system is required, every public corridor in buildings of residential occupancy and every exit stair shaft shall be provided with smoke detectors.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire alarm system is required, every public corridor in buildings of residential occupancy and every exit stair shaft shall be provided with smoke detectors.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.18.4.(3), if a fire alarm system is required in a building that is not sprinklered, fire detectors shall be installed in the following spaces: storage rooms not within dwelling units, service rooms not within dwelling units, janitors’ rooms rooms in which hazardous substances are to be used or stored (see Note A-3.3.1.2.(1)), elevator hoistways, chutes and dumbwaiter shafts, and laundry rooms in buildings of residential occupancy, but not those within dwelling units.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.18.4.(3), if a fire alarm system is required in a building that is not sprinklered, fire detectors shall be installed in the following spaces: storage rooms not within dwelling units, service rooms not within dwelling units, janitors’ rooms rooms in which hazardous substances are to be used or stored (see Note A-3.3.1.2.(1)), elevator hoistways, chutes and dumbwaiter shafts, and laundry rooms in buildings of residential occupancy, but not those within dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: Heat detectors and smoke detectors described in Sentence 9.10.18.4.(2) are not required in dwelling units or in sprinkleredbuildings in which the sprinkler system is electrically supervised and equipped with a water flow alarm.
P/T Sentence Text: Heat detectors and smoke detectors described in Sentence 9.10.18.4.(2) are not required in dwelling units or in sprinklered buildings in which the sprinkler system is electrically supervised and equipped with a water flow alarm.

National Sentence Text: Except for a recirculating air system serving not more than one dwelling unit, where a fire alarm system is required to be installed, every recirculating air-handling system shall be designed to prevent the circulation of smoke upon a signal from a duct-type smoke detector where such system supplies more than one suite on the same floor or serves more than 1 storey.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a recirculating air system serving not more than one dwelling unit, where a fire alarm system is required to be installed, every recirculating air-handling system shall be designed to prevent the circulation of smoke upon a signal from a duct-type smoke detector where such system supplies more than one suite on the same floor or serves more than 1 storey.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.18.6.(2), where a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h separates a portion of a building from the remainder of the building and there are no openings through the fire separation other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and conduit, the requirements for fire alarm and detection systems may be applied to each portion so separated as if it were a separate building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.18.6.(2), where a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h separates a portion of a building from the remainder of the building and there are no openings through the fire separation other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and conduit, the requirements for fire alarm and detection systems may be applied to each portion so separated as if it were a separate building.

National Sentence Text: The permission in Sentence 9.10.18.6.(1) to consider separated portions of a building as separate buildings does not apply to service rooms and storage rooms.
P/T Sentence Text: The permission in Sentence 9.10.18.6.(1) to consider separated portions of a building as separate buildings does not apply to service rooms and storage rooms.

National Sentence Text: Central vacuum cleaning systems serving more than one suite or storey in buildings equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon activation of the fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: Central vacuum cleaning systems serving more than one suite or storey in buildings equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon activation of the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm system is not required in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.90. provided there are no other occupancies in the building.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire alarm system is not required in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.90. provided there are no other occupancies in the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 9.10.19.8., smoke alarms conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S531-14 Smoke Alarms shall be installed in each dwelling unit, each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit, and ancillary spaces and common spaces not in dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 9.10.19.8., smoke alarms conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S531-14 Smoke Alarms shall be installed in each dwelling unit, each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit, and ancillary spaces and common spaces not in dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite.

National Sentence Text: The sound patterns of smoke alarms shall meet the temporal patterns of alarm signals (see Note A-3.2.4.18.(2)), or be a combination of temporal pattern and voice relay.
P/T Sentence Text: The sound patterns of smoke alarms shall meet the temporal patterns of alarm signals (see Note A-3.2.4.18.(2)), or be a combination of temporal pattern and voice relay.

National Sentence Text: Within dwelling units, sufficient smoke alarms shall be installed so that there is at least one smoke alarm installed on each storey, including basements, and on any storey of a dwelling unit containing sleeping rooms, a smoke alarm is installed in each sleeping room, and in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the storey, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a hallway, the smoke alarm shall be located in the hallway. (See Note A-9.10.19.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Within dwelling units, sufficient smoke alarms shall be installed so that there is at least one smoke alarm installed on each storey, including basements, and on any storey of a dwelling unit containing sleeping rooms, a smoke alarm is installed in each sleeping room, and in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the storey, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a hallway, the smoke alarm shall be located in the hallway.

National Sentence Text: A smoke alarm required by Sentence 9.10.19.3.(1) shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S553-14 Installation of Smoke Alarms
P/T Sentence Text: A smoke alarm required by Sentence 9.10.19.3.(1) shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S553-14 Installation of Smoke Alarms

National Sentence Text: Smoke alarms required in Article 9.10.19.1. and Sentence 9.10.19.3.(1) shall be installed on or near the ceiling.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke alarms required in Article 9.10.19.1. and Sentence 9.10.19.3.(1) shall be installed on or near the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.19.4.(2)and 9.10.19.4.(3), smoke alarms described in Sentence 9.10.19.1.(1) shall be installed with permanent connections to an electrical circuit (see Note A-3.2.4.20.(7)(a)), have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the smoke alarm, and in case the regular power supply to the smoke alarm is interrupted, be provided with a battery as an alternative power source that can continue to provide power to the smoke alarm for a period of no less than 7 days in the normal condition, followed by 4 minutes of alarm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.19.4.(2) and 9.10.19.4.(3), smoke alarms described in Sentence 9.10.19.1.(1) shall be installed with permanent connections to an electrical circuit (see Note A-3.2.4.20.(7)(a)), have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the smoke alarm, and in case the regular power supply to the smoke alarm is interrupted, be provided with a battery as an alternative power source that can continue to provide power to the smoke alarm for a period of no less than 7 days in the normal condition, followed by 4 minutes of alarm.

National Sentence Text: Where the building is not supplied with electrical power, smoke alarms are permitted to be battery-operated.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is not supplied with electrical power, smoke alarms are permitted to be battery-operated.

National Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual suites, except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(4), are installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems and form part of the fire alarm system. (See Note A-3.2.4.20.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual suites, except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(4), are installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems and form part of the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors permitted to be installed in lieu of smoke alarms as stated in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(3) are permitted to sound localized alarms within individual suites, and need not sound an alarm throughout the rest of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors permitted to be installed in lieu of smoke alarms as stated in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(3) are permitted to sound localized alarms within individual suites, and need not sound an alarm throughout the rest of the building.

National Sentence Text: Where more than one smoke alarm is required in a dwelling unit, the smoke alarms shall be wired so that the activation of one alarm will cause all alarms within the dwelling unit to sound.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Where more than one smoke alarm is required in a dwelling unit, the smoke alarms shall be wired so that the activation of one alarm will cause all alarms within the dwelling unit to sound.
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one smoke alarm is required in a dwelling unit, the smoke alarms shall be interconnected so that the activation of one alarm will cause all alarms within the dwelling unit to sound.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where more than one smoke alarm is required in a dwelling unit, the smoke alarms shall be interconnected so that the activation of one alarm will cause all alarms within the dwelling unit to sound.

National Sentence Text: Smoke alarms in a house with a secondary suite shall be wirelessly interconnected or interconnected by hard-wiring so that the activation of any one smoke alarm causes all smoke alarms within the house with a secondary suite to sound. (See Note A-9.10.19.5.(2).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Smoke alarms in a house with a secondary suite shall be wirelessly interconnected or interconnected by hard-wiring so that the activation of any one smoke alarm causes all smoke alarms within the house with a secondary suite to sound. (See Note A-9.10.19.5.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke alarms in a house with a secondary suite shall be interconnected so that the activation of any one smoke alarm causes all smoke alarms within the house with a secondary suite to sound. (See Note A-9.10.19.5.(2).)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Smoke alarms in a house with a secondary suite shall be interconnected so that the activation of any one smoke alarm causes all smoke alarms within the house with a secondary suite to sound. (See Note A-9.10.19.5.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.6.(2), a manually operated device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a dwelling unit so that the signal emitted by the smoke alarm can be silenced for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and sound again if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to re-actuate it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.6.(2), a manually operated device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a dwelling unit so that the signal emitted by the smoke alarm can be silenced for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and sound again if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to re-actuate it.

National Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy equipped with smoke detectors installed to ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems which are part of the fire alarm system in lieu of smoke alarms as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(3), need not incorporate the manually operated device required in Sentence 9.10.19.6.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy equipped with smoke detectors installed to ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems which are part of the fire alarm system in lieu of smoke alarms as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(3), need not incorporate the manually operated device required in Sentence 9.10.19.6.(1).

National Sentence Text: Where instructions are necessary to describe the maintenance and care required for smoke alarms to ensure continuing satisfactory performance, they shall be posted in a location where they will be readily available to the occupants for reference.
P/T Sentence Text: Where instructions are necessary to describe the maintenance and care required for smoke alarms to ensure continuing satisfactory performance, they shall be posted in a location where they will be readily available to the occupants for reference.

National Sentence Text: Except where a fire alarm system is installed or required in a building, smoke detectors forming part of a residential fire warning system installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S540-13 Residential Fire and Life Safety Warning Systems: Installation, Inspection, Testing and Maintenance are permitted to be installed in lieu of all smoke alarms required by Articles 9.10.19.1.and 9.10.19.3., provided that the fire warning system is capable of sounding audible signals as stated in Articles 9.10.19.2.and 9.10.19.5., is powered as stated in Article 9.10.19.4., and is equipped with a silencing device as stated in Article 9.10.19.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a fire alarm system is installed or required in a building, smoke detectors forming part of a residential fire warning system installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S540-13 Residential Fire and Life Safety Warning Systems: Installation, Inspection, Testing and Maintenance are permitted to be installed in lieu of all smoke alarms required by Articles 9.10.19.1.and 9.10.19.3., provided that the fire warning system is capable of sounding audible signals as stated in Articles 9.10.19.2.and 9.10.19.5., is powered as stated in Article 9.10.19.4., and is equipped with a silencing device as stated in Article 9.10.19.6.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.20.1.(3), a window or access panel providing an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide and having a sill height of not more than 900 mm above the floor shall be provided on the second and third storeys of every building in at least one wall facing on a street if such storeys are not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.20.1.(3), a window or access panel providing an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide and having a sill height of not more than 900 mm above the floor shall be provided on the second and third storeys of every building in at least one wall facing on a street if such storeys are not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence 9.10.20.1.(1) shall be readily openable from both inside and outside or be glazed with plain glass.
P/T Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence 9.10.20.1.(1) shall be readily openable from both inside and outside or be glazed with plain glass.

National Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence 9.10.20.1.(1) need not be provided in buildings containing only dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, or houses with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence 9.10.20.1.(1) need not be provided in buildings containing only dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, or houses with a secondary suite.

National Sentence Text: Except for basements in houses with a secondary suite or basements serving not more than one dwelling unit, each unsprinklered basement exceeding 25 m in length or width shall be provided with direct access to the outdoors to at least one street.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for basements in houses with a secondary suite or basements serving not more than one dwelling unit, each unsprinklered basement exceeding 25 m in length or width shall be provided with direct access to the outdoors to at least one street.

National Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence 9.10.20.2.(1) may be provided by a door, window or other means that provides an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, the sill height of which shall not be more than 900 mm above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence 9.10.20.2.(1) may be provided by a door, window or other means that provides an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, the sill height of which shall not be more than 900 mm above the floor.

National Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence 9.10.20.2.(1) may also be provided by an interior stair accessible from the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence 9.10.20.2.(1) may also be provided by an interior stair accessible from the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: Access for fire department equipment shall be provided to each building by means of a street, private roadway or yard. (See Notes A-9.10.20.3.(1)and A-3.2.5.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Access for fire department equipment shall be provided to each building by means of a street, private roadway or yard. (See Notes A-9.10.20.3.(1) and A-3.2.5.6.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Where access to a building as required in Sentence 9.10.20.3.(1) is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.
P/T Sentence Text: Where access to a building as required in Sentence 9.10.20.3.(1) is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, the NFC.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the NFC(AE).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Equipment forming part of a fire protection system that may be adversely affected by freezing temperatures and that is located in an unheated area shall be protected from freezing.
P/T Sentence Text: Equipment forming part of a fire protection system that may be adversely affected by freezing temperatures and that is located in an unheated area shall be protected from freezing.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.10.21.2.to 9.10.21.9., construction camps shall conform to Subsections 9.10.1.to 9.10.20.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Articles 9.10.21.2. to 9.10.21.9., construction camps shall conform to Subsections 9.10.1. to 9.10.20.

National Sentence Text: Except for sleeping rooms within dwelling units, sleeping rooms in construction camps shall be separated from each other and from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 30 minfire-resistance rating.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except for sleeping rooms within dwelling units, sleeping rooms in construction camps shall be separated from each other and from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 30 min fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except in a dwelling unit, a floor assembly in a construction camp building separating the first storey and the second storey shall be constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 30 minfire-resistance rating.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except in a dwelling unit, a floor assembly in a construction camp building separating the first storey and the second storey shall be constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 30 min fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Walkways of combustible construction connecting buildings shall be separated from each connected building by a fire separation having not less than a 45 minfire-resistance rating.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Walkways of combustible construction connecting buildings shall be separated from each connected building by a fire separation having not less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Construction camp buildings shall be separated from each other by a distance of not less than 10 m except as otherwise permitted in Subsections 9.10.14. and 9.10.15.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Construction camp buildings shall be separated from each other by a distance of not less than 10 m except as otherwise permitted in Subsections 9.10.14. and 9.10.15.

National Sentence Text: Except in dwelling units and except as provided in Sentence 9.10.21.6.(2), the surface flame-spread rating of wall and ceiling surfaces in corridors and walkways, exclusive of doors, shall not exceed 25 over not less than 90% of the exposed surface area and not more than 150 over the remaining surface area.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except in dwelling units and except as provided in Sentence 9.10.21.6.(2), the surface flame-spread rating of wall and ceiling surfaces in corridors and walkways, exclusive of doors, shall not exceed 25 over not less than 90% of the exposed surface area and not more than 150 over the remaining surface area.

National Sentence Text: Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.10.17.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.10.17.

National Sentence Text: Except in dwelling units, corridors providing access to exit from sleeping rooms in construction camp buildings with sleeping accommodation for more than 10 persons shall be provided with a smoke detector connected to the building alarm system.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except in dwelling units, corridors providing access to exit from sleeping rooms in construction camp buildings with sleeping accommodation for more than 10 persons shall be provided with a smoke detector connected to the building alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Each construction camp building shall be provided with portable fire extinguishers in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NFC.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Each construction camp building shall be provided with portable fire extinguishers in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NFC.

National Sentence Text: Every construction camp building providing sleeping accommodation for more than 30 persons shall be provided with a hose station that is protected from freezing and is equipped with a hose of sufficient length so that every portion of the building is within reach of a hose stream.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Every construction camp building providing sleeping accommodation for more than 30 persons shall be provided with a hose station that is protected from freezing and is equipped with a hose of sufficient length so that every portion of the building is within reach of a hose stream.

National Sentence Text: Hose stations required in Sentence 9.10.21.9.(1) shall be located near an exit.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Hose stations required in Sentence 9.10.21.9.(1) shall be located near an exit.

National Sentence Text: Hoses referred to in Sentence 9.10.21.9.(1) shall be not less than 19 mm inside diam and shall be connected to a central water supply or to a storage tank having a capacity of not less than 4 500 L with a pumping system capable of supplying a flow of not less than 5 L/s at a gauge pressure of 300 kPa. (See Note A-9.10.22.)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Hoses referred to in Sentence 9.10.21.9.(1) shall be not less than 19 mm inside diam and shall be connected to a central water supply or to a storage tank having a capacity of not less than 4 500 L with a pumping system capable of supplying a flow of not less than 5 L/s at a gauge pressure of 300 kPa.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.10.22.1.(2), natural gas and propane cooktops and ovens shall be installed in accordance with the applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code (See also Article 9.34.1.1.)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as required in Sentence 9.10.22.1.(2), natural gas and propane cooktops and ovens shall be installed in accordance with the applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code (See also Article 9.34.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.10.22.1.(2), natural gas and propane cooktops and ovens shall be installed in accordance with the Gas Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See also Article 9.34.1.1.)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as required in Sentence 9.10.22.1.(2), natural gas and propane cooktops and ovens shall be installed in accordance with the Gas Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See also Article 9.34.1.1.)

National Sentence Text: Clearances for and protection around gas, propane and electric ranges shall be not less than those provided in Articles 9.10.22.2.and 9.10.22.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Clearances for and protection around gas, propane and electric ranges shall be not less than those provided in Articles 9.10.22.2.and 9.10.22.3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.22.2.(2), framing, finishes and cabinetry installed directly above the location of the cooktop shall be not less than 750 mm above the level of cooktop burners or elements.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.22.2.(2), framing, finishes and cabinetry installed directly above the location of the cooktop shall be not less than 750 mm above the level of cooktop burners or elements.

National Sentence Text: The vertical clearance described in Sentence 9.10.22.2.(1) for framing, finishes and cabinets located directly above the location of the cooktop may be reduced to 600 mm above the level of the elements or burners, provided the framing, finishes and cabinets are noncombustible, or are protected by a metal hood that projects 125 mm beyond the framing, finishes and cabinets.
P/T Sentence Text: The vertical clearance described in Sentence 9.10.22.2.(1) for framing, finishes and cabinets located directly above the location of the cooktop may be reduced to 600 mm above the level of the elements or burners, provided the framing, finishes and cabinets are noncombustible, or are protected by a metal hood that projects 125 mm beyond the framing, finishes and cabinets.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.22.3.(2)and 9.10.22.3.(3), combustible wall framing, finishes or cabinets within 450 mm of the area where the cooktop is to be located shall be protected above the level of the heating elements or burners by material providing fire resistance at least equivalent to that provided by a 9.5 mm thickness of gypsum board.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.22.3.(2) and 9.10.22.3.(3), combustible wall framing, finishes or cabinets within 450 mm of the area where the cooktop is to be located shall be protected above the level of the heating elements or burners by material providing fire resistance at least equivalent to that provided by a 9.5 mm thickness of gypsum board.

National Sentence Text: Counter-top splash boards or back plates that extend above the level of heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence 9.10.22.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Counter-top splash boards or back plates that extend above the level of heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence 9.10.22.3.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except for cabinetry described in Article 9.10.22.2., cabinetry located not less than 450 mm above the level of the heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence 9.10.22.3.(1). (See Note A-9.11.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for cabinetry described in Article 9.10.22.2., cabinetry located not less than 450 mm above the level of the heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence 9.10.22.3.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.11.1.1.(2)and 9.11.1.1.(3), a dwelling unit shall be separated from every other space in a building in which noise may be generated by a separating assembly and adjoining constructions, which together provide an apparent sound transmission class (ASTC) rating of not less than 47, or a separating assembly providing a sound transmission class (STC) rating of not less than 50 and adjoining constructions that conform to Article 9.11.1.4. (See Note A-9.11.1.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.11.1.1.(2) and 9.11.1.1.(3), a dwelling unit shall be separated from every other space in a building in which noise may be generated by a separating assembly and adjoining constructions, which together provide an apparent sound transmission class (ASTC) rating of not less than 47, or a separating assembly providing a sound transmission class (STC) rating of not less than 50 and adjoining constructions that conform to Article 9.11.1.4.

National Sentence Text: Where a house contains a secondary suite, each dwelling unit shall be separated from every other space in the house in which noise may be transmitted by construction whose joist spaces are filled with sound-absorbing material of not less than 150 mm nominal thickness, whose stud spaces are filled with sound-absorbing material, having a resilient channel on one side of the separation spaced 400 or 600 mm o.c., and having not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board on ceilings and on both sides of walls, construction providing an STC rating of not less than 43, or a separating assembly and adjoining constructions, which together provide an ASTC rating of not less than 40. (See Note A-9.11.1.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a house contains a secondary suite, each dwelling unit shall be separated from every other space in the house in which noise may be transmitted by construction whose joist spaces are filled with sound-absorbing material of not less than 150 mm nominal thickness, whose stud spaces are filled with sound-absorbing material, having a resilient channel on one side of the separation spaced 400 or 600 mm o.c., and having not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board on ceilings and on both sides of walls, construction providing an STC rating of not less than 43, or a separating assembly and adjoining constructions, which together provide an ASTC rating of not less than 40.

National Sentence Text: Construction separating a dwelling unit from an elevator shaft or refuse chute shall have an STC rating of not less than 55.
P/T Sentence Text: Construction separating a dwelling unit from an elevator shaft or refuse chute shall have an STC rating of not less than 55.

National Sentence Text: The STC ratings shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E 413-10 Classification for Rating Sound Insulation using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E 90-09 Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements
P/T Sentence Text: The STC ratings shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E 413-10 Classification for Rating Sound Insulation using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E 90-09 Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements

National Sentence Text: The ASTC ratings shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E 413-10 Classification for Rating Sound Insulation using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E 336-11 Measurement of Airborne Sound Attenuation between Rooms in Buildings or calculated in accordance with Article 5.8.1.4.or 5.8.1.5.
P/T Sentence Text: The ASTC ratings shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E 413-10 Classification for Rating Sound Insulation using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E 336-11 Measurement of Airborne Sound Attenuation between Rooms in Buildings or calculated in accordance with Article 5.8.1.4. or 5.8.1.5.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with the required STC ratings shall be demonstrated through measurements carried out in accordance with Sentence 9.11.1.2.(1), or the construction of separating assemblies conforming to Table 9.10.3.1.-Aor 9.10.3.1.-B, as applicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the required STC ratings shall be demonstrated through measurements carried out in accordance with Sentence 9.11.1.2.(1), or the construction of separating assemblies conforming to Table 9.10.3.1.-A or 9.10.3.1.-B, as applicable.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with the required ASTC ratings shall be demonstrated through measurements or calculations carried out in accordance with Sentence 9.11.1.2.(2), or the construction of separating assemblies conforming to Table 9.10.3.1.-Aor 9.10.3.1.-B, as applicable, that have an STC rating of not less than 50 in conjunction with flanking assemblies constructed in accordance with Article 9.11.1.4. (see Note A-9.11.1.3.(2)(b)). (See Note A-9.11.1.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the required ASTC ratings shall be demonstrated through measurements or calculations carried out in accordance with Sentence 9.11.1.2.(2), or the construction of separating assemblies conforming to Table 9.10.3.1.-A or 9.10.3.1.-B, as applicable, that have an STC rating of not less than 50 in conjunction with flanking assemblies constructed in accordance with Article 9.11.1.4. (see Note A-9.11.1.3.(2)(b)).

National Sentence Text: This Article applies where the required protection is provided in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.1.(1)(b) and compliance is demonstrated in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.3.(2)(b).
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies where the required protection is provided in accordance with Sentence 9.11.1.1.(1) and compliance is demonstrated in accordance with Sentence 9.11.1.3.(2).

National Sentence Text: Flanking wall assemblies connected to a separating floor or ceiling assembly shall be constructed with concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 200 kg/m2, or gypsum board finish that is supported on wood or steel framing, and ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating floor or ceiling assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Flanking wall assemblies connected to a separating floor or ceiling assembly shall be constructed with concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 200 kg/m2, or gypsum board finish that is supported on wood or steel framing, and ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating floor or ceiling assembly.

National Sentence Text: Flanking wall and ceiling assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or gypsum board finish that is supported on wood or steel framing, and ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating wall assembly or, for double-stud walls, where it meets the space between the two lines of studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Flanking wall and ceiling assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or gypsum board finish that is supported on wood or steel framing, and ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating wall assembly or, for double-stud walls, where it meets the space between the two lines of studs.

National Sentence Text: Flanking floor assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with concrete having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or in accordance with Section 9.16., or supported on joists or trusses that are not continuous across the junction and are covered with floor treatments in accordance with Table 9.11.1.4. for the applicable wall construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Flanking floor assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with concrete having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or in accordance with part 9., or supported on joists or trusses that are not continuous across the junction and are covered with floor treatments in accordance with Table 9.11.1.4. for the applicable wall construction.

National Sentence Text: The topsoil and vegetable matter in all unexcavated areas under a building shall be removed.
P/T Sentence Text: The topsoil and vegetable matter in all unexcavated areas under a building shall be removed.

National Sentence Text: In localities where termite infestation is known to be a problem, all stumps, roots and other wood debris shall be removed from the soil to a depth of not less than 300 mm in unexcavated areas under a building.
P/T Sentence Text: In localities where termite infestation is known to be a problem, all stumps, roots and other wood debris shall be removed from the soil to a depth of not less than 300 mm in unexcavated areas under a building.
