National Sentence Text: The bottom of every excavation shall be free of all organic material.
P/T Sentence Text: The bottom of every excavation shall be free of all organic material.

National Sentence Text: Excavations shall be kept free of standing water.
P/T Sentence Text: Excavations shall be kept free of standing water.

National Sentence Text: The bottom of excavations shall be kept from freezing throughout the entire construction period.
P/T Sentence Text: The bottom of excavations shall be kept from freezing throughout the entire construction period.

National Sentence Text: Excavations for foundations shall extend to undisturbed soil.
P/T Sentence Text: Excavations for foundations shall extend to undisturbed soil.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.12.2.2.(4)to 9.12.2.2.(7), the minimum depth of foundations below finished ground level shall conform to Table 9.12.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.12.2.2.(4) to 9.12.2.2.(7), the minimum depth of foundations below finished ground level shall conform to Table 9.12.2.2.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation is insulated in a manner that will reduce heat flow to the soil beneath the footings, the foundation depth shall conform to that required for foundations containing no heated space. (See Note A-9.12.2.2.(2).) (See Note A-9.12.2.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation is insulated in a manner that will reduce heat flow to the soil beneath the footings, the foundation depth shall conform to that required for foundations containing no heated space. (See Note A-9.12.2.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The minimum depth of foundations for exterior concrete steps with more than 2 risers shall conform to Sentences 9.12.2.2.(1), 9.12.2.2.(2) and 9.12.2.2.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum depth of foundations for exterior concrete steps with more than 2 risers shall conform to Sentences 9.12.2.2.(1), 9.12.2.2.(2) and 9.12.2.2.(5).

National Sentence Text: Concrete steps with 1 and 2 risers are permitted to be laid on ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete steps with 1 and 2 risers are permitted to be laid on ground level.

National Sentence Text: The foundation depths required in Sentence 9.12.2.2.(1) are permitted to be decreased where experience with local soil conditions shows that lesser depths are satisfactory, or where the foundation is designed for lesser depths.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): The foundation depths required in Sentence 9.12.2.2.(1) are permitted to be decreased where experience with local soil conditions shows that lesser depths are satisfactory, or where the foundation is designed for lesser depths.
P/T Sentence Text: The foundation depths required in Sentence 9.12.2.2.(1) are permitted to be decreased where experience with local soil conditions shows that lesser depths are satisfactory, or where the foundation is designed for lesser depths by a registered professional.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The foundation depths required in Sentence 9.12.2.2.(1) are permitted to be decreased where experience with local soil conditions shows that lesser depths are satisfactory, or where the foundation is designed for lesser depths by a registered professional.

National Sentence Text: The foundation depths required by Sentence 9.12.2.2.(1) do not apply to foundations for buildings that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction, and whose superstructure conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1-09 Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes or accessory buildings that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction, not more than 1 storey in height, not more than 55 m2 in building area, and where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the floor joists is not more than 600 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The foundation depths required by Sentence 9.12.2.2.(1) do not apply to foundations for buildings that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction, and whose superstructure conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1-09 Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes or accessory buildings that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction, not more than 1 storey in height, not more than 55 m2 in building area, and where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the floor joists is not more than 600 mm.

National Sentence Text: The foundation depths required by Sentence 9.12.2.2.(1) do not apply to foundations for decks and other accessible exterior platforms of not more than 1 storey, not more than 55 m2 in area, where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, not supporting a roof, and not attached to another structure, unless it can be demonstrated that differential movement will not adversely affect the performance of that structure.
P/T Sentence Text: The foundation depths required by Sentence 9.12.2.2.(1) do not apply to foundations for decks and other accessible exterior platforms of not more than 1 storey , not more than 55 m2 in area, where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, not supporting a roof, and not attached to another structure, unless it can be demonstrated that differential movement will not adversely affect the performance of that structure.

National Sentence Text: Where decks or other accessible exterior platforms are supported on surface foundations supported on other than coarse-grained soil with good drainage or rock, access to the foundation positions to permit re-levelling of the platform shall be provided by passageways with a clear height under the platform of not less than 600 mm and a width of not less than 600 mm, or by installing the decking in a manner that allows easy removal.
P/T Sentence Text: Where decks or other accessible exterior platforms are supported on surface foundations supported on other than coarse-grained soil with good drainage or rock, access to the foundation positions to permit re-levelling of the platform shall be provided by passageways with a clear height under the platform of not less than 600 mm and a width of not less than 600 mm, or by installing the decking in a manner that allows easy removal.

National Sentence Text: Backfill shall be placed to avoid damaging the foundation wall, the drainage tile, externally applied thermal insulation and waterproofing or dampproofing of the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Backfill shall be placed to avoid damaging the foundation wall, the drainage tile, externally applied thermal insulation and waterproofing or dampproofing of the wall.

National Sentence Text: Backfill shall be graded to prevent drainage towards the foundation after settling.
P/T Sentence Text: Backfill shall be graded to prevent drainage towards the foundation after settling.

National Sentence Text: Backfill that is within 600 mm of the foundation shall be free of deleterious debris and boulders larger than 250 mm diam. (See Note A-9.12.3.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Backfill that is within 600 mm of the foundation shall be free of deleterious debris and boulders larger than 250 mm diam. (See Note A-9.12.3.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.12.3.3.(3), backfill shall not contain pyritic material or material that is susceptible to ice lensing in concentrations that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. (See Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.12.3.3.(3), backfill shall not contain pyritic material or material that is susceptible to ice lensing in concentrations that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. National Sentence Text: Backfill with material of any concentration that is susceptible to ice lensing is permitted where foundation walls are cast-in-place concrete, concrete block insulated on the exterior, or concrete block protected from the backfill by a material that serves as a slip plane. (See Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Backfill with material of any concentration that is susceptible to ice lensing is permitted where foundation walls are cast-in-place concrete, concrete block insulated on the exterior, or concrete block protected from the backfill by a material that serves as a slip plane.

National Sentence Text: The soil in trenches beneath footings for sewers and watermains shall be compacted by tamping up to the level of the footing base, or shall be filled with concrete having a strength not less than 10 MPa to support the footing.
P/T Sentence Text: The soil in trenches beneath footings for sewers and watermains shall be compacted by tamping up to the level of the footing base, or shall be filled with concrete having a strength not less than 10 MPa to support the footing.

National Sentence Text: This Section presents measures to control the ingress of water, moisture and soil gas.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section presents measures to control the ingress of water, moisture and soil gas.

National Sentence Text: Subsection 9.13.2. applies to below-ground walls and floors-on-ground where drainage is provided in accordance with Section 9.14. over and along the entire below-ground portion of the foundation wall.
P/T Sentence Text: part 9. applies to below-ground walls and floors-on-ground where drainage is provided in accordance with part 9. over and along the entire below-ground portion of the foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: Subsection 9.13.3. applies to below-ground walls, floors-on-ground and roofs of underground structures that are subject to hydrostatic pressure.
P/T Sentence Text: part 9. applies to below-ground walls, floors-on-ground and roofs of underground structures that are subject to hydrostatic pressure.

National Sentence Text: Subsection 9.13.4. applies to walls, roofs and floors that are in contact with the ground.
P/T Sentence Text: part 9. applies to walls, roofs and floors that are in contact with the ground.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.13.3.1., where the exterior finished ground level is at a higher elevation than the ground level inside the foundation walls, exterior surfaces of foundation walls below ground level shall be dampproofed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.13.3.1., where the exterior finished ground level is at a higher elevation than the ground level inside the foundation walls, exterior surfaces of foundation walls below ground level shall be dampproofed.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.13.2.1.(3) and Article 9.13.3.1., floors-on-ground shall be dampproofed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.13.2.1.(3) and Article 9.13.3.1., floors-on-ground shall be dampproofed.

National Sentence Text: Dampproofing required in Sentence 9.13.2.1.(2) need not be provided for floors in garages, floors in unenclosed portions of buildings, or floors installed over not less than 100 mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve.
P/T Sentence Text: Dampproofing required in Sentence 9.13.2.1.(2) need not be provided for floors in garages, floors in unenclosed portions of buildings, or floors installed over not less than 100 mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve.

National Sentence Text: Materials installed to provide required dampproofing shall be capable of protecting assemblies against moisture transfer from the ground, compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials installed to provide required dampproofing shall be capable of protecting assemblies against moisture transfer from the ground, compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise specified in this Section, materials used for exterior dampproofing shall conform to one of the following standards: ASTM D 1227-95 Emulsified Asphalt Used as a Protective Coating for Roofing Type III, Class I, ASTM D 4479/D 4479M-07e1 Asphalt Roof Coatings – Asbestos-Free Type III, CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction or CSA CAN/CSA-A123.4-04 Asphalt for Constructing Built-Up Roof Coverings and Waterproofing Systemsor have a water vapour permeance of not more than 43 ng/Pa·s·m2 when tested in accordance with Procedure A (wet of ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials and consist of one of the following material types: a vapour-resistant coating, a cold-fluid-applied or hot-rubberized bituminous dampproofing membrane, a liquid-applied or spray-applied asphalt-based emulsion dampproofing, or a type III hot-applied asphalt.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise specified in this Section, materials used for exterior dampproofing shall conform to one of the following standards: ASTM D 1227-95 Emulsified Asphalt Used as a Protective Coating for Roofing Type III, Class I, ASTM D 4479/D 4479M-07(2012)e1 Asphalt Roof Coatings – Asbestos-Free Type III, CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction or CSA CAN/CSA-A123.4-04 Asphalt for Constructing Built-Up Roof Coverings and Waterproofing Systemsor have a water vapour permeance of not more than 43 ng/Pa·s·m2 when tested in accordance with Procedure A (wet of ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials and consist of one of the following material types: a vapour-resistant coating, a cold-fluid-applied or hot-rubberized bituminous dampproofing membrane, a liquid-applied or spray-applied asphalt-based emulsion dampproofing, or a type III hot-applied asphalt.

National Sentence Text: The area in which dampproofing is to be carried out shall be kept free of water during the application and curing of the dampproofing system.
P/T Sentence Text: The area in which dampproofing is to be carried out shall be kept free of water during the application and curing of the dampproofing system.

National Sentence Text: The surface to be dampproofed shall be prepared in accordance with the instructions of the dampproofing material manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: The surface to be dampproofed shall be prepared in accordance with the instructions of the dampproofing material manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: Where the dampproofing material is to be applied on insulating concrete form (ICF) walls, the instructions of the ICF wall manufacturer shall be followed.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the dampproofing material is to be applied on insulating concrete form (ICF) walls, the instructions of the ICF wall manufacturer shall be followed.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry walls to be dampproofed shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level with not less than 6 mm of mortar conforming to Section 9.20. coved over the footing.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry walls to be dampproofed shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level with not less than 6 mm of mortar conforming to part 9. coved over the footing.

National Sentence Text: Concrete walls to be dampproofed shall have holes and recesses sealed with cement mortar or a mastic or sealant that is suitable for vertical applications and compatible with the dampproofing material.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete walls to be dampproofed shall have holes and recesses sealed with cement mortar or a mastic or sealant that is suitable for vertical applications and compatible with the dampproofing material.

National Sentence Text: The surface required to be dampproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections and depressions, loose particles and debris that could be detrimental to the performance of the material to be applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The surface required to be dampproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections and depressions, loose particles and debris that could be detrimental to the performance of the material to be applied.

National Sentence Text: Exterior dampproofing shall be applied from finished ground level to the top of the exterior of the footing.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior dampproofing shall be applied from finished ground level to the top of the exterior of the footing.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise stated in this Subsection, dampproofing shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions with regard to surface priming, conditions during application, application quantity and rate, and curing times.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless otherwise stated in this Subsection, dampproofing shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions with regard to surface priming, conditions during application, application quantity and rate, and curing times.

National Sentence Text: Joints, cracks and penetrations shall be sealed to maintain the continuity of the dampproofing, where the dampproofing material is not capable of bridging such discontinuities. (See Note A-9.13.2.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Joints, cracks and penetrations shall be sealed to maintain the continuity of the dampproofing, where the dampproofing material is not capable of bridging such discontinuities.

National Sentence Text: The interior surface of foundation walls below ground level shall be protected by means that minimize the ingress of moisture from the foundation wall into interior spaces, where a separate interior finish is applied to a concrete or unit masonry wall that is in contact with the soil, or wood members are placed in contact with such walls for the installation of insulation or finish.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.13.2.5.(3), where the protection of interior finishes required in Sentence 9.13.2.5.(1) consists of membranes or coatings, the membrane or coating shall extend from the basement floor surface up to the highest extent of the interior insulation or finish, but not higher than the exterior finished ground level, and no membrane or coating with a permeance less than 170 ng/(Pa·s·m2) shall be applied to the interior surface of the foundation wall above ground level between the insulation and the foundation wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.13.2.5.(3), where the protection of interior finishes required in Sentence 9.13.2.5.(1) consists of membranes or coatings, the membrane or coating shall extend from the basement floor surface up to the highest extent of the interior insulation or finish, but not higher than the exterior finished ground level, and no membrane or coating with a permeance less than 170 ng/(Pa·s·m2) shall be applied to the interior surface of the foundation wall above ground level between the insulation and the foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: Where insulation functions as both moisture protection for interior finishes and as a vapour barrier in accordance with Subsection 9.25.4., it shall be applied over the entire interior surface of the foundation wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulation functions as both moisture protection for interior finishes and as a vapour barrier in accordance with part 9., it shall be applied over the entire interior surface of the foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: Where dampproofing is installed below the floor, it shall consist of polyethylene not less than 0.15 mm thick with joints lapped not less than 100 mm, type S roll roofing with joints lapped not less than 100 mm, or rigid extruded/expanded polystyrene with sealed or ship-lapped joints that has sufficient compressive strength to support the floor assembly, and a water vapour permeance complying with Clause 9.13.2.2.(2)(a).

P/T Sentence Text: Materials installed to provide required waterproofing shall be compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.

P/T Sentence Text: Materials used for exterior waterproofing shall conform to ASTM D 1227-95 Emulsified Asphalt Used as a Protective Coating for Roofing in which case, they shall be installed in accordance with Sentence 9.13.3.3.(3), ASTM D 3019-08 Lap Cement Used with Asphalt Roll Roofing, Non-Fibered, Asbestos-Fibered, and Non-Asbestos-Fibered where non-fibered and non-asbestos-fibered (Types I and asphalt roll roofing are permitted, ASTM D 4479/D 4479M-07(2012)e1 Asphalt Roof Coatings – Asbestos-Free in which case, they shall be installed in accordance with Sentence 9.13.3.3.(3) and with reinforcing material, ASTM D 4637/D 4637M-12 EPDM Sheet Used In Single-Ply Roof Membrane ASTM D 4811/D 4811M-06 Nonvulcanized (Uncured) Rubber Sheet Used as Roof Flashing ASTM D 6878/D 6878M-11a Thermoplastic Polyolefin Based Sheet Roofing CGSB 37-GP-9Ma-1983 Primer, Asphalt, Unfilled, for Asphalt Roofing, Dampproofing and Waterproofing where a primer is required, CGSB CAN/CGSB-37.50-M89 Hot-Applied, Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing CGSB CAN/CGSB-37.54-95 Polyvinyl Chloride Roofing and Waterproofing Membrane CGSB 37-GP-56M-1985 Membrane, Modified, Bituminous, Prefabricated, and Reinforced for Roofing CGSB CAN/CGSB-37.58-M86 Membrane, Elastomeric, Cold-Applied Liquid, for Non-Exposed Use in Roofing and Waterproofing CSA CAN/CSA-A123.2-03 Asphalt-Coated Roofing Sheets CSA CAN/CSA-A123.4-04 Asphalt for Constructing Built-Up Roof Coverings and Waterproofing Systems in which case, they shall be installed with reinforcing material, or CSA A123.17-05 Asphalt Glass Felt Used in Roofing and Waterproofing

National Sentence Text: Surfaces to be waterproofed shall be prepared in accordance with the instructions of the waterproofing material manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Surfaces to be waterproofed shall be prepared in accordance with the instructions of the waterproofing material manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: Where the waterproofing material is to be applied on ICF walls, the instructions of the ICF wall manufacturer shall be followed.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the waterproofing material is to be applied on ICF walls, the instructions of the ICF wall manufacturer shall be followed.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry walls that are to be waterproofed shall be parged on exterior surfaces below ground level with not less than 6 mm of mortar conforming to Section 9.20.coved over the footing.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry walls that are to be waterproofed shall be parged on exterior surfaces below ground level with not less than 6 mm of mortar conforming to part 9. coved over the footing.

National Sentence Text: Concrete walls that are to be waterproofed shall have all holes and recesses sealed with mortar or waterproofing material.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete walls that are to be waterproofed shall have all holes and recesses sealed with mortar or waterproofing material.

National Sentence Text: Surfaces required to be waterproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections and depressions, loose particles and debris that could be detrimental to the performance of the waterproofing material.
P/T Sentence Text: Surfaces required to be waterproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections and depressions, loose particles and debris that could be detrimental to the performance of the waterproofing material.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise stated in this Subsection, waterproofing shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions with regard to surface priming, conditions during application, the required number of layers of reinforcing fabric on foundation, footings, floors, walls and structural slabs, application quantity and rate, and curing times.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless otherwise stated in this Subsection, waterproofing shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions with regard to surface priming, conditions during application, the required number of layers of reinforcing fabric on foundation, footings, floors, walls and structural slabs, application quantity and rate, and curing times.

National Sentence Text: Waterproofing shall be continuous across joints and at junctions between different building elements.
P/T Sentence Text: Waterproofing shall be continuous across joints and at junctions between different building elements.

National Sentence Text: The waterproofed surface shall be protected with a suitable material to minimize mechanical damage during backfilling.
P/T Sentence Text: The waterproofed surface shall be protected with a suitable material to minimize mechanical damage during backfilling.

National Sentence Text: The area in which the waterproofing is to be carried out shall be kept free of water during the application and curing of the waterproofing system.
P/T Sentence Text: The area in which the waterproofing is to be carried out shall be kept free of water during the application and curing of the waterproofing system.

National Sentence Text: Basement floors-on-ground to be waterproofed shall have a system of membrane waterproofing provided between 2 layers of concrete, each of which shall be not less than 75 mm thick, with the floor membrane made continuous with the wall membrane to form a complete seal. (See Note A-9.13.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Basement floors-on-ground to be waterproofed shall have a system of membrane waterproofing provided between 2 layers of concrete, each of which shall be not less than 75 mm thick, with the floor membrane made continuous with the wall membrane to form a complete seal.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to wall, roof and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from the ground, and the rough-in to allow the future protection of conditioned space that is separated from the ground by a wall, roof or floor assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to wall, roof and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from the ground, and the rough-in to allow the future protection of conditioned space that is separated from the ground by a wall, roof or floor assembly.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection addresses the leakage of soil gas from the ground into the building.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection addresses the leakage of soil gas from the ground into the building.

National Sentence Text: All wall, roof and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from the ground shall be protected by an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3.
P/T Sentence Text: All wall, roof and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from the ground shall be protected by an air barrier system conforming to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Unless the space between the air barrier system and the ground is designed to be accessible for the future installation of a subfloor depressurization system, dwelling units and buildings containing residential occupancies shall be provided with the rough-in for a radon extraction system conforming to Article 9.13.4.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless the space between the air barrier system and the ground is designed to be accessible for the future installation of a subfloor depressurization system, dwelling units and buildings containing residential occupancies shall be provided with the rough-in for a radon extraction system conforming to Article 9.13.4.3.

National Sentence Text: Where buildings are used for occupancies other than those described in Sentence 9.13.4.2.(2), protection from radon ingress and the means to address high radon concentrations in the future shall conform to Article 9.13.4.3., or Parts 5 and 6 (see Article 5.4.1.1.and 6.2.1.1.). (See Note A-9.13.4.2.(3).) (See Note A-9.13.4.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where buildings are used for occupancies other than those described in Sentence 9.13.4.2.(2), protection from radon ingress and the means to address high radon concentrations in the future shall conform to Article 9.13.4.3., or Parts 5 and 6 (see Article 5.4.1.1.and 6.2.1.1.).

National Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground shall be provided with a rough-in for subfloor depressurization consisting of a gas-permeable layer, an inlet and an outlet as described in Sentence 9.13.4.3.(2), or clean granular material and a pipe as described in Sentence 9.13.4.3.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground shall be provided with a rough-in for subfloor depressurization consisting of a gas-permeable layer, an inlet and an outlet as described in Sentence 9.13.4.3.(2), or clean granular material and a pipe as described in Sentence 9.13.4.3.(3).

National Sentence Text: The rough-in referred to in Clause 9.13.4.3.(1)(a) shall include a gas-permeable layer installed in the space between the air barrier and the ground to allow the depressurization of that space, an inlet that allows for the effective depressurization of the gas-permeable layer (see Note A-9.13.4.3.(2)(b) and (3)(b)(i)), and an outlet in the conditioned space that permits connection to depressurization equipment, is sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system, and is clearly labeled to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon from below the floor-on-ground.
P/T Sentence Text: The rough-in referred to in Sentence 9.13.4.3.(1) shall include a gas-permeable layer installed in the space between the air barrier and the ground to allow the depressurization of that space, an inlet that allows for the effective depressurization of the gas-permeable layer (see Note A-9.13.4.3.(2)(b)), and an outlet in the conditioned space that permits connection to depressurization equipment, is sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system, and is clearly labeled to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon from below the floor-on-ground.

National Sentence Text: The rough-in referred to in Clause 9.13.4.3.(1)(b) shall include clean granular material installed below the floor-on-ground in accordance with Sentence 9.16.2.1.(1), and a pipe not less than 100 mm in diameter installed through the floor, such that its bottom end opens into the granular layer required Clause 9.13.4.3.(3)(a) at or near the centre of the floor and not less than 100 mm of granular material projects beyond the terminus of the pipe measured along its axis (see Note A-9.13.4.3.(2)(b) and (3)(b)(i)), its top end permits connection to depressurization equipment and is provided with an airtight cap, and the pipe is clearly labeled near the cap and, if applicable, every 1.8 m and at every change in direction to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon from below the floor-on-ground.
P/T Sentence Text: The rough-in referred to in Sentence 9.13.4.3.(1) shall include clean granular material installed below the floor-on-ground in accordance with Sentence 9.16.2.1.(1), and a pipe not less than 100 mm in diameter installed through the floor, such that its bottom end opens into the granular layer required Sentence 9.13.4.3.(3) at or near the centre of the floor and not less than 100 mm of granular material projects beyond the terminus of the pipe measured along its axis (see Note A-9.13.4.3.(2)(b)), its top end permits connection to depressurization equipment and is provided with an airtight cap, and the pipe is clearly labeled near the cap and, if applicable, every 1.8 m and at every change in direction to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon from below the floor-on-ground.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to subsurface drainage and to surface drainage.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to subsurface drainage and to surface drainage.

National Sentence Text: Drainage for crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.18.
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage for crawl spaces shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Drainage requirements beneath floors-on-ground shall conform to Section 9.16.
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage requirements beneath floors-on-ground shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown to be unnecessary, the bottom of every exterior foundation wall shall be drained by drainage tile or pipe laid around the exterior of the foundation in conformance with Subsection 9.14.3. or by a layer of gravel or crushed rock in conformance with Subsection 9.14.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown to be unnecessary, the bottom of every exterior foundation wall shall be drained by drainage tile or pipe laid around the exterior of the foundation in conformance with part 9. or by a layer of gravel or crushed rock in conformance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: Where mineral fibre insulation or crushed rock backfill is provided adjacent to the exterior surface of a foundation wall, the insulation or backfill shall extend to the footing level to facilitate the drainage of ground water to the foundation’s drainage system (see Note A-9.14.2.1.(2)(a)), and any pyritic material in the crushed rock shall be limited to a concentration that will not damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies (see Sentence 9.12.3.3.(2) and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1)).
P/T Sentence Text: Where mineral fibre insulation or crushed rock backfill is provided adjacent to the exterior surface of a foundation wall, the insulation or backfill shall extend to the footing level to facilitate the drainage of ground water to the foundation’s drainage system (see Note A-9.14.2.1.(2)(a)), and any pyritic material in the crushed rock shall be limited to a concentration that will not damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies (see Sentence 9.12.3.3.(2) and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1)).

National Sentence Text: Drain tile and drain pipe for foundation drainage shall conform to ASTM C 4-04 Clay Drain Tile and Perforated Clay Drain Tile ASTM C 412M-11 Concrete Drain Tile (Metric) ASTM C 444M-03 Perforated Concrete Pipe (Metric) ASTM C 700-13 Vitrified Clay Pipe, Extra Strength, Standard Strength, and Perforated BNQ BNQ 3624-115/2016 Polyethylene (PE) Pipe and Fittings for Soil and Foundation Drainage CSA CAN/CSA-B182.1-15 Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA G401-14 Corrugated Steel Pipe Products
P/T Sentence Text: Drain tile and drain pipe for foundation drainage shall conform to ASTM C 4-04 Clay Drain Tile and Perforated Clay Drain Tile ASTM C 412M-11 Concrete Drain Tile (Metric) ASTM C 444M-03 Perforated Concrete Pipe (Metric) ASTM C 700-13 Vitrified Clay Pipe, Extra Strength, Standard Strength, and Perforated BNQ BNQ 3624-115/2016 Polyethylene (PE) Pipe and Fittings for Soil and Foundation Drainage CSA CAN/CSA-B182.1-15 Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA G401-14 Corrugated Steel Pipe Products

National Sentence Text: Drain tile or pipe used for foundation drainage shall be not less than 100 mm in diam.
P/T Sentence Text: Drain tile or pipe used for foundation drainage shall be not less than 100 mm in diam.

National Sentence Text: Drain tile or pipe shall be laid on undisturbed or well-compacted soil so that the top of the tile or pipe is below the bottom of the floor slab or the ground cover of the crawl space.
P/T Sentence Text: Drain tile or pipe shall be laid on undisturbed or well-compacted soil so that the top of the tile or pipe is below the bottom of the floor slab or the ground cover of the crawl space.

National Sentence Text: Drain tile or pipe with butt joints shall be laid with 6 mm to 10 mm open joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Drain tile or pipe with butt joints shall be laid with 6 mm to 10 mm open joints.

National Sentence Text: The top half of joints referred to in Sentence 9.14.3.3.(2) shall be covered with sheathing paper, 0.10 mm polyethylene or No. 15 asphalt or tar-saturated felt.
P/T Sentence Text: The top half of joints referred to in Sentence 9.14.3.3.(2) shall be covered with sheathing paper, 0.10 mm polyethylene or No. 15 asphalt or tar-saturated felt.

National Sentence Text: The top and sides of drain pipe or tile shall be covered with not less than 150 mm of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve.
P/T Sentence Text: The top and sides of drain pipe or tile shall be covered with not less than 150 mm of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve.

National Sentence Text: Granular material used to drain the bottom of a foundation shall consist of a continuous layer of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve, and no pyritic material in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies (see Note A-9.4.4.4.(1)).
P/T Sentence Text: Granular material used to drain the bottom of a foundation shall consist of a continuous layer of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve, and no pyritic material in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies (see Note A-9.4.4.4.(1)).

National Sentence Text: Granular material described in Article 9.14.4.1. shall be laid on undisturbed or compacted soil to a minimum depth of not less than 125 mm beneath the footing of the building and extend not less than 300 mm beyond the outside edge of the footings.
P/T Sentence Text: Granular material described in Article 9.14.4.1. shall be laid on undisturbed or compacted soil to a minimum depth of not less than 125 mm beneath the footing of the building and extend not less than 300 mm beyond the outside edge of the footings.

National Sentence Text: The bottom of an excavation drained by a granular layer shall be graded so that the entire area described in Article 9.14.4.2. is drained to a sump conforming to Article 9.14.5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: The bottom of an excavation drained by a granular layer shall be graded so that the entire area described in Article 9.14.4.2. is drained to a sump conforming to Article 9.14.5.2.

National Sentence Text: Where because of wet site conditions soil becomes mixed with the granular drainage material, sufficient additional granular material shall be provided so that the top 125 mm are kept free of soil.
P/T Sentence Text: Where because of wet site conditions soil becomes mixed with the granular drainage material, sufficient additional granular material shall be provided so that the top 125 mm are kept free of soil.

National Sentence Text: Foundation drains shall drain to a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well.
P/T Sentence Text: Foundation drains shall drain to a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well.

National Sentence Text: Where a sump pit is provided it shall be not less than 750 mm deep, not less than 0.25 m2 in area, and provided with a cover.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a sump pit is provided it shall be not less than 750 mm deep, not less than 0.25 m2 in area, and provided with a cover.

National Sentence Text: Covers for sump pits shall be designed to resist removal by children, and to be airtight in accordance with Sentence 9.25.3.3.(7).
P/T Sentence Text: Covers for sump pits shall be designed to resist removal by children, and to be airtight in accordance with Sentence 9.25.3.3.(7).

National Sentence Text: Where gravity drainage is not practical, an automatic sump pump shall be provided to discharge the water from the sump pit described in Sentence 9.14.5.2.(1) into a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well.
P/T Sentence Text: Where gravity drainage is not practical, an automatic sump pump shall be provided to discharge the water from the sump pit described in Sentence 9.14.5.2.(1) into a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well.

National Sentence Text: Dry wells may be used only when located in areas where the natural groundwater level is below the bottom of the dry well.
P/T Sentence Text: Dry wells may be used only when located in areas where the natural groundwater level is below the bottom of the dry well.

National Sentence Text: Dry wells shall be not less than 5 m from the buildingfoundation and located so that drainage is away from the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Dry wells shall be not less than 5 m from the buildingfoundation and located so that drainage is away from the building.

National Sentence Text: The building shall be located or the building site graded so that water will not accumulate at or near the building.
P/T Sentence Text: The building shall be located or the building site graded so that water will not accumulate at or near the building.

National Sentence Text: Surface drainage shall be directed away from the location of a water supply well or septic tank disposal bed.
P/T Sentence Text: Surface drainage shall be directed away from the location of a water supply well or septic tank disposal bed.

National Sentence Text: Every window well shall be drained to the footing level or other suitable location.
P/T Sentence Text: Every window well shall be drained to the footing level or other suitable location.

National Sentence Text: Where runoff water from a driveway is likely to accumulate or enter a garage, a catch basin shall be installed to provide adequate drainage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where runoff water from a driveway is likely to accumulate or enter a garage, a catch basin shall be installed to provide adequate drainage.

National Sentence Text: Downspouts shall conform to Article 9.26.18.2. (See Notes A-9.15.1.1.and A-9.4.4.6. and 9.15.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Downspouts shall conform to Article 9.26.18.2.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.15.1.2.and 9.15.1.3., this Section applies to concrete or unit masonry foundation walls and concrete footings not subject to surcharge on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and for buildings of wood-frame or masonry construction, wood-frame foundation walls and wood or concrete footings not subject to surcharge on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and for buildings of wood-frame construction, and flat insulating concrete form foundation walls and concrete footings not subject to surcharge (see Note A-9.15.1.1.(1)(c) and 9.20.1.1.(1)(b)) on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and for buildings of light-frame or flat insulating concrete form construction that are not more than 2 storeys in building height, with a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m, and containing only a single dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.15.1.2. and 9.15.1.3., this Section applies to concrete or unit masonry foundation walls and concrete footings not subject to surcharge on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and for buildings of wood-frame or masonry construction, wood-frame foundation walls and wood or concrete footings not subject to surcharge on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and for buildings of wood-frame construction, and flat insulating concrete form foundation walls and concrete footings not subject to surcharge (see Note A-9.15.1.1.(1)(c)) on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and for buildings of light-frame or flat insulating concrete form construction that are not more than 2 storeys in building height, with a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m, and containing only a single dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Foundations for applications other than as described in Sentence 9.15.1.1.(1) shall be designed in accordance with Section 9.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Foundations for applications other than as described in Sentence 9.15.1.1.(1) shall be designed in accordance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: Buildings erected on permafrost shall have foundations designed by a designer competent in this field in accordance with the appropriate requirements of Part 4..
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings erected on permafrost shall have foundations designed by a designer competent in this field in accordance with the appropriate requirements of part 4..

National Sentence Text: Where the superstructure of a detached building conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1-09 Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes the foundation shall be constructed in conformance with the remainder of this Section, or CSA Z240.10.1-16 Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Where the superstructure of a detached building conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1-09 Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes the foundation shall be constructed in conformance with the remainder of this Section, or CSA Z240.10.1-16 Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings

National Sentence Text: Concrete shall conform to Section 9.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Concrete block shall conform to CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units and shall have a compressive strength over the average net cross-sectional area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete block shall conform to CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units and shall have a compressive strength over the average net cross-sectional area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.

National Sentence Text: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: For concrete block foundation walls required to be reinforced, mortar shall be Type S, conforming to CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry grout shall be coarse, conforming to CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry and placement of grout shall conform to CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: For concrete block foundation walls required to be reinforced, mortar shall be Type S, conforming to CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry grout shall be coarse, conforming to CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry and placement of grout shall conform to CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings

National Sentence Text: Where pier-type foundations are used, the piers shall be designed to support the applied loads from the superstructure.
P/T Sentence Text: Where pier-type foundations are used, the piers shall be designed to support the applied loads from the superstructure.

National Sentence Text: Where piers are used as a foundation system in a building of 1 storey in building height, the piers shall be installed to support the principal framing members and shall be spaced not more than 3.5 m apart along the framing, unless the piers and their footings are designed for larger spacings.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piers are used as a foundation system in a building of 1 storey in building height, the piers shall be installed to support the principal framing members and shall be spaced not more than 3.5 m apart along the framing, unless the piers and their footings are designed for larger spacings.

National Sentence Text: The height of piers described in Sentence 9.15.2.3.(2) shall not exceed 3 times their least dimension at the base of the pier.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of piers described in Sentence 9.15.2.3.(2) shall not exceed 3 times their least dimension at the base of the pier.

National Sentence Text: Where concrete block is used for piers described in Sentence 9.15.2.3.(2), they shall be laid with cores placed vertically, and where the width of the building is 4.3 m or less, placed with their longest dimension at right angles to the longest dimension of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Where concrete block is used for piers described in Sentence 9.15.2.3.(2), they shall be laid with cores placed vertically, and where the width of the building is 4.3 m or less, placed with their longest dimension at right angles to the longest dimension of the building.

National Sentence Text: Foundations of wood-frame construction shall conform to CSA S406-16 Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings or Part 4. (See Note A-9.15.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Foundations of wood-frame construction shall conform to CSA S406-16 Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings or part 4..

National Sentence Text: Footings shall be provided under walls, pilasters, columns, piers, fireplaces and chimneys that bear on soil or rock, except that footings may be omitted under piers or monolithic concrete walls if the safe loadbearing capacity of the soil or rock is not exceeded.
P/T Sentence Text: Footings shall be provided under walls, pilasters, columns, piers, fireplaces and chimneys that bear on soil or rock, except that footings may be omitted under piers or monolithic concrete walls if the safe loadbearing capacity of the soil or rock is not exceeded.

National Sentence Text: Footings shall rest on undisturbed soil, rock or compacted granular fill.
P/T Sentence Text: Footings shall rest on undisturbed soil, rock or compacted granular fill.

National Sentence Text: Granular fill shall not contain pyritic material in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Granular fill shall not contain pyritic material in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.15.3.4.(2), the minimum footing width or area requirements provided in Articles 9.15.3.4.to 9.15.3.7. shall apply to footings, where the footings support foundation walls of masonry, concrete, or flat insulating concrete form walls, above-ground walls of masonry, flat insulating concrete form walls or light wood-frame construction, and floors and roofs of light wood-frame construction, the span of supported joists does not exceed 4.9 m, and the specified live load on any floor supported by the footing does not exceed 2.4 kPa (see Table 4.1.5.3.).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.15.3.4.(2), the minimum footing width or area requirements provided in Articles 9.15.3.4.to 9.15.3.7. shall apply to footings, where the footings support foundation walls of masonry, concrete, or flat insulating concrete form walls, above-ground walls of masonry, flat insulating concrete form walls or light wood-frame construction, and floors and roofs of light wood-frame construction, the span of supported joists does not exceed 4.9 m, and the specified live load on any floor supported by the footing does not exceed 2.4 kPa (see Table 4.1.5.3.).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.15.3.4.(2), where the span of the supported joists exceeds 4.9 m, footings shall be designed in accordance with Section 4.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.15.3.4.(2), where the span of the supported joists exceeds 4.9 m, footings shall be designed in accordance with part 4.

National Sentence Text: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa, footings shall be designed in accordance with Section 4.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa, footings shall be designed in accordance with part 4.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.15.3.4.(2)and 9.15.3.4.(3) and in Articles 9.15.3.5.to 9.15.3.7., the minimum footing width or area shall comply with Table 9.15.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.15.3.4.(2) and 9.15.3.4.(3) and in Articles 9.15.3.5. to 9.15.3.7., the minimum footing width or area shall comply with Table 9.15.3.4.

National Sentence Text: Where the supported joist span exceeds 4.9 m in buildings with light wood-frame walls, floors and roofs, footing widths shall be determined according to Section 4.2., or the following formula W=w•Ssjs/ storeys•4.9where W= minimum footing width, w= minimum width of footings supporting joists not exceeding 4.9 m, as defined by Table 9.15.3.4.,   sjs= sum of the supported joist spans on each storey whose load is transferred to the footing, and storeys= number of storeys supported by the footing. (See Note A-9.15.3.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the supported joist span exceeds 4.9 m in buildings with light wood-frame walls, floors and roofs, footing widths shall be determined according to part 4., or the following formula W=w•Ssjs/ storeys•4.9where W= minimum footing width, w= minimum width of footings supporting joists not exceeding 4.9 m, as defined by Table 9.15.3.4.,   sjs= sum of the supported joist spans on each storey whose load is transferred to the footing, and storeys= number of storeys supported by the footing.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation rests on gravel, sand or silt in which the water table level is less than the width of the footings below the bearing surface, the footing width for walls shall be not less than twice the width required by Sentences 9.15.3.4.(1)and 9.15.3.4.(2), and Articles 9.15.3.5.and 9.15.3.6., and the footing area for columns shall be not less than twice the area required by Sentences 9.15.3.4.(1)and 9.15.3.4.(2) and Article 9.15.3.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation rests on gravel, sand or silt in which the water table level is less than the width of the footings below the bearing surface, the footing width for walls shall be not less than twice the width required by Sentences 9.15.3.4.(1) and 9.15.3.4.(2), and Articles 9.15.3.5. and 9.15.3.6., and the footing area for columns shall be not less than twice the area required by Sentences 9.15.3.4.(1) and 9.15.3.4.(2) and Article 9.15.3.7.

National Sentence Text: The strip footing widths for exterior walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by 65 mm for each storey of masonry veneer over wood-frame construction supported by the foundation wall, 130 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the foundation wall, and 150 mm for each storey of flat insulating concrete form wall construction supported by the foundation wall.
P/T Sentence Text: The strip footing widths for exterior walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by 65 mm for each storey of masonry veneer over wood-frame construction supported by the foundation wall, 130 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the foundation wall, and 150 mm for each storey of flat insulating concrete form wall construction supported by the foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: The minimum strip footing widths for interior loadbearing masonry walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by 100 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the footing.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum strip footing widths for interior loadbearing masonry walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by 100 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the footing.

National Sentence Text: Footings for interior non-loadbearing masonry walls shall be not less than 200 mm wide for walls up to 5.5 m high and the width shall be increased by 100 mm for each additional 2.7 m of height.
P/T Sentence Text: Footings for interior non-loadbearing masonry walls shall be not less than 200 mm wide for walls up to 5.5 m high and the width shall be increased by 100 mm for each additional 2.7 m of height.

National Sentence Text: The footing area for column spacings other than shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be adjusted in proportion to the distance between columns.
P/T Sentence Text: The footing area for column spacings other than shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be adjusted in proportion to the distance between columns.

National Sentence Text: Footing thickness shall be not less than the greater of 100 mm, or the width of the projection of the footing beyond the supported element.
P/T Sentence Text: Footing thickness shall be not less than the greater of 100 mm, or the width of the projection of the footing beyond the supported element.

National Sentence Text: Where step footings are used, the vertical rise between horizontal portions shall not exceed 600 mm, and the horizontal distance between risers shall not be less than 600 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where step footings are used, the vertical rise between horizontal portions shall not exceed 600 mm, and the horizontal distance between risers shall not be less than 600 mm.

National Sentence Text: Insulating concrete form units shall be manufactured of polystyrene conforming to the performance requirements of ULC CAN/ULC-S701.1-17 Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards for Type 2, 3 or 4 polystyrene.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating concrete form units shall be manufactured of polystyrene conforming to the performance requirements of ULC CAN/ULC-S701.1-17 Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards for Type 2, 3 or 4 polystyrene.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.15.4.2.(2), the thickness of foundation walls made of unreinforced concrete block or solid concrete and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.-A for walls not exceeding 3.0 m in unsupported height.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.15.4.2.(2), the thickness of foundation walls made of unreinforced concrete block or solid concrete and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.-A for walls not exceeding 3.0 m in unsupported height.

National Sentence Text: The thickness of concrete in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be not less than the greater of 140 mm, or the thickness of the concrete in the wall above.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of concrete in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be not less than the greater of 140 mm, or the thickness of the concrete in the wall above.

National Sentence Text: Foundation walls made of flat insulating concrete form units shall be laterally supported at the top and at the bottom.
P/T Sentence Text: Foundation walls made of flat insulating concrete form units shall be laterally supported at the top and at the bottom.

National Sentence Text: The thickness and reinforcing of foundation walls made of reinforced concrete block and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.-B and Sentences 9.15.4.2.(5)to 9.15.4.2.(8), where the walls are laterally supported at the top, average stable soils are encountered, and wind loads on the exposed portion of the foundation are no greater than 0.70 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness and reinforcing of foundation walls made of reinforced concrete block and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.-B and Sentences 9.15.4.2.(5)to 9.15.4.2.(8), where the walls are laterally supported at the top, average stable soils are encountered, and wind loads on the exposed portion of the foundation are no greater than 0.70 kPa.

National Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, continuous vertical reinforcement shall be provided at wall corners, wall ends, wall intersections, at changes in wall height, at the jambs of all openings and at movement joints, extend from the top of the footing to the top of the foundation wall, and where foundation walls are laterally supported at the top, have not less than 50 mm embedment into the footing, if the floor slab does not provide lateral support at the wall base.
P/T Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, continuous vertical reinforcement shall be provided at wall corners, wall ends, wall intersections, at changes in wall height, at the jambs of all openings and at movement joints, extend from the top of the footing to the top of the foundation wall, and where foundation walls are laterally supported at the top, have not less than 50 mm embedment into the footing, if the floor slab does not provide lateral support at the wall base.

National Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, a continuous horizontal bond beam containing not less than one 15M bar shall be installed along the top of the wall, at the sill and head of all openings greater than 1.20 m in width, and at structurally connected floors.
P/T Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, a continuous horizontal bond beam containing not less than one 15M bar shall be installed along the top of the wall, at the sill and head of all openings greater than 1.20 m in width, and at structurally connected floors.

National Sentence Text: In concrete block walls required to be reinforced, all vertical bar reinforcement shall be installed along the centre line of the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: In concrete block walls required to be reinforced, all vertical bar reinforcement shall be installed along the centre line of the wall.

National Sentence Text: In concrete block walls required to be reinforced, ladder- or truss-type lateral reinforcement not less than 3.8 mm in diameter (no. 9 shall be installed in the bed joint of every second masonry course.
P/T Sentence Text: In concrete block walls required to be reinforced, ladder- or truss-type lateral reinforcement not less than 3.8 mm in diameter (no. 9 shall be installed in the bed joint of every second masonry course.

National Sentence Text: Sentences 9.15.4.3.(2)to 9.15.4.3.(4) pertain to lateral support for walls described in Sentence 9.15.4.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Sentences 9.15.4.3.(2) to 9.15.4.3.(4) pertain to lateral support for walls described in Sentence 9.15.4.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: Foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the top if such walls support a solid masonry superstructure, the floor joists are embedded in the top of the foundation walls, or the floor system is anchored to the top of the foundation walls with anchor bolts, in which case the joists may run either parallel or perpendicular to the foundation walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the top if such walls support a solid masonry superstructure, the floor joists are embedded in the top of the foundation walls, or the floor system is anchored to the top of the foundation walls with anchor bolts, in which case the joists may run either parallel or perpendicular to the foundation walls.

National Sentence Text: Unless the wall around an opening is reinforced to withstand earth pressure, the portion of the foundation wall beneath an opening shall be considered laterally unsupported if the opening is more than 1.2 m wide, or the total width of the openings in the foundation wall constitutes more than 25% of the length of the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless the wall around an opening is reinforced to withstand earth pressure, the portion of the foundation wall beneath an opening shall be considered laterally unsupported if the opening is more than 1.2 m wide, or the total width of the openings in the foundation wall constitutes more than 25% of the length of the wall.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of Sentence 9.15.4.3.(3), the combined width of the openings shall be considered as a single opening if the average width is greater than the width of solid wall between them.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of Sentence 9.15.4.3.(3), the combined width of the openings shall be considered as a single opening if the average width is greater than the width of solid wall between them.

National Sentence Text: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the top if the floor joists are installed according to Article 9.20.17.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the top if the floor joists are installed according to Article 9.20.17.5.

National Sentence Text: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the bottom where the foundation wall supports backfill not more than 1.2 m in height, is supported at the footing by a shear key and at the top by the ground floor framing, or is doweled to the footing with not less than 15M bars spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the bottom where the foundation wall supports backfill not more than 1.2 m in height, is supported at the footing by a shear key and at the top by the ground floor framing, or is doweled to the footing with not less than 15M bars spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall consist of one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and 10M bars at 600 mm o.c., and be located in the inside half of the wall section, and with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall consist of one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and 10M bars at 600 mm o.c., and be located in the inside half of the wall section, and with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete.

National Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be provided in accordance with Table 9.15.4.5.-A for 140 mm walls, Table 9.15.4.5.-B for 190 mm walls, and Table 9.15.4.5.-C for 240 mm walls, located in the inside half of the wall section with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete wall, and where interrupted by wall openings, placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the openings.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be provided in accordance with Table 9.15.4.5.-A for 140 mm walls, Table 9.15.4.5.-B for 190 mm walls, and Table 9.15.4.5.-C for 240 mm walls, located in the inside half of the wall section with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete wall, and where interrupted by wall openings, placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the openings.

National Sentence Text: Cold joints in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be reinforced with no less than one 15M bar spaced at not more than 600 mm o.c. and embedded 300 mm on both sides of the joint.
P/T Sentence Text: Cold joints in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be reinforced with no less than one 15M bar spaced at not more than 600 mm o.c. and embedded 300 mm on both sides of the joint.

National Sentence Text: Reinforcing around openings in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall comply with Article 9.20.17.3.or 9.20.17.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Reinforcing around openings in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall comply with Article 9.20.17.3. or 9.20.17.4.

National Sentence Text: Exterior foundation walls shall extend not less than 150 mm above finished ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior foundation walls shall extend not less than 150 mm above finished ground level.

National Sentence Text: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of floor joists, the reduced section shall be not more than 350 mm high and not less than 90 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of floor joists, the reduced section shall be not more than 350 mm high and not less than 90 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of a masonry exterior facing, the reduced section shall be not less than 90 mm thick, and tied to the facing material with metal ties conforming to Sentence 9.20.9.4.(3) spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. vertically, and 900 mm o.c. horizontally.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of a masonry exterior facing, the reduced section shall be not less than 90 mm thick, and tied to the facing material with metal ties conforming to Sentence 9.20.9.4.(3) spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. vertically, and 900 mm o.c. horizontally.

National Sentence Text: The space between wall and facing described in Sentence 9.15.4.7.(2) shall be filled with mortar.
P/T Sentence Text: The space between wall and facing described in Sentence 9.15.4.7.(2) shall be filled with mortar.

National Sentence Text: Corbelling of masonry foundation walls supporting cavity walls shall conform to Article 9.20.12.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Corbelling of masonry foundation walls supporting cavity walls shall conform to Article 9.20.12.2.

National Sentence Text: Crack control joints shall be provided in foundation walls more than 25 m long at intervals of not more than 15 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Crack control joints shall be provided in foundation walls more than 25 m long at intervals of not more than 15 m.

National Sentence Text: Joints required in Sentence 9.15.4.9.(1) shall be designed to resist moisture penetration and shall be keyed to prevent relative displacement of the wall portions adjacent to the joint.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints required in Sentence 9.15.4.9.(1) shall be designed to resist moisture penetration and shall be keyed to prevent relative displacement of the wall portions adjacent to the joint.

National Sentence Text: Interior masonry foundation walls not subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Section 9.20.
P/T Sentence Text: Interior masonry foundation walls not subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.15.5.1.(2), foundation walls of hollow masonry units supporting floor joists shall be capped with not less than 50 mm of concrete, solid masonry units that are 100% solid and not less than 50 mm high, or semi-solid or hollow solid masonry units that have the top course completely filled with mortar, grout or concrete.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.15.5.1.(2), foundation walls of hollow masonry units supporting floor joists shall be capped with not less than 50 mm of concrete, solid masonry units that are 100% solid and not less than 50 mm high, or semi-solid or hollow solid masonry units that have the top course completely filled with mortar, grout or concrete.

National Sentence Text: Capping required in Sentence 9.15.5.1.(1) need not be provided in localities where termites are not known to occur, when the joists are supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm, and when the siding overlaps the foundation wall not less than 12 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Capping required in Sentence 9.15.5.1.(1) need not be provided in localities where termites are not known to occur, when the joists are supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm, and when the siding overlaps the foundation wall not less than 12 mm.

National Sentence Text: Not less than 190 mm depth of solid masonry shall be provided beneath beams supported on masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than 190 mm depth of solid masonry shall be provided beneath beams supported on masonry.

National Sentence Text: Where the beam referred to in Sentence 9.15.5.2.(1) is supported below the top of the foundation walls, the ends of such beams shall be protected from the weather.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the beam referred to in Sentence 9.15.5.2.(1) is supported below the top of the foundation walls, the ends of such beams shall be protected from the weather.

National Sentence Text: Pilasters shall be provided under beams that frame into unit masonry foundation walls 140 mm or less in thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: Pilasters shall be provided under beams that frame into unit masonry foundation walls 140 mm or less in thickness.

National Sentence Text: Pilasters required in Sentence 9.15.5.3.(1) shall be not less than 90 mm by 290 mm and shall be bonded or tied into the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Pilasters required in Sentence 9.15.5.3.(1) shall be not less than 90 mm by 290 mm and shall be bonded or tied into the wall.

National Sentence Text: The top 200 mm of pilasters required in Sentence 9.15.5.3.(1) shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout or concrete.
P/T Sentence Text: The top 200 mm of pilasters required in Sentence 9.15.5.3.(1) shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout or concrete.

National Sentence Text: Concrete block foundation walls shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level as required in Section 9.13.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete block foundation walls shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level as required in part 9.

National Sentence Text: Exterior surfaces of concrete block foundation walls above ground level shall have tooled joints, or shall be parged or otherwise suitably finished.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior surfaces of concrete block foundation walls above ground level shall have tooled joints, or shall be parged or otherwise suitably finished.

National Sentence Text: All form ties shall be removed at least flush with the concrete surface.
P/T Sentence Text: All form ties shall be removed at least flush with the concrete surface.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to floors supported on ground or on granular fill that do not provide structural support for the superstructure.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to floors supported on ground or on granular fill that do not provide structural support for the superstructure.

National Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground that support loads from the superstructure shall be designed in conformance with Part 4..
P/T Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground that support loads from the superstructure shall be designed in conformance with part 4..

National Sentence Text: All spaces within dwelling units, except crawl spaces, shall be provided with a floor-on-ground, where access is provided to the space, and a floor supported by the structure is not provided.
P/T Sentence Text: All spaces within dwelling units, except crawl spaces, shall be provided with a floor-on-ground, where access is provided to the space, and a floor supported by the structure is not provided.

National Sentence Text: Dampproofing and waterproofing shall conform to Section 9.13.
P/T Sentence Text: Dampproofing and waterproofing shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.16.2.1.(2), not less than 100 mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve shall be placed beneath floors-on-ground. (See also Subsection 9.13.4. and Note A-9.13.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.16.2.1.(2), not less than 100 mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve shall be placed beneath floors-on-ground. (See also part 9. and Note A-9.13.4.)

National Sentence Text: Granular material need not be installed under slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained therein permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter.
P/T Sentence Text: Granular material need not be installed under slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained therein permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter.

National Sentence Text: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to variations in moisture content or chemical-microbiological oxidation shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to variations in moisture content or chemical-microbiological oxidation shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to freezing shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground that will be subjected to freezing temperatures. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to freezing shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground that will be subjected to freezing temperatures. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.16.2.2.(4), fill beneath floors-on-ground shall be compacted.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.16.2.2.(4), fill beneath floors-on-ground shall be compacted.

National Sentence Text: Fill beneath floors-on-ground need not be compacted where the material is clean coarse aggregate containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve.
P/T Sentence Text: Fill beneath floors-on-ground need not be compacted where the material is clean coarse aggregate containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.16.3.2. or where it can be shown to be unnecessary, ingress of water underneath a floor-on-ground shall be prevented by grading or drainage.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.16.3.2. or where it can be shown to be unnecessary, ingress of water underneath a floor-on-ground shall be prevented by grading or drainage.

National Sentence Text: Where groundwater levels may cause hydrostatic pressure beneath a floor-on-ground, the floor-on-ground shall be a poured concrete slab, and designed to resist such pressures.
P/T Sentence Text: Where groundwater levels may cause hydrostatic pressure beneath a floor-on-ground, the floor-on-ground shall be a poured concrete slab, and designed to resist such pressures.

National Sentence Text: When floor drains are required (see Section 9.31.), the floor surface shall be sloped so that no water can accumulate.
P/T Sentence Text: When floor drains are required (see part 9.), the floor surface shall be sloped so that no water can accumulate.

National Sentence Text: The finished surface of concrete floor slabs shall be trowelled smooth and even.
P/T Sentence Text: The finished surface of concrete floor slabs shall be trowelled smooth and even.

National Sentence Text: Dry cement shall not be added to the floor surfaces to absorb surplus water.
