P/T Sentence Text: Dry cement shall not be added to the floor surfaces to absorb surplus water.

National Sentence Text: When a topping course is provided for a concrete floor slab, it shall consist of 1 part cement to 2.5 parts clean, well graded sand by volume, with a water/cement ratio approximately equal to that of the base slab.
P/T Sentence Text: When a topping course is provided for a concrete floor slab, it shall consist of 1 part cement to 2.5 parts clean, well graded sand by volume, with a water/cement ratio approximately equal to that of the base slab.

National Sentence Text: When concrete topping is provided, it shall not be less than 20 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: When concrete topping is provided, it shall not be less than 20 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Concrete slabs shall not be less than 75 mm thick exclusive of concrete topping.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete slabs shall not be less than 75 mm thick exclusive of concrete topping.

National Sentence Text: A bond-breaking material shall be placed between the slab and footings or rock.
P/T Sentence Text: A bond-breaking material shall be placed between the slab and footings or rock.

National Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground constructed of wood shall conform to CSA S406-16 Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground constructed of wood shall conform to CSA S406-16 Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to columns used to support beams carrying loads from not more than 2 wood-frame floors where the supported length of joists bearing on such beams does not exceed 5 m, and the live load on any floor does not exceed 2.4 kPa (see Table 4.1.5.3.), beams or header joists carrying loads from not more than 2 levels of wood-frame balconies, decks or other accessible exterior platforms, or 1 level plus the roof, where the supported length of joists bearing on such beams or joists does not exceed 5 m, the sum of the specified snow and occupancy loads does not exceed 4.8 kPa (see Sentence 9.4.2.3.(1) for the determination of load on platform-type constructions), and the platform serves only a single suite of residential occupancy, or carport roofs (see Section 9.35.).
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to columns used to support beams carrying loads from not more than 2 wood-frame floors where the supported length of joists bearing on such beams does not exceed 5 m, and the live load on any floor does not exceed 2.4 kPa (see Table 4.1.5.3.), beams or header joists carrying loads from not more than 2 levels of wood-frame balconies, decks or other accessible exterior platforms, or 1 level plus the roof, where the supported length of joists bearing on such beams or joists does not exceed 5 m, the sum of the specified snow and occupancy loads does not exceed 4.8 kPa (see Sentence 9.4.2.3.(1) for the determination of load on platform-type constructions), and the platform serves only a single suite of residential occupancy, or carport roofs (see part 9.).

National Sentence Text: Columns for applications other than as described in Sentence 9.17.1.1.(1) shall be designed in accordance with Part 4..
P/T Sentence Text: Columns for applications other than as described in Sentence 9.17.1.1.(1) shall be designed in accordance with part 4..

National Sentence Text: Columns shall be centrally located on a footing conforming to Section 9.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns shall be centrally located on a footing conforming to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Columns shall be securely fastened to the supported member to reduce the likelihood of lateral differential movement between the column and the supported member. (See also Article 9.23.6.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Columns shall be securely fastened to the supported member to reduce the likelihood of lateral differential movement between the column and the supported member. (See also Article 9.23.6.2.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.17.2.2.(3), columns shall be laterally supported to resist racking directly, or by connection to the supported members. (See Note A-9.17.2.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.17.2.2.(3), columns shall be laterally supported to resist racking directly, or by connection to the supported members.

National Sentence Text: Columns need not be provided with lateral support as described in Sentence 9.17.2.2.(2), where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, and the columns support a deck with no superstructure.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns need not be provided with lateral support as described in Sentence 9.17.2.2.(2), where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, and the columns support a deck with no superstructure.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.17.3.1.(2), steel pipe columns shall have an outside diameter of not less than 73 mm and a wall thickness of not less than 4.76 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.17.3.1.(2), steel pipe columns shall have an outside diameter of not less than 73 mm and a wall thickness of not less than 4.76 mm.

National Sentence Text: Columns of sizes other than as specified in Sentence 9.17.3.1.(1) are permitted to be used where the loadbearing capacities are shown to be adequate.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns of sizes other than as specified in Sentence 9.17.3.1.(1) are permitted to be used where the loadbearing capacities are shown to be adequate.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.17.3.2.(2), steel columns shall be fitted with not less than 100 mm by 100 mm by 6.35 mm thick steel plates at each end, and where the column supports a wooden beam, the top plate shall extend across the full width of the beam.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.17.3.2.(2), steel columns shall be fitted with not less than 100 mm by 100 mm by 6.35 mm thick steel plates at each end, and where the column supports a wooden beam, the top plate shall extend across the full width of the beam.

National Sentence Text: The top plate required in Sentence 9.17.3.2.(1) need not be provided where a column supports a steel beam and provision is made for the attachment of the column to the beam.
P/T Sentence Text: The top plate required in Sentence 9.17.3.2.(1) need not be provided where a column supports a steel beam and provision is made for the attachment of the column to the beam.

National Sentence Text: Exterior steel columns shall be treated on the outside surface with at least one coat of rust-inhibitive paint. (See Note A-9.17.3.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior steel columns shall be treated on the outside surface with at least one coat of rust-inhibitive paint.

National Sentence Text: Where the imposed load does not exceed 36 kN, adjustable steel columns shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-7.2-94 Adjustable Steel Columns
P/T Sentence Text: Where the imposed load does not exceed 36 kN, adjustable steel columns shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-7.2-94 Adjustable Steel Columns

National Sentence Text: Steel columns other than those described in Sentence 9.17.3.4.(1) shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel columns other than those described in Sentence 9.17.3.4.(1) shall be designed in accordance with part 4..

National Sentence Text: The width or diameter of a wood column shall be not less than the width of the supported member.
P/T Sentence Text: The width or diameter of a wood column shall be not less than the width of the supported member.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.35.4.2., columns shall be not less than 184 mm for round columns and 140 mm by 140 mm for rectangular columns, unless calculations are provided to show that lesser sizes are adequate.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.35.4.2., columns shall be not less than 184 mm for round columns and 140 mm by 140 mm for rectangular columns, unless calculations are provided to show that lesser sizes are adequate.

National Sentence Text: Wood columns shall be either solid, glued-laminated or built-up.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood columns shall be either solid, glued-laminated or built-up.

National Sentence Text: Built-up columns shall consist of not less than 38 mm thick full-length members bolted together with not less than 9.52 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 450 mm o.c., or nailed together with not less than 76 mm nails spaced not more than 300 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Built-up columns shall consist of not less than 38 mm thick full-length members bolted together with not less than 9.52 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 450 mm o.c., or nailed together with not less than 76 mm nails spaced not more than 300 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Glued-laminated columns shall conform to Section 4.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Glued-laminated columns shall conform to part 4.

National Sentence Text: Wood columns shall be separated from concrete in contact with the ground by 0.05 mm polyethylene film or Type S roll roofing.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood columns shall be separated from concrete in contact with the ground by 0.05 mm polyethylene film or Type S roll roofing.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry columns shall be built of masonry units conforming to CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units and having a compressive strength over the net area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry columns shall be built of masonry units conforming to CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units and having a compressive strength over the net area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry columns shall be not less than 290 mm by 290 mm or 240 mm by 380 mm in size.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry columns shall be not less than 290 mm by 290 mm or 240 mm by 380 mm in size.

National Sentence Text: Concrete shall conform to Section 9.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Concrete columns shall be not less than 200 mm by 200 mm for rectangular columns and 230 mm diam for circular columns.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete columns shall be not less than 200 mm by 200 mm for rectangular columns and 230 mm diam for circular columns.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to crawl spaces whose exterior walls have less than 25% of their total area above exterior ground level open to the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to crawl spaces whose exterior walls have less than 25% of their total area above exterior ground level open to the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: Foundations enclosing crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Foundations enclosing crawl spaces shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Crawl spaces shall be considered to be heated where the space is used as a hot air plenum, contains heating ducts that are not sealed and insulated to minimize heat loss to the space, or is not separated from heated space in accordance with Section 9.25.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Crawl spaces shall be considered to be heated where the space is used as a hot air plenum, contains heating ducts that are not sealed and insulated to minimize heat loss to the space, or is not separated from heated space in accordance with Section 9.25.
P/T Sentence Text: Crawl spaces shall be considered to be heated where the space contains heating ducts that are not sealed and insulated to minimize heat loss to the space, or is not separated from heated space in accordance with part 9.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Crawl spaces shall be considered to be heated where the space contains heating ducts that are not sealed and insulated to minimize heat loss to the space, or is not separated from heated space in accordance with Section 9.25.

National Sentence Text: Heating of heated crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.33.
P/T Sentence Text: Heating of heated crawl spaces shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Insulation, an air barrier system and a vapour barrier shall be installed in the walls of heated crawl spaces in accordance with Section 9.25.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation, an air barrier system and a vapour barrier shall be installed in the walls of heated crawl spaces in accordance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: An access opening of not less than 500 mm by 700 mm shall be provided to each crawl space where the crawl space serves a single dwelling unit, and not less than 550 mm by 900 mm for other crawl spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: An access opening of not less than 500 mm by 700 mm shall be provided to each crawl space where the crawl space serves a single dwelling unit, and not less than 550 mm by 900 mm for other crawl spaces.

National Sentence Text: Access openings shall be fitted with a door or hatch, except when the crawl space is heated and the access opening into the crawl space is from an adjacent heated space.
P/T Sentence Text: Access openings shall be fitted with a door or hatch, except when the crawl space is heated and the access opening into the crawl space is from an adjacent heated space.

National Sentence Text: Unheated crawl spaces shall be ventilated by natural or mechanical means.
P/T Sentence Text: Unheated crawl spaces shall be ventilated by natural or mechanical means.

National Sentence Text: Where an unheated crawl space is ventilated by natural means, ventilation shall be provided to the outside air by not less than 0.1 m2 of unobstructed vent area for every 50 m2 of floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an unheated crawl space is ventilated by natural means, ventilation shall be provided to the outside air by not less than 0.1 m2 of unobstructed vent area for every 50 m2 of floor area.

National Sentence Text: Vents shall be uniformly distributed on opposite sides of the building, and designed to prevent the entry of snow, rain and insects.
P/T Sentence Text: Vents shall be uniformly distributed on opposite sides of the building, and designed to prevent the entry of snow, rain and insects.

National Sentence Text: Heated crawl spaces shall be ventilated in accordance with Section 9.32. (See also Article 9.3.2.9.)
P/T Sentence Text: Heated crawl spaces shall be ventilated in accordance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: Where equipment requiring service such as plumbing cleanouts, traps and burners is located in crawl spaces, an access way with a height and width of not less than 600 mm shall be provided from the access door to the equipment and for a distance of 900 mm on the side or sides of the equipment to be serviced.
P/T Sentence Text: Where equipment requiring service such as plumbing cleanouts, traps and burners is located in crawl spaces, an access way with a height and width of not less than 600 mm shall be provided from the access door to the equipment and for a distance of 900 mm on the side or sides of the equipment to be serviced.

National Sentence Text: Except where it can be shown to be unnecessary, the ingress of water into a crawl space shall be controlled by grading or drainage.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where it can be shown to be unnecessary, the ingress of water into a crawl space shall be controlled by grading or drainage.

National Sentence Text: Drainage of foundation walls shall conform to Article 9.14.2.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage of foundation walls shall conform to Article 9.14.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Drainage of the ground cover or floor-on-ground in the crawl space shall conform to Subsection 9.16.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage of the ground cover or floor-on-ground in the crawl space shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Drains shall conform to Section 9.14.
P/T Sentence Text: Drains shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is unheated, a ground cover shall be provided consisting of not less than 50 mm of asphalt, 100 mm of 15 MPa Portland cement concrete, Type S roll roofing, or 0.10 mm polyethylene.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is unheated, a ground cover shall be provided consisting of not less than 50 mm of asphalt, 100 mm of 15 MPa Portland cement concrete, Type S roll roofing, or 0.10 mm polyethylene.

National Sentence Text: Joints in sheet-type ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.1.(1) shall be lapped not less than 100 mm and weighted down.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints in sheet-type ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.1.(1) shall be lapped not less than 100 mm and weighted down.

National Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is heated, a ground cover consisting of not less than 0.15 mm polyethylene sheet conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction shall be installed as part of an air barrier system in accordance with Subsection 9.25.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is heated, a ground cover consisting of not less than 0.15 mm polyethylene sheet conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction shall be installed as part of an air barrier system in accordance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: The ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2.(1) shall have its joints lapped not less than 300 mm, and be sealed and evenly weighted down, or be covered with concrete not less than 50 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: The ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2.(1) shall have its joints lapped not less than 300 mm, and be sealed and evenly weighted down, or be covered with concrete not less than 50 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: The perimeter of the ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2.(1) shall be sealed to the foundation wall. (See Notes A-9.13.4., A-9.25.3.4. and 9.25.3.6., and A-9.25.3.6.(2) and (3).)
P/T Sentence Text: The perimeter of the ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2.(1) shall be sealed to the foundation wall. (See Notes A-9.13.4. , A-9.25.3.4., and A-9.25.3.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: All penetrations of the ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2.(1) shall be sealed against air leakage. (See Subsection 9.25.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: All penetrations of the ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2.(1) shall be sealed against air leakage. (See part 9.)

National Sentence Text: Only crawl spaces under 1-storey portions of dwelling units shall be used as warm-air plenums.
P/T Sentence Text: Only crawl spaces under 1-storey portions of dwelling units shall be used as warm-air plenums.

National Sentence Text: Enclosing material in crawl spaces described in Sentence 9.18.7.1.(1), including insulation, shall have a surface flame-spread rating not greater than 150.
P/T Sentence Text: Enclosing material in crawl spaces described in Sentence 9.18.7.1.(1), including insulation, shall have a surface flame-spread rating not greater than 150.

National Sentence Text: Combustible ground cover in crawl spaces described in Sentence 9.18.7.1.(1) shall be protected beneath each register opening with noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible ground cover in crawl spaces described in Sentence 9.18.7.1.(1) shall be protected beneath each register opening with noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: The noncombustible register protection described in Sentence 9.18.7.1.(3) shall extend not less than 300 mm beyond the projection of the register opening, and have up-turned edges. (See Note A-9.18.7.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: The noncombustible register protection described in Sentence 9.18.7.1.(3) shall extend not less than 300 mm beyond the projection of the register opening, and have up-turned edges.

National Sentence Text: Except where it can be shown to be unnecessary, where insulation is installed between a ceiling and the underside of the roof sheathing, a space shall be provided between the insulation and the sheathing, and vents shall be installed to permit the transfer of moisture from the space to the exterior. (See Note A-9.19.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where it can be shown to be unnecessary, where insulation is installed between a ceiling and the underside of the roof sheathing, a space shall be provided between the insulation and the sheathing, and vents shall be installed to permit the transfer of moisture from the space to the exterior. (See Note A-9.19.1.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.19.1.2.(2), the unobstructed vent area shall be not less than 1/300 of the insulated ceiling area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.19.1.2.(2), the unobstructed vent area shall be not less than 1/300 of the insulated ceiling area.

National Sentence Text: Where the roof slope is less than 1 in 6 or in roofs that are constructed with roof joists, the unobstructed vent area shall be not less than 1/150 of the insulated ceiling area.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the roof slope is less than 1 in 6 or in roofs that are constructed with roof joists, the unobstructed vent area shall be not less than 1/150 of the insulated ceiling area.

National Sentence Text: Required vents may be roof type, eave type, gable-end type or any combination thereof, and shall be distributed uniformly on opposite sides of the building, with not less than 25% of the required openings located at the top of the space, and with not less than 25% of the required openings located at the bottom of the space.
P/T Sentence Text: Required vents may be roof type, eave type, gable-end type or any combination thereof, and shall be distributed uniformly on opposite sides of the building, with not less than 25% of the required openings located at the top of the space, and with not less than 25% of the required openings located at the bottom of the space.

National Sentence Text: Except where each joist space is separately vented, roof joist spaces shall be interconnected by installing purlins not less than 38 mm by 38 mm on the top of the roof joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where each joist space is separately vented, roof joist spaces shall be interconnected by installing purlins not less than 38 mm by 38 mm on the top of the roof joists.

National Sentence Text: Vents shall comply with CSA CAN3-A93-M82 Natural Airflow Ventilators for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Vents shall comply with CSA CAN3-A93-M82 Natural Airflow Ventilators for Buildings

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.19.1.3.(2), not less than 63 mm of space shall be provided between the top of the insulation and the underside of the roof sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.19.1.3.(2), not less than 63 mm of space shall be provided between the top of the insulation and the underside of the roof sheathing.

National Sentence Text: At the junction of sloped roofs and exterior walls, where preformed baffles are used to contain the insulation, the baffles shall provide an unobstructed air space, between the insulation and the underside of the roof sheathing, that is not less than 25 mm in dimension, and of sufficient cross area to meet the attic or roof space venting requirements of Article 9.19.1.2., and extend vertically not less than 50 mm above the top of the insulation.
P/T Sentence Text: At the junction of sloped roofs and exterior walls, where preformed baffles are used to contain the insulation, the baffles shall provide an unobstructed air space, between the insulation and the underside of the roof sheathing, that is not less than 25 mm in dimension, and of sufficient cross area to meet the attic or roof space venting requirements of Article 9.19.1.2., and extend vertically not less than 50 mm above the top of the insulation.

National Sentence Text: Ceiling insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not restrict the free flow of air through roof vents or through any portion of the attic or roof space.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not restrict the free flow of air through roof vents or through any portion of the attic or roof space.

National Sentence Text: The lower portion of a mansard or gambrel style roof need not be ventilated.
P/T Sentence Text: The lower portion of a mansard or gambrel style roof need not be ventilated.

National Sentence Text: The upper portion of roofs described in Sentence 9.19.1.4.(1) shall be ventilated in conformance with Articles 9.19.1.1.to 9.19.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The upper portion of roofs described in Sentence 9.19.1.4.(1) shall be ventilated in conformance with Articles 9.19.1.1.to 9.19.1.3.

National Sentence Text: Every attic or roof space shall be provided with an access hatch where the open space in the attic or roof space measures 3 m2 or more in area, 1 m or more in length or width, and 600 mm or more in height over at least the area described in Clauses 9.19.2.1.(1)(a)and 9.19.2.1.(1)(b). (See Note A-9.19.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Every attic or roof space shall be provided with an access hatch where the open space in the attic or roof space measures 3 m2 or more in area, 1 m or more in length or width, and 600 mm or more in height over at least the area described in Clauses 9.19.2.1.(1)and 9.19.2.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: The hatch required in Sentence 9.19.2.1.(1) shall be not less than 550 mm by 900 mm except that, where the hatch serves not more than one dwelling unit, the hatch may be reduced to 0.32 m2 in area with no dimension less than 500 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The hatch required in Sentence 9.19.2.1.(1) shall be not less than 550 mm by 900 mm except that, where the hatch serves not more than one dwelling unit, the hatch may be reduced to 0.32 m2 in area with no dimension less than 500 mm.

National Sentence Text: Hatchways to attic or roof spaces shall be fitted with doors or covers.
P/T Sentence Text: Hatchways to attic or roof spaces shall be fitted with doors or covers.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.1.2., this Section applies to unreinforced masonry and masonry veneer walls not in contact with the ground, where the height of the walls constructed on the foundation walls does not exceed 11 m, and the roof or floor assembly above the first storey is not of concrete construction, and flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground that (see Note A-9.15.1.1.(1)(c) and 9.20.1.1.(1)(b)) have a maximum floor-to-floor height of 3 m, are erected in buildings not more than 2 storeys in building height and containing only a single dwelling unit, and are erected in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.4 (see Note A-9.20.1.2.).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.1.2., this Section applies to unreinforced masonry and masonry veneer walls not in contact with the ground, where the height of the walls constructed on the foundation walls does not exceed 11 m, and the roof or floor assembly above the first storey is not of concrete construction, and flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground that (see Note A-9.15.1.1.(1)(c)) have a maximum floor-to-floor height of 3 m, are erected in buildings not more than 2 storeys in building height and containing only a single dwelling unit, and are erected in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.4 (see Note A-9.20.1.2.).

National Sentence Text: For walls other than those described in Sentence 9.20.1.1.(1), or where the masonry walls or insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground are designed for specified loads on the basis of ultimate and serviceability limit states, Subsection 4.3.2. shall apply. (See Note A-9.20.1.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: For walls other than those described in Sentence 9.20.1.1.(1), or where the masonry walls or insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground are designed for specified loads on the basis of ultimate and serviceability limit states, part 4. shall apply.

National Sentence Text: In locations where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, loadbearing elements of masonry buildings more than 1 storey in building height shall be reinforced with not less than the minimum amount of reinforcement required by Subsection 9.20.15.
P/T Sentence Text: In locations where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, loadbearing elements of masonry buildings more than 1 storey in building height shall be reinforced with not less than the minimum amount of reinforcement required by part 9.

National Sentence Text: In locations where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.35 but less than or equal to 0.55, loadbearing elements of masonry buildings 3 storeys in building height shall be reinforced with not less than the minimum amount of reinforcement required by Subsection 9.20.15.
P/T Sentence Text: In locations where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.35 but less than or equal to 0.55, loadbearing elements of masonry buildings 3 storeys in building height shall be reinforced with not less than the minimum amount of reinforcement required by part 9.

National Sentence Text: Masonry units shall comply with ASTM C 73-10 Calcium Silicate Brick (Sand-Lime ASTM C 126-13 Ceramic Glazed Structural Clay Facing Tile, Facing Brick, and Solid Masonry Units ASTM C 212-14 Structural Clay Facing Tile CSA CAN/CSA-A82-14 Fired Masonry Brick Made from Clay or Shale CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units CSA A165.2-14 Concrete Brick Masonry Units or CSA A165.3-14 Prefaced Concrete Masonry Units
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry units shall comply with ASTM C 73-10 Calcium Silicate Brick (Sand-Lime ASTM C 126-13 Ceramic Glazed Structural Clay Facing Tile, Facing Brick, and Solid Masonry Units ASTM C 212-14 Structural Clay Facing Tile CSA CAN/CSA-A82-14 Fired Masonry Brick Made from Clay or Shale CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units CSA A165.2-14 Concrete Brick Masonry Units or CSA A165.3-14 Prefaced Concrete Masonry Units

National Sentence Text: Used bricks shall be free of old mortar, soot or other surface coating and shall conform to Article 9.20.2.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Used bricks shall be free of old mortar, soot or other surface coating and shall conform to Article 9.20.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Glass blocks shall not be used as loadbearing units or in the construction of fireplaces or chimneys.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass blocks shall not be used as loadbearing units or in the construction of fireplaces or chimneys.

National Sentence Text: Masonry made with cellular concrete shall not be used in contact with the soil or exposed to the weather.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry made with cellular concrete shall not be used in contact with the soil or exposed to the weather.

National Sentence Text: Stone shall be sound and durable.
P/T Sentence Text: Stone shall be sound and durable.

National Sentence Text: Concrete blocks exposed to the weather shall have density and water absorption characteristics conforming to concrete types A, B, C, or D described in CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete blocks exposed to the weather shall have density and water absorption characteristics conforming to concrete types A, B, C, or D described in CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units

National Sentence Text: The compressive strength of concrete blocks shall conform to Table 9.20.2.7.
P/T Sentence Text: The compressive strength of concrete blocks shall conform to Table 9.20.2.7.

National Sentence Text: Cementitious materials and aggregates for mortar and grout shall comply with CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Cementitious materials and aggregates for mortar and grout shall comply with CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry

National Sentence Text: Water and aggregate shall be clean and free of significant amounts of deleterious materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Water and aggregate shall be clean and free of significant amounts of deleterious materials.

National Sentence Text: Lime used in mortar shall be hydrated.
P/T Sentence Text: Lime used in mortar shall be hydrated.

National Sentence Text: If lime putty is used in mortar, it shall be made by slaking quicklime in water for not less than 24 h or soaking hydrated lime in water for not less than 12 h.
P/T Sentence Text: If lime putty is used in mortar, it shall be made by slaking quicklime in water for not less than 24 h or soaking hydrated lime in water for not less than 12 h.

National Sentence Text: Mortar types shall be in accordance with Table 9.20.3.2.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar types shall be in accordance with Table 9.20.3.2.-A.

National Sentence Text: Mortar for glass block masonry shall be Type S Portland cement-lime where exposed to the exterior, or Type S or N where protected from the exterior.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar for glass block masonry shall be Type S Portland cement-lime where exposed to the exterior, or Type S or N where protected from the exterior.

National Sentence Text: Mortar shall be mixed within the proportion limits provided in Table 9.20.3.2.-B, with sufficient water to bring the mixture to a consistency adequate for laying masonry units.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar shall be mixed within the proportion limits provided in Table 9.20.3.2.-B, with sufficient water to bring the mixture to a consistency adequate for laying masonry units.

National Sentence Text: Grout shall be mixed within the proportion limits provided in Table 9.20.3.2.-C, with sufficient water to provide a suitable flow to fill all voids completely, without excessive segregation or bleeding.
P/T Sentence Text: Grout shall be mixed within the proportion limits provided in Table 9.20.3.2.-C, with sufficient water to provide a suitable flow to fill all voids completely, without excessive segregation or bleeding.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.3.2.(6), mortar shall be used and placed in final position within 1.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is 25°C or higher, or within 2.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is less than 25°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.3.2.(6), mortar shall be used and placed in final position within 1.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is 25°C or higher, or within 2.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is less than 25°C.

National Sentence Text: Mortar and grout containing a set-control admixture shall be manufactured off-site in a batching plant and shall be used and placed in final position within a time not exceeding the useful life stipulated by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar and grout containing a set-control admixture shall be manufactured off-site in a batching plant and shall be used and placed in final position within a time not exceeding the useful life stipulated by the manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: Grout used for reinforced masonry shall be placed in accordance with the requirements of CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Grout used for reinforced masonry shall be placed in accordance with the requirements of CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.4.1.(2), mortar joint thickness for burned clay brick and concrete masonry units shall be 10 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.4.1.(2), mortar joint thickness for burned clay brick and concrete masonry units shall be 10 mm.

National Sentence Text: Permitted tolerances in head and bed joints shall be not more than ± 5 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Permitted tolerances in head and bed joints shall be not more than ± 5 mm.

National Sentence Text: Hollow masonry units shall be laid with mortar applied to head and bed joints of both inner and outer face shells.
P/T Sentence Text: Hollow masonry units shall be laid with mortar applied to head and bed joints of both inner and outer face shells.

National Sentence Text: Vertically aligned webs of hollow masonry units shall be laid in a full bed of mortar under the starting course, in all courses of columns, and where adjacent to cells or cavities that are to be filled with grout.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertically aligned webs of hollow masonry units shall be laid in a full bed of mortar under the starting course, in all courses of columns, and where adjacent to cells or cavities that are to be filled with grout.

National Sentence Text: Except for head joints left open for weep holes and ventilation, solid masonry units shall be laid with full head and bed joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for head joints left open for weep holes and ventilation, solid masonry units shall be laid with full head and bed joints.

National Sentence Text: All masonry shall be supported on masonry, concrete or steel, except that masonry veneer walls may be supported on foundations of wood frame constructed in conformance with Sentence 9.15.2.4.(1). (See Note A-9.20.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: All masonry shall be supported on masonry, concrete or steel, except that masonry veneer walls may be supported on foundations of wood frame constructed in conformance with Sentence 9.15.2.4.(1). (See Note A-9.20.5.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Every masonry wall shall be at least as thick as the wall it supports, except as otherwise permitted in Article 9.20.12.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Every masonry wall shall be at least as thick as the wall it supports, except as otherwise permitted in Article 9.20.12.2.

National Sentence Text: Masonry over openings shall be supported by steel, masonry or reinforced concrete lintels, or masonry arches.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry over openings shall be supported by steel, masonry or reinforced concrete lintels, or masonry arches.

National Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry veneer above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2., and have a bearing length not less than 90 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry veneer above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2., and have a bearing length not less than 90 mm.

National Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry other than veneer, masonry and reinforced concrete lintels, and masonry arches shall be designed in accordance with Part 4. to support the imposed load.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry other than veneer, masonry and reinforced concrete lintels, and masonry arches shall be designed in accordance with part 4. to support the imposed load.

National Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry shall be prime painted or otherwise protected from corrosion.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry shall be prime painted or otherwise protected from corrosion.

National Sentence Text: Masonry exterior walls, other than cavity walls, in 1-storeybuildings and the top storeys of 2- and 3-storey buildings shall be not less than 140 mm thick, provided the walls are not more than 2.8 m high at the eaves and 4.6 m high at the peaks of gable ends.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry exterior walls, other than cavity walls, in 1-storeybuildings and the top storeys of 2- and 3-storey buildings shall be not less than 140 mm thick, provided the walls are not more than 2.8 m high at the eaves and 4.6 m high at the peaks of gable ends.

National Sentence Text: The exterior walls of the bottom storeys of 2-storeybuildings, and exterior walls of the bottom 2 storeys of 3-storeybuildings shall be not less than 190 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: The exterior walls of the bottom storeys of 2-storey buildings, and exterior walls of the bottom 2 storeys of 3-storeybuildings shall be not less than 190 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: In exterior walls composed of more than one wythe, each wythe shall be not less than 90 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: In exterior walls composed of more than one wythe, each wythe shall be not less than 90 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Cavity walls shall be made with not less than 90 mm wide units if the joints are raked and not less than 75 mm wide units if the joints are not raked.
P/T Sentence Text: Cavity walls shall be made with not less than 90 mm wide units if the joints are raked and not less than 75 mm wide units if the joints are not raked.

National Sentence Text: The width of a cavity in a cavity wall shall be not less than 50 mm and not greater than 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The width of a cavity in a cavity wall shall be not less than 50 mm and not greater than 150 mm.

National Sentence Text: The minimum thickness of cavity walls above the supporting base shall be 230 mm for the top 7.6 m and 330 mm for the remaining portion, except that where 75 mm wide units are used, the wall height above the top of the foundation wall shall not exceed 6 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum thickness of cavity walls above the supporting base shall be 230 mm for the top 7.6 m and 330 mm for the remaining portion, except that where 75 mm wide units are used, the wall height above the top of the foundation wall shall not exceed 6 m.

National Sentence Text: The thickness of loadbearing interior walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2)and 9.20.10.1.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of loadbearing interior walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2) and 9.20.10.1.(3).

National Sentence Text: The thickness of interior non-loadbearing walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2)and 9.20.10.1.(3), and in any case, not less than 65 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of interior non-loadbearing walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2) and 9.20.10.1.(3), and in any case, not less than 65 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except for masonry veneer where each masonry unit is supported individually by the structural backing, masonry veneer shall consist of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for masonry veneer where each masonry unit is supported individually by the structural backing, masonry veneer shall consist of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Veneer described in Sentence 9.20.6.4.(1) over wood-frame walls shall have not less than a 25 mm air space behind the veneer.
P/T Sentence Text: Veneer described in Sentence 9.20.6.4.(1) over wood-frame walls shall have not less than a 25 mm air space behind the veneer.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer less than 90 mm thick shall have unraked joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer less than 90 mm thick shall have unraked joints.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2., where the masonry units are required to be individually supported by the structural backing.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer shall conform to part 4., where the masonry units are required to be individually supported by the structural backing.

National Sentence Text: The height of parapet walls above the adjacent roof surface shall be not more than 3 times the parapet wall thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of parapet walls above the adjacent roof surface shall be not more than 3 times the parapet wall thickness.

National Sentence Text: Parapet walls shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout, or concrete, and that extends from the top of the parapet to not less than 300 mm below the adjacent roof level.
P/T Sentence Text: Parapet walls shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout, or concrete, and that extends from the top of the parapet to not less than 300 mm below the adjacent roof level.

National Sentence Text: Slab and panel facings of precast concrete and natural or artificial stone shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Slab and panel facings of precast concrete and natural or artificial stone shall conform to part 4.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.7.2.(2) and Article 9.20.7.4., the depth of any chase or recess shall not exceed one third the thickness of the wall, and the width of the chase or recess shall not exceed 500 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.7.2.(2) and Article 9.20.7.4., the depth of any chase or recess shall not exceed one third the thickness of the wall, and the width of the chase or recess shall not exceed 500 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.7.2.(2) and Article 9.20.7.4., no chase or recess shall be constructed in any wall 190 mm or less in thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.7.2.(2) and Article 9.20.7.4., no chase or recess shall be constructed in any wall 190 mm or less in thickness.

National Sentence Text: Recesses may be constructed in 190 mm walls provided they do not exceed 100 mm in depth, 750 mm in height and 500 mm in width.
P/T Sentence Text: Recesses may be constructed in 190 mm walls provided they do not exceed 100 mm in depth, 750 mm in height and 500 mm in width.

National Sentence Text: Chases and recesses shall be not less than 4 times the wall thickness apart, and 600 mm away from any pilaster, cross wall, buttress or other vertical element providing required lateral support for the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Chases and recesses shall be not less than 4 times the wall thickness apart, and 600 mm away from any pilaster, cross wall, buttress or other vertical element providing required lateral support for the wall.

National Sentence Text: Chases or recesses that do not conform to the limits specified in Articles 9.20.7.1.to 9.20.7.3. shall be considered as openings, and any masonry supported above such a chase or recess shall be supported by a lintel or arch as provided in Article 9.20.5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Chases or recesses that do not conform to the limits specified in Articles 9.20.7.1.to 9.20.7.3. shall be considered as openings, and any masonry supported above such a chase or recess shall be supported by a lintel or arch as provided in Article 9.20.5.2.

National Sentence Text: Chases and recesses shall not be cut into walls made with hollow units after the masonry units are in place.
P/T Sentence Text: Chases and recesses shall not be cut into walls made with hollow units after the masonry units are in place.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.8.1.(2), loadbearing walls of hollow masonry units supporting roof or floor framing members shall be capped with not less than 50 mm of solid masonry or have the top course filled with concrete.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.8.1.(2), loadbearing walls of hollow masonry units supporting roof or floor framing members shall be capped with not less than 50 mm of solid masonry or have the top course filled with concrete.

National Sentence Text: Capping required in Sentence 9.20.8.1.(1) may be omitted where the roof framing is supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Capping required in Sentence 9.20.8.1.(1) may be omitted where the roof framing is supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm.

National Sentence Text: Floor joists supported on cavity walls shall be supported on solid masonry units not less than 57 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor joists supported on cavity walls shall be supported on solid masonry units not less than 57 mm high.

National Sentence Text: Floor joists described in Sentence 9.20.8.2.(1) shall not project into the cavity.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor joists described in Sentence 9.20.8.2.(1) shall not project into the cavity.

National Sentence Text: Roof and ceiling framing members bearing on cavity walls shall be supported on solid masonry units not less than 57 mm high that bridge the full thickness of the wall, or a wood plate not less than 38 mm thick, bearing not less than 50 mm on each wythe.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof and ceiling framing members bearing on cavity walls shall be supported on solid masonry units not less than 57 mm high that bridge the full thickness of the wall, or a wood plate not less than 38 mm thick, bearing not less than 50 mm on each wythe.

National Sentence Text: The bearing area under beams and joists shall be sufficient to carry the supported load.
P/T Sentence Text: The bearing area under beams and joists shall be sufficient to carry the supported load.

National Sentence Text: In no case shall the minimum length of end bearing of beams supported on masonry be less than 90 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: In no case shall the minimum length of end bearing of beams supported on masonry be less than 90 mm.

National Sentence Text: The length of end bearing of floor, roof or ceiling joists supported on masonry shall be not less than 40 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The length of end bearing of floor, roof or ceiling joists supported on masonry shall be not less than 40 mm.

National Sentence Text: Beams and columns supported on masonry walls shall be supported on pilasters where the thickness of the masonry wall or wythe is less than 190 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Beams and columns supported on masonry walls shall be supported on pilasters where the thickness of the masonry wall or wythe is less than 190 mm.

National Sentence Text: Not less than 190 mm depth of solid masonry or concrete shall be provided under the beam or column referred to in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than 190 mm depth of solid masonry or concrete shall be provided under the beam or column referred to in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1).

National Sentence Text: Pilasters required in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1) shall be bonded or tied to masonry walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Pilasters required in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1) shall be bonded or tied to masonry walls.

National Sentence Text: Concrete pilasters required in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1) shall be not less than 50 mm by 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete pilasters required in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1) shall be not less than 50 mm by 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry pilasters required in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1) shall be not less than 100 mm by 290 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry pilasters required in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1) shall be not less than 100 mm by 290 mm.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer of solid masonry units resting on a bearing support shall not project more than one third of the thickness of the veneer. (See Note A-9.20.8.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer of solid masonry units resting on a bearing support shall not project more than one third of the thickness of the veneer. (See Note A-9.20.8.5.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Where the masonry veneer described in Sentence 9.20.8.5.(1) is rough stone masonry, the projection shall be measured as the average projection of the units, and the thickness of the veneer shall be measured as the average thickness of the veneer.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the masonry veneer described in Sentence 9.20.8.5.(1) is rough stone masonry, the projection shall be measured as the average projection of the units, and the thickness of the veneer shall be measured as the average thickness of the veneer.

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in adjacent masonry courses shall be offset unless each wythe of masonry is reinforced with the equivalent of not less than 2 corrosion-resistant steel bars of 3.76 mm diam placed in the horizontal joints at vertical intervals not exceeding 460 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in adjacent masonry courses shall be offset unless each wythe of masonry is reinforced with the equivalent of not less than 2 corrosion-resistant steel bars of 3.76 mm diam placed in the horizontal joints at vertical intervals not exceeding 460 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where joints in the reinforcing referred to in Sentence 9.20.9.1.(1) occur, the bars shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where joints in the reinforcing referred to in Sentence 9.20.9.1.(1) occur, the bars shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.9.5. regarding masonry veneer, masonry walls that consist of 2 or more wythes shall have the wythes bonded or tied together with masonry bonding units as described in Article 9.20.9.3. or with metal ties as described in Article 9.20.9.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.9.5. regarding masonry veneer, masonry walls that consist of 2 or more wythes shall have the wythes bonded or tied together with masonry bonding units as described in Article 9.20.9.3. or with metal ties as described in Article 9.20.9.4.

National Sentence Text: Where wythes are bonded together with masonry units, the bonding units shall comprise not less than 4% of the wall surface area.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wythes are bonded together with masonry units, the bonding units shall comprise not less than 4% of the wall surface area.

National Sentence Text: Bonding units described in Sentence 9.20.9.3.(1) shall be spaced not more than 600 mm vertically and horizontally in the case of brick masonry and 900 mm o.c. in the case of block or tile.
P/T Sentence Text: Bonding units described in Sentence 9.20.9.3.(1) shall be spaced not more than 600 mm vertically and horizontally in the case of brick masonry and 900 mm o.c. in the case of block or tile.

National Sentence Text: Units described in Sentence 9.20.9.3.(1) shall extend not less than 90 mm into adjacent wythes.
P/T Sentence Text: Units described in Sentence 9.20.9.3.(1) shall extend not less than 90 mm into adjacent wythes.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more wythes are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the ties shall conform to the requirements in Sentences 9.20.9.4.(3)to 9.20.9.4.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: Where 2 or more wythes are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the ties shall conform to the requirements in Sentences 9.20.9.4.(3) to 9.20.9.4.(6).

National Sentence Text: Other ties may be used where it can be shown that such ties provide walls that are at least as strong and as durable as those made with the individual rod type.
P/T Sentence Text: Other ties may be used where it can be shown that such ties provide walls that are at least as strong and as durable as those made with the individual rod type.

National Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall be corrosion-resistant, have a minimum cross-sectional area of not less than 17.8 mm2, and have not less than a 50 mm portion bent at right angles at each end.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall be corrosion-resistant, have a minimum cross-sectional area of not less than 17.8 mm2, and have not less than a 50 mm portion bent at right angles at each end.

National Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall extend from within 25 mm of the outer face of the wall to within 25 mm of the inner face of the wall, be completely embedded in mortar except for the portion exposed in cavity walls, and be staggered from course to course.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall extend from within 25 mm of the outer face of the wall to within 25 mm of the inner face of the wall, be completely embedded in mortar except for the portion exposed in cavity walls, and be staggered from course to course.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more wythes in walls other than cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry backing walls are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the space between wythes shall be completely filled with mortar.
P/T Sentence Text: Where 2 or more wythes in walls other than cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry backing walls are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the space between wythes shall be completely filled with mortar.

National Sentence Text: Ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4.(5) shall be located within 300 mm of openings and spaced not more than 900 mm apart around openings, and spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 460 mm apart vertically at other locations.
P/T Sentence Text: Ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4.(5) shall be located within 300 mm of openings and spaced not more than 900 mm apart around openings, and spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 460 mm apart vertically at other locations.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences 9.20.9.4.(8)and 9.20.9.4.(9), where the inner and outer wythes of cavity walls are tied with individual wire ties, the ties shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 400 mm apart vertically.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences 9.20.9.4.(8) and 9.20.9.4.(9), where the inner and outer wythes of cavity walls are tied with individual wire ties, the ties shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 400 mm apart vertically.

National Sentence Text: Within 100 mm of the bottom of each floor or roof assembly where the cavity extends below the assemblies, the ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4.(7) shall be spaced not more than 600 mm apart horizontally.
P/T Sentence Text: Within 100 mm of the bottom of each floor or roof assembly where the cavity extends below the assemblies, the ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4.(7) shall be spaced not more than 600 mm apart horizontally.

National Sentence Text: Within 300 mm of any openings, the ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4.(7) shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Within 300 mm of any openings, the ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4.(7) shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer 75 mm or more in thickness and resting on a bearing support shall be tied to masonry backing or to wood framing members with straps that are corrosion-resistant, not less than 0.76 mm thick, not less than 22 mm wide, shaped to provide a key with the mortar, and spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.9.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer 75 mm or more in thickness and resting on a bearing support shall be tied to masonry backing or to wood framing members with straps that are corrosion-resistant, not less than 0.76 mm thick, not less than 22 mm wide, shaped to provide a key with the mortar, and spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.9.5.

National Sentence Text: Straps described in Sentence 9.20.9.5.(1) that are fastened to wood framing members shall be bent at a right angle within 6 mm from the fastener, and fastened with corrosion-resistant 3.18 mm diam screws or spiral nails having a wood penetration of not less than 63 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Straps described in Sentence 9.20.9.5.(1) that are fastened to wood framing members shall be bent at a right angle within 6 mm from the fastener, and fastened with corrosion-resistant 3.18 mm diam screws or spiral nails having a wood penetration of not less than 63 mm.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer individually supported by masonry or wood-frame backing shall be secured to the backing in conformance with Subsection 4.3.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer individually supported by masonry or wood-frame backing shall be secured to the backing in conformance with part 4.

National Sentence Text: Glass block shall have horizontal joint reinforcement of 2 corrosion-resistant bars of not less than 3.76 mm diam or expanded metal strips not less than 75 mm wide spaced at vertical intervals of not more than 600 mm for units 200 mm or less in height, and installed in every horizontal joint for units higher than 200 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass block shall have horizontal joint reinforcement of 2 corrosion-resistant bars of not less than 3.76 mm diam or expanded metal strips not less than 75 mm wide spaced at vertical intervals of not more than 600 mm for units 200 mm or less in height, and installed in every horizontal joint for units higher than 200 mm.

National Sentence Text: Reinforcement required in Sentence 9.20.9.6.(1) shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Reinforcement required in Sentence 9.20.9.6.(1) shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.

National Sentence Text: Masonry walls shall be laterally supported by floor or roof construction or by intersecting masonry walls or buttresses.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry walls shall be laterally supported by floor or roof construction or by intersecting masonry walls or buttresses.

National Sentence Text: The spacing of supports required in Sentence 9.20.10.1.(1) shall be not more than 20 times the wall thickness for all loadbearing walls and exterior non-loadbearing walls, and 36 times the wall thickness for interior non-loadbearing walls.
P/T Sentence Text: The spacing of supports required in Sentence 9.20.10.1.(1) shall be not more than 20 times the wall thickness for all loadbearing walls and exterior non-loadbearing walls, and 36 times the wall thickness for interior non-loadbearing walls.

National Sentence Text: In applying Sentence 9.20.10.1.(2), the thickness of cavity walls shall be taken as the greater of two-thirds of the sum of the thicknesses of the wythes, or the thickness of the thicker wythe.
P/T Sentence Text: In applying Sentence 9.20.10.1.(2), the thickness of cavity walls shall be taken as the greater of two-thirds of the sum of the thicknesses of the wythes, or the thickness of the thicker wythe.

National Sentence Text: Floor and roof constructions providing lateral support for walls as required in Sentence 9.20.10.1.(1) shall be constructed to transfer lateral loads to walls or buttresses approximately at right angles to the laterally supported walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor and roof constructions providing lateral support for walls as required in Sentence 9.20.10.1.(1) shall be constructed to transfer lateral loads to walls or buttresses approximately at right angles to the laterally supported walls.

National Sentence Text: Where required to receive lateral support (see Subsection 9.20.10.), masonry walls shall be anchored to each floor or roof assembly at maximum intervals of 2 m, except that anchorage to floor joists not more than 1 m above grade may be omitted.
P/T Sentence Text: Where required to receive lateral support (see part 9.), masonry walls shall be anchored to each floor or roof assembly at maximum intervals of 2 m, except that anchorage to floor joists not more than 1 m above grade may be omitted.

National Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.1.(1) shall be corrosion-resistant and be not less than the equivalent of 40 mm by 4.76 mm thick steel straps.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.1.(1) shall be corrosion-resistant and be not less than the equivalent of 40 mm by 4.76 mm thick steel straps.

National Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.1.(1) shall be shaped to provide a mechanical key with the masonry and shall be securely fastened to the horizontal support to develop the full strength of the anchor.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.1.(1) shall be shaped to provide a mechanical key with the masonry and shall be securely fastened to the horizontal support to develop the full strength of the anchor.

National Sentence Text: When joists are parallel to the wall, anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.1.(1) shall extend across not less than 3 joists.
P/T Sentence Text: When joists are parallel to the wall, anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.1.(1) shall extend across not less than 3 joists.

National Sentence Text: Where required to provide lateral support, intersecting walls shall be bonded or tied together.
P/T Sentence Text: Where required to provide lateral support, intersecting walls shall be bonded or tied together.

National Sentence Text: Where bonding is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.20.11.2.(1), 50% of the adjacent masonry units in the intersecting wall, distributed uniformly over the height of the intersection, shall be embedded in the laterally supported wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Where bonding is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.20.11.2.(1), 50% of the adjacent masonry units in the intersecting wall, distributed uniformly over the height of the intersection, shall be embedded in the laterally supported wall.

National Sentence Text: Where tying is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.20.11.2.(1), the ties shall be corrosion-resistant metal, equivalent to not less than 4.76 mm by 40 mm steel strapping, spaced not more than 800 mm o.c. vertically, and shaped at both ends to provide sufficient mechanical key to develop the strength of the ties.
P/T Sentence Text: Where tying is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.20.11.2.(1), the ties shall be corrosion-resistant metal, equivalent to not less than 4.76 mm by 40 mm steel strapping, spaced not more than 800 mm o.c. vertically, and shaped at both ends to provide sufficient mechanical key to develop the strength of the ties.

National Sentence Text: Wood-frame walls shall be anchored to masonry walls that they intersect with not less than 4.76 mm diam corrosion-resistant steel rods spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. vertically.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood-frame walls shall be anchored to masonry walls that they intersect with not less than 4.76 mm diam corrosion-resistant steel rods spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. vertically.

National Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.3.(1) shall be fastened to the wood framing at one end and shaped to provide a mechanical key at the other end to develop the strength of the anchor.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.3.(1) shall be fastened to the wood framing at one end and shaped to provide a mechanical key at the other end to develop the strength of the anchor.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.11.4.(2), roof systems of wood-frame construction shall be anchored to exterior masonry walls by not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts, spaced not more than 2.4 m apart, embedded not less than 90 mm into the masonry, and fastened to a rafter plate of not less than 38 mm thick lumber.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.11.4.(2), roof systems of wood-frame construction shall be anchored to exterior masonry walls by not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts, spaced not more than 2.4 m apart, embedded not less than 90 mm into the masonry, and fastened to a rafter plate of not less than 38 mm thick lumber.

National Sentence Text: The roof system described in Sentence 9.20.11.4.(1) is permitted to be anchored by nailing the wall furring strips to the side of the rafter plate.
P/T Sentence Text: The roof system described in Sentence 9.20.11.4.(1) is permitted to be anchored by nailing the wall furring strips to the side of the rafter plate.

National Sentence Text: Cornices, sills or other trim of masonry material which project beyond the wall face shall have not less than 65% of their mass, but not less than 90 mm, within the wall or shall be adequately anchored to the wall with corrosion-resistant anchors.
P/T Sentence Text: Cornices, sills or other trim of masonry material which project beyond the wall face shall have not less than 65% of their mass, but not less than 90 mm, within the wall or shall be adequately anchored to the wall with corrosion-resistant anchors.

National Sentence Text: Where anchor bolts are to be placed in the top of a masonry pier, the pier shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 9.15.2.3.(4) and shall be capped with concrete or reinforced masonry not less than 200 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Where anchor bolts are to be placed in the top of a masonry pier, the pier shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 9.15.2.3.(4) and shall be capped with concrete or reinforced masonry not less than 200 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: All corbelling shall consist of solid masonry units.
P/T Sentence Text: All corbelling shall consist of solid masonry units .

National Sentence Text: The units referred to in Sentence 9.20.12.1.(1) shall be corbelled so that the horizontal projection of any unit does not exceed 25 mm and the total projection does not exceed one third of the total wall thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: The units referred to in Sentence 9.20.12.1.(1) shall be corbelled so that the horizontal projection of any unit does not exceed 25 mm and the total projection does not exceed one third of the total wall thickness.

National Sentence Text: Cavity walls of greater thickness than the foundation wall on which they rest shall not be corbelled but may project 25 mm over the outer face of the foundation wall disregarding parging.
P/T Sentence Text: Cavity walls of greater thickness than the foundation wall on which they rest shall not be corbelled but may project 25 mm over the outer face of the foundation wall disregarding parging.

National Sentence Text: Where the foundation wall referred to in Sentence 9.20.12.2.(1) is unit masonry, it is permitted to be corbelled to meet flush with the inner face of a cavity wall provided the projection of each course does not exceed half the height or one third the thickness of the corbelled unit, and the total corbel does not exceed one third of the foundation wall thickness. (See Note A-9.20.12.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the foundation wall referred to in Sentence 9.20.12.2.(1) is unit masonry, it is permitted to be corbelled to meet flush with the inner face of a cavity wall provided the projection of each course does not exceed half the height or one third the thickness of the corbelled unit, and the total corbel does not exceed one third of the foundation wall thickness.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer resting on a bearing support shall not project more than 25 mm beyond the supporting base where the veneer is not less than 90 mm thick, and 12 mm beyond the supporting base where the veneer is less than 90 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer resting on a bearing support shall not project more than 25 mm beyond the supporting base where the veneer is not less than 90 mm thick, and 12 mm beyond the supporting base where the veneer is less than 90 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: In the case of rough stone veneer, the projection, measured as the average projection of the stone units, shall not exceed one-third the bed width beyond the supporting base.
P/T Sentence Text: In the case of rough stone veneer, the projection, measured as the average projection of the stone units, shall not exceed one-third the bed width beyond the supporting base.

National Sentence Text: Materials used for flashing shall conform to Table 9.20.13.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials used for flashing shall conform to Table 9.20.13.1.

National Sentence Text: Aluminum flashing in contact with masonry or concrete shall be effectively coated or separated from the masonry or concrete by an impervious membrane.
P/T Sentence Text: Aluminum flashing in contact with masonry or concrete shall be effectively coated or separated from the masonry or concrete by an impervious membrane.

National Sentence Text: Fastening devices for flashing shall be corrosion-resistant and, where metal flashing is used, shall be compatible with the flashing with respect to galvanic action.
P/T Sentence Text: Fastening devices for flashing shall be corrosion-resistant and, where metal flashing is used, shall be compatible with the flashing with respect to galvanic action.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed in masonry and masonry veneer walls beneath jointed masonry window sills, over the back and top of parapet walls, over the heads of glass block panels, beneath weep holes, and over the heads of window or door openings in exterior walls when the vertical distance between the top of a window or door frame and the bottom edge of the eave exceeds one-quarter of the horizontal eave overhang.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed in masonry and masonry veneer walls beneath jointed masonry window sills, over the back and top of parapet walls, over the heads of glass block panels, beneath weep holes, and over the heads of window or door openings in exterior walls when the vertical distance between the top of a window or door frame and the bottom edge of the eave exceeds one-quarter of the horizontal eave overhang.

National Sentence Text: When installed beneath jointed masonry window sills or over the heads of openings, flashing shall extend from the front edge of the masonry up behind the sill or lintel.
P/T Sentence Text: When installed beneath jointed masonry window sills or over the heads of openings, flashing shall extend from the front edge of the masonry up behind the sill or lintel.

National Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry backing walls shall be bedded not less than 25 mm in the inside wythe, extend to not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing, and be installed with a nominally horizontal slope toward the outside wythe.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry backing walls shall be bedded not less than 25 mm in the inside wythe, extend to not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing, and be installed with a nominally horizontal slope toward the outside wythe.

National Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over masonry backing walls shall conform to the flashing requirements for cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry backing walls in Article 9.20.13.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over masonry backing walls shall conform to the flashing requirements for cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry backing walls in Article 9.20.13.5.

National Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over wood-frame walls shall be installed so that it extends from a point not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing to a point 150 mm up the wood-frame wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over wood-frame walls shall be installed so that it extends from a point not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing to a point 150 mm up the wood-frame wall.

National Sentence Text: Where the frame wall is sheathed with a sheathing membrane, a non-wood-based rigid exterior insulating sheathing or a semi-rigid insulating sheathing with an integral sheathing membrane, the flashing shall be installed behind the sheathing membrane or insulating sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the frame wall is sheathed with a sheathing membrane, a non-wood-based rigid exterior insulating sheathing or a semi-rigid insulating sheathing with an integral sheathing membrane, the flashing shall be installed behind the sheathing membrane or insulating sheathing.

National Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentence 9.20.13.6.(2) is permitted to conform to the requirements for concealed flashing in Table 9.20.13.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentence 9.20.13.6.(2) is permitted to conform to the requirements for concealed flashing in Table 9.20.13.1.

National Sentence Text: Joints in flashing shall be made watertight.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints in flashing shall be made watertight.

National Sentence Text: Weep holes spaced not more than 800 mm apart shall be provided at the bottom of cavities in cavity walls, and cavities or air spaces in masonry veneer walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Weep holes spaced not more than 800 mm apart shall be provided at the bottom of cavities in cavity walls, and cavities or air spaces in masonry veneer walls.

National Sentence Text: The cavities or air spaces described in Sentence 9.20.13.8.(1) shall include those above lintels over window and door openings required to be flashed in conformance with Article 9.20.13.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The cavities or air spaces described in Sentence 9.20.13.8.(1) shall include those above lintels over window and door openings required to be flashed in conformance with Article 9.20.13.3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(3), where the interior finish of the exterior walls of a building is a type that may be damaged by moisture, exterior masonry walls, other than cavity walls or walls that are protected for their full height by a roof of a carport or porch, shall be covered on the interior surface with sheathing membrane conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.32-M77 Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type lapped not less than 100 mm at the joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(3), where the interior finish of the exterior walls of a building is a type that may be damaged by moisture, exterior masonry walls, other than cavity walls or walls that are protected for their full height by a roof of a carport or porch, shall be covered on the interior surface with sheathing membrane conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.32-M77 Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type lapped not less than 100 mm at the joints.

National Sentence Text: In situations described in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(1), flashing shall be provided where water will accumulate, to lead it to the exterior.
P/T Sentence Text: In situations described in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(1), flashing shall be provided where water will accumulate, to lead it to the exterior.

National Sentence Text: Where insulation that effectively limits the passage of water is applied by a waterproof adhesive or mortar directly to parged masonry, the requirements for sheathing membrane in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(1) do not apply. (See Note A-9.20.13.9.(3).) (See Note A-9.20.13.9.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulation that effectively limits the passage of water is applied by a waterproof adhesive or mortar directly to parged masonry, the requirements for sheathing membrane in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(1) do not apply. (See Note A-9.20.13.9.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Cavity walls shall be constructed so that mortar droppings are prevented from forming a bridge to allow the passage of rain water across the cavity.
P/T Sentence Text: Cavity walls shall be constructed so that mortar droppings are prevented from forming a bridge to allow the passage of rain water across the cavity.

National Sentence Text: The junction of door and window frames with masonry shall be caulked in conformance with Subsection 9.27.4.
P/T Sentence Text: The junction of door and window frames with masonry shall be caulked in conformance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: Where no flashing is installed beneath window sills, such sills shall be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the wall surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Where no flashing is installed beneath window sills, such sills shall be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the wall surface.

National Sentence Text: Mortar and masonry shall be maintained at a temperature not below 5°C during installation and for not less than 48 h after installation.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar and masonry shall be maintained at a temperature not below 5°C during installation and for not less than 48 h after installation.

National Sentence Text: No frozen material shall be used in mortar mix.
P/T Sentence Text: No frozen material shall be used in mortar mix.
