National Sentence Text: The top surface of uncompleted masonry exposed to the weather shall be completely covered with a waterproofing material when construction is not in progress.
P/T Sentence Text: The top surface of uncompleted masonry exposed to the weather shall be completely covered with a waterproofing material when construction is not in progress.

National Sentence Text: Where reinforcement is required in this Section, masonry walls shall be reinforced horizontally and vertically with steel having a total cross-sectional area of not less than 0.002 times the horizontal cross-sectional area of the wall, so that not less than one-third of the required steel area is installed either horizontally or vertically and the remainder in the other direction.
P/T Sentence Text: Where reinforcement is required in this Section, masonry walls shall be reinforced horizontally and vertically with steel having a total cross-sectional area of not less than 0.002 times the horizontal cross-sectional area of the wall, so that not less than one-third of the required steel area is installed either horizontally or vertically and the remainder in the other direction.

National Sentence Text: Where reinforcement for masonry is required in this Section, it shall be installed in conformance with the requirements for reinforced masonry as contained in CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Where reinforcement for masonry is required in this Section, it shall be installed in conformance with the requirements for reinforced masonry as contained in CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings

National Sentence Text: Carbon steel connectors required to be corrosion-resistant shall be galvanized to at least the minimum standards in Table 9.20.16.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Carbon steel connectors required to be corrosion-resistant shall be galvanized to at least the minimum standards in Table 9.20.16.1.

National Sentence Text: The thickness of the concrete in flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground shall be not less than 140 mm, and constant for the entire height of the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of the concrete in flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground shall be not less than 140 mm, and constant for the entire height of the wall.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall consist of one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and 10M bars at 600 mm o.c., and be placed in the middle third of the wall section.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall consist of one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and 10M bars at 600 mm o.c., and be placed in the middle third of the wall section.

National Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall consist of 10M bars at 400 mm o.c., and be placed in the middle third of the wall section.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall consist of 10M bars at 400 mm o.c., and be placed in the middle third of the wall section.

National Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement required by Sentence 9.20.17.2.(2) and interrupted by wall openings shall be placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement required by Sentence 9.20.17.2.(2) and interrupted by wall openings shall be placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the opening.

National Sentence Text: No openings shall occur within 1 200 mm of interior and exterior corners of exterior non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.
P/T Sentence Text: No openings shall occur within 1 200 mm of interior and exterior corners of exterior non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.

National Sentence Text: Portions of walls above openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall have a minimum depth of concrete of no less than 200 mm across the width of the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Portions of walls above openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall have a minimum depth of concrete of no less than 200 mm across the width of the opening.

National Sentence Text: Openings that are more than 600 mm but not more than 3 000 mm in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced at the top and bottom with one 10M bar.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings that are more than 600 mm but not more than 3 000 mm in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced at the top and bottom with one 10M bar.

National Sentence Text: Openings more than 3 000 mm in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced on all four sides with two 10M bars.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings more than 3 000 mm in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced on all four sides with two 10M bars.

National Sentence Text: Reinforcing bars described in Sentences 9.20.17.3.(3)and 9.20.17.3.(4) shall extend 600 mm beyond the edges of the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Reinforcing bars described in Sentences 9.20.17.3.(3) and 9.20.17.3.(4) shall extend 600 mm beyond the edges of the opening.

National Sentence Text: The cumulative width of openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall not make up more than 70% of the length of any wall.
P/T Sentence Text: The cumulative width of openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall not make up more than 70% of the length of any wall.

National Sentence Text: No openings shall occur within 1 200 mm of interior and exterior corners of exterior loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.
P/T Sentence Text: No openings shall occur within 1 200 mm of interior and exterior corners of exterior loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.

National Sentence Text: In loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls, lintels shall be provided over all openings wider than 900 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: In loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls, lintels shall be provided over all openings wider than 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence 9.20.17.4.(2) shall be constructed in accordance with Span Table 9.20.17.4.-A, Table 9.20.17.4.-B or Table 9.20.17.4.-C.
P/T Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence 9.20.17.4.(2) shall be constructed in accordance with Span Table 9.20.17.4.-A, Table 9.20.17.4.-B or Table 9.20.17.4.-C.

National Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence 9.20.17.4.(2) over openings wider than 1 200 mm shall be reinforced for shear with 10M stirrups at a maximum spacing of half the distance from the bottom reinforcing bar to the top of the lintel.
P/T Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence 9.20.17.4.(2) over openings wider than 1 200 mm shall be reinforced for shear with 10M stirrups at a maximum spacing of half the distance from the bottom reinforcing bar to the top of the lintel.

National Sentence Text: Floor joists supported on the side of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be supported with joist hangers secured to wood ledger boards.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor joists supported on the side of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be supported with joist hangers secured to wood ledger boards.

National Sentence Text: The ledger boards referred to in Sentence 9.20.17.5.(1) shall be not less than 38 mm thick, and the depth of the floor joists.
P/T Sentence Text: The ledger boards referred to in Sentence 9.20.17.5.(1) shall be not less than 38 mm thick, and the depth of the floor joists.

National Sentence Text: Anchor bolts shall be used to secure ledger boards to flat insulating concrete form walls and shall be embedded in the wall to a depth not less than 100 mm, and spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.17.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchor bolts shall be used to secure ledger boards to flat insulating concrete form walls and shall be embedded in the wall to a depth not less than 100 mm, and spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.17.5.

National Sentence Text: Floor joists and building frames supported on the top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be anchored in conformance with Article 9.23.6.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor joists and building frames supported on the top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be anchored in conformance with Article 9.23.6.1.

National Sentence Text: Roof framing supported on the top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be fixed to the top plates, which shall be anchored to the wall with anchor bolts not less than 12.7 mm in diameter, and spaced at not more than 1 200 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof framing supported on the top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be fixed to the top plates, which shall be anchored to the wall with anchor bolts not less than 12.7 mm in diameter, and spaced at not more than 1 200 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: The anchor bolts described in Sentence 9.20.17.6.(1) shall be placed in the centre of the flat insulating concrete form wall and shall be embedded no less than 100 mm into the concrete.
P/T Sentence Text: The anchor bolts described in Sentence 9.20.17.6.(1) shall be placed in the centre of the flat insulating concrete form wall and shall be embedded no less than 100 mm into the concrete.

National Sentence Text: Attachment of roof framing to wood top plates shall be in accordance with Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Attachment of roof framing to wood top plates shall be in accordance with Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: Above-ground flat insulating concrete form walls shall be protected from precipitation and damage in conformance with Section 9.27.
P/T Sentence Text: Above-ground flat insulating concrete form walls shall be protected from precipitation and damage in conformance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height serving fireplaces or serving appliances having a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, and flue pipes connected to such chimneys.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height serving fireplaces or serving appliances having a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, and flue pipes connected to such chimneys.

National Sentence Text: Chimneys, other than those described in Sentence 9.21.1.1.(1), gas vents and flue pipes serving gas-, oil- or solid-fuel-burning appliances and their associated equipment, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, covered by the standards referenced in Sentences 9.33.5.2.(1)and 9.33.5.3.(1) shall conform to Subsection 9.33.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimneys, other than those described in Sentence 9.21.1.1.(1), gas vents and flue pipes serving gas-, oil- or solid-fuel-burning appliances and their associated equipment, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, covered by the standards referenced in Sentences 9.33.5.2.(1) and 9.33.5.3.(1) shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Chimneys and flue pipes other than those described in Sentences 9.21.1.1.(1)and 9.21.1.1.(2) shall conform to Section 6.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimneys and flue pipes other than those described in Sentences 9.21.1.1.(1)and 9.21.1.1.(2) shall conform to part 6.

National Sentence Text: The walls of any chimney or flue pipe shall be constructed so as to be smoke- and flame-tight.
P/T Sentence Text: The walls of any chimney or flue pipe shall be constructed so as to be smoke- and flame-tight.

National Sentence Text: A chimneyflue that serves a fireplace or incinerator shall not serve any other appliance.
P/T Sentence Text: A chimneyflue that serves a fireplace or incinerator shall not serve any other appliance.

National Sentence Text: A chimneyflue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to a natural-gas- or propane-fired appliance.
P/T Sentence Text: A chimneyflue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to a natural-gas- or propane-fired appliance.

National Sentence Text: A chimneyflue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to an oil-burning appliance unless the solid-fuel-burning appliance is certified for such installation and the installation of both appliances meets the requirements of the relevant standards referenced in Article 9.33.5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: A chimneyflue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to an oil-burning appliance unless the solid-fuel-burning appliance is certified for such installation and the installation of both appliances meets the requirements of the relevant standards referenced in Article 9.33.5.2.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 9.21.2.1., where two or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimneyflue, the connections shall be made as described in Sentences 9.21.2.2.(2)to 9.21.2.2.(4) and an adequate draft shall be provided for the connected appliances in conformance with the requirements of applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with the requirements of the relevant standards listed in Subsection 9.33.10.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as required by Article 9.21.2.1., where two or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the connections shall be made as described in Sentences 9.21.2.2.(2) to 9.21.2.2.(4) and an adequate draft shall be provided for the connected appliances in conformance with the requirements of applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with the requirements of the relevant standards listed in Subsection 9.33.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 9.21.2.1., where two or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimneyflue, the connections shall be made as described in Sentences 9.21.2.2.(2) to 9.21.2.2.(4) and an adequate draft shall be provided for the connected appliances in conformance with the requirements of the relevant standards listed in part 9.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as required by Article 9.21.2.1., where two or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the connections shall be made as described in Sentences 9.21.2.2.(2) to 9.21.2.2.(4) and an adequate draft shall be provided for the connected appliances in conformance with the requirements of the relevant standards listed in Subsection 9.33.10.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimneyflue, the appliances shall be located on the same storey.
P/T Sentence Text: Where 2 or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimneyflue, the appliances shall be located on the same storey.

National Sentence Text: The connection referred to in Sentence 9.21.2.2.(2) for a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below connections for appliances burning other fuels.
P/T Sentence Text: The connection referred to in Sentence 9.21.2.2.(2) for a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below connections for appliances burning other fuels.

National Sentence Text: The connection referred to in Sentence 9.21.2.2.(2) for a liquid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below any connections for appliances burning natural gas or propane.
P/T Sentence Text: The connection referred to in Sentence 9.21.2.2.(2) for a liquid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below any connections for appliances burning natural gas or propane.

National Sentence Text: Chimneyflues shall not be inclined more than 45° to the vertical.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimney flues shall not be inclined more than 45° to the vertical.

National Sentence Text: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the requirements of the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 9.33.5.2.(1)and 9.33.5.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the requirements of the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 9.33.5.2.(1) and 9.33.5.3.(1).

National Sentence Text: Where a chimneyflue serves only one appliance, the flue area shall be at least equal to that of the flue pipe connected to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a chimneyflue serves only one appliance, the flue area shall be at least equal to that of the flue pipe connected to it.

National Sentence Text: The size of a chimneyflue serving a masonry fireplace shall conform to Table 9.21.2.5.-Aor 9.21.2.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of a chimneyflue serving a masonry fireplace shall conform to Table 9.21.2.5.-Aor 9.21.2.5.-B.

National Sentence Text: The width of an oval chimneyflue shall be not less than two-thirds its breadth.
P/T Sentence Text: The width of an oval chimneyflue shall be not less than two-thirds its breadth.

National Sentence Text: Every masonry or concrete chimney shall have a lining of clay, concrete, firebrick or metal.
P/T Sentence Text: Every masonry or concrete chimney shall have a lining of clay, concrete, firebrick or metal.

National Sentence Text: Joints of chimney liners shall be sealed to provide a barrier to the passage of flue gases and condensate into the cavity between the liner and the surrounding masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints of chimney liners shall be sealed to provide a barrier to the passage of flue gases and condensate into the cavity between the liner and the surrounding masonry.

National Sentence Text: Joints of clay, concrete or firebrick chimney liners shall be struck flush to provide a straight, smooth, aligned chimneyflue.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints of clay, concrete or firebrick chimney liners shall be struck flush to provide a straight, smooth, aligned chimneyflue.

National Sentence Text: Clay liners shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A324-M88 Clay Flue Liners
P/T Sentence Text: Clay liners shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A324-M88 Clay Flue Liners

National Sentence Text: Liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.3.3.(1) shall be not less than 15.9 mm thick and shall be capable of resisting, without softening or cracking, a temperature of 1 100°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.3.3.(1) shall be not less than 15.9 mm thick and shall be capable of resisting, without softening or cracking, a temperature of 1 100°C.

National Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall conform to ASTM C 27-98 Fireclay and High-Alumina Refractory Brick
P/T Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall conform to ASTM C 27-98 Fireclay and High-Alumina Refractory Brick

National Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar
P/T Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar

National Sentence Text: Concrete flue liners shall conform to Clause 4.2.6.4 of CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete flue liners shall conform to Clause 4.2.6.4 of CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces

National Sentence Text: Metal liners shall be constructed of not less than 0.3 mm thick stainless steel.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal liners shall be constructed of not less than 0.3 mm thick stainless steel.

National Sentence Text: Metal liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.3.6.(1) shall only be used in chimneys serving gas- or oil-burning appliances. (See Note A-9.21.3.6.(2).) (See Note A-9.21.3.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Metal liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.3.6.(1) shall only be used in chimneys serving gas- or oil-burning appliances. (See Note A-9.21.3.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Chimney liners shall be installed when the surrounding masonry or concrete is placed.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimney liners shall be installed when the surrounding masonry or concrete is placed.

National Sentence Text: A space not less than 10 mm wide shall be left between a chimney liner and surrounding masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: A space not less than 10 mm wide shall be left between a chimney liner and surrounding masonry.

National Sentence Text: The space required in Sentence 9.21.3.8.(1) shall not be filled with mortar.
P/T Sentence Text: The space required in Sentence 9.21.3.8.(1) shall not be filled with mortar.

National Sentence Text: Chimney liners used in chimneys for solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar or mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimney liners used in chimneys for solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar or mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume.

National Sentence Text: Chimney liners used in chimneys for oil- or gas-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimney liners used in chimneys for oil- or gas-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume.

National Sentence Text: Chimney liners shall extend from a point not less than 200 mm below the lowest flue pipe connection to a point not less than 50 mm or more than 100 mm above the chimney cap.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimney liners shall extend from a point not less than 200 mm below the lowest flue pipe connection to a point not less than 50 mm or more than 100 mm above the chimney cap.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Concrete shall conform to Section 9.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Footings for masonry chimneys and concrete chimneys shall conform to Section 9.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Footings for masonry chimneys and concrete chimneys shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: A chimney flue shall extend not less than 900 mm above the highest point at which the chimney comes in contact with the roof, and 600 mm above the highest roof surface or structure within 3 m of the chimney. (See Note A-9.21.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A chimney flue shall extend not less than 900 mm above the highest point at which the chimney comes in contact with the roof, and 600 mm above the highest roof surface or structure within 3 m of the chimney.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.21.4.5.(2), chimneys shall be braced in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. to provide lateral stability under wind loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.21.4.5.(2), chimneys shall be braced in accordance with part 4. to provide lateral stability under wind loads.

National Sentence Text: A chimney need not be laterally braced provided no horizontal outside dimension is less than 400 mm, and the chimney extends not more than 3.6 m above a roof or the masonry wall of which it forms a part. (See Note A-9.21.4.5.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A chimney need not be laterally braced provided no horizontal outside dimension is less than 400 mm, and the chimney extends not more than 3.6 m above a roof or the masonry wall of which it forms a part.

National Sentence Text: The top of a chimney shall have a waterproof cap of reinforced concrete, masonry or metal.
P/T Sentence Text: The top of a chimney shall have a waterproof cap of reinforced concrete, masonry or metal.

National Sentence Text: The cap required in Sentence 9.21.4.6.(1) shall slope from the lining and be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the chimney wall.
P/T Sentence Text: The cap required in Sentence 9.21.4.6.(1) shall slope from the lining and be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the chimney wall.

National Sentence Text: Cast-in-place concrete caps shall be separated from the chimney liner by a bond break and be sealed at that location.
P/T Sentence Text: Cast-in-place concrete caps shall be separated from the chimney liner by a bond break and be sealed at that location.

National Sentence Text: Jointed precast concrete or masonry chimney caps shall have flashing installed beneath the cap extending from the liner to the drip edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Jointed precast concrete or masonry chimney caps shall have flashing installed beneath the cap extending from the liner to the drip edge.

National Sentence Text: A cleanout opening with a metal frame and a tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimneyflue.
P/T Sentence Text: A cleanout opening with a metal frame and a tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue.

National Sentence Text: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Flue liners in the same chimney shall be separated by not less than 75 mm of masonry or concrete exclusive of liners where clay liners are used, or 90 mm of firebrick where firebrick liners are used.
P/T Sentence Text: Flue liners in the same chimney shall be separated by not less than 75 mm of masonry or concrete exclusive of liners where clay liners are used, or 90 mm of firebrick where firebrick liners are used.

National Sentence Text: Flue liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.4.9.(1) shall be installed to prevent significant lateral movement.
P/T Sentence Text: Flue liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.4.9.(1) shall be installed to prevent significant lateral movement.

National Sentence Text: Junctions with adjacent materials shall be adequately flashed to shed water.
P/T Sentence Text: Junctions with adjacent materials shall be adequately flashed to shed water.

National Sentence Text: The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be not less than 50 mm for interior chimneys, and 12 mm for exterior chimneys. (See Note A-9.21.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be not less than 50 mm for interior chimneys, and 12 mm for exterior chimneys.

National Sentence Text: A clearance of not less than 150 mm shall be provided between a cleanout opening and combustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: A clearance of not less than 150 mm shall be provided between a cleanout opening and combustible material.

National Sentence Text: Combustible flooring and subflooring shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible flooring and subflooring shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys.

National Sentence Text: All spaces between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be sealed top or bottom with noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: All spaces between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be sealed top or bottom with noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Joists or beams may be supported on masonry walls which enclose chimneyflues provided the combustible members are separated from the flue by not less than 290 mm of solid masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: Joists or beams may be supported on masonry walls which enclose chimney flues provided the combustible members are separated from the flue by not less than 290 mm of solid masonry.

National Sentence Text: Except when otherwise specifically stated herein, this Section applies to masonry fireplaces constructed on-site.
P/T Sentence Text: Except when otherwise specifically stated herein, this Section applies to masonry fireplaces constructed on-site.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20. and concrete to Section 9.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, unit masonry shall conform to part 9. and concrete to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Masonry above openings shall be supported by steel lintels conforming to Sentence 9.20.5.2.(2), reinforced concrete or a masonry arch.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry above openings shall be supported by steel lintels conforming to Sentence 9.20.5.2.(2), reinforced concrete or a masonry arch.

National Sentence Text: Footings for masonry and concrete fireplaces shall conform to Section 9.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Footings for masonry and concrete fireplaces shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Where a supply of combustion air is provided directly to the fire chamber of a fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace, the installation shall comply with the "Outdoor Air Supply" requirements provided in CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces
P/T Sentence Text: Where a supply of combustion air is provided directly to the fire chamber of a fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace, the installation shall comply with the "Outdoor Air Supply" requirements provided in CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces

National Sentence Text: Except where a fireplace is equipped with a steel liner, every fireplace shall have a firebrick liner.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a fireplace is equipped with a steel liner, every fireplace shall have a firebrick liner.

National Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be not less than 50 mm thick for the sides and back, and 25 mm thick for the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be not less than 50 mm thick for the sides and back, and 25 mm thick for the floor.

National Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar
P/T Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar

National Sentence Text: Joints between a firebrick liner and the adjacent backing masonry shall be offset.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints between a firebrick liner and the adjacent backing masonry shall be offset.

National Sentence Text: Steel liners for fireplaces shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S639-M87 Steel Liner Assemblies for Solid-Fuel Burning Masonry Fireplaces and shall be installed in accordance with the installation instructions in that standard.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel liners for fireplaces shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S639-M87 Steel Liner Assemblies for Solid-Fuel Burning Masonry Fireplaces and shall be installed in accordance with the installation instructions in that standard.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.22.3.1.(2), the thickness of the back and sides of a fireplace, including the thickness of any firebrick liner, shall be not less than 190 mm where a metal liner or a firebrick liner less than 51 mm thick is used.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.22.3.1.(2), the thickness of the back and sides of a fireplace, including the thickness of any firebrick liner, shall be not less than 190 mm where a metal liner or a firebrick liner less than 51 mm thick is used.

National Sentence Text: When a steel fireplace liner is used with an air circulating chamber surrounding the firebox, the back and sides of the fireplace shall consist of solid masonry units not less than 90 mm thick, or hollow masonry units not less than 190 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: When a steel fireplace liner is used with an air circulating chamber surrounding the firebox, the back and sides of the fireplace shall consist of solid masonry units not less than 90 mm thick, or hollow masonry units not less than 190 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: The distance from the back of the fire chamber to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be not less than 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance from the back of the fire chamber to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be not less than 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.22.5.1.(2), fireplaces shall have a noncombustible hearth extending not less than 400 mm in front of the fireplace opening and not less than 200 mm beyond each side of the fireplace opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.22.5.1.(2), fireplaces shall have a noncombustible hearth extending not less than 400 mm in front of the fireplace opening and not less than 200 mm beyond each side of the fireplace opening.

National Sentence Text: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.22.5.2.(2), the fire chamber floor and hearth shall be supported on a reinforced concrete slab not less than 100 mm thick at its supports and, if cantilevered, not less than 50 mm thick at its unsupported edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.22.5.2.(2), the fire chamber floor and hearth shall be supported on a reinforced concrete slab not less than 100 mm thick at its supports and, if cantilevered, not less than 50 mm thick at its unsupported edge.

National Sentence Text: A hearth for a fireplace with an opening raised not less than 200 mm from a combustible floor is permitted to be supported on that floor provided the requirements of Clauses 5.3.6.5. to 5.3.6.7. of CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces are followed.
P/T Sentence Text: A hearth for a fireplace with an opening raised not less than 200 mm from a combustible floor is permitted to be supported on that floor provided the requirements of Clauses 5.3.6.5. to 5.3.6.7. of CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces are followed.

National Sentence Text: The throat of every fireplace shall be equipped with a metal damper sufficiently large to cover the full area of the throat opening.
P/T Sentence Text: The throat of every fireplace shall be equipped with a metal damper sufficiently large to cover the full area of the throat opening.

National Sentence Text: The sides of the smoke chamber connecting a fireplace throat with a flue shall not be sloped at an angle greater than 45° to the vertical.
P/T Sentence Text: The sides of the smoke chamber connecting a fireplace throat with a flue shall not be sloped at an angle greater than 45° to the vertical.

National Sentence Text: The thickness of masonry walls surrounding the smoke chamber shall be not less than 190 mm at the sides, front and back, except that the portions of the back exposed to the outside may be 140 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of masonry walls surrounding the smoke chamber shall be not less than 190 mm at the sides, front and back, except that the portions of the back exposed to the outside may be 140 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Factory-built fireplaces and their installation shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S610-M87 Factory-Built Fireplaces
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-built fireplaces and their installation shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S610-M87 Factory-Built Fireplaces

National Sentence Text: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be not less than 300 mm above the top of the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be not less than 300 mm above the top of the opening.

National Sentence Text: Metal exposed to the interior of a fireplace such as the damper control mechanism shall have not less than a 50 mm clearance from any combustible material on the face of the fireplace where such metal penetrates through the face of the fireplace.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal exposed to the interior of a fireplace such as the damper control mechanism shall have not less than a 50 mm clearance from any combustible material on the face of the fireplace where such metal penetrates through the face of the fireplace.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 100 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of a fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 50 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 100 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of a fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 50 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 50 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of the smoke chamber of a fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 25 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 50 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of the smoke chamber of a fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 25 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: The clearance of combustible material above heat-circulating duct outlets from those outlets shall be not less than 300 mm where the combustible material projects not less than 38 mm from the face, and 150 mm where the projection is less than 38 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance of combustible material above heat-circulating duct outlets from those outlets shall be not less than 300 mm where the combustible material projects not less than 38 mm from the face, and 150 mm where the projection is less than 38 mm.

National Sentence Text: Fireplace inserts and hearth-mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to ULC ULC-S628-93 Fireplace Inserts
P/T Sentence Text: Fireplace inserts and hearth-mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to ULC ULC-S628-93 Fireplace Inserts

National Sentence Text: The installation of fireplace inserts and hearth-mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment (See Note A-9.23.1.1.) (See also Note A-9.4.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of fireplace inserts and hearth-mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to constructions where wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of lumber frames of small repetitive structural members, or engineered components, and where roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., the constructions do not serve as foundations, the specified live load on supported subfloors and floor framing does not exceed 2.4 kPa, and the span of any structural member does not exceed 12.20 m. (See Note A-9.23.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to constructions where wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of lumber frames of small repetitive structural members, or engineered components, and where roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., the constructions do not serve as foundations, the specified live load on supported subfloors and floor framing does not exceed 2.4 kPa, and the span of any structural member does not exceed 12.20 m.

National Sentence Text: Where the conditions in Sentence 9.23.1.1.(1) are exceeded for wood constructions, the design of the framing and fastening shall conform to Subsection 4.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the conditions in Sentence 9.23.1.1.(1) are exceeded for wood constructions, the design of the framing and fastening shall conform to part 4.

National Sentence Text: All members shall be so framed, anchored, fastened, tied and braced to provide the necessary strength and rigidity.
P/T Sentence Text: All members shall be so framed, anchored, fastened, tied and braced to provide the necessary strength and rigidity.

National Sentence Text: Ends of wood joists, beams and other members framing into masonry or concrete shall be treated to prevent decay where the bottom of the member is at or below ground level, or a 12 mm air space shall be provided at the end and sides of the member.
P/T Sentence Text: Ends of wood joists, beams and other members framing into masonry or concrete shall be treated to prevent decay where the bottom of the member is at or below ground level, or a 12 mm air space shall be provided at the end and sides of the member.

National Sentence Text: Air spaces required in Sentence 9.23.2.2.(1) shall not be blocked by insulation, vapour barriers or airtight materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Air spaces required in Sentence 9.23.2.2.(1) shall not be blocked by insulation, vapour barriers or airtight materials.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.2.3.(2), wood framing members that are not pressure-treated with a wood preservative and that are supported on concrete in contact with the ground or fill shall be separated from the concrete by not less than 0.05 mm polyethylene film or Type S roll roofing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.2.3.(2), wood framing members that are not pressure-treated with a wood preservative and that are supported on concrete in contact with the ground or fill shall be separated from the concrete by not less than 0.05 mm polyethylene film or Type S roll roofing.

National Sentence Text: Dampproofing material referred to in Sentence 9.23.2.3.(1) is not required where the wood member is at least 150 mm above the ground.
P/T Sentence Text: Dampproofing material referred to in Sentence 9.23.2.3.(1) is not required where the wood member is at least 150 mm above the ground.

National Sentence Text: Lumber shall conform to Subsection 9.3.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.3.1.(2) and unless otherwise indicated, nails specified in this Section shall be common steel wire nails or common spiral nails conforming to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.3.1.(2) and unless otherwise indicated, nails specified in this Section shall be common steel wire nails or common spiral nails conforming to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples

National Sentence Text: Nails used to comply with Table 9.23.3.4. shall have a diameter not less than that stated in Table 9.23.3.1. (See Note A-9.23.3.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used to comply with Table 9.23.3.4. shall have a diameter not less than that stated in Table 9.23.3.1. (See Note A-9.23.3.1.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Wood screws specified in this Section shall conform to ASME B18.6.1-1981 Wood Screws (Inch (See Note A-9.23.3.1.(3).) (See Note A-9.23.3.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Wood screws specified in this Section shall conform to ASME B18.6.1-1981 Wood Screws (Inch (See Note A-9.23.3.1.(3).)

National Sentence Text: All nails shall be long enough so that not less than half their required length penetrates into the second member.
P/T Sentence Text: All nails shall be long enough so that not less than half their required length penetrates into the second member.

National Sentence Text: Splitting of wood members shall be minimized by staggering the nails in the direction of the grain and by keeping nails well in from the edges. (See Note A-9.23.3.3.(1).) (See Note A-9.23.3.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Splitting of wood members shall be minimized by staggering the nails in the direction of the grain and by keeping nails well in from the edges. (See Note A-9.23.3.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.3.4.(2), nailing of framing shall conform to Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.3.4.(2), nailing of framing shall conform to Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: Where the bottom wall plate or sole plate of an exterior wall is not nailed to floor joists, rim joists or blocking in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4., the exterior wall is permitted to be fastened to the floor framing by having plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing extend down over floor framing and fastened to the floor framing by nails or staples conforming to Article 9.23.3.5., or tying the wall framing to the floor framing by galvanized-metal strips 50 mm wide, not less than 0.41 mm thick, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart, and fastened at each end with at least two 63 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the bottom wall plate or sole plate of an exterior wall is not nailed to floor joists, rim joists or blocking in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4., the exterior wall is permitted to be fastened to the floor framing by having plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing extend down over floor framing and fastened to the floor framing by nails or staples conforming to Article 9.23.3.5., or tying the wall framing to the floor framing by galvanized-metal strips 50 mm wide, not less than 0.41 mm thick, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart, and fastened at each end with at least two 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa, roof rafters, joists or trusses shall be tied to the wall framing with connectors that will resist a factored uplift load of 3 kN.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa, roof rafters, joists or trusses shall be tied to the wall framing with connectors that will resist a factored uplift load of 3 kN.

National Sentence Text: Galvanized-steel straps are deemed to comply with Sentence 9.23.3.4.(3), provided they are 50 mm wide, not less than 0.91 mm thick, and fastened at each end with at least four 63 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized-steel straps are deemed to comply with Sentence 9.23.3.4.(3), provided they are 50 mm wide, not less than 0.91 mm thick, and fastened at each end with at least four 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.3.5.(2)to 9.23.3.5.(4), fastening of sheathing and subflooring shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.3.5.(2) to 9.23.3.5.(4) , fastening of sheathing and subflooring shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-A.

National Sentence Text: Fastening of roof sheathing and sheathing in required braced wall panels shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-B, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa and less than 1.2 kPaand the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 0.90, or the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 and not more than 0.90.
P/T Sentence Text: Fastening of roof sheathing and sheathing in required braced wall panels shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-B, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa and less than 1.2 kPa and the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 0.90, or the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 and not more than 0.90.

National Sentence Text: Fastening of roof sheathing and sheathing in required braced wall panels shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-C, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa and less than 1.2 kPa and the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 1.8, or the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.90 and not more than 1.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Fastening of roof sheathing and sheathing in required braced wall panels shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-C, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa and less than 1.2 kPa and the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 1.8, or the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.90 and not more than 1.8.

National Sentence Text: Fastening of sheathing shall conform to Part 4, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.2 kPa, or for required braced wall panels, where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Fastening of sheathing shall conform to part 4., where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.2 kPa, or for required braced wall panels, where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8.

National Sentence Text: Staples shall not be less than 1.6 mm in diameter or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown driven with the crown parallel to framing.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples shall not be less than 1.6 mm in diameter or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown driven with the crown parallel to framing.

National Sentence Text: Roofing nails for the attachment of fibreboard or gypsum sheathing shall not be less than 3.2 mm in diameter with a minimum head diameter of 11.1 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Roofing nails for the attachment of fibreboard or gypsum sheathing shall not be less than 3.2 mm in diameter with a minimum head diameter of 11.1 mm.

National Sentence Text: Flooring screws shall not be less than 3.2 mm in diameter.
P/T Sentence Text: Flooring screws shall not be less than 3.2 mm in diameter.

National Sentence Text: The edges of sheathing in a braced wall panel shall be supported and fastened to wood blocking where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.2, or the braced wall panel supports more than a roof of lightweight construction.
P/T Sentence Text: The edges of sheathing in a braced wall panel shall be supported and fastened to wood blocking where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.2, or the braced wall panel supports more than a roof of lightweight construction.

National Sentence Text: Spans provided in this Subsection for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall apply only where the floors serve residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3., or the uniformly distributed live load on the floors does not exceed that specified for residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Spans provided in this Subsection for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall apply only where the floors serve residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3., or the uniformly distributed live load on the floors does not exceed that specified for residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3.

National Sentence Text: Spans for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall be determined according to Subsection 4.1.3. where the supported floors serve other than residential areas, or support a uniform live load in excess of that specified for residential areas. (See Note A-9.23.4.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Spans for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall be determined according to part 4. where the supported floors serve other than residential areas, or support a uniform live load in excess of that specified for residential areas.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.23.4.2.(2) and Article 9.23.14.10., spans for wood joists and rafters shall conform to the spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Ato 9.23.4.2.-G for the uniform live loads shown in the Tables. (See Article 9.4.2.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.23.4.2.(2) and Article 9.23.14.10., spans for wood joists and rafters shall conform to the spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Ato 9.23.4.2.-G for the uniform live loads shown in the Tables. (See Article 9.4.2.2.)

National Sentence Text: Spans for floor joists that are not selected from Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Aand 9.23.4.2.-B and that are required to be designed for the same loading conditions, shall not exceed the design requirements for uniform loading and vibration criteria. (See Note A-9.23.4.2.(2).) (See Note A-9.23.4.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Spans for floor joists that are not selected from Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Aand 9.23.4.2.-B and that are required to be designed for the same loading conditions, shall not exceed the design requirements for uniform loading and vibration criteria. (See Note A-9.23.4.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Spans for built-up wood and glued-laminated timber floor beams shall conform to the spans in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Hto 9.23.4.2.-K. (See Article 9.4.2.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Spans for built-up wood and glued-laminated timber floor beams shall conform to the spans in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-H to 9.23.4.2.-K. (See Article 9.4.2.2.)

National Sentence Text: Spans for roof ridge beams shall conform to the spans in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-L for the uniform snow load shown. (See Articles 9.4.2.2. and 9.23.14.8.)
P/T Sentence Text: Spans for roof ridge beams shall conform to the spans in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-L for the uniform snow load shown. (See Articles 9.4.2.2. and 9.23.14.8.)

National Sentence Text: The spans for steel floor beams with laterally supported top flanges shall conform to Table 9.23.4.3.(See Note A-9.23.4.3.(1).) (See Note A-9.23.4.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The spans for steel floor beams with laterally supported top flanges shall conform to Table 9.23.4.3.(See Note A-9.23.4.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Beams described in Sentence 9.23.4.3.(1) shall at least meet the requirements for Grade 350 W steel contained in CSA G40.21-13 Structural Quality Steel See Note A-Table 9.23.4.3. (See Note A-9.23.4.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Beams described in Sentence 9.23.4.3.(1) shall at least meet the requirements for Grade 350 W steel contained in CSA G40.21-13 Structural Quality Steel

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.4.4.(2), where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, the joist spans shown in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A or the spacing of the members shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.4.4.(2), where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, the joist spans shown in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A or the spacing of the members shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.

National Sentence Text: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, joist spans are permitted to be selected from Span Table 9.23.4.2.-B provided the concrete is 38 to 51 mm thick, is normal weight, is placed directly on the subflooring, and has not less than 20 MPa compressive strength after 28 days.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, joist spans are permitted to be selected from Span Table 9.23.4.2.-B provided the concrete is 38 to 51 mm thick, is normal weight, is placed directly on the subflooring, and has not less than 20 MPa compressive strength after 28 days.

National Sentence Text: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping not more than 51 mm thick, the allowable beam spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Hto 9.23.4.2.-K shall be multiplied by 0.8 or the supported length of the floor joists shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping not more than 51 mm thick, the allowable beam spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-H to 9.23.4.2.-K shall be multiplied by 0.8 or the supported length of the floor joists shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.

National Sentence Text: Where a roof is required to support an additional uniform dead load from roofing materials such as concrete roofing tile, or materials other than as specified in Section 9.27., such as clay roofing tiles, the additional load shall be allowed for by reducing the spans for roof joists and rafters in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Dto 9.23.4.2.-G, or the spacing of the members, and the spans for ridge beams and lintels in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Land 9.23.12.3.-Ato 9.23.12.3.-D. (See Note A-9.23.4.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roof is required to support an additional uniform dead load from roofing materials such as concrete roofing tile, or materials other than as specified in part 9., such as clay roofing tiles, the additional load shall be allowed for by reducing the spans for roof joists and rafters in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Dto 9.23.4.2.-G, or the spacing of the members, and the spans for ridge beams and lintels in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Land 9.23.12.3.-A to 9.23.12.3.-D.

National Sentence Text: Holes drilled in roof, floor or ceiling framing members shall be not larger than one-quarter the depth of the member and shall be located not less than 50 mm from the edges, unless the depth of the member is increased by the size of the hole.
P/T Sentence Text: Holes drilled in roof, floor or ceiling framing members shall be not larger than one-quarter the depth of the member and shall be located not less than 50 mm from the edges, unless the depth of the member is increased by the size of the hole.

National Sentence Text: Floor, roof and ceiling framing members are permitted to be notched provided the notch is located on the top of the member within half the joist depth from the edge of bearing and is not deeper than one-third the joist depth, unless the depth of the member is increased by the size of the notch.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor, roof and ceiling framing members are permitted to be notched provided the notch is located on the top of the member within half the joist depth from the edge of bearing and is not deeper than one-third the joist depth, unless the depth of the member is increased by the size of the notch.

National Sentence Text: Wall studs shall not be notched, drilled or otherwise damaged so that the undamaged portion of the stud is less than two-thirds the depth of the stud if the stud is loadbearing or 40 mm if the stud is non-loadbearing, unless the weakened studs are suitably reinforced.
P/T Sentence Text: Wall studs shall not be notched, drilled or otherwise damaged so that the undamaged portion of the stud is less than two-thirds the depth of the stud if the stud is loadbearing or 40 mm if the stud is non-loadbearing, unless the weakened studs are suitably reinforced.

National Sentence Text: Top plates in walls shall not be notched, drilled or otherwise weakened to reduce the undamaged width to less than 50 mm unless the weakened plates are suitably reinforced.
P/T Sentence Text: Top plates in walls shall not be notched, drilled or otherwise weakened to reduce the undamaged width to less than 50 mm unless the weakened plates are suitably reinforced.

National Sentence Text: Roof truss members shall not be notched, drilled or otherwise weakened unless such notching or drilling is allowed for in the design of the truss.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof truss members shall not be notched, drilled or otherwise weakened unless such notching or drilling is allowed for in the design of the truss.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.23.6.3.(1), building frames shall be anchored to the foundation unless a structural analysis of wind and earthquake pressures shows anchorage is not required.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.23.6.3.(1), building frames shall be anchored to the foundation unless a structural analysis of wind and earthquake pressures shows anchorage is not required.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.6.1.(3)to 9.23.6.1.(6), anchorage shall be provided by embedding the ends of the first floor joists in concrete, or fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.6.1.(3) to 9.23.6.1.(6), anchorage shall be provided by embedding the ends of the first floor joists in concrete, or fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.6.1.(3) to 9.23.6.1.(6), anchorage shall be provided by embedding the ends of the first floor joists in concrete, fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c., or embedding in concrete two 38 mm by 89 mm sill plates placed on edge and separated by blocking spaced 1.2 m o.c.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.6.1.(3) to 9.23.6.1.(6), anchorage shall be provided by embedding the ends of the first floor joists in concrete, fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c., or embedding in concrete two 38 mm by 89 mm sill plates placed on edge and separated by blocking spaced 1.2 m o.c.

National Sentence Text: For buildings with 2 or more floors supported by frame walls that are in areas where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.70 or the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is equal to or greater than 0.80 kPa but not greater than 1.20 kPa, anchorage shall be provided by fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than two anchor bolts per braced wall panel, where all anchor bolts used are not less than 15.9 mm in diameter, located within 0.5 m of the end of the foundation, and spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c, or not less than 12.7 mm in diameter, located within 0.5 m of the end of the foundation, and spaced not more than 1.7 m o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: For buildings with 2 or more floors supported by frame walls that are in areas where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.70 or the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is equal to or greater than 0.80 kPa but not greater than 1.20 kPa, anchorage shall be provided by fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than two anchor bolts per braced wall panel, where all anchor bolts used are not less than 15.9 mm in diameter, located within 0.5 m of the end of the foundation, and spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c, or not less than 12.7 mm in diameter, located within 0.5 m of the end of the foundation, and spaced not more than 1.7 m o.c.

National Sentence Text: For buildings supported by frame walls that are in areas where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not greater than 1.8 and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is not greater than 1.20 kPa, anchorage shall be provided by fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than two anchor bolts per braced wall panel located within 0.5 m of the end of the foundation and spaced in accordance with Table 9.23.6.1.
P/T Sentence Text: For buildings supported by frame walls that are in areas where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not greater than 1.8 and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is not greater than 1.20 kPa, anchorage shall be provided by fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than two anchor bolts per braced wall panel located within 0.5 m of the end of the foundation and spaced in accordance with Table 9.23.6.1.

National Sentence Text: Anchor bolts referred to in Sentences 9.23.6.1.(2)to 9.23.6.1.(4) shall be fastened to the sill plate with nuts and washers, embedded not less than 100 mm in the foundation, and so designed that they may be tightened without withdrawing them from the foundation.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchor bolts referred to in Sentences 9.23.6.1.(2) to 9.23.6.1.(4) shall be fastened to the sill plate with nuts and washers, embedded not less than 100 mm in the foundation, and so designed that they may be tightened without withdrawing them from the foundation.

National Sentence Text: Where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8 or the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.2 kPa, anchorage shall be designed according to Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8 or the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.2 kPa, anchorage shall be designed according to part 4..

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.6.2.(2)and 9.23.6.2.(3), exterior columns and posts shall be anchored to resist uplift and lateral movement.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.6.2.(2) and 9.23.6.2.(3), exterior columns and posts shall be anchored to resist uplift and lateral movement.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.6.2.(3), where columns or posts support balconies, decks, verandas or other exterior platforms, and the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, the columns or posts shall be anchored to the foundation to resist uplift and lateral movement, or the supported joists or beams shall be directly anchored to the ground to resist uplift.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.6.2.(3), where columns or posts support balconies, decks, verandas or other exterior platforms, and the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, the columns or posts shall be anchored to the foundation to resist uplift and lateral movement, or the supported joists or beams shall be directly anchored to the ground to resist uplift.

National Sentence Text: Anchorage is not required for platforms described in Sentence 9.23.6.2.(2) that are not more than 1 storey in height, are not more than 55 m2 in area, do not support a roof, and are not attached to another structure, unless it can be demonstrated that differential movement will not adversely affect the performance of the structure to which the platform is attached.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchorage is not required for platforms described in Sentence 9.23.6.2.(2) that are not more than 1 storey in height, are not more than 55 m2 in area, do not support a roof, and are not attached to another structure, unless it can be demonstrated that differential movement will not adversely affect the performance of the structure to which the platform is attached.

National Sentence Text: Buildings not more than 4.3 m wide and not more than 1 storey in building height that are not anchored in accordance with Sentence 9.23.6.1.(1) shall be anchored in conformance with the requirements of CSA Z240.10.1-16 Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings not more than 4.3 m wide and not more than 1 storey in building height that are not anchored in accordance with Sentence 9.23.6.1.(1) shall be anchored in conformance with the requirements of CSA Z240.10.1-16 Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings

National Sentence Text: Where sill plates provide bearing for the floor system, they shall be not less than 38 mm by 89 mm material.
P/T Sentence Text: Where sill plates provide bearing for the floor system, they shall be not less than 38 mm by 89 mm material.

National Sentence Text: Sill plates shall be levelled by setting them on a full bed of mortar, or laid directly on the foundation if the top of the foundation is level. (See also Article 9.23.2.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Sill plates shall be levelled by setting them on a full bed of mortar, or laid directly on the foundation if the top of the foundation is level.

National Sentence Text: The joint between the sill plate for exterior walls and the foundation shall be sealed in accordance with Subsection 9.25.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The joint between the sill plate for exterior walls and the foundation shall be sealed in accordance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: Beams shall have even and level bearing and the bearing at end supports shall be not less than 89 mm long, except as stated in the notes to Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Hto 9.23.4.2.-K.
P/T Sentence Text: Beams shall have even and level bearing and the bearing at end supports shall be not less than 89 mm long, except as stated in the notes to Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-H to 9.23.4.2.-K.

National Sentence Text: Exterior steel beams shall be shop primed. (See Note A-9.23.8.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior steel beams shall be shop primed.

National Sentence Text: Where a beam is made up of individual pieces of lumber that are nailed together, the individual members shall be 38 mm or greater in thickness and installed on edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a beam is made up of individual pieces of lumber that are nailed together, the individual members shall be 38 mm or greater in thickness and installed on edge.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(3), where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(3), where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.

National Sentence Text: Where a beam is continuous over more than one span, individual members are permitted to be butted together to form a joint at or within 150 mm of the end quarter points of the clear spans, provided the quarter points are not those closest to the ends of the beam.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a beam is continuous over more than one span, individual members are permitted to be butted together to form a joint at or within 150 mm of the end quarter points of the clear spans, provided the quarter points are not those closest to the ends of the beam.

National Sentence Text: Members joined at quarter points shall be continuous over adjacent supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Members joined at quarter points shall be continuous over adjacent supports.

National Sentence Text: Joints in individual members of a beam that are located at or near the end quarter points shall not occur in adjacent members at the same quarter point and shall not reduce the effective beam width by more than half.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints in individual members of a beam that are located at or near the end quarter points shall not occur in adjacent members at the same quarter point and shall not reduce the effective beam width by more than half.

National Sentence Text: Not more than one butt joint shall occur in any individual member of a built-up beam within any one span.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than one butt joint shall occur in any individual member of a built-up beam within any one span.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(8), where 38 mm members are laid on edge to form a built-up beam, individual members shall be nailed together with a double row of nails not less than 89 mm in length, spaced not more than 450 mm apart in each row with the end nails located 100 mm to 150 mm from the end of each piece.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(8), where 38 mm members are laid on edge to form a built-up beam, individual members shall be nailed together with a double row of nails not less than 89 mm in length, spaced not more than 450 mm apart in each row with the end nails located 100 mm to 150 mm from the end of each piece.

National Sentence Text: Where 38 mm members in built-up wood beams are not nailed together as provided in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(7), they shall be bolted together with not less than 12.7 mm diam bolts equipped with washers and spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c., with the end bolts located not more than 600 mm from the ends of the members.
P/T Sentence Text: Where 38 mm members in built-up wood beams are not nailed together as provided in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(7), they shall be bolted together with not less than 12.7 mm diam bolts equipped with washers and spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c., with the end bolts located not more than 600 mm from the ends of the members.

National Sentence Text: Except when supported on ribbon boards, floor joists shall have not less than 38 mm length of end bearing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except when supported on ribbon boards, floor joists shall have not less than 38 mm length of end bearing.

National Sentence Text: Ribbon boards referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.1.(1) shall be not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber let into the studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Ribbon boards referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.1.(1) shall be not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber let into the studs.

National Sentence Text: Floor joists may be supported on the tops of beams or may be framed into the sides of beams.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor joists may be supported on the tops of beams or may be framed into the sides of beams.

National Sentence Text: When framed into the side of a wood beam, joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(1) shall be supported on joist hangers or other acceptable mechanical connectors, or not less than 38 mm by 64 mm ledger strips nailed to the side of the beam, except that 38 mm by 38 mm ledger strips may be used provided each joist is nailed to the beam by not less than four 89 mm nails, in addition to the nailing for the ledger strip required in Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: When framed into the side of a wood beam, joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(1) shall be supported on joist hangers or other acceptable mechanical connectors, or not less than 38 mm by 64 mm ledger strips nailed to the side of the beam, except that 38 mm by 38 mm ledger strips may be used provided each joist is nailed to the beam by not less than four 89 mm nails, in addition to the nailing for the ledger strip required in Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: When framed into the side of a steel beam, joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(1) shall be supported on the bottom flange of the beam or on not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber bolted to the web with not less than 6.3 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 600 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: When framed into the side of a steel beam, joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(1) shall be supported on the bottom flange of the beam or on not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber bolted to the web with not less than 6.3 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 600 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(3) shall be spliced above the beam with not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber at least 600 mm long to support the flooring.
P/T Sentence Text: Joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(3) shall be spliced above the beam with not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber at least 600 mm long to support the flooring.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 12 mm space shall be provided between the splice required in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(4) and the beam to allow for shrinkage of the wood joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 12 mm space shall be provided between the splice required in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(4) and the beam to allow for shrinkage of the wood joists.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.4.(1), bottoms of floor joists shall be restrained from twisting at each end by toe-nailing to the supports, end-nailing to the header joists or by providing continuous strapping, blocking between the joists or cross-bridging near the supports. (See Note A-9.23.4.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.4.(1), bottoms of floor joists shall be restrained from twisting at each end by toe-nailing to the supports, end-nailing to the header joists or by providing continuous strapping, blocking between the joists or cross-bridging near the supports.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.23.9.4.(5), where strapping is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, it shall be not less than 19 mm by 64 mm, nailed to the underside of floor joists, located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of strapping, and fastened at each end to a sill or header.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.23.9.4.(5), where strapping is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, it shall be not less than 19 mm by 64 mm, nailed to the underside of floor joists, located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of strapping, and fastened at each end to a sill or header.

National Sentence Text: Where bridging is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, it shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 64 mm or 38 mm by 38 mm cross bridging located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of bridging.
P/T Sentence Text: Where bridging is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, it shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 64 mm or 38 mm by 38 mm cross bridging located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of bridging.

National Sentence Text: Where bridging and strapping are specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, bridging shall comply with Sentence 9.23.9.4.(2), or consist of 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists, and except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.4.(5), strapping shall comply with Sentence 9.23.9.4.(1) and be installed under the bridging.
P/T Sentence Text: Where bridging and strapping are specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, bridging shall comply with Sentence 9.23.9.4.(2), or consist of 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists, and except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.4.(5), strapping shall comply with Sentence 9.23.9.4.(1) and be installed under the bridging.

National Sentence Text: Bridging specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-B shall consist of bridging as described in Sentence 9.23.9.4.(2), or 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Bridging specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-B shall consist of bridging as described in Sentence 9.23.9.4.(2), or 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists.
