National Sentence Text: Strapping described in Sentence 9.23.9.4.(1) and Clause 9.23.9.4.(3)(b) is not required where furring strips complying with Table 9.29.3.1. are fastened directly to the joists, or a panel-type ceiling finish complying with Subsection 9.29.5., Subsection 9.29.6., Subsection 9.29.7., Subsection 9.29.8., or Subsection 9.29.9. is attached directly to the joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Strapping described in Sentence 9.23.9.4.(1) and Sentence 9.23.9.4.(3) is not required where furring strips complying with Table 9.29.3.1. are fastened directly to the joists, or a panel-type ceiling finish complying with part 9., part 9., part 9., part 9., or part 9. is attached directly to the joists.

National Sentence Text: Where a ceiling attached to wood furring is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-B, the ceiling finish shall consist of gypsum board, plywood or OSB not less than 12.7 mm thick, and the furring shall be 19 mm by 89 mm wood furring spaced at not more than 600 mm o.c., or 19 mm by 64 mm wood furring spaced at not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a ceiling attached to wood furring is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-B, the ceiling finish shall consist of gypsum board, plywood or OSB not less than 12.7 mm thick, and the furring shall be 19 mm by 89 mm wood furring spaced at not more than 600 mm o.c., or 19 mm by 64 mm wood furring spaced at not more than 400 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Header joists around floor openings shall be doubled when they exceed 1.2 m in length.
P/T Sentence Text: Header joists around floor openings shall be doubled when they exceed 1.2 m in length.

National Sentence Text: The size of header joists exceeding 3.2 m in length shall be determined by calculations.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of header joists exceeding 3.2 m in length shall be determined by calculations.

National Sentence Text: Trimmer joists around floor openings shall be doubled when the length of the header joist exceeds 800 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Trimmer joists around floor openings shall be doubled when the length of the header joist exceeds 800 mm.

National Sentence Text: When the header joist exceeds 2 m in length the size of the trimmer joists shall be determined by calculations.
P/T Sentence Text: When the header joist exceeds 2 m in length the size of the trimmer joists shall be determined by calculations.

National Sentence Text: When tail joists and header joists are supported by the floor framing, they shall be supported by suitable joist hangers or nailing in accordance with Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: When tail joists and header joists are supported by the floor framing, they shall be supported by suitable joist hangers or nailing in accordance with Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing walls parallel to the floor joists shall be supported by joists beneath the wall or on blocking between the joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing walls parallel to the floor joists shall be supported by joists beneath the wall or on blocking between the joists.

National Sentence Text: Blocking referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.8.(1) for the support of non-loadbearing walls shall be not less than 38 mm by 89 mm lumber, and except as required for the fastening of walls constructed with required braced wall panels, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Blocking referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.8.(1) for the support of non-loadbearing walls shall be not less than 38 mm by 89 mm lumber, and except as required for the fastening of walls constructed with required braced wall panels, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.8.(6), non-loadbearing interior walls at right angles to the floor joists are not restricted as to location.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.8.(6), non-loadbearing interior walls at right angles to the floor joists are not restricted as to location.

National Sentence Text: Loadbearing interior walls parallel to floor joists shall be supported by beams or walls of sufficient strength to safely transfer the specified live loads to the vertical supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Loadbearing interior walls parallel to floor joists shall be supported by beams or walls of sufficient strength to safely transfer the specified live loads to the vertical supports.

National Sentence Text: Unless the joist size is designed to support such loads, loadbearing interior walls at right angles to floor joists shall be located not more than 900 mm from the joist support where the wall does not support a floor, and not more than 600 mm from the joist support where the wall supports one or more floors.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless the joist size is designed to support such loads, loadbearing interior walls at right angles to floor joists shall be located not more than 900 mm from the joist support where the wall does not support a floor, and not more than 600 mm from the joist support where the wall supports one or more floors.

National Sentence Text: Loadbearing and non-loadbearing walls constructed with required braced wall panels shall be continuously supported by floor joists, blocking or rim joists to allow for the required fastening (see Table 9.23.3.4.).
P/T Sentence Text: Loadbearing and non-loadbearing walls constructed with required braced wall panels shall be continuously supported by floor joists, blocking or rim joists to allow for the required fastening (see Table 9.23.3.4.).

National Sentence Text: Floor joists supporting roof loads shall not be cantilevered more than 400 mm beyond their supports where 38 mm by 184 mm joists are used and not more than 600 mm beyond their supports where 38 mm by 235 mm or larger joists are used.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor joists supporting roof loads shall not be cantilevered more than 400 mm beyond their supports where 38 mm by 184 mm joists are used and not more than 600 mm beyond their supports where 38 mm by 235 mm or larger joists are used.

National Sentence Text: The cantilevered portions referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.9.(1) shall not support floor loads from other storeys unless calculations are provided to show that the design resistances of the cantilevered joists are not exceeded.
P/T Sentence Text: The cantilevered portions referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.9.(1) shall not support floor loads from other storeys unless calculations are provided to show that the design resistances of the cantilevered joists are not exceeded.

National Sentence Text: Where cantilevered floor joists described in Sentences 9.23.9.9.(1)and 9.23.9.9.(2) are at right angles to the main floor joists, the tail joists in the cantilevered portion shall extend inward away from the cantilever support a distance equal to not less than 6 times the length of the cantilever, and shall be end nailed to an interior doubled header joist in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Where cantilevered floor joists described in Sentences 9.23.9.9.(1)and 9.23.9.9.(2) are at right angles to the main floor joists, the tail joists in the cantilevered portion shall extend inward away from the cantilever support a distance equal to not less than 6 times the length of the cantilever, and shall be end nailed to an interior doubled header joist in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: The size and spacing of studs shall conform to Table 9.23.10.1.
P/T Sentence Text: The size and spacing of studs shall conform to Table 9.23.10.1.

National Sentence Text: Where loadbearing interior walls are not finished in accordance with Section 9.29., blocking or strapping shall be fastened to the studs at mid-height to prevent sideways buckling.
P/T Sentence Text: Where loadbearing interior walls are not finished in accordance with part 9., blocking or strapping shall be fastened to the studs at mid-height to prevent sideways buckling.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.23.10.3.(2)and 9.23.10.3.(3), all studs shall be placed at right angles to the wall face.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.23.10.3.(2) and 9.23.10.3.(3), all studs shall be placed at right angles to the wall face.

National Sentence Text: Studs on the flat are permitted to be used in gable ends of roofs that contain only unfinished space or in non-loadbearing interior walls within the limits described in Article 9.23.10.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Studs on the flat are permitted to be used in gable ends of roofs that contain only unfinished space or in non-loadbearing interior walls within the limits described in Article 9.23.10.1.

National Sentence Text: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided the studs are clad on not less than one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.
P/T Sentence Text: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided the studs are clad on not less than one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.

National Sentence Text: Wall studs shall be continuous for the full storey height except at openings and shall not be spliced except by fingerjoining with a structural adhesive. (See Note A-9.23.10.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Wall studs shall be continuous for the full storey height except at openings and shall not be spliced except by fingerjoining with a structural adhesive. (See Note A-9.23.10.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Corners and intersections shall be designed to provide adequate support for the vertical edges of interior finishes, sheathing and cladding materials, and in no instance shall exterior corners be framed with less than the equivalent of 2 studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Corners and intersections shall be designed to provide adequate support for the vertical edges of interior finishes, sheathing and cladding materials, and in no instance shall exterior corners be framed with less than the equivalent of 2 studs.

National Sentence Text: Where the vertical edges of interior finishes at wall intersections are supported at vertical intervals by blocking or furring, the vertical distance between such supports shall not exceed the maximum distance between supports specified in Section 9.29.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the vertical edges of interior finishes at wall intersections are supported at vertical intervals by blocking or furring, the vertical distance between such supports shall not exceed the maximum distance between supports specified in part 9.

National Sentence Text: Where the lintel spanning the opening is more than 3 m long, studs shall be tripled on each side of the opening so that the two inner studs on each side extend from the bottom of the supported lintel to the top of the bottom wall plate, and the outer stud on each side extends from the bottom of the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the lintel spanning the opening is more than 3 m long, studs shall be tripled on each side of the opening so that the two inner studs on each side extend from the bottom of the supported lintel to the top of the bottom wall plate, and the outer stud on each side extends from the bottom of the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.10.6.(3), where the lintel spanning the opening is not more than 3 m long, studs shall be doubled on each side of the opening so that the inner studs on each side extend from the bottom of the supported lintel to the top of the bottom wall plate, and the outer stud on each side extends from the bottom of the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.10.6.(3), where the lintel spanning the opening is not more than 3 m long, studs shall be doubled on each side of the opening so that the inner studs on each side extend from the bottom of the supported lintel to the top of the bottom wall plate, and the outer stud on each side extends from the bottom of the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate.

National Sentence Text: Single studs are permitted to be used on either side of openings in non-loadbearing interior walls not required to have fire-resistance ratings, provided the studs extend from the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate, or in loadbearing or non-loadbearing interior or exterior walls, provided the opening is less than and within the required stud spacing, and no 2 such openings of full stud-space width are located in adjacent stud spaces. (See Note A-9.23.10.6.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Single studs are permitted to be used on either side of openings in non-loadbearing interior walls not required to have fire-resistance ratings, provided the studs extend from the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate, or in loadbearing or non-loadbearing interior or exterior walls, provided the opening is less than and within the required stud spacing, and no 2 such openings of full stud-space width are located in adjacent stud spaces.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.11.1.(2), wall plates shall be not less than 38 mm thick, and not less than the required width of the wall studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.11.1.(2), wall plates shall be not less than 38 mm thick, and not less than the required width of the wall studs.

National Sentence Text: In non-loadbearing walls and in loadbearing walls where the studs are located directly over framing members, the bottom wall plate is permitted to be 19 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: In non-loadbearing walls and in loadbearing walls where the studs are located directly over framing members, the bottom wall plate is permitted to be 19 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: A bottom wall plate shall be provided in all cases.
P/T Sentence Text: A bottom wall plate shall be provided in all cases.

National Sentence Text: The bottom plate in exterior walls shall not project more than one-third the plate width over the support.
P/T Sentence Text: The bottom plate in exterior walls shall not project more than one-third the plate width over the support.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.23.11.3.(2)to 9.23.11.3.(4), at least 2 top plates shall be provided in loadbearing walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.23.11.3.(2) to 9.23.11.3.(4), at least 2 top plates shall be provided in loadbearing walls.

National Sentence Text: A single top plate is permitted to be used in a section of a loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the top plate forms a tie across the lintel.
P/T Sentence Text: A single top plate is permitted to be used in a section of a loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the top plate forms a tie across the lintel.

National Sentence Text: A single top plate is permitted to be used in loadbearing walls where the concentrated loads from ceilings, floors and roofs are not more than 50 mm to one side of the supporting studs and in all non-loadbearing walls.
P/T Sentence Text: A single top plate is permitted to be used in loadbearing walls where the concentrated loads from ceilings, floors and roofs are not more than 50 mm to one side of the supporting studs and in all non-loadbearing walls.

National Sentence Text: The top plates need not be provided in a section of loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the lintel is tied to the adjacent wall section with not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel, or 19 mm by 89 mm by 300 mm wood splice nailed to each wall section with at least three 63 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: The top plates need not be provided in a section of loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the lintel is tied to the adjacent wall section with not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel, or 19 mm by 89 mm by 300 mm wood splice nailed to each wall section with at least three 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Joints in the top plates of loadbearing walls shall be staggered not less than one stud spacing.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints in the top plates of loadbearing walls shall be staggered not less than one stud spacing.

National Sentence Text: The top plates in loadbearing walls shall be lapped or otherwise tied at corners and intersecting walls in accordance with Sentence 9.23.11.4.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: The top plates in loadbearing walls shall be lapped or otherwise tied at corners and intersecting walls in accordance with Sentence 9.23.11.4.(4).

National Sentence Text: Joints in single top plates used with loadbearing walls shall be tied in accordance with Sentence 9.23.11.4.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Joints in single top plates used with loadbearing walls shall be tied in accordance with Sentence 9.23.11.4.(4).

National Sentence Text: Ties referred to in Sentences 9.23.11.4.(2)and 9.23.11.4.(3) shall be the equivalent of not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel nailed to each wall with at least three 63 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: Ties referred to in Sentences 9.23.11.4.(2) and 9.23.11.4.(3) shall be the equivalent of not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel nailed to each wall with at least three 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not more than 1.8, doubled top plates in braced wall bands shall be fastened on each side of a splice with 76 mm long common steel wire nails or spiral nails in accordance with Table 9.23.11.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not more than 1.8, doubled top plates in braced wall bands shall be fastened on each side of a splice with 76 mm long common steel wire nails or spiral nails in accordance with Table 9.23.11.4.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.12.1.(2), openings in non-loadbearing walls shall be framed with not less than 38 mm material the same width as the studs, securely nailed to adjacent studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.12.1.(2), openings in non-loadbearing walls shall be framed with not less than 38 mm material the same width as the studs, securely nailed to adjacent studs.

National Sentence Text: Openings for doors in non-loadbearing walls required to be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating shall be framed with the equivalent of at least two 38 mm thick members that are the same width as the wall plates.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings for doors in non-loadbearing walls required to be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating shall be framed with the equivalent of at least two 38 mm thick members that are the same width as the wall plates.

National Sentence Text: Openings in loadbearing walls greater than the required stud spacing shall be framed with lintels designed to carry the superimposed loads to adjacent studs. (See Note A-9.23.10.6.(3).) (See Note A-9.23.10.6.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings in loadbearing walls greater than the required stud spacing shall be framed with lintels designed to carry the superimposed loads to adjacent studs. (See Note A-9.23.10.6.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.12.3.(2), where 2 or more members are used in lintels, they shall be fastened together with not less than 82 mm nails in a double row, with nails not more than 450 mm apart in each row.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.12.3.(2), where 2 or more members are used in lintels, they shall be fastened together with not less than 82 mm nails in a double row, with nails not more than 450 mm apart in each row.

National Sentence Text: Lintel members are permitted to be separated by filler pieces.
P/T Sentence Text: Lintel members are permitted to be separated by filler pieces.

National Sentence Text: Spans and sizes of wood lintels shall conform to the spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Land 9.23.12.3.-Ato 9.23.12.3.-D for buildings of residential occupancy, where the wall studs exceed 38 mm by 64 mm in size, where the spans of supported joists do not exceed 4.9 m, and where the spans of trusses do not exceed 9.8 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Spans and sizes of wood lintels shall conform to the spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Land 9.23.12.3.-A to 9.23.12.3.-D for buildings of residential occupancy, where the wall studs exceed 38 mm by 64 mm in size, where the spans of supported joists do not exceed 4.9 m, and where the spans of trusses do not exceed 9.8 m.

National Sentence Text: In loadbearing exterior and interior walls of 38 mm by 64 mm framing members, lintels shall consist of 64 mm thick members on edge, or 38 mm thick and 19 mm thick members fastened together with a double row of nails not less than 63 mm long and spaced not more than 450 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: In loadbearing exterior and interior walls of 38 mm by 64 mm framing members, lintels shall consist of 64 mm thick members on edge, or 38 mm thick and 19 mm thick members fastened together with a double row of nails not less than 63 mm long and spaced not more than 450 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Lintels referred to in Sentence 9.23.12.3.(2) shall be not less than 50 mm greater in depth than those shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Land 9.23.12.3.-Ato 9.23.12.3.-D for the maximum spans shown, and shall not exceed 2.24 m in length. (See Note A-9.23.13.) (See Note A-9.23.13.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Lintels referred to in Sentence 9.23.12.3.(2) shall be not less than 50 mm greater in depth than those shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-L and 9.23.12.3.-Ato 9.23.12.3.-D for the maximum spans shown, and shall not exceed 2.24 m in length.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 0.70 and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 0.80 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 0.70 and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 0.80 kPa.

National Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed as follows: exterior walls shall be clad with panel-type cladding in accordance with Section 9.27., sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard, fibreboard, gypsum board or diagonal lumber sheathing complying with Subsection 9.23.17. and fastened in accordance with Table 9.23.3.5.-A, or finished on the interior with a panel-type material in accordance with the requirements of Section 9.29., or in accordance with Articles 9.23.13.4.to 9.23.13.7., Part 4, or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed as follows: exterior walls shall be clad with panel-type cladding in accordance with part 9., sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard, fibreboard, gypsum board or diagonal lumber sheathing complying with part 9. and fastened in accordance with Table 9.23.3.5.-A, or finished on the interior with a panel-type material in accordance with the requirements of part 9., or in accordance with Articles 9.23.13.4. to 9.23.13.7., part 4., or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.23.13.1., this Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not more than 1.8 and the lowest exterior frame wall supports not more than 1 floor in buildings of heavy construction (see Note A-9.23.13.2.(1)(a)(i)), or the lowest exterior frame wall supports not more than 2 floors in other types of construction, and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 1.20 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.23.13.1., this Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not more than 1.8 and the lowest exterior frame wall supports not more than 1 floor in buildings of heavy construction (see Note A-9.23.13.2.(1)(a)(i)), or the lowest exterior frame wall supports not more than 2 floors in other types of construction, and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 1.20 kPa.

National Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Articles 9.23.13.4.to 9.23.13.7., Part 4, or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Articles 9.23.13.4. to 9.23.13.7., part 4., or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.23.13.1.and 9.23.13.2., this Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8, greater than 0.70 and the lowest exterior frame wall supports more than 2 floors in buildings of light construction, or greater than 0.70 and the lowest exterior frame wall supports more than 1 floor in buildings of heavy construction, or the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.20 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.23.13.1. and 9.23.13.2., this Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8, greater than 0.70 and the lowest exterior frame wall supports more than 2 floors in buildings of light construction, or greater than 0.70 and the lowest exterior frame wall supports more than 1 floor in buildings of heavy construction, or the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.20 kPa.

National Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Part 4, or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction (See Note A-9.23.13.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed in accordance with part 4., or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction

National Sentence Text: Braced wall bands shall be full storey height, be not more than 1.2 m wide, lap at both ends with another braced wall band, be aligned with braced wall bands on storeys above and below, and conform to the spacing and dimensions given in Table 9.23.13.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Braced wall bands shall be full storey height, be not more than 1.2 m wide, lap at both ends with another braced wall band, be aligned with braced wall bands on storeys above and below, and conform to the spacing and dimensions given in Table 9.23.13.5.

National Sentence Text: The perimeter of the building shall be located within braced wall bands.
P/T Sentence Text: The perimeter of the building shall be located within braced wall bands.

National Sentence Text: For split-level buildings, a braced wall band shall be located where there is a change in floor level greater than the depth of one floor joist.
P/T Sentence Text: For split-level buildings, a braced wall band shall be located where there is a change in floor level greater than the depth of one floor joist.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.13.5.(2)to 9.23.13.5.(5) and Article 9.23.13.7., braced wall panels shall be located within braced wall bands, extend, as applicable, from the top of the supporting footing, slab or subfloor to the underside of the floor, ceiling or roof framing above, and conform to the spacing and dimensions given in Table 9.23.13.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.13.5.(2) to 9.23.13.5.(5) and Article 9.23.13.7., braced wall panels shall be located within braced wall bands, extend, as applicable, from the top of the supporting footing, slab or subfloor to the underside of the floor, ceiling or roof framing above, and conform to the spacing and dimensions given in Table 9.23.13.5.

National Sentence Text: In basements or crawl spaces where the perimeter foundation walls extend from the footings to the underside of the supported floor, braced wall bands constructed with braced wall panels shall be spaced not more than 15 m from the perimeter foundation walls, 15 m from interior foundation walls, and 15 m from adjacent braced wall bands constructed with braced wall panels. (See Note A-9.23.13.5.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: In basements or crawl spaces where the perimeter foundation walls extend from the footings to the underside of the supported floor, braced wall bands constructed with braced wall panels shall be spaced not more than 15 m from the perimeter foundation walls, 15 m from interior foundation walls, and 15 m from adjacent braced wall bands constructed with braced wall panels.

National Sentence Text: Portions of the perimeter of a single open or enclosed space need not comply with Sentence 9.23.13.5.(1), where the roof of the space projects not more than 3.5 m from the face of the framing of the nearest parallel braced wall band, and half the perpendicular plan dimension, that portion of the perimeter structure does not support a floor, and the roof of the space is integral with the roof of the rest of the building with framing members not more than 400 mm o.c., or constructed with roof framing not more than 400 mm o.c. fastened to the wall framing (see Table 9.23.3.4. and Article 9.23.9.1. for balloon framing). (See Note A-9.23.13.5.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Portions of the perimeter of a single open or enclosed space need not comply with Sentence 9.23.13.5.(1), where the roof of the space projects not more than 3.5 m from the face of the framing of the nearest parallel braced wall band, and half the perpendicular plan dimension, that portion of the perimeter structure does not support a floor, and the roof of the space is integral with the roof of the rest of the building with framing members not more than 400 mm o.c., or constructed with roof framing not more than 400 mm o.c. fastened to the wall framing (see Table 9.23.3.4. and Article 9.23.9.1. for balloon framing).

National Sentence Text: Walls in detached garages and in accessory buildings serving a single dwelling unit, and the front wall of attached garages serving a single dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence 9.23.13.5.(1) where these walls do not support a floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Walls in detached garages and in accessory buildings serving a single dwelling unit, and the front wall of attached garages serving a single dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence 9.23.13.5.(1) where these walls do not support a floor.

National Sentence Text: Braced wall panels in the braced wall band at the front of an attached garage serving a single dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence 9.23.13.5.(1), provided the maximum spacing between the front of the garage and the back wall of the garage does not exceed 7.6 m, there is not more than one floor above the garage, not less than 50% of the length of the back wall of the garage is constructed of braced wall panels, and not less than 25% of the length of the side walls is constructed of braced wall panels.
P/T Sentence Text: Braced wall panels in the braced wall band at the front of an attached garage serving a single dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence 9.23.13.5.(1), provided the maximum spacing between the front of the garage and the back wall of the garage does not exceed 7.6 m, there is not more than one floor above the garage, not less than 50% of the length of the back wall of the garage is constructed of braced wall panels, and not less than 25% of the length of the side walls is constructed of braced wall panels.

National Sentence Text: Required braced wall panels shall be clad with panel-type cladding complying with Section 9.27. and Table 9.23.3.4., sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard or diagonal lumber sheathing complying with Subsection 9.23.16. and Table 9.23.13.6., and fastened in accordance with Article 9.23.3.5., or finished on the interior with a panel-type material in accordance with the requirements of Section 9.29. and Table 9.23.13.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Required braced wall panels shall be clad with panel-type cladding complying with part 9. and Table 9.23.3.4., sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard or diagonal lumber sheathing complying with part 9. and Table 9.23.13.6., and fastened in accordance with Article 9.23.3.5., or finished on the interior with a panel-type material in accordance with the requirements of part 9. and Table 9.23.13.6.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.13.6.(3), required interior braced wall panels shall be sheathed or finished on both sides with a wood-based material, or finished on both sides with gypsum board.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.13.6.(3), required interior braced wall panels shall be sheathed or finished on both sides with a wood-based material, or finished on both sides with gypsum board.

National Sentence Text: Required interior braced wall panels of wood-based material may be sheathed on one side only, provided the sheathing material is plywood, OSB or waferboard, and the maximum spacing of fasteners along the edge is half of the maximum spacing shown in Table 9.23.3.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Required interior braced wall panels of wood-based material may be sheathed on one side only, provided the sheathing material is plywood, OSB or waferboard, and the maximum spacing of fasteners along the edge is half of the maximum spacing shown in Table 9.23.3.5.-B.

National Sentence Text: For stacked braced wall bands, where the construction of any one braced wall panel is required to be of a wood-based material, a wood-based material shall be installed in all the required braced wall panels in that braced wall band.
P/T Sentence Text: For stacked braced wall bands, where the construction of any one braced wall panel is required to be of a wood-based material, a wood-based material shall be installed in all the required braced wall panels in that braced wall band.

National Sentence Text: Gypsum board interior finish shall not be considered as an acceptable sheathing material to provide the required bracing in exterior walls. (See Note A-9.23.13.6.(5) and (6).)
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum board interior finish shall not be considered as an acceptable sheathing material to provide the required bracing in exterior walls. (See Note A-9.23.13.6.(5).)

National Sentence Text: At braced wall band spacing intervals of not more than 15 m, braced wall panels shall be constructed with OSB, plywood or diagonal lumber. (See Note A-9.23.13.6.(5) and (6).)
P/T Sentence Text: At braced wall band spacing intervals of not more than 15 m, braced wall panels shall be constructed with OSB, plywood or diagonal lumber. (See Note A-9.23.13.6.(5).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.13.7.(2)and 9.23.13.7.(3), one exterior wall of the uppermost storey in each orthogonal direction may be set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, provided the adjacent interior braced wall band of the storey below the setback is spaced not more than 10.6 m from the exterior wall of the storey below the setback wall, consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6.(2), extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals of not more than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.13.7.(2) and 9.23.13.7.(3), one exterior wall of the uppermost storey in each orthogonal direction may be set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, provided the adjacent interior braced wall band of the storey below the setback is spaced not more than 10.6 m from the exterior wall of the storey below the setback wall, consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6.(2), extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals of not more than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6).

National Sentence Text: Where the exterior wall of the uppermost storey is set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, the roof and floor space supporting the setback wall shall be sheathed with a wood-based material between the exterior wall of the storey below the setback and the adjacent interior braced wall bands of the storey below the setback.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the exterior wall of the uppermost storey is set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, the roof and floor space supporting the setback wall shall be sheathed with a wood-based material between the exterior wall of the storey below the setback and the adjacent interior braced wall bands of the storey below the setback.

National Sentence Text: Where the exterior wall of the uppermost storey is set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, the exterior walls perpendicular to the setback wall shall have their top plate connected with nails that are spaced at no greater than half the spacing required in Table 9.23.3.4., and have their top plate splices fastened with twice the number of nails specified in Sentences 9.23.11.4.(4)and 9.23.11.4.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the exterior wall of the uppermost storey is set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, the exterior walls perpendicular to the setback wall shall have their top plate connected with nails that are spaced at no greater than half the spacing required in Table 9.23.3.4., and have their top plate splices fastened with twice the number of nails specified in Sentences 9.23.11.4.(4) and 9.23.11.4.(5).

National Sentence Text: The maximum distance between adjacent required braced wall panels in a braced wall band, measured from the edge of the panels, may be increased to 7.3 m provided that, throughout the height of the building, the length of any braced wall panel within the braced wall band is not less than 1.2 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum distance between adjacent required braced wall panels in a braced wall band, measured from the edge of the panels, may be increased to 7.3 m provided that, throughout the height of the building, the length of any braced wall panel within the braced wall band is not less than 1.2 m.

National Sentence Text: The maximum spacing between the centre lines of required braced wall bands given in Table 9.23.13.5. may be increased from 7.6 m to no more than 10.6 m, provided that the interior braced wall band whose spacing is being increased is replaced with an interior braced wall band that consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6.(2), extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals no greater than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum spacing between the centre lines of required braced wall bands given in Table 9.23.13.5. may be increased from 7.6 m to no more than 10.6 m, provided that the interior braced wall band whose spacing is being increased is replaced with an interior braced wall band that consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6.(2), extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals no greater than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6).

National Sentence Text: For each orthogonal direction of the building, the length of required braced wall panels of one exterior wall given in Table 9.23.13.5. may be reduced from 40% to no less than 25% of the length of the braced wall band, provided an additional parallel and adjacent interior braced wall band is constructed that is spaced not more than 10.6 m from the exterior wall, consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6.(2) and whose lengths sum to no less than 25% of the length of the braced wall band, extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals no greater than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: For each orthogonal direction of the building, the length of required braced wall panels of one exterior wall given in Table 9.23.13.5. may be reduced from 40% to no less than 25% of the length of the braced wall band, provided an additional parallel and adjacent interior braced wall band is constructed that is spaced not more than 10.6 m from the exterior wall, consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6.(2) and whose lengths sum to no less than 25% of the length of the braced wall band, extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals no greater than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6).

National Sentence Text: Where the length of required braced wall panels of an exterior wall is reduced as described in Sentence 9.23.13.7.(6), the ratio of the length of braced wall panels in the respective upper braced wall bands to the length of braced wall panels in the reduced exterior braced wall band shall not exceed 2.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the length of required braced wall panels of an exterior wall is reduced as described in Sentence 9.23.13.7.(6), the ratio of the length of braced wall panels in the respective upper braced wall bands to the length of braced wall panels in the reduced exterior braced wall band shall not exceed 2.

National Sentence Text: Roof rafters and joists and ceiling joists shall be continuous or shall be spliced over vertical supports that extend to suitable bearing.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof rafters and joists and ceiling joists shall be continuous or shall be spliced over vertical supports that extend to suitable bearing.

National Sentence Text: Roof and ceiling framing members shall be doubled on each side of openings greater than 2 rafter or joist spacings wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof and ceiling framing members shall be doubled on each side of openings greater than 2 rafter or joist spacings wide.

National Sentence Text: The length of end bearing of joists and rafters shall be not less than 38 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The length of end bearing of joists and rafters shall be not less than 38 mm.

National Sentence Text: Rafters shall be located directly opposite each other and tied together at the peak, or may be offset by their own thickness if nailed to a ridge board not less than 17.5 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Rafters shall be located directly opposite each other and tied together at the peak, or may be offset by their own thickness if nailed to a ridge board not less than 17.5 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.14.4.(3), framing members shall be connected by gusset plates or nailing at the peak in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.14.4.(3), framing members shall be connected by gusset plates or nailing at the peak in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: Where the roof framing on opposite sides of the peak is assembled separately, such as in the case of factory-built houses, the roof framing on opposite sides is permitted to be fastened together with galvanized-steel strips not less than 200 mm by 75 mm by 0.41 mm thick spaced not more than 1.2 m apart and nailed at each end to the framing by at least two 63 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the roof framing on opposite sides of the peak is assembled separately, such as in the case of factory-built houses, the roof framing on opposite sides is permitted to be fastened together with galvanized-steel strips not less than 200 mm by 75 mm by 0.41 mm thick spaced not more than 1.2 m apart and nailed at each end to the framing by at least two 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Rafters shall be shaped at supports to provide even bearing surfaces and supported directly above the exterior walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Rafters shall be shaped at supports to provide even bearing surfaces and supported directly above the exterior walls.

National Sentence Text: Hip and valley rafters shall be not less than 50 mm greater in depth than the common rafters and not less than 38 mm thick, actual dimension.
P/T Sentence Text: Hip and valley rafters shall be not less than 50 mm greater in depth than the common rafters and not less than 38 mm thick, actual dimension.

National Sentence Text: Ceiling joists and collar ties of not less than 38 mm by 89 mm lumber are permitted to be assumed to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists where the roof slope is 1 in 3 or greater.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling joists and collar ties of not less than 38 mm by 89 mm lumber are permitted to be assumed to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists where the roof slope is 1 in 3 or greater.

National Sentence Text: Collar ties referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.7.(1) more than 2.4 m long shall be laterally supported near their centres by not less than 19 mm by 89 mm continuous members at right angles to the collar ties.
P/T Sentence Text: Collar ties referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.7.(1) more than 2.4 m long shall be laterally supported near their centres by not less than 19 mm by 89 mm continuous members at right angles to the collar ties.

National Sentence Text: Dwarf walls and struts are permitted to be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Dwarf walls and struts are permitted to be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.

National Sentence Text: When struts are used to provide intermediate support they shall be not less than 38 mm by 89 mm material extending from each rafter to a loadbearing wall at an angle of not less than 45° to the horizontal.
P/T Sentence Text: When struts are used to provide intermediate support they shall be not less than 38 mm by 89 mm material extending from each rafter to a loadbearing wall at an angle of not less than 45° to the horizontal.

National Sentence Text: When dwarf walls are used for rafter support, they shall be framed in the same manner as loadbearing walls and securely fastened top and bottom to the roof and ceiling framing to prevent over-all movement.
P/T Sentence Text: When dwarf walls are used for rafter support, they shall be framed in the same manner as loadbearing walls and securely fastened top and bottom to the roof and ceiling framing to prevent over-all movement.

National Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be installed between floor joists beneath dwarf walls referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.7.(5) that enclose finished rooms.
P/T Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be installed between floor joists beneath dwarf walls referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.7.(5) that enclose finished rooms.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(4), roof rafters and joists shall be supported at the ridge of the roof by a loadbearing wall extending from the ridge to suitable bearing, or a ridge beam supported by not less than 89 mm length of bearing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(4), roof rafters and joists shall be supported at the ridge of the roof by a loadbearing wall extending from the ridge to suitable bearing, or a ridge beam supported by not less than 89 mm length of bearing.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(3), the ridge beam referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(1) shall conform to the sizes and spans shown in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-L, provided the supported rafter or joist length does not exceed 4.9 m, and the roof does not support any concentrated loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(3), the ridge beam referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(1) shall conform to the sizes and spans shown in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-L, provided the supported rafter or joist length does not exceed 4.9 m, and the roof does not support any concentrated loads.

National Sentence Text: The ridge beam referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(1) need not comply with Sentence 9.23.14.8.(2) where the beam is of not less than 38 mm by 140 mm material, and the beam is supported at intervals not exceeding 1.2 m by not less than 38 mm by 89 mm members extending vertically from the ridge to suitable bearing.
P/T Sentence Text: The ridge beam referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(1) need not comply with Sentence 9.23.14.8.(2) where the beam is of not less than 38 mm by 140 mm material, and the beam is supported at intervals not exceeding 1.2 m by not less than 38 mm by 89 mm members extending vertically from the ridge to suitable bearing.

National Sentence Text: When the roof slope is 1 in 3 or more, ridge support need not be provided when the lower ends of the rafters are adequately tied to prevent outward movement.
P/T Sentence Text: When the roof slope is 1 in 3 or more, ridge support need not be provided when the lower ends of the rafters are adequately tied to prevent outward movement.

National Sentence Text: Ties required in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(4) are permitted to consist of tie rods or ceiling joists forming a continuous tie for opposing rafters and nailed in accordance with Table 9.23.14.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Ties required in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(4) are permitted to consist of tie rods or ceiling joists forming a continuous tie for opposing rafters and nailed in accordance with Table 9.23.14.8.

National Sentence Text: Ceiling joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(5) shall be fastened together with at least one more nail per joist splice than required for the rafter to joist connection shown in Table 9.23.14.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(5) shall be fastened together with at least one more nail per joist splice than required for the rafter to joist connection shown in Table 9.23.14.8.

National Sentence Text: Members referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(6) are permitted to be fastened together either directly or through a gusset plate.
P/T Sentence Text: Members referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(6) are permitted to be fastened together either directly or through a gusset plate.

National Sentence Text: Roof joists supporting a finished ceiling, other than plywood, OSB or waferboard, shall be restrained from twisting along the bottom edges by means of furring, blocking, cross bridging or strapping conforming to Article 9.23.9.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof joists supporting a finished ceiling, other than plywood, OSB or waferboard, shall be restrained from twisting along the bottom edges by means of furring, blocking, cross bridging or strapping conforming to Article 9.23.9.3.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.14.10.(2), ceiling joists supporting part of the roof load from the rafters shall be not less than 25 mm greater in depth than required for ceiling joists not supporting part of the roof load.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.14.10.(2), ceiling joists supporting part of the roof load from the rafters shall be not less than 25 mm greater in depth than required for ceiling joists not supporting part of the roof load.

National Sentence Text: When the roof slope is 1 in 4 or less, the ceiling joist sizes referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.10.(1) shall be determined from Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Cto 9.23.4.2.-Fand 9.23.4.2.-L for roof joists.
P/T Sentence Text: When the roof slope is 1 in 4 or less, the ceiling joist sizes referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.10.(1) shall be determined from Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Cto 9.23.4.2.-F and 9.23.4.2.-L for roof joists.

National Sentence Text: Roof trusses which are not designed in accordance with Part 4. shall be capable of supporting a total ceiling load (dead load plus live load ) of 0.35 kPa plus two and two-thirds times the specified live roof load for 24 h, and not exceed the deflections shown in Table 9.23.14.11. when loaded with the ceiling load plus one and one-third times the specified roof snow load for 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof trusses which are not designed in accordance with part 4. shall be capable of supporting a total ceiling load (dead load plus live load ) of 0.35 kPa plus two and two-thirds times the specified live roof load for 24 h, and not exceed the deflections shown in Table 9.23.14.11. when loaded with the ceiling load plus one and one-third times the specified roof snow load for 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The joint connections used in trusses described in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(1) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Subsection 4.3.1. (See Note A-9.23.14.11.(2).) (See Note A-9.23.14.11.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The joint connections used in trusses described in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(1) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in part 4. (See Note A-9.23.14.11.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Where the length of compression web members in roof trusses described in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(1) exceeds 1.83 m, such web members shall be provided with continuous bracing to prevent buckling.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the length of compression web members in roof trusses described in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(1) exceeds 1.83 m, such web members shall be provided with continuous bracing to prevent buckling.

National Sentence Text: Bracing required in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.
P/T Sentence Text: Bracing required in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.

National Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.23.14.11.(1) is demonstrated by testing, it shall consist of a full scale load test carried out in conformance with CSA S307-M1980 Load Test Procedure for Wood Roof Trusses for Houses and Small Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.23.14.11.(1) is demonstrated by testing, it shall consist of a full scale load test carried out in conformance with CSA S307-M1980 Load Test Procedure for Wood Roof Trusses for Houses and Small Buildings

National Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.23.14.11.(1) is demonstrated by analysis, it shall be carried out in accordance with good engineering practice such as that described in TPIC 2014 Truss Design Procedures and Specifications for Light Metal Plate Connected Wood Trusses (Limit States Design)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.23.14.11.(1) is demonstrated by analysis, it shall be carried out in accordance with good engineering practice such as that described in TPIC 2014 Truss Design Procedures and Specifications for Light Metal Plate Connected Wood Trusses (Limit States Design)

National Sentence Text: Subflooring shall be provided beneath finish flooring where the finish flooring does not have adequate strength to support the specified live loads (see Subsection 9.30.3.).
P/T Sentence Text: Subflooring shall be provided beneath finish flooring where the finish flooring does not have adequate strength to support the specified live loads (see part 9.).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.15.2.(2), wood-based panels for subfloors shall conform to CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.15.2.(2), wood-based panels for subfloors shall conform to CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard

National Sentence Text: Particleboard subflooring may be used only where a building is constructed in a factory so that the subfloor will not be exposed to the weather.
P/T Sentence Text: Particleboard subflooring may be used only where a building is constructed in a factory so that the subfloor will not be exposed to the weather.

National Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence 9.23.15.2.(2) shall conform to grade D-2 or D-3 in ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard
P/T Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence 9.23.15.2.(2) shall conform to grade D-2 or D-3 in ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard

National Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence 9.23.15.2.(2) shall have its upper surface and all edges treated to restrict water absorption, where the subfloor is used in bathrooms, kitchens, laundry rooms or other areas subject to periodic wetting. (See Note A-9.23.15.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence 9.23.15.2.(2) shall have its upper surface and all edges treated to restrict water absorption, where the subfloor is used in bathrooms, kitchens, laundry rooms or other areas subject to periodic wetting. (See Note A-9.23.15.2.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Where the edges of panel-type subflooring are required to be supported (see Sentence 9.30.2.1.(2)), such support shall consist of tongue-and-groove panel edges or not less than 38 mm by 38 mm blocking securely nailed between framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the edges of panel-type subflooring are required to be supported (see Sentence 9.30.2.1.(2)), such support shall consist of tongue-and-groove panel edges or not less than 38 mm by 38 mm blocking securely nailed between framing members.

National Sentence Text: Plywood subflooring shall be installed with the surface grain at right angles to the joists and with joints parallel to floor joists staggered.
P/T Sentence Text: Plywood subflooring shall be installed with the surface grain at right angles to the joists and with joints parallel to floor joists staggered.

National Sentence Text: OSB subflooring conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or to O-1 and O-2 grades in CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard and waferboard subflooring conforming to R-1 grade in CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard shall be installed so that the direction of face orientation is at right angles to the joists and the joints parallel to the floor joists are staggered. (See Note A-9.23.15.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: OSB subflooring conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or to O-1 and O-2 grades in CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard and waferboard subflooring conforming to R-1 grade in CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard shall be installed so that the direction of face orientation is at right angles to the joists and the joints parallel to the floor joists are staggered. (See Note A-9.23.15.4.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.15.5.(2)and 9.23.15.5.(3), subfloors shall conform to either Table 9.23.15.5.-Aor 9.23.15.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.15.5.(2) and 9.23.15.5.(3), subfloors shall conform to either Table 9.23.15.5.-A or 9.23.15.5.-B.

National Sentence Text: Where the finished flooring consists of not less than 19 mm matched wood strip flooring laid at right angles to joists spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., subflooring shall be permitted to consist of not less than 12.5 mm thick plywood, 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or OSB conforming to 2R32/2F16 grade.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the finished flooring consists of not less than 19 mm matched wood strip flooring laid at right angles to joists spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., subflooring shall be permitted to consist of not less than 12.5 mm thick plywood, 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or OSB conforming to 2R32/2F16 grade.

National Sentence Text: Except where the flooring consists of ceramic tiles applied with adhesive, where a separate panel-type underlay or concrete topping is applied to a subfloor on joists spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., the subfloor is permitted to consist of not less than 12.5 mm thick plywood, 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or OSB conforming to 2R32/2F16 grade.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the flooring consists of ceramic tiles applied with adhesive, where a separate panel-type underlay or concrete topping is applied to a subfloor on joists spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., the subfloor is permitted to consist of not less than 12.5 mm thick plywood, 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or OSB conforming to 2R32/2F16 grade.

National Sentence Text: When resilient flooring is applied directly to an OSB, waferboard, particleboard or plywood subfloor, the subfloor shall be fastened to the supports with annular grooved nails.
P/T Sentence Text: When resilient flooring is applied directly to an OSB, waferboard, particleboard or plywood subfloor, the subfloor shall be fastened to the supports with annular grooved nails.

National Sentence Text: Lumber subflooring shall be laid at an angle of not less than 45° to the joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber subflooring shall be laid at an angle of not less than 45° to the joists.

National Sentence Text: Lumber subflooring shall be fully supported at the ends on solid bearing.
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber subflooring shall be fully supported at the ends on solid bearing.

National Sentence Text: Lumber for subflooring shall be of uniform thickness and not more than 184 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber for subflooring shall be of uniform thickness and not more than 184 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Except where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 0.8 kPa and the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is less than or equal to 0.70, continuous lumber or panel-type roof sheathing shall be installed to support the roofing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 0.8 kPa and the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is less than or equal to 0.70, continuous lumber or panel-type roof sheathing shall be installed to support the roofing.

National Sentence Text: Wood-based panels used for roof sheathing shall conform to the requirements of CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: Wood-based panels used for roof sheathing shall conform to the requirements of CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard

National Sentence Text: Plywood roof sheathing shall be installed with the surface grain at right angles to the roof framing.
P/T Sentence Text: Plywood roof sheathing shall be installed with the surface grain at right angles to the roof framing.

National Sentence Text: OSB roof sheathing conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or to O-1 and O-2 grades as specified in CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard shall be installed with the direction of face orientation at right angles to the roof framing members. (See Note A-9.23.15.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: OSB roof sheathing conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or to O-1 and O-2 grades as specified in CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard shall be installed with the direction of face orientation at right angles to the roof framing members. (See Note A-9.23.15.4.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Panel-type sheathing board shall be applied so that joints perpendicular to the roof ridge are staggered where the sheathing is applied with the surface grain parallel to the roof ridge, and the thickness of the sheathing is such that the edges are required to be supported.
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type sheathing board shall be applied so that joints perpendicular to the roof ridge are staggered where the sheathing is applied with the surface grain parallel to the roof ridge, and the thickness of the sheathing is such that the edges are required to be supported.

National Sentence Text: A gap of not less than 2 mm shall be left between sheets of plywood, OSB or waferboard.
P/T Sentence Text: A gap of not less than 2 mm shall be left between sheets of plywood, OSB or waferboard.

National Sentence Text: Lumber roof sheathing shall not be more than 286 mm wide and shall be applied so that all ends are supported with end joints staggered.

National Sentence Text: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and to minimize airflow into the insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material. P/T Sentence Text: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and to minimize airflow into the insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material. (See Article 9.19.1.3.)

National Sentence Text: Spray-applied polyurethane insulation shall be installed in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S705.2-05 Thermal Insulation – Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density – Application
P/T Sentence Text: Spray-applied polyurethane insulation shall be installed in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S705.2-05 Thermal Insulation – Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density – Application

National Sentence Text: Wall, ceiling and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or from the ground shall be constructed so as to include an air barrier system that will provide a continuous barrier to air leakage from the interior of the building into wall, floor, attic or roof spaces, sufficient to prevent excessive moisture condensation in such spaces during the winter, and from the exterior or the ground inward sufficient to prevent moisture condensation on the room side during winter, ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants, and minimize the ingress of soil gas. (See Note A-9.25.3.1.(1).) (See Note A-9.25.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Wall, ceiling and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or from the ground shall be constructed so as to include an air barrier system that will provide a continuous barrier to air leakage from the interior of the building into wall, floor, attic or roof spaces, sufficient to prevent excessive moisture condensation in such spaces during the winter, and from the exterior or the ground inward sufficient to prevent moisture condensation on the room side during winter, ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants, and minimize the ingress of soil gas.

National Sentence Text: Air barrier systems shall possess the characteristics necessary to provide an effective barrier to air infiltration and exfiltration under differential air pressure due to stack effect, mechanical systems or wind.
P/T Sentence Text: Air barrier systems shall possess the characteristics necessary to provide an effective barrier to air infiltration and exfiltration under differential air pressure due to stack effect, mechanical systems or wind.

National Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide airtightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide airtightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction

National Sentence Text: Where the air barrier system consists of an air-impermeable panel-type material, all joints shall be sealed to prevent air leakage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the air barrier system consists of an air-impermeable panel-type material, all joints shall be sealed to prevent air leakage.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.25.3.6.(3), where the air barrier system consists of flexible sheet material, all joints shall be sealed, or lapped not less than 100 mm and clamped, such as between framing members, furring or blocking, and rigid panels.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.25.3.6.(3), where the air barrier system consists of flexible sheet material, all joints shall be sealed, or lapped not less than 100 mm and clamped, such as between framing members, furring or blocking, and rigid panels.

National Sentence Text: Where an interior wall meets an exterior wall, ceiling, floor or roof required to be provided with air barrier protection, the air barrier system shall extend across the intersection.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior wall meets an exterior wall, ceiling, floor or roof required to be provided with air barrier protection, the air barrier system shall extend across the intersection.

National Sentence Text: Where an interior wall projects through a ceiling or extends to become an exterior wall, spaces in the wall shall be blocked to provide continuity across those spaces with the air barrier system in the abutting walls or ceiling.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior wall projects through a ceiling or extends to become an exterior wall, spaces in the wall shall be blocked to provide continuity across those spaces with the air barrier system in the abutting walls or ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Where an interior floor projects through an exterior wall or extends to become an exterior floor, continuity of the air barrier system shall be maintained from the abutting walls across the floor assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior floor projects through an exterior wall or extends to become an exterior floor, continuity of the air barrier system shall be maintained from the abutting walls across the floor assembly.

National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.

National Sentence Text: Where access hatches and sump pit covers are installed through assemblies constructed with an air barrier system, they shall be weatherstripped around their perimeters to prevent air leakage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where access hatches and sump pit covers are installed through assemblies constructed with an air barrier system, they shall be weatherstripped around their perimeters to prevent air leakage.

National Sentence Text: Clearances between chimneys or gas vents and the surrounding construction that would permit air leakage from within the building into a wall or attic or roof space shall be sealed by noncombustible material to prevent such leakage. (See Note A-9.25.3.4. and 9.25.3.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Clearances between chimneys or gas vents and the surrounding construction that would permit air leakage from within the building into a wall or attic or roof space shall be sealed by noncombustible material to prevent such leakage.

National Sentence Text: Masonry walls required to provide a barrier to the ingress of air from the ground shall include a course of masonry units without voids, or be sealed with flashing material extending across the full width of the masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry walls required to provide a barrier to the ingress of air from the ground shall include a course of masonry units without voids, or be sealed with flashing material extending across the full width of the masonry.

National Sentence Text: The masonry course or flashing described in Sentence 9.25.3.4.(1) shall be located at the level of the adjoining floor and be sealed to it in accordance with Article 9.25.3.6., or in the absence of a floor, be located at the level of the ground cover required by Article 9.18.6.1. and be sealed to it.
P/T Sentence Text: The masonry course or flashing described in Sentence 9.25.3.4.(1) shall be located at the level of the adjoining floor and be sealed to it in accordance with Article 9.25.3.6., or in the absence of a floor, be located at the level of the ground cover required by Article 9.18.6.1. and be sealed to it.

National Sentence Text: Waterproofing systems for roofs of underground structures shall be sealed to the air barrier in the walls. (See Note A-9.25.3.4. and 9.25.3.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Waterproofing systems for roofs of underground structures shall be sealed to the air barrier in the walls.

National Sentence Text: Materials used to provide a barrier to the ingress of air through floors-on-ground shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Materials used to provide a barrier to the ingress of air through floors-on-ground shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction

National Sentence Text: Where the floor-on-ground is a concrete slab, the air barrier shall be installed below the slab, or applied to the top of the slab, provided a separate floor is installed over the slab. (See Note A-9.25.3.6.(2) and (3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the floor-on-ground is a concrete slab, the air barrier shall be installed below the slab, or applied to the top of the slab, provided a separate floor is installed over the slab.

National Sentence Text: Where the air barrier installed below a floor-on-ground is flexible sheet material, joints in the barrier shall be lapped not less than 300 mm. (See Note A-9.25.3.6.(2) and (3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the air barrier installed below a floor-on-ground is flexible sheet material, joints in the barrier shall be lapped not less than 300 mm. (See Note A-9.25.3.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Where installed in conjunction with a framed floor-on-ground or above a floor-on-ground, the air barrier shall be installed in accordance with Article 9.25.3.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Where installed in conjunction with a framed floor-on-ground or above a floor-on-ground, the air barrier shall be installed in accordance with Article 9.25.3.3.

National Sentence Text: A floor-on-ground shall be sealed around its perimeter to the inner surfaces of adjacent walls using flexible sealant.
P/T Sentence Text: A floor-on-ground shall be sealed around its perimeter to the inner surfaces of adjacent walls using flexible sealant.

National Sentence Text: All penetrations of a floor-on-ground that are required to drain water from the floor surface shall be sealed in a manner that prevents the upward flow of air without preventing the downward flow of liquid water.
P/T Sentence Text: All penetrations of a floor-on-ground that are required to drain water from the floor surface shall be sealed in a manner that prevents the upward flow of air without preventing the downward flow of liquid water.

National Sentence Text: Thermally insulated wall, ceiling and floor assemblies shall be constructed with a vapour barrier so as to provide a barrier to diffusion of water vapour from the interior into wall spaces, floor spaces or attic or roof spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Thermally insulated wall, ceiling and floor assemblies shall be constructed with a vapour barrier so as to provide a barrier to diffusion of water vapour from the interior into wall spaces, floor spaces or attic or roof spaces.

National Sentence Text: Vapour barriers shall have a permeance not greater than 60 ng/(Pa·s·m2) measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry cup).
P/T Sentence Text: Vapour barriers shall have a permeance not greater than 60 ng/(Pa·s·m2) measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry cup).

National Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5. (See Note A-9.25.4.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to part 5.. (See Note A-9.25.4.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Where polyethylene is installed to serve only as the vapour barrier, it shall comply with Clause 4.4, Thermal Stability, and Clause 5.7, Oxidative Induction Time, of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Where polyethylene is installed to serve only as the vapour barrier, it shall comply with Clause 4.4, Thermal Stability, and Clause 5.7, Oxidative Induction Time, of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction

National Sentence Text: Membrane-type vapour barriers other than polyethylene shall conform to the requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.33-M89 Vapour Barrier Sheet, Excluding Polyethylene, for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Membrane-type vapour barriers other than polyethylene shall conform to the requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.33-M89 Vapour Barrier Sheet, Excluding Polyethylene, for Use in Building Construction

National Sentence Text: Where a coating is applied to gypsum board to function as the vapour barrier, the permeance of the coating shall be determined in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-1.501-M89 Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard
P/T Sentence Text: Where a coating is applied to gypsum board to function as the vapour barrier, the permeance of the coating shall be determined in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-1.501-M89 Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard
