National Sentence Text: Where foamed plastic insulation functions as the vapour barrier, it shall be sufficiently thick so as to meet the requirement of Sentence 9.25.4.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where foamed plastic insulation functions as the vapour barrier, it shall be sufficiently thick so as to meet the requirement of Sentence 9.25.4.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: Products installed to function as the vapour barrier shall protect the warm side of wall, ceiling and floor assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: Products installed to function as the vapour barrier shall protect the warm side of wall, ceiling and floor assemblies.

National Sentence Text: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Note A-9.25.4.3.(2) and Note A-9.25.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Note A-9.25.4.3.(2) and Note A-9.25.5.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Where the same product is used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the product shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the assembly to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Notes A-9.25.4.3.(2), Note A-9.25.5.1.(1) and Note A-9.25.5.2.) (See Note A-9.25.5.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the same product is used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the product shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the assembly to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Notes A-9.25.4.3.(2), Note A-9.25.5.1.(1) and Note A-9.25.5.2.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.25.5.1.(2)to 9.25.5.1.(4), sheet and panel-type materials incorporated into assemblies described in Article 9.25.1.1. shall conform to Article 9.25.5.2., where the material has an air leakage characteristic less than 0.1 L/(s·m2) at 75 Pa, and a water vapour permeance less than 60 ng/(Pa·s·m2) when measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry (see Note A-9.25.5.1.(1)(a)(ii)), and the intended use of the interior space where the materials are installed will not result in high moisture generation. (See Note A-9.25.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.25.5.1.(2) to 9.25.5.1.(4), sheet and panel-type materials incorporated into assemblies described in Article 9.25.1.1. shall conform to Article 9.25.5.2., where the material has an air leakage characteristic less than 0.1 L/(s·m2) at 75 Pa, and a water vapour permeance less than 60 ng/(Pa·s·m2) when measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry (see Note A-9.25.5.1.(1)(a)(ii)), and the intended use of the interior space where the materials are installed will not result in high moisture generation.

National Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to part 5..

National Sentence Text: Wood-based sheathing materials not more than 12.5 mm thick and complying with Article 9.23.17.2. need not comply with Sentence 9.25.5.1.(1). (See Note A-9.25.5.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Wood-based sheathing materials not more than 12.5 mm thick and complying with Article 9.23.17.2. need not comply with Sentence 9.25.5.1.(1). (See Note A-9.25.5.1.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Where a material has a water vapour permeance not less than 30 ng/(Pa s m2) and a thermal resistance not less than 0.7 (m2·K)/W and the heating degree-days of the building location are less than 6000, the assembly need not comply with Sentence 9.25.5.1.(1). (See Note A-9.25.5.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a material has a water vapour permeance not less than 30 ng/(Pa s m2) and a thermal resistance not less than 0.7 (m2·K)/W and the heating degree-days of the building location are less than 6000, the assembly need not comply with Sentence 9.25.5.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: Sheet and panel-type materials described in Article 9.25.5.1. shall be installed on the warm face of the assembly (see also Article 9.25.4.2.), at a location where the ratio between the total thermal resistance of all materials outboard of its innermost impermeable surface and the total thermal resistance of all materials inboard of that surface is not less than that required by Table 9.25.5.2., or outboard of an air space that is vented to the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet and panel-type materials described in Article 9.25.5.1. shall be installed on the warm face of the assembly (see also Article 9.25.4.2.), at a location where the ratio between the total thermal resistance of all materials outboard of its innermost impermeable surface and the total thermal resistance of all materials inboard of that surface is not less than that required by Table 9.25.5.2., or outboard of an air space that is vented to the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: For walls, the air space described in Clause 9.25.5.2.(1)(c) shall comply with Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: For walls, the air space described in Sentence 9.25.5.2.(1) shall comply with Sentence 9.27.2.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "roof" shall mean sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them, including platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation. (See Note A-9.26.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "roof" shall mean sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them, including platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation. (See Note A-9.26.1.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "roofing" shall mean the primary covering for roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "roofing" shall mean the primary covering for roofs.

National Sentence Text: Roofs shall be protected with roofing, including flashing, installed so as to effectively shed water, prevent the ingress of water and moisture into building assemblies and occupied space, and minimize the ingress of water due to ice damming into building assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: Roofs shall be protected with roofing, including flashing, installed so as to effectively shed water, prevent the ingress of water and moisture into building assemblies and occupied space, and minimize the ingress of water due to ice damming into building assemblies.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence 9.26.1.2.(1) shall be demonstrated by conforming to the remainder of this Section, or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence 9.26.1.2.(1) shall be demonstrated by conforming to the remainder of this Section, or part 5..

National Sentence Text: Methods described in CSA CAN3-A123.51-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:3 and Steeper or in CSA CAN3-A123.52-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:6 to Less Than 1:3 are permitted to be used for asphalt shingle applications not described in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Methods described in CSA CAN3-A123.51-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:3 and Steeper or in CSA CAN3-A123.52-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:6 to Less Than 1:3 are permitted to be used for asphalt shingle applications not described in this Section.

National Sentence Text: Where materials used for the preparation of the substrate for roofing are covered in the scope of a standard listed in Table 9.26.2.1.-A, they shall conform to that standard.
P/T Sentence Text: Where materials used for the preparation of the substrate for roofing are covered in the scope of a standard listed in Table 9.26.2.1.-A, they shall conform to that standard.

National Sentence Text: Where roofing materials are covered in the scope of a standard listed in Table 9.26.2.1.-B, they shall conform to that standard.
P/T Sentence Text: Where roofing materials are covered in the scope of a standard listed in Table 9.26.2.1.-B, they shall conform to that standard.

National Sentence Text: Materials listed in Tables 9.26.2.1.-Aand 9.26.2.1.-B shall be installed in conformance with the manufacturer’s written instructions. (See Sentence 1.5.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Materials listed in Tables 9.26.2.1.-A and 9.26.2.1.-B shall be installed in conformance with the manufacturer’s written instructions. (See Sentence 1.5.1.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Nails used for roofing shall be corrosion-resistant roofing or shingle nails conforming to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used for roofing shall be corrosion-resistant roofing or shingle nails conforming to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples

National Sentence Text: Nails shall have sufficient length to penetrate through, or 12 mm into, roof sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails shall have sufficient length to penetrate through, or 12 mm into, roof sheathing.

National Sentence Text: Nails used with asphalt roofing shall have a head diameter of not less than 9.5 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.95 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used with asphalt roofing shall have a head diameter of not less than 9.5 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.95 mm.

National Sentence Text: Nails used with wood shingles or shakes shall have a head diameter of not less than 4.8 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.0 mm and shall be stainless steel, aluminum or hot-dipped galvanized. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used with wood shingles or shakes shall have a head diameter of not less than 4.8 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.0 mm and shall be stainless steel, aluminum or hot-dipped galvanized. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Staples used to apply asphalt or wood shingles shall be corrosion-resistant and shall be driven with the crown parallel to the eaves.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples used to apply asphalt or wood shingles shall be corrosion-resistant and shall be driven with the crown parallel to the eaves.

National Sentence Text: Staples used with asphalt shingles shall be not less than 19 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 25 mm crown, except that an 11 mm crown may be used as provided in Sentence 9.26.7.4.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Staples used with asphalt shingles shall be not less than 19 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 25 mm crown, except that an 11 mm crown may be used as provided in Sentence 9.26.7.4.(2).

National Sentence Text: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.26.3.1.(2)and 9.26.3.1.(3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.26.3.1.(2) and 9.26.3.1.(3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence 9.26.3.1.(1) when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence 9.26.3.1.(1) when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.

National Sentence Text: Profiled metal roof cladding systems specifically designed for low-slope applications are permitted to be installed with lower slopes than required by Sentence 9.26.3.1.(1), provided they are installed in conformance with the manufacturer’s written recommendations.
P/T Sentence Text: Profiled metal roof cladding systems specifically designed for low-slope applications are permitted to be installed with lower slopes than required by Sentence 9.26.3.1.(1), provided they are installed in conformance with the manufacturer’s written recommendations.

National Sentence Text: Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting constructions due to water ingress, roofs and constructions that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from exterior walls, and guards that are connected to the roof, or to a construction that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts. (See Notes A-9.26.1.1.(1), Note A-9.26.4.1. and Note A-9.27.3.8.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting constructions due to water ingress, roofs and constructions that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from exterior walls, and guards that are connected to the roof, or to a construction that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts.

National Sentence Text: The slope required by Sentence 9.26.3.1.(4) shall be sufficient to maintain a positive slope after expected shrinkage of the building frame, where these surfaces are supported by exterior walls and exterior columns (see Note A-9.27.3.8.(4)), and once design loading is taken into consideration, where these surfaces are cantilevered from exterior walls. (See Notes A-9.26.4.1. and Note A-9.26.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The slope required by Sentence 9.26.3.1.(4) shall be sufficient to maintain a positive slope after expected shrinkage of the building frame, where these surfaces are supported by exterior walls and exterior columns (see Note A-9.27.3.8.(4)), and once design loading is taken into consideration, where these surfaces are cantilevered from exterior walls.

National Sentence Text: Except where the omission of flashing will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting constructions, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and walls that rise above the roof, and guards that are connected to the roof by more than pickets or posts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the omission of flashing will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting constructions, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and walls that rise above the roof, and guards that are connected to the roof by more than pickets or posts.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of Sentence 9.26.4.1.(1), roofs shall include platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of Sentence 9.26.4.1.(1), roofs shall include platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation.

National Sentence Text: Sheet metal flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.33 mm thick copper, 0.35 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet metal flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.33 mm thick copper, 0.35 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Where sloping surfaces of shingled roofs intersect to form a valley, the valley shall be flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Where sloping surfaces of shingled roofs intersect to form a valley, the valley shall be flashed.

National Sentence Text: Valley flashing shall be installed over continuous sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Valley flashing shall be installed over continuous sheathing.

National Sentence Text: Closed valleys shall not be used with rigid shingles on slopes of less than 1 in 1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Closed valleys shall not be used with rigid shingles on slopes of less than 1 in 1.2.

National Sentence Text: Open valleys shall be flashed with at least one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or 2 layers of roll roofing.
P/T Sentence Text: Open valleys shall be flashed with at least one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or 2 layers of roll roofing.

National Sentence Text: The bottom layer of roofing required in Sentence 9.26.4.3.(4) shall consist of at least Type S smooth roll roofing or Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface not less than 457 mm wide, centred in the valley and fastened with nails spaced not more than 450 mm o.c. located 25 mm away from the edges.
P/T Sentence Text: The bottom layer of roofing required in Sentence 9.26.4.3.(4) shall consist of at least Type S smooth roll roofing or Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface not less than 457 mm wide, centred in the valley and fastened with nails spaced not more than 450 mm o.c. located 25 mm away from the edges.

National Sentence Text: The top layer of roofing required in Sentence 9.26.4.3.(4) shall consist of at least Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface up), 914 mm wide, centred in the valley, applied over a 100 mm wide strip of cement along each edge of the bottom layer, and fastened with a sufficient number of nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The top layer of roofing required in Sentence 9.26.4.3.(4) shall consist of at least Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface up), 914 mm wide, centred in the valley, applied over a 100 mm wide strip of cement along each edge of the bottom layer, and fastened with a sufficient number of nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.

National Sentence Text: The intersection of shingle roofs and masonry walls or chimneys shall be protected with flashing.
P/T Sentence Text: The intersection of shingle roofs and masonry walls or chimneys shall be protected with flashing.

National Sentence Text: Counter flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry and shall extend not less than 150 mm down the masonry and lap the lower flashing not less than 100 mm.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Counter flashing required in Sentence (1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry and shall extend not less than 150 mm down the masonry and lap the lower flashing not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Counterflashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry and shall extend not less than 150 mm down the masonry and lap the lower flashing not less than 100 mm.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Counterflashing required in Sentence (1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry and shall extend not less than 150 mm down the masonry and lap the lower flashing not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Flashing along the slopes of a roof described in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) shall be stepped so that there is not less than a 75 mm head lap in both the lower flashing and counter flashing.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Flashing along the slopes of a roof described in Sentence (1) shall be stepped so that there is not less than a 75 mm head lap in both the lower flashing and counter flashing.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing along the slopes of a roof described in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) shall be stepped so that there is not less than a 75 mm head lap in both the lower flashing and counterflashing.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Flashing along the slopes of a roof described in Sentence (1) shall be stepped so that there is not less than a 75 mm head lap in both the lower flashing and counterflashing.

National Sentence Text: Where the roof described in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) slopes upwards from the masonry, the flashing shall extend up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the masonry, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the roof described in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) slopes upwards from the masonry, the flashing shall extend up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the masonry, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.

National Sentence Text: The intersection of shingle roofs and walls clad with other than masonry shall be protected with flashing.
P/T Sentence Text: The intersection of shingle roofs and walls clad with other than masonry shall be protected with flashing.

National Sentence Text: Flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.5.(1) shall be installed so that it extends up the wall not less than 75 mm behind the sheathing paper, and extends not less than 75 mm horizontally.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.5.(1) shall be installed so that it extends up the wall not less than 75 mm behind the sheathing paper, and extends not less than 75 mm horizontally.

National Sentence Text: Along the slope of the roof, the flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.5.(1) shall be stepped with not less than a 75 mm head lap.
P/T Sentence Text: Along the slope of the roof, the flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.5.(1) shall be stepped with not less than a 75 mm head lap.

National Sentence Text: The intersection of built-up roofs with masonry walls or chimneys shall have a cant strip at the intersection, and a roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip and not less than 150 mm up the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: The intersection of built-up roofs with masonry walls or chimneys shall have a cant strip at the intersection, and a roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip and not less than 150 mm up the wall.

National Sentence Text: Counter flashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.6.(1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Counter flashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence (1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Counterflashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.6.(1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Counterflashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence (1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: The intersection of built-up roofs with walls clad with other than masonry shall have a cant strip at the intersection.
P/T Sentence Text: The intersection of built-up roofs with walls clad with other than masonry shall have a cant strip at the intersection.

National Sentence Text: The roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7.(1).

National Sentence Text: Flashing plies shall extend not less than 150 mm up the wall referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7.(1) behind the sheathing paper.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing plies shall extend not less than 150 mm up the wall referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7.(1) behind the sheathing paper.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentence 9.26.4.8.(5), chimney saddles shall be installed where the upper side of a chimney on a sloping roof is more than 750 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentence 9.26.4.8.(5), chimney saddles shall be installed where the upper side of a chimney on a sloping roof is more than 750 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Chimney saddles shall be covered with sheet metal or roofing material of weight and quality equivalent to the roofing.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimney saddles shall be covered with sheet metal or roofing material of weight and quality equivalent to the roofing.

National Sentence Text: Saddles shall be flashed where they intersect the roof.
P/T Sentence Text: Saddles shall be flashed where they intersect the roof.

National Sentence Text: The intersection of the saddle and the chimney shall be flashed and counterflashed as described in Article 9.26.4.4.
P/T Sentence Text: The intersection of the saddle and the chimney shall be flashed and counterflashed as described in Article 9.26.4.4.

National Sentence Text: A chimney saddle need not be installed if the intersection between the chimney and roof is protected by sheet metal flashing that extends up the chimney to a height equal to at least one sixth the width of the chimney, but not less than 150 mm, and up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the chimney, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.
P/T Sentence Text: A chimney saddle need not be installed if the intersection between the chimney and roof is protected by sheet metal flashing that extends up the chimney to a height equal to at least one sixth the width of the chimney, but not less than 150 mm, and up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the chimney, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.

National Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentence 9.26.4.8.(5) at the chimney shall be counterflashed as required by Article 9.26.4.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentence 9.26.4.8.(5) at the chimney shall be counterflashed as required by Article 9.26.4.4.
Where a pipe or duct penetrates a roof, the joint between the pipe or duct and the roof shall be flashed and be made watertight.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where a pipe or duct penetrates a roof, the joint between the pipe or duct and the roof shall be flashed and be made watertight.

P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.26.4.9.(3), flashing for a pipe or duct shall be rectangular and shall be not less than 500 mm in length by 500 mm in width and, if sleeve flashing is used, the sleeve shall extend not less than 150 mm above the roof at every point of the pipe or duct.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as required by Sentence 9.26.4.9.(3), flashing for a pipe or duct shall be rectangular and shall be not less than 500 mm in length by 500 mm in width and, if sleeve flashing is used, the sleeve shall extend not less than 150 mm above the roof at every point of the pipe or duct.

P/T Sentence Text: The flashing flange for a pipe or duct shall extend not less than 125 mm beyond a pipe or duct penetrating a sloping roof, and not less than 250 mm beyond a pipe or duct penetrating a flat roof.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The flashing flange for a pipe or duct shall extend not less than 125 mm beyond a pipe or duct penetrating a sloping roof, and not less than 250 mm beyond a pipe or duct penetrating a flat roof.

P/T Sentence Text: If lead sheet is used as a flashing for a plumbing system pipe, it shall be worked over and into a hub of the increaser, which shall then be fitted with a 100 mm diam or larger roof ring caulked into the hub of the increaser.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): If lead sheet is used as a flashing for a plumbing system pipe, it shall be worked over and into a hub of the increaser, which shall then be fitted with a 100 mm diam or larger roof ring caulked into the hub of the increaser.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.5.1.(2), eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.5.1.(2), eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: Eave protection is not required over unheated garages, carports and porches, where the roof overhang exceeds 900 mm measured along the roof slope from the edge of the roof to the inner face of the exterior wall, on roofs of asphalt shingles installed in accordance with Subsection 9.26.8., on roofs with slopes of 1 in 1.5 or greater, or in regions with 3 500 or fewer degree-days.
P/T Sentence Text: Eave protection is not required over unheated garages, carports and porches, where the roof overhang exceeds 900 mm measured along the roof slope from the edge of the roof to the inner face of the exterior wall, on roofs of asphalt shingles installed in accordance with part 9., on roofs with slopes of 1 in 1.5 or greater, or in regions with 3 500 or fewer degree-days.

National Sentence Text: Eave protection shall be laid beneath the starter strip and shall consist of No. 15 asphalt-saturated felt laid in two plies lapped 480 mm and cemented together with lap cement, Type M or S roll roofing laid with not less than 100 mm head and end laps cemented together with lap cement, glass fibre or polyester fibre coated base sheets, or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of modified bituminous coated material.
P/T Sentence Text: Eave protection shall be laid beneath the starter strip and shall consist of No. 15 asphalt-saturated felt laid in two plies lapped 480 mm and cemented together with lap cement, Type M or S roll roofing laid with not less than 100 mm head and end laps cemented together with lap cement, glass fibre or polyester fibre coated base sheets, or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of modified bituminous coated material.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.26.6.1.(2), when underlay is used beneath shingles, it shall be asphalt-saturated sheathing paper weighing not less than 0.195 kg/m2, or No. 15 plain or perforated asphalt-saturated felt.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.26.6.1.(2), when underlay is used beneath shingles, it shall be asphalt-saturated sheathing paper weighing not less than 0.195 kg/m2, or No. 15 plain or perforated asphalt-saturated felt.

National Sentence Text: Underlay used beneath wood shingles shall be breather type.
P/T Sentence Text: Underlay used beneath wood shingles shall be breather type.

National Sentence Text: When used with shingles, underlay shall be installed parallel to the eaves with head and end lap of not less than 50 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: When used with shingles, underlay shall be installed parallel to the eaves with head and end lap of not less than 50 mm.

National Sentence Text: The top edge of each strip of underlay referred to in Sentence 9.26.6.2.(1) shall be fastened with sufficient roofing nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The top edge of each strip of underlay referred to in Sentence 9.26.6.2.(1) shall be fastened with sufficient roofing nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.

National Sentence Text: The underlay referred to in Sentence 9.26.6.2.(1) shall overlap the eave protection by not less than 100 mm. (See Article 9.26.10.2. for underlay beneath wood shakes.)
P/T Sentence Text: The underlay referred to in Sentence 9.26.6.2.(1) shall overlap the eave protection by not less than 100 mm. (See Article 9.26.10.2. for underlay beneath wood shakes.)

National Sentence Text: Coverage shall be not less than 2 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.
P/T Sentence Text: Coverage shall be not less than 2 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.

National Sentence Text: A starter strip shall be installed along the lower edge of the roof so that it extends approximately 12 mm beyond the eaves and rake of the roof and fastened along the bottom edge with nails spaced not more than 300 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: A starter strip shall be installed along the lower edge of the roof so that it extends approximately 12 mm beyond the eaves and rake of the roof and fastened along the bottom edge with nails spaced not more than 300 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips shall be at least Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing not less than 300 mm wide, shingles of the same weight and quality as those used as a roof covering with tabs facing up the roof slope, or pre-manufactured starter strips installed with sealant at the eaves.
P/T Sentence Text: Starter strips shall be at least Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing not less than 300 mm wide, shingles of the same weight and quality as those used as a roof covering with tabs facing up the roof slope, or pre-manufactured starter strips installed with sealant at the eaves.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips need not be provided where eave protection of not less than Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing is provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Starter strips need not be provided where eave protection of not less than Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing is provided.

National Sentence Text: Shingles shall have a head lap of not less than 50 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles shall have a head lap of not less than 50 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.7.4.(2), shingles shall be fastened with at least 4 nails or staples for 1 m wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.7.4.(2), shingles shall be fastened with at least 4 nails or staples for 1 m wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.

National Sentence Text: Where staples with an 11 mm crown are used, shingles shall be fastened with at least 6 staples.
P/T Sentence Text: Where staples with an 11 mm crown are used, shingles shall be fastened with at least 6 staples.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners may be reduced for narrower shingles in proportion to the width of the shingle or when shingles incorporating interlocking devices are used.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners may be reduced for narrower shingles in proportion to the width of the shingle or when shingles incorporating interlocking devices are used.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences 9.26.7.4.(1)and 9.26.7.4.(2) shall be located 25 mm to 40 mm from each end of each strip shingle with other fasteners equally spaced between them.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences 9.26.7.4.(1) and 9.26.7.4.(2) shall be located 25 mm to 40 mm from each end of each strip shingle with other fasteners equally spaced between them.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences 9.26.7.4.(1)and 9.26.7.4.(2) shall be located not less than 12 mm above the tops of the cutouts.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences 9.26.7.4.(1) and 9.26.7.4.(2) shall be located not less than 12 mm above the tops of the cutouts.

National Sentence Text: Shingle tabs shall be secured by a spot of plastic cement not exceeding 25 mm diam under the centre of each tab or by interlocking devices or self-sealing strips.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingle tabs shall be secured by a spot of plastic cement not exceeding 25 mm diam under the centre of each tab or by interlocking devices or self-sealing strips.

National Sentence Text: Shingles on hips and ridges shall be applied so they extend not less than 100 mm on either side of the hip or ridge, and shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles on hips and ridges shall be applied so they extend not less than 100 mm on either side of the hip or ridge, and shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.

National Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence 9.26.7.6.(1) shall be fastened with nails or staples on each side located not more than 25 mm from the edge and 25 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence 9.26.7.6.(1) shall be fastened with nails or staples on each side located not more than 25 mm from the edge and 25 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle.

National Sentence Text: Eave protection shall conform to Subsection 9.26.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Eave protection shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Except for the first 2 courses, coverage shall be not less than 3 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the first 2 courses, coverage shall be not less than 3 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.

National Sentence Text: A starter strip shall be installed as in Article 9.26.7.2.
P/T Sentence Text: A starter strip shall be installed as in Article 9.26.7.2.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips required in Sentence 9.26.8.2.(1) shall be laid in a continuous band of cement not less than 200 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Starter strips required in Sentence 9.26.8.2.(1) shall be laid in a continuous band of cement not less than 200 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Shingle tabs shall be secured with cold application cement applied at the rate of not less than 0.5 L/m2 of cemented area, or hot application asphalt applied at the rate of 1 kg/m2 of cemented area.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingle tabs shall be secured with cold application cement applied at the rate of not less than 0.5 L/m2 of cemented area, or hot application asphalt applied at the rate of 1 kg/m2 of cemented area.

National Sentence Text: The first course of shingles shall be secured by a continuous band of cement along the eaves applied so that the width of the band equals the shingle exposure plus 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The first course of shingles shall be secured by a continuous band of cement along the eaves applied so that the width of the band equals the shingle exposure plus 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: The succeeding courses of shingles shall be secured by a continuous band of cement applied so that the width of the band equals the shingle exposure plus 50 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The succeeding courses of shingles shall be secured by a continuous band of cement applied so that the width of the band equals the shingle exposure plus 50 mm.

National Sentence Text: The band required in Sentence 9.26.8.4.(2) shall be located not more than 50 mm above the butt of the overlying course of shingles.
P/T Sentence Text: The band required in Sentence 9.26.8.4.(2) shall be located not more than 50 mm above the butt of the overlying course of shingles.

National Sentence Text: Shingles on hips and ridges shall be not less than 300 mm wide applied to provide triple coverage.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles on hips and ridges shall be not less than 300 mm wide applied to provide triple coverage.

National Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence 9.26.8.5.(1) shall be cemented to the roof shingles and to each other with a coat of cement and fastened with nails or staples located 40 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle and 50 mm from each edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence 9.26.8.5.(1) shall be cemented to the roof shingles and to each other with a coat of cement and fastened with nails or staples located 40 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle and 50 mm from each edge.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Shingles shall be fastened in accordance with Article 9.26.7.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles shall be fastened in accordance with Article 9.26.7.4.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), decking for wood shingled roofs may be continuous or spaced.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), decking for wood shingled roofs may be continuous or spaced.

National Sentence Text: Western cedar shingles shall be not less than No. 2 grade.
P/T Sentence Text: Western cedar shingles shall be not less than No. 2 grade.

National Sentence Text: Eastern white cedar shingles shall be not less than B (clear) grade.
P/T Sentence Text: Eastern white cedar shingles shall be not less than B (clear) grade.

National Sentence Text: Wood shingles shall be not less than 400 mm long and not less than 75 mm or more than 350 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood shingles shall be not less than 400 mm long and not less than 75 mm or more than 350 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Shingles shall be spaced approximately 6 mm apart and offset at the joints in adjacent courses not less than 40 mm so that joints in alternate courses are staggered.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles shall be spaced approximately 6 mm apart and offset at the joints in adjacent courses not less than 40 mm so that joints in alternate courses are staggered.

National Sentence Text: Shingles shall be fastened with 2 nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from the sides of the shingle and 40 mm above the exposure line.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles shall be fastened with 2 nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from the sides of the shingle and 40 mm above the exposure line.

National Sentence Text: The exposure of wood roof shingles shall conform to Table 9.26.9.6.
P/T Sentence Text: The exposure of wood roof shingles shall conform to Table 9.26.9.6.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Eave protection shall conform to Subsection 9.26.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Eave protection shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Shakes shall be not less than 450 mm long and not less than 100 mm nor more than 350 mm wide with a butt thickness of not more than 32 mm and not less than 9 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Shakes shall be not less than 450 mm long and not less than 100 mm nor more than 350 mm wide with a butt thickness of not more than 32 mm and not less than 9 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where eave protection is not provided, an underlay conforming to the requirements in Article 9.26.6.1. for wood shingles shall be laid as a strip not less than 900 mm wide along the eaves.
P/T Sentence Text: Where eave protection is not provided, an underlay conforming to the requirements in Article 9.26.6.1. for wood shingles shall be laid as a strip not less than 900 mm wide along the eaves.

National Sentence Text: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence 9.26.10.2.(1) not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlaid between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.
P/T Sentence Text: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence 9.26.10.2.(1) not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlaid between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.

National Sentence Text: Interlaid strips referred to in Sentence 9.26.10.2.(2) shall be lapped not less than 150 mm at hips and ridges in a manner that will prevent water from reaching the roof sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Interlaid strips referred to in Sentence 9.26.10.2.(2) shall be lapped not less than 150 mm at hips and ridges in a manner that will prevent water from reaching the roof sheathing.

National Sentence Text: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in any one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.
P/T Sentence Text: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in any one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.

National Sentence Text: Shakes shall be fastened with nails located approximately 20 mm from the sides of the shakes and 40 mm above the exposure line.
P/T Sentence Text: Shakes shall be fastened with nails located approximately 20 mm from the sides of the shakes and 40 mm above the exposure line.

National Sentence Text: The exposure of wood shakes shall not exceed 190 mm for shakes not less than 450 mm long, and 250 mm for shakes not less than 600 mm long.
P/T Sentence Text: The exposure of wood shakes shall not exceed 190 mm for shakes not less than 450 mm long, and 250 mm for shakes not less than 600 mm long.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Eave protection shall conform to Subsection 9.26.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Eave protection shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Shakes shall be not less than No. 1 or Handsplit grade.
P/T Sentence Text: Shakes shall be not less than No. 1 or Handsplit grade.

National Sentence Text: The quantities of bituminous materials used on built-up roofs shall conform to Table 9.26.11.1.
P/T Sentence Text: The quantities of bituminous materials used on built-up roofs shall conform to Table 9.26.11.1.

National Sentence Text: Coal-tar products and asphalt products shall not be used together in built-up roof construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Coal-tar products and asphalt products shall not be used together in built-up roof construction.

National Sentence Text: Bitumen roofing felts shall be at least No. 15 felt.
P/T Sentence Text: Bitumen roofing felts shall be at least No. 15 felt.

National Sentence Text: Aggregate used for surfacing built-up roofs shall be clean, dry and durable and shall consist of particles of gravel, crushed stone or air-cooled blast furnace slag having a size of from 6 mm to 15 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Aggregate used for surfacing built-up roofs shall be clean, dry and durable and shall consist of particles of gravel, crushed stone or air-cooled blast furnace slag having a size of from 6 mm to 15 mm.

National Sentence Text: The minimum amount of aggregate surfacing per square metre of roof surface shall be 15 kg gravel or crushed stone or 10 kg crushed slag.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum amount of aggregate surfacing per square metre of roof surface shall be 15 kg gravel or crushed stone or 10 kg crushed slag.

National Sentence Text: Flashing for built-up roofs shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing for built-up roofs shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Built-up roofing shall consist of not less than 3 mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.
P/T Sentence Text: Built-up roofing shall consist of not less than 3 mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.

National Sentence Text: In hot process applications each layer of bitumen-saturated felt shall be laid while the bitumen is hot, with each layer overlapping the previous one.
P/T Sentence Text: In hot process applications each layer of bitumen-saturated felt shall be laid while the bitumen is hot, with each layer overlapping the previous one.

National Sentence Text: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.7.(1) shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.
P/T Sentence Text: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.7.(1) shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.

National Sentence Text: Felt shall be laid free of wrinkles and shall be rolled directly into the hot bitumen and broomed forward and outward from the centre to ensure complete adhesion.
P/T Sentence Text: Felt shall be laid free of wrinkles and shall be rolled directly into the hot bitumen and broomed forward and outward from the centre to ensure complete adhesion.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.8.(2), built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with not less than a 50 mm headlap and a 50 mm sidelap between each sheet.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.8.(2), built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with not less than a 50 mm headlap and a 50 mm sidelap between each sheet.

National Sentence Text: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence 9.26.11.8.(1) may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.
P/T Sentence Text: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence 9.26.11.8.(1) may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.

National Sentence Text: Roofing shall be securely attached to the decking or where insulation is applied above the deck, the insulation shall be securely attached to the deck before the first layer of felt is fastened to the insulation.
P/T Sentence Text: Roofing shall be securely attached to the decking or where insulation is applied above the deck, the insulation shall be securely attached to the deck before the first layer of felt is fastened to the insulation.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4), a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4), a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.

National Sentence Text: At least 2 plies of the roofing membrane shall be carried over the top of the cant strip.
P/T Sentence Text: At least 2 plies of the roofing membrane shall be carried over the top of the cant strip.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall extend over the top of the cant strip and be shaped to form a drip.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall extend over the top of the cant strip and be shaped to form a drip.

National Sentence Text: The cant strip required in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(1) need not be provided where a gravel stop is installed at the edge of roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: The cant strip required in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(1) need not be provided where a gravel stop is installed at the edge of roofs.

National Sentence Text: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4) is fastened and 2 plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4) is fastened and 2 plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.

National Sentence Text: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4) shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.
P/T Sentence Text: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4) shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.

National Sentence Text: Wide selvage asphalt roofing shall provide double coverage over the entire roof surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Wide selvage asphalt roofing shall provide double coverage over the entire roof surface.

National Sentence Text: Plies of selvage roofing shall be cemented together to ensure a watertight joint.
P/T Sentence Text: Plies of selvage roofing shall be cemented together to ensure a watertight joint.

National Sentence Text: Sheet metal roofing shall be not less than 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet metal roofing shall be not less than 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), where sheet metal roofing is not supported by roof decking but spans between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live loads for roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), where sheet metal roofing is not supported by roof decking but spans between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live loads for roofs.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), where glass-reinforced polyester roofing panels are not supported by roof decking but span between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live roof loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), where glass-reinforced polyester roofing panels are not supported by roof decking but span between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live roof loads.

National Sentence Text: Hot applied rubberized asphalt roofing shall be installed in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-37.51-M90 Application for Hot-Applied Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing
P/T Sentence Text: Hot applied rubberized asphalt roofing shall be installed in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-37.51-M90 Application for Hot-Applied Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing

National Sentence Text: Polyvinyl chloride sheet applied roofing membrane shall be installed in accordance with CGSB 37-GP-55M-1979 Application of Sheet Applied Flexible Polyvinyl Chloride Roofing Membrane
P/T Sentence Text: Polyvinyl chloride sheet applied roofing membrane shall be installed in accordance with CGSB 37-GP-55M-1979 Application of Sheet Applied Flexible Polyvinyl Chloride Roofing Membrane

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), concrete roof tiles shall be installed according to CSA CAN/CSA-A220 Series-06 Concrete Roof Tiles (See Note A-9.26.17.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), concrete roof tiles shall be installed according to CSA CAN/CSA-A220 Series-06 Concrete Roof Tiles (See Note A-9.26.17.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: When roof drains are provided they shall conform to Part 7.
P/T Sentence Text: When roof drains are provided they shall conform to part 7..

National Sentence Text: Where downspouts are provided and are not connected to a sewer, extensions shall be provided to carry rainwater away from the building in a manner which will prevent soil erosion.
P/T Sentence Text: Where downspouts are provided and are not connected to a sewer, extensions shall be provided to carry rainwater away from the building in a manner which will prevent soil erosion.

National Sentence Text: Where lumber, wood shingles, shakes, fibre-cement shingles, planks and sheets, plywood, OSB, waferboard, hardboard, vinyl, aluminum or steel, including trim and soffits, are installed as cladding on wood-frame walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.27.2.to 9.27.12., or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where lumber, wood shingles, shakes, fibre-cement shingles, planks and sheets, plywood, OSB, waferboard, hardboard, vinyl, aluminum or steel, including trim and soffits, are installed as cladding on wood-frame walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9. to 9., or part 5..

National Sentence Text: Where stucco is installed as cladding on wood-frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.27.2.to 9.27.5., and Section 9.28., or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where stucco is installed as cladding on wood-frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9. to 9., and part 9., or part 5..

National Sentence Text: Where masonry serves as cladding on wood-frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.27.2.to 9.27.4., and Section 9.20., or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where masonry serves as cladding on wood-frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9. to 9., and part 9., or part 5..

National Sentence Text: Where asphalt shingles are installed as cladding on wood-frame walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.26.7.and 9.27.2.to 9.27.4., or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where asphalt shingles are installed as cladding on wood-frame walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9. and 9.to 9., or part 5..

National Sentence Text: Where an exterior insulation finish system is installed as cladding on wood-frame, masonry, cold-formed steel stud or cast-in-place concrete walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.25.5., 9.27.2.to 9.27.4., and 9.27.13., or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exterior insulation finish system is installed as cladding on wood-frame, masonry, cold-formed steel stud or cast-in-place concrete walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9. , 9.to 9. , and 9., or part 5..

National Sentence Text: Where cladding materials other than those described in Sentences 9.27.1.1.(1)to 9.27.1.1.(5) are installed, or where the cladding materials described in Sentences 9.27.1.1.(1)to 9.27.1.1.(5) are installed on substrates other than those identified in Sentences 9.27.1.1.(1)to 9.27.1.1.(5), the materials and installation shall comply with Part 5. (See Note A-9.27.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where cladding materials other than those described in Sentences 9.27.1.1.(1)to 9.27.1.1.(5) are installed, or where the cladding materials described in Sentences 9.27.1.1.(1)to 9.27.1.1.(5) are installed on substrates other than those identified in Sentences 9.27.1.1.(1)to 9.27.1.1.(5), the materials and installation shall comply with part 5..

National Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that precipitation ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and prevent the ingress of precipitation into interior space. (See Note A-9.27.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that precipitation ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and prevent the ingress of precipitation into interior space.

National Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from specific mechanisms of deterioration, such as mechanical impact and ultraviolet radiation, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to minimize the likelihood of their required performance being reduced to an unacceptable level as a result of those mechanisms. (See Note A-9.27.2.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from specific mechanisms of deterioration, such as mechanical impact and ultraviolet radiation, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to minimize the likelihood of their required performance being reduced to an unacceptable level as a result of those mechanisms.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(2), a cladding assembly is deemed to have a capillary break between the cladding and the backing assembly, where there is a drained and vented air space not less than 10 mm deep behind the cladding, over the full height and width of the wall (see also Article 9.27.5.3.), an open drainage material, not less than 10 mm thick and with a cross-sectional area that is not less than 80% open, is installed between the cladding and the backing, over the full height and width of the wall, the cladding is loosely fastened to the backing and behind each cladding component there is a clear air space that is continuous for the full width of the component, not less than 10 mm deep at the bottom of the component, and not less than 6 mm deep over not less than 90 mm for every 230 mm of exposed height of the component, the wall is a masonry cavity wall or the cladding is masonry veneer constructed according to Section 9.20., or the cladding conforms to Subsection 9.27.13.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(2), a cladding assembly is deemed to have a capillary break between the cladding and the backing assembly, where there is a drained and vented air space not less than 10 mm deep behind the cladding, over the full height and width of the wall (see also Article 9.27.5.3.), an open drainage material, not less than 10 mm thick and with a cross-sectional area that is not less than 80% open, is installed between the cladding and the backing, over the full height and width of the wall, the cladding is loosely fastened to the backing and behind each cladding component there is a clear air space that is continuous for the full width of the component, not less than 10 mm deep at the bottom of the component, and not less than 6 mm deep over not less than 90 mm for every 230 mm of exposed height of the component, the wall is a masonry cavity wall or the cladding is masonry veneer constructed according to part 9., or the cladding conforms to part 9.

National Sentence Text: The drained and vented air space, and drainage material described in Sentence 9.27.3.1.(1) may be interrupted by penetrations for windows, doors and services, flashing, and furring, provided the furring does not make up more than 20% of the furred area.
P/T Sentence Text: The drained and vented air space, and drainage material described in Sentence 9.27.3.1.(1) may be interrupted by penetrations for windows, doors and services, flashing, and furring, provided the furring does not make up more than 20% of the furred area.

National Sentence Text: Where a construction projects over the top of the drained and vented air space described in Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a) or over the drainage material described in Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(b), the air space or drainage material shall not be contiguous with concealed spaces in the projecting construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a construction projects over the top of the drained and vented air space described in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(1) or over the drainage material described in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(1), the air space or drainage material shall not be contiguous with concealed spaces in the projecting construction.

National Sentence Text: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection, where such walls enclose spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection, where such walls enclose spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(6), exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection incorporating a capillary break, where the number of degree-days is less than 3400 and the moisture index is greater than 0.90, or the number of degree-days is 3400 or more, and the moisture index is greater than 1.00. (See Sentence 1.1.3.1.(1) and for information on the moisture index.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(6), exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection incorporating a capillary break, where the number of degree-days is less than 3400 and the moisture index is greater than 0.90, or the number of degree-days is 3400 or more, and the moisture index is greater than 1.00.

National Sentence Text: In exterior walls described in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(5), the first and second planes of protection need not incorporate a capillary break, where it can be shown that omitting the capillary break will not adversely affect the performance of the building assemblies, the building is an accessory building, or the wall is constructed of non-moisture-sensitive materials, and intersecting or supported floors are also constructed of non-moisture-sensitive materials, or is constructed as a mass wall of sufficient thickness to minimize the transfer of moisture to the interior.
P/T Sentence Text: In exterior walls described in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(5), the first and second planes of protection need not incorporate a capillary break, where it can be shown that omitting the capillary break will not adversely affect the performance of the building assemblies, the building is an accessory building, or the wall is constructed of non-moisture-sensitive materials, and intersecting or supported floors are also constructed of non-moisture-sensitive materials, or is constructed as a mass wall of sufficient thickness to minimize the transfer of moisture to the interior.

National Sentence Text: Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise cladding assemblies with first and second planes of protection, the first plane of protection shall consist of cladding with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and managing precipitation ingress caused by the kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences (see Subsection 9.27.4.), the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to (see Subsection 9.27.3.) intercept all rain and snow that gets past the first plane of protection, and effectively dissipate any rain or snow to the exterior, and the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise cladding assemblies with first and second planes of protection, the first plane of protection shall consist of cladding with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and managing precipitation ingress caused by the kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences (see part 9.), the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to (see part 9.) intercept all rain and snow that gets past the first plane of protection, and effectively dissipate any rain or snow to the exterior, and the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.

National Sentence Text: A clearance of not less than 200 mm shall be provided between finished ground and cladding that is adversely affected by moisture, such as untreated wood, plywood, OSB, waferboard and hardboard.
P/T Sentence Text: A clearance of not less than 200 mm shall be provided between finished ground and cladding that is adversely affected by moisture, such as untreated wood, plywood, OSB, waferboard and hardboard.

National Sentence Text: A clearance of not less than 50 mm shall be provided between a roof surface and cladding that is adversely affected by moisture, such as untreated wood, plywood, OSB, waferboard and hardboard. (See Note A-9.27.3.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: A clearance of not less than 50 mm shall be provided between a roof surface and cladding that is adversely affected by moisture, such as untreated wood, plywood, OSB, waferboard and hardboard.

National Sentence Text: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane having an appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.
P/T Sentence Text: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane having an appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.

National Sentence Text: Except for cladding systems conforming to Subsection 9.27.13., the inner boundary of the drainage plane shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.2.to 9.27.3.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for cladding systems conforming to part 9., the inner boundary of the drainage plane shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.2.to 9.27.3.6.

National Sentence Text: The protection provided by the second plane of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: The protection provided by the second plane of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.

National Sentence Text: Flashing material and its installation shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.7.and 9.27.3.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing material and its installation shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.7.and 9.27.3.8.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.32-M77 Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.32-M77 Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.27.3.4.to 9.27.3.6., at least one layer of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath cladding.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.27.3.4. to 9.27.3.6., at least one layer of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath cladding.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3.(1) shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3.(1) shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3.(1) is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3.(1) is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.

National Sentence Text: Where non-wood-based rigid exterior insulating sheathing, or exterior insulating sheathing with an integral sheathing membrane is installed, a separate sheathing membrane is not required.
P/T Sentence Text: Where non-wood-based rigid exterior insulating sheathing, or exterior insulating sheathing with an integral sheathing membrane is installed, a separate sheathing membrane is not required.

National Sentence Text: Where insulating sheathing is installed as provided in Sentence 9.27.3.4.(1), sheathing panels subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, and the joints of sheathing panels not subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, or lapped or tongue and groove, and detailed to ensure drainage of water to the exterior. (See Note A-9.27.3.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulating sheathing is installed as provided in Sentence 9.27.3.4.(1), sheathing panels subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, and the joints of sheathing panels not subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, or lapped or tongue and groove, and detailed to ensure drainage of water to the exterior.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least 2 layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Article 9.23.17.1. and Note A-9.27.3.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least 2 layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Article 9.23.17.1. and Note A-9.27.3.5.(1).)

National Sentence Text: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.5.(1) shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing membrane.
P/T Sentence Text: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.5.(1) shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing membrane.

National Sentence Text: Wall sheathing is permitted to be used in lieu of one layer of sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.5.(1), and its thickness need not conform to Table 9.23.17.2.-A. (See Note A-9.27.3.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Wall sheathing is permitted to be used in lieu of one layer of sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.5.(1), and its thickness need not conform to Table 9.23.17.2.-A.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentences 9.27.3.6.(2)or 9.27.3.6.(3), as applicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentences 9.27.3.6.(2)or 9.27.3.6.(3), as applicable.

National Sentence Text: Cladding consisting of sheets of plywood, hardboard, OSB, waferboard or fibre cement is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6.(1), provided the cladding is applied so that all edges are directly supported by framing, the vertical joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and covered with battens, shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints, and the horizontal joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Cladding consisting of sheets of plywood, hardboard, OSB, waferboard or fibre cement is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6.(1), provided the cladding is applied so that all edges are directly supported by framing, the vertical joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and covered with battens, shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints, and the horizontal joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints.

National Sentence Text: Metal siding consisting of sheets of metal is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6.(1) where the joints between sheets are of the locked-seam type.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal siding consisting of sheets of metal is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6.(1) where the joints between sheets are of the locked-seam type.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, 0.48 mm thick aluminum, or 1.02 mm thick vinyl.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, 0.48 mm thick aluminum, or 1.02 mm thick vinyl.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.3.8.(2), flashing shall be installed at every horizontal junction between cladding elements, every horizontal offset in the cladding, and every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be concentrated along that line, or the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the cladding above. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.3.8.(2), flashing shall be installed at every horizontal junction between cladding elements, every horizontal offset in the cladding, and every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be concentrated along that line, or the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the cladding above.

National Sentence Text: Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence 9.27.3.8.(1) where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, where the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a)), and the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize the ingress of precipitation into the air space, or at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a)).
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence 9.27.3.8.(1) where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, where the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Sentence 9.27.2.2.(1)), and the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize the ingress of precipitation into the air space, or at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Sentence 9.27.2.2.(1)).

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed over exterior wall openings where the vertical distance from the bottom of the eave to the top of the trim is more than one-quarter of the horizontal overhang of the eave. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed over exterior wall openings where the vertical distance from the bottom of the eave to the top of the trim is more than one-quarter of the horizontal overhang of the eave. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(3).)
