National Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentences 9.27.3.8.(1)and 9.27.3.8.(3) shall extend not less than 50 mm upward inboard of the sheathing membrane or sheathing installed in lieu of the sheathing membrane (see Article 9.27.3.4.), have a slope of not less than 6% toward the exterior after the expected shrinkage of the building frame, terminate at each end with an end-dam with a height in millimetres not less than 25 mm or 1/10 the value of the 1-in-5 driving rain wind pressure in Pa, and at the height defined in subclause 9.27.3.8.(4)(c)(i), extending to the face of the adjacent cladding, lap not less than 10 mm vertically over the building element below, and terminate in a drip offset not less than 5 mm outward from the outer face of the building element below. P/T Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentences 9.27.3.8.(1) and 9.27.3.8.(3) shall extend not less than 50 mm upward inboard of the sheathing membrane or sheathing installed in lieu of the sheathing membrane (see Article 9.27.3.4.), have a slope of not less than 6% toward the exterior after the expected shrinkage of the building frame, terminate at each end with an end-dam with a height in millimetres not less than 25 mm or 1/10 the value of the 1-in-5 driving rain wind pressure in Pa, and at the height defined in Sentence 9.27.3.8.(4), extending to the face of the adjacent cladding, lap not less than 10 mm vertically over the building element below, and terminate in a drip offset not less than 5 mm outward from the outer face of the building element below.

National Sentence Text: Where the sills of windows and doors installed in exterior walls are not self-flashing, flashing shall be installed between the underside of the window or door and the wall construction below. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the sills of windows and doors installed in exterior walls are not self-flashing, flashing shall be installed between the underside of the window or door and the wall construction below. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(5).)

National Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided where required to prevent the entry of water into the structure.
P/T Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided where required to prevent the entry of water into the structure.

National Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided between masonry, siding or stucco and the adjacent door and window frames or trim, including sills, unless such locations are completely protected from the entry of rain.
P/T Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided between masonry, siding or stucco and the adjacent door and window frames or trim, including sills, unless such locations are completely protected from the entry of rain.

National Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided at vertical joints between different cladding materials unless the joint is suitably lapped or flashed to prevent the entry of rain. (See Articles 9.7.6.2., 9.20.13.12.and 9.28.1.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided at vertical joints between different cladding materials unless the joint is suitably lapped or flashed to prevent the entry of rain. (See Articles 9.7.6.2. , 9.20.13.12.and 9.28.1.5.)

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall be a non-hardening type suitable for exterior use, selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and compatible with and adhere to the substrate to which they are applied. (See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall be a non-hardening type suitable for exterior use, selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and compatible with and adhere to the substrate to which they are applied.

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall conform to ASTM C 834-10 Latex Sealants ASTM C 920-14 Elastomeric Joint Sealants ASTM C 1184-13 Structural Silicone Sealants or ASTM C 1311-10 Solvent Release Sealants
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall conform to ASTM C 834-10 Latex Sealants ASTM C 920-14 Elastomeric Joint Sealants ASTM C 1184-13 Structural Silicone Sealants or ASTM C 1311-10 Solvent Release Sealants

National Sentence Text: Backer rod shall conform to ASTM C 1330-02 Cylindrical Sealant Backing for Use with Cold Liquid-Applied Sealants (See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Backer rod shall conform to ASTM C 1330-02 Cylindrical Sealant Backing for Use with Cold Liquid-Applied Sealants (See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.27.5.1.(2)to 9.27.5.1.(4), cladding shall be fastened to the framing members or furring members, or to blocking between the framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.27.5.1.(2) to 9.27.5.1.(4), cladding shall be fastened to the framing members or furring members, or to blocking between the framing members.

National Sentence Text: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than 14.3 mm lumber, 12.5 mm plywood, or 12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than 14.3 mm lumber, 12.5 mm plywood, or 12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.

National Sentence Text: Vertically applied metal siding and wood shingles and shakes are permitted to be attached to the sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than 14.3 mm lumber, 7.5 mm plywood, or 7.5 mm OSB or waferboard.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertically applied metal siding and wood shingles and shakes are permitted to be attached to the sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than 14.3 mm lumber, 7.5 mm plywood, or 7.5 mm OSB or waferboard.

National Sentence Text: Where wood shingles or shakes are applied to sheathing which is not suitable for attaching the shingles or shakes, the shingles or shakes are permitted to be attached to a wood lath not less than 38 mm by 9.5 mm thick securely nailed to the framing and applied as described in Article 9.27.7.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood shingles or shakes are applied to sheathing which is not suitable for attaching the shingles or shakes, the shingles or shakes are permitted to be attached to a wood lath not less than 38 mm by 9.5 mm thick securely nailed to the framing and applied as described in Article 9.27.7.5.

National Sentence Text: Blocking for the attachment of cladding shall be not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber securely nailed to the framing and spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Blocking for the attachment of cladding shall be not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber securely nailed to the framing and spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.27.5.1.(4), furring for the attachment of cladding shall be not less than 19 mm by 38 mm lumber when applied over sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.27.5.1.(4), furring for the attachment of cladding shall be not less than 19 mm by 38 mm lumber when applied over sheathing.

National Sentence Text: When applied without sheathing, furring referred to in Sentence 9.27.5.3.(1) shall be not less than 19 mm by 64 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., or 19 mm by 89 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: When applied without sheathing, furring referred to in Sentence 9.27.5.3.(1) shall be not less than 19 mm by 64 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., or 19 mm by 89 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Furring referred to in Sentence 9.27.5.3.(1) shall be securely fastened to the framing, and spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Furring referred to in Sentence 9.27.5.3.(1) shall be securely fastened to the framing, and spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Nail or staple size and spacing for the attachment of cladding and trim shall conform to Table 9.27.5.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Nail or staple size and spacing for the attachment of cladding and trim shall conform to Table 9.27.5.4.

National Sentence Text: Nails or staples for the attachment of cladding and wood trim shall be corrosion-resistant and shall be compatible with the cladding material.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails or staples for the attachment of cladding and wood trim shall be corrosion-resistant and shall be compatible with the cladding material.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners for metal or vinyl cladding shall be positioned to permit expansion and contraction of the cladding.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners for metal or vinyl cladding shall be positioned to permit expansion and contraction of the cladding.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners for shakes and shingles shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 19 mm into the framing.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners for shakes and shingles shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 19 mm into the framing.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence 9.27.5.7.(1) shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence 9.27.5.7.(1) shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.

National Sentence Text: Lumber siding shall be sound, free of knot holes, loose knots, through checks or splits.
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber siding shall be sound, free of knot holes, loose knots, through checks or splits.

National Sentence Text: Drop, rustic, novelty, lapped board and vertical wood siding shall be not less than 14.3 mm thick and not more than 286 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Drop, rustic, novelty, lapped board and vertical wood siding shall be not less than 14.3 mm thick and not more than 286 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Bevel siding shall be not less than 5 mm thick at the top, and not less than 12 mm thick at the butt for siding 184 mm or less in width, and 14.3 mm thick at the butt for siding wider than 184 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Bevel siding shall be not less than 5 mm thick at the top, and not less than 12 mm thick at the butt for siding 184 mm or less in width, and 14.3 mm thick at the butt for siding wider than 184 mm.

National Sentence Text: Bevel siding shall be not more than 286 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Bevel siding shall be not more than 286 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Lumber siding shall prevent water from entering at the joints by the use of lapped or matched joints or by vertical wood battens.
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber siding shall prevent water from entering at the joints by the use of lapped or matched joints or by vertical wood battens.

National Sentence Text: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than 9.5 mm for matched siding, 25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or 12 mm for vertical battens.
P/T Sentence Text: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than 9.5 mm for matched siding, 25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or 12 mm for vertical battens.

National Sentence Text: Shingles and shakes shall conform to CSA O118.1-08 Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles or CSA O118.2-08 Eastern White Cedar Shingles
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Shingles and shakes shall conform to CSA O118.1-08 Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles or CSA O118.2-08 Eastern White Cedar Shingles
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles and shakes shall conform to CSA O118.1-08 Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles CSA O118.2-08 Eastern White Cedar Shingles or CSA O118.3-93 Northern Pine Tapersawn Shakes
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Shingles and shakes shall conform to CSA O118.1-08 Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles CSA O118.2-08 Eastern White Cedar Shingles or CSA O118.3-93 Northern Pine Tapersawn Shakes

National Sentence Text: Western cedar shakes shall be not less than No. 1 or Handsplit grade, and western cedar shingles not less than No. 2 grade, except that No. 3 grade may be used for undercoursing.
P/T Sentence Text: Western cedar shakes shall be not less than No. 1 or Handsplit grade, and western cedar shingles not less than No. 2 grade, except that No. 3 grade may be used for undercoursing.

National Sentence Text: Eastern white cedar shingles shall be at least B (clear) grade, except that C grade may be used for the lower course of double course applications.
P/T Sentence Text: Eastern white cedar shingles shall be at least B (clear) grade, except that C grade may be used for the lower course of double course applications.

National Sentence Text: Shingles and shakes shall be not less than 65 mm or more than 350 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles and shakes shall be not less than 65 mm or more than 350 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Shingles or shakes shall be fastened with nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from each edge and not less than 25 mm above the exposure line for single-course applications, or approximately 50 mm above the butt for double-course applications.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles or shakes shall be fastened with nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from each edge and not less than 25 mm above the exposure line for single-course applications, or approximately 50 mm above the butt for double-course applications.

National Sentence Text: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset not less than 40 mm so that joints in any 2 of 3 consecutive courses are staggered.
P/T Sentence Text: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset not less than 40 mm so that joints in any 2 of 3 consecutive courses are staggered.

National Sentence Text: In double-course application, joints in the outer course shall be offset from joints in the under-course by not less than 40 mm, and joints in succeeding courses shall be offset not less than 40 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: In double-course application, joints in the outer course shall be offset from joints in the under-course by not less than 40 mm, and joints in succeeding courses shall be offset not less than 40 mm.

National Sentence Text: When lath is used with double-course application [see Sentence 9.27.5.1.(4)], it shall be spaced according to the exposure and securely fastened to the framing.
P/T Sentence Text: When lath is used with double-course application [see Sentence 9.27.5.1.(4)], it shall be spaced according to the exposure and securely fastened to the framing.

National Sentence Text: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall rest on the top edge of the lath.
P/T Sentence Text: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall rest on the top edge of the lath.

National Sentence Text: The outer course of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall be fastened to the lath with nails of sufficient length to penetrate through the lath.
P/T Sentence Text: The outer course of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall be fastened to the lath with nails of sufficient length to penetrate through the lath.

National Sentence Text: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1).

National Sentence Text: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.
P/T Sentence Text: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.

National Sentence Text: The exposure and butt thickness of shingles and shakes shall conform to Table 9.27.7.6.
P/T Sentence Text: The exposure and butt thickness of shingles and shakes shall conform to Table 9.27.7.6.

National Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood or CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood
P/T Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood or CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood

National Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be not less than 6 mm thick when applied directly to sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be not less than 6 mm thick when applied directly to sheathing.

National Sentence Text: When applied directly to framing or over furring strips, plywood cladding thickness shall conform to Table 9.27.8.2.
P/T Sentence Text: When applied directly to framing or over furring strips, plywood cladding thickness shall conform to Table 9.27.8.2.

National Sentence Text: The thickness of grooved or textured plywood cladding shall be measured at the point of least thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of grooved or textured plywood cladding shall be measured at the point of least thickness.

National Sentence Text: The edges of plywood cladding shall be treated with a suitable paint or sealer.
P/T Sentence Text: The edges of plywood cladding shall be treated with a suitable paint or sealer.

National Sentence Text: Plywood applied in panels shall have all edges supported.
P/T Sentence Text: Plywood applied in panels shall have all edges supported.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 2 mm gap shall be provided between panels referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 2 mm gap shall be provided between panels referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1).

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1) shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the plywood joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1) shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the plywood joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

National Sentence Text: Plywood applied in horizontal lapped strips shall have not less than a 2 mm gap provided at the butted ends, which shall be caulked.
P/T Sentence Text: Plywood applied in horizontal lapped strips shall have not less than a 2 mm gap provided at the butted ends, which shall be caulked.

National Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence 9.27.8.5.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence 9.27.8.5.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Wedges shall be inserted under all vertical butt joints and at all corners when horizontal lapped plywood is applied without sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Wedges shall be inserted under all vertical butt joints and at all corners when horizontal lapped plywood is applied without sheathing.

National Sentence Text: Factory-finished hardboard cladding shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.5-M87 Hardboard, Precoated, Factory Finished, for Exterior Cladding
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-finished hardboard cladding shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.5-M87 Hardboard, Precoated, Factory Finished, for Exterior Cladding

National Sentence Text: Hardboard cladding that is not factory finished shall conform to Types 1, 2 or 5 in CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard cladding that is not factory finished shall conform to Types 1, 2 or 5 in CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard

National Sentence Text: Type 1 or 2 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 6 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support, and 7.5 mm thick when applied over furring or framing members not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Type 1 or 2 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 6 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support, and 7.5 mm thick when applied over furring or framing members not more than 400 mm o.c.

P/T Sentence Text: Type 5 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 9 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support or over furring or framing members spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Where hardboard cladding is grooved, the grooves shall not extend more than 1.5 mm into the minimum required thickness. (See Note A-9.27.9.2.(3).) (See Note A-9.27.9.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where hardboard cladding is grooved, the grooves shall not extend more than 1.5 mm into the minimum required thickness. (See Note A-9.27.9.2.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Hardboard cladding applied in panels shall have all edges supported with not less than a 5 mm gap provided between sheets.
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard cladding applied in panels shall have all edges supported with not less than a 5 mm gap provided between sheets.

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.9.3.(1) shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.9.3.(1) shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.9.3.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.9.3.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

National Sentence Text: Hardboard applied in horizontal lapped strips shall have not less than a 5 mm gap provided at the butted ends, which shall be sealed or otherwise protected with suitable mouldings.
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard applied in horizontal lapped strips shall have not less than a 5 mm gap provided at the butted ends, which shall be sealed or otherwise protected with suitable mouldings.

National Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence 9.27.9.4.(1) shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of siding board but not less than 9.5 mm for matched joint siding or 25 mm for lapped siding.
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence 9.27.9.4.(1) shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of siding board but not less than 9.5 mm for matched joint siding or 25 mm for lapped siding.

National Sentence Text: Not less than 3 mm clearance shall be provided between hardboard cladding and door or window frames.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than 3 mm clearance shall be provided between hardboard cladding and door or window frames.

National Sentence Text: OSB and waferboard cladding shall conform to CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: OSB and waferboard cladding shall conform to CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard

National Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-2 grade shall be not less than 6.0 mm thick where applied directly to sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-2 grade shall be not less than 6.0 mm thick where applied directly to sheathing.

National Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-2 grade applied directly to framing or over furring strips shall conform to the thickness shown for plywood in Table 9.27.8.2. (See Note A-9.27.10.2.(2).) (See Note A-9.27.10.2.(2).)

P/T Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-1 grade and waferboard conforming to R-1 grade shall be not less than 7.9 mm thick where applied directly to sheathing.

National Sentence Text: Where applied directly to framing or over furring strips, OSB conforming to O-1 grade and waferboard conforming to R-1 grade shall be not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Where applied directly to framing or over furring strips, OSB conforming to O-1 grade and waferboard conforming to R-1 grade shall be not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: OSB and waferboard applied in panels shall have all edges supported and treated with a primer or sealer.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB and waferboard applied in panels shall have all edges supported and treated with a primer or sealer.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 3 mm gap shall be provided between sheets in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.10.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 3 mm gap shall be provided between sheets in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.10.3.(1).

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.10.3.(1) shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the OSB and waferboard joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.10.3.(1) shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the OSB and waferboard joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.10.3.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.10.3.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 3 mm clearance shall be provided between OSB and waferboard cladding and door or window frames.

P/T Sentence Text: Steel sheet cladding shall have a minimum thickness of 0.3 mm and conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.3-M91 Prefinished Galvanized and Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Steel Sheet for Residential Use

P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal and vertical strip aluminum siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use (See Note A-9.27.11.1.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Aluminum sheet cladding shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.1-M85 Sheet, Aluminum Alloy, Prefinished, Residential and shall have a thickness of not less than 0.58 mm, except that siding supported by backing or sheathing shall have a thickness of not less than 0.46 mm. National Sentence Text: Vinyl siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-41.24-95 Rigid Vinyl Siding, Soffits and Fascia
P/T Sentence Text: Vinyl siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-41.24-95 Rigid Vinyl Siding, Soffits and Fascia

P/T Sentence Text: The attachment of vinyl siding shall conform to the requirements in part 9. for metal siding.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.13.1.(2), this Subsection applies to exterior insulation finish systems (EIFS) that are covered in the scope of ULC CAN/ULC-S716.1-12 Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems (EIFS) - Materials and Systems and have a geometrically defined drainage cavity with a minimum cavity depth of 10 mm and an open area equal to not less than 13% of the area of a full-size EIFS panel. National Sentence Text: EIFS that are not covered by Sentence 9.27.13.1.(1) shall comply with Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: EIFS that are not covered by Sentence 9.27.13.1.(1) shall comply with part 5..

P/T Sentence Text: The materials used in EIFS shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S716.1-12 Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems (EIFS) - Materials and Systems

National Sentence Text: Sheathing shall be provided beneath stucco applied over wood-frame walls except as permitted in Article 9.28.4.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing shall be provided beneath stucco applied over wood-frame walls except as permitted in Article 9.28.4.2.

National Sentence Text: Where applied beneath stucco, sheathing shall conform to Subsection 9.23.17.
P/T Sentence Text: Where applied beneath stucco, sheathing shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to any substrate other than masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to any substrate other than masonry.

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to masonry where the masonry is soft-burned tile or brick of less strength than the stucco, or the masonry surface is not sound, clean and sufficiently rough to provide a good key.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to masonry where the masonry is soft-burned tile or brick of less strength than the stucco, or the masonry surface is not sound, clean and sufficiently rough to provide a good key.

National Sentence Text: Stucco applied over masonry chimneys shall be reinforced.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco applied over masonry chimneys shall be reinforced.

National Sentence Text: Stucco finish shall not be applied over concrete masonry units less than one month old unless the units have been cured by the autoclave process.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco finish shall not be applied over concrete masonry units less than one month old unless the units have been cured by the autoclave process.

National Sentence Text: Stucco shall be not less than 200 mm above finished ground level except when it is applied over concrete or masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco shall be not less than 200 mm above finished ground level except when it is applied over concrete or masonry.

National Sentence Text: Flashing and caulking used with stucco shall conform to Subsections 9.27.3. and Subsection 9.27.4., except that if aluminum flashing is used, it shall be separated from the stucco by an impervious membrane or coating. (See Article 9.7.6.2. for caulking around window frames.)
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing and caulking used with stucco shall conform to Subsections 9. and part 9., except that if aluminum flashing is used, it shall be separated from the stucco by an impervious membrane or coating. (See Article 9.7.6.2. for caulking around window frames.)

National Sentence Text: Portland cement shall conform to CSA A3001-13 Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Portland cement shall conform to CSA A3001-13 Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete

National Sentence Text: Aggregate shall be clean, well-graded natural sand or sand manufactured from crushed stone, gravel or air-cooled blast furnace slag and shall contain no significant amounts of deleterious material.
P/T Sentence Text: Aggregate shall be clean, well-graded natural sand or sand manufactured from crushed stone, gravel or air-cooled blast furnace slag and shall contain no significant amounts of deleterious material.

National Sentence Text: Aggregate grading shall conform to Table 9.28.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Aggregate grading shall conform to Table 9.28.2.2.

National Sentence Text: Water shall be clean and free of significant amounts of deleterious material.
P/T Sentence Text: Water shall be clean and free of significant amounts of deleterious material.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be corrosion-resistant and of a material other than aluminum.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be corrosion-resistant and of a material other than aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Nails for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be not less than 3.2 mm diam with a head diameter of not less than 11.1 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be not less than 3.2 mm diam with a head diameter of not less than 11.1 mm.

National Sentence Text: Staples for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be not less than 1.98 mm diam or thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be not less than 1.98 mm diam or thickness.

National Sentence Text: Staples and nails for attaching stucco lath or reinforcing to vertical surfaces shall be of sufficient length to penetrate 25 mm into framing members or to the full depth of the sheathing where the sheathing is used for attachment.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples and nails for attaching stucco lath or reinforcing to vertical surfaces shall be of sufficient length to penetrate 25 mm into framing members or to the full depth of the sheathing where the sheathing is used for attachment.

National Sentence Text: On horizontal surfaces nails for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be not less than 38 mm long.
P/T Sentence Text: On horizontal surfaces nails for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be not less than 38 mm long.

National Sentence Text: Rib lath or expanded metal stucco mesh shall be copper-alloy steel coated with rust-inhibitive paint after fabrication, or galvanized.
P/T Sentence Text: Rib lath or expanded metal stucco mesh shall be copper-alloy steel coated with rust-inhibitive paint after fabrication, or galvanized.

National Sentence Text: Woven or welded wire mesh shall be galvanized.
P/T Sentence Text: Woven or welded wire mesh shall be galvanized.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing need not be provided beneath stucco where not less than 1.19 mm diam galvanized wire is applied horizontally to the framing at vertical intervals of not more than 150 mm, or where paper-backed welded wire metal lath is used.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing need not be provided beneath stucco where not less than 1.19 mm diam galvanized wire is applied horizontally to the framing at vertical intervals of not more than 150 mm, or where paper-backed welded wire metal lath is used.

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall conform to Table 9.28.4.3. See Note A-Table 9.28.4.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall conform to Table 9.28.4.3.

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be held not less than 6 mm away from the backing by means of suitable self-furring devices.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be held not less than 6 mm away from the backing by means of suitable self-furring devices.

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be applied with the long dimension horizontal.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be applied with the long dimension horizontal.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal and vertical joints in stucco lath shall be lapped not less than 50 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal and vertical joints in stucco lath shall be lapped not less than 50 mm.

National Sentence Text: End joints of stucco lath shall be staggered and shall occur over framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: End joints of stucco lath shall be staggered and shall occur over framing members.

National Sentence Text: External corners of stucco lath shall be reinforced with a vertical strip of lath or reinforcing extending not less than 150 mm on both sides of the corner, or the lath or reinforcing shall extend around corners not less than 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: External corners of stucco lath shall be reinforced with a vertical strip of lath or reinforcing extending not less than 150 mm on both sides of the corner, or the lath or reinforcing shall extend around corners not less than 150 mm.

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be fastened in conformance with Subsection 9.27.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be fastened in conformance with part 9.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners on vertical surfaces shall be spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. vertically and 400 mm o.c. horizontally, or 100 mm o.c. vertically and 600 mm o.c. horizontally.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners on vertical surfaces shall be spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. vertically and 400 mm o.c. horizontally, or 100 mm o.c. vertically and 600 mm o.c. horizontally.

National Sentence Text: Nailing patterns other than those required in Sentence 9.28.4.6.(2) are permitted to be used provided there are at least 20 fasteners per square metre of wall surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Nailing patterns other than those required in Sentence 9.28.4.6.(2) are permitted to be used provided there are at least 20 fasteners per square metre of wall surface.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners on horizontal surfaces shall be spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along the framing members when members are spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 100 mm o.c. along members when members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners on horizontal surfaces shall be spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along the framing members when members are spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 100 mm o.c. along members when members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Stucco mixes shall conform to Table 9.28.5.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco mixes shall conform to Table 9.28.5.1.

National Sentence Text: Pigment if used shall consist of pure mineral oxides inert to the action of sun, lime and cement.
P/T Sentence Text: Pigment if used shall consist of pure mineral oxides inert to the action of sun, lime and cement.

National Sentence Text: Pigment shall not exceed 6% of the Portland cement by weight.
P/T Sentence Text: Pigment shall not exceed 6% of the Portland cement by weight.

National Sentence Text: Materials shall be thoroughly mixed before and after water is added.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials shall be thoroughly mixed before and after water is added.

National Sentence Text: Stucco shall be applied not later than 3 h after the initial mixing.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco shall be applied not later than 3 h after the initial mixing.

National Sentence Text: The base for stucco shall be maintained above freezing.
P/T Sentence Text: The base for stucco shall be maintained above freezing.

National Sentence Text: Stucco shall be maintained at a temperature of not less than 10°C during application, and for not less than 48 h afterwards.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco shall be maintained at a temperature of not less than 10°C during application, and for not less than 48 h afterwards.

National Sentence Text: Stucco shall be applied with at least 2 base coats and one finish coat, providing a total thickness of not less than 15 mm, measured from the face of the lath or the face of the masonry where no lath is used.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco shall be applied with at least 2 base coats and one finish coat, providing a total thickness of not less than 15 mm, measured from the face of the lath or the face of the masonry where no lath is used.

National Sentence Text: The first coat shall be not less than 6 mm thick, measured from the face of the lath or masonry, fully embedding the lath.
P/T Sentence Text: The first coat shall be not less than 6 mm thick, measured from the face of the lath or masonry, fully embedding the lath.

National Sentence Text: The surface of the first coat shall be scored to provide a key with the second coat.
P/T Sentence Text: The surface of the first coat shall be scored to provide a key with the second coat.

National Sentence Text: The second coat shall be not less than 6 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: The second coat shall be not less than 6 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: The surface of the second coat shall be lightly roughened to provide a key with the finish coat if the finish coat is other than stone dash.
P/T Sentence Text: The surface of the second coat shall be lightly roughened to provide a key with the finish coat if the finish coat is other than stone dash.

National Sentence Text: When the finish coat is other than stone dash, the base shall be dampened but not saturated before the finish coat is applied.
P/T Sentence Text: When the finish coat is other than stone dash, the base shall be dampened but not saturated before the finish coat is applied.

National Sentence Text: The thickness of the finish coat shall be not less than 3 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of the finish coat shall be not less than 3 mm.

National Sentence Text: When a stone dash finish is used, the stone shall be partially embedded in the second coat before the second coat starts to set or stiffen.
P/T Sentence Text: When a stone dash finish is used, the stone shall be partially embedded in the second coat before the second coat starts to set or stiffen.

National Sentence Text: A wall or ceiling finish shall also conform to the appropriate requirements in Sections 9.10. and Section 9.11., in addition to the requirements in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: A wall or ceiling finish shall also conform to the appropriate requirements in Sections 9. and part 9., in addition to the requirements in this Section.

National Sentence Text: Waterproof finish shall be provided to a height of not less than 1.8 m above the floor in shower stalls, 1.2 m above the rims of bathtubs equipped with showers, and 400 mm above the rims of bathtubs not equipped with showers.
P/T Sentence Text: Waterproof finish shall be provided to a height of not less than 1.8 m above the floor in shower stalls, 1.2 m above the rims of bathtubs equipped with showers, and 400 mm above the rims of bathtubs not equipped with showers.

National Sentence Text: Waterproof finish shall consist of ceramic, plastic or metal tile, sheet vinyl, tempered hardboard, laminated thermosetting decorative sheets or linoleum.
P/T Sentence Text: Waterproof finish shall consist of ceramic, plastic or metal tile, sheet vinyl, tempered hardboard, laminated thermosetting decorative sheets or linoleum.

National Sentence Text: Wood furring for the attachment of wall and ceiling finishes shall conform to Table 9.29.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood furring for the attachment of wall and ceiling finishes shall conform to Table 9.29.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Furring shall be fastened to the framing or to wood blocks with not less than 51 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: Furring shall be fastened to the framing or to wood blocks with not less than 51 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Application of plaster wall and ceiling finishes, including installation of metal or gypsum lath, shall conform to CSA A82.30-M1980 Interior Furring, Lathing and Gypsum Plastering
P/T Sentence Text: Application of plaster wall and ceiling finishes, including installation of metal or gypsum lath, shall conform to CSA A82.30-M1980 Interior Furring, Lathing and Gypsum Plastering

National Sentence Text: The requirements for application of gypsum board in this Subsection apply to the single layer application of gypsum board to wood furring or framing using nails or screws.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements for application of gypsum board in this Subsection apply to the single layer application of gypsum board to wood furring or framing using nails or screws.

National Sentence Text: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to ASTM C 840-13 Application and Finishing of Gypsum Board or CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to ASTM C 840-13 Application and Finishing of Gypsum Board or CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application

National Sentence Text: Gypsum products shall conform to ASTM C 1178/C 1178M-13 Coated Glass Mat Water-Resistant Gypsum Backing Panel or ASTM C 1396/C 1396M-14 Gypsum Board except that the flame-spread rating of gypsum board shall be determined in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum products shall conform to ASTM C 1178/C 1178M-13 Coated Glass Mat Water-Resistant Gypsum Backing Panel or ASTM C 1396/C 1396M-14 Gypsum Board except that the flame-spread rating of gypsum board shall be determined in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies

National Sentence Text: Maximum spacing of supports for gypsum board applied as a single layer shall conform to Table 9.29.5.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Maximum spacing of supports for gypsum board applied as a single layer shall conform to Table 9.29.5.3.

National Sentence Text: Gypsum board supporting insulation shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum board supporting insulation shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: The length of fasteners for gypsum board shall conform to Table 9.29.5.5., except that lesser depths of penetration are permitted for assemblies required to have a fire-resistance rating provided it can be shown, on the basis of fire tests, that such depths are adequate for the required rating.
P/T Sentence Text: The length of fasteners for gypsum board shall conform to Table 9.29.5.5., except that lesser depths of penetration are permitted for assemblies required to have a fire-resistance rating provided it can be shown, on the basis of fire tests, that such depths are adequate for the required rating.

National Sentence Text: Nails for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples

National Sentence Text: Screws for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM C 1002-07 Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs
P/T Sentence Text: Screws for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM C 1002-07 Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs

National Sentence Text: For single-layer application on a ceiling, nails shall be spaced not more than 180 mm o.c. on ceiling supports, or every 300 mm o.c. along ceiling supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: For single-layer application on a ceiling, nails shall be spaced not more than 180 mm o.c. on ceiling supports, or every 300 mm o.c. along ceiling supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Where the ceiling sheets are supported by the wall sheets around the perimeter of the ceiling, this support may be considered as equivalent to nailing at this location.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the ceiling sheets are supported by the wall sheets around the perimeter of the ceiling, this support may be considered as equivalent to nailing at this location.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.29.5.8.(4), for single-layer application on walls, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, or every 300 mm o.c. along vertical wall supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.29.5.8.(4), for single-layer application on walls, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, or every 300 mm o.c. along vertical wall supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: For single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board provides required bracing in braced wall panels, lateral support for studs, or fire protection, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, and top and bottom plates. (See Article 9.23.10.2. and Section 9.10.)
P/T Sentence Text: For single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board provides required bracing in braced wall panels, lateral support for studs, or fire protection, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, and top and bottom plates.

National Sentence Text: The uppermost nails on vertical wall supports shall be not more than 200 mm below the ceiling.
P/T Sentence Text: The uppermost nails on vertical wall supports shall be not more than 200 mm below the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Nails shall be located not less than 10 mm from the side or edge of the board.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails shall be located not less than 10 mm from the side or edge of the board.

National Sentence Text: Nails shall be driven so that the heads do not puncture the paper.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails shall be driven so that the heads do not puncture the paper.

National Sentence Text: For single-layer application on a ceiling, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on ceiling supports.
P/T Sentence Text: For single-layer application on a ceiling, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on ceiling supports.

National Sentence Text: Where the ceiling sheets are supported by the wall sheets around the perimeter of the ceiling, this support may be considered as equivalent to screwing at this location.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the ceiling sheets are supported by the wall sheets around the perimeter of the ceiling, this support may be considered as equivalent to screwing at this location.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.29.5.9.(4), for single-layer application on walls, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are more than 400 mm o.c., or not more than 400 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.29.5.9.(4), for single-layer application on walls, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are more than 400 mm o.c., or not more than 400 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are not more than 400 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.5.9.(5), for single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board provides required bracing in braced wall panels, lateral support for studs, or fire protection, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, and top and bottom plates. (See Article 9.23.10.2. and Section 9.10.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.5.9.(5), for single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board provides required bracing in braced wall panels, lateral support for studs, or fire protection, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, and top and bottom plates.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating is determined based on Table 9.10.3.1.-A, Sentence 9.29.5.9.(4) need not apply for the purpose of fire protection.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating is determined based on Table 9.10.3.1.-A, Sentence 9.29.5.9.(4) need not apply for the purpose of fire protection.

National Sentence Text: Screws shall be located not less than 10 mm from the edge of the board.
P/T Sentence Text: Screws shall be located not less than 10 mm from the edge of the board.

National Sentence Text: Screws shall be driven so that the heads do not puncture the paper.
P/T Sentence Text: Screws shall be driven so that the heads do not puncture the paper.

National Sentence Text: In cold weather, heat shall be provided to maintain a temperature not below 10°C for 48 h prior to taping and finishing and maintained for not less than 48 h thereafter.
P/T Sentence Text: In cold weather, heat shall be provided to maintain a temperature not below 10°C for 48 h prior to taping and finishing and maintained for not less than 48 h thereafter.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.29.6.1.(2)and 9.29.6.1.(3), the minimum thickness of plywood interior finish shall conform to Table 9.29.6.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.29.6.1.(2) and 9.29.6.1.(3), the minimum thickness of plywood interior finish shall conform to Table 9.29.6.1.

National Sentence Text: A manufacturing tolerance of  0.4 mm may be applied to the thicknesses listed in Table 9.29.6.1.
P/T Sentence Text: A manufacturing tolerance of  0.4 mm may be applied to the thicknesses listed in Table 9.29.6.1.

National Sentence Text: No minimum thickness is required where plywood is applied over continuous backing.
P/T Sentence Text: No minimum thickness is required where plywood is applied over continuous backing.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.29.6.2.(2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.29.6.2.(2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.

National Sentence Text: If the grain of the face ply is at right angles to the supporting members, the groove is permitted to extend into plies below the face ply provided the thickness of the plywood exceeds the value shown in Table 9.29.6.1. by an amount equal to not less than the depth of penetration of the grooves into the plies below the face ply.
P/T Sentence Text: If the grain of the face ply is at right angles to the supporting members, the groove is permitted to extend into plies below the face ply provided the thickness of the plywood exceeds the value shown in Table 9.29.6.1. by an amount equal to not less than the depth of penetration of the grooves into the plies below the face ply.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.6.3.(2), nails for attaching plywood finishes shall not be less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports, except that staples providing equivalent lateral resistance may also be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.6.3.(2), nails for attaching plywood finishes shall not be less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports, except that staples providing equivalent lateral resistance may also be used.

National Sentence Text: Where plywood finish provides required bracing in braced wall panels, the plywood shall be fastened in accordance with the fastening requirements for sheathing stated in Sentence 9.23.3.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Where plywood finish provides required bracing in braced wall panels, the plywood shall be fastened in accordance with the fastening requirements for sheathing stated in Sentence 9.23.3.5.(2).

National Sentence Text: All plywood edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing.
P/T Sentence Text: All plywood edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing.

National Sentence Text: Hardboard shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard

National Sentence Text: Hardboard shall be not less than 3 mm thick where applied over continuous backing, 6 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 9 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard shall be not less than 3 mm thick where applied over continuous backing, 6 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 9 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Nails for fastening hardboard shall be casing or finishing nails not less than 38 mm long, spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for fastening hardboard shall be casing or finishing nails not less than 38 mm long, spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.

National Sentence Text: All hardboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing where the backing is not continuous.
P/T Sentence Text: All hardboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing where the backing is not continuous.

National Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S706.1-16 Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S706.1-16 Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings

National Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard sheets shall be not less than 11.1 mm thick on supports not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard sheets shall be not less than 11.1 mm thick on supports not more than 400 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard tile shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard tile shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Nails for fastening fibreboard sheets shall be not less than 2.6 mm shank diameter casing or finishing nails of sufficient length to penetrate not less than 20 mm into the supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for fastening fibreboard sheets shall be not less than 2.6 mm shank diameter casing or finishing nails of sufficient length to penetrate not less than 20 mm into the supports.

National Sentence Text: Nails shall be spaced not more than 100 mm o.c. along edge supports and 200 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails shall be spaced not more than 100 mm o.c. along edge supports and 200 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.

National Sentence Text: All fibreboard edges shall be supported by blocking, furring or framing.
P/T Sentence Text: All fibreboard edges shall be supported by blocking, furring or framing.

National Sentence Text: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard
P/T Sentence Text: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard

National Sentence Text: OSB or waferboard finish shall conform to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: OSB or waferboard finish shall conform to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.29.9.2.(2)and 9.29.9.2.(3), the minimum thickness of O-2 grade OSB used as an interior finish shall conform to that shown for plywood in Table 9.29.6.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.29.9.2.(2) and 9.29.9.2.(3), the minimum thickness of O-2 grade OSB used as an interior finish shall conform to that shown for plywood in Table 9.29.6.1.

National Sentence Text: Thicknesses listed in Table 9.29.6.1. shall permit a manufacturing tolerance of  0.4 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Thicknesses listed in Table 9.29.6.1. shall permit a manufacturing tolerance of  0.4 mm.

National Sentence Text: No minimum thickness is required where O-2 grade OSB is applied over continuous backing.
P/T Sentence Text: No minimum thickness is required where O-2 grade OSB is applied over continuous backing.

National Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-1 grade, waferboard conforming to R-1 grade and particleboard shall be not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 400 mm o.c., not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports not more than 600 mm o.c., and not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 600 mm o.c. in walls where blocking is provided at midwall height.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-1 grade, waferboard conforming to R-1 grade and particleboard shall be not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 400 mm o.c., not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports not more than 600 mm o.c., and not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 600 mm o.c. in walls where blocking is provided at midwall height.

National Sentence Text: OSB conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing shall meet the minimum panel mark of W16, on supports not more than 400 mm o.c., W24, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c., and W16, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c. where blocking is provided at mid-wall height.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing shall meet the minimum panel mark of W16, on supports not more than 400 mm o.c., W24, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c., and W16, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c. where blocking is provided at mid-wall height.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.9.3.(2), nails for fastening particleboard, OSB or waferboard shall be not less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.9.3.(2), nails for fastening particleboard, OSB or waferboard shall be not less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.

National Sentence Text: Where OSB or waferboard provides required bracing in braced wall panels, the OSB or waferboard shall be fastened in accordance with the fastening requirements for sheathing stated in Sentence 9.23.3.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Where OSB or waferboard provides required bracing in braced wall panels, the OSB or waferboard shall be fastened in accordance with the fastening requirements for sheathing stated in Sentence 9.23.3.5.(2).

National Sentence Text: All particleboard, OSB or waferboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing.
P/T Sentence Text: All particleboard, OSB or waferboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing.

National Sentence Text: Ceramic tile shall be set in a mortar base or applied with an adhesive.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceramic tile shall be set in a mortar base or applied with an adhesive.

National Sentence Text: Plastic tile shall be applied with an adhesive.
P/T Sentence Text: Plastic tile shall be applied with an adhesive.

National Sentence Text: When ceramic tile is applied to a mortar base the cementitious material shall consist of one part Portland cement to not more than one-quarter part lime by volume.
P/T Sentence Text: When ceramic tile is applied to a mortar base the cementitious material shall consist of one part Portland cement to not more than one-quarter part lime by volume.

National Sentence Text: The cementitious material described in Sentence 9.29.10.2.(1) shall be mixed with not less than 3 nor more than 5 parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.
P/T Sentence Text: The cementitious material described in Sentence 9.29.10.2.(1) shall be mixed with not less than 3 nor more than 5 parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.

National Sentence Text: Mortar shall be applied over metal lath or masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar shall be applied over metal lath or masonry.

National Sentence Text: Ceramic tile applied to a mortar base shall be thoroughly soaked and pressed into place forcing the mortar into the joints while the tile is wet.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceramic tile applied to a mortar base shall be thoroughly soaked and pressed into place forcing the mortar into the joints while the tile is wet.

National Sentence Text: Adhesives to attach ceramic and plastic tile shall be applied to the finish coat or brown coat of plaster that has been steel-trowelled to an even surface or to gypsum board or to masonry provided the masonry has an even surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Adhesives to attach ceramic and plastic tile shall be applied to the finish coat or brown coat of plaster that has been steel-trowelled to an even surface or to gypsum board or to masonry provided the masonry has an even surface.

National Sentence Text: Ceramic and plastic tile installed on walls around bathtubs or showers shall be applied over moisture-resistant backing.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceramic and plastic tile installed on walls around bathtubs or showers shall be applied over moisture-resistant backing.

National Sentence Text: The joints between wall tiles and a bathtub shall be suitably caulked with material conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-19.22-M89 Mildew-Resistant Sealing Compound for Tubs and Tiles
P/T Sentence Text: The joints between wall tiles and a bathtub shall be suitably caulked with material conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-19.22-M89 Mildew-Resistant Sealing Compound for Tubs and Tiles

National Sentence Text: Finished flooring shall be provided in all residential occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Finished flooring shall be provided in all residential occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Where water permeable finished flooring in bathrooms, kitchens, public entrance halls and laundry areas is supported by a subfloor of a type that would be damaged by water, such flooring shall be installed over a membrane with a water permeance not exceeding 18 ng/(Pa·s·m2) when tested in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials (See Note A-9.30.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where water permeable finished flooring in bathrooms, kitchens, public entrance halls and laundry areas is supported by a subfloor of a type that would be damaged by water, such flooring shall be installed over a membrane with a water permeance not exceeding 18 ng/(Pa·s·m2) when tested in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials (See Note A-9.30.1.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Wood sleepers supporting finished flooring over a concrete base supported on the ground shall be not less than 19 mm by 38 mm and shall be treated with a wood preservative.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood sleepers supporting finished flooring over a concrete base supported on the ground shall be not less than 19 mm by 38 mm and shall be treated with a wood preservative.

National Sentence Text: Finished flooring shall have a surface that is smooth, even and free from roughness or open defects.
P/T Sentence Text: Finished flooring shall have a surface that is smooth, even and free from roughness or open defects.

National Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring. (See Sentence 9.30.3.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring. (See Sentence 9.30.3.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting on panel-type subflooring whose edges are unsupported. (See Article 9.23.15.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting on panel-type subflooring whose edges are unsupported. (See Article 9.23.15.3.)

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be provided under ceramic tile applied with adhesive.
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be provided under ceramic tile applied with adhesive.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be not less than 6 mm thick and shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be not less than 6 mm thick and shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay under ceramic tile applied with adhesive shall be not less than 6 mm thick where the supports are spaced up to 300 mm o.c., and 11 mm thick where the supports are spaced wider than 300 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay under ceramic tile applied with adhesive shall be not less than 6 mm thick where the supports are spaced up to 300 mm o.c., and 11 mm thick where the supports are spaced wider than 300 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be fastened to the subfloor with staples, annular grooved flooring nails or spiral nails, spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along the edges and 200 mm o.c. both ways at other locations.
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be fastened to the subfloor with staples, annular grooved flooring nails or spiral nails, spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along the edges and 200 mm o.c. both ways at other locations.

National Sentence Text: Nails for panel-type underlay shall be not less than 19 mm long for 6 mm thick underlay and 22 mm long for 7.9 mm thick underlay.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for panel-type underlay shall be not less than 19 mm long for 6 mm thick underlay and 22 mm long for 7.9 mm thick underlay.

National Sentence Text: Staples for panel-type underlay shall have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and be not less than 22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and 28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples for panel-type underlay shall have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and be not less than 22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and 28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.

National Sentence Text: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset not less than 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.
P/T Sentence Text: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset not less than 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.

National Sentence Text: Underlay beneath resilient or ceramic floors applied with an adhesive shall have all holes or open defects on the surface patched so that the defects will not be transmitted to the finished surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Underlay beneath resilient or ceramic floors applied with an adhesive shall have all holes or open defects on the surface patched so that the defects will not be transmitted to the finished surface.

National Sentence Text: The thickness of wood strip flooring shall conform to Table 9.30.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of wood strip flooring shall conform to Table 9.30.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Wood strip flooring shall not be laid parallel to lumber subflooring unless a separate underlay is provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood strip flooring shall not be laid parallel to lumber subflooring unless a separate underlay is provided.

National Sentence Text: If wood strip flooring is applied without a subfloor, it shall be laid at right angles to the joists so that the end joints are staggered and occur over supports or are end matched.
P/T Sentence Text: If wood strip flooring is applied without a subfloor, it shall be laid at right angles to the joists so that the end joints are staggered and occur over supports or are end matched.

National Sentence Text: If the flooring is end matched, it shall be laid so that no 2 adjoining strips break joints in the same space between supports and each strip bears on no fewer than 2 supports.
P/T Sentence Text: If the flooring is end matched, it shall be laid so that no 2 adjoining strips break joints in the same space between supports and each strip bears on no fewer than 2 supports.

National Sentence Text: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with not less than one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips more than 25 mm in width shall have at least 2 nails per strip.
P/T Sentence Text: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with not less than one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips more than 25 mm in width shall have at least 2 nails per strip.

National Sentence Text: Face nails shall be countersunk.
P/T Sentence Text: Face nails shall be countersunk.

National Sentence Text: Staples are permitted to be used to fasten wood strip flooring not more than 7.9 mm in thickness provided the staples are not less than 29 mm long with a shank diameter of 1.19 mm and with 4.7 mm crowns.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples are permitted to be used to fasten wood strip flooring not more than 7.9 mm in thickness provided the staples are not less than 29 mm long with a shank diameter of 1.19 mm and with 4.7 mm crowns.

National Sentence Text: Adhesive used to attach parquet block flooring shall be suitable for bonding wood to the applicable subfloor material.
P/T Sentence Text: Adhesive used to attach parquet block flooring shall be suitable for bonding wood to the applicable subfloor material.

National Sentence Text: Resilient flooring used on concrete slabs supported on ground shall consist of asphalt, rubber, unbacked vinyl or vinyl with an inorganic type backing.
P/T Sentence Text: Resilient flooring used on concrete slabs supported on ground shall consist of asphalt, rubber, unbacked vinyl or vinyl with an inorganic type backing.

National Sentence Text: Flooring described in Sentence 9.30.5.1.(1) shall be attached to the base with a suitable waterproof and alkali-resistant adhesive.
P/T Sentence Text: Flooring described in Sentence 9.30.5.1.(1) shall be attached to the base with a suitable waterproof and alkali-resistant adhesive.

National Sentence Text: Ceramic tile shall be set in a mortar bed or applied to a sound smooth base with a suitable adhesive.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceramic tile shall be set in a mortar bed or applied to a sound smooth base with a suitable adhesive.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type subfloor to which ceramic tile is to be applied with adhesive shall have its edges supported according to Article 9.23.15.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type subfloor to which ceramic tile is to be applied with adhesive shall have its edges supported according to Article 9.23.15.3.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to the plumbing facilities and plumbing systems within dwelling units.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to the plumbing facilities and plumbing systems within dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: In occupancies other than dwelling units, plumbing facilities, grab bars, floor drains, and floor and wall finishes around urinals shall conform to Subsection 3.7.2. (See also Section 3.8. regarding barrier-free plumbing facilities.)
P/T Sentence Text: In occupancies other than dwelling units, plumbing facilities, grab bars, floor drains, and floor and wall finishes around urinals shall conform to part 3. (See also part 3. regarding barrier-free plumbing facilities.)

National Sentence Text: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to Subsection 3.7.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to part 3.

National Sentence Text: Systems used for service water heating shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.
P/T Sentence Text: Systems used for service water heating shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in part 9.

National Sentence Text: The construction, extension, alteration, renewal or repair of plumbing systems and sewage disposal systems shall conform to Part 7.
P/T Sentence Text: The construction, extension, alteration, renewal or repair of plumbing systems and sewage disposal systems shall conform to part 7..

National Sentence Text: Metal pipes in contact with cinders or other corrosive material shall be protected by a heavy coating of bitumen or other corrosion protection.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal pipes in contact with cinders or other corrosive material shall be protected by a heavy coating of bitumen or other corrosion protection.

National Sentence Text: When provided, grab bars shall be capable of resisting a load of not less than 1.3 kN applied vertically or horizontally.
P/T Sentence Text: When provided, grab bars shall be capable of resisting a load of not less than 1.3 kN applied vertically or horizontally.
Glass used in shower and bathtub enclosures shall comply with Sentence 9.6.1.4.(6).
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Glass used in shower and bathtub enclosures shall comply with Sentence 9.6.1.4.(6).

National Sentence Text: Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with potable water.
P/T Sentence Text: Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with potable water.

National Sentence Text: Where a piped water supply is available, piping for hot and cold water shall be connected to every kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub, shower, slop sink and laundry area.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a piped water supply is available, piping for hot and cold water shall be connected to every kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub, shower, slop sink and laundry area.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where a piped water supply is available, piping for hot and cold water shall be connected to every kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub, shower, slop sink and laundry area.

National Sentence Text: Piping for cold water shall be run to every water closet.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping for cold water shall be run to every water closet.

National Sentence Text: A kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub or shower, and water closet shall be provided for every dwelling unit where a piped water supply is available.
P/T Sentence Text: A kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub or shower, and water closet shall be provided for every dwelling unit where a piped water supply is available.

National Sentence Text: Where a piped water supply is available a hot water supply shall be provided in every dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a piped water supply is available a hot water supply shall be provided in every dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Where gravity drainage to a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well is possible, a floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where gravity drainage to a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well is possible, a floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: A floor drain shall be provided in a garbage room, incinerator room or boiler room serving more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: A floor drain shall be provided in a garbage room, incinerator room or boiler room serving more than one dwelling unit.

Except as permitted by the Plumbing Code Regulation or Private Sewage Disposal Systems Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, sewage disposal design shall conform to the requirements of Articles 9.31.5.2.and 9.31.5.3.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as permitted by the Plumbing Code Regulation or Private Sewage Disposal Systems Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, sewage disposal design shall conform to the requirements of Articles 9.31.5.2. and 9.31.5.3.

National Sentence Text: Wastes from every plumbing fixture shall be piped to the building sewer.
