Matched National Sentence (Variation): Wastes from every plumbing fixture shall be piped to the building sewer.
P/T Sentence Text: Wastes from every plumbing fixture shall be piped to the building sewer.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Wastes from every plumbing fixture shall be piped to the building sewer.

National Sentence Text: Building sewers shall discharge into a public sewage system where such system is available.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Building sewers shall discharge into a public sewage system where such system is available.
P/T Sentence Text: Building sewers shall discharge into a public sewage system where such system is available.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Building sewers shall discharge into a public sewage system where such system is available.

National Sentence Text: Where a public sewage system is not available, the building sewer shall discharge into a private sewage disposal system.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Where a public sewage system is not available, the building sewer shall discharge into a private sewage disposal system.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a public sewage system is not available, the building sewer shall discharge into a private sewage disposal system.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where a public sewage system is not available, the building sewer shall discharge into a private sewage disposal system.

National Sentence Text: Where hot water is required to be supplied in accordance with Article 9.31.4.2., equipment shall provide an adequate supply of hot water, and be installed in conformance with Part 7.
P/T Sentence Text: Where hot water is required to be supplied in accordance with Article 9.31.4.2., equipment shall provide an adequate supply of hot water, and be installed in conformance with part 7..

National Sentence Text: Service water heaters shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to the NPC.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Service water heaters shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to the NPC.
P/T Sentence Text: Service water heaters shall conform to the Plumbing Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Service water heaters shall conform to the Plumbing Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

National Sentence Text: The installation of service water heaters, including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment or CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
Matched National Sentence (Variation): The installation of service water heaters, including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment or CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of service water heaters, including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to the Pressure Equipment Safety Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, CSA B139 Series-15 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment the Gas Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment or the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The installation of service water heaters, including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to the Pressure Equipment Safety Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, CSA B139 Series-15 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment the Gas Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment or the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

National Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, service water heaters shall be secured to the structure to prevent overturning. (See Note A-9.31.6.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, service water heaters shall be secured to the structure to prevent overturning. (See Note A-9.31.6.2.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for service water heaters are of steel, they shall be coated with zinc, vitreous enamel (glass lined), hydraulic cement or other corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for service water heaters are of steel, they shall be coated with zinc, vitreous enamel (glass lined), hydraulic cement or other corrosion-resistant material.

National Sentence Text: Fuel-burning service water heaters shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to Section 9.21.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel-burning service water heaters shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Heating coils of service water heaters shall not be installed in a flue or in the combustion chamber of a boiler or furnace heating a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Heating coils of service water heaters shall not be installed in a flue or in the combustion chamber of a boiler or furnace heating a building.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to the ventilation of rooms and spaces in residential occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to the ventilation of rooms and spaces in residential occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation of all other occupancies shall comply with Part 6.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation of all other occupancies shall comply with part 6..

National Sentence Text: A storage garage for up to 4 motor vehicles that serves a residential occupancy may be considered to be part of that occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: A storage garage for up to 4 motor vehicles that serves a residential occupancy may be considered to be part of that occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Systems used for ventilation shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.
P/T Sentence Text: Systems used for ventilation shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in part 9.

National Sentence Text: Every residential occupancy shall incorporate provisions for non-heating-season ventilation in accordance with Subsection 9.32.2., and except as required by Sentences 9.32.1.2.(2)and 9.32.1.2.(3), if supplied with electrical power and a heating system, provisions for heating-season ventilation in accordance with Part 6.
P/T Sentence Text: Every residential occupancy shall incorporate provisions for non-heating-season ventilation in accordance with part 9., and except as required by Sentences 9.32.1.2.(2) and 9.32.1.2.(3), if supplied with electrical power and a heating system, provisions for heating-season ventilation in accordance with part 6..

National Sentence Text: A self-contained heating-season ventilation system serving a single dwelling unit shall comply with Subsection 9.32.3. (See Note A-9.32.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A self-contained heating-season ventilation system serving a single dwelling unit shall comply with part 9. (See Note A-9.32.1.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: In houses that contain a secondary suite, heating-season ventilation need not be provided for exits, public corridors, and ancillary spaces that are not within a dwelling unit, except as provided in Sentence 9.32.1.2.(4). (See Note A-9.32.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: In houses that contain a secondary suite, heating-season ventilation need not be provided for exits, public corridors, and ancillary spaces that are not within a dwelling unit, except as provided in Sentence 9.32.1.2.(4).

National Sentence Text: Where ancillary spaces described in Clause 9.32.1.2.(3)(c) contain exhaust devices, these spaces shall be provided with make-up air in accordance with Article 9.32.3.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Where ancillary spaces described in Sentence 9.32.1.2.(3) contain exhaust devices, these spaces shall be provided with make-up air in accordance with Article 9.32.3.8.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, accessible for cleaning, and constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material. (See Note A-9.32.1.3.(2).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, accessible for cleaning, and constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material. (See Note A-9.32.1.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, be accessible for cleaning, be constructed of a smooth, corrosion-resistant material, not include screens, and not be secured with fasteners protruding into the duct.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, be accessible for cleaning, be constructed of a smooth, corrosion-resistant material, not include screens, and not be secured with fasteners protruding into the duct. (See Note A-9.32.1.3.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.
P/T Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.
Where roughed-in plumbing is installed for the future installation of a bathroom or water closet room, provision shall be made for the future installation of the required ventilation.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Where roughed-in plumbing is installed for the future installation of a bathroom or water closet room, provision shall be made for the future installation of the required ventilation.

National Sentence Text: The non-heating-season ventilation required by Clause 9.32.1.2.(1)(a) shall be supplied by natural ventilation in accordance with Article 9.32.2.2., or a mechanical ventilation system in accordance with Article 9.32.2.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The non-heating-season ventilation required by Sentence 9.32.1.2.(1) shall be supplied by natural ventilation in accordance with Article 9.32.2.2., or a mechanical ventilation system in accordance with Article 9.32.2.3.

National Sentence Text: The unobstructed openable ventilation area to the outdoors for rooms and spaces in residential buildings ventilated by natural means shall conform to Table 9.32.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed openable ventilation area to the outdoors for rooms and spaces in residential buildings ventilated by natural means shall conform to Table 9.32.2.2.

National Sentence Text: Where a vestibule opens directly off a living or dining room within a dwelling unit, ventilation to the outdoors for such rooms may be through the vestibule.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a vestibule opens directly off a living or dining room within a dwelling unit, ventilation to the outdoors for such rooms may be through the vestibule.

National Sentence Text: Openings for natural ventilation other than windows shall provide protection from the weather and insects.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings for natural ventilation other than windows shall provide protection from the weather and insects.

National Sentence Text: Screening shall be of corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Screening shall be of corrosion-resistant material.

National Sentence Text: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is mechanically cooled, its non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust air from inside the room or space, or to introduce outdoor air into that room or space, at a rate conforming with Table 9.32.2.3., or comply with Subsection 9.32.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is mechanically cooled, its non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust air from inside the room or space, or to introduce outdoor air into that room or space, at a rate conforming with Table 9.32.2.3., or comply with part 9.

National Sentence Text: In applying Clause 9.32.2.3.(1)(a), at least one bedroom in each dwelling unit shall be designated as the master bedroom, air change rates for any combined living/dining or family/dining space shall be determined as if the spaces were individual rooms, where a basement incorporates rooms of the types designated in Table 9.32.2.3., the assigned air change rate for each room shall be as specified for those types of rooms, basement areas used for other purposes that exceed 2/3 of the total basementfloor area shall be assigned an air change rate of 10 L/s, basement areas used for other purposes that are 2/3 of the total basementfloor area or less shall be assigned an air change rate of 5 L/s, and other habitable rooms, other than spaces intended solely for access, egress, storage, or service equipment, shall be assigned an air change rate of 5 L/s.
P/T Sentence Text: In applying Sentence 9.32.2.3.(1), at least one bedroom in each dwelling unit shall be designated as the master bedroom, air change rates for any combined living/dining or family/dining space shall be determined as if the spaces were individual rooms, where a basement incorporates rooms of the types designated in Table 9.32.2.3., the assigned air change rate for each room shall be as specified for those types of rooms, basement areas used for other purposes that exceed 2/3 of the total basement floor area shall be assigned an air change rate of 10 L/s, basement areas used for other purposes that are 2/3 of the total basement floor area or less shall be assigned an air change rate of 5 L/s, and other habitable rooms, other than spaces intended solely for access, egress, storage, or service equipment, shall be assigned an air change rate of 5 L/s.

National Sentence Text: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is not mechanically cooled, the non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust indoor air from the room or space or to introduce outdoor air to that room or space at a rate of one air change per hour.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is not mechanically cooled, the non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust indoor air from the room or space or to introduce outdoor air to that room or space at a rate of one air change per hour.

National Sentence Text: A non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall be designed and installed in conformance with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI SAR-G1 HRAI Digest the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA manuals. (See Note A-9.32.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: A non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall be designed and installed in conformance with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI Digest, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA manuals.

National Sentence Text: The heating-season ventilation required by Clause 9.32.1.2.(1)(b) shall be provided by a mechanical ventilation system complying with good practice such as that described in CSA CAN/CSA-F326-M91 Residential Mechanical Ventilation Systems for dwelling units with 5 or fewer bedrooms, the balance of this Subsection, or Part 6. (See Note A-9.32.3.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The heating-season ventilation required by Sentence 9.32.1.2.(1) shall be provided by a mechanical ventilation system complying with good practice such as that described in CSA CAN/CSA-F326-M91 Residential Mechanical Ventilation Systems for dwelling units with 5 or fewer bedrooms, the balance of this Subsection, or part 6..

National Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation systems complying with the balance of this Subsection shall incorporate at least the following components: a principal ventilation system complying with Article 9.32.3.3., supplemental exhaust fans complying with Article 9.32.3.7., and protection against depressurization in accordance with Article 9.32.3.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation systems complying with the balance of this Subsection shall incorporate at least the following components: a principal ventilation system complying with Article 9.32.3.3., supplemental exhaust fans complying with Article 9.32.3.7., and protection against depressurization in accordance with Article 9.32.3.8.

National Sentence Text: Aspects of mechanical ventilation systems not specifically described in this Subsection shall be designed, constructed and installed in accordance with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI SAR-G1 HRAI Digest the HRAI Residential Mechanical Ventilation Manual, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA manuals.
P/T Sentence Text: Aspects of mechanical ventilation systems not specifically described in this Subsection shall be designed, constructed and installed in accordance with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI Digest, the HRAI Residential Mechanical Ventilation Manual, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA manuals.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation system equipment installed to meet the requirements of this Section shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers’ instructions and recommendations except that, where such instructions and recommendations are in conflict with the requirements of this Subsection, the requirements of this Subsection shall govern.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation system equipment installed to meet the requirements of this Section shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers’ instructions and recommendations except that, where such instructions and recommendations are in conflict with the requirements of this Subsection, the requirements of this Subsection shall govern.

National Sentence Text: Except where mounted on concrete foundations, fans and heat recovery ventilators shall be isolated from structural components by resilient mountings to minimize the transmission of noise and vibration to occupied spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where mounted on concrete foundations, fans and heat recovery ventilators shall be isolated from structural components by resilient mountings to minimize the transmission of noise and vibration to occupied spaces.

National Sentence Text: Where flow-regulating dampers are required, they shall be adjustable and accessible without requiring the removal of fans, motors or insulating materials, or the use of specialized tools, and a device on the outside of the duct or device in which they are installed shall indicate the position of the damper.
P/T Sentence Text: Where flow-regulating dampers are required, they shall be adjustable and accessible without requiring the removal of fans, motors or insulating materials, or the use of specialized tools, and a device on the outside of the duct or device in which they are installed shall indicate the position of the damper.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment shall be accessible for inspection, maintenance, repair and cleaning.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment shall be accessible for inspection, maintenance, repair and cleaning.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors, in accordance with the manufacturers’ instructions. (See Note A-9.32.3.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors, in accordance with the manufacturers’ instructions.

National Sentence Text: The principal ventilation system shall incorporate the following components: a principal ventilation fan complying with this Article, and except as permitted by Article 9.32.3.6., provision for the introduction of outdoor air to the dwelling unit, in conformance with Article 9.32.3.4.or 9.32.3.5.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): The principal ventilation system shall incorporate the following components: a principal ventilation fan complying with this Article, and except as permitted by Article 9.32.3.6., provision for the introduction of outdoor air to the dwelling unit, in conformance with Article 9.32.3.4. or 9.32.3.5.
P/T Sentence Text: The principal ventilation system shall incorporate the following components: a principal ventilation fan complying with this Article, and provision for the introduction of outdoor air to the dwelling unit, in conformance with Article 9.32.3.4. or 9.32.3.5.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The principal ventilation system shall incorporate the following components: a principal ventilation fan complying with this Article, and provision for the introduction of outdoor air to the dwelling unit, in conformance with Article 9.32.3.4. or 9.32.3.5.

National Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan shall be capable of operating at an exhaust capacity complying with Table 9.32.3.3., referred to hereinafter as the "normal operating exhaust capacity." (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan shall be capable of operating at an exhaust capacity complying with Table 9.32.3.3., referred to hereinafter as the "normal operating exhaust capacity." (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The requirement for a principal ventilation fan may be satisfied by a single fan, by the exhaust side of a heat recovery ventilator, or by a group of fans, provided all fans in the group are controlled simultaneously by a controller complying with Sentences 9.32.3.3.(5), 9.32.3.3.(6)and 9.32.3.3.(7). (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: The requirement for a principal ventilation fan may be satisfied by a single fan, by the exhaust side of a heat recovery ventilator, or by a group of fans, provided all fans in the group are controlled simultaneously by a controller complying with Sentences 9.32.3.3.(5), 9.32.3.3.(6)and 9.32.3.3.(7). (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(3).)

National Sentence Text: The components of the principal ventilation system shall be approved by their manufacturer for continuous operation.
P/T Sentence Text: The components of the principal ventilation system shall be approved by their manufacturer for continuous operation.

National Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located within the living area of the dwelling unit and clearly marked "VENTILATION FAN." (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located within the living area of the dwelling unit and clearly marked "VENTILATION FAN." (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(5).)

National Sentence Text: If all controls serving the principal ventilation fan are in the "off" position, the principal ventilation system shall not operate.
P/T Sentence Text: If all controls serving the principal ventilation fan are in the "off" position, the principal ventilation system shall not operate.

National Sentence Text: The requirement for a manual switch stated in Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5) can be satisfied by a manual override incorporated in a dehumidistat or other automatic control, provided the automatic control is located within the living area of the dwelling unit, and the manual override is clearly marked "VENTILATION FAN."
P/T Sentence Text: The requirement for a manual switch stated in Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5) can be satisfied by a manual override incorporated in a dehumidistat or other automatic control, provided the automatic control is located within the living area of the dwelling unit, and the manual override is clearly marked "VENTILATION FAN."

National Sentence Text: Where the principal ventilation fan is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the principal ventilation fan is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.

National Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is connected directly to the return side of the duct system of a forced air heating system or other forced air distribution system, it shall be connected, where applicable, not less than 1 m upstream from the connection of the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is connected directly to the return side of the duct system of a forced air heating system or other forced air distribution system, it shall be connected, where applicable, not less than 1 m upstream from the connection of the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5).

National Sentence Text: Exhaust air intakes for principal ventilation fans located in kitchens, bathrooms and water-closet rooms shall be located in the ceiling or on the wall not less than 2 m above the floor. (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(10).) (See Note A-9.32.3.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust air intakes for principal ventilation fans located in kitchens, bathrooms and water-closet rooms shall be located in the ceiling or on the wall not less than 2 m above the floor. (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(10).)

National Sentence Text: Where outdoor air is to be introduced to the dwelling unit through a forced air heating system, the provision of outdoor air shall comply with this Article.
P/T Sentence Text: Where outdoor air is to be introduced to the dwelling unit through a forced air heating system, the provision of outdoor air shall comply with this Article.

National Sentence Text: Where the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan exceeds the maximum outdoor airflow permitted by Table 9.32.3.4. for a mixed air temperature of 15°C or exceeds the minimum acceptable return air temperature specified by the manufacturer of the furnace, whichever is less, then either the system shall incorporate a means for tempering outdoor air introduced to the heating system ducts so that a mixed air temperature of 15°C or the minimum acceptable return air temperature specified by the manufacturer of the furnace, whichever is less, is achieved when the outdoor air is at the January 2.5% temperature and the indoor air temperature is 22°C, or this Article shall be considered to be no longer applicable and the mechanical ventilation system shall comply with either Clause 9.32.3.1.(1)(a) or with Article 9.32.3.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan exceeds the maximum outdoor airflow permitted by Table 9.32.3.4. for a mixed air temperature of 15°C or exceeds the minimum acceptable return air temperature specified by the manufacturer of the furnace, whichever is less, then either the system shall incorporate a means for tempering outdoor air introduced to the heating system ducts so that a mixed air temperature of 15°C or the minimum acceptable return air temperature specified by the manufacturer of the furnace, whichever is less, is achieved when the outdoor air is at the January 2.5% temperature and the indoor air temperature is 22°C, or this Article shall be considered to be no longer applicable and the mechanical ventilation system shall comply with either Sentence 9.32.3.1.(1) or with Article 9.32.3.5.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of Table 9.32.3.4., the furnace airflow shall be determined by operating the forced air heating system’s circulation fan at the rate chosen to satisfy Clause 9.32.3.4.(9)(a) when measuring the return airflow in the furnace return air plenum immediately upstream of the connection of the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5) and then adding this return airflow measurement to the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan, or by using the manufacturer’s rated flow for the furnace for 150 Pa static pressure and the wiring configuration necessary to achieve the flow specified in Clause 9.32.3.4.(9)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of Table 9.32.3.4., the furnace airflow shall be determined by operating the forced air heating system’s circulation fan at the rate chosen to satisfy Sentence 9.32.3.4.(9) when measuring the return airflow in the furnace return air plenum immediately upstream of the connection of the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5) and then adding this return airflow measurement to the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan, or by using the manufacturer’s rated flow for the furnace for 150 Pa static pressure and the wiring configuration necessary to achieve the flow specified in Sentence 9.32.3.4.(9).

National Sentence Text: Linear interpolation is permitted in using Table 9.32.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Linear interpolation is permitted in using Table 9.32.3.4.

National Sentence Text: An outdoor air supply duct shall be installed between the outdoors and the furnace return air plenum and shall be connected not less than 3 m upstream of the plenum connection to the furnace, as measured along the length of the duct, or through an acceptable mixing device installed in the return air plenum.
P/T Sentence Text: An outdoor air supply duct shall be installed between the outdoors and the furnace return air plenum and shall be connected not less than 3 m upstream of the plenum connection to the furnace, as measured along the length of the duct, or through an acceptable mixing device installed in the return air plenum.

National Sentence Text: The outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5) shall incorporate a flow-regulating damper.
P/T Sentence Text: The outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5) shall incorporate a flow-regulating damper.

National Sentence Text: Where the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5) is not connected to an outdoor air supply fan, it shall be connected downstream of all return branch connections.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5) is not connected to an outdoor air supply fan, it shall be connected downstream of all return branch connections.

National Sentence Text: Where the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5) is connected to an auxiliary outdoor air supply fan, the auxiliary outdoor air supply fan shall be approved by the manufacturer for the handling of untempered outdoor air if it will be handling untempered outdoor air, approved by the manufacturer for continuous operation, and designed to provide an outdoor air supply flow within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the exhaust fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5) is connected to an auxiliary outdoor air supply fan, the auxiliary outdoor air supply fan shall be approved by the manufacturer for the handling of untempered outdoor air if it will be handling untempered outdoor air, approved by the manufacturer for continuous operation, and designed to provide an outdoor air supply flow within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the exhaust fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan.

National Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5) shall be wired in such a way that activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the forced air heating system’s circulation fan to provide an airflow not greater than the space-heating airflow, where applicable, activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the auxiliary outdoor air supply fan described in Sentence 9.32.3.3.(8), and the auxiliary outdoor air supply fan does not operate when the principal ventilation fan is not operating.
P/T Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5) shall be wired in such a way that activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the forced air heating system’s circulation fan to provide an airflow not greater than the space-heating airflow, where applicable, activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the auxiliary outdoor air supply fan described in Sentence 9.32.3.3.(8), and the auxiliary outdoor air supply fan does not operate when the principal ventilation fan is not operating.

National Sentence Text: With the principal ventilation fan operating at its normal operating exhaust capacity, the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct shall be measured and the flow-regulating damper required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(6) shall be adjusted and permanently fixed so that the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct is within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the principal ventilation fan.
P/T Sentence Text: With the principal ventilation fan operating at its normal operating exhaust capacity, the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct shall be measured and the flow-regulating damper required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(6) shall be adjusted and permanently fixed so that the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct is within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the principal ventilation fan.

National Sentence Text: The airflow measurements required by Sentences 9.32.3.4.(3)and 9.32.3.4.(10) shall be done using a method accurate to within ±15% of the flow rate being measured.
P/T Sentence Text: The airflow measurements required by Sentences 9.32.3.4.(3) and 9.32.3.4.(10) shall be done using a method accurate to within ±15% of the flow rate being measured.

National Sentence Text: All connections between the ventilation system and the heating system shall be in accordance with Articles 9.33.4.1.and 9.33.5.2. (See Note A-9.32.3.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: All connections between the ventilation system and the heating system shall be in accordance with Articles 9.33.4.1. and 9.33.5.2.

National Sentence Text: Where outdoor air is to be introduced to the dwelling unit through means other than a forced air heating system, the provision of outdoor air shall comply with this Article.
P/T Sentence Text: Where outdoor air is to be introduced to the dwelling unit through means other than a forced air heating system, the provision of outdoor air shall comply with this Article.

National Sentence Text: An outdoor air supply fan shall be installed with a rated capacity within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the exhaust fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan.
P/T Sentence Text: An outdoor air supply fan shall be installed with a rated capacity within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the exhaust fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan.

National Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5) shall be wired in such a way that activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the outdoor air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(2), and the outdoor air supply fan does not operate when the principal ventilation fan is not operating.
P/T Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5) shall be wired in such a way that activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the outdoor air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(2), and the outdoor air supply fan does not operate when the principal ventilation fan is not operating.

National Sentence Text: The outdoor air supply fan shall be connected to the outdoors through an outdoor air supply duct.
P/T Sentence Text: The outdoor air supply fan shall be connected to the outdoors through an outdoor air supply duct.

National Sentence Text: The outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(4) shall incorporate a flow-regulating damper.
P/T Sentence Text: The outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(4) shall incorporate a flow-regulating damper.

National Sentence Text: With the principal ventilation fan operating at its normal operating exhaust capacity, the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct shall be measured and the flow-regulating damper required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(5) shall be adjusted and permanently fixed so that the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct is within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the principal ventilation fan.
P/T Sentence Text: With the principal ventilation fan operating at its normal operating exhaust capacity, the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct shall be measured and the flow-regulating damper required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(5) shall be adjusted and permanently fixed so that the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct is within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the principal ventilation fan.

National Sentence Text: The airflow measurements required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(6) shall be done using a method accurate to within ±15% of the flow rate being measured.
P/T Sentence Text: The airflow measurements required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(6) shall be done using a method accurate to within ±15% of the flow rate being measured.

National Sentence Text: Except where a heat recovery ventilator is used to supply the outdoor air, the outdoor air shall be tempered to at least 12°C before being circulated to habitable spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a heat recovery ventilator is used to supply the outdoor air, the outdoor air shall be tempered to at least 12°C before being circulated to habitable spaces.

National Sentence Text: Any tempering device installed to comply with Sentence 9.32.3.5.(8) shall be installed in accordance with Articles 9.33.4.1.and 9.33.5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Any tempering device installed to comply with Sentence 9.32.3.5.(8) shall be installed in accordance with Articles 9.33.4.1.and 9.33.5.2.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.5.(11), outdoor air shall be distributed by a system of trunk and branch supply ducts, from the outdoor air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(2) to each bedroom, any storey, including basements and heated crawl spaces, without a bedroom, and if there is no storey without a bedroom, to the principal living area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.5.(11), outdoor air shall be distributed by a system of trunk and branch supply ducts, from the outdoor air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(2) to each bedroom, any storey, including basements and heated crawl spaces, without a bedroom, and if there is no storey without a bedroom, to the principal living area.

National Sentence Text: In a dwelling unit in which there is no storey without a bedroom, if an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is located in the principal living area and the principal ventilation fan has no more than 2 exhaust air intakes located in other rooms, distribution of outdoor air to the principal living area is not required.
P/T Sentence Text: In a dwelling unit in which there is no storey without a bedroom, if an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is located in the principal living area and the principal ventilation fan has no more than 2 exhaust air intakes located in other rooms, distribution of outdoor air to the principal living area is not required.

National Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with balancing dampers that can be fixed in their adjusted positions, and include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.
P/T Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with balancing dampers that can be fixed in their adjusted positions, and include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.

National Sentence Text: The air supply outlets through which outdoor air is delivered to the rooms shall be located in the ceiling or in a wall at not less than 2 m above the floor and shall be designed and installed to promote diffusion across the ceiling.
P/T Sentence Text: The air supply outlets through which outdoor air is delivered to the rooms shall be located in the ceiling or in a wall at not less than 2 m above the floor and shall be designed and installed to promote diffusion across the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for the free flow of air to or from all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing grilles in doors. (See Note A-9.32.3.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for the free flow of air to or from all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing grilles in doors.

National Sentence Text: A ventilation system with no provision for the introduction of outdoor air to the dwelling unit may only be used where the dwelling unit contains no solid-fuel-burning appliance, no fireplace of other than direct-vented type, and no other fuel-fired space- or water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types, and has a forced air distribution system with a circulation fan with a rated capacity equal to at least 5 times the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan, a supply side that complies with Sentences 9.32.3.5.(10)to 9.32.3.5.(12), and a return side that complies with Articles 9.33.6.12.and 9.33.6.13.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): A ventilation system with no provision for the introduction of outdoor air to the dwelling unit may only be used where the dwelling unit contains no solid-fuel-burning appliance, no fireplace of other than direct-vented type, and no other fuel-fired space- or water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types, and has a forced air distribution system with a circulation fan with a rated capacity equal to at least 5 times the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan, a supply side that complies with Sentences 9.32.3.5.(10) to 9.32.3.5.(12), and a return side that complies with Articles 9.33.6.12. and 9.33.6.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.6.(3), where an exhaust-only system is installed, the principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5) shall be wired in such a way that, where applicable, activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the circulation fan of the forced air distribution system required by Clause 9.32.3.6.(1)(b) at its rated capacity.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.6.(3), where an exhaust-only system is installed, the principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5) shall be wired in such a way that, where applicable, activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the circulation fan of the forced air distribution system required by Sentence 9.32.3.6.(1) at its rated capacity.

National Sentence Text: Interlocking the forced air distribution system’s circulation fan with the principal ventilation fan as required by Sentence 9.32.3.6.(2) is not required where the forced air distribution system is equipped with a control that automatically activates the circulation fan at user-selected intervals. (See Note A-9.32.3.7.)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Interlocking the forced air distribution system s circulation fan with the principal ventilation fan as required by Sentence 9.32.3.6.(2) is not required where the forced air distribution system is equipped with a control that automatically activates the circulation fan at user-selected intervals.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.32.3.7.(2)and 9.32.3.7.(3), a supplemental exhaust fan with a rated capacity not less than 50 L/s shall be installed in each kitchen.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.32.3.7.(2) and 9.32.3.7.(3), a supplemental exhaust fan with a rated capacity not less than 50 L/s shall be installed in each kitchen.

National Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan is not required in a kitchen where the only exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is located in that kitchen.
P/T Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan is not required in a kitchen where the only exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is located in that kitchen.

National Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan is not required in a kitchen where the principal ventilation fan draws from that kitchen and other rooms, provided the principal ventilation fan can be switched to a high exhaust rate equal to not less than 2.5 times the minimum normal operating exhaust capacity specified in Table 9.32.3.3., and the high exhaust rate of the principal ventilation fan, as described in Clause 9.32.3.7.(3)(a), is activated by a manual switch in the kitchen labeled "KITCHEN EXHAUST."
P/T Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan is not required in a kitchen where the principal ventilation fan draws from that kitchen and other rooms, provided the principal ventilation fan can be switched to a high exhaust rate equal to not less than 2.5 times the minimum normal operating exhaust capacity specified in Table 9.32.3.3., and the high exhaust rate of the principal ventilation fan, as described in Sentence 9.32.3.7.(3), is activated by a manual switch in the kitchen labeled "KITCHEN EXHAUST."

National Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is not located in a bathroom or water-closet room, a supplemental exhaust fan with a rated capacity not less than 25 L/s shall be installed in that bathroom or water-closet room.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is not located in a bathroom or water-closet room, a supplemental exhaust fan with a rated capacity not less than 25 L/s shall be installed in that bathroom or water-closet room.

National Sentence Text: Where the intake for a supplemental exhaust fan other than a cooking appliance exhaust fan serving a cooktop is installed in a kitchen, it shall be installed in the ceiling or on the wall at not less than 2 m above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the intake for a supplemental exhaust fan other than a cooking appliance exhaust fan serving a cooktop is installed in a kitchen, it shall be installed in the ceiling or on the wall at not less than 2 m above the floor.

National Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the fan.
P/T Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the fan.

National Sentence Text: Where a kitchen or bathroom is exempted from the requirement to install a supplemental exhaust fan by virtue of Sentences 9.32.3.7.(2)or 9.32.3.7.(3), the principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the kitchen or bathroom and wired in parallel with the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Where a kitchen or bathroom is exempted from the requirement to install a supplemental exhaust fan by virtue of Sentences 9.32.3.7.(2)or 9.32.3.7.(3), the principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the kitchen or bathroom and wired in parallel with the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5).

National Sentence Text: Where a supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(6), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control. (See Note A-9.32.3.8.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(6), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to dwelling units that contain a fuel-fired space-heating appliance or fuel-fired water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types, and ancillary spaces that contain an exhaust device, where the space is not within a dwelling unit in a house with a secondary suite and where the house with a secondary suite contains a fuel-fired space-heating appliance or fuel-fired water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to dwelling units that contain a fuel-fired space-heating appliance or fuel-fired water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types, and ancillary spaces that contain an exhaust device, where the space is not within a dwelling unit in a house with a secondary suite and where the house with a secondary suite contains a fuel-fired space-heating appliance or fuel-fired water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.32.3.8.(6)to 9.32.3.8.(8), any mechanical air exhausting device, other than the principal ventilation fan operating at a rate not greater than the maximum permitted by Table 9.32.3.3., shall be provided with outdoor makeup air supplied by a fan rated to deliver outdoor air to the dwelling unit at a rate not less than the exhaust capacity of the device, and not greater than that exhaust capacity plus 10%.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.32.3.8.(6) to 9.32.3.8.(8), any mechanical air exhausting device, other than the principal ventilation fan operating at a rate not greater than the maximum permitted by Table 9.32.3.3., shall be provided with outdoor makeup air supplied by a fan rated to deliver outdoor air to the dwelling unit at a rate not less than the exhaust capacity of the device, and not greater than that exhaust capacity plus 10%.

National Sentence Text: An outdoor makeup air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) shall be wired so that it is activated whenever the device for which it supplies outdoor makeup air is activated.
P/T Sentence Text: An outdoor makeup air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) shall be wired so that it is activated whenever the device for which it supplies outdoor makeup air is activated.

National Sentence Text: The outdoor makeup air required by Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) shall be introduced to a normally unoccupied area in the dwelling unit, or tempered to at least 12°C before being introduced to occupied areas or to a supply duct system.
P/T Sentence Text: The outdoor makeup air required by Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) shall be introduced to a normally unoccupied area in the dwelling unit, or tempered to at least 12°C before being introduced to occupied areas or to a supply duct system.

National Sentence Text: If the outdoor makeup air required by Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not tempered upstream of the supply fan, the supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) shall be approved by the manufacturer for the handling of untempered outdoor air.
P/T Sentence Text: If the outdoor makeup air required by Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not tempered upstream of the supply fan, the supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) shall be approved by the manufacturer for the handling of untempered outdoor air.

National Sentence Text: The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not required in a dwelling unit with solid-fuel-burning appliances, where all other fuel-fired appliances are direct-vented or mechanically vented.
P/T Sentence Text: The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not required in a dwelling unit with solid-fuel-burning appliances, where all other fuel-fired appliances are direct-vented or mechanically vented.

National Sentence Text: The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not required if it can be shown using the test procedures in CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.71-2005 Depressurization Test that the maximum depressurization levels to which fuel-fired space- or water-heating appliances and their venting systems will be exposed will not exceed the limits set out in CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.71-2005 Depressurization Test for the categories of fuel-fired appliances and venting systems installed in the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not required if it can be shown using the test procedures in CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.71-2005 Depressurization Test that the maximum depressurization levels to which fuel-fired space- or water-heating appliances and their venting systems will be exposed will not exceed the limits set out in CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.71-2005 Depressurization Test for the categories of fuel-fired appliances and venting systems installed in the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not required for mechanical exhausting devices operating a subfloor depressurization system installed for the purpose of reducing the risk of radon ingress. (See Note A-9.32.3.9.)
P/T Sentence Text: The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not required for mechanical exhausting devices operating a subfloor depressurization system installed for the purpose of reducing the risk of radon ingress.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to every building that contains a residential occupancy and that also contains a fuel-burning appliance, or a storage garage.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to every building that contains a residential occupancy and that also contains a fuel-burning appliance, or a storage garage.

National Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide (CO) alarms required by this Article shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-6.19-01 Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices be equipped with an integral alarm that satisfies the audibility requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-6.19-01 Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the CO alarm, where the CO alarm is powered by the dwelling unit’s electrical system, and be mechanically fixed at a height recommended by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide (CO) alarms required by this Article shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-6.19-01 Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices be equipped with an integral alarm that satisfies the audibility requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-6.19-01 Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the CO alarm, where the CO alarm is powered by the dwelling unit’s electrical system, and be mechanically fixed at a height recommended by the manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: Where a room contains a solid-fuel-burning appliance, a CO alarm conforming to CSA CAN/CSA-6.19-01 Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices shall be mechanically fixed at the manufacturer’s recommended height where these instructions specifically mention solid-fuel-burning appliances, or in the absence of specific instructions related to solid-fuel-burning appliances, on or near the ceiling.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room contains a solid-fuel-burning appliance, a CO alarm conforming to CSA CAN/CSA-6.19-01 Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices shall be mechanically fixed at the manufacturer’s recommended height where these instructions specifically mention solid-fuel-burning appliances, or in the absence of specific instructions related to solid-fuel-burning appliances, on or near the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.

National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed either inside each bedroom, or if outside, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways, in every suite of residential occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with the service room, and in the service room.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed either inside each bedroom, or if outside, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways, in every suite of residential occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with the service room, and in the service room.

National Sentence Text: For each suite of residential occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with a storage garage or that is adjacent to an attic or crawl space to which the storage garage is also adjacent, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: For each suite of residential occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with a storage garage or that is adjacent to an attic or crawl space to which the storage garage is also adjacent, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.

National Sentence Text: Where CO alarms are installed in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the CO alarms shall be wired so that the activation of any one CO alarm causes all CO alarms within the house with a secondary suite including their common spaces to sound. (See Note A-9.32.3.10.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where CO alarms are installed in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the CO alarms shall be wired so that the activation of any one CO alarm causes all CO alarms within the house with a secondary suite including their common spaces to sound.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.10.(4), capacity ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C260-M90 Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment or HVI HVI Publication 916-2013 Airflow Test Procedure
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.10.(4), capacity ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C260-M90 Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment or HVI HVI Publication 916-2013 Airflow Test Procedure

National Sentence Text: Sound ratings for fans shall be determined in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C260-M90 Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment or HVI HVI Publication 915-2013 Loudness Testing and Rating Procedure
P/T Sentence Text: Sound ratings for fans shall be determined in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C260-M90 Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment or HVI HVI Publication 915-2013 Loudness Testing and Rating Procedure

National Sentence Text: Capacity ratings for fans shall be measured at the external static pressure differentials shown in Table 9.32.3.10.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: Capacity ratings for fans shall be measured at the external static pressure differentials shown in Table 9.32.3.10.-A.

National Sentence Text: Fans in heat recovery ventilators used to provide one or more required fans shall have their airflow at normal temperature rated in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C439-09 Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators
P/T Sentence Text: Fans in heat recovery ventilators used to provide one or more required fans shall have their airflow at normal temperature rated in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C439-09 Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators

National Sentence Text: Where a heat recovery ventilator is used to provide one or more required fans, it shall have a low-temperature ventilation reduction factor of not less than 50% when tested in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C439-09 Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators at an outdoor temperature at least as low as the outdoor design temperature for the location where the ventilation system is to be installed, but the outdoor design temperature need not be lower than -25°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a heat recovery ventilator is used to provide one or more required fans, it shall have a low-temperature ventilation reduction factor of not less than 50% when tested in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C439-09 Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators at an outdoor temperature at least as low as the outdoor design temperature for the location where the ventilation system is to be installed, but the outdoor design temperature need not be lower than -25°C.

National Sentence Text: Fans, including makeup air supply fans, installed to satisfy Articles 9.32.3.3.to 9.32.3.8. with less than 1 m of duct between themselves and the visible interior surfaces of rooms other than unfinished basements, furnace rooms, utility rooms and attics, shall have a sound rating complying with Table 9.32.3.10.-B when operating at the required flow rate.
P/T Sentence Text: Fans, including makeup air supply fans, installed to satisfy Articles 9.32.3.3.to 9.32.3.8. with less than 1 m of duct between themselves and the visible interior surfaces of rooms other than unfinished basements, furnace rooms, utility rooms and attics, shall have a sound rating complying with Table 9.32.3.10.-B when operating at the required flow rate.

National Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113-10 Fans and Ventilators (See Note A-9.32.3.11.)
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113-10 Fans and Ventilators

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.11.(6), ventilation ducts and their fittings shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.33.6.2., except that exhaust ducts serving only a bathroom or water-closet room are permitted to be of combustible material, provided they are reasonably airtight and constructed of a material impervious to water.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.11.(6), ventilation ducts and their fittings shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.33.6.2., except that exhaust ducts serving only a bathroom or water-closet room are permitted to be of combustible material, provided they are reasonably airtight and constructed of a material impervious to water.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts shall not discharge into heated or unheated enclosed spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts shall not discharge into heated or unheated enclosed spaces.

National Sentence Text: Where an exhaust duct passes through an unheated space or is not separated from an unheated space by an insulated building assembly, the duct shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exhaust duct passes through an unheated space or is not separated from an unheated space by an insulated building assembly, the duct shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5.

National Sentence Text: Where a duct carrying outdoor air that is not tempered and not mixed with indoor air passes through heated space, it shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5, and provided with a vapour barrier.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a duct carrying outdoor air that is not tempered and not mixed with indoor air passes through heated space, it shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5, and provided with a vapour barrier.

National Sentence Text: All exhaust intakes located within 3 m horizontally of a cooktop shall be equipped with a grease filter at the intake end.
P/T Sentence Text: All exhaust intakes located within 3 m horizontally of a cooktop shall be equipped with a grease filter at the intake end.

National Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, lead directly to the outdoors with no connections to other exhaust fans or ducts, and be equipped with a grease filter at the intake end.
P/T Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, lead directly to the outdoors with no connections to other exhaust fans or ducts, and be equipped with a grease filter at the intake end.

National Sentence Text: All ductwork shall be installed to avoid crushing and shall be permanently supported to prevent sagging.
P/T Sentence Text: All ductwork shall be installed to avoid crushing and shall be permanently supported to prevent sagging.

National Sentence Text: Joints in all ventilation system ducting shall be sealed with mastic, metal foil duct tape or the manufacturers’ specified sealants.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints in all ventilation system ducting shall be sealed with mastic, metal foil duct tape or the manufacturers’ specified sealants.

National Sentence Text: Except where the size of a duct can be determined using Table 9.32.3.11.-A or Table 9.32.3.11.-B, duct sizes shall be determined according to Subsection 9.33.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the size of a duct can be determined using Table 9.32.3.11.-A or Table 9.32.3.11.-B, duct sizes shall be determined according to part 9.

National Sentence Text: In using Table 9.32.3.11.-A, when sizing branch ducts, "maximum length of duct" refers to the physical length of the duct from the interior grille served by that branch duct to the exterior hood, when sizing a trunk duct, "maximum length of duct" refers to the physical length of the duct from the interior grille of the longest branch served by that trunk to the exterior hood, outdoor air supply ducts shall be sized as trunk ducts, "maximum airflow in duct" refers to the maximum airflow rate that a given section of duct (branch or must provide to satisfy the ventilation system design, and "fan’s external static pressure" refers to the external static pressure at which the fan is rated to achieve the maximum airflow rate that the fan is required or intended to provide.
P/T Sentence Text: In using Table 9.32.3.11.-A, when sizing branch ducts, "maximum length of duct" refers to the physical length of the duct from the interior grille served by that branch duct to the exterior hood, when sizing a trunk duct, "maximum length of duct" refers to the physical length of the duct from the interior grille of the longest branch served by that trunk to the exterior hood, outdoor air supply ducts shall be sized as trunk ducts, "maximum airflow in duct" refers to the maximum airflow rate that a given section of duct (branch or must provide to satisfy the ventilation system design, and "fan’s external static pressure" refers to the external static pressure at which the fan is rated to achieve the maximum airflow rate that the fan is required or intended to provide.

National Sentence Text: Where flexible duct is used, it may be sized by choosing the next higher diameter in Table 9.32.3.11.-A or by choosing the diameter for a duct twice as long as the actual length.
P/T Sentence Text: Where flexible duct is used, it may be sized by choosing the next higher diameter in Table 9.32.3.11.-A or by choosing the diameter for a duct twice as long as the actual length.

National Sentence Text: Where rectangular duct is used in place of round duct, it shall be selected according to Table 9.32.3.11.-B. (See Note A-9.32.3.12.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where rectangular duct is used in place of round duct, it shall be selected according to Table 9.32.3.11.-B.

National Sentence Text: This Article shall apply to heat recovery ventilators installed to provide one or more of the fans required by this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article shall apply to heat recovery ventilators installed to provide one or more of the fans required by this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel airflow to a common air supply duct, unless specifically permitted by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel airflow to a common air supply duct, unless specifically permitted by the manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel airflow to a common downstream exhaust duct.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel airflow to a common downstream exhaust duct.

National Sentence Text: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer, including air balancing and airflow determination, shall be followed.
P/T Sentence Text: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer, including air balancing and airflow determination, shall be followed.

National Sentence Text: A means for the free flow of condensate shall be provided in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations or, in their absence, a condensate drain of at least 1/2 inch nominal pipe size pitched in the direction of flow and complete with a trap or condensate pump of sufficient capacity shall be installed and connected to the dwelling unit’s drain, waste and vent system.
P/T Sentence Text: A means for the free flow of condensate shall be provided in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations or, in their absence, a condensate drain of at least 1/2 inch nominal pipe size pitched in the direction of flow and complete with a trap or condensate pump of sufficient capacity shall be installed and connected to the dwelling unit’s drain, waste and vent system.

National Sentence Text: The heat recovery ventilator and all condensate lines shall be installed in a space where the ambient temperature will not adversely affect the operation of the system.
P/T Sentence Text: The heat recovery ventilator and all condensate lines shall be installed in a space where the ambient temperature will not adversely affect the operation of the system.

National Sentence Text: Intake openings shall be located so as to avoid contamination of the ventilation air from other local sources such as automobile exhaust and exhaust from the building or adjacent buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Intake openings shall be located so as to avoid contamination of the ventilation air from other local sources such as automobile exhaust and exhaust from the building or adjacent buildings.

National Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.

National Sentence Text: The distance separating air intakes from building envelope penetrations that are potential sources of contaminants, such as gas vents or oil fill pipes, shall be not less than 900 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance separating air intakes from building envelope penetrations that are potential sources of contaminants, such as gas vents or oil fill pipes, shall be not less than 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: Air intakes shall be clearly labeled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Air intakes shall be clearly labeled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where air intake and exhaust openings are in exposed locations, provision shall be made to protect them from the entry of precipitation by the use of louvres, weather cowls or other suitable protection.
P/T Sentence Text: Where air intake and exhaust openings are in exposed locations, provision shall be made to protect them from the entry of precipitation by the use of louvres, weather cowls or other suitable protection.

National Sentence Text: Air intake openings shall incorporate screens or grilles to protect against the entry of animals and insects.
P/T Sentence Text: Air intake openings shall incorporate screens or grilles to protect against the entry of animals and insects.

National Sentence Text: Except for exhaust outlets serving heat recovery ventilators, exhaust outlets shall incorporate backdraft dampers.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for exhaust outlets serving heat recovery ventilators, exhaust outlets shall incorporate backdraft dampers.

National Sentence Text: An exhaust outlet that does not incorporate a backdraft damper located at the building envelope shall incorporate a screen located at the building envelope to protect against the entry of animals.
P/T Sentence Text: An exhaust outlet that does not incorporate a backdraft damper located at the building envelope shall incorporate a screen located at the building envelope to protect against the entry of animals.

National Sentence Text: Screens, grilles and filters installed in air intake and exhaust openings shall be easily removable for cleaning purposes, without the need for special tools.
P/T Sentence Text: Screens, grilles and filters installed in air intake and exhaust openings shall be easily removable for cleaning purposes, without the need for special tools.

National Sentence Text: Where screens or grilles are installed in air intake and exhaust openings, the net free area of the air intake or exhaust opening shall be equal to or greater than the required cross-sectional area of the duct served or such openings shall comply with Table 9.32.3.13.
P/T Sentence Text: Where screens or grilles are installed in air intake and exhaust openings, the net free area of the air intake or exhaust opening shall be equal to or greater than the required cross-sectional area of the duct served or such openings shall comply with Table 9.32.3.13.

National Sentence Text: Screens and grilles shall be of corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Screens and grilles shall be of corrosion-resistant material.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to the design and installation of heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, and air-conditioning systems serving only one dwelling unit, and radiant heating systems in houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to the design and installation of heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, and air-conditioning systems serving only one dwelling unit, and radiant heating systems in houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.

National Sentence Text: The design and installation of heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, and air-conditioning systems other than those described in Sentence 9.33.1.1.(1) shall conform to Part 6.. (See Note A-9.33.1.1.(2) and Subsection 9.10.10.)
P/T Sentence Text: The design and installation of heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, and air-conditioning systems other than those described in Sentence 9.33.1.1.(1) shall conform to part 6.. (See Note A-9.33.1.1.(2) and part 9.)

National Sentence Text: Air duct distribution systems serving one of the dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite shall not be directly interconnected with other parts of the house.
P/T Sentence Text: Air duct distribution systems serving one of the dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite shall not be directly interconnected with other parts of the house.

National Sentence Text: Systems used for heating and air-conditioning shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.
P/T Sentence Text: Systems used for heating and air-conditioning shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in part 9.
Provisions for access to roof-mounted heating, ventilating and air-conditioning equipment shall conform to the requirements of Article 3.6.4.7.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Provisions for access to roof-mounted heating, ventilating and air-conditioning equipment shall conform to the requirements of Article 3.6.4.7.
