National Sentence Text: Residential buildings intended for use in the winter months on a continuing basis shall be equipped with heating facilities conforming to this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Residential buildings intended for use in the winter months on a continuing basis shall be equipped with heating facilities conforming to this Section.

National Sentence Text: At the outside winter design temperature, required heating facilities shall be capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature of not less than 22°C in all living spaces, 18°C in unfinished basements, 18°C in common service rooms, ancillary spaces and exits in houses with a secondary suite, and 15°C in heated crawl spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: At the outside winter design temperature, required heating facilities shall be capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature of not less than 22°C in all living spaces, 18°C in unfinished basements, 18°C in common service rooms, ancillary spaces and exits in houses with a secondary suite, and 15°C in heated crawl spaces.

National Sentence Text: The outdoor conditions to be used in designing heating and air-conditioning systems shall be determined in conformance with Article 1.1.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: The outdoor conditions to be used in designing heating and air-conditioning systems shall be determined in conformance with Article 1.1.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Heating and air-conditioning systems, including ducting, and mechanical heating and refrigeration equipment, shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to the relevant provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI SAR-G1 HRAI Digest the CHC Handbook on Hydronic Heating Systems, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA Manuals. (See also Subsection 9.32.3. for the design of systems that also provide ventilation.)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Heating and air-conditioning systems, including ducting, and mechanical heating and refrigeration equipment, shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to the relevant provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI SAR-G1 HRAI Digest the CHC Handbook on Hydronic Heating Systems, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA Manuals. (See also part 9. for the design of systems that also provide ventilation.)
P/T Sentence Text: Heating and air-conditioning systems, including ducting, and mechanical heating and refrigeration equipment, shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI Digest, the CHC Handbook on Hydronic Heating Systems, the Hydronics Institute Manuals, the SMACNA Manuals, and CSA B214-16 Installation Code for Hydronic Heating Systems
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Heating and air-conditioning systems, including ducting, and mechanical heating and refrigeration equipment, shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI Digest, the CHC Handbook on Hydronic Heating Systems, the Hydronics Institute Manuals, the SMACNA Manuals, and CSA B214-16 Installation Code for Hydronic Heating Systems

National Sentence Text: The installation of a hydronic heating system shall conform to applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, to CSA B214-16 Installation Code for Hydronic Heating Systems
Where a single heating system serves a house with a secondary suite, individual temperature controls shall be provided in each dwelling unit served by the system. (See Note A-9.33.4.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a single heating system serves a house with a secondary suite, individual temperature controls shall be provided in each dwelling unit served by the system. (See Note A-9.33.4.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Equipment forming part of a heating or air-conditioning system, with the exception of embedded pipes or ducts, shall be installed with provision for access for inspection, maintenance, repair and cleaning.
P/T Sentence Text: Equipment forming part of a heating or air-conditioning system, with the exception of embedded pipes or ducts, shall be installed with provision for access for inspection, maintenance, repair and cleaning.

National Sentence Text: Equipment forming part of a heating or air-conditioning system that may be adversely affected by freezing temperatures and that is located in an unheated area shall be protected from freezing.
P/T Sentence Text: Equipment forming part of a heating or air-conditioning system that may be adversely affected by freezing temperatures and that is located in an unheated area shall be protected from freezing.

National Sentence Text: Heating and cooling systems shall be designed to allow for expansion and contraction of the heat transfer fluid and to maintain the system pressure within the rated working pressure limits of all components of the system.
P/T Sentence Text: Heating and cooling systems shall be designed to allow for expansion and contraction of the heat transfer fluid and to maintain the system pressure within the rated working pressure limits of all components of the system.

National Sentence Text: Mechanical systems and equipment shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum amount of structural movement provided for in the construction of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical systems and equipment shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum amount of structural movement provided for in the construction of the building.

National Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, heating and air-conditioning equipment with fuel or power connections shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement. (See Note A-9.31.6.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, heating and air-conditioning equipment with fuel or power connections shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement. (See Note A-9.31.6.2.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Asbestos shall not be used in air distribution systems or equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Asbestos shall not be used in air distribution systems or equipment.

National Sentence Text: Systems serving garages, and systems serving other occupied parts of a dwelling unit but located in or running through a garage, shall be designed and constructed in a manner such that means are not provided for the transfer of contaminants from the garage into other spaces in the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Systems serving garages, and systems serving other occupied parts of a dwelling unit but located in or running through a garage, shall be designed and constructed in a manner such that means are not provided for the transfer of contaminants from the garage into other spaces in the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The required capacity of heating appliances located in a dwelling unit and serving only that dwelling unit, shall be determined in accordance with CSA F280-12 Determining the Required Capacity of Residential Space Heating and Cooling Appliances except that the design temperatures shall conform to Subsection 9.33.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The required capacity of heating appliances located in a dwelling unit and serving only that dwelling unit, shall be determined in accordance with CSA F280-12 Determining the Required Capacity of Residential Space Heating and Cooling Appliances except that the design temperatures shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.33.5.3.and 9.33.5.4., the installation of heating and air-conditioning equipment, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, and including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, to CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code CSA B52-13 Mechanical Refrigeration Code CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I or CSA C448 Series-13 Design and Installation of Earth Energy Systems (See also Sentence 9.33.5.3.(1).) (See Note A-9.33.5.3.)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Articles 9.33.5.3. and 9.33.5.4., the installation of heating and air-conditioning equipment, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, and including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, to CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code CSA B52-13 Mechanical Refrigeration Code CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I or CSA C448 Series-13 Design and Installation of Earth Energy Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.33.5.3. and 9.33.5.4., the installation of heating and air-conditioning equipment, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, and including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to the Pressure Equipment Safety Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, CSA B52-13 Mechanical Refrigeration Code CSA B139 Series-15 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment the Gas Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, or CSA C448 Series-13 Design and Installation of Earth Energy Systems
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Articles 9.33.5.3. and 9.33.5.4., the installation of heating and air-conditioning equipment, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, and including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to the Pressure Equipment Safety Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, CSA B52-13 Mechanical Refrigeration Code CSA B139 Series-15 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment the Gas Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, or CSA C448 Series-13 Design and Installation of Earth Energy Systems

National Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation, including the provision of combustion air, of solid-fuel-burning appliances and equipment, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, shall conform to CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation, including the provision of combustion air, of solid-fuel-burning appliances and equipment, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, shall conform to CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment

National Sentence Text: Fireplaces shall conform to Section 9.22.
P/T Sentence Text: Fireplaces shall conform to part 9.
Combustion air intake inlets shall be located on the outside of the building and not within an attic or roof space or a crawl space.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Combustion air intake inlets shall be located on the outside of the building and not within an attic or roof space or a crawl space.

National Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating systems in which the rated heat input does not exceed 120 kW shall conform to this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating systems in which the rated heat input does not exceed 120 kW shall conform to this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Air duct distribution systems in which the rated heat input exceeds 120 kW shall conform to Part 6. and Subsection 3.6.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Air duct distribution systems in which the rated heat input exceeds 120 kW shall conform to part 6. and part 3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.33.6.2.(2)to 9.33.6.2.(6) and in Article 3.6.4.3., all ducts, duct connectors, associated fittings and plenums used in air duct systems shall be constructed of steel, aluminum alloy, copper, clay or similar noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.33.6.2.(2) to 9.33.6.2.(6) and in Article 3.6.4.3., all ducts, duct connectors, associated fittings and plenums used in air duct systems shall be constructed of steel, aluminum alloy, copper, clay or similar noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Ducts, associated fittings and plenums are permitted to contain combustible material provided they conform to the appropriate requirements for Class 1 duct materials in ULC CAN/ULC-S110-13 Test for Air Ducts conform to Article 3.1.5.18. and Subsection 3.1.9., are not used in vertical runs serving more than 2 storeys, and are not used in air duct systems in which the air temperature may exceed 120°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Ducts, associated fittings and plenums are permitted to contain combustible material provided they conform to the appropriate requirements for Class 1 duct materials in ULC CAN/ULC-S110-13 Test for Air Ducts conform to Article 3.1.5.18. and part 3., are not used in vertical runs serving more than 2 storeys, and are not used in air duct systems in which the air temperature may exceed 120°C.

National Sentence Text: Duct sealants shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25 and a smoke developed classification of not more than 50.
P/T Sentence Text: Duct sealants shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25 and a smoke developed classification of not more than 50.

National Sentence Text: Duct connectors that contain combustible materials and that are used between ducts and air outlet units shall conform to the appropriate requirements for Class 1 air duct materials in ULC CAN/ULC-S110-13 Test for Air Ducts be limited to 4 m in length, be used only in horizontal runs, and not penetrate required fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Duct connectors that contain combustible materials and that are used between ducts and air outlet units shall conform to the appropriate requirements for Class 1 air duct materials in ULC CAN/ULC-S110-13 Test for Air Ducts be limited to 4 m in length, be used only in horizontal runs, and not penetrate required fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Combustible ducts that are part of a duct system carrying only ventilation air and that are contained entirely within a dwelling unit need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 9.33.6.2.(1)to 9.33.6.2.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible ducts that are part of a duct system carrying only ventilation air and that are contained entirely within a dwelling unit need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 9.33.6.2.(1)to 9.33.6.2.(4).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.33.6.13.(2)and 9.33.6.13.(3), ducts that are part of a return-air duct system and that are contained entirely within a dwelling unit need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 9.33.6.2.(1)to 9.33.6.2.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.33.6.13.(2) and 9.33.6.13.(3), ducts that are part of a return-air duct system and that are contained entirely within a dwelling unit need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 9.33.6.2.(1)to 9.33.6.2.(4).

National Sentence Text: Materials referred to in Sentences 9.33.6.2.(1)to 9.33.6.2.(6), when used in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture, shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet, and be corrosion-resistant.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials referred to in Sentences 9.33.6.2.(1) to 9.33.6.2.(6), when used in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture, shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet, and be corrosion-resistant.

National Sentence Text: Tape used for sealing duct joints in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall meet the flame-resistance requirements for fabric in ULC CAN/ULC-S109-14 Flame Tests of Flame-Resistant Fabrics and Films
P/T Sentence Text: Tape used for sealing duct joints in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall meet the flame-resistance requirements for fabric in ULC CAN/ULC-S109-14 Flame Tests of Flame-Resistant Fabrics and Films

National Sentence Text: Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation of air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall be of noncombustible material when exposed to heated air or radiation from heat sources that would result in the exposed surface exceeding a temperature of 120°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation of air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall be of noncombustible material when exposed to heated air or radiation from heat sources that would result in the exposed surface exceeding a temperature of 120°C.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.6.4.(3), when combustible coverings and linings, including associated adhesives and insulation, are used, they shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25 on any exposed surface or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, and a smoke developed classification of not more than 50.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.6.4.(3), when combustible coverings and linings, including associated adhesives and insulation, are used, they shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25 on any exposed surface or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, and a smoke developed classification of not more than 50.

National Sentence Text: The outer covering of ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems used within an assembly of combustible construction are permitted to have an exposed surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, and a smoke developed classification greater than 50.
P/T Sentence Text: The outer covering of ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems used within an assembly of combustible construction are permitted to have an exposed surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, and a smoke developed classification greater than 50.

National Sentence Text: Combustible coverings and linings described in Sentences 9.33.6.4.(2), 9.33.6.4.(3)and 9.33.6.4.(6) shall not flame, glow, smoulder or smoke when tested in accordance with the method of test in ASTM C 411-11 Hot-Surface Performance of High-Temperature Thermal Insulation at the maximum temperature to which the coverings and linings are to be exposed in service.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible coverings and linings described in Sentences 9.33.6.4.(2) , 9.33.6.4.(3)and 9.33.6.4.(6) shall not flame, glow, smoulder or smoke when tested in accordance with the method of test in ASTM C 411-11 Hot-Surface Performance of High-Temperature Thermal Insulation at the maximum temperature to which the coverings and linings are to be exposed in service.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.33.6.4.(6)and 9.33.6.4.(7), foamed plastic insulation shall not be used as part of an air duct or for insulating an air duct.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.33.6.4.(6) and 9.33.6.4.(7) , foamed plastic insulation shall not be used as part of an air duct or for insulating an air duct.

National Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation conforming to Article 9.25.2.2. is permitted to be used to insulate a galvanized steel, stainless steel or aluminum air duct, provided the foamed plastic insulation applied to supply ductwork is not less than 3 m from the furnace bonnet, the temperature within the ductwork where the insulation is installed is not greater than 50°C, duct joints are taped with a product conforming to Sentence 9.33.6.3.(1), return air plenums are separated from the foamed plastic insulation, and the foamed plastic insulation is protected by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections 9.29.4.to 9.29.9., provided the building does not contain a Group C major occupancy, by sheet metal that is mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, is not less than 0.38 mm thick and has a melting point of 650°C or more, or by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.15.(2)(e).
P/T Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation conforming to Article 9.25.2.2. is permitted to be used to insulate a galvanized steel, stainless steel or aluminum air duct, provided the foamed plastic insulation applied to supply ductwork is not less than 3 m from the furnace bonnet, the temperature within the ductwork where the insulation is installed is not greater than 50°C, duct joints are taped with a product conforming to Sentence 9.33.6.3.(1), return air plenums are separated from the foamed plastic insulation, and the foamed plastic insulation is protected by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections 9.to 9., provided the building does not contain a Group C major occupancy, by sheet metal that is mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, is not less than 0.38 mm thick and has a melting point of 650°C or more, or by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.15.(2).

National Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation is permitted to be used in a ceiling space that acts as a return air plenum provided the foamed plastic insulation is protected from exposure to the plenum in accordance with Sentence 3.1.5.14.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Foamed plastic insulation is permitted to be used in a ceiling space that acts as a return air plenum provided the foamed plastic insulation is protected from exposure to the plenum in accordance with Sentence 3.1.5.14.(4).

National Sentence Text: Combustible coverings and linings of ducts, including associated adhesives and insulation, shall be interrupted at the immediate area of operation of heat sources in a duct system, such as electric resistance heaters or fuel-burning heaters or furnaces, and where the duct penetrates a fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible coverings and linings of ducts, including associated adhesives and insulation, shall be interrupted at the immediate area of operation of heat sources in a duct system, such as electric resistance heaters or fuel-burning heaters or furnaces, and where the duct penetrates a fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Linings of ducts shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers or of fire dampers, fire stop flaps and other closures.
P/T Sentence Text: Linings of ducts shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers or of fire dampers, fire stop flaps and other closures.

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel or aluminum supply ducts shall conform to Table 9.33.6.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel or aluminum supply ducts shall conform to Table 9.33.6.5.

National Sentence Text: The design of fittings for ducts shall conform to SMACNA ANSI/SMACNA 006-2006 HVAC Duct Construction Standards – Metal and Flexible except that metal thicknesses shall conform to Table 9.33.6.5.
P/T Sentence Text: The design of fittings for ducts shall conform to SMACNA ANSI/SMACNA 006-2006 HVAC Duct Construction Standards – Metal and Flexible except that metal thicknesses shall conform to Table 9.33.6.5.

National Sentence Text: Where the installation of heating supply ducts in walls and floors creates a space between the duct and construction material, the space shall be fire stopped with noncombustible material at each end.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the installation of heating supply ducts in walls and floors creates a space between the duct and construction material, the space shall be fire stopped with noncombustible material at each end.

National Sentence Text: Ducts shall be securely supported by metal hangers, straps, lugs or brackets, except that, where zero clearance is permitted, wooden brackets are permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Ducts shall be securely supported by metal hangers, straps, lugs or brackets, except that, where zero clearance is permitted, wooden brackets are permitted to be used.

National Sentence Text: All round duct joints shall be tight-fitting and lapped not less than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: All round duct joints shall be tight-fitting and lapped not less than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Rectangular duct connections shall be made with S and drive cleats or equivalent mechanical connections.
P/T Sentence Text: Rectangular duct connections shall be made with S and drive cleats or equivalent mechanical connections.

National Sentence Text: Duct systems shall have no openings other than those required for the proper operation and maintenance of the system.
P/T Sentence Text: Duct systems shall have no openings other than those required for the proper operation and maintenance of the system.

National Sentence Text: Air duct systems serving garages shall not be interconnected with other parts of the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Air duct systems serving garages shall not be interconnected with other parts of the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Trunk supply ducts shall not be nailed directly to wood members.
P/T Sentence Text: Trunk supply ducts shall not be nailed directly to wood members.

National Sentence Text: Branch ducts shall be supported at suitable spacings to maintain alignment and prevent sagging.
P/T Sentence Text: Branch ducts shall be supported at suitable spacings to maintain alignment and prevent sagging.

National Sentence Text: Ducts passing through unheated spaces shall have all joints taped or otherwise sealed to ensure that the ducts are airtight throughout their length.
P/T Sentence Text: Ducts passing through unheated spaces shall have all joints taped or otherwise sealed to ensure that the ducts are airtight throughout their length.

National Sentence Text: Combustible ducts in concrete slabs-on-ground that are connected to a furnace supply plenum shall be located not closer than 600 mm to that plenum and not less than 600 mm from its connection to a riser or register.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible ducts in concrete slabs-on-ground that are connected to a furnace supply plenum shall be located not closer than 600 mm to that plenum and not less than 600 mm from its connection to a riser or register.

National Sentence Text: Ducts in or beneath concrete slabs-on-ground shall be watertight and corrosion-, decay-, and mildew-resistant.
P/T Sentence Text: Ducts in or beneath concrete slabs-on-ground shall be watertight and corrosion-, decay-, and mildew-resistant.

National Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall be constructed to provide interior drainage from and access to all low points, and not be connected directly to a sewer.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall be constructed to provide interior drainage from and access to all low points, and not be connected directly to a sewer.

National Sentence Text: The clearance of furnaceplenums from combustible material shall conform to the appropriate standards in Sentence 9.33.5.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance of furnaceplenums from combustible material shall conform to the appropriate standards in Sentence 9.33.5.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: Where the plenum clearance required in Sentence 9.33.6.8.(1) is 75 mm or less, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be equal to the required plenum clearance within 450 mm of the plenum, and be not less than 12 mm at a distance of 450 mm or more from the plenum, except that this clearance may be reduced to zero beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the supply duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(2).) (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the plenum clearance required in Sentence 9.33.6.8.(1) is 75 mm or less, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be equal to the required plenum clearance within 450 mm of the plenum, and be not less than 12 mm at a distance of 450 mm or more from the plenum, except that this clearance may be reduced to zero beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the supply duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Where the plenum clearance required in Sentence 9.33.6.8.(1) is more than 75 mm but not more than 150 mm, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be equal to the required plenum clearance within a horizontal distance of 1.8 m of the plenum, and not less than 12 mm at a horizontal distance of 1.8 m or more from the plenum, except that this distance may be reduced to zero beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(3).) (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the plenum clearance required in Sentence 9.33.6.8.(1) is more than 75 mm but not more than 150 mm, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be equal to the required plenum clearance within a horizontal distance of 1.8 m of the plenum, and not less than 12 mm at a horizontal distance of 1.8 m or more from the plenum, except that this distance may be reduced to zero beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Where the plenum clearance required in Sentence 9.33.6.8.(1) is more than 150 mm, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be equal to the required plenum clearance within a horizontal distance of 1 m of the plenum, not less than 150 mm within a horizontal distance between 1 m and 1.8 m from the plenum, and not less than 25 mm at a horizontal distance of 1.8 m or more from the plenum, except that this distance may be reduced to 8 mm beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the supply duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(4).) (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the plenum clearance required in Sentence 9.33.6.8.(1) is more than 150 mm, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be equal to the required plenum clearance within a horizontal distance of 1 m of the plenum, not less than 150 mm within a horizontal distance between 1 m and 1.8 m from the plenum, and not less than 25 mm at a horizontal distance of 1.8 m or more from the plenum, except that this distance may be reduced to 8 mm beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the supply duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Where a register is installed in a floor directly over a pipeless furnace, a double-walled register box with not less than 100 mm between walls, or a register box with the warm-air passage completely surrounded by the cold-air passage, shall be permitted in lieu of the clearances listed in Sentences 9.33.6.8.(2), 9.33.6.8.(3)and 9.33.6.8.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Where a register is installed in a floor directly over a pipeless furnace, a double-walled register box with not less than 100 mm between walls, or a register box with the warm-air passage completely surrounded by the cold-air passage, shall be permitted in lieu of the clearances listed in Sentences 9.33.6.8.(2), 9.33.6.8.(3)and 9.33.6.8.(4).

National Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with adjustable dampers and fitted with devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.
P/T Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with adjustable dampers and fitted with devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.

National Sentence Text: Supply outlets and return openings in the dwelling unit, when located less than 2 m above the floor, shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diam sphere.
P/T Sentence Text: Supply outlets and return openings in the dwelling unit, when located less than 2 m above the floor, shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diam sphere.

National Sentence Text: Combustible grilles, diffusers and other devices for the supply and return air openings installed in walls and ceilings shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than 200 in bathrooms, and not more than 150 in rooms or spaces other than bathrooms.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible grilles, diffusers and other devices for the supply and return air openings installed in walls and ceilings shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than 200 in bathrooms, and not more than 150 in rooms or spaces other than bathrooms.

National Sentence Text: In a dwelling unit, a warm-air supply outlet shall be provided in each finished room that is located adjacent to unheated space.
P/T Sentence Text: In a dwelling unit, a warm-air supply outlet shall be provided in each finished room that is located adjacent to unheated space.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.6.11.(3), when a room described in Sentence 9.33.6.11.(1) is located adjacent to exterior walls, such outlet shall be located so as to bathe at least one exterior wall or window with warm air, except in bathrooms, utility rooms or kitchens, where this may not be practical.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.6.11.(3), when a room described in Sentence 9.33.6.11.(1) is located adjacent to exterior walls, such outlet shall be located so as to bathe at least one exterior wall or window with warm air, except in bathrooms, utility rooms or kitchens, where this may not be practical.

National Sentence Text: Where the heating system is also designed to provide ventilation air, ceiling outlets or outlets located high on interior walls are permitted to be installed, provided the outlets are designed for this purpose and are installed with diffusers.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the heating system is also designed to provide ventilation air, ceiling outlets or outlets located high on interior walls are permitted to be installed, provided the outlets are designed for this purpose and are installed with diffusers.

National Sentence Text: At least one warm-air supply outlet shall be provided for each 40 m2 of floor surface area in unfinished basements serving dwelling units, and it shall be located so as to provide adequate distribution of warm air throughout the basement.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one warm-air supply outlet shall be provided for each 40 m2 of floor surface area in unfinished basements serving dwelling units, and it shall be located so as to provide adequate distribution of warm air throughout the basement.

National Sentence Text: At least one warm-air supply outlet shall be provided for each 80 m2 of floor surface area in heated crawl spaces serving dwelling units, and it shall be located so as to provide adequate distribution of warm air throughout the crawl space.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one warm-air supply outlet shall be provided for each 80 m2 of floor surface area in heated crawl spaces serving dwelling units, and it shall be located so as to provide adequate distribution of warm air throughout the crawl space.

National Sentence Text: Except for pipeless furnaces, the capacity of warm-air supply outlets serving dwelling units shall be not less than the design heat loss from the area served and shall not exceed 3 kW per outlet.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for pipeless furnaces, the capacity of warm-air supply outlets serving dwelling units shall be not less than the design heat loss from the area served and shall not exceed 3 kW per outlet.

National Sentence Text: In basements and heated crawl spaces, the calculated heat gain from the supply ducts and plenum surfaces is permitted to be considered in calculating the design heat loss.
P/T Sentence Text: In basements and heated crawl spaces, the calculated heat gain from the supply ducts and plenum surfaces is permitted to be considered in calculating the design heat loss.

National Sentence Text: The temperature of supply air at warm-air supply outlets shall not exceed 70°C.
P/T Sentence Text: The temperature of supply air at warm-air supply outlets shall not exceed 70°C.

National Sentence Text: Warm-air supply outlets located in finished areas shall be provided with diffusers and adjustable openings and shall not be located on a furnaceplenum.
P/T Sentence Text: Warm-air supply outlets located in finished areas shall be provided with diffusers and adjustable openings and shall not be located on a furnace plenum.

National Sentence Text: Return-air inlets shall not be installed in an enclosed room or crawl space that provides combustion air to a furnace.
P/T Sentence Text: Return-air inlets shall not be installed in an enclosed room or crawl space that provides combustion air to a furnace.

National Sentence Text: Except for unfinished areas and floor levels which are less than 900 mm above or below an adjacent floor level which is provided with a return-air inlet, at least one return-air inlet shall be provided in each floor level in a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for unfinished areas and floor levels which are less than 900 mm above or below an adjacent floor level which is provided with a return-air inlet, at least one return-air inlet shall be provided in each floor level in a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for the return of air from all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing return duct inlets. (See Note A-9.33.6.13.)
P/T Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for the return of air from all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing return duct inlets.

National Sentence Text: The return-air system shall be designed to handle the entire air supply.
P/T Sentence Text: The return-air system shall be designed to handle the entire air supply.

National Sentence Text: Where any part of a return duct will be exposed to radiation from the furnace heat exchanger or other radiating part within the furnace, such part of a return duct directly above or within 600 mm of the outside furnace casing shall be noncombustible.
P/T Sentence Text: Where any part of a return duct will be exposed to radiation from the furnace heat exchanger or other radiating part within the furnace, such part of a return duct directly above or within 600 mm of the outside furnace casing shall be noncombustible.

National Sentence Text: Return ducts serving solid-fuel-burning furnaces shall be constructed of noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: Return ducts serving solid-fuel-burning furnaces shall be constructed of noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Combustiblereturn ducts shall be lined with noncombustible material below floor registers, at the bottom of vertical ducts, and under furnaces having a bottom return.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible return ducts shall be lined with noncombustible material below floor registers, at the bottom of vertical ducts, and under furnaces having a bottom return.

National Sentence Text: Spaces between studs or joists used as return ducts shall be separated from the unused portions of such spaces by tight-fitting metal stops or wood blocking.
P/T Sentence Text: Spaces between studs or joists used as return ducts shall be separated from the unused portions of such spaces by tight-fitting metal stops or wood blocking.

National Sentence Text: A vertical return duct shall have openings to return air on not more than one floor.
P/T Sentence Text: A vertical return duct shall have openings to return air on not more than one floor.

National Sentence Text: The return-air system shall be designed so that the negative pressure from the circulating fan cannot affect the furnace combustion air supply, nor draw combustion products from joints or openings in the furnace or flue pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: The return-air system shall be designed so that the negative pressure from the circulating fan cannot affect the furnace combustion air supply, nor draw combustion products from joints or openings in the furnace or flue pipe.

National Sentence Text: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S111-13 Fire Tests for Air Filter Units
P/T Sentence Text: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S111-13 Fire Tests for Air Filter Units

National Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or, in dwelling units, when the furnace circulation fan is not operating.
P/T Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or, in dwelling units, when the furnace circulation fan is not operating.

National Sentence Text: When odour removal equipment of the adsorption type is used it shall be installed to provide access so that adsorption material can be reactivated or renewed, and protected from dust accumulation by air filters installed on the inlet side.
P/T Sentence Text: When odour removal equipment of the adsorption type is used it shall be installed to provide access so that adsorption material can be reactivated or renewed, and protected from dust accumulation by air filters installed on the inlet side.

National Sentence Text: Every steam or hot water radiator and convector located in a recess or concealed space or attached to the face of a wall of combustible construction shall be provided with a noncombustible lining or backing.
P/T Sentence Text: Every steam or hot water radiator and convector located in a recess or concealed space or attached to the face of a wall of combustible construction shall be provided with a noncombustible lining or backing.

National Sentence Text: The exposed surface temperature of a steam or hot water radiator shall not exceed 70°C unless precautions are taken to prevent human contact.
P/T Sentence Text: The exposed surface temperature of a steam or hot water radiator shall not exceed 70°C unless precautions are taken to prevent human contact.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be made from materials designed to withstand the effects of temperatures and pressures that may occur in the system. (See Articles 3.1.5.19., 3.1.9.1.and 9.10.9.6. for fire safety requirements.)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be made from materials designed to withstand the effects of temperatures and pressures that may occur in the system. (See Articles 3.1.5.19., 3.1.9.1. and 9.10.9.6. for fire safety requirements.)

National Sentence Text: Every pipe used in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be installed to allow for expansion and contraction due to temperature changes.
P/T Sentence Text: Every pipe used in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be installed to allow for expansion and contraction due to temperature changes.

National Sentence Text: Supports and anchors for piping in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be designed and installed to ensure that undue stress is not placed on the supporting structure.
P/T Sentence Text: Supports and anchors for piping in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be designed and installed to ensure that undue stress is not placed on the supporting structure.

National Sentence Text: Insulation and coverings on pipes shall be composed of material suitable for the operating temperature of the system to withstand deterioration from softening, melting, mildew and mould.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation and coverings on pipes shall be composed of material suitable for the operating temperature of the system to withstand deterioration from softening, melting, mildew and mould.

National Sentence Text: Insulation and coverings on pipes in which the temperature of the fluid exceeds 120°C shall be made of noncombustible material, or shall not flame, glow, smoulder or smoke when tested in accordance with ASTM C 411-11 Hot-Surface Performance of High-Temperature Thermal Insulation at the maximum temperature to which such insulation or covering is to be exposed in service.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation and coverings on pipes in which the temperature of the fluid exceeds 120°C shall be made of noncombustible material, or shall not flame, glow, smoulder or smoke when tested in accordance with ASTM C 411-11 Hot-Surface Performance of High-Temperature Thermal Insulation at the maximum temperature to which such insulation or covering is to be exposed in service.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(6), where combustible insulation is used on piping in a horizontal or vertical service space, the insulation and coverings on such pipes shall have a flame-spread rating throughout the material of not more than 25 in buildings of noncombustible construction, and 75 in buildings of combustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(6), where combustible insulation is used on piping in a horizontal or vertical service space, the insulation and coverings on such pipes shall have a flame-spread rating throughout the material of not more than 25 in buildings of noncombustible construction, and 75 in buildings of combustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(6), insulation and coverings on piping located in rooms and spaces other than the service spaces described in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(3) shall have a flame-spread rating not more than that required for the interior finish for the ceiling of the room or space.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(6), insulation and coverings on piping located in rooms and spaces other than the service spaces described in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(3) shall have a flame-spread rating not more than that required for the interior finish for the ceiling of the room or space.

National Sentence Text: Pipes that are exposed to human contact shall be insulated so that the exposed surface does not exceed 70°C. (See Note A-6.5.1.1.(3).) (See Note A-6.5.1.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Pipes that are exposed to human contact shall be insulated so that the exposed surface does not exceed 70°C. (See Note A-6.5.1.1.(3).)

National Sentence Text: No flame-spread rating or smoke developed classification limitations are required where combustible insulation and coverings are used on piping when such piping is located within a concealed space in a wall, located in a floor slab, or enclosed in a noncombustible raceway or conduit.
P/T Sentence Text: No flame-spread rating or smoke developed classification limitations are required where combustible insulation and coverings are used on piping when such piping is located within a concealed space in a wall, located in a floor slab, or enclosed in a noncombustible raceway or conduit.

National Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 9.33.8.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 9.33.8.3.

National Sentence Text: Where a pipe carrying steam or hot water at a temperature above 120°C passes through a combustible floor, ceiling or wall, the construction shall be protected by a sleeve of metal or other noncombustible material not less than 50 mm larger in diameter than the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pipe carrying steam or hot water at a temperature above 120°C passes through a combustible floor, ceiling or wall, the construction shall be protected by a sleeve of metal or other noncombustible material not less than 50 mm larger in diameter than the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Unprotected steam or hot water pipes that pass through a storage space shall be covered with not less than 25 mm thickness of noncombustible insulation to prevent direct contact with the material stored.
P/T Sentence Text: Unprotected steam or hot water pipes that pass through a storage space shall be covered with not less than 25 mm thickness of noncombustible insulation to prevent direct contact with the material stored.

National Sentence Text: Where a cooling unit is combined with a fuel-fired furnace in the same duct system, the cooling unit shall be installed in parallel with the heating furnace, upstream of the furnace, provided the furnace is designed for such application, or downstream of the furnace, provided the cooling unit is designed to prevent excessive temperature or pressure in the refrigeration system.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a cooling unit is combined with a fuel-fired furnace in the same duct system, the cooling unit shall be installed in parallel with the heating furnace, upstream of the furnace, provided the furnace is designed for such application, or downstream of the furnace, provided the cooling unit is designed to prevent excessive temperature or pressure in the refrigeration system.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.33.10.2.and 9.33.10.3., the products of combustion from oil-, gas- and solid-fuel-burning appliances, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, shall be vented in conformance with the applicable appliance installation standard listed in Sentences 9.33.5.2.(1)and 9.33.5.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.33.10.2. and 9.33.10.3., the products of combustion from oil-, gas- and solid-fuel-burning appliances, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, shall be vented in conformance with the applicable appliance installation standard listed in Sentences 9.33.5.2.(1) and 9.33.5.3.(1).

National Sentence Text: Factory-built chimneys serving solid-fuel-burning appliances, and their installation, shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S629-16 650°C Factory-Built Chimneys (See Note A-9.33.10.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-built chimneys serving solid-fuel-burning appliances, and their installation, shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S629-16 650°C Factory-Built Chimneys (See Note A-9.33.10.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Masonry or concrete chimneys shall conform to Section 9.21.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry or concrete chimneys shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: Electrical installations, including the service capacity of the installation and the number and distribution of circuits and receptacles, shall meet the requirements of the appropriate provincial, territorial or municipal legislation or, in the absence of such legislation, shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Electrical installations, including the service capacity of the installation and the number and distribution of circuits and receptacles, shall meet the requirements of the appropriate provincial, territorial or municipal legislation or, in the absence of such legislation, shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical installations, including the service capacity of the installation and the number and distribution of circuits and receptacles, shall conform to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Electrical installations, including the service capacity of the installation and the number and distribution of circuits and receptacles, shall conform to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

National Sentence Text: Where electrical services are available, electrical facilities shall be provided for every building in conformance with this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Where electrical services are available, electrical facilities shall be provided for every building in conformance with this Section.

National Sentence Text: Entrance switches, meters, panel boxes, splitter boxes, time clocks and other similar equipment shall not be located in any public area unless adequate precautions are taken to prevent interference with the equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Entrance switches, meters, panel boxes, splitter boxes, time clocks and other similar equipment shall not be located in any public area unless adequate precautions are taken to prevent interference with the equipment.

National Sentence Text: Recessed lighting fixtures shall not be located in insulated ceilings unless the fixtures are designed for such installations.
P/T Sentence Text: Recessed lighting fixtures shall not be located in insulated ceilings unless the fixtures are designed for such installations.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.34.1.5.(2), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables installed in buildings permitted to be of combustible construction shall not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test (FT1 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables or be located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Clause 3.1.5.23.(1)(b).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.34.1.5.(2), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables installed in buildings permitted to be of combustible construction shall not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test (FT1 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables or be located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Sentence 3.1.5.23.(1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.34.1.5.(3), where a concealed space in a floor or ceiling assembly is used as a plenum, electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and optical fibre cables installed within the plenum shall conform to Clause 3.6.4.3.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.34.1.5.(3), where a concealed space in a floor or ceiling assembly is used as a plenum, electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and optical fibre cables installed within the plenum shall conform to Sentence 3.6.4.3.(1).

National Sentence Text: Wires or cables within plenum spaces that are used for the transmission of signals in fire alarm, security, radio, and television broadcasting, closed circuit television or community television systems need not meet the requirements of Sentence 9.34.1.5.(2). (See Note A-9.34.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Wires or cables within plenum spaces that are used for the transmission of signals in fire alarm, security, radio, and television broadcasting, closed circuit television or community television systems need not meet the requirements of Sentence 9.34.1.5.(2).

National Sentence Text: An exterior lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch located within the building shall be provided at every entrance to buildings of residential occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: An exterior lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch located within the building shall be provided at every entrance to buildings of residential occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.2.(2), a lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch shall be provided in kitchens, bedrooms, living rooms, utility rooms, laundry rooms, dining rooms, bathrooms, water-closet rooms, vestibules and hallways in dwelling units.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.2.(2), a lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch shall be provided in kitchens, bedrooms, living rooms, utility rooms, laundry rooms, dining rooms, bathrooms, water-closet rooms, vestibules and hallways in dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: Where a receptacle controlled by a wall switch is provided in bedrooms or living rooms, such rooms need not conform to the requirements in Sentence 9.34.2.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where a receptacle controlled by a wall switch is provided in bedrooms or living rooms, such rooms need not conform to the requirements in Sentence 9.34.2.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: Every stairway shall be lighted.
P/T Sentence Text: Every stairway shall be lighted.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.3.(3), 3-way wall switches located at the head and foot of every stairway shall be provided to control at least one lighting outlet with fixture for stairways with 4 or more risers in dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.3.(3), 3-way wall switches located at the head and foot of every stairway shall be provided to control at least one lighting outlet with fixture for stairways with 4 or more risers in dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.

National Sentence Text: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and which serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and which serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.

National Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for each 30 m2 or fraction thereof of floor area in unfinished basements.
P/T Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for each 30 m2 or fraction thereof of floor area in unfinished basements.

National Sentence Text: The outlet required in Sentence 9.34.2.4.(1) nearest the stairs shall be controlled by a wall switch located at the head of the stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: The outlet required in Sentence 9.34.2.4.(1) nearest the stairs shall be controlled by a wall switch located at the head of the stairs.

National Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided in storage rooms.
P/T Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided in storage rooms.

National Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for an attached, built-in or detached garage or carport.
P/T Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for an attached, built-in or detached garage or carport.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(3), outlets required in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(1) shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(3), outlets required in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(1) shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.

National Sentence Text: Where the outlet and fixture required in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(1) are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch accessible to an adult of average height is permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the outlet and fixture required in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(1) are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch accessible to an adult of average height is permitted to be used.

National Sentence Text: Where a carport is lighted by a light at the entrance to a dwelling unit, additional carport lighting is not required.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a carport is lighted by a light at the entrance to a dwelling unit, additional carport lighting is not required.

National Sentence Text: Every public or service area in buildings shall be provided with lighting outlets with fixtures controlled by a wall switch or panel to illuminate every portion of such areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Every public or service area in buildings shall be provided with lighting outlets with fixtures controlled by a wall switch or panel to illuminate every portion of such areas.

National Sentence Text: When provided by incandescent lighting, illumination required in Sentence 9.34.2.7.(1) shall conform to Table 9.34.2.7. (See Article 9.9.12.2. for lighting in means of egress.)
P/T Sentence Text: When provided by incandescent lighting, illumination required in Sentence 9.34.2.7.(1) shall conform to Table 9.34.2.7. (See Article 9.9.12.2. for lighting in means of egress.)

National Sentence Text: When other types of lighting are used, illumination equivalent to that shown in Table 9.34.2.7. shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: When other types of lighting are used, illumination equivalent to that shown in Table 9.34.2.7. shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall conform to Subsection 9.9.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall conform to part 9.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to garages and carports serving not more than one dwelling unit.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): This Section applies to garages and carports serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to garages and carports serving not more than one dwelling unitor a house with a secondary suite .
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): This Section applies to garages and carports serving not more than one dwelling unitor a house with a secondary suite .

National Sentence Text: The construction of a garage or carport shall conform to the requirements for other buildings in this Part except as provided in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: The construction of a garage or carport shall conform to the requirements for other buildings in this Part except as provided in this Section.

National Sentence Text: Where a roofed enclosure used for the storage or parking of motor vehicles has more than 60% of the total perimeter enclosed by walls, doors or windows, the enclosure shall be considered a garage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roofed enclosure used for the storage or parking of motor vehicles has more than 60% of the total perimeter enclosed by walls, doors or windows, the enclosure shall be considered a garage.

National Sentence Text: Where an attached or built-in garage is provided and where adjacent spaces in the building are less than 50 mm above the garage floor, the garage floor shall be sloped to the outdoors, or where the garage can accommodate not more than 3 vehicles, an airtight curb or partition not less than 50 mm high shall be installed at the edges of the garage floor adjacent to interior space. (See Note A-9.35.2.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where an attached or built-in garage is provided and where adjacent spaces in the building are less than 50 mm above the garage floor, the garage floor shall be sloped to the outdoors, or where the garage can accommodate not more than 3 vehicles, an airtight curb or partition not less than 50 mm high shall be installed at the edges of the garage floor adjacent to interior space.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9.12.and 9.15. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9. and 9. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.

National Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction are permitted to be supported on wood mud sills, or a 100 mm thick concrete floor slab.
P/T Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction are permitted to be supported on wood mud sills, or a 100 mm thick concrete floor slab.

National Sentence Text: In clay-type soils subject to significant movement with a change in soil moisture content, the foundation depth of carports or garages connected to a dwelling unit directly or by a breezeway shall be approximately the same depth as the main buildingfoundation.
P/T Sentence Text: In clay-type soils subject to significant movement with a change in soil moisture content, the foundation depth of carports or garages connected to a dwelling unit directly or by a breezeway shall be approximately the same depth as the main building foundation.

National Sentence Text: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and a slab serving an attached garage, breezeway or carport.
P/T Sentence Text: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and a slab serving an attached garage, breezeway or carport.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Section 9.12., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in part 9., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.

National Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction need not conform with the foundation drainage requirements stated in Section 9.14., where the finished ground level is at or near the elevation of the garage’s floor and where the ground slopes away from the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction need not conform with the foundation drainage requirements stated in part 9., where the finished ground level is at or near the elevation of the garage’s floor and where the ground slopes away from the building.

National Sentence Text: Piers for the support of carport columns shall extend not less than 150 mm above ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Piers for the support of carport columns shall extend not less than 150 mm above ground level.

National Sentence Text: Piers referred to in Sentence 9.35.3.4.(1) shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.
P/T Sentence Text: Piers referred to in Sentence 9.35.3.4.(1) shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.

National Sentence Text: Interior finish need not be applied to garage and carport walls.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Interior finish need not be applied to garage and carport walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.35.4.1.(2), interior finish need not be applied to garage and carport walls.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as required by Sentence 9.35.4.1.(2), interior finish need not be applied to garage and carport walls.

P/T Sentence Text: The walls and ceilings of an attached garage shall have an interior finish consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board conforming to part 9., lath and plaster conforming to part 9., or any material that can be shown to remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials

National Sentence Text: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to Section 9.17., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to part 9., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.

National Sentence Text: Garage or carport walls and columns shall be anchored to the foundation to resist wind uplift in conformance with Subsection 9.23.6., except that where a garage is supported on the surface of the ground, ground anchors shall be provided to resist wind uplift.
P/T Sentence Text: Garage or carport walls and columns shall be anchored to the foundation to resist wind uplift in conformance with part 9., except that where a garage is supported on the surface of the ground, ground anchors shall be provided to resist wind uplift.
Except as required by part 9., the walls and ceilings of a garage shall be provided with thermal insulation conforming to part 9.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as required by Section 9.36., the walls and ceilings of a garage shall be provided with thermal insulation conforming to Subsection 9.25.2.

National Sentence Text: This Section is concerned with the energy used by buildings as a result of the design and construction of the building envelope, and the design and construction or specification of systems and equipment for heating, ventilating or air-conditioning, and service water heating. (See Note A-9.36.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Section is concerned with the energy used by buildings as a result of the design and construction of the building envelope, and the design and construction or specification of systems and equipment for heating, ventilating or air-conditioning, and service water heating.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "common space" shall mean all spaces required to be conditioned spaces in accordance with the requirements of the Code that are not within a suite but shall not include crawl spaces and vertical service spaces. (See Note A-9.36.1.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "common space" shall mean all spaces required to be conditioned spaces in accordance with the requirements of the Code that are not within a suite but shall not include crawl spaces and vertical service spaces. (See Note A-9.36.1.3.(3).)

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "overall thermal transmittance," or U-value, shall mean the rate, in W/(m2·K), at which heat is transferred through a building assembly that is subject to temperature differences. (See Note A-9.36.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "overall thermal transmittance," or U-value, shall mean the rate, in W/(m2·K), at which heat is transferred through a building assembly that is subject to temperature differences. (See Note A-9.36.1.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "effective thermal resistance," or RSI value, shall mean the inverse of the overall thermal transmittance of an assembly, in (m2·K)/W. (See Note A-9.36.1.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "effective thermal resistance," or RSI value, shall mean the inverse of the overall thermal transmittance of an assembly, in (m2·K)/W. (See Note A-9.36.1.2.(3).)

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "fenestration" shall mean all building envelope assemblies, including their frames, that transfer visible light, such as windows, clerestories, skylights, translucent wall panels, glass block assemblies, transoms, sidelights, sliding, overhead or swinging glass doors, and glazed inserts in doors, etc. (See Note A-9.36.1.2.(4).) (See Note A-9.36.1.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "fenestration" shall mean all building envelope assemblies, including their frames, that transfer visible light, such as windows, clerestories, skylights, translucent wall panels, glass block assemblies, transoms, sidelights, sliding, overhead or swinging glass doors, and glazed inserts in doors, etc. (See Note A-9.36.1.2.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.36.1.3.(2)to 9.36.1.3.(5), buildings shall comply with the prescriptive or trade-off requirements in Subsections 9.36.2.to 9.36.4., the performance requirements in Subsection 9.36.5., or the NECB.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.36.1.3.(2) to 9.36.1.3.(5), buildings shall comply with the prescriptive or trade-off requirements in Subsections 9.to 9., the performance requirements in part 9., or the NECB.

National Sentence Text: Subsections 9.36.2.to 9.36.4. apply to buildings of residential occupancy to which Part 9 applies, buildings containing business and personal services, mercantile or low-hazard industrial occupancies to which Part 9 applies whose combined total floor area does not exceed 300 m2, excluding parking garages that serve residential occupancies, and buildings containing a mix of the residential and non-residential occupancies described in Clauses 9.36.1.3.(2)(a)and 9.36.1.3.(2)(b).
P/T Sentence Text: Subsections 9. to 9. apply to buildings of residential occupancy to which part 9. applies, buildings containing business and personal services, mercantile or low-hazard industrial occupancies to which part 9. applies whose combined total floor area does not exceed 300 m2 , excluding parking garages that serve residential occupancies, and buildings containing a mix of the residential and non-residential occupancies described in Clauses 9.36.1.3.(2)and 9.36.1.3.(2).

National Sentence Text: Subsection 9.36.5. applies only to houses with or without a secondary suite, and buildings containing only dwelling units and common spaces whose total floor area does not exceed 20% of the total floor area of the building. (See Note A-9.36.1.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: part 9. applies only to houses with or without a secondary suite, and buildings containing only dwelling units and common spaces whose total floor area does not exceed 20% of the total floor area of the building.

National Sentence Text: Buildings containing non-residential occupancies whose combined total floor area exceeds 300 m2 or medium-hazard industrial occupancies shall comply with the NECB.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings containing non-residential occupancies whose combined total floor area exceeds 300 m2 or medium-hazard industrial occupancies shall comply with the NECB.

National Sentence Text: Buildings or portions of buildings that are not required to be conditioned spaces are exempted from the requirements of this Section. (See Note A-9.36.1.3.(5).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Buildings or portions of buildings that are not required to be conditioned spaces are exempted from the requirements of this Section. (See Note A-9.36.1.3.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings or portions of buildings that are not required to be conditioned spaces are exempted from the requirements of this Section. (See Note A-9.36.1.3.(5).) (See also Article 9.25.2.1.)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Buildings or portions of buildings that are not required to be conditioned spaces are exempted from the requirements of this Section. (See Note A-9.36.1.3.(5).) (See also Article 9.25.2.1.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.36.2.1.(2), this Subsection is concerned with the loss of energy due to heat transfer and air leakage through materials, components and assemblies, including their interfaces, forming part of the building envelope where it separates conditioned space from unconditioned space, the exterior air or the ground.
Matched National Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentence 9.36.2.1.(2), this Subsection is concerned with the loss of energy due to heat transfer and air leakage through materials, components and assemblies, including their interfaces, forming part of the building envelope where it separates conditioned space from unconditioned space, the exterior air or the ground.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.36.2.1.(2) , 9.36.2.1.(6) and 9.36.2.1.(7), this Subsection is concerned with the loss of energy due to heat transfer and air leakage through materials, components and assemblies, including their interfaces, forming part of the building envelope where it separates conditioned space from unconditioned space, the exterior air or the ground.
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): Except as provided in Sentences 9.36.2.1.(2) , 9.36.2.1.(6) and 9.36.2.1.(7), this Subsection is concerned with the loss of energy due to heat transfer and air leakage through materials, components and assemblies, including their interfaces, forming part of the building envelope where it separates conditioned space from unconditioned space, the exterior air or the ground.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of this Subsection also apply to components of a building envelope assembly that separate a conditioned space from an adjoining storage garage, even if the storage garage is intended to be heated. (See Notes A-9.36.2.1.(2)and A-9.36.1.3.(5).)
Matched National Sentence (Variation): The requirements of this Subsection also apply to components of a building envelope assembly that separate a conditioned space from an adjoining storage garage, even if the storage garage is intended to be heated. (See Notes A-9.36.2.1.(2) and A-9.36.1.3.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of this Subsection also apply to components of a building envelope assembly that separate a conditioned space from an adjoining storage garage, even if the storage garage is intended to be heated. (See Notes A-9.36.2.1.(2)and A-9.36.1.3.(5).) (See also Article 9.25.2.1.)
Matched P/T Sentence (Variation): The requirements of this Subsection also apply to components of a building envelope assembly that separate a conditioned space from an adjoining storage garage, even if the storage garage is intended to be heated. (See Notes A-9.36.2.1.(2) and A-9.36.1.3.(5).) (See also Article 9.25.2.1.)

National Sentence Text: Except for skylight shafts addressed in Sentence 9.36.2.6.(4), for the purpose of this Subsection, wall assemblies inclined less than 60° from the horizontal shall be considered as roof assemblies, and roof assemblies inclined 60° or more from the horizontal shall be considered as wall assemblies.
